If This Was A Movie

by AgathaLovesRio

Summary

Agatha is THE Hollywood star, America's Sweetheart, and absolute Hollywood royalty. She is a single mom to 16-year-old Nicholas Harkness, a student at SHIELD High School.
Rio is the new, science teacher at the Hollywood elite school and holds a strict no dating parents policy.

When Agatha‚Äôs famous chaotic reverie meets Rio‚Äôs down-to-earth simplicity, the attraction should be undeniable. But, the winds of fate have more in store for these two and their coven of friends as they come to terms with their love and desire.

Notes

The first five chapters have been edited and this isn't short anymore...
Enjoy!

BlueSky/Twitter: AgathaLovesRio

Threads: LoudestWomanEverSeen

Tomorrow is Just A Mystery and That's Okay

Chapter Summary

Meet Rio Vidal and her best friend, Alice Wu-Gulliver.

üé∂

I'm alone, on my own

And that's all I know

I'll be strong, I'll be wrong

Oh, but life goes on

Oh, I'm just a girl

Trying to find a place in this world

A Place in This World - Taylor Swift

üé∂

Late July

‚ÄúThere! It‚Äôs perfect!‚Äù Rio Vidal exclaimed as she placed the last plant on a bookshelf. Her new Los Angeles apartment was now completely unpacked and decorated. It felt like home.

She took a deep breath, inhaling the scent of the orchids and azaleas placed around the apartment. They weren‚Äôt the easiest plants to grow in planters and keep inside, but she had learned from the best. The bamboo plant was tucked into the corner of the dining room, which she took meticulous care of, and the succulents, which she carefully trimmed. They were probably her most prized possessions, something she had control over in a life in which she felt she had such little control.

‚ÄúYou and your plants. You put more care into them than your actual lesson plans.‚Äù Alice Wu-Gulliver said from her spot on the couch with a teasing smile and changed the music playing on the Bluetooth speaker to a girl in red song.

Rio returned the smile as she looked over at her childhood best friend and pseudo-sister, and sat on the plush, forest-green couch beside her.

‚ÄúPlants need love and care, you know that. Lesson plans are automatic at this point and follow a pattern and set of rules. I can write them in my sleep by now, and so can you."

Rio had taught science for thirteen years and loved it. She took care when she planned her lessons. She just knew the material well, especially biology, botany, and chemistry. Her three major loves growing up in San Francisco were animals, plants, and blowing things up.

‚ÄúNo phoning it in at SHIELD, Ri. Calderu knows everything, and we have to keep the parents happy‚Äîor nannies, au pairs, whoever it is,‚Äù Alice said, leaning her head to the side. She began recounting the different families and broke down who did what roles in each.

Rio knew how high-stakes her new position at SHIELD was. The acronym stood for The School for Hollywood's Innovative Education and Leadership Development - a pretentious name for a place where Hollywood‚Äôs elite sent their children. Hardly anyone knew what it actually stood for anymore; it was simply SHIELD.

Rio had first met the principal, Lilia Calderu, the previous spring when she had interviewed for the position from Rio‚Äôs hospital bed. She was an older, petite woman. Rio recalled how Alice had told her that Lilia had taught at SHIELD since she came to LA and had ingrained herself amongst the Hollywood elite, learning secrets and becoming someone they confided in. Now, she knew everything and was well-respected in the community. Her New York upbringing and Sicilian ancestry added to her persona, and when Rio first met her, she automatically understood.

Alice had taught in the history department at SHIELD since 2014 and helped Rio get an interview with Lilia once Rio told Alice she was leaving the school in San Francisco. The elite school in Los Angeles generally ran on a who-you-knew hiring system due to the unique demographics of the student body.

Rio chuckled. ‚ÄúRelax. I've got this, and you‚Äôre the reason I have this job. I‚Äôm not going to make you look bad. I‚Äôve taught the children of the rich and powerful before. My old school catered to the upper class, too. This won‚Äôt be too different from that, from the sounds of it. Signing non-disclosure agreements as a career requirement is a little odd, and having seen some of the parents naked in movies, or having crushes on them, might be awkward at first, but I‚Äôll adjust.‚Äù Seeing Alice‚Äôs face scrunch at that, Rio got serious and held up her hand. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry. I learned my lesson about dating parents, especially famous ones, okay? That‚Äôs the entire reason I left and moved here, remember?‚Äù

Rio had made the mistake of dating a parent once, almost ruining her career. It had turned into a stalker situation when the woman could not let go, and after a series of unfortunate events, Rio had escaped for LA as soon as possible.

Alice smirked. ‚ÄúOh, it‚Äôs not dating I‚Äôm worried about.‚Äù Alice lifted an eyebrow suggestively.

Rio laughed and smacked her with a decorative pillow that said ‚ÄúLive Laugh Lesbian‚Äù on it, a housewarming gift from Alice one year. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe that‚Äôs allowed!‚Äù She said, still laughing. Fraternization had been expressly forbidden at her previous school, which had complicated matters.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs one of the reasons we sign NDAs!‚Äù Alice exclaimed back, holding her arms up to block the pillow.

Rio stopped her barrage, tossed the pillow onto a forest green armchair to her right that matched the couch, and grabbed her beer from the coffee table.

‚ÄúSeriously, though, Alice, thank you so much for helping with everything. The job, finding the apartment, and being by my side. I am actually looking forward to professional development and in-service tomorrow for once, and not dreading it. I‚Äôm very curious to see who my students are, and more importantly, who their parents are.‚Äù

Rio took a swig of her beer and reminisced on her previous years of teaching. Tomorrow would begin her fourteenth time preparing for a new school year, and it had long since lost its excitement. However, teaching in the same school as Alice for the first time in a decade and at this specific school was the beginning of a new adventure, and it reminded her of their first year of teaching.

Alice took a drink from her beer as well. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just glad you‚Äôre finally here, and I can finally share everything with you again. The apartment was perfect timing since my neighbor moved out.‚Äù

Alice and Rio had lived together before and were roommates in college and young adulthood when they taught together. Now, at thirty-five, they needed their own space but wanted to remain close. If the apartment next to Alice hadn‚Äôt come available, then they had both planned on hunting for the perfect place with two units together, or a duplex. They hadn‚Äôt been as close the past ten years due to distance and legalities. It had taken a toll on both of them, and it was time to put an end to that.

‚ÄúI think you‚Äôre the only one excited about starting in-service at seven AM on a Monday at the end of July. Class lists are fun, especially at the high school level when we know most of them so well and what to expect. We can also just email or text the parents, personal assistants, or PR people in some cases now, depending on the type of relationship you have with that family, of course.¬† Some of the parents are pretty hands-on, which is unexpected for the higher-level celebrities, but nice, especially when it is the megastars.‚Äù

Rio took another pull of her beer and put it back on a plant-shaped coaster before settling back into the couch. ‚ÄúWhich parents are super involved?‚Äù She held up a hand before Alice could object. ‚ÄúI have already signed my stack of NDAs and can know, so tell me.‚Äù



Alice grumbled, though she had been dying to tell her best friend, her sister, really, about everything that happened at SHIELD and in LA in general. She wanted to tell her all about the families and her close friendships with some of the parents. She couldn‚Äôt wait for Rio to start joining her in spending time with her and her friends. Alice was so glad to have Rio back in her life for more than just holidays and breaks, and was ready to pick up where they had left off.

‚ÄúWell, for starters, Agatha Harkness and Wanda Maximoff are supermoms, believe it or not,‚Äù Alice responded, gesturing with her hands.

Agatha and Wanda were both award-winning and globally beloved actresses. Given Agatha Harkness‚Äôs ‚Äòbad boy‚Äô persona, she knew that would surprise Rio. The media always portrayed them as doting moms with very busy schedules. There were also conflicting rumors that Agatha and Wanda were dating.

Rio, meeting Alice‚Äôs expectations, was shocked. ‚ÄúAgatha Harkness? THE Agatha Harkness? America‚Äôs Lesbian Badass Sweetheart and everyone‚Äôs favorite Mother? That Agatha Harkness? HER SON GOES TO SHIELD?!‚Äù She shrieked the last part. Rio had been a fan of Agatha‚Äôs since before she could remember.

Agatha Harkness was a trailblazer for LGBTQ equality, especially in Hollywood. She was a single mom, championing fertility procedures and putting a spotlight on reproductive methods, all families, and being a single mother by choice. She was also absolutely stunning, a global megastar and one of the greatest stars of their time. At fifty-one, Agatha was on her way to a triple EGOT ‚Äî meaning she had won all four major awards, an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony, had been the youngest EGOT winner, the youngest Oscar nominee, the youngest Oscar winner, and just all around glass ceiling breaker. She was also known for her multitude of relationships, if you could call them that. It was part of what made Agatha, well, Agatha.

Agatha had very publicly cut ties with her mother at sixteen, and the entire country had rallied behind their teenage sweetheart, supporting her and embracing her identity. Everyone loved a juicy story, and Agatha had one. Rio had idolized her, and still did, though she had toned it down a lot since her youth. That woman had been her gay awakening. If she were to encounter her now, she might die.

The moment the realization dawned on her, her naturally tanned skin went pale, and she looked at Alice, mouth agape. Agatha‚Äôs son, Nicholas, was a teenager. Not that Rio followed Agatha on social media or anything, or that she knew he had just had a birthday in June.

‚ÄúAgatha‚Äôs son, Nicky, he‚Äôs going to be a sophomore or a junior this year, yeah?‚Äù Rio asked, attempting to sound casual.

Alice laughed. The last ten years of non-disclosure agreements had bound Alice from discussing anything school-related with Rio. Unfortunately, since her friends and chosen family were also the parents of her students, this included much of her life. She had been dying to share all of this with her, and she knew that this specific information would absolutely break Rio‚Äôs brain and send her spinning.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs going to be a junior, you creepy lurker. He‚Äôs the quarterback of the football team,‚Äù Alice said, smirking.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still getting used to there being sports and it being just like any other all-American high school and not like the one in ‚ÄòFame‚Äô.‚Äù Rio interrupted. Alice rolled her eyes.

‚ÄúRemember, it‚Äôs more than just the children of movie stars. It‚Äôs child actors, the children of star athletes, musicians, billionaires, the one percent, the elite, and even a few rocket scientists. Anyway, he has no interest in acting or stardom, is incredibly smart like his mother, and can be a troublemaker. He‚Äôs respectful, but if there are any pranks or general shenanigans, he‚Äôs historically been behind them. Agatha knows he‚Äôs not perfect, and she does hold him accountable. She‚Äôs a great mom. The Maximoff boys will be freshmen this year, and while Billy is a pure theatre kid, Tommy idolizes Nicky and will follow where Nicky leads, historically.‚Äù She finished and looked at Rio to make sure she was still breathing. She was, but still had surprise and a bit of panic in her eyes.



‚ÄúDid you just call her Agatha and a great mom?‚Äù Rio‚Äôs eyes were glued to Alice as she drained her beer. ‚ÄúGod, Alice. I have got to get a grip before we have Meet the Teacher night next week and school starts in two weeks.‚Äù Rio rubbed the left side of her chest to soothe herself from all the new information. A habit she had picked up from her childhood. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the real story with Agatha and Wanda? Are the rumors true, or are they just really close like we are?‚Äù

Rio had always wondered about that relationship and Wanda Maximoff herself. The two stars had been fixtures in each other‚Äôs lives for nearly 30 years, were often each other‚Äôs ‚Äòdate‚Äô to awards shows, starred together often, and were frequently pictured together. Yes, Wanda was married to Vision, and they had twins, but it was still very suspicious. Wanda never looked entirely comfortable when she was with Vision, always looking at something or someone, off to the side. There was an entire corner of the internet dedicated to the theory.

Alice had gone into the kitchen and grabbed water, yogurts from the fridge, and a bag of pretzels. She walked back in, handing one of each to Rio and putting the bag of pretzels between them.

‚ÄúMost parents prefer first names, less formal, especially since their kids have been there since pre-K.‚Äù She sat back down, curling her legs under her. She chewed her lip in thought. Rio could tell Alice was debating whether or not she should add something to that. ‚ÄúAs for Agatha and Wanda, they‚Äôre more sisters than anything. Agatha took her under her wing on the first show they did together, shortly after Wanda moved here when she was still a teenager. They had similar stories, you know that. They‚Äôre the emergency contacts for the boys. If one is out of town, the other picks up the slack. If they‚Äôre both gone, Vision is on kid duty. It‚Äôs a very cohesive family unit. Wanda is ‚ÄòAunt Wanda‚Äô and Agatha is ‚ÄòAunt Aggie‚Äô.‚Äù

Rio had known Alice since they were twelve and had been taken in by Alice and her Gran. Rio knew Alice was holding back.

‚ÄúAlice, stop holding back. You obviously know a lot. How?‚Äù Rio raised an eyebrow in question.

Alice sighed.

‚ÄúAgatha and Wanda are some of my closest friends. They‚Äôre more like my family. When I moved out here, Agatha insisted that they help me get acclimated. Something my mother and Gran would have wanted.‚Äù She shrugged.

Rio nodded, hurt that Alice hadn‚Äôt told her, but Rio knew that technically, due to Agatha and Wanda being connected with the school, that was part of the NDAs.

Alice‚Äôs mother, Lorna Wu, had been an actress as well. A friend of Agatha‚Äôs and the reason Alice had been raised by Gran, Lorna‚Äôs mother. Lorna wanted to keep Alice as far away from Hollywood life as possible and had rarely been in Alice‚Äôs life. Rio had met Lorna several times and thought she would have been a great mom.

Lorna thought otherwise. Rio was also hurt that Alice had called these women her family. Rio was happy that Alice had found a family in LA, but Rio had been so alone in their hometown once Alice left. Alice was her family.

Alice continued, bringing Rio back from her thoughts.

‚ÄúKnowing them for so long, it weirds me out when I hear gossip about the two of them being an item because they are more like sisters than anything else. Agatha practically helped raise Wanda,‚Äù Alice had finished her yogurt at that point and was using her spoon as emphasis. ‚ÄúImagine if we were to date,‚Äù she added, grimacing.

Rio gasped, not as insulted as she probably should be.

‚ÄúHEY! I am a catch! You would be lucky to date me!‚Äù

She laughed, knowing Alice was right. ‚ÄúI get it, though. We would co-parent with each other if we were to have kids. That‚Äôs never going to happen, though. I much prefer cats and plants, and you are a dog person. ‚ÄúRemember, you said you weren‚Äôt going to mix with your students‚Äô parents romantically.‚Äù Alice teased, a knowing gleam in her eye.

I am a professional, and I will stick to my personal rules and boundaries. If these women are your friend group, I assume you‚Äôre going to drag me into it. Dating your friends typically doesn‚Äôt go well for me either. They finally called it a night around ten as they had to be at work early to start preparing for the semester. Alice stretched as she unfolded herself and got up, almost falling over as she stood, and shook out her legs and feet to regain circulation in them.

‚ÄúYou probably should‚Äôve tested that out first,‚Äù Rio laughed, putting her feet on the ground first before standing. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt sit folded in on ourselves for that long and just pop up like daisies without consequence anymore. Lock the door behind you, please!‚Äù Rio stood once the tingling in her own legs had faded and turned toward her bedroom. The two had keys to each other‚Äôs places, partially for this reason.

‚ÄúWill do, love you!‚Äù Alice called over her shoulder as she left.

‚ÄúLove you too,‚Äù Rio shouted back. It was a habit they had. Something they had learned firsthand to do. Always tell the people around you that you loved them every time you departed, no matter where they were going or how long they would be gone. She heard the door close and lock. She would go back and lock the deadbolt before bed. Right now, she needed a shower after all the moving and unpacking from the day. She turned on music for the shower speaker, background noise so she didn‚Äôt feel alone, and headed for the en-suite, glancing at a tortoiseshell-colored lump in the middle of her bed.

‚ÄúThere you are, Raven! I see you‚Äôre making yourself at home.‚Äù Raven was her seventeen-year-old cat. Rio had adopted her when she and Alice had their first place fifteen years ago, and Rio had retained custody ever since.

Once under the shower‚Äôs hot water, enveloped in steam with Taylor Swift playing in the background, Rio massaged the shampoo onto her scalp and thought about the upcoming school year and what lay ahead. She would meet some huge celebrities from sports, film, music, and even politics. She was excited and nervous about this journey, and hoped her past didn‚Äôt follow her here. Shampoo was washed out and switched to conditioner as she remained lost in her thoughts, thinking about the colleagues she had already met, the insane security detail, and the security measures. When you had that many famous children altogether, you had to have heightened security, extra legal measures, and state-of-the-art everything. She couldn‚Äôt imagine the pressure put on the administration or the board of trustees.

Rio was excited about the budget, though, and the opportunities it provided. The tuition, donations from parents, and unnecessary fundraisers throughout the year, though half of it went to charity, would provide ample funding for teachers to do anything they wanted for their students.

She scrubbed the sweat and grime from unpacking off her skin as she thought back on her conversations with Alice and what that meant for the future. Exactly how much had gone unsaid for the past ten years? Rio had still told Alice everything in the past decade. Her dating life, career woes, dating woes, and the stalker issue. Alice had come and bailed her out in the spring when she had hit her version of rock bottom.

Rio hadn‚Äôt known much about Alice‚Äôs life in LA. She knew about a few people she had dated and knew she had made friends, but nothing beyond that. They still spent holidays and birthdays together, but even then, a lot of things had been vague. Alice had always been Rio‚Äôs protector, they joked about Alice being her Knight of Wands. A callback to a movie Alice‚Äôs mother, Lorna, had been in with Agatha.

She turned off the water and dried herself off. She was hoping that she and Alice could become as close as they once were, now that Rio had signed the same paperwork that Alice had. This whole weekend, and tonight especially, had been a good start. They so easily fell back into their old habits.

Rio was also somewhat worried about how well she would teach this demographic of children. Yes, she had taught kids with famous parents before, but not at this high of a caliber. Not children who were potentially not impressed by anything, and had access to all types of educational resources if they wanted to utilize them. How was she supposed to keep them engaged in learning? Maybe she wasn‚Äôt cut out to teach the children of the Hollywood elite, and elite in general. She sighed. Clearly, this was just impostor syndrome. Everything would be fine. Lilia wouldn‚Äôt have offered her the position if she didn‚Äôt think she was more than capable. SHIELD paid ridiculously well and did not hire just anyone. You had to be overly qualified and know someone.

She climbed into bed, exhausted, and Raven snuggled up to her, knowing she was stressed. Rio set her alarm and switched to her bedtime playlist. The very first song was from a movie Agatha had starred in with Lorna Wu called ‚ÄúThe Witches Road‚Äù. Agatha had sung the theme song for the movie, winning her a Grammy and an Oscar for the song and best actress. It was one of Rio‚Äôs favorites, and she drifted off to sleep with Agatha‚Äôs voice in her ear as she had so many times before.

You've Got A Smile That Could Light Up This Whole Town

Chapter Summary

Agatha and Rio meet for the first time. They don't see it, but others do.

Chapter Notes

Oh, let's hope I can do this justice.

Edited 5/6/25

See the end of the chapter for more notes

üé∂

Walk in the streets with you in your worn-out jeans

I can't help thinking this is how it ought to be

Laughing on a park bench, thinking to myself

"Hey, isn't this easy?"

You Belong With Me - Taylor Swift

üé∂

Late July

‚ÄúPlease welcome my next guest, the double EGOT winner, multiple everything winner, America‚Äôs Sweetheart, activist, just all-around amazing person, and one of my personal close friends, Agatha Harkness!‚Äù Drew Barrymore announced to a round of applause and cheers.

Agatha walked out and danced to Demi Lovato‚Äôs ‚ÄòConfident‚Äô, meeting Drew halfway. Agatha had originally suggested ‚ÄòWomanizer‚Äô, but Drew reminded her that she had already done that once. It had been during a time when Agatha had been pictured out with multiple women each night. Agatha had been having a great time, and so had the media. ‚ÄòConfident‚Äô was more fitting this time.

Agatha wore a black halter jumpsuit with purple stilettos, her signature color and shoe style. Her long chestnut hair was pulled up, and her iconic three-goddesses locket was perfectly attached at the collar. Agatha was just the appropriate amount of professionalism and attractiveness for daytime TV, a balance she had perfected decades ago. Drew looked extremely adorable as always in a white long-sleeve shirt, dark grey pants with a matching vest, a purple tie that matched Agatha‚Äôs shoes, and purple ballet flats. They had coordinated previously on colors, and Drew looked very Drew . She was only two years Agatha‚Äôs junior but exuded a youthful energy. Agatha and Drew had been in an exclusive circle of child actors who had known each other since they were in diapers and had very easy chemistry as they were friends outside of acting. Drew pulled Agatha into a giant hug as the excitement from the audience died down.

‚ÄúDrew! It‚Äôs so good to be here again!‚Äù She said as she settled into her place on the guest couch and crossed her legs at the knee. ‚ÄúThe girls aren‚Äôt too sunburned from this weekend, are they?‚Äù

Drew waved off the question. ‚ÄúNot anything a little aloe vera couldn‚Äôt soothe. We had such a great time hanging out with you guys this weekend! We even have some pictures!‚Äù As Drew said it, pictures popped up on the screen positioned between them. One of Drew, Agatha, and Wanda around Agatha‚Äôs pool in swimsuits, a second of Wanda‚Äôs twin boys, Agatha‚Äôs son, and Drew‚Äôs two daughters, and the final was a picture of Nicky pushing Agatha into the pool. The audience laughed, and Agatha pretended to be shocked. Drew smiled and continued.

‚ÄúAs everyone knows by now, we‚Äôve known each other most of our lives, and you‚Äôre one of my most popular guests.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course I am,‚Äù Agatha smirked, drawing reactions from the audience.

‚ÄúAlways so humble,‚Äù Drew quipped. ‚ÄúBefore we start, I wanted to give you something to put with all of those awards you have.‚Äù

Agatha hummed in response. It was the natural chemistry she and Drew had that kept the producers, and Drew, insisting on her coming back.

‚ÄúCan I guess what it is first?‚Äù Agatha asked, raising her eyebrows.

‚ÄúOf course, I wasn‚Äôt going to make it easy, you get three guesses.‚Äù Drew was aglow with excitement.

Agatha was in full character, the persona she put on for the cameras, and she knew Drew was prepared to match this side of her.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs obviously an award, so, hottest guest of all time?‚Äù

Drew rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúNice try, no.‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay, then simply Mother Harkness or Most Likely to Lead an Army of Sapphics.‚Äù She winked toward the audience, where she swore half of them swooned. People often asked Agatha why she didn‚Äôt date, and why would she? Why use just one crayon when there were so many different colors to choose from?

‚ÄúI should have gone with the biggest ego, no. Most Reoccurring Guest. This is the first week of our fifth season and your eighth time here.‚Äù Drew handed Agatha a plaque.

‚ÄúAnytime, Drew.‚Äù

Drew switched gears back to the previous weekend. ‚ÄúSo, back to the pictures and the weekend, I keep having Agatha come back because she constantly has new projects going on, but also we‚Äôre friends, as you can see in the pictures.‚Äù

Agatha nodded. ‚ÄúWanda Maximoff lives next door,‚Äù Agatha heard snickers from a few people in the audience whom she was addressing. She would never beat those allegations. ‚ÄúSo any party or gathering at my house usually involves her and her family as well. Our three boys are in high school and get along so well with Drew‚Äôs daughters, though they‚Äôre in middle school. We‚Äôre soaking up the last few weeks of summer and had a little impromptu pool party.‚Äù She turned back to Drew to let her continue leading the conversation.

‚ÄúYour son, Nicky, just turned sixteen. How‚Äôs driving going?‚Äù

The audience groaned in sympathy.

Agatha sighed. ‚ÄúYes, thank you. I thought him playing football was nerve-racking! I‚Äôm just glad I‚Äôm not in charge of the driving. Vision, Wanda‚Äôs husband for those of you who don‚Äôt know, has been in charge of that, so I don‚Äôt wind up in the news. He‚Äôs extremely patient, whereas I am not, and Wanda is too nervous, and Nat, our head of security.‚Äù There were a few claps and cheers from the audience at the mention of Nat. She had a small cult following. Agatha flashed a slightly evil grin. ‚ÄúLadies, she is single.‚Äù Drew threw her a dark look before Agatha continued. ‚ÄúAnyway, she is not the one you want teaching your sixteen-year-old to drive. We‚Äôve decided that Vision is in charge of teaching all the kids to drive, including Drew‚Äôs girls.‚Äù

Drew nodded before pivoting.

‚ÄúSpeaking of Wanda and her family, your new movie, Death‚Äôs Beloved, premieres in October, and there‚Äôs already a lot of buzz around it. The two of you star opposite each other yet again, in a romantic role?‚Äù Drew‚Äôs right eyebrow quirked.

Agatha laughed sarcastically and shook her head as the audience cheered. People were obsessed with the thought of her and Wanda being an item. They couldn‚Äôt be further from the truth.

‚ÄúYes, we‚Äôre married. I‚Äôm a detective chasing a serial killer, and Wanda is my wife. In the movie. We have a few scenes, and they are very well done. I‚Äôm so glad she‚Äôs the person I got to do it with. We have such great chemistry, and given that I consider her to be my sister.‚Äù She sent a look toward the audience. ‚ÄúIt didn‚Äôt seem awkward or anything. Our intimacy coordinator was amazing.‚Äù

‚ÄúWow,‚Äù Drew‚Äôs bright eyes sparkled. ‚ÄúI cannot wait. We‚Äôve all heard the song already, and it‚Äôs gorgeous. Do you think this will be your third Best Actress Oscar win and third Grammy win? Completing that third EGOT?‚Äù

Agatha laughed. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs only August, and we‚Äôre still months away from nominations. I have no idea if the song or I will be nominated, and we know that doesn‚Äôt guarantee a win. If anything, Wanda deserves a nomination and a win for her work in the movie. Working opposite of her as another lead was amazing, and I hope we‚Äôre both nominated as leads since that‚Äôs truly what we are. There wasn‚Äôt a leading man, and I hope that is acknowledged.‚Äù She stated firmly. ‚ÄúLike you said, it‚Äôs not even out until October, and so much can happen between now and then.‚Äù

Drew nodded seriously. ‚ÄúI agree with you, and we‚Äôve discussed that it‚Äôs time for the awards committees to recognize that the leads do not have to be different genders and we need a broader range of categories.‚Äù A cheer of agreement went up in the audience. They chatted a bit more about the movie, Agatha sang the song ‚ÄúMy Beloved‚Äù, and they wrapped the show.

While resetting to begin taping the next episode, Drew gave Agatha a quick hug goodbye and thanked her for doing the show again.

‚ÄúDid you see the picture of the new high school science teacher? Rio Vidal?‚Äù Drew asked.

Agatha shook her head. She hadn‚Äôt checked her email yet, though she was usually very eager to read about any new teachers joining the faculty for personal reasons. ‚ÄúNo, why?‚Äù

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs gorgeous. Maybe you should read up on your science, given your history with teachers at SHIELD, this may be one you don‚Äôt want to miss out on.‚Äù Drew teased as she waggled her eyebrows.

Agatha laughed. ‚ÄúDrew, please. I have stopped sleeping with the teachers, starting this year. Calderu is getting too old to deal with all that drama. Plus, she‚Äôs probably extremely young ‚Äî ‚Äú

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs 35.‚Äù

‚ÄúExactly. I have an entire kid as old as that age gap. Thank you for trying, but you know me, Drew.‚Äù

Drew and Wanda had been trying to get her to settle down for years, the hopeless romantics that they were. It wasn‚Äôt Agatha‚Äôs nature, she‚Äôd rather find ‚Äòem, fuck ‚Äòem, and free ‚Äòem. The three F‚Äôs. Agatha did not do romantic relationships, but she appreciated how much her friends cared.

Drew shook her head as she went back to the stage. ‚ÄúOne day, Aggie. One day, you‚Äôll find love!‚Äù Drew put her hand on her heart and exaggerated her gesture. ‚ÄúOh, and uh, Nat‚Äôs behind you, she looks pissed about your comment.‚Äù Drew turned and walked off briskly.

Agatha blew out a breath and turned to see her and Wanda‚Äôs main bodyguard. She was a petite redhead and a former Russian assassin. ‚ÄúIt was a joke, Nat.‚Äù Agatha quickly defended. She had known Nat almost as long as she had known Wanda, and had only been teasing.

‚ÄúYou know I don‚Äôt date.‚Äù The younger woman said through clenched teeth, handing Agatha her bag and phone.

Agatha shook her head. ‚ÄúNat, it wouldn‚Äôt hurt‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúNyet.‚Äù

Agatha groaned. ‚ÄúYou need to get laid.‚Äù Agatha followed Nat out to the car waiting for them. It was mid-morning, and they were headed back to Agatha‚Äôs house before going up to Nicky‚Äôs school later in the afternoon. Agatha and Wanda both needed to speak to his football coach.

‚ÄúWhat I need and what I want are two entirely different things,‚Äù Nat replied in Russian, careful others might overhear.

‚ÄúI got a few numbers of some very attractive women for you,‚Äù Agatha offered.

‚ÄúKeep them, I did get the number of the woman with the blue and purple hair you kept looking at.‚Äù Nat handed it to her.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the best wing-woman, Natasha.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio looked around her classroom and smiled. She had gotten everything set up the way she wanted it. The assignment turn-in stations, absent work, grouped seats, expectations, the lab, and all the equipment. Not bad for two days of work. She had also met with the other science teachers and had her two weeks of professional development, meetings, lesson planning, and other before-school starting activities scheduled. Meet the teacher night was exactly a week from today, and her butterflies about it were settling.

Ms. Calderu had already talked with the three new-to-campus teachers about what to expect, and Rio had Alice to advise her. Alice had been right when she said that teachers didn‚Äôt leave SHIELD until they retired or died. The rest of the faculty had been here for years, and Rio took comfort in that. It meant Rio had a lot of people she could go to if she had any questions. She checked her watch, it was three, and Rio and Alice planned to go down to the football field at 3:30. The team would be in the weight room, but Alice was going to point out Nicky and Tommy to Rio so she could familiarize herself with them. There were a few other students Alice wanted to introduce her to as well, if there was time, and Rio hoped there would be a few parents milling about‚Äînamely, Agatha and Wanda. Rio had just zipped up her green teacher bag when Alice came in, loaded down with her own teacher bag and work to take home.

‚ÄúI thought we could drop our stuff off at my car before we went down to the fieldhouse,‚Äù Alice said as she walked into the room and looked around at the transformed space. ‚ÄúWow, you wasted no time getting settled. It took me years to get my room the way I like it.‚Äù She added.

The two women had decided to carpool most days since they were coming from the same place. It made the most sense.

‚ÄúSure, let me just grab everything.‚Äù Rio gathered her own take-home work and looked down at her outfit. She wore a Phoenix Mercury shirt, her favorite WNBA team, denim shorts, and green Nikes. Her shoulder-length, dark brown hair was pulled back in a messy bun. She was a hot mess and looked like she had been working in her room all day, which she had been. ‚ÄúIs this appropriate attire to potentially meet parents or students in?‚Äù She gave Alice a skeptical look.

Alice scoffed. Her black and red hair was thrown up in a ponytail, and she wore an old Led Zeppelin shirt, basketball shorts, and Converse. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine. Trust me, no one is dressed up around here until school starts. Everyone around here, students and parents, are still humans. Even Calderu had on joggers when I saw her earlier. It‚Äôs fine.‚Äù Alice reassured her as they walked out to her car. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm pretty sure I saw part of Wagatha‚Äôs security detail though, if you need to freshen up or something,‚Äù Alice teased.

‚ÄúDid you just call them by their ship name?‚Äù Rio gasped. Alice had insisted the two weren‚Äôt together, yet here she was, using the ship name people who were convinced they were dating would use for them.

Alice laughed. ‚ÄúEven they agree it‚Äôs easier and use it for themselves. It‚Äôs a big joke to them.‚Äù Alice unlocked her Jeep as they dropped their stuff in the backseat, closed the doors, and relocked it. She joined arms with Rio and led her down to the field house. ‚ÄúBesides, it‚Äôs just Wanda Maximoff and Agatha Harkness. No big deal.‚Äù She added with a shit-eating grin.

Rio looked at her incredulously. ‚ÄúOkay, Ms. ‚ÄòMy Mom Was A Hollywood Star‚Äô and these are my friends. This isn‚Äôt exactly a normal Tuesday activity for me. Meeting your mom was one thing, and the few celebrities who dropped by, but this is completely different.‚Äù

The pair slowed as they approached the fieldhouse, which looked like it belonged to a college campus. A woman with dark red hair pulled back in a French braid that stopped between her shoulder blades, wearing a blue tank top and black shorts, stood beside the door, scrolling on her phone, but very alert.

‚ÄúHey, Alice! We‚Äôve missed you.‚Äù She said, not even looking up.

Alice waved. ‚ÄúHey, Nat. This is Rio Vidal, the sister I‚Äôve told you guys about and SHIELD‚Äôs new high school science teacher. Rio, this is Natasha Romanov. She‚Äôs on Wagatha‚Äôs security team, and yes, they share the team.‚Äù Natasha‚Äôs eyebrow rose slightly at that. Alice turned back to the redhead. ‚ÄúSo I assume they‚Äôre in there.‚Äù

Natasha glanced over Rio for a bit longer than necessary before offering a hand in greeting. ‚ÄúNice to meet you, Ms. Vidal.‚Äù

Rio blushed and returned the greeting. ‚ÄúPlease, call me Rio.‚Äù Was LA just crawling with attractive women? Had she died and gone to lesbian heaven?

‚ÄúRio, it is then. Call me Nat.‚Äù Nat looked back at Alice. ‚ÄúYes, they‚Äôre going over schedules with Coach Rogers.‚Äù She turned back to Rio. ‚ÄúTrying to work past the Agatha Harkness nerves before you‚Äôre surrounded next week?‚Äù

Rio blushed. ‚ÄúIs it that obvious?‚Äù

Nat gave her a sweet smile. ‚ÄúTrust me, you‚Äôre not the first one. She‚Äôs a big deal. I‚Äôve known her, both of them, forever. Don‚Äôt let her name or smile go to your‚Ä¶‚Äù She paused and looked her up and down. A gesture that the younger woman felt everywhere. ‚Äú...head.‚Äù She finished. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre both very devoted parents, and when they‚Äôre on this side of the country, they‚Äôre present at everything. Also, so you‚Äôre prepared, Agatha has on a low-cut shirt and Bermuda shorts that show off every muscle with random tennis shoes. Wanda is wearing a very cute and appropriate sleeveless, black sundress with sandals.‚Äù She said with a grin.

Alice laughed as she saw the shock on Rio‚Äôs face. She knew that Nat was teasing and playing with Rio. She had told her friends about Rio and how she hoped to pull her into the ‚Äòcoven‚Äô as they called themselves. This was Nat‚Äôs way of preparing Rio for the force that was Agatha.

‚ÄúTrust us, Rio, it helps when you go in prepared. Now come on.‚Äù Alice grabbed her hand and swiped her badge for the door to open. Alice leaned in and whispered into Rio‚Äôs ear. ‚ÄúEspecially since she was your gay awakening.‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs cheeks immediately went bright red.

They walked through the door, and Rio could hear the sounds of weights clinking against each other and boys purposefully grunting too hard. The air was also a mix of teenage boy sweat and various scents of Axe. She wanted to gag. They walked down the hall, and there in the main workroom were roughly forty boys on various machines. A tall boy of roughly sixteen who was running on a treadmill saw Alice, and his face lit up. He jammed his fingers against the buttons and hopped off, smacking the arm of the boy next to him. The boy who got off first had messy brown hair and blue eyes. He looked exactly like Agatha Harkness. The other boy was slightly shorter and thinner, not having as much muscle as the other, with straight brown hair and green eyes. He looked just like Wanda. They both came up to them grinning.

‚ÄúHey Ali-Ms.Wu!‚Äù Nicky said, as he turned to Rio. ‚ÄúYou must be Ms. Vidal. I‚Äôm Nicky Harkness, this is my cousin Tommy.‚Äù They both extended their hands, and she returned their greetings. They were very polite young men, but she wasn‚Äôt easily fooled. Rio was well-versed in teenage boys and had been warned by multiple faculty members about their true personas and the pranks they had pulled in the past.¬† Nicky turned back to look at Alice.

‚ÄúMom and Aunt Wanda are talking to Coach Rogers in the office. I assume that‚Äôs why you came down here.‚Äù

Alice raised an eyebrow in warning. ‚ÄúNo first names at school, Nicky. You know that,‚Äù she reminded him. Rio was starting to see what Alice had meant about her being close with Wagatha and their family.

Nicky and Tommy both nodded as they mumbled a ‚ÄúYes ma‚Äôam,‚Äù and went back to their workouts. Alice turned and headed to the offices, not making it far as the women they were looking for had apparently completed their meeting and were heading back.

‚ÄúAlice!‚Äù Wanda exclaimed, a wide smile lighting up her face. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve missed you so much! You‚Äôve been so busy this summer, and we‚Äôve been wrapping projects.‚Äù She pulled the woman in for a hug. Agatha had been looking down at her phone, popped her head up upon hearing Alice‚Äôs name, and smiled brightly at her. She also pulled Alice in for a tight hug, greeting her.

Rio hung back, taking in the exchange. Realizing just how much of Alice‚Äôs life she had missed out on over the past decade. This looked like a small reunion, not reconnecting with the parents of students.

Rio‚Äôs train of self-pity derailed as Wanda‚Äôs bright green eyes landed on her. ‚ÄúYou must be Rio! Alice has told us about you.‚Äù Wanda pulled Rio into a hug, too, surprising Rio as she awkwardly hugged her back. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Wanda, welcome to SHIELD.‚Äù Wanda released Rio, who turned, right toward Agatha.

Rio had grown up with Alice Wu, the daughter of the legendary Lorna Wu. She had met Lorna several times. Rio had even met a few other celebrities as she revolved around the Lorna Wu star, but Agatha Harkness was always the star to beat. She was the Hollywood celebrity and ‚Äúit‚Äù woman of Rio‚Äôs most formative years. Now, here Rio was, about to meet her face-to-face as an adult. How she managed to have words or move was beyond her. She smiled and extended her hand. ‚ÄúHi, Ms. Harkness, I‚Äôm Rio, Nicky‚Äôs new science teacher.‚Äù

Agatha shook her hand with a laugh. ‚ÄúOh, please, call me Agatha.‚Äù

Rio could‚Äôve sworn she saw something flicker across those ocean-blue eyes and that her smile wavered, but Rio wasn‚Äôt sure why and shrugged it off, chalking it up to her imagination. Rio was internally screaming and trying so hard to remain calm. Agatha‚Äôs smile was electric. She was pretty sure that if the school lost power, Agatha‚Äôs smile alone could light the entire campus.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nice to meet you, Agatha. I‚Äôm a huge fan.‚Äù She cringed internally‚Äîstupid thing to say. Agatha laughed again, her blue eyes sparkling.

‚ÄúWell, you know what they say, never meet your idols. Hopefully, I won‚Äôt disappoint you.‚Äù Agatha smiled genuinely, trying to keep her embarrassment from creeping across her face. What the hell, Harkness? And stop laughing!

Eyebrow raised, Wanda glanced over at her best friend and took her cue. ‚ÄúWell, it smells like a teenage boy in here, and the mix of gym socks, Axe, and blue Gatorade is giving me a headache. Let‚Äôs continue this outside, shall we?‚Äù Wanda cleared her throat and slid her eyes down to where Agatha and Rio were still clasping hands. Agatha immediately dropped the younger woman‚Äôs hand and smoothed out her shorts absentmindedly.

‚ÄúYes, right, outside.‚Äù

Alice looked over at Rio, who was pretending to be very interested in something on the floor as she tucked a strand of hair behind her ear.

The four women headed outside into the late July air. An awkward silence between them, with Wanda and Alice exchanging knowing looks. Once they were outside, Nat fell into step behind them as they headed to the car that Wanda and Agatha were in. The boys still had another hour to practice.

‚ÄúThere was a write-up about each teacher in the newsletter, but it didn‚Äôt say what brought you to LA, Rio. Any reason in particular?‚Äù Wanda asked, looking over at Rio. Ideas were formulating in her head. She knew Agatha better than anyone, and that woman had never ONCE reacted that way when meeting someone. Agatha always controlled the situation, flirted, and decided what type of encounter to have, and that was that. Alice had already prepared Agatha that Rio was her sister and not to make things awkward. Alice wanted Rio to find a place within their little family, not become another one of Agatha‚Äôs conquests.

Wanda, seeing how Agatha had reacted and reading her the way Agatha Harkness herself had taught her to, was pretty sure Agatha didn‚Äôt want that either.

Rio had practiced answering this question to ensure it sounded real. She would not be telling people that there had been a dating/break-up/stalker situation that ended in heartbreak and disaster.

‚ÄúThe school I was at had minimal growth potential, and I decided I needed a change. Alice and I have been friends, sisters, since we were twelve, so I came out here.‚Äù She gave a friendly smile in her reply.



Wanda nodded and smiled back. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs exciting! I‚Äôm so glad to have you join us here and look forward to getting to know you better. I wish we could chat more, but Agatha and I have a meeting to get to. We‚Äôll see you around this week, I‚Äôm sure, and for sure next week.‚Äù Wanda knew Rio‚Äôs answer was bullshit as she remembered Alice running off to San Francisco unexpectedly last spring, and Lilia following shortly after. Still, she wasn‚Äôt going to call her out, yet. She looked over at Agatha, who still had a stupid smile plastered on her face. They were at their car when Nat opened the door, trying to usher them inside. They waved and asked the two teachers to email the class syllabi over to them. They already had Alice‚Äôs, but they asked anyway.

Once Wanda was sure the other two women were on the way to their car, she smacked Agatha‚Äôs arm hard. ‚ÄúWHAT THE FUCK WAS THAT HARKNESS?!

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio slid into the seat and put her hands over her face. ‚ÄúFuck! I am so glad that the first meeting is over. I behaved like a tongue-tied fangirl. ‚ÄòI‚Äôm a big fan, ‚Äô who admits that? She‚Äôs just so pretty, and confident, and involved, and‚Ä¶‚Äù She stared out the window as her words trailed off.

Alice was shaking her head as she pulled out of the parking lot. ‚ÄúAnd, she‚Äôs into you.‚Äù She said, ending her friend‚Äôs sentence, very matter-of-factly.

Rio cackled. ‚ÄúShe absolutely is not. She was busy messaging or whatever, and I interrupted her.‚Äù Rio used her hand to emphasize her point. There was not a world in which Agatha Harkness, goddess, was interested in her: Rio Vidal, teacher, and regular person.

Alice rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúOkay, sure. That‚Äôs what that was.‚Äù

‚ÄúExactly. Do you want me to make dinner tonight?‚Äù

‚ÄúRemember, Ri. I‚Äôm friends with them. We hang out regularly. They‚Äôre family.‚Äù Alice said calmly, though Rio‚Äôs scream of excitement was deafening.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

‚ÄúAgatha? Agatha? AGATHA!‚Äù Wanda had been trying to get Agatha‚Äôs attention since they had gotten in the car to no avail. Agatha could get so buried in her thoughts that she could block everything and everyone else out. Wanda waved her hand in front of her face, ‚ÄúYo, ground control to Major Tom!‚Äù Finally, the older woman snapped out of it and looked around the large SUV. First at Wanda and then at Nat.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù Agatha finally replied, startled.

‚ÄúWhat happened back there?‚Äù Wanda asked again.

Agatha thought back on the last few minutes. She had raised her eyes and saw Rio. Her heart had quite possibly stopped when those brown eyes looked into her soul. Agatha had a body count a few miles long and she was no stranger to beautiful women, but this was different. She had also made an absolute fool of herself. She, who was always quick-witted and sure of herself, had said something stupid. Shook a hand for far too long. Needed Wanda to come to her rescue. Never in history had that happened before. Wanda was notoriously useless around women. She turned her eyes to Wanda and Nat.

‚ÄúI have no fucking idea.‚Äù

Wanda‚Äôs grin illuminated her whole face. ‚ÄúOh my God! You just fell hard for her! You like her!‚Äù She grabbed Agatha‚Äôs arm and shook her.

Agatha raised an eyebrow and looked at her best friend. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not. I‚Äôm just dehydrated or something.‚Äù Echoing a young woman she once knew. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs 16 years younger than me, a teacher at the school our children go to, and I do not fall for people. People fall for me and then get their hearts broken.‚Äù She replied.

‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs romantic.‚Äù Nat chimed in.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm very upfront about it first,‚Äù Agatha added.

‚ÄúBecause that makes it better,‚Äù Wanda added.

Agatha shrugged. ‚ÄúAnyway, everything is fine. It was a fluke.‚Äù

Agatha turned her head to look out the window. Every time she closed her eyes, she thought of Rio‚Äôs smile.

She remembered the phone number in her bag and knew she‚Äôd be tearing it up and throwing it away when they got home.

No reason.

Chapter End Notes

Please let me know what you think!

I Was Enchanted To Meet You

Chapter Summary

We learn some more backstory and our loveable idiots deny everything.
They'll do that for awhile.

Chapter Notes

I own nothing and will be using some tidbits that are canon.
Updated 5/6/25

See the end of the chapter for more notes

üé∂

The playful conversation starts

Counter all your quick remarks

Like passing notes in secrecy

Enchanted - Taylor Swift

üé∂

Late July

Wanda was buzzing with energy, which had nothing to do with the wine she had been drinking. Her best friend in the entire world finally liked someone, and she, Wanda Maximoff, had witnessed the meet-cute.

They sat in Agatha‚Äôs living room, music playing lightly in the background. Wanda was snuggled in the corner of the plush black couch, legs crossed in front of her, body turned so she could see Agatha on the opposite end of the couch, and Jennifer Kale on the couch perpendicular to them. Jen was their right-hand girl. Manager, agent, public relations, friend, and all-around go-to woman for whatever they needed. Nat sat beside Jen, nursing a drink and reading something on her tablet.

‚ÄúSo, let me get this right. Agatha Harkness, our Aggie, actually acted like a tongue-tied teenager in front of a beautiful woman who happens to be Alice‚Äôs best friend?‚Äù Jennifer asked, her brown eyes wide, mouth open in shock.

‚ÄúOh, shut up. Even on my worst days, I‚Äôm still as smooth as that head of yours.‚Äù Agatha shot back, referencing Jen‚Äôs most recent haircut, as she had chosen a very short fade that made her appear bald. She was gorgeous, though Agatha would never admit it, and Jen exuded confidence with it.

Wanda knew that this was how Jen and Agatha communicated; the two of them needed each other to remain employed and on top of their respective careers.

Jen, not missing a beat, quirked an eyebrow. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs better than that rat‚Äôs nest you call hair.‚Äù She shot back.

‚ÄúStop it, you two, or I‚Äôm taking away the wine,‚Äù Nat said sternly, but with a smile.

They both mumbled, ‚Äúshe started it,‚Äù but stopped bickering for the moment.

‚ÄúAnyway,‚Äù Wanda continued, ‚Äúshe is Alice‚Äôs best friend, Agatha. You probably met her once or twice before Lorna died, since they‚Äôve been friends for so long. I vaguely remember seeing her at Lorna‚Äôs funeral,‚Äù she recalled.

Agatha thought about it for a moment and turned to Jen.

‚ÄúWe saw Alice a few times when she was young, for holidays and stuff. You know, Lorna kept her personal life and her Hollywood life divided, and Alice lived with Norma, Lorna‚Äôs mom. Alice was in college when Lorna died, and we were all disguised at the funeral since it was closed to celebrities and kept small considering everything. We were surprised Alice took the position at SHIELD as quickly as she did after Norma died. I‚Äôm sure I did meet Rio when she was a kid, the way those two were inseparable, but I don‚Äôt quite remember,‚Äù Agatha lied, the explanation was for Jen‚Äôs benefit as Nat and Wanda had been there at the time. Lorna had been a mentor and confidant for Agatha and was in their inner circle at the time.¬† Agatha would never forget the look on Rio‚Äôs face those two times they had accidentally run into each other two decades ago, but no one needed to know that. It had been entertaining, but she hadn‚Äôt been able to find much amusement in it for long. Agatha had been there out of concern for Lorna and her own need to speak to her urgently. ‚ÄúObviously, I wasn‚Äôt paying attention. That would be weird.‚Äù She replied.

Alice had been twenty-two when her mother died from an overdose at an Oscars after-party. Norma died three years later.

When Alice started teaching at SHIELD, everyone was surprised she wanted anything to do with Hollywood, especially given how insistent Lorna had been on keeping Alice away from it and then what had happened.

Wanda shrugged. ‚ÄúStill, you need to talk to her more, get to know her, ask her out‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚Äú...Date her, get married, have babies.‚Äù Nat finished with a sly smile.

‚ÄúOh, not you too!‚Äù Agatha gave an exasperated sigh. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nothing! I was just, caught off-guard! That‚Äôs all! I need harder liquor for this.‚Äù She said as she got up and marched to the bar area beside the kitchen.

‚ÄúJust keep it out of the tabloids and away from the paparazzi, will you? I‚Äôm trying to generate award buzz for you two and am in negotiations for your next roles. I don‚Äôt need to be cleaning up after you screwing your son‚Äôs science teacher after last year's debacle.‚Äù Jen said, scrolling socials and media websites to make sure current chatter was all positive.

Agatha decided it was better to get water instead of continuing to drink as she returned to the living room and sat on the couch, leaning against Wanda. ‚ÄúThe only people I‚Äôm screwing are random models and people I meet that sign an NDA.‚Äù

Wanda and Nat both rolled their eyes and sighed as Jen smirked and raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs my hoe,‚Äù Jen grunted as Nat elbowed her hard in the side. Agatha chuckled.

‚ÄúBesides, Alice is family, and it‚Äôs just a matter of time before Rio starts spending time with us. I‚Äôm not going to sleep with a member of our little coven. No one else is pulling that trigger.‚Äù

All eyes landed on Jen.

‚ÄúWhoa, why is everyone looking at me?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause it‚Äôs been ten years and neither of you have made a move,‚Äù Wanda sighed.

Jen shook her head. ‚ÄúWe are not talking about me right now, this is about Agatha. Let‚Äôs go back to making fun of her, please.‚Äù

Agatha scoffed.

In all honesty, Agatha knew that she would find an excuse to run into Rio the next time she was up at SHIELD. She suddenly was only interested in Nicky‚Äôs science class for the upcoming year.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio sat on her couch, eating the stir-fry she had made for both of them, as Alice turned off the episode of The Drew Barrymore Show they had recorded. ‚ÄúThey are both going to be nominated for that Oscar, I bet Agatha wins it,‚Äù Rio said as she turned the music on for background noise, Freddie Mercury‚Äôs voice filling the air. ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt even seen the movie, but judging by the song and everything that‚Äôs been said about it, I‚Äôm just going with it.‚Äù

‚ÄúOoh, maybe she‚Äôll take you to the Oscars as her date!‚Äù Alice grinned ear-to-ear.

Rio smacked her arm. ‚ÄúStop it. She and Wanda will probably go together since they‚Äôll both be nominated.‚Äù Rio ate the last bite of her dinner and took both of their bowls to the kitchen to put in the dishwasher and clean up. Rio typically inhaled her food and would wait until Alice was mostly done with hers before she started eating. ‚ÄúPlus, she is not into me. I‚Äôm sixteen years younger than she is, remember? Her son fits in that age gap. I‚Äôve almost had Raven as long as that age gap. I have pants as old as that age gap.‚Äù She just shook her head as she put leftovers in a container for lunch the next day.

Alice rolled her eyes as her best friend returned and settled opposite her on the couch. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre smitten. You‚Äôve been obsessed with her forever. The few times she was at Gran‚Äôs growing up, you nearly combusted.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a difference between being obsessed with a celebrity and meeting them as a normal parent of one of your students. Besides, that was almost twenty years ago, I was a child, and it happened twice at Gran‚Äôs when we were teenagers. I thought Agatha was sleeping with your mom.‚Äù Rio recalled.

Lorna rarely came to Gran‚Äôs, trying her best to keep Alice away from Hollywood. She didn‚Äôt want Alice to fall into the life that had consumed her. Every time Lorna came home, it was in an attempt to get clean. Every time, she eventually relapsed, but she would try. Agatha came to visit her twice. They were on a TV show together then.

‚ÄúThen there was the funeral, when she and Wanda were disguised, and Agatha pulled you aside,‚Äù Rio added solemnly.¬† When Lorna died, it was right after she had won an Oscar with Agatha for the song from The Witches Road, as well as Best Supporting Actress, and Best Feature Film. She had won three Oscars that night, and hours later, she overdosed and died.

Lorna had co-starred with Agatha in The Witches Road, and the movie had consumed her. It was an instant classic, shooting to the top ten of all the best movie lists. However, it was a dark movie and it had been said that Lorna couldn‚Äôt handle the subject matter.

Gran had been furious and held a very small funeral, keeping it closed to celebrities and anyone else from Hollywood.

Wanda, Agatha, Nat, and a few other co-stars from that movie had snuck in. Agatha had pulled Alice aside and talked to her, slipping her information for a therapist, lawyers in case she needed them, and Lilia Calderu‚Äôs information for after graduation.

Lorna had always bragged about how Alice was going to be a teacher and influence the lives of children and have a lasting impact.

Alice had been bitter, but when Gran died, she finally called Lilia Calderu and applied to SHIELD.

Alice‚Äôs voice broke through the memories. ‚ÄúI remember!‚Äù She laughed. ‚ÄúI had to remind you how straight my mother was.‚Äù Which was true. She was a huge ally, but Lorna had been married multiple times to famous men. One marriage lasted only 28 hours, and she had zero romantic interest in women-something Lorna once called a tragedy.

Rio shook her head and smiled. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs still weird knowing that you‚Äôre technically Hollywood royalty, but I get surprised when I see you call these people by their first names or act so friendly with them. I‚Äôm still shocked that you‚Äôre friends with Agatha and Wanda.‚Äù

The other woman shrugged. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt grow up in it. We usually weren't whenever Mom and her famous friends were at home. The few times we were, it was just as shocking to me as it was to you. I wasn‚Äôt close to these people. I know them now, and you will too. With this particular group of women, they‚Äôre my family, I was just bound by NDAs and couldn't say anything.‚Äù Alice looked at Rio before her eyes lit up. ‚ÄúHopefully you‚Äôll get really close to Agatha,‚Äù she added as she put her arms up to shield her face in case Rio smacked her with a pillow or anything else. They had had their share of pillow fights, and stuffed animal fights, Rio had used the occasional chancla, whatever was handy, growing up. They were millennials. It‚Äôs how they showed affection.

Rio just groaned. ‚ÄúNo. Could you imagine? I‚Äôd have her fans try to murder me, I‚Äôm sure.‚Äù She thought about what Alice had said about being kept out of the spotlight, and she was right. She spent more time at Alice‚Äôs than at her own home as a kid and had her own room there by the time she was fourteen. It was a haven for her. Her parents hadn‚Äôt been great, and they never noticed when she wasn‚Äôt home either. When they died, she was a senior in high school, and Gran legally became her guardian, even though she technically already had been. Alice truly was the only family she had. Gran would usually send the girls away when Lorna would come home, not wanting them to see the detox process. She had been such a good mother to the girls. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not into me, and I don‚Äôt date parents of students,‚Äù Rio added.

Alice just shrugged. ‚ÄúWhatever you say, Captain Oblivious.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Early August

It was Friday, and there was still another week before school started. Rio had been trying to put that meeting in the back of her memories, but it kept replaying in her thoughts. She was sitting at her desk, working on her About Me and Meet the Teacher slideshow with Fletcher playing in the background. Rio was absolutely NOT picturing Agatha Harkness‚Äôs smile when there was a knock on her open classroom door. She looked up, expecting to see a coworker. Instead, standing in front of her was Agatha Harkness, as if Rio had summoned the global megastar with her mind. Agatha‚Äôs hair was down in soft waves down to her elbows. She wore a purple, sleeveless, button-up blouse, with high-waisted black shorts. Black sandals completed the outfit. She looked amazing and had that dazzling smile. Rio could‚Äôve sworn she was dreaming and subtly pinched her leg under her desk. It hurt. Not dreaming.

‚ÄúHi Rio, am I catching you at a bad time?‚Äù Agatha asked, having stepped slightly into the brightly lit classroom.

Rio stared for a moment before she remembered how to blink. Where was Alice? Wanda? Nat? A fucking mouse? Literally, anyone or anything would be helpful right now.

‚ÄúOh, no, just preparing some things for next week. How can I help you, Ms. Ha..‚Äù She faltered for a moment, ‚ÄúAgatha?‚Äù She smiled as she stood up and walked around her desk to meet in the middle, sitting on top of one of the student desks, painfully aware of the black basketball shorts and Pink Pony Club tank top she was wearing with a sports bra. Her hair was up in another messy bun, escaped strands falling around her face, and she had ditched her shoes an hour or so ago. Parents weren‚Äôt supposed to be in the building today, but Alice had warned her that Agatha was allowed to do basically whatever she wanted.



Agatha sat on a desk close to Rio, and they turned to face each other, an empty desk between them. Great Agatha, now you have to come up with a reason as to why you‚Äôre here. ‚ÄúNicky has football practice,‚Äù Okay, not a lie, ‚Äúso I thought I‚Äôd see which teachers were here to go ahead and see who would be signing up to do concession stand duty at games and maybe get supply lists. Everything I‚Äôve been working on is currently in post, and all of my press and such is around here, so I have some time on my hands to be pretty involved, which is what I prefer.‚Äù Okay, that sounded somewhat believable. She thought to herself.

Rio raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúYou go school shopping with Nicky?‚Äù She asked. Did mega-celebrities actually do that? She wondered.

‚ÄúDepending on my schedule at this point of the year, yes. I really try to be as hands-on as I possibly can.‚Äù Agatha reiterated. ‚ÄúSame with working concessions at football games and track meets. I‚Äôve seen firsthand what happens when people get caught up more in fame and leave their children to be raised by others. I swore I wouldn't do that when I had Nicky, and Wanda did the same with the boys. So here we are, our little chosen family, doing what we can to give them as much of a normal life as possible.‚Äù She explained. Why was she explaining this all to a stranger? She didn‚Äôt know. There was just something about Rio that made her want to tell her everything. She was so easy to talk to, and that was dangerous.



Rio nodded. Alice was somewhat a product of what Agatha was talking about, and Rio wondered if she was one of the children she was talking about, but she let it slide. ‚ÄúAll of that information will be readily available on Tuesday at Open House.‚Äù

What the fuck Vidal? She immediately thought to herself. That is Agatha Fucking Harkness and you‚Äôre thinking about rules? Give her the goddamn list! You already emailed her the syllabus! Hell, give her the answers to the first test if she asks! She shook the thoughts from her head.

‚ÄúI mean, I‚Äôm sure you want to get a head start this weekend. Let me print out a copy of what Nicky needs specifically for class.‚Äù She replied, trying to breathe normally, walking back to her desk.

Agatha‚Äôs smile brightened if that was even possible.

‚ÄúThank you. He‚Äôs still at the age where it‚Äôs fun to drag him out and embarrass him.‚Äù

Rio noticed that Agatha had followed her to her desk and was leaning against it, very close to Rio.

‚ÄúOh, I‚Äôm sure it is. Alice and I embarrassed ourselves plenty. We didn‚Äôt need adults around to help.‚Äù She smiled up at Agatha, clicking around the desktop for the files she needed and tapping her foot slightly to the beat of the current song, trying to act natural when she realized her music had changed to a very not safe for work playlist.

Rio‚Äôs face went bright red as the lyrics rang out, ‚ÄúGet into my bed, girls just want to have sex.‚Äù

Rio scrambled to find the music player and turn it off. ‚ÄúLike right now,‚Äù she mumbled.

Agatha chuckled. ‚ÄúI love that playlist, though I‚Äôm partial to ‚ÄòShe Calls Me Daddy‚Äô and ‚ÄòMommy Issues.‚Äô‚Äù

Rio choked on her saliva.

Agatha smirked. Where was everyone now? She still had it. She was smooth, no tripping up for this dyke. The other day was a total fluke. Except Rio was still coughing and turning blue. Agatha looked around for the required teacher tumbler and grabbed the green metal water cup with random stickers.

Agatha knelt down and put the straw to Rio‚Äôs lips. Rio sucked down water and Agatha looked down at the tile floor. Agatha proving to herself that she could flirt harmlessly had made Rio choke.

That was not the kind of choking Agatha enjoyed.

Rio‚Äôs coughing subsided, her eyes watery. ‚ÄúThank you, I don‚Äôt know what happened.‚Äù She laughed nervously.

‚ÄúSomeone made inappropriate jokes, and you choked. I think I saw them run out of the door.‚Äù Agatha pointed.

Rio poked her tongue in her cheek, realizing how close they had come to each other. She backed up and stood, pressing the print button. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs get you those documents, shall we?‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Wanda had lost Agatha, at SHIELD of all places.

They were on a specific mission to get the finalized new parent list from the front office. Wanda had stepped into the principal‚Äôs office, while the other three women waited for the list.

‚ÄúI just need to ask Lilia a quick question about this weekend is all,‚Äù Wanda had said, before slipping into the office. She knew Agatha wouldn‚Äôt follow. Agatha spent enough time in Lilia‚Äôs office, with as much as Nicky and Tommy got into trouble during the year, always the one to smooth things over. She didn‚Äôt want to spend more time there than she had to.

So technically, Wanda didn‚Äôt lose Agatha, Nat, and Jen did.

How had three women, lost ONE award-winning actress?

Wanda had replayed the events of the past few days for Lilia Calderu and made sure to emphasize Agatha‚Äôs insistence that she was not attracted to Rio.

Lilia emitted a throaty laugh, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about time Agatha finds someone who can truly understand her and meet her where she‚Äôs at.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat do you mean?‚Äù Wanda tilted her head in question.

‚ÄúRio has a past too, they would be good for each other,‚Äù Lilia shrugged. Wanda had known Lilia since she had landed in Los Angeles all those years before and Lilia still baffled her.

Lilia turned her eyes to the door, a gleam in her eye and a knowing smile playing at the corners of her lips. ‚ÄúYou better go find Agatha.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs right outside the door with Jen and Nat.‚Äù Wanda furrowed her eyebrows.

Lilia was a fixture at SHIELD, with many joking that she came with the building. She had secured a position right out of college and had risen to principal. She knew everything about everyone and was incredibly insightful. Many alumni, or just those who knew her, were convinced she could tell the future.

‚ÄúIs she?‚Äù

Nat and Jen rushed through the door.

‚ÄúWe lost Agatha,‚Äù Nat said first.

‚ÄúWhich normally wouldn‚Äôt be a big deal, but‚Ä¶‚Äù Jen trailed off.

The three women turned their heads to Lilia as she huffed a laugh and waved a hand, dismissing them.

They left the office, Wanda in the lead. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll go to Alice‚Äôs classroom first, see if she‚Äôs seen her. Then we‚Äôll head to Rio‚Äôs,‚Äù she instructed.

Wanda would normally not be concerned. However, Agatha had been right that this was Alice‚Äôs best friend and someone who would inevitably spend more time with all of them.

Wanda had a plan, and she was not going to let Agatha‚Äôs abnormally high sex drive mess it up.

Jen snickered. ‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt one or both of you make a cheesy high school movie like this? You know, back when Agatha was young?‚Äù

Wanda rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not old now, and those were generally slasher flicks with a killer chasing us.‚Äù They turned down a hall as she looked at Nat. ‚ÄúAren‚Äôt you supposed to know where we are, body guard?‚Äù A sly smile tugged at Wanda‚Äôs lips.

Nat glanced at Wanda as they arrived at¬† Alice‚Äôs classroom. ‚ÄúPhone tracking says she‚Äôs in the building. The building with more security than Fort Knox, I think she‚Äôll be okay.‚Äù

They walked into the familiar classroom decorated with an assortment of history, motivational, and pop-culture posters. Bookshelves around the room held the expected books and supplies as well an array of student projects from over the years, gifts from previous students, and various personal touches. Stevie Nicks came through the overhead speaker, and standing precariously on a chair, placed on top of a table, was Alice, attempting to put shades over the fluorescent lights to make the lighting less harsh.

‚ÄúAlice,‚Äù Wanda said as she walked in, scanning the room, ‚Äúhave you seen Agatha?‚Äù



‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù Alice turned quickly as if she had forgotten her current situation. The chair toppled, and Alice came tumbling from her makeshift tower. Nat and Jen rushed forward to keep her from being seriously injured. Jen, having the longer stride as the taller of the two, caught Alice around the waist.

‚ÄúThanks,‚Äù Alice said, blushing, as Jen helped her to the ground the rest of the way. They quickly parted as Jen mumbled that it was nothing and looked at the ground. Nat and Wanda exchanged understanding and knowing looks.

‚ÄúUh, yeah, she stopped by to ask where Rio‚Äôs room is,‚Äù Alice fidgeted with her clothing ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt really touched base with any of you. Is Agatha into Rio?‚Äù She would add that moment with Jen to the pile of other moments with Jen. They had collected a decade of them and hadn‚Äôt done anything about it yet. What was another few decades?



Wanda turned, gesturing for Alice to lead the way as they headed to Rio‚Äôs room. Being in charge was something Wanda was trying to do more often, and she found it thrilling.

‚ÄúShe lies and says she‚Äôs not, that Rio‚Äôs too young and she doesn‚Äôt want a repeat of what happened before.‚Äù She explained to the younger woman as they walked down the hall.

Alice sighed. ‚ÄúRio has a rule about not dating her students‚Äô parents, but I know her.‚Äù

Jen let out a sigh of relief, ‚ÄúGreat, so we leave them alone, let them live their lives, and my job is easier.‚Äù

The other women stopped right at Rio‚Äôs door and looked back at Jen as they whispered, ‚ÄúNot a chance.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio‚Äôs skin had just returned to its natural olive state and had just handed Agatha the supply list, her school contact information, and a hard copy of the syllabus when everyone else walked in.

‚ÄúThere you are, Aggie!‚Äù Wanda said with a radiant smile. It looked mischievous to Rio.

Rio looked at Alice with a raised eyebrow but didn‚Äôt say anything. Agatha turned toward the four intruders. ‚ÄúI had just come down here to get more information about Nicky‚Äôs science class,‚Äù she explained.

Jennifer raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúOf course you did.‚Äù She turned towards Rio and extended her hand. ‚ÄúJennifer Kale, I keep these two employed and in line. I also clean up after their son‚Äôs shenanigans. You can call me Jen.‚Äù

Rio shook her hand and returned her smile. ‚ÄúRio Vidal. Science. I will try to keep an eye on Nicky and Tommy. I hear Billy stays out of trouble.‚Äù

Jen nodded. ‚ÄúYes, that one took after Vision and the young Wanda. Not the two standing before you, thankfully.‚Äù

Wanda rolled her eyes and looked back at Rio. ‚ÄúDid Agatha tell you about tomorrow?‚Äù She asked, feigning innocence.



Rio raised an eyebrow in question. ‚ÄúWhat about tomorrow?‚Äù

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe you, Aggie!‚Äù Wanda smiled warmly. ‚ÄúEvery year, we host a huge party for the teachers and parents at our beach house. We have a pool and a private beach area. We have a lot of fun, and it‚Äôs a casual way to meet the parents, with no students present, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about being in a swimsuit or drinking with kids around.

‚ÄúWe can be pretty laid back here, it‚Äôs just the general nature of the school and environment. We try to host things when we can, volunteer, chaperone, those kinds of things,‚Äù Wanda gestured with her hand as if to indicate other events. ‚ÄúTony Stark tends to host several things for the larger Hollywood community, often involving the kids, and we do things for the teachers and the school.

‚ÄúAll the teachers are there, and Calderu comes. I‚Äôm surprised Alice hasn‚Äôt mentioned it yet. Anyway, it starts around seven, and Alice knows where the house is. We‚Äôd love to have you.‚Äù At some point in her very excited explanation, Wanda had put her hand on Rio‚Äôs arm, and Agatha had turned bright red with a murderous expression.

The other three women had moved off to the back of the room and were talking in hushed, suspicious tones.

‚ÄúPlease come,‚Äù Wanda added, looking at Rio with big green eyes.

Rio couldn‚Äôt possibly tell this woman no. She glanced back at Alice, who had suddenly appeared back at her side. ‚ÄúIf Alice usually goes, then I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll be there. That sounds like a great way to meet people in a less stressful environment.‚Äù

Alice nodded, and for some reason, there were butterflies in Rio‚Äôs stomach at the thought of being at a party at Agatha‚Äôs beach house in swimwear. Rio glanced at Agatha and caught her eye. Agatha smiled slightly at Rio before turning away and returning to her more nonchalant expression.

Wanda beamed. ‚ÄúGreat! We‚Äôll see you tomorrow! We‚Äôve got to go get the boys from practice.‚Äù Wanda grabbed Agatha‚Äôs arm, and they left with their small entourage following behind them.

‚ÄúWell, that was‚Ä¶something,‚Äù Rio said after a moment. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm ready to go home. Are you ready to go home? Let‚Äôs go home.‚Äù Without waiting for Alice, Rio started gathering her things and turned off the computer. ‚ÄúWait, where‚Äôs my phone?‚Äù She asked, looking around the room.



Alice held it up. ‚ÄúFound it! It was on a desk.‚Äù In reality, Alice had grabbed it while Rio had been distracted by Wanda so that she, Jennifer, and Nat could program everyone‚Äôs numbers into it. Nat had pick-pocketed Agatha‚Äôs phone and programmed Rio‚Äôs number into it.

‚ÄúAnd yes, I‚Äôm ready to go home. I can‚Äôt believe I forgot to tell you about the party.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha found herself, once again, sitting in her living room, wine in hand, talking about Rio Vidal, the woman who was becoming a recurring theme in her thoughts and topic of conversation.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe you didn‚Äôt tell her about the party tomorrow!‚Äù Wanda exclaimed from her usual seat in the corner of the couch.

Agatha just rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúAlice always comes, I just assumed Rio would come with her.‚Äù

Nat laughed. ‚ÄúSure you did, or you were afraid to invite the pretty girl to your party and see her in a swimsuit.‚Äù

Agatha took a drink and swallowed before replying. ‚ÄúI am a grown woman. We had a nice conversation today, and for the last time, I am not attracted to her.‚Äù

Wanda just smirked and said, ‚ÄúWell, I for one think the blue shirt she wore today really brought out the green of her eyes.‚Äù She glanced at Nat and Jen to make sure they were listening for Agatha‚Äôs response.

Automatically, Agatha replied, ‚ÄúHer eyes are a beautiful light brown, amber if they catch the light just right, and she was wearing a black Pink Pony Club tank top since school hasn‚Äôt started.‚Äù After it was out of her mouth, she realized what had happened as her friends laughed. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just very observant, okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt make my job harder,‚Äù Jen groaned.

Agatha leaned back into the couch. Rio was enchanting, and Agatha believed there was nothing wrong with innocent flirting. She would not, however, go beyond that.

No more sleeping with teachers.

Chapter End Notes

I am excited about the next chapter! I apologize for the typos and all the things! You can find me under this name on bluesky. I'm on twitter, but don't really post there. Ever.

This Night is Sparkling Don't You Let it Go

Chapter Summary

A party, flirty parents, and talking while the sunsets.
Just a normal Saturday.

Chapter Notes

DaretoDream82 and I feel like these chapters just feel so much better!
All the disclaimers.
Updated 5/6/2025

See the end of the chapter for more notes

üé∂

This night is sparkling, don't you let it go

I'm wonderstruck, blushing all the way home

I'll spend forever wondering if you knew

That this night is flawless, don't you let it go

Enchanted - Taylor Swift

üé∂

Early August

Rio was going to a party at Agatha Harkness‚Äôs beach house.

Yes, it was for all of the faculty, staff, and parents at SHIELD, but the fact remained that Rio would be at a star-studded party at a beach house owned by Agatha Fucking Harkness.

After leaving school on Friday, Rio had decided she needed a new swimsuit specifically for the occasion. Alice, unsurprisingly, had jumped at the idea. Saturday morning was spent getting pedicures, something they hadn‚Äôt done together in years. While Rio hadn‚Äôt lost touch with Alice, they had grown apart, not being able to discuss much with Alice‚Äôs position being what it was. Rio felt as if she was getting to know a new version of Alice, really getting to know her. Whenever they got together for holidays or breaks, they mainly discussed Rio and her drama. Rio‚Äôs school hadn‚Äôt required NDAs, although she had a few semi-famous friends who personally required them.

Rio still told Alice everything, NDA or not.

Alice however, refused to break laws. She was far more of a stickler in that regard.

They were very different in that way, and Rio respected that, though she didn‚Äôt like the secrets and lies. Still, it was Alice, and Rio respected her deeply held beliefs of her universally distributed sister. They both had trauma and it manifested in different ways and came with it‚Äôs own responses. Rio didn‚Äôt like lies and secrets due to her previous relationship, and Alice was very adverse to breaking contracts, laws, and unspoken agreements, due to her mother breaking the unspoken bond and agreement of motherhood.

It was something Alice and Rio had discussed at length.

Rio brought herself back to the moment, checking over herself for what must have been the fiftieth time in the floor-length mirror. The royal blue bikini she had chosen complemented her tan skin and made the gold flecks in her brown eyes stand out just right. She pulled on denim cutoffs and a black tank top, letting her collarbone-length dark hair stay down for now. She had packed a bag in order to be proactive. Alice had informed that it wasn‚Äôt unusual for people to stay at the house for the night, though Agatha and Wanda would usually have their drivers take them home. Wagatha believed in safety and was adamant that people stay if needed. Rio planned for them to come home or get an Uber, but generally kept a go-bag in her car as a habit from childhood and just freshened it up for the night. Like the scouts, Rio was always prepared.

‚ÄúWhy do I feel like a teenager going to her first major party, Raven?‚Äù Rio asked her cat, who was observing her from her spot on the bed. Raven let out a meow in reply.
