‚ÄúOh, not you too. I think the two of us could be good friends, and that‚Äôs it.‚Äù She looked at the green-eyed cat that was giving her a look. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt look at me like that. Maybe you‚Äôll meet her one day‚Äîjust friends. Stop judging me like that. Besides, it‚Äôs just you and me. Well, and Alice. The last time I tried to date turned out disastrous. You never liked her, I should‚Äôve listened.‚Äù She shook her head as she heard Alice come in.

‚ÄúAre you ready? Are you having deep conversations with Raven?‚Äù She asked as she walked into the bedroom and scratched the cat under the chin. ‚ÄúI swear this cat is going to live forever.‚Äù She turned and looked at Raven. ‚ÄúYou better, at least.‚Äù She looked back at Rio, ‚ÄúYou look amazing! Agatha is going to die.‚Äù She added as Raven added a meow of agreement.

Rio rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúAgain, no. I bought this for me, no matter what you say. You look amazing, that orange was a good choice.‚Äù

Alice wore an orange bikini, black board shorts, and a blue tank top. Her black and red hair was pulled back in a ponytail and flip-flops adorned her feet. ‚ÄúLet me just grab my bag, and I‚Äôll be ready to go. Raven‚Äôs been fed.‚Äù

Ten minutes later, they were on their way to the beach, bags safely in the back, and the lyrics of ‚ÄòFeminomenon‚Äô filling the car. Rio wasn‚Äôt entirely sure why she was so nervous. It was just a massive party at Agatha Harkness and Wanda Maximoff‚Äôs beach house.

‚ÄúThey do this every year?‚Äù Rio asked, turning to Alice.

‚ÄúYes, like Wanda said, they do all the things if they can. They are the super moms. Drew loves to do things at the elementary and middle school levels, and Tony Stark loves a good party. It just depends on the occasion. SHIELD does quite a few of events, but independent activities like this? Wagatha is usually behind it if their schedule allows.‚Äù Alice answered.

Rio shook her head in disbelief, ‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs amazing, but wow. That‚Äôs a lot.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey love it. Especially Wanda. Agatha just goes along with it.‚Äù Alice added.

‚ÄúI would not do those things for you.‚Äù Rio laughed.

‚ÄúOh, you would absolutely throw random parties for me, just not school parties.‚Äù Alice agreed.

Rio looked out the windshield as they headed towards Malibu. ‚ÄúWhy, though? They‚Äôre these huge megastars. Yes, back-to-school parties happen, but why would they do something like this, especially just for the teachers and other parents and then go over the top for other things?‚Äù She looked at Alice who was focused on the road.

Alice thought about it for a moment. ‚ÄúYou know the basic Agatha Harkness back story.‚Äù She stated.

Rio nodded. ‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù

‚ÄúOkay, recap it.‚Äù

Rio looked at Alice out of the side of her eyes but did as requested. ‚ÄúAgatha‚Äôs mom put her in a beauty pageant when Agatha was a baby in October 1973 at six months old, and she instantly went into commercials and then was cast in a TV show at the age of one. Boom, instant child star.‚Äù Rio started to recap. ‚ÄúShe was cast in movies at five, and her super crazy religious mother tried to control her, no freedoms, private tutors, etc., despite the fact that she was the one who had introduced her child to Hollywood.

‚ÄúHer mom kept her as sheltered as she could, and Agatha rebelled and was friends with all the other child stars of the time.

‚ÄúHer mom, Evanora, was very abusive and caught Agatha making out with another star of the time, and outed her, thinking it would ruin Agatha, and it didn‚Äôt.

‚ÄúThe crazy bitch then tried to shoot her in public in the eighties and missed. Agatha filed to be emancipated from her mother at sixteen and won, becoming America‚Äôs lesbian sweetheart in 1989. She went on to get her high school degree that year and graduated from college, but never had an actual school, childhood, or parental experience.

‚ÄúThen, Wanda was dumped in Hollywood in 1994 after her family was killed in the war in Sokovia, and Agatha took her under her wing. Something about Wanda‚Äôs aunt was a producer on Agatha's new show, and they cast Wanda as the younger sister.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo far, yes. It was Sisters, by the way. I love that show.‚Äù Alice chimed in.

‚ÄúWe can quote that show,‚Äù Rio replied. They still watched it, even if it was nearly 30 years old. Rio and Alice watched it as a comfort show, even though it had ended in 2001.

‚ÄúSo Agatha took Wanda under her wing, and in 1995, things with the aunt went south, and Agatha basically took her in like a sister, and we see where that ended up,‚Äù Rio concluded.

Alice nodded her head. Those were all the basics Rio needed to know for now. Alice knew a few additional details more, but Agatha always seemed to provide more details when Alice thought she had known all there was to know. And Lilia mainly told Alice things about Alice‚Äôs mother.

Agatha could fill in any more nitty-gritty details from there when she was ready. That could be part of their bonding and eventual love story. Alice knew Rio had her own nitty-gritty back story to share with Agatha.

‚ÄúRight. They met Nat in 1997, that‚Äôs not my story to share, though. They, like us, are a found family with many traditions. We‚Äôre all phoenixes. Jen and Lilia even fit into the puzzle along the way, and so did I. We were all covenless witches at one point, and Agatha refers to the group as the coven, we all do.

‚ÄúAgatha and Wanda wanted to make sure their kids had great memories and wanted to give back to the places they found homes in.‚Äù

Rio took in her friend's words and looked at her for a long moment. ‚ÄúYou really have kept so much from me,‚Äù she stated, pieces of a puzzle falling into place. Alice shrugged ‚ÄúI signed several NDAs, and they were covered under that umbrella, Rio. My hands were tied.‚Äù

Rio looked down at her lap. This was Alice, the only family she had left. She couldn‚Äôt be mad at her. Not really. She understood, it just hurt. She had told Alice everything about her friends in San Francisco and Rio had also signed an NDA.

She pushed that all aside, determined not to ruin the night.

‚ÄúTell me about Jen,‚Äù Rio changed the subject with a knowing smirk.

Alice‚Äôs cheeks pinkened as she seemed to focus even more on the road, if it was even possible. ‚ÄúWhat do you mean? She‚Äôs a friend.‚Äù

‚ÄúI saw how you looked at her yesterday.‚Äù

Alice shook her head. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nothing, we‚Äôre just friends. We both moved out here about the same time, and I wouldn‚Äôt want to lose that friendship.‚Äù

Rio grinned. ‚ÄúOh good, because she‚Äôs really cute and I was thinking I would ‚Äî‚Äù

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt say you could make a move.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I thought.‚Äù Rio picked a new song to play, and they drove the last few minutes in a comfortable silence.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Everything was perfectly set up: the food, the bar, and the music. Agatha was wearing a simple black high-waisted two-piece with a white open-front cover-up monogrammed with a purple monogrammed A.H.. Wanda stood beside her in a black and white one-piece and a matching cover-up with a scarlet monogrammed W.M.

They were never beating those couple of allegations.

‚ÄúRelax, Alice texted me. They‚Äôre on their way.‚Äù Wanda put a comforting hand on Agatha‚Äôs arm, noticing how tense her best friend was.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what you mean,‚Äù Agatha replied, her shoulders automatically relaxing.

‚ÄúSure you don‚Äôt.‚Äù Wanda teased.

Natasha stepped up next to them wearing a black tank top and shorts with a red one-piece underneath. She was on duty, as evidenced by her earpiece, but the swimsuit made sense. ‚ÄúMaking a move tonight, Aggie?‚Äù She said with a slight smirk.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre all terrible friends,‚Äù Agatha pouted as Jen joined the group in her pink swim shorts and halter top.

‚ÄúThis event is too public for you to do anything anyway.‚Äù Jen nodded in agreement.

Wanda‚Äôs shoulders sagged. ‚ÄúMust you take the fun out of everything, Jen?‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio‚Äôs eyes widened as they drove through the gate and up to the Malibu beach house. Alice ignored the man who directed her where to park and chose a place of her own.

‚ÄúJust leave your bag here and bring your phone for now,‚Äù Alice instructed with a smile as she climbed down from her Jeep.

Rio looked up at the massive beach house that was more like a beach mansion.

She followed Alice up the few steps to the double doors, and they walked straight into the open-concept house, seeing straight to the back of the house, which was entirely glass.

The back doors were open, leading out to where the pool was, and beyond that, a path led to the beach. Rio‚Äôs eyes landed automatically on Agatha, who was talking to Coach Rogers. She was headed towards her when someone grabbed her arm and spun her around. Rio found herself face to face with her boss, Lilia Calderu, wearing a classy one-piece with a wrap-around skirt.

‚ÄúRio, I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre here. This is the perfect time to get to know the parents, especially some of the very well-known, award-winning ones. Have a lovely time.‚Äù Lilia smiled at her warmly and slipped back into the growing crowd. Rio stared at the spot where she had been with a baffled look on her face as Alice took her arm.

‚ÄúRemember, the woman knows more than we do and speaks in riddles.‚Äù Alice handed her a drink. ‚ÄúHere, now go talk.‚Äù Rio nodded and turned to where Agatha had been prior. She wasn‚Äôt sure why that was the first person she wanted to talk to, Rio just felt drawn to the older woman. Instead, she found herself in conversation with Pepper Potts-Stark and Drew Barrymore.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so glad you came, I was telling Agatha about you when we were filming the other day,‚Äù Drew had a hand on Rio‚Äôs arm, drawing circles on it with her thumb.

Pepper had an eyebrow raised and a smirk on her face. As a waiter walked by, she took Rio‚Äôs empty drink from her and replaced it with a full one.

Rio looked at the older blonde woman thankfully. She had a feeling that she and Pepper would be good friends.

‚ÄúOh? About what exactly?‚Äù Rio managed to get out. Why was Drew Barrymore having a conversation about her?

Drew smiled widely. ‚ÄúI had read about you in the welcome back email and told our dear Aggie that she needed to brush up on her science is all,‚Äù she said with a wink.

Rio was going to melt. Drew Barrymore was trying to set her up with Agatha Harkness. LA truly was lesbian heaven.

Pepper put a hand on Drew‚Äôs arm. ‚ÄúDrew, you‚Äôre going to cause her to short-circuit.‚Äù Pepper laughed and changed the subject. ‚ÄúAlice has told us great things about you. I‚Äôm sure Morgan will love your class.‚Äù

They chatted a little longer before Rio stepped away, their numbers added to her phone. She didn‚Äôt need Drew‚Äôs number necessarily, however, Drew insisted.

Rio smiled and blew air out of her nose with a small smile upon seeing Agatha‚Äôs number with a purple heart next to it. Devils, she thought.

The inside of the house was becoming rather crowded, and the sun was beginning to set outside. Rio took that as a sign and excused herself from the group of English teachers she was speaking to. Rio found English teachers to be the most dramatic group on any campus, and this group was already living up to that reputation. Rio slipped out the back door, picked up her third drink of the night, walked past the pool, and down the stairs and the short path to the private beach, surprised that it was empty.

Rio sat in one of the beach chairs in the sand and took in the relative quiet, the muted sounds of the party behind her and the waves in front of her.

Rio removed her sandals, set them to the side, and let her toes dig into the sand. She leaned back and took in the pink and orange hues of the sunset, the light breeze slipped over her skin.

It was a beautiful view and something she hoped she would get to do again. Maybe next year, she thought.

There had been another beach house once, but it hadn‚Äôt been nearly as peaceful. This was peaceful, and comforting, a place that spoke of family and memories.

She was lost in her thoughts and the scenery when she heard the unmistakable and familiar voice of Agatha Harkness behind her.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve always said the sunset is the universe‚Äôs way of celebrating lesbianism,‚Äù Agatha said as she sat down in the chair next to Rio, drink in hand. ‚ÄúIs it okay if I join you? I can leave if you want to continue enjoying the peace and Mother Nature‚Äôs lesbianism. I know the party gets pretty crowded and overwhelming.‚Äù She added.

Rio laughed. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs your house, pretty sure you‚Äôre allowed to sit where you want. Thank you for asking and not assuming though. Very polite of you.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have been told I‚Äôm rather polite for Hollywood elite.‚Äù She retorted.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt get ahead of yourself there, Harkness. Don‚Äôt want to inflate your ego too much.‚Äù Rio was shocked at herself. Apparently, all it took was three incredibly strong drinks and she could banter back and forth with Agatha Fucking Harkness. Wonder if I can drink at work, she considered.

‚ÄúI think the awards have already done that job.‚Äù She laughed and snorted, causing her to turn bright red.

Rio smiled reflexively upon hearing Agatha‚Äôs snort. It was something that she had always found charming about the actress in interviews and her acting. It was something that seemed genuine. ‚ÄúI love your laugh. That snort is adorable.‚Äù Fuck, Vidal, she thought as a blush spread across her cheeks.

The two women sat there in embarrassed silence without looking at each other.

Rio was the first to break the silence between them. ‚ÄúDo you spend time here often? The sunset is beautiful here. Everything is really.‚Äù

Agatha took a drink and nodded. ‚ÄúIt depends on our schedules and life. We begin and end our summer here and try to spend time here during the summer. Girls‚Äô weekends when we can, it‚Äôs a nice little getaway. We also have Wanda‚Äôs cabin in Lake Tahoe, and our apartment in New York. The New York apartment doubles for work, of course.‚Äù

‚ÄúWow, that‚Äôs taking U-Hauling to a new level.‚Äù Rio immediately slapped a hand over her mouth. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to go drown myself in the ocean.‚Äù

Agatha laughed and snorted again, before groaning. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll join you.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not completely wrong, though. It does look like that. Wanda is my family. When we found each other, it became an older-younger sibling situation. It made sense to buy property together and share it that way. We didn‚Äôt both need our own. Our houses are even on a compound of sorts. I‚Äôm sure Alice told you.‚Äù

Rio looked at Agatha, mouth slightly agape. Agatha and Wanda lived on the same piece of land, too? ‚ÄúShe most certainly did not! I just found out she knew you both this week.‚Äù

Agatha nodded. ‚ÄúRight, NDAs.‚Äù Agatha ran her hand through her elbow-length hair. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs public knowledge that we‚Äôre neighbors. What‚Äôs not as commonly known is that it‚Äôs actually a very large enclosed piece of land. Her house is on one side, mine is on the other, and the original house is in the middle. The boys now hang out in that middle house, we call it the Clubhouse. We have driveways that connect them. There are what goes for woods in LA, towards the back, and space to build more houses if we wanted to. I bought the land when I turned eighteen, back when there was still a lot of land on what was the outskirts of LA at the time. Now there‚Äôs a housing development across the street.‚Äù She laughed before continuing, ‚ÄúNat lives next to us, even though she could live on the property if she weren‚Äôt so hardheaded.

‚ÄúWith us being so close, Wanda and I are somewhat codependent, and we realize that. It‚Äôs not in a toxic way, more in the way that we‚Äôve experienced trauma, and we‚Äôre each other‚Äôs security blankets. Obviously, we can go places without each other. We‚Äôre not that bad. But knowing that your sister is right there unless she‚Äôs off filming somewhere? It‚Äôs priceless. I imagine it‚Äôs the same for you and Alice from what she has said?‚Äù Agatha was looking directly at Rio, waiting for her response.

Rio nodded. She had never expected to have such an easy conversation with this woman. ‚ÄúYes. She‚Äôs all I have, family-wise. We‚Äôve lived together before, and we used to be extremely close. Being in different cities for so long was excruciating, and with the confidentiality, we didn‚Äôt know everything about each other anymore. So being neighbors and working together again has already been amazing.‚Äù Rio enjoyed talking to Agatha. It was as if this weren‚Äôt their third actual conversation, ever.

Agatha‚Äôs smile softened. ‚ÄúI know keeping things from those you love can be extremely difficult. We share so much, especially since we are very much one big family. We share the private jets. We got to a point where we couldn‚Äôt fly commercially a long time ago. The security team, styling team, domestic teams, and a few vehicles- that‚Äôs all shared. Except favorite cars, those are personally owned, Vision is absolutely hers, my flings are mine, for a few hours at least, and the boys, well, we all have a hand in raising them.

‚ÄúMaybe one day we‚Äôll split things, maybe one day we‚Äôll split the compound, maybe we won‚Äôt. If people want to think we‚Äôre a couple or think we have a polyamorous thing going on, it‚Äôs fine. This family works for us, and I love it.‚Äù

Rio exhaled in wonder. ‚ÄúThat all sounds amazing. Raising your kids together, and being right there when you need each other?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt is pretty great.‚Äù Agatha agreed.

The Agatha image that the media portrayed was not the side of Agatha that Rio was seeing now. Yes, she could be flirty like that public persona, Rio had seen that firsthand. However, she was attentive and caring. The media made it seem as though she were all sarcasm, wit, and sexuality unless it came to parenting or her activism. However, Agatha was very focused on her inner circle, which included more than just Nicky. She had built a chosen family, was kind, offered women water when they were choking, and enjoyed watching sunsets. Agatha Harkness even had awkward moments and slipped up. Rio was looking forward to getting to know more about this woman.

As they talked after the sun went down and the moon had come up, Wanda and Alice looked on from the balcony of the beach house.

‚ÄúFriends to idiots to lovers?‚Äù Alice asked, watching as Rio laughed at something that Agatha said and put a hand on Agatha‚Äôs bare arm.

‚ÄúYep,‚Äù Wanda said, popping the p.

Jen stepped up next to Alice, careful not to brush up against her, but giving her a warm smile.

Nat sidled up next to Wanda, quickly taking her hand and squeezing it, before letting it go as if nothing had happened.

Jen and Nat‚Äôs eyes automatically caught what the other two had been looking at.

Jen sighed. Apparently, she was now an accomplice to this. ‚ÄúSlow burn?‚Äù She added.

‚ÄúUnfortunately.‚Äù Alice and Wanda said in unison.

‚ÄúAngst and drama because they‚Äôre afraid of their feelings and being hurt in the process,‚Äù Lilia added, stepping forth from the shadows. The four younger women just nodded. Completely unsurprised by her appearance.

‚Äú...and we will be here to push all the way,‚Äù Nat added, looking at Wanda expectantly.

Wanda nodded and turned to Jen, ready to begin her plan. ‚ÄúAt ten, you and Alice will leave in Alice‚Äôs Jeep, which is why I made you ride with us. I don‚Äôt care where you go.‚Äù In her head, she was screaming ‚Äòone of your places, idiots‚Äô, but she didn‚Äôt voice it. If she could successfully matchmake two couples, she‚Äôd be thrilled. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll leave Rio‚Äôs bag here. I‚Äôll text Agatha saying you both left. Knowing Agatha, she‚Äôll offer to either take Rio home or back to the compound to continue their conversation. Since Nat came in a different vehicle tonight, I‚Äôll have Nat take me home.‚Äù Wanda grinned. She loved when her plans came together.

Jen huffed a laugh and looked at Wanda fondly. ‚ÄúGot it, boss.‚Äù

Jen and Alice went back to the party, and Nat returned to do her job, fingertips lightly brushing Wanda‚Äôs arm as she departed.

Wanda‚Äôs eyes trailed after the other redhead, Lilia carefully watching both of them.

The older woman turned toward Wanda. ‚ÄúSometimes we do what we think is right, even though it is not what we want. You might be hurting someone by doing the ‚Äòright‚Äô thing. Times have changed.‚Äù She left before Wanda could respond. Wanda shook her head. She‚Äôs right and you know it, Maximoff.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The stars twinkled in the sky and the sounds of the party filtered out of the house behind them. Agatha found it odd that no one else had wandered down to the beach and she had a feeling that was the doing of one Natasha Romanov and would have to thank her for it later. She enjoyed having this time to talk, uninterrupted, with Rio. The younger woman made Agatha really laugh, something few were able to do, and was easy to talk to.

The two women had abandoned their chairs and were sitting on a beach blanket, sides pressed together so they could hear each other over the sounds of the ocean and the party.

There was a natural lull in the conversation, and Agatha‚Äôs eyes had locked on Rio‚Äôs, when they dropped to Rio‚Äôs plump pink lips.

The tip of Agatha‚Äôs tongue swept over her own lips.

Agatha wasn‚Äôt sure if it was the alcohol, the ocean, the moon, or that shooting star, but she was extremely tempted to lean forward and find out if Rio‚Äôs lips were as soft as they looked.

Rio cleared her throat, and Agatha‚Äôs eyes darted back up to meet hers.

‚ÄúAgatha?‚Äù Rio said, voice wavering.

Rio looked into Agatha‚Äôs sapphire blue eyes that reflected the stars. Agatha had been staring at her, and Rio had thought about kissing her.

No, that was not something Rio could do. Agatha was a parent, and that was a boundary Rio had drawn. It was a mixture of the alcohol, the setting, and her silly childhood crush.

‚ÄúI can be your friend.‚Äù She said. Idiot. You‚Äôre an idiot.

Agatha‚Äôs smile reached her eyes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd like that.‚Äù

Something in Rio was relieved. She was worried she would cause offense or that Agatha would laugh and tell her that she was only here to add Rio to her CVS receipt length list of women.

Rio‚Äôs smile was bright. She did her best to mimic a teenage girl, ‚ÄúOMG! Wait until I tell my friends that I‚Äôm friends with Agatha Harkness!‚Äù

Agatha smacked her on the arm, mood ruined. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a child.‚Äù

Rio nodded enthusiastically. ‚ÄúYou were almost an EGOT winner when I was born.‚Äù

Agatha rolled her eyes. Picking up her phone as it vibrated, notifying her of a text. ‚ÄúOh wow, we‚Äôve been down here awhile.‚Äù

Rio grinned. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm amazing company.‚Äù

Agatha pretended to ignore her as she suppressed a smile and read the text from Wanda.

SuperStar Wanda:

Alice and Jen left together!! In Alice‚Äôs car.

Here‚Äôs hoping they finally get their act together.

She left Rio‚Äôs bag though. MAKE A MOVE.

Rio‚Äôs phone went off next, to a text from Alice.

Sister Alice

Taking Jen home‚Ä¶not sure if to mine or hers,

Probably a movie night!

Left your bag with Wanda.

Ask Agatha to take you home. You know, to

her house.

Rio and Agatha looked back up at each other. Rio spoke first. ‚ÄúDid you know that Jen and Alice were into each other?‚Äù She asked.

Agatha just looked at her. ‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt?‚Äù

Rio sighed. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt even know Jen existed until this week, NDAs, remember?‚Äù

Agatha put a comforting hand on Rio‚Äôs knee, their sides still touching. They had decided to be friends, hadn‚Äôt kissed, yet hadn‚Äôt parted either.

This was not lost on Agatha.

Agatha flashed an Oscar-winning smile. ‚ÄúWould you like to go back to my place? As friends, of course.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

It burns but it burns pretty.

Little Does She Know Her Whole World‚Äôs About To Change

Chapter Summary

Agatha takes Rio back to her house.
As friends of course.

Chapter Notes

Trigger: implied child abuse
Also:
Sorry if I got anyone's hopes up.

No, I'm not. I warned you all, it's a slow burn.
This story unfolded quickly, and I finally came back and started editing! All thoughts and writing are mine (with inserts/suggestions from DaretoDream82).

UPDATED - 5/6/2025

Also, Agatha's full name is now Agatha Fucking Harkness, and she's basically the Idina Menzel of this universe.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Agatha met a boy with eyes like a man

Turns out her heart fits right in the palm of Rio‚Äôs hand

Now he'll be Agatha‚Äôs shelter when it rains

Little does Rio know, her whole world's about to change

When Emma Falls in Love - Taylor Swift

üé∂

‚ÄúAngel, did you change the lyrics and gender-bend them?‚Äù Agatha raised an eyebrow at Wanda.

Wanda shrugged. ‚ÄúMaybe?‚Äù

Early August

Agatha stood up from the sand in one fluid motion, without using her hands, in only a way Agatha Fucking Harkness could, and held out a hand to help Rio, which she gladly took.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt mind leaving your party early?‚Äù Rio asked, noting that it was far from dying down.

‚ÄúOh, gods no. I usually leave before midnight anyway. It‚Äôs not about me and I prefer smaller affairs anyway, I‚Äôm getting too old for these big to-dos. I only stay out late for the awards after parties because it‚Äôs almost required.‚Äù Agatha tugged Rio to her feet and picked up their empty glasses. Agatha led them up the beach to the side of the house where a car was waiting, handed the glasses to one of the security guys, and nodded. ‚ÄúPizza and movies?‚Äù Agatha asked, gesturing for Rio to get into the large black SUV first.

Rio laughed. ‚ÄúI said let‚Äôs be friends and you‚Äôre asking me to Netflix and chill? Isn‚Äôt that a little outdated Harkness?‚Äù She asked with a bemused smile. Noting that her bag was in the car, surely Wanda‚Äôs doing.

Agatha rolled her eyes as the door closed behind them. ‚ÄúTrust me, if I was you up for nefarious reasons, you would know. I‚Äôm serious. And, as you don‚Äôt sleep with parents, I don‚Äôt sleep with my son‚Äôs teachers,‚Äù she thought for a moment. ‚Äúanymore.‚Äù

Rio laughed. ‚ÄúAh, one of Hollywood‚Äôs bad boys cleaning up her act? For moi?‚Äù She replied, batting her eyelashes.

‚ÄúSure, that‚Äôs why.‚Äù In reality, no one else interested her, but she wasn‚Äôt telling Rio that. ‚ÄúWhat kind of pizza do you want? I‚Äôm ordering now so it should be there when we arrive.‚Äù She asked, changing the subject. If they were doing this whole friend thing, she needed to shelve this line of talk.

‚ÄúVeggie please, if that‚Äôs okay. Is Nicky home?‚Äù Rio asked. She hadn‚Äôt seen him much and wondered if he was doing something with his de facto cousins. She hadn‚Äôt even met Vision yet. She didn‚Äôt think she‚Äôd meet him now, but was starting to wonder if he existed.

‚ÄúVeggie it is, and all three boys are with Vision having a horror movie marathon at the Clubhouse I was telling you about. The boys could stay by themselves, but they‚Äôre getting to the age where we wouldn‚Äôt put it past them to throw their own party, and we‚Äôre not quite ready for that. So, adult supervision it is. Billy wouldn‚Äôt, but the other two absolutely would.‚Äù She smiled.

Rio looked out the window, watching the ocean pass them as they headed back towards the city. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs it like? Knowing everyone knows so much about you?‚Äù She asked without thinking, automatically realizing how invasive the question was. ‚ÄúOh no! Don‚Äôt answer that.‚Äù

Agatha regarded her for a second, thinking about her response.

‚ÄúNo, it‚Äôs okay, no one outside of an interview has ever asked me that before, and interviewers never want the real answer, a completely honest answer. It seems like the entire world knows everything about me, but it‚Äôs only what I want them to know.

‚ÄúWhen my mother outed me in 1989, stripping my life bare for all to see and in turn exposing herself for who she really was, I was taught to curate a certain image.

‚ÄúYes, the public sees the dedicated mom, activist, trailblazer, ‚Äòbad boy‚Äô persona‚Äîbecause that‚Äôs what I want them to see. Just like I only show the parts of my personal life that I want to show.‚Äù Agatha chose her words carefully. She felt like she could tell Rio a lot, but she didn‚Äôt want to give just anything away. Agatha had layers and she never just stripped herself raw. She had done that once before and refused to do it again.

‚ÄúInformation leaks, it always does. That‚Äôs why I have Jen and Nat. It‚Äôs why I send Nicky to a school with ironclad NDAs run by a woman I have known forever and trust. As a testament to how well it all works, Alice is a close friend of mine and has been a decade, and you had no idea.‚Äù Agatha watched Rio process and mull over everything she had just said before plowing on.

‚ÄúIf you know what you‚Äôre doing, know the right people, and play your cards right, then Hollywood can be both very public and extremely private at the same time. We have learned to control the narrative, and while our lives are on display, it‚Äôs the show we want people to see, and we take comfort in that.

‚ÄúPeople will believe what they want to believe, but we can steer them in the direction of what we want them to believe. Few people know what really goes on behind these walls and that‚Äôs why I bought this land and enclosed it. So my family, chosen and otherwise, had an escape. A place we could be our authentic selves.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôll start to learn that there are things about me you don‚Äôt know and you can decide for yourself if that‚Äôs a good or a bad thing.‚Äù Agatha kept her eyes locked on Rio. This was not a speech she often gave to people, it was not something she really ever told anyone. The last time she had broken down how curated her life was, was to Alice. That had been out of necessity, and she felt like this was too.

Agatha knew that Rio was important to Alice, and Alice was important to Agatha, whether Alice believed it or not. Alice was Lorna‚Äôs daughter, and Agatha had made a promise to Lorna.



Rio took everything in and processed it. She wasn‚Äôt completely surprised that there was a hidden side to Agatha and that she carefully revealed what people knew about her. Rio had read about what had happened to her when she was outed and could see why Agatha had been advised to live the way she did.

Rio remembered Alice‚Äôs mother, Lorna, being an open book to the public, but keeping Alice hidden from view and out of the public eye. Rio knew double lives were possible, though Lorna didn‚Äôt really have a double life in as much as she had a mother who was willing to raise the daughter she rarely saw.

Rio realized that the more she learned about Agatha Harkness, the more of a mystery she became.



The large vehicle drove through the automatic gate and to the left, snaking around a driveway and coming to a stop in front of a large house that Rio assumed belonged to Agatha.

Agatha stepped out first, offering her hand to Rio, who stepped out, slung her bag over her shoulder, and stopped abruptly when she saw the house before her.

For the second time that night, Rio was amazed by the beauty and architecture of a house.

The house was composed of glass and stone. A mix of modern and a hidden witch‚Äôs cottage. Rio chuckled. ‚ÄúNever beating those witch allegations Harkness.‚Äù

They walked through the covered porch and in the double doors, the smell of pizza in the air.

Agatha shrugged. ‚ÄúMaybe I don‚Äôt want to. I like my vampire glass witch cottage thank you,‚Äù Agatha glanced over her shoulder to see if Rio caught the reference.

The younger woman laughed. ‚ÄúSurrounded by the trees, it does look like that. When did you have it built?‚Äù Rio followed Agatha through the foyer and into the living room. Three plush black couches surrounded a large dark wooden coffee table. A large TV was mounted on a wall surrounded by built-in shelves with pictures, books, and various decor items. The back wall was completely glass with a door that led out to a pool, which was lit and had various lights hanging in the patio area. The kitchen was open concept like the beach house, and was Rio‚Äôs dream kitchen. There was a bar directly behind the center couch. Someone could cook, fetch something, whatever was needed, and still be a part of whatever was happening in the main room. There were stairs back in the foyer, and she thought they had passed a bathroom. She was just realizing she was still in her bikini and shorts.

Agatha had gone to the kitchen and was getting something out of the fridge. Also still in her bikini and monogrammed cover-up. ‚ÄúLet me think, I bought the land in ‚Äò91, and Wanda and I built the clubhouse in ‚Äò97. She built her house in 2005 when she and Vision got married, and I started building mine around the time I decided to have Nicky and it was completed in ‚Äò08.‚Äù She walked into the living room carrying the pizza box, a bottle of wine, and two glasses.

‚ÄúImpressive. That‚Äôs quite a history lesson. Before we eat, where‚Äôs the bathroom? I should change out of this swimsuit.‚Äù She asked.

Agatha looked down at herself and laughed.

‚ÄúI completely forgot. When you‚Äôre so used to wearing whatever people tell you to, you just go with it.‚Äù In reality, Agatha had been admiring Rio‚Äôs current attire. Friends could appreciate the scenery. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs back down the hall, on the left. I should probably change too.‚Äù Agatha set everything down and followed Rio, before disappearing up the stairs.

It wasn‚Äôt long before they were seated on the couch, Rio in forest green shorts and a Stanford Basketball tank top, Agatha in black yoga pants, and a purple SHIELD football mom shirt.

Agatha had turned the music on for background noise, a nineties playlist Wanda had made. Agatha knew it had to be safe if Wanda had made it.

‚ÄúAren‚Äôt you cute in your mom shirt?‚Äù Rio smirked, finishing her second slice of pizza in about as many minutes.

‚ÄúHas anyone told you that you eat like a teenage boy?‚Äù Agatha responded, still eating her first slice.

‚ÄúOnly everyone I‚Äôve ever met.‚Äù Rio sipped her wine. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a habit left over from how I grew up.‚Äù

Agatha raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúSounds like there‚Äôs a story there. How did you meet Alice? You know a lot about my background, what‚Äôs the Rio Vidal story?‚Äù Agatha asked, taking another slice of pizza. Agatha knew some of Rio‚Äôs story, but wanted to hear it from the source.

They sat on the center couch, the same way she and Wanda often did. Her tucked in one corner, Rio tucked in the other, facing each other. It felt natural, even if they were new friends.



‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Rio started, biting her lip, thinking about how much she wanted to divulge, and then sighing. Might as well go all in, no telling what Alice had already shared. ‚ÄúMy parents moved to San Francisco when I was 12. We moved around a lot and didn‚Äôt live in the best places. They weren‚Äôt the best people. It was my biological mom, she was great until my first stepdad left when I was about five. That‚Äôs when she started dating the wrong people. I never knew my dad. Anyway, she and my then stepdad, number six I think?‚Äù She scoffed. ‚ÄúI started at a new middle school, an extremely awkward age to start over with no friends and very little anything. I met Alice on the first day I was there. She was standing off to the side judging people like you do at that age, and I awkwardly stood next to her and made a comment about the group she was watching. Our preteen surliness was a match made in melodramatic heaven.

‚ÄúWe had several advanced classes together and we would work together on our projects. After a few weeks, I missed the bus home one afternoon. When I told her the neighborhood I lived in, she insisted that she walk me home. When we reached the door, we heard gunshots in my apartment. She dragged me back to her Gran‚Äôs house and refused to let me go back to my apartment. She and Gran insisted I stay the night, especially since my mom didn‚Äôt pick up the phone when I called.

‚ÄúWhen I finally got through to my mom, they were both fine. They had made someone upset and what we had heard were warning shots.‚Äù Rio smiled slightly at the memory and looked up at Agatha. ‚ÄúYou were friends with Lorna, right? So you knew her mom, Norma?‚Äù

Agatha nodded and Rio continued, ‚ÄúWell, imagine how pissed Norma Wu was when she found out about my home life. From then on, I spent most of my time there, and by the time I was fourteen, I had my own room and lived there ninety-five percent of the time. It got to where she was the one school called, she was my emergency contact. Gran finished raising me. I was shocked when I saw a picture one day and realized that Lorna Wu was Alice‚Äôs mom.

‚ÄúAnytime I did go home, it wasn‚Äôt a good time. My parents basically forgot I existed unless they needed my help with something illegal, and as much as Gran tried to fight them, they had legal rights. When I went back to Gran‚Äôs, it was with marks, bruises, burns, and so much trauma.

‚ÄúThey really didn‚Äôt care where I was, as long as I was there whenever they needed me for whatever illegal activity or scheme required a pretty young girl. They finally died at the beginning of my senior year of high school. I had recently returned from a short stint with them, things had gone terribly south, there was a lot of yelling when I was finally able to sneak out and run back home.

‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt there long when the police showed up and told me they had died. I stayed with Gran and Alice, and as terrible as it sounds, a weight was lifted. Gran seemed a lot less worried after that too.

‚ÄúWe both went to Stanford, something we worked so hard for. While teaching is not the most glorious thing we could do with our lives, it was something that allowed us to give back. Alice wanted to do something, not simple, but normal. Civilian, as she called it, and I think Lorna put it into her head when she was young. I‚Äôve just always loved learning and sharing knowledge. So that‚Äôs what we did. We also wanted to make Gran proud of us, and we did.‚Äù Rio looked back at Agatha, whose eyes were red and watery. ‚ÄúAgatha, please don‚Äôt cry, we all have our past.‚Äù



Agatha knew how much the past affected Alice,¬† and how much Rio meant to her. Agatha also knew details that Rio would never be privy to.

She wanted to wrap her arms around Rio and hold her, to try and take the pain away. She wanted to cradle this woman‚Äôs head to her chest and hold her there.

Instead, she put a hand on Rio‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúI am so sorry you had such a rough start and had to go through all that.‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs eyes took in the lines and light wrinkles in Rio‚Äôs face. Memorizing every detail. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe parents would do things like that to their children. I mean, my mother did, but she was a very special case. I am so glad Norma was there for you.‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs breath caught at the way Agatha‚Äôs eyes were taking her in. ‚ÄúAgatha, it‚Äôs fine, I‚Äôve done a lot of therapy since then.‚Äù Rio looked away and tucked her hair behind her ear. ‚ÄúThank you though. Norma Wu was an amazing woman and I loved her like she was my Mom.‚Äù

Agatha dropped her hand from Rio‚Äôs shoulder, letting her fingertips trail down Rio‚Äôs arm, and moved back slightly. ‚ÄúThat makes sense as to why you were there those times I came to see Lorna, and at the funeral.‚Äù Agatha also remembered seeing an ‚ÄòR‚Äô on the door of the room next to Alice‚Äôs door with the ‚ÄòA‚Äô on it.

Rio nearly choked, something Agatha was becoming good at making her do. ‚ÄúYou remember that.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou looked like you were going to kill me. Yes, I remember. If anyone asks, I do not remember, as I very pointedly told everyone I did not, did you ever tell Alice what happened?‚Äù Agatha asked.

‚ÄúWhich time?‚Äù

‚ÄúEither one.‚Äù

Rio laughed. ‚ÄúThat I caught you sneaking out of her mother‚Äôs room? No. I did tell her I thought the two of you were a thing and she assured me you weren‚Äôt. I believe her now.‚Äù

Agatha nodded. ‚ÄúWe very much were not. I was just there to get her to come back and finish shooting, then I got her into rehab.‚Äù It was the lie that Agatha always told.

‚ÄúShe never did outrun her demons. Alice doesn‚Äôt blame you though, and neither do I.‚Äù Rio added.

Agatha‚Äôs heart clenched. Rio still didn‚Äôt know, and it wasn‚Äôt Agatha‚Äôs place to tell her.

‚ÄúOh, I know,‚Äù Agatha assured her. ‚ÄúCome with me, I want to show you something.‚Äù She said, standing and picking up the now-empty pizza box and the empty bottle of wine.

Rio rose up to follow her as Agatha led through the kitchen first, disposing of the empty containers, and then back to the front of the house into what Rio assumed was an office.

‚ÄúThis is my Harkness brag room,‚Äù Agatha turned on the light.

‚ÄúHow humble of you,‚Äù Rio smirked, noting that she was wrong about the office. Her breath caught as she took in the cases full of different awards, the memorabilia from different shows and movies Agatha had been in, pictures of her with other celebrities, trophies, and medals Nicky had won, various pictures of him, her, Wanda, and Nat. There were so many memories captured around the giant room.

It wasn‚Äôt about bragging per se, it was about preserving precious memories, like a living time capsule. Rio walked around various set pieces, even costumes encased in glass. ‚ÄúThis is amazing. I can‚Äôt believe they let you keep some of this stuff.‚Äù She came to one piece in particular and squealed. ‚ÄúTHE COAT! From Witches Road! I thought it was destroyed!‚Äù

Agatha laughed.

‚ÄúNo, that was a backup. This one is the original, with all of the details and everything. I even have Lorna‚Äôs jacket from the movie.‚Äù She nodded to another case.

‚ÄúYou two were close.‚Äù The younger woman stated, looking at a picture from that night at The Oscars.



‚ÄúShe was one of my mentors.‚Äù Agatha lowered her voice, measuring her words carefully. ‚ÄúOf course, we were. I was in the ambulance that night, I held her hand as she‚Ä¶I promised I would watch over Alice.‚Äù She looked away as a tear fell.

This time, it was Rio‚Äôs turn to be the comforter.

Rio wrapped her arms around Agatha.

‚ÄúNo, you didn‚Äôt. Lorna knew what she was doing. That movie consumed her, it happens to some of the best actors and you did everything you could.‚Äù Rio stepped back as Agatha gave her a watery smile.

‚ÄúWhy are you so easy to bare my soul too?‚Äù Agatha asked, wiping a tear away with her thumb.

‚ÄúBecause I‚Äôm secretly a soul-stealing witch,‚Äù Rio replied with a tooth-baring smile.

Agatha huffed a laugh and pointed out a few more set pieces and several pictures.

Rio took in the many pictures from various decades. She noted that Lorna was in many of them, and of course, Agatha and Wanda were constantly paired together. The room was a large, living, breathing time capsule, and Rio was fascinated.

Pictures from the opening nights of Rent and Wicked, the premier of Frozen and Frozen II, Agatha having played Elsa.

‚ÄúCan you tell me anything about Frozen III?‚Äù Rio quirked a brow.

Agatha ran tongue along the inside of her bottom lip. ‚ÄúI cannot.‚Äù

Rio huffed. ‚ÄúFine, want to play a game to Frozen?‚Äù

The morning sun was warm on Rio‚Äôs face as she rubbed her eyes. She blinked multiple times, trying to get her bearings. Rio had suggested a drinking game to Frozen, as you do at thirty-five and fifty-one.

Rio had learned that Agatha Harkness did not back down from a challenge.

The game was simple. Drink every time there was queer subtext.

They had to switch to water rather quickly and then continued talking through Frozen II.

Watching Agatha Harkness movies with Agatha Harkness was enlightening, especially when Wanda was in them. Wanda played Anna in the movie, given their connection, and Agatha told multiple stories about the recording and artistry.

Rio looked around her as she gathered her thoughts. She was lying on the couch opposite the glass wall. Agatha was still asleep on the center couch, face buried in her arms. Rio grabbed her phone, noticing that it was seven and past her cat‚Äôs scheduled breakfast time. Rio was many things and a crazy cat lady was one of them. Not wanting to wake Agatha and having received zero texts from Alice, she thought about who else she could text for a ride home. Rio didn‚Äôt know many people here yet. She had however gotten the impression that she was being welcomed into this group of women, and of that group, Nat was the most likely to be awake. Considering meddling had happened to get Agatha‚Äôs number into her phone, she probably had everyone‚Äôs number. Rio opened a new message and typed in a few letters when the contact appeared. Thank you, meddling bitches.

Me:

Hey, it‚Äôs Rio, are you awake?

Natasha R.:

I just got back from a run. Need a

ride home from Agatha‚Äôs?

Me:

Yes. Wait, how do you know?

Natasha R.:

It‚Äôs my job. Be right there.

Don‚Äôt worry about waking

Aggie, she sleeps like the dead.

Give me 10.

Me:

Right. Thanks

Rio let out a sigh and found her bag. She went to the bathroom, to freshen up and slip her shoes on. Nat had disarmed the alarm remotely and Rio stepped out of the house right as the petite bodyguard pulled up in a red SUV. The younger woman put her bag in the backseat and climbed in the front. Nat handed her Tylenol and pointed to the coffee.

‚ÄúThought you would need these.‚Äù She smiled.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù Rio grumbled as she took the Tylenol and chased it with the coffee. ‚ÄúAny word from Alice and Jen?‚Äù

Nat shook her head. ‚ÄúNo, we‚Äôve been waiting for them to pull that trigger for years now. At least they actually stayed the night though.‚Äù

Rio just chuckled. ‚ÄúCreeper.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt is my job to know where everyone is,‚Äù she replied.

‚ÄúWhich is why I didn‚Äôt bother giving you my address.‚Äù She looked over at the redhead.

‚ÄúYou live in the same building as Alice, so I don‚Äôt need it anyway, but you‚Äôre right. I assume you talked, drank, and that‚Äôs it?‚Äù Nat asked, keeping her eyes on the road, although there was no traffic to speak of early on a Sunday morning.

‚ÄúExactly. You can report that back to the Meddling Bitches group chat.‚Äù Rio took another sip of her coffee.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a good name for it, actually. You know Agatha will report everything to Wanda anyway.‚Äù.

‚ÄúOh, I know she will.‚Äù Rio had gathered that Agatha told Wanda everything. ‚ÄúHow did you join up with Wanda and Agatha? I know the ‚Äòmet at a club in New York‚Äô story, but I have a feeling there‚Äôs more to it. I know you‚Äôve been with them almost as long as they‚Äôve known each other.‚Äù

Nat raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúFast learner. Well, you know I‚Äôm from Russia, that‚Äôs not hard to gather, the Romanov is a dead giveaway, and I still have the slightest accent on certain words. Would you believe me if I told you I was a very young assassin?‚Äù Nat looked at Rio from the corner of her eye to gauge Rio‚Äôs response.

The response was laughter as Rio looked at her. ‚ÄúOh please, I mean, I had heard the rumors, but‚Ä¶‚Äù She noticed that Nat was not laughing. ‚ÄúWait, it‚Äôs true? You actually were sent by Agatha‚Äôs mom to kill her before she died in prison?‚Äù

‚ÄúSure was.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut how?‚Äù She was flabbergasted at this point. What the hell kind of people had she become friends with?

‚ÄúTurns out Agatha Harkness and Wanda Maximoff are not the type of people you want to meet in a dark alley. Assassin or not. It‚Äôs a longer story, but basically, Agatha punched me in the face, Wanda stepped on my throat, which was surprisingly pleasant...but anyway, Agatha made me an offer to be on her security team, some legal stuff happened, and the rest is history.‚Äù She shrugged as they pulled up to Rio‚Äôs building.

Rio sat back, ‚ÄúSo Agatha just collects people like Infinity Stones?‚Äù She asked.

The other woman nodded. ‚ÄúWomen that need a family, yes.‚Äù Don‚Äôt forget to text Agatha so she doesn‚Äôt wake up and freak out that you‚Äôre gone.‚Äù

Rio walked into her apartment to one very angry cat.

‚ÄúOkay, okay, I‚Äôm sorry. Let me put my bag down.‚Äù It took her longer than usual to feed Raven due to the self-appointed queen getting under her feet, jumping on the counter, and yelling at her in her way. ‚ÄúYou better hope I never start dating anyone and sleep over at their house you freeloader.‚Äù She said as she put her bowl down. She pulled out her phone and texted Agatha.

Me

Sorry for leaving without a word

this morning. Had to get home to

feed the cat. Nat gave me a ride.

She was hired to kill you?

Rio assumed she‚Äôd hear from her later and knew Alice would just come over. She had a lot to process but needed to shower first.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha had woken up, read Rio‚Äôs text, and taken a shower. It was too early to formulate words. What ungodly hour had that woman gotten up at? The time stamp said eight, who did those things on a weekend? In Agatha‚Äôs mind, that constituted as a red flag.

Agatha leaned against the counter, coffee mug raised to her lips, as she ran through what to text back.

‚ÄúSorry for crying on you? No. Desperate.‚Äù Agatha sipped on her coffee but didn‚Äôt put it down as she stared at the phone, thumb hovering over the letters of the touchscreen.

‚ÄúGlad we got drunk together? Yeah, absolutely not, Harkness, this is not the early aughts.‚Äù She took a long drink of her coffee and sat the mug on the counter, holding the phone with two hands now.

Agatha was in her fifties, she knew how to communicate with women.

It was literally part of what gave her her reputation.

Me:

I find friends in odd situations.

What kind‚Äôve cat? Definitely important

to get home and feed her. Glad

we got to hang out!

Okay, that wasn‚Äôt too bad, maybe a little overly enthusiastic. Agatha found that she wasn‚Äôt completely in control of herself around Rio. A fluke, really.

Rio üíö

She‚Äôs a menace is what she is.

She‚Äôs a tortoiseshell, quite possibly

immortal, definitely a familiar. You‚Äôll

Have to meet her.

Rio üíö

Thanks, I enjoyed it. Can‚Äôt wait to do it again.

Agatha had noticed the green heart those wenches she called friends had put next to Rio's name and decided to leave it. At least she hadn‚Äôt scared Rio off, yet. So far, the friends thing was going well and she knew it was just a matter of time before Wanda ran in to demand to hear everything unless she had already talked to Natasha. Wanda would still want to hear everything directly from Agatha.

As if summoned by her thoughts, Wanda ran through the door.

Agatha hadn‚Äôt bothered resetting the alarm, which would have been useless, as Wanda could deactivate it from her phone.

‚ÄúGet in here and tell me everything,‚Äù Wanda demanded, launching herself on the couch as though she weren‚Äôt forty-five, and assuming her normal position.

Agatha groaned and moved to join her.

‚Äú...and that‚Äôs all. Nothing happened. Friendly touches, tears, pizza, a drinking game, and we passed out.‚Äù She summarized after droning on for the past hour.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it? You acted like you were twenty-two, were moderately drunk, and you didn‚Äôt even make out? You make out with everyone when you‚Äôre drunk, we‚Äôve done it a time or two.‚Äù Wanda admonished.

‚ÄúNot everyone, only women, and we haven‚Äôt done that in a while, I remember being threatened. I also don‚Äôt drink to get drunk and have things under control.‚Äù She pointed out. ‚ÄúBesides, Rio and I are friends. ONLY FRIENDS.‚Äù Agatha gave Wanda a pointed look.

‚ÄúWhatever.‚Äù Wanda pouted. ‚ÄúI happen to think with the similar backgrounds, similar interests, etc., it would go well.‚Äù

Agatha shook her head, holding her hands out in front of her. ‚ÄúWhatever you say, but it‚Äôs not happening.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

After leaving Jen‚Äôs house, Alice went straight to Rio‚Äôs apartment instead of her own. Alice walked in, using her key, and handed Rio a container of vegetable fried rice. ‚ÄúIt tastes almost like Gran‚Äôs.‚Äù She sat the rest of the containers on the coffee table and sat on the couch.

‚ÄúThe fried rice I make tastes just like Gran‚Äôs, because she taught me how to make it.‚Äù Rio looked at Alice suspiciously. Chinese take-out meant one thing.

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have time. I‚Äôm panicking in a lesbian way.‚Äù Alice whined.

‚ÄúThere it is, water? Soda? Tea?‚Äù Rio listed off beverages and headed toward the kitchen.

‚ÄúWater, I need to hydrate.‚Äù

‚ÄúI bet you do!‚Äù Rio chuckled.

Alice pouted, ‚ÄúUnfortunately, not like that.‚Äù

Rio came back and handed Alice her water before settling into the couch with her fried rice, Alice already cradling wonton soup close to her chest. ‚ÄúWe went back to Jen‚Äôs place and had a movie night.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat movies?‚Äù

‚ÄúBound and I Can‚Äôt Think Straight. Movies we have both seen. Multiple times. With each other.‚Äù Alice lamented.

‚ÄúShit, Alice, what happened?‚Äù

‚ÄúStraight up gay panic of the middle age variety. We cuddled, Ri. We fell asleep like that, and then I snuck out and didn‚Äôt even say goodbye. We have been decently close friends since I moved out here. Ten years, Rio. Ten.‚Äù Alice took a bite of a dumpling, shaking her head at her own idiocy.

‚ÄúSo let me get this sapphic, the two of you have been circling each other for years now, dropping hints like carabiners at Lilith Fair, and still nothing?‚Äù Rio asked, disbelief written all over her face.

‚ÄúOur inaction is physically painful at this point,‚Äù Alice winced.

‚ÄúWhat the hell are you waiting for? Her to invite you to a Melissa Etheridge concert?‚Äù Rio had finished eating and was gesturing with hands.

‚ÄúMuna or Xana might be more her speed, but no. It‚Äôs just, that she‚Äôs so serious and aggressive with everything and I‚Äôm way more laid back. Plus she‚Äôs always busy.‚Äù Alice explained.

Rio sighed heavily. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a teacher, there are months where no one even sees us. Her clients are your family, and she spends time with them too, right? You would balance each other out well.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf this were a book or a movie, I would yell at the characters right now.‚Äù Alice groaned. ‚ÄúEnough about me. You and Agatha, stepping into friendship, that‚Äôs awesome.‚Äù She gave her a double thumbs up and a sarcastic wink.

‚ÄúOh go to hell, Wu,‚Äù Rio replied. Rio had filled Alice in on everything that had happened the previous night and Rio was very glad she had made the decision to join SHIELD and that Alice could talk to her more freely now. There was so much Rio hadn‚Äôt known about Alice the past ten years.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the last week before school starts. Open House and Meet-the-Teacher is on Tuesday, and we have planning and all of the things that come with it for the rest of the week. Anything next weekend?‚Äù Rio asked.

Alice shook her head. ‚ÄúNothing that I can think of. Sports haven‚Äôt started yet, and I can‚Äôt think of any parties or anything.‚Äù

‚ÄúGreat.‚Äù Rio wanted time to prepare to be in this new world of celebrity parents, celebrity children, dealing with public relations reps, possible paparazzi, and the other things that might pop up. It was going to be a wild ride and she needed to be prepared.



Tuesday arrived and Rio was dressed in the required jeans and SHIELD t-shirt for the night. The faculty were lined up on stage behind Lilia Calderu as she addressed the parents, guardians, and adults responsible for the various students of SHIELD before setting everyone free for the event. Calderu would dismiss the teachers to their classrooms first. She would then address the families separately before allowing them to roam the campus grounds.

‚ÄúAs a reminder, everyone has signed a set of iron-clad NDAs that covers everything that could possibly come up. These NDAs apply for students, all reps, agents, etc. We take privacy very seriously here at SHIELD and it‚Äôs one of the reasons we are the elite educational institution for the best and brightest in Hollywood and the upper class. While our teachers get to their classrooms‚Ä¶‚Äù That was their cue and the faculty turned and exited the stage.

Rio had spotted Agatha and Wanda as they entered earlier, and a few other now familiar faces. She waved to Alice as they split to go to their separate rooms. Rio left her door open, double checked that the slideshow was scrolling automatically and that the handouts were neatly organized. She took a deep breath and took her position at the front of the room to meet parents and students, just like she had every year at her previous school. With six different periods, she would be meeting a lot of students and parents over the next hour and a half.

The secretary‚Äôs voice came over the loudspeaker to announce that parents and students were being released to make their way around their respective buildings.

‚ÄúHere we go‚Äù Rio whispered to herself as the first few parents started to filter in.

She shook hands, handed out information, made small talk, told students what they would need, and smiled.

Her smile widened when Wanda, Agatha, boys, and a man she assumed was Vision walked in.

‚ÄúRio Vidal, this is my husband, Dr. Vision Maximoff. He‚Äôs a professor at UCLA.‚Äù Wanda smiled brightly, though it did not reach her eyes.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so nice to meet you Dr. Maximoff, I‚Äôve heard a lot about you.‚Äù Rio lied. Wanda‚Äôs smile melted into one of sincere appreciation that Vision didn‚Äôt see.

‚ÄúPlease, call me Vision. I‚Äôve heard a lot about you from all the ladies in my life, and have a feeling you‚Äôll soon be a fixture at the compound,‚Äù Vision replied with a grin.

The boys just groaned and Rio gave a polite chuckle. It seemed as though Wanda made sure to keep the little coven around at all times.

‚ÄúNicky and Tommy, it‚Äôs nice to see you both again. You must be Billy.‚Äù Rio shook each of their hands.

‚ÄúYes, hi Ms. Vidal.‚Äù He replied shyly. He was the kid who took after Vision. They spoke for a second before Vision and the boys moved to the next class. Wanda put her arm on Rio‚Äôs bicep and spoke softly.

‚ÄúHey, we‚Äôre meeting up with Jen, Nat, and Alice after this for a late dinner, you‚Äôre coming.‚Äù

It wasn‚Äôt a request.

Rio glanced at Agatha who was talking to Pepper Potts-Stark, who had a hand on Agatha‚Äôs arm. What was that story? Rio wondered.

‚ÄúI rode with Alice and it sounds like I don‚Äôt have a choice.‚Äù She blew air out of her nose in amusement.

Wanda‚Äôs smile widened. ‚ÄúGlad we‚Äôre on the same page, see you later!‚Äù She turned and grabbed Agatha‚Äôs arm as she said goodbye to Pepper, and they moved to the next classroom.

Rio looked at the clock, noticing there was still another half hour to go.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The rest of the night was uneventful as Rio collected her belongings and walked out the door, hearing it click shut behind her as Alice walked toward her from down the hall.

‚ÄúHey, Wanda told me about dinner,‚Äù Rio said as her friend came up beside her.

‚ÄòOh, yeah, it‚Äôs tradition. I was going to tell you when we were done.‚Äù Alice chewed nervously on her pinky nail. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have to go if you don‚Äôt want to though. It‚Äôs late and we have work. Plus Raven needs to be fed,‚Äù Alice blurted out quickly.

Rio turned her head and looked at Alice suspiciously as they walked out of the building.

‚ÄúYou let me take your car before anyone arrived so I could go feed her highness early, and it‚Äôs only 8:00. We‚Äôll get home later than normal, but we have a late report time in the morning. Since when do you not‚Ä¶‚Äù Rio stopped as realization hit.

‚ÄúOhhhh! You haven‚Äôt talked to one Ms. Kale since you ghosted her Sunday morning! How many texts has she sent you? Calls? Voicemails? No. She‚Äôs not that type.‚Äù

Alice was at the car, glaring back at Rio.

Rio jogged the rest of the way and got in the vehicle. ‚ÄúOh, Wanda is going to make the two of you sit next to each other!‚Äù She cackled as they got in the car.

‚ÄúWell, we know where you‚Äôre sitting!‚Äù Alice shot back.

‚ÄúOh, I would sit in Agatha‚Äôs lap if it meant having a front-row seat to whatever this is about to be.‚Äù She replied, laughing harder.

When they arrived, just as expected, the only two seats that were left were one next to Jen and one next to Agatha, with Wanda directing each of them as to where to sit. It was an old-style diner, a burgers, and milkshakes type of place. Everyone placed their orders before delving into the conversation.

It was a round table so that everyone could see and speak to each other. Rio and Alice sat next to each other and could have switched places, but Wanda‚Äôs look said that they would not be doing that.

Wanda sat on the other side of Agatha, with Nat next to her.

Alice immediately dug her nails into Rio‚Äôs thigh and turned to talk to her.

Jen ignored Alice and spoke with Nat.

‚ÄúAlice,‚Äù Rio whispered. ‚ÄúShe is not happy with the way you left things. Talk to her, now.‚Äù

Jen looked across the table at Agatha, ‚ÄúI know you have a lot of press to run, a few projects in post, but I have a few ‚Äî ‚Äú

Agatha put up a hand to stop her. ‚ÄúNo shop talk right now, and I‚Äôm with Rio.‚Äù She pointed at Alice. ‚ÄúTalk.‚Äù

Alice had turned to Nat and Wanda who had done the same thing and told her to talk to Jen.

The two women turned to each other with four sets of eyes on them. When Jen turned to look at everyone else, the other four started talking to each other. Jen turned back to Alice.

Alice took a deep breath, she had no idea what she was going to do or say. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really sorry for how I left Sunday morning. I don‚Äôt know what got into me.‚Äù

I‚Äôm tired of running and I wanted to kiss you because I want more and I‚Äôm tired of pretending I‚Äôm okay with just being friends. She left that unspoken, not for here.

Jen almost always knew what she wanted out of her life. It‚Äôs not that she didn‚Äôt know what she wanted, it‚Äôs that she knew Alice was one of her closest friends. She cherished the times they had together. She was already worried she would lose Alice now that Rio was in town, she couldn‚Äôt risk dating her and them breaking up.

The fact remained that Jen wanted nothing more than to actually be with Alice.

She took a sip of her drink, her throat suddenly dry.

‚ÄúI understand. And, about that, it was nice, but you know I‚Äôm not looking for anything serious right now.‚Äù Jen‚Äôs heart ached as she spoke the words, her eyes searching Alice‚Äôs to see how she took it. Maybe, just maybe, Alice would read Jen‚Äôs mind. You, I want you.

Alice looked down, not wanting Jen to see into her shattered soul. ‚ÄúOh, right, I know, and you know I‚Äôm not either. How often have we had those talks with each other, right?‚Äù Alice tried to give a small laugh, but it fell flat. This bitch. ‚ÄúJust friends and occasional movie cuddle buddies?‚Äù

Something had flashed across Alice‚Äôs face, but it happened so quickly that Jennifer couldn‚Äôt quite tell what it was as she was clouded by her own hurt. ‚ÄúOf course, always.‚Äù She smiled and turned back to the group. ‚ÄúYes, can we help you bunch of Nosey Nellie‚Äôs?‚Äù Jen asked.

Rio put a comforting hand on Alice‚Äôs leg.

‚ÄúOh, just a natural lull in conversation is all,‚Äù Agatha mused.

‚ÄúFor the duration of ours?‚Äù Jen asked dryly.

‚ÄúCoincidence.‚Äù Agatha looked across at Nat and asked a random question, getting everyone to start talking again.



Wanda wanted to scream. Why would these idiots not let her push them together? Jen and Alice were the perfect balance for each other, and they may not see it, but Wanda knew there was love there.

Agatha and Rio were basically soulmates.

Idiots.

Wanda Maximoff was surrounded by relationship-impaired idiots, why wouldn‚Äôt they listen to her when she obviously had all the answers?



Nat bit back a laugh. She could tell Wanda was about to implode and it was adorable. She shook her head slightly, trying to shake the thought out of her head. Nat knew Wanda wanted everyone else to be happy in love, to live their happy ending, when Wanda herself was very much not.

Nat quickly squeezed Wanda‚Äôs thigh and watched the other redhead visibly relax.

Rio looked at Alice and Jen. Maybe they should focus on themselves instead of meddling with others. She glanced at Agatha. She couldn‚Äôt believe she was friends with this group of women, let alone Agatha.



Agatha looked at each woman one by one. Maybe if they would stop meddling and focus on themselves, they would figure out what they wanted.

Their food came and they chatted over current events and other celebrities while they ate. She and Rio had a private conversation about a television series that only they watched, agreeing that the background sapphic romance needed to take more screen time. Season three was set to premiere the following spring and they made plans to watch it together.

Agatha was planning to watch a show with someone months in advance. Like a friend . She told herself.

Wanda kept looking at her throughout their meal, the two stars had a way of speaking by just looking at each other.

Wanda darted her eyes at Rio. Take the leap, ask her out.

Agatha rolled her eyes. Take your own advice.

Wanda glared. It‚Äôs complicated and you know that.

Agatha sighed. We‚Äôre a mess, angel.

Wanda shrugged and nodded. At least we‚Äôll always have each other Aggie.

Agatha nodded and winked. I love you.

Wanda smiled and looked down. I love you too.

Once in the car, Rio smacked Alice‚Äôs arm.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre an idiot! Gran would smack you so hard your ancestors would have felt it!‚Äù Rio exclaimed.

‚ÄúOw! Good thing I hadn‚Äôt started driving yet!‚Äù Alice exclaimed as she started to drive.

‚ÄúYou like that beautiful woman and you two decided to just be friends. What is this? High school!? If it doesn‚Äôt work out, then it doesn‚Äôt work out and you act like adults. When we get home, you will be calling her and asking her out on a date. Do I need to be there to witness it? Because I will. Ten years, you useless lesbians.‚Äù She sighed and sunk back into her seat after her rant.

Alice stared out of the windshield, a sly smile on her face.

Alice was overjoyed to have her sister back in her life.

Jen was grateful to be in her car.¬† She made a quick escape, waving goodbye to her friends with a tight-lipped smile and practically running to the car before Wanda could get on to her.

Once in the car and on the road, she turned on the music and did something that Jennifer Kale did not do.

She cried.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio showered, and settled in bed with her bedtime playlist on. Raven curled up next to her when her phone dinged.

Agatha üíú

Well, at least Wanda is currently

focused on Alice and Jen. She‚Äôs

so mad.

Me

I noticed. I‚Äôm upset with Alice though.

She truly likes Jen. Maybe more?

Me:

doesn‚Äôt run when shit gets hard.

Me:

Knew it. Everyone is queer

in this town, I swear.

Agatha üíú

the queer part, not everyone, but

most.

to lesbian heaven.

to join us?

Me:

Agatha üíú

Tomorrow. Go to sleep. Goodnight, Rio.

Me:

Goodnight, Agatha.

Rio put her phone aside and smiled. She would tell Alice all about it in the morning. A weekend at Agatha‚Äôs beach house sounded like a lot of fun, even with three students. With this new group of friends, she had a feeling everything was going to be a lot different from now on.



Chapter End Notes

Sometimes I forget what handles I use where. It's cool. This story is currently in the forefront of my mind and I'm trying to get it out as fast as it happens in my brain. AuDHD and all.

I Could Make The Bad Boys Good For The Weekend

Chapter Summary

Alice calls Jen, school begins, and everyone heads to the beach house for Labor Day weekend.
Lilia provides more cryptic messages and a bit of counsel, and we see a little more meddling.

Chapter Notes

Agatha and Jen are back to bickering, and Alice and Jen decide to pick up the pace.

I have no idea how Hollywood works, so...go with me there. I know how teaching and schools work. Granted this is HIGHLY fictionalized. HIGHLY.

Y'all, this is when Dare2Dream83 called me out and now we're besties.
Everyone tell her thank you for cracking open my Neurospicy brain...

Updated 5/14/25

See the end of the chapter for more notes

üé∂
