And I know you heard about me

So hey, let's be friends

I'm dying to see how this one ends

Blank Space - Taylor Swift

üé∂

August - September

Jennifer Kale had cried for exactly two minutes. It had quite possibly been the most she had cried in ten years over something personal. She walked into her townhouse, locked her door, and began to go through her nighttime routine. She had a meticulous skincare regimen she followed. Alice constantly told her that she didn‚Äôt need it and that Jen‚Äôs skin was naturally perfect, but she wasn‚Äôt taking any chances.

Alice.

Jen huffed and stamped her foot in the empty bedroom, now wearing silk pajamas.

How dare Alice sneak out of here like a coward Sunday morning and then tell her they should just be friends? They had cuddled on that very couch multiple times and fallen asleep. Didn‚Äôt ALL sapphics with crushes on each other do that? Wasn‚Äôt that some unwritten law somewhere?

Didn‚Äôt Alice know she was supposed to stop Jen and say, ‚ÄúNo. We will not be doing the just friends thing. We should be together.‚Äù

Jen should have known that Alice wasn‚Äôt going to do that. Alice was a protector, she defended. She didn‚Äôt charge in blindly.

Neither of them did. It‚Äôs why they had been in this predicament forever.

Jen had hoped that Rio's moving here would spur Alice to make a move. Alice talked about Rio constantly, about how Rio always gave her the courage to do things.

So much for that plan.

Jen rinsed and washed her face before rubbing in moisturizer when her phone rang. It was the distinct ringtone she had given to Alice.

She patted her face dry while reaching for the device.

A video call.

‚ÄúFine, Alice, I‚Äôll play.‚Äù

She answered and immediately smiled upon seeing Alice wearing Jen‚Äôs University of Oregon shirt.

‚ÄúGo on a date with me.‚Äù Alice blurted.

Jen couldn‚Äôt hide her shock as her mouth hung open. ‚ÄúW-what did you just say to me?‚Äù

‚ÄúI like you, Jen, and I have for years. I know we don‚Äôt want to risk our friendship, but I can‚Äôt pretend anymore, okay? Go out with me. Saturday. There‚Äôs ‚Äî‚Äù

‚ÄúYes. Saturday.‚Äù Jen cut her off with a wide smile, her eyes sparkling. She didn‚Äôt care where they went. She just knew it was about time.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The rest of the week flew by as Rio and Alice prepared for the first day of school on the upcoming Monday. Alice had asked Jen out, and they were scheduled to go out the upcoming Saturday. On a real date. Their friends were possibly more excited than they were. The Friday before, Agatha and Wanda met with Jen about offers.

Jen walked into Agatha‚Äôs house, where they often met. Her office was more for her to have phone calls and handle meetings with heads of studios and the like. When she dealt with her ‚Äòtalent‚Äô, which was only Agatha and Wanda, she did so at their houses, usually Agatha‚Äôs, and killed two birds with one stone.

She turned on her laptop and laid her folders down.‚ÄúFirst, I would like to thank you both for recently making the PR side of my job easy. Agatha, you‚Äôve been lying relatively low. A certain brunette keeping you from hoeing about?‚Äù She jabbed, ‚ÄúWanda, you always do great.‚Äù She smiled at both of them, sincerely at Wanda, who smiled back from her normal spot as Agatha flipped her off from hers.

Jennifer rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúReal mature, Harkness. Anyway, you both have the press for your upcoming releases, various things in post, multiple commercial campaigns running, and awards season coming up. Also, Wanda, you, and Nat are leaving this afternoon for some things in New York this weekend. And... I have offers for you both.

Marvel is offering you roles, but as you know, Marvel comes with massive secrecy. You won‚Äôt even know what those roles are until after you talk with them and accept them. Disney, knowing how well you work together, also has opposite roles for both of you. Then there‚Äôs a TV show, Agatha, a comedy, something you‚Äôd be great at. Wanda, a movie for Netflix, definitely would be an award-winner. What do you think?‚Äù

They looked at each other and back at Jen.

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù They said in unison.

‚ÄúNeither of you even knows the location, dates, anything.‚Äù She responded.

Agatha looked at her. ‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt provide any of that information, meaning you don‚Äôt have it.‚Äù

Jen sighed. ‚ÄúCaught me. We know Marvel doesn‚Äôt have it yet. Disney will work around Marvel, and we have to know those two to know about the third roles for each of you. We‚Äôre looking at the next few years being taken up by Marvel and Disney, with some smaller projects in between. I will get back to everyone, and we‚Äôll start the processes.‚Äù She shot off the emails she had already drafted, put everything back in her bag, and looked at them. ‚ÄúNow, on to more important things. I have a date with Alice tomorrow, and I don‚Äôt know what to wear, and, oddly,¬† I‚Äôm nervous.‚Äù

Agatha was idly scrolling through her phone. ‚ÄúJust go back to her place, strip, and get it all out of both of your systems. You‚Äôve been circling each other like horny lesbian sharks for years.‚Äù She responded.

Wanda‚Äôs jaw dropped. ‚ÄúAGATHA!‚Äù She gasped. ‚ÄúThese are our friends, and we want them to be happy!‚Äù

Agatha looked up. ‚ÄúGetting laid makes me happy.‚Äù

Wanda smacked her on the leg and looked at Jen, who had an exasperated look on her face. ‚ÄúIgnoring this one, wear something comfortable. Where are you going?‚Äù She asked.

‚ÄúThank you, Wanda,‚Äù Jen said, shooting Agatha an exasperated look. ‚ÄúAnd thank you for absolutely nothing, Agatha.‚Äù Agatha shrugged. She was not the person to go to for dating advice. Sex advice, absolutely. Dating, absolutely not. Jen continued, ‚ÄúLunch and a multi-cultural festival I wanted to go to that I mentioned a month or so back.‚Äù She responded with a slight smile.

Wanda squealed, ‚ÄúShe listened and remembered! Okay, so comfortable shoes for walking, obviously, and then something comfortable for being outside in the heat. A sundress! Go with a sundress. Pink is your color, do that!‚Äù She was giddy and in her element. As much as she didn‚Äôt want her sons to grow up, she couldn‚Äôt wait to help them out with dates either.

Agatha groaned. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt forget a hat so you don‚Äôt blind her.‚Äù

‚ÄúDid you even brush your hair today? The iconic hair that you‚Äôre supposed to take meticulous care of?‚Äù Jen responded.

‚ÄúDid you polish your head?‚Äù Agatha shot back. ‚ÄúAnd I do take care of my hair when necessary, thank you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWill you two stop it? Agatha, you're just jealous because there are so many rules and stipulations with your hair and how iconic it is. The times you have been able to do anything with it, even that was meticulously curated and written into contracts and insurance policies.‚Äù Wanda turned to Jen, ‚ÄúShe was in her late twenties and had to shave it for a role when she found out how terrible she looked bald. It took months just to greenlight the haircut and the movie. They almost had to get a body double just because it was taking so long.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am not jealous,‚Äù Agatha mumbled. Much like other celebrities had iconic features, hers had been her hair since she was a kid, to the point where, like Taylor Swift‚Äôs legs, Mariah Carey‚Äôs vocal cords, and America Ferrera‚Äôs smile were insured, so had been her hair. It hadn‚Äôt been her idea, and it still wasn‚Äôt her favorite thing in the world. However, it made sense business-wise.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre also jealous because I have a date, and you don‚Äôt,‚Äù Jen added.

‚ÄúOh, please. I could have any date I wanted.‚Äù She huffed, hating that they were teaming up against her.

‚ÄúStop it. Both of you.‚Äù Wanda warned, using her mom voice and glare. The other two women muttered as they changed the topic.

Agatha was slightly annoyed that Alice and Jennifer had figured it out right after deciding to remain friends. What was worse was that she knew Rio had been the one to make the final push. She had reminded herself that she and Rio had just met. Agatha Harkness possessed many things. However, patience was not one of them. She didn‚Äôt want to screw things up, and Rio was extremely young. Agatha was not entirely sure where this was coming from, and knew that remaining friends was the best course of action. Clearly, she was letting Wanda and her other friends get to her, and she needed to focus on her career. She needed to devote her time to preparing for her commitments and promoting her upcoming projects.

Agatha knew she was bored and that was all.

‚Äú...football starts up in September, so we have that, and then the premiere for Death‚Äôs Beloved in October.‚Äù Wanda looked over at Agatha.

Jen perked up. ‚ÄúThis one has been promoted for months. There‚Äôs already award talk, as you both know. The theme song has been everywhere already.‚Äù

Wanda turned to Agatha with a wide grin, and Agatha could already see the wheels turning in her head.

‚ÄúYou should take Rio,‚Äù Wanda said excitedly.

Agatha shook her head. ‚ÄúNo, I know this is not one for Nicky to attend, but I thought we‚Äôd go together since we played opposite each other.‚Äù

Jen held up a hand, eyes lighting up. ‚ÄúNo, Wanda‚Äôs on to something. Wanda, people have been wondering about you and Vision.‚Äù She gave her a pointed look as Wanda looked away. ‚ÄúSo you should probably walk the carpet with your husband. Unless you planned on walking it with someone else, that‚Äôs not Agatha?‚Äù Wanda shook her head.

‚ÄúRight. So, go with your husband, and Agatha, take Rio. We‚Äôre not doing fake dating or any publicity stunts like that, so no one goes down that road, but it will be nice for people to see that you have other friends. I‚Äôve been trying to get Alice to walk the carpet for years as the daughter of Lorna Wu, but she won‚Äôt touch it.‚Äù

Agatha glared at both of them. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll think about it, and we‚Äôll circle back. How‚Äôs that?‚Äù

Wanda nodded. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll take it. Now, Jen, about your date tomorrow.‚Äù She wanted to change the subject as quickly as possible before this could turn back to her at all, just glad Nat wasn‚Äôt here.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Alice was nervous. It was Saturday, and she was finally going on a date with Jen. The events from the previous Tuesday continued to play in Alice‚Äôs head. She and Jen agreeing to be just friends, and Rio pushing Alice to call Jen an hour later.

Alice had been so afraid Jen would say no, but instead, she said yes before Alice even finished speaking. Apparently, Jen‚Äôs ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not looking for anything serious‚Äù was more of a defense mechanism than anything. So here Alice was, in her closet, with Rio sitting on her bed, telling her what to wear.

‚ÄúSeriously, Alice, she‚Äôs going to think you‚Äôre beautiful no matter what you wear. She‚Äôs absolutely into you.‚Äù She said, popping a chip into her mouth.

‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt even know we liked each other,‚Äù Alice replied, holding a black shirt up to herself before making a face and replacing it.

‚ÄúOkay, true, but I just met everyone, and anytime I see the two of you together, Agatha is there. You try paying attention to anyone else when Agatha Harkness is standing RIGHT THERE.‚Äù She gestured with her hand to make the point.

Alice pulled on a pair of black shorts, moving so that Rio could see how they looked. ‚ÄúI do it all the time. Almost a decade, Ri.‚Äù

Rio nodded her approval of the shorts as the other woman disappeared back into the closet. ‚ÄúI applaud your strength. Yes, the orange halter. It honestly is your color. She was also apparently very close with your mother, found that out last weekend, and I‚Äôm new to the friend group. The Converse, the plain black ones. I‚Äôm surprised you didn‚Äôt see her more when you were younger. ‚Äù She added. The more Rio was learning, the more hurt she was becoming. How much longer could she tell herself that Alice was just doing what was best? ‚ÄúWear your hair down, it‚Äôs so pretty like that. I‚Äôm so glad you didn‚Äôt do it all red.

Alice had never made dating a major priority in her life, and Rio wanted the best for her. The more Alice shared about Jen, the more it seemed like Jen would be a good fit for her. It helped that they had known each other for so long, and they already knew each other‚Äôs quirks and habits. Alice had been cautious of LA, anything to do with Hollywood, dating, and even drinking for a very long time. Rio had been the bad influence of the two. Anything that could take her down the path of Lorna Wu, she kept at arm‚Äôs length. Alice knew she had the same addictive personality as her mother did. She had to take things slowly and in moderation, integrating into the world of Hollywood, and wine nights, she was still careful with any type of medication, and with that, came dating.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy for you, Alice. It‚Äôs going to go great. If you need any help with dating advice, well, there‚Äôs maybe Wanda? She seems to have good luck in that department, just not in the decision-making aspect of it. If you want to find yourself in a horrible situation though, I‚Äôm your girl.‚Äù Rio gave her the thumbs up as Alice came out and closed the door, showing off the completed look.

‚ÄúThat was not your fault. You had no idea ANY of that was going to happen. Now, wish me luck, and text Agatha to see what she‚Äôs doing tonight.‚Äù Alice winked.

Rio laughed and hugged her tightly.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to work out. She‚Äôs already wrapped around you like that finger trap that got stuck on your finger when we were fifteen and drunk.‚Äù Rio whispered before she let Alice go and left to go back to her own apartment.

‚ÄúIt was Lunar New Year, we had too much sake, and it was made for toddlers!‚Äù Alice said after her.

‚ÄúThen drink some sake!‚Äù



Rio stared at her phone as she thought about texting Agatha. ‚ÄúFriends hang out with each other. If Alice wasn‚Äôt going out with Jen, we would do something tonight.‚Äù She said, looking over at the cat, who had jumped up on the couch with her.

Me:

Hey, what are you doing this evening?

She hesitated before sending it and looked over at Raven. ‚ÄúAlice won‚Äôt come back and want to go over everything, right? Surely they‚Äôll hang out all night, right?‚Äù Raven gave a soft meow before climbing into her lap. ‚ÄúRight.‚Äù She pressed send and automatically saw that Agatha was typing a response.

Agatha üíú

Nothing, actually. I don‚Äôt expect Alice and Jen‚Äôs

date to end, nor do you, I assume. 2/3 boys have

a football weekend retreat thing. Vision and Billy

went somewhere on some nerd thing with Vision‚Äôs

best friend, Herb. Wanda and Nat are at some press

thing this weekend for something Wanda did.

I‚Äôm solo.

Rio looked down at the phone. She hadn‚Äôt changed Agatha‚Äôs contact from what Alice and crew had entered, so the purple heart had stayed. She wondered what they had put in Agatha‚Äôs phone. She thought for a moment and looked down at Raven. ‚ÄúYou might meet a new friend today, old woman. Hopefully, you like her.‚Äù

Me:

Sounds boring, but same. Want

to come over and be bored together?

Agatha üíú

but I know you mean the

This is Raven. She may be older

than God herself.

Rio placed her phone on the coffee table and stood up to make sure her apartment was tidied up. Rio kept it clean but didn‚Äôt want any dishes in the sink or accidental underwear on the floor. She scooped out the cat box, took out the trash, double-checked that the bathroom was clean, and all the usual ‚Äòsomeone other than my sister is coming over‚Äô chores were done. She looked in the fridge to see what she had on hand and decided on a chicken and bacon pasta from scratch. It was simple but with a homemade sauce, so somewhat impressive. She was wearing normal lazy Saturday clothes: black sweats and a green tank, with hair clipped up, and barefoot. She wasn‚Äôt going to bother changing as she saw no need. It wasn‚Äôt like she was trying to impress Agatha. She wasn‚Äôt. She fed Raven in hopes that she‚Äôd leave them alone while they ate, knowing full well that she wouldn‚Äôt. She already had music playing as she couldn‚Äôt stand silence and always had something playing. Currently, it was some random Spotify mix. Sister Alice

The date‚Äôs going well. We‚Äôll probably

grab dinner and then I think we‚Äôre going

to see a movie and maybe back to my place.

Me:

YAY! I won‚Äôt bother you. Tell Jen

I said hi. Agatha is coming over.

Dinner and movies or whatever.

Love you too.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha had packed a bag, not because she thought anything would happen, but because she wanted to be comfortable at Rio‚Äôs house. She was used to having to look a certain way when she was out during the day, which was why she wore jeans and a simple black top. Nice enough to be photographed if she were seen between the vehicle and Rio‚Äôs building. She had packed sweats and a UCLA shirt to change into later. She was glad Rio had texted her, although honestly, Agatha had been about ten minutes away from texting her new friend herself. It was the weekend before school started, and she wanted to spend time together before she was buried in work this week.

Rio had sent her the address, though she already knew where she lived, having been to Alice‚Äôs plenty of times over the years. Her thoughts wandered to her friends in New York, wanting to check on them, but knowing it was best to leave them alone when they were on their own. Agatha sighed at the thought of Wanda and that whole‚Ä¶thing. She knew Wanda would always do what Wanda felt was best for the boys, and that she and Vision loved each other in their way. It was a messy situation, and she needed Wanda to hurry the hell up and fill Rio in so she had someone to talk to about it.

Agatha shook the thoughts away as the elevator doors opened on Rio‚Äôs floor and walked to the door. She had been let into the building easily. The doormen were all the same and knew her, even if they hadn‚Äôt, no one told Agatha Harkness no. She was one of the most recognizable people in the world. She knocked and wasn‚Äôt surprised when the door opened almost immediately.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Rio said, standing aside to let her in. ‚ÄúMake yourself at home, put your bag wherever. What do you want to drink?‚Äù

‚ÄúHi,‚Äù She replied, not setting her bag down yet. Eyes landing on what looked like something fruity. ‚ÄúWhatever you‚Äôre drinking is fine, and where‚Äôs your bathroom? I want to change. I hate having to look put together all the time.‚Äù She grimaced.

Rio laughed. ‚ÄúI have a rum and pineapple, and there‚Äôs one down the hall on the right. I completely get it. I‚Äôm not ready to wear teacher clothes every day. I‚Äôll grab our food. We‚Äôre even eating at the table. Like adults!‚Äù She responded.

‚ÄúOh goody!‚Äù She said sarcastically as she headed down the hall.

When she returned a few minutes later, she set her bag behind the couch and joined Rio at the table. ‚ÄúYou cook?‚Äù

‚ÄúAlice and I both do. Gran made sure of it. I had taught myself growing up anyway, but Gran honed my skill.‚Äù She answered as they both started eating.

Agatha hummed in satisfaction, ‚ÄúYou did a great job. I do okay, but this is amazing. If that whole teaching thing doesn‚Äôt pan out, you‚Äôve got a backup skill to fall back on.‚Äù Agatha downplayed her own skills. She had been taught to cook by two women who believed that she should know how to cook for herself. One of those people had learned from the same person Rio had.

Rio‚Äôs cheeks tinged a light pink. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not the first one to say that.‚Äù Her eyes darted to Agatha‚Äôs feet. ‚ÄúI apologize if Raven tries to steal your food.‚Äù

Agatha raised an eyebrow, ‚ÄúThe cat? I haven‚Äôt even‚Ä¶‚Äù She was cut off by a feline intruder jumping into her lap. ‚Äú...and you must be Raven. Sorry, but I am not sharing with you.‚Äù She said as she put her fork down and removed the cat from her lap, only for Raven to jump into the other empty lap and be dismissed for a second time.

Rio shook her head. ‚ÄúI promise I feed her, do not listen to her lies.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen a cat beg for human food before,‚Äù Agatha remarked, watching as the cat sat between the two chairs, green eyes watching them both.

‚ÄúOh, that‚Äôs not a cat, as I said before, that is an immortal familiar.‚Äù Rio finished her food, putting her fork down, watching Agatha.

Agatha looked at her and down at her plate. ‚ÄúDo you even taste your food? We‚Äôve been sitting for five minutes.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat was me tasting my food and eating slowly.‚Äù She replied.

Agatha shook her head and gestured ahead with her fork. ‚ÄúWell, do continue about Raven.‚Äù

‚ÄúAlice and I adopted her when we got our first place in college. Alice is more of a dog person, but she humored me. We were at the shelter, about to adopt another cat, when a kitten was meowing incessantly. Suddenly, this mostly black paw shot out of the adjacent kennel, attempting to smack the kitten to get it to stop, and all we saw were these shiny green eyes. I swear to this day that cat was not there. The shelter didn‚Äôt even have the paperwork for her and made up some random name, and I‚Äôm pretty sure falsified information when we decided that we obviously had to have the magical mystery cat. That was nearly sixteen years ago. They guessed she was around two, though not a single vet has been able to age her properly. On paper, she‚Äôs eighteen, but in reality? No idea. In my heart? At least a thousand.‚Äù Rio smiled affectionately at the aged feline, now more brown and orange than black as she once had been. She turned her attention back to Agatha, passion in her voice as she continued speaking about her cat.

‚ÄúShortly after Norma died, when Alice moved out here and I moved to a different place of my own for the first time, Raven disappeared for six weeks. I thought she was gone, that I had lost her, too.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs smile faltered, something dark sliding over her eyes before it left just as quickly as it had appeared. ‚ÄúThankfully, she returned without a scratch, no parasites, nothing. A little thin and in need of a bath, which she hated. The vet was mystified. I‚Äôve also seen her chase off predators, hunt things much bigger than her, all kinds of unusual things. She‚Äôs basically a friend-shaped Eldritch creature.‚Äù Raven now perched in Rio‚Äôs lap, eyeing Agatha, as Rio absentmindedly scratched her head.

Agatha looked at the animal, having finished her dinner, and now leaned forward with her chin propped on her fist. ‚ÄúYou are one interesting cat.‚Äù She noted, as the cat in question judged her. She turned back to Rio. ‚ÄúWhy do I feel like she‚Äôs staring into my soul?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause she is. Seconds?‚Äù Rio stood and took their plates.

‚ÄúNo, thank you. That was great. Let me help.‚Äù Agatha stood, collected their empty glasses, and followed Rio into the kitchen. As she helped clean up, she noticed how intently Raven watched her. Agatha had never felt judged by a cat before.

‚ÄúI feel like she‚Äôs sizing me up.‚Äù Agatha finally said as they finished cleaning up, putting leftovers away, and refreshing their drinks.

‚ÄúShe does that.‚Äù Was all Rio said as she walked back to the living room, and they both sat on the couch. ‚ÄúHave you told anyone that I‚Äôm going to the beach house yet?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, have you?‚Äù Agatha turned toward Rio.

‚ÄúNo. No particular reason. I just haven‚Äôt shared it with Alice yet. She‚Äôs been so excited about this date, and I keep forgetting.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh, Jen has been, too, and Wanda, of course.‚Äù Agatha shook her head.

‚ÄúMovie?‚Äù Rio asked, changing the subject before asking questions she knew Agatha would not give her the answers to. She tried to think of a movie that wasn‚Äôt an Agatha or Wanda film, she was in the mood to watch.

‚ÄúYes. Want to watch one we‚Äôve probably both seen a million times and make commentary?‚Äù Agatha asked with a sly grin. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs one of my favorite things to do.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf we can find one, I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôve seen that many black and white movies.‚Äù Rio joked.

Agatha hit her with a pillow, smirking at the ‚ÄòLive Laugh Lesbian‚Äô saying. ‚ÄúWe can watch another Disney or PG one, child.‚Äù

Rio looked to the ceiling and poked her tongue into the side of her cheek. ‚ÄúOkay, point taken. What about the lesbian classic D.E.B.S?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe extremely cheesy spy thriller with a killer 80s soundtrack?‚Äù Agatha asked with a knowing smirk.

‚ÄúThe one and only,‚Äù Rio answered, already searching through her various subscription services for the movie.

‚ÄúOh, absolutely, but only if we turn it into a sing-along.‚Äù

They shared sarcastic comments and sang along with exaggerated movements, noting the various tropes of the movie. Agatha pointed out different people she knew, including those she knew.

‚ÄúHow do you even keep track, or remember?‚Äù Rio shook her head, laughing.

‚ÄúA gentle sapphic never forgets, lest she repeats.‚Äù

Rio scoffed. ‚ÄúHow many little black books do you have?‚Äù

‚ÄúA small library full,‚Äù Agatha winked at Rio scandalously.

Rio rolled her eyes and shook her head again, saying nothing.

Agatha‚Äôs face softened as the credits began to roll. ‚ÄúDoes it bother you?‚Äù Her voice was softer now, quieter. Agatha was not ashamed of her decades of conquests and dalliances. It was part of who she was, and it was widely known. Yet she found herself somewhat self-conscious of it for the first time since she was thirteen.

Rio tilted her head to the side and thought about it. This was Agatha Harkness. Quite possibly the most respectful ‚Äòplayboy‚Äô to roam the Earth. She knew women who had encountered her. You couldn‚Äôt live in the state of California and not know at least one. Agatha was legendary in terms of respect, boundaries, and aftercare. She wasn‚Äôt going to call you back, and lightning never struck twice, but for someone with her reputation, it was a respectful one.

‚ÄúNo. It would if you were arrogant in the way men are, or if there were rumors of you treating women horribly, but no. Besides, everyone has hobbies.‚Äù Rio gestured around her apartment at her plants.

For some reason, Rio Vidal‚Äôs approval was the validation that Agatha needed at that moment. Not that it mattered, it‚Äôs not like they would ever be doing anything. Rio was a friend, not food.

Agatha had only really sought the validation of five people in her life, not counting the public as a whole. Two of those people were dead, one was no longer in her life, one was a middle-aged redhead, and the other was a teenage boy.

None of them were Rio Vidal, yet here she was, overcome with warmth from knowing that the beautiful, friend , woman next to her, did not see her as less than, or a horrible person for her choice of extracurricular activities.

The next movie started automatically while they talked and laughed late into the night. Rio looked over at Agatha when the older woman‚Äôs voice cut off mid-sentence to see that she had fallen asleep. Rio looked at her for a moment, taking in Agatha‚Äôs sleeping form, now in sweats and an oversized UCLA t-shirt. It was a deep-set couch, one that Rio had spent many nights on when her bed felt too big and empty. She glanced toward her room and back to Agatha.

Rio had a decision to make. She groaned as she stood and stretched. She glanced down at Agatha and again in the direction of her room as she tidied the living room and turned off any remaining lights.

Rio went to her bathroom and brushed her teeth, trying not to think about Agatha sound asleep on her couch. The couch that could, in theory, safely fit both of them. Innocently, as friends. She walked back through her room and picked up a blanket to drape over her sleeping friend as she cast a cynical look at her bed. ‚ÄúOh, what, like you have any room to judge. You‚Äôre not comforting.‚Äù She scoffed at the offending piece of furniture as she went back to the couch, having decided on her fate.

Rio curled up in a ball opposite Agatha and draped the blanket over them. They weren‚Äôt cuddling, they weren‚Äôt even touching‚Äîjust two friends who had fallen asleep on the same piece of furniture together. Rio had a feeling this was a normal occurrence in this co-dependent coven. She settled in, whispered goodnight, and went to sleep.

Raven hopped up on the couch and weighed her options before climbing on top of Agatha and falling asleep.

For the second Sunday morning in a row, the early morning sunlight filtered in and gently cast its light across Rio and Agatha, this time asleep on the same couch, legs intertwined.

Alice burst through the door barefoot, hair askew,¬† wearing nothing but an orange sports bra and Garfield boxers. She pounced on Rio and planted a giant kiss on her cheek.

‚ÄúI love you and am forever indebted to you. Good morning, Aggie.‚Äù Alice grinned, quickly disappearing. ‚ÄúEnjoy your morning!‚Äù She called as the door shut behind her.

Agatha was still half asleep, but mumbled. ‚ÄúWas that her thanking you because they fucked?‚Äù

Rio sleepily shook her head. ‚ÄúNo. Knowing my sister, they decided to date, finally kissed, Jen spent the night, and they woke up holding each other. Lesbians. It was her thank you for that.‚Äù

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù Agatha clicked her tongue, eyes still closed. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs going to text their group chat about this, isn‚Äôt she?‚Äù

‚ÄúYep,‚Äù Rio popped the p, shifting under the covers. ‚ÄúWanda will be insufferable this week.‚Äù

Agatha sighed. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going back to sleep.‚Äù

It wasn‚Äôt until after Agatha had left and Alice had come over to tell Rio about her date that Rio finally let herself process last night‚Äôs sleeping situation.

‚ÄúOur legs were all wrapped together, Alice!‚Äù Rio exclaimed, making some complicated motions using both arms.

‚ÄúOkay, we‚Äôve slept like that, no big deal,‚Äù Alice shrugged as she put the final touches on a seating chart.

‚ÄúYes, but you‚Äôre my sister, and while gorgeous, you‚Äôre not Mother Harkness,‚Äù Rio referred to Agatha by her Instagram handle and what she was commonly referred to by the lesbian community.

Alice didn‚Äôt take offense as she knew exactly what Rio meant. ‚ÄúKnew you still had that crush, Ms. ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre just friends‚Äô. Besides, you‚Äôre the one who made the very conscious decision to sleep on the couch.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe are just friends, which might complicate things. I knew I shouldn‚Äôt have told you I chose to sleep on the couch.‚Äù She grimaced. ‚ÄúNo, she‚Äôs the parent of a student.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo, you‚Äôre both tactile and you like to cuddle. It‚Äôs cute, even if you don‚Äôt end up together. You have another platonic cuddle buddy.‚Äù Alice tried to spin it in a positive light.

Rio just sighed. ‚ÄúMeanwhile, you‚Äôve found yourself a whole-ass wife,‚Äù she grinned.

‚ÄúNo one said anything about any of that.‚Äù Alice glared back. ‚ÄúWe are taking things slow, still painfully so. We are officially dating though, and it‚Äôs about fucking time.‚Äù Their whole relationship had been based on caution, why not remain at that speed? Alice sighed. At this rate, Agatha and Rio would be grandparents, and Wanda would figure out her life by the time she and Jen even moved in together.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha had been waiting for Wanda to return from her trip. Agatha had told Wanda that she was to come to Agatha‚Äôs immediately.

Agatha had just finished her fourth set of Pilates when the non-lethal redhead finally came in the door.

‚ÄúI had Nat take my stuff to the house. What‚Äôs wrong? You wouldn‚Äôt tell me, is everything okay?‚Äù Wanda asked, eyes searching the older woman‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúWe fell asleep on the couch, our legs were all,‚Äù she gestured with her arms to mimic their legs, ‚Äúwhen we woke up, and it just felt natural. I don‚Äôt cuddle with just anyone.‚Äù Agatha plopped on the couch, running out of energy, as the words flowed forth.

Wanda tried to control her excitement and not overreact. Agatha was right. She didn‚Äôt spend the night with people. She was tactile with very few, the core group being it, and even then, mainly Wanda. ‚ÄúHow did Rio react?‚Äù She asked cautiously.

Agatha shrugged. ‚ÄúWe both acted like nothing happened.‚Äù

Wanda mimicked Agatha‚Äôs plop and looked over at her. ‚ÄúA bunch of useless lesbians, I swear.‚Äù She sighed.

‚ÄúThe worst.‚Äù Agatha agreed. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs fun, attractive, smart, I can tell her anything.‚Äù She shook her head. ‚ÄúBut, no. I will not be dating my son‚Äôs teachers...anymore.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat a great time to up your standards,‚Äù Wanda remarked. ‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt date them in the first place, nor do you date. You won‚Äôt even mention how you‚Äôre feeling about the intimacy of it all.‚Äù She studied Agatha‚Äôs face for any signs of how she felt, and while she saw a few twitches, Agatha‚Äôs multitudes of awards weren‚Äôt for nothing.

Where Wanda had to put forth the effort to keep her emotions from being written all over her face, Agatha had been born with a resting bitch face.

‚ÄúI will not be doing that at this moment. We are friends and nothing more.‚Äù Agatha replied.

Wanda shook her head. After nearly three decades with Agatha, this didn‚Äôt surprise her. ‚ÄúDo you need a shovel to bury those feelings?‚Äù She asked.

Agatha scoffed. ‚ÄúCan I borrow yours?‚Äù She asked.

‚ÄúI hate you.‚Äù Wanda smiled.

‚ÄúYou love me,‚Äù Agatha responded.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The first day of school started with a school-wide meeting before students arrived. Lilia looked at the faculty and staff and reminded everyone, once again, of the NDAs that had been signed, their unusual student body and parents, the school‚Äôs mission, and so forth.

Rio was beginning to detest the term.

‚ÄúIn conclusion,‚Äù Lilia had said, ‚Äúwe are not just working with parents, but nannies, managers, agents, PR, etc. You will develop all types of relationships. We are all adults here, and we sign NDAs for a reason. I have eyes and ears everywhere. I know what goes on. Act like adults and keep things out of the public eye, or at least let the reps handle it how they need to. Think logically and do not involve students in their parents‚Äô affairs. While a few relationships have worked out successfully in the past, many have not. Be mindful of that.‚Äù She dismissed them all to get ready for the students to show up. It was the same speech every year, though it hit harder this year for a large population of the faculty.

Lilia pulled Alice aside with a knowing smile. ‚ÄúRemember what I‚Äôve told you, while Jen‚Äôs not a parent, it could still affect things. I‚Äôm happy for you, but you are both hard-headed and stubborn.‚Äù She squeezed Alice‚Äôs arm and walked toward where Rio spoke with another science teacher.

Lilia pulled Rio aside, a hand on her shoulder, ‚ÄúMay and December are not that much different,‚Äù then the older woman walked away without another word.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck does that mean?‚Äù Rio asked as Alice came up beside her.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand half of what that woman says, and I‚Äôve been here for ten years,‚Äù Alice replied. ‚ÄúOh well, off to start the day.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh! Alice, I forgot to tell you. I‚Äôm going with you to the beach weekend! Happy first day of school!‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Wanda was easily the most excited about Rio joining them for the upcoming holiday weekend. However, she was also perplexed as she sat in her living room the last week of August with Jen and Nat. Alice and Rio were teaching, and Agatha was at a press interview.

‚ÄúSix bedrooms at the beach house. The boys will have the bunkroom, which isn‚Äôt a bunkroom anymore, but they‚Äôll want to all stay together. Vision and I.‚Äù Her eyes darted down as she said it, hands fidgeting.

Jen had been looking at her phone, but Nat caught her look and lightly brushed her fingertips down her arm in comfort, eliciting a tense smile from Wanda before she continued her bedroom planning.

‚ÄúNat, you have your room. Jen, do you and Alice want to share a room?‚Äù She asked.

Jen‚Äôs eyes shot up. ‚ÄúUmm, we‚Äôre not..but yes.‚Äù

Wanda‚Äôs smile widened slightly, happy someone had figured it out at least. ‚ÄúFinally. That leaves Agatha in her room and‚Ä¶damn, that‚Äôs just enough rooms with no way to force her and Rio to share a room.‚Äù Wanda had been hoping to force Rio and Agatha to room together, but unfortunately, she and Agatha had bought a large house all those years ago.

Jen shrugged. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve had four movie nights, we‚Äôve been present at two of them, and they usually end up falling asleep in the same room or on each other anyway. They‚Äôre comfortable together and have barely known each other for a month.‚Äù She reminded her.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs like a year in lesbian time!‚Äù Wanda whined.

Nat fully put her hand on Wanda‚Äôs arm, looking at her softly. That look conveyed more than Nat‚Äôs words did. ‚ÄúI know you want Aggie to find someone, but give it a bit more time, okay?‚Äù

Wanda nodded. Jen looked from Nat to Wanda and back. ‚ÄúIf you try to force Agatha too much, she‚Äôll rebel,‚Äù Jen added.

‚ÄúI agree with Jen,‚Äù Nat stared at Wanda. ‚ÄúYou know she‚Äôs right.‚Äù

Wanda nodded. ‚ÄúFine, but that doesn‚Äôt mean I‚Äôll stop nudging.‚Äù She chewed on her lip and looked at Nat. ‚ÄúI want her to have‚Ä¶to be‚Ä¶‚Äù She whispered.

Jen watched the interaction between Wanda and Nat carefully. Wanda was quickly spiraling, and Jen knew it was only a matter of time. She jotted down a few notes and sighed. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to head to the office. I have a few contract negotiations to handle. Have a good afternoon.‚Äù She waved and left.

Upon hearing the door click behind Jen, Nat pulled Wanda into her, an arm around her waist. Wanda laid her head on Nat‚Äôs shoulder, eyes darting to the clock to gauge how much time they had. Nat pressed her lips to Wanda‚Äôs temple.

‚ÄúTalk to me dragostea mea, my love,‚Äù Nat whispered.

Wanda relaxed into Nat, careful to watch the time. Always aware of the time. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how much longer I can do this, Natasha. Something has to change, and I still don‚Äôt know what to do.‚Äù Her fingers drew circles on Nat‚Äôs arm as she tried to keep her breathing steady. This was not a new conversation for them, and it was becoming more frequent.



Nat caressed Wanda‚Äôs cheek, her brows furrowed. Nat would always respect Wanda‚Äôs decisions, even if they did rip at her heart. ‚ÄúHave you talked to Agatha? Told her where you‚Äôre at?‚Äù

Wanda shook her head. ‚ÄúYou know what she would say, and my therapist isn‚Äôt helpful, and no, I haven‚Äôt talked to anyone else. Everyone‚Äôs too close to us, Nat. They will all say the same thing.‚Äù

Nat knew they would. She was selfishly counting on it.

Nat curled her index finger under Wanda‚Äôs chin and tilted it up, their eyes meeting. ‚ÄúSunshine, I‚Ä¶‚Äù She was cut off when they heard the front door open, and they flew apart.

‚ÄúAfternoon, Darling!‚Äù Vision called, ruining the moment.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The first few weeks of school had gone well. Rio was getting to know her students well and building relationships with them and the other parents. So far, no shenanigans had been started by Nicky or Tommy, and Billy was a great kid. Labor Day weekend had finally arrived, and she was excited to go on this little trip with her friends, something she hadn‚Äôt had with any of her friends in San Francisco. She enjoyed their weekend movie nights, no matter who joined, dinners with Alice during the week, and Jennifer, who was starting to dine with them too. Rio knew that this weekend at the Wagatha beach house was going to be both memorable and fun. They were all headed up to Malibu that evening and would return Monday afternoon.

As the final bell rang, Rio grabbed her things and met Alice in the hall as they walked towards her car, as it had been Rio‚Äôs week to drive.

‚ÄúAre you excited to stay in the massive beach house all weekend?‚Äù Alice asked, knocking her shoulder into Rio‚Äôs.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not what I‚Äôm excited about. I‚Äôm excited to spend time with this forged family you‚Äôve roped me into.‚Äù Rio responded with a grin. It was true. That‚Äôs what this felt like.

She and Alice had always been family, but she was happy it had expanded.

Alice smiled back. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always a fun weekend. You‚Äôre going to love it.‚Äù

Though she didn‚Äôt know Morgan all that well yet, Agatha had said that she was very trustworthy, even if Tony was her father. There was apparently history there.

Rio trusted Agatha.

However, the more Rio learned about Agatha over the past few weeks, the more she saw her for who she was. This would be a major public persona change, and people would notice.

While it didn‚Äôt bother Rio, she noticed the change.

Rio pouted a bit before letting out a resigned sigh. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs starting to make sense why Wanda is so invested in wanting everyone else around her to be happy when she clearly isn‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Dinner had been eaten, rooms sorted, and luggage settled. They were on the beach around a bonfire. Tommy and Nicky were throwing a football around; Vision, Billy, Nat, and Wanda were pointing out stars and constellations to each other; Alice and Jen were catching each other up on the week, and Rio was taking it all in. Agatha came up next to her and handed her a bottle of some mixed alcohol, and sat next to her. Agatha wore shorts over a swimsuit with her hair down. Rio, dressed similarly, nodded her thanks.

Without thinking, Rio automatically remarked. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve noticed your weekends haven‚Äôt exactly been your usual style recently.‚Äù She flinched as she said it.

Agatha just gave a wry smile. ‚ÄúEven Hollywood bad boys are allowed to take a break. Besides, Jen needed a break. She was about to have a stroke spinning everything and cleaning up my messes.‚Äù

Rio nodded. ‚ÄúI can only imagine. The woman could be a fixer for the mafia at this point.‚Äù

‚ÄúDepending on which website you read.‚Äù Rio smiled.

‚ÄúWhich ones are you reading?‚Äù Agatha asked, meeting Rio‚Äôs eyes.

Brown eyes met blue, really seeing Agatha. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe everything I read.‚Äù She replied softly.

‚ÄúOh? And what do you believe?‚Äù Agatha asked, the noise around her fading. All she was focused on was Rio‚Äôs answer. Sometime in the last month, this woman‚Äôs opinion had become almost as important to her as Wanda‚Äôs. It was something she couldn‚Äôt quite put into words yet, but the gravity of it was not lost on her. She had stopped truly caring about what the public thought of her personal life, relationship-wise, years ago. ‚ÄúI see you, Agatha,‚Äù Rio responded and was about to continue when a shout interrupted the moment as a redhead crashed into them, catching a rogue football.

Agatha swore. She could murder her son.

‚ÄúSorry, Mom! Sorry, Rio!‚Äù Nicky shouted. They had all agreed that the boys could call Rio by her first name when they weren‚Äôt at school, just like they did with Alice.

Nat rolled off both of them. ‚ÄúSorry. I didn‚Äôt think either of you wanted a black eye.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere are worse ways to go than death by redhead, Natasha. It‚Äôs fine.‚Äù Rio replied, standing up, her drink spilled all over her, and the moment was lost. ‚ÄúThank you for the save.‚Äù

Agatha had fixed the expression on her face and mumbled her thanks as well.

‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm going to go shower and head to bed,‚Äù Agatha said, standing and heading off.

Several others also took that moment to excuse themselves and call it a night.

Rio wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what she had been about to say, but she had done a lot of thinking about this developing friendship and Agatha herself in the past few weeks, telling herself that Agatha‚Äôs behavioral changes had absolutely nothing to do with her.

Returning to her assigned guest room, Rio readied herself for bed. She showered and lay down in the luxuriously comfortable bed, alone.¬† It shouldn‚Äôt have bothered her, but she knew what the odd energetic feeling in her chest was. It‚Äôs just a crush, she told herself. Nothing to get that worked up over, and nothing to be done about.

I don‚Äôt date parents, her thoughts continued as she let sleep overcome her, even if they‚Äôre her‚Ä¶

Chapter End Notes

Thank you for the kudos and comments! They are really helping a lot!

This thing is evolving, a lot, thanks brain! While Agatha and Rio remain the main relationship, the Wandanat of it all is going to be explored more as well. Since Agatha was very much "I'm here and queer" from a young age, Wanda is a pathological people pleaser. We'll delve more into that in later chapters.

Jen and Alice said "fuck it, we're doing this."

I'll Be Yours For The Weekend

Chapter Summary

The Labor Day Weekend trip and more insight into Nat and Wanda's relationship.
Agatha and Rio grow closer, but still not.

Chapter Notes

Thank you so much to my lovely Beta! She's been helping me flesh things out and reminding me that people cannot read my mind.

Anyway, we're approaching fall in fic-time where we will see more of the celebrity side of things.

Updated 5/21/25!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

üé∂

And the heart I know I'm breakin' is my own

To leave the warmest bed I've ever known

We could call it even

Even though I'm leavin'

And I'll be yours for the weekend

Tis The Damn Season - Taylor Swift

Labor Day Weekend

It was early. The sun had yet to rise, and the two redheads were only up because they had gone for a run on the beach, their daily runs something they had established when they were eighteen . They sat on one of the back decks looking out over the ocean, drinking coffee and enjoying the cool morning breeze. Wanda enjoyed these mornings with Natasha when they could be alone. Their chairs were pushed together, and they knew no one else would be up for at least another hour. They still wouldn‚Äôt risk it and would part ways to shower shortly after finishing their coffee, but they enjoyed the fleeting moment.

Wanda held Nat‚Äôs hand and ran her thumb over her knuckles. She was careful, knowing that her husband and sons were in the house behind them. She wasn‚Äôt worried so much about Vision. It was the boys. She sighed as she dropped the other woman‚Äôs hand and wrapped it around her coffee mug. ‚ÄúJen and Alice have gotten their shit together, it seems.‚Äù Wanda let her native accent slip through.

Nat nodded. ‚ÄúThanks to Rio for giving the final push. That only took ten years.‚Äù She set her empty mug down and placed her hand on Wanda‚Äôs thigh.

Wanda nodded, ‚ÄúNow for the other two. What else can we do? How can we get them into a one-bed situation? Stranded? Forced proximity? Jen already nixed fake dating.‚Äù She rattled off.

‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt we just give it time, sunshine? They‚Äôre just getting to know each other and are already draw n to each other. It‚Äôs going to work out.‚Äù Nat replied. She felt bad for breaking up their moment last night, and at least wanted to back off for the weekend.

‚ÄúIf I can‚Äôt be completely happy, everyone else is going to be, fuck.‚Äù Wanda bit back, bitterly, fire in her eyes. The more time passed, the worse things got for her situation, it seemed. No amount of stardom, therapy, or money could fix that. She had traded her soul and happiness for this life.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Nat knew Wanda was unraveling, and until Wanda made a decision, it was better to validate and change the subject. ‚ÄúYou fixed the football schedule to where they‚Äôre working the concession stand together for a quarter of each home game, Jen will make it so Rio goes to the premiere as her date, we won‚Äôt always be at movie nights , you‚Äôre going to plant it in Agatha‚Äôs head to take Rio to SNL when she hosts, AND the Halloween party. That‚Äôs a lot of forced proximity.‚Äù She pointed out, her own accent rather prominent. Dropping their American accents around each other was something they had been doing since they were teenagers , another layer of intimacy between them.

Their accents would slip through occasionally with the others, but not like this.

Wanda nodded. ‚ÄúI know. I‚Äôm just worried that we‚Äôre going to be traveling a lot soon, and they won‚Äôt be together as much.‚Äù

A grin formed on the former assassin's lips as she turned to look at Wanda. ‚ÄúThen you either get Agatha to send her flowers, or you do it. Or plants, we know Rio has a green thumb. Talk to Alice. You also make sure she‚Äôs calling, texting, whatever, daily. Since Rio is here now, that means we have Alice and Rio join us for the holidays, and if, for some idiot reason, they STILL aren‚Äôt together by winter, we send them up to the cabin together, and all make excuses as to why the rest of us can‚Äôt go. Manifest a blizzard. Oh! Rio loves music! Get Agatha to take her to some concerts, pull some strings. You‚Äôre crafty, Wanda. We‚Äôll figure it out, together, like we always do. I‚Äôm going to shower before everyone wakes up.‚Äù Nat stood and kissed Wanda on the crown of her head, deliberately ignoring the cameras on the perimeter of the house, before walking inside.

Wanda closed her eyes and sighed as she went to take their cups inside and get ready for the day herself, focusing on the plan she had previously come up with.

As everyone else woke up for the day, they gathered in the kitchen, various adults making breakfast. Vision and the boys would be taking the boat out to go fishing, Wanda decided that she, Nat, Jen, and Alice would go into town, and she suggested that Rio and Agatha remain at the house.

‚ÄúWhy, exactly, should we stay at the house?‚Äù Agatha asked, eyebrows high on her forehead.

‚ÄúSomeone needs to stay here in case something happens to us on the boat. Someone always stays back.‚Äù Vision piped up as he loaded a cooler. He knew his wife well and knew when she was meddling.

Agatha glanced over at him. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why you have someone going with you, we have a guy at the house, and what the actual Coast Guard is for.‚Äù

‚ÄúI would prefer to stay at the house, but you don‚Äôt have to stay with me. I have been told that I‚Äôm an adult.‚Äù Rio said, poking her tongue in her cheek absentmindedly as she leaned against the kitchen island, drinking her coffee.

Agatha almost immediately changed her mind, but she didn‚Äôt want to give Wanda the satisfaction. ‚ÄúI guess I can stay, but only because I don‚Äôt want to be on the pier on the last weekend of summer,‚Äù Agatha huffed and rolled her eyes, acting annoyed.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs settled then!‚Äù Wanda clapped her hands together. ‚ÄúEveryone disperse!‚Äù

Vision and the boys left shortly after, and the four women headed into Malibu. Rio and Agatha changed into swimwear. Then, Rio grabbed her beach bag, waving at Agatha as she went down to the private beach.

Agatha had a decision to make. Stay poolside or go down to the beach with Rio, and one sounded much more inviting than the other, which is how she found herself moments later sitting under the large beach umbrella where they had sat that first night at the party roughly a month ago.

Rio smiled as she turned a page of the book she was reading. ‚ÄúCareful, Agatha, Wanda might think her meddling is working.‚Äù

‚ÄúWanda needs to worry about her own shit. She won‚Äôt, but she needs to,‚Äù Agatha said as she situated herself and looked over at her companion for the day. They both had on sunglasses. Probably for the best. She smirked to herself. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôre you reading?‚Äù Agatha asked.

‚ÄúLesbian smut,‚Äù Rio responded, face deadpan, her eyes cutting to the side to see Agatha‚Äôs reaction.

Agatha sucked in a breath. ‚ÄúGood smut, I hope.‚Äù She replied, side-eyeing her friend as well. Fuck Harkness. FRIENDS. Stop trying to get in her bikini bottoms, s he thought to herself.



‚ÄúI know what I‚Äôll be doing later.‚Äù Rio teased. Fuck, Vidal. You‚Äôre just FRIENDS. Stop flirting. You know where this leads. Her inner alarm went off.



Thankfully, Agatha barely caught herself before making any slightly embarrassing sounds and quickly changed the subject. ‚ÄúSO, the first football game is coming up‚Ä¶‚Äù She said, face red.

Rio took the cue as they went back to safer territory. ‚ÄúYes, we‚Äôre working concessions together on Friday. Wanda‚Äôs doing, I‚Äôm sure. We‚Äôre working all the home games together.‚Äù She knew that was all Wanda and Lilia.

Agatha knew it, too.

‚ÄúShe means well,‚Äù Agatha replied. ‚ÄúShe wants to see me, and everyone around her, happy. She throws herself into her work, her kids, her friends, and the school. Anything and everything she can.‚Äù

‚ÄúEveryone except herself? She does realize that you, her best friend and sister, are gay and living your best life, right?‚Äù

‚ÄúAm I?‚Äù Agatha asked. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs still worried about how it would affect everything she‚Äôs built. Once I hit 16, I built my career on being America‚Äôs Lesbian Sweetheart. She was America‚Äôs Imported Straight Sweetheart. The girl-next-door, ‚Äù Agatha sighed . ‚ÄúNope. Not my story to tell, even though I was there . Wanda wants the best for me, and by extension, you.‚Äù

Rio smiled. ‚ÄúWell, so far, I have gained what feels like an entire family, and I don‚Äôt feel weird and starstruck around the two of you anymore. It does suck that Nat‚Äôs off-limits though. She‚Äôs hot.‚Äù She shot Agatha a devilish grin as Agatha rolled her eyes.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not off limits, but she refuses to date. Wanda would make sure we never found your body, though. ‚Äù

Rio nodded solemnly, ‚ÄúI believe it. ‚Äù

Agatha laughed. ‚ÄúThat woman is feisty, and we have had a lot of training over the years.‚Äù She looked out at the ocean and back at Rio. ‚ÄúGoing back to concession duty for football games. How do you feel about having to serve hot dogs?‚Äù She asked, already plotting something.

Rio wrinkled her nose. ‚ÄúEww. I‚Äôd rather not.‚Äù

Agatha jumped to her feet and shed her shorts and sunglasses. ‚ÄúThe last one waist-deep in the ocean, is on hot dog duty.‚Äù As she darted off.

‚ÄúNOT FAIR HARKNESS!‚Äù Rio shouted as she scrambled to her feet and chased after her, taking her shorts and glasses off as she ran.

Agatha hit the water first and turned around to watch Rio, feeling the refreshingly cold water hit her skin as she slowly walked backward to let the younger woman catch up a bit. Agatha could admit she had played dirty, but that‚Äôs how she liked it. ‚ÄúCome on, kid! You can do better than that!‚Äù She shouted over the waves, turning back around. She was only knee-deep, and Rio was catching up. The water was up to her thighs when Rio jumped on her back, and they both went down.

Agatha yelped as she hit her knees and got a mouthful of saltwater. Rio was still wrapped around her.

‚ÄúI AM VICTORIOUS!‚Äù Rio cried as Agatha spat out the ocean water.

Agatha leaned back laughing, dunking Rio in the ocean. Rio tightened her grip around her neck and took Agatha down with her as they both went under the water and rolled over. Rio finally unwrapped herself from Agatha, and they came back up, sputtering and laughing.

‚ÄúTechnically, I hit the water first. I win,‚Äù Agatha said, continuing to cough up water and laugh.

‚ÄúOnly because you cheated, bitch.‚Äù Rio responded, splashing water up at the other.

‚ÄúOh, is that how we‚Äôre playing this now?‚Äù Agatha teased as she splashed back.

The two women splashed and chased each other, reliving a childhood neither really had. They were closer to the shore when Agatha pounced on Rio. This time, it was Rio who yelped in surprise and went down. They rolled in the water for the second time, coming to a stop with Rio on top of Agatha. Rio was straddling her hips, hands on either side of her head.

‚ÄúTruce?‚Äù Rio asked, keeping her pinned down, grinning madly.

‚ÄúTruce!‚Äù Agatha laughed. The water was shallow enough that it wasn‚Äôt going over her face, but her hair floated a bit around her. ‚ÄúWe'll make whoever is working with us do hot dogs.‚Äù

‚ÄúPerfect,‚Äù Rio replied softly. It was then that Rio realized their positioning but didn‚Äôt immediately move. She studied Agatha‚Äôs face, and her gaze fell to her lips. This would be the perfect moment. Nope. Parent. Danger Will Robinson. Abort. Remove self. Rise. Move. She didn‚Äôt.

Agatha closed her mouth, still ajar in shock at her own declaration, and sat up, shaking her head to clear it. ‚ÄúYes, good idea. I also need to wash the sand and ocean out of my hair. Have to take care of it or Jen will kill me. ‚Äù

Rio held out her hand to help her up. ‚ÄúSo it‚Äôs true then, and not just made up? Your hair really is insured?‚Äù

‚ÄúAbsolutely.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the real amount? I‚Äôve seen everything from one million to one billion,‚Äù Rio inquired out of curiosity as Agatha took her hand and stood, the two immediately putting a few feet in between themselves.

‚ÄúTwenty million with various stipulations for maintenance, coloring, that kind of thing. I cut it on a whim without permission when I was sixteen, the smallest piece. Thankfully, it was 1989, and not everything was so monitored. I was due for maintenance anyway,‚Äù Agatha shrugged.

‚ÄúAnd the locket?‚Äù Rio asked. ‚ÄúI heard that was insured too, which makes sense, but wasn‚Äôt it just a random thrift store find?‚Äù Rio had read about it in a few interviews. Agatha always said it was something she had found while out with friends, and it was one of the bigger mysteries surrounding her persona. They walked back to their spot under the umbrella.

‚ÄúYes, but I‚Äôve grown attached. It now has a GPS chip on it, so I never lose it. It‚Äôs truly irreplaceable and priceless. Yes, it‚Äôs insured, though I don‚Äôt tell anyone how much.‚Äù Agatha didn‚Äôt currently have it on, it was in a safe within a safe, inside a wall safe in the house.

‚ÄúUnderstandable.‚Äù Rio nodded. She could tell from the tone of Agatha‚Äôs voice not to ask any more questions about it. She had seen it on Agatha on multiple occasions, and it was even more beautiful and detailed up close. Rio did not ask her what was in it, and no one knew.

Rio followed suit and looked in the fridge. ‚ÄúSpaghetti leftovers from last night, Your Highness.‚Äù She replied, taking out containers. ‚ÄúGrab plates, will you?‚Äù

Agatha feigned shock, placing her open hand in the middle of her chest. ‚ÄúPar-don?‚Äù She emphasized the word. ‚ÄúMoi? What if I break a nail?‚Äù She asked, dramatically.

Rio laughed and rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúOh, please, you keep your nails short for other activities, and you just spent the morning playing in the Pacific.‚Äù

Agatha smiled a genuine smile that reached her eyes. The smile that Rio had been seeing a lot lately, whenever they bantered like this. Agatha turned and got the plates.

Agatha couldn‚Äôt remember the last time something had come this easily to her, this back and forth, this closeness. Not since Wanda, and that had been more of a trauma bond, and immediately developed into a protective feeling. Even with the other women she was close to, it had taken her longer to develop this close of a relationship. There was her original coven, but that didn‚Äôt exist anymore.

The first night she and Rio had really talked, she had wanted to bare her soul to her. A little over a month, and they had already developed an easy back and forth. Yes, there was some flirting, but they would eventually tamp that down. Agatha was just naturally flirty, after all. It was harmless.

Long, dark brown, damp hair pulled back in a ponytail. Rio was already on the couch with her book. Her hair was pulled up, and her dark green tank top showed that her skin had darkened a bit in the sun. She wore black bike shorts that had some type of leaf pattern on them.
