‚ÄúHot. I miss sex.‚Äù Rio responded automatically. Drown yourself in the ocean, Vidal. She groaned inwardly.

Agatha chuckled. ‚ÄúSame.‚Äù Play in traffic, Harkness, she thought. ‚ÄúI can leave you alone to read if you prefer.‚Äù She added, face red.

Rio shook her head. ‚ÄúNo, I prefer your company." Do they make something for verbal diarrhea? ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs funny, as a teenager, growing up with Lorna Wu's daughter, I would have killed to be close friends with huge megastars. Now that I am, I forget you guys are even famous. You‚Äôre just normal people,‚Äù She looked up at Agatha, adding, ‚ÄúWith more money than God.‚Äù

Agatha couldn‚Äôt help but give a small laugh, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a downtime for us. There are times when there are paparazzi and cameras everywhere, names splashed all over the media, and then there are the quiet times like right now. I‚Äôm sure pictures will show up tomorrow of Wanda around Malibu, but nothing huge. Just ‚ÄòWanda Maximoff enjoying a weekend with friends‚Äô, hopefully. A few of the lesbian Twitter accounts will probably say something about Nat being there and not Vision. Jen will have it scrubbed. Then, a few of the accounts that are obsessed with Jen will say something about Jen and Alice, but that‚Äôs it. Someone will mention my absence, and we‚Äôll continue like normal. We both try to act as down-to-earth as possible because we are. We still have our diva moments and definitely did when we were younger, but we have an example to set.‚Äù She explained.

Rio took it all in. She chewed on her lip for a minute and took a deep breath before finally asking the question that had been on her mind for, years, now that she thought about it. ‚ÄúAgatha, why, exactly, don‚Äôt you date seriously?‚Äù

‚ÄúPass,‚Äù Agatha replied.

‚ÄúOh, come on. We‚Äôve shared a lot of things.‚Äù Rio huffed, trying to see past the neutral facade that Agatha was now wearing.

‚ÄúWhy won‚Äôt you date parents?‚Äù Agatha countered.

‚ÄúPoint taken.‚Äù Rio was about to ask Agatha about the faint scars she had noticed on her leg and back earlier when the front door opened and their friends walked in. Rio hadn‚Äôt realized that it was already evening, meaning the fishing group would be back soon as well.

The Malibu group had brought pizza, and the fishing group returned with nothing except sunburns and fish tales. They were around the fire again, talking and roasting marshmallows, when Wanda decided it was time to interfere.

‚ÄúAs we all know, our movie premieres mid-October,‚Äù Wanda said, silencing everyone, garnering a few looks. ‚ÄúAgatha, you should bring Rio.‚Äù She added, before taking a drink of whatever concoction she had.

All eyes turned to the two women who had previously been discussing musical interests. Rio choked on her water. Maybe she needed to just stop drinking anything around this group when they were speaking. Agatha glared at her best friend. If looks could kill, Wanda would have burst into flames.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs still two months‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha started.

‚ÄúSix weeks,‚Äù Nat clarified.

‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt that a school night?‚Äù Rio asked.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre on fall break then,‚Äù Alice informed her.

‚ÄúHow convenient,‚Äù Agatha and Rio muttered simultaneously.

‚ÄúThe twins and I can‚Äôt go see the movie. Our moms get naked,‚Äù Nicky supplied, matter-of-factly, as he popped a marshmallow in his mouth before either Rio or Agatha said anything.

‚ÄúMom is taking Dad,‚Äù the twins added as they each set a marshmallow on fire.

‚ÄúI prefer to stay out of the spotlight, but occasionally I am forced into it.‚Äù Vision‚Äôs expression was dour, a rarity for him. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm an introvert at heart,‚Äù he added quickly, his normal, easy smile returning.

‚ÄúWe need to go ahead and set it now to coordinate what you‚Äôre wearing,‚Äù Jen finished.

Wanda watched Agatha and Rio carefully. Wanda knew what every look, glance, twitch, and eye sparkle from Agatha meant. They could quite literally have entire conversations without saying a word.



She watched Agatha look at Rio, the question in her eyes. Do you want to come with me?

That was an easy one, surely Rio could catch that one, thought Wanda. She looked towards Rio, watching the young teacher tilt her head as if responding to Agatha's unspoken question. Both broke out in a subtle smile.



Wanda was delighted to see this silent exchange. It had taken Agatha and Wanda years to develop their connection. It had taken Agatha and Rio a month.

Soulmates!

She had called it. She couldn‚Äôt wait to send a text later..

‚ÄúI‚Äôd love to go. I think it will be fun to tag along as your plus one.‚Äù Rio finally said aloud.

‚ÄúGreat!‚Äù Said Wanda, ignoring the added comment. She turned to look at the boys, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs getting late. Go shower and head off to bed. We‚Äôre just going to talk shop for a bit.‚Äù

They groaned but knew she meant to just go inside and play video games or something. ‚ÄúYes, ma‚Äôam.‚Äù They replied. Vision took that as his cue as well. ‚ÄúI will make sure they don‚Äôt burn the house down, Darling. He kissed Wanda‚Äôs forehead and stood. The boys hugged their moms and aunts, said goodnight to the others, and went inside.

‚ÄúOkay, schedules for the next few months.‚Äù Wanda started.

Rio and Agatha exchanged looks before Rio turned to Wanda. ‚ÄúThis doesn‚Äôt involve Alice or me‚Ä¶‚Äù

Wanda cut her off, ‚ÄúYes, it does, stay.‚Äù

Rio remained where she sat and pulled out her phone, opening the Calendar app. She had a feeling it was about to fill up.

‚ÄúIn addition to school happenings, what else do we have, Jen?‚Äù Wanda started.

Jennifer cleared her throat. They had planned all of this out on their trip. Go over their schedules for the next few months and push Agatha into inviting Rio at least to the premiere, New York for SNL, and the Halloween party. That would at least get them to November. Maybe by then, they‚Äôd know each other well enough to at least kiss.

‚ÄúYou two have talk shows around LA, and a few NY appearances, especially the closer we get to October. Wanda, your SNL episode is at the end of September, and Nat will go with you. Agatha, yours is the weekend after the premiere.‚Äù

Rio looked at Agatha. ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs your musical guest?‚Äù Rio asked quickly.

Agatha smiled, mischief in her eyes. She already knew the reaction she was about to get. ‚ÄúChap‚Ä¶‚Äù She didn‚Äôt get to finish before Rio squealed. ‚ÄúWant to come?‚Äù She asked when Rio stopped. She shrieked a yes.

Jen nodded and put it down. Wanda smirked, she knew what that response was going to be.

‚ÄúThen there‚Äôs the annual Halloween party. Wanda, costumes?‚Äù Jen asked.

‚ÄúI think Billy is going with his ‚Äòfriend‚Äô Eddie Wilson, Sam Wilson‚Äôs son . Tommy and Nicky will probably go as zombies, right, Aggie?‚Äù Wanda asked, as Agatha nodded. That was their current thing.

‚ÄúVision and I are doing Glinda and Fiyero from Wicked.‚Äù Wanda finished.

Agatha snorted, laughing as Wanda gave her a sharp look. Agatha mumbled something about Rio saying something funny, and Rio nodded conspiratorially.

‚ÄúAlice and I are going as Xena and Gabby,‚Äù Jen said.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you need‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha started before a graham cracker connected with the side of her head. She turned to see Wanda looking around innocently. Instead, she muttered something about them making such a gay choice and picking graham cracker out of her hair.

Jennifer smirked and looked at Nat. ‚ÄúWhat about you? Are you and Agatha doing something? Agatha letting you borrow the Elphaba costume, perhaps? ‚Äù

Nat shook her head. ‚ÄúNo. I decided to be on duty that night and not dress up.‚Äù

Agatha automatically threw her hands up. ‚ÄúShe volunteered, I swear.‚Äù

Nat nodded. ‚ÄúI want to have eyes on all the camera screens in The Tower make sure all your drunk asses are safe,‚Äù she said with a smile that didn‚Äôt reach her eyes.

Jen nodded with a glance at Wanda, who was suddenly very interested in picking at her shorts. She looked back at Agatha. ‚ÄúAlright, Agatha?‚Äù

Agatha looked up and then over at Rio. ‚ÄúWant to go to the Halloween party and wear some ridiculous coordinated costume with me?‚Äù She asked, keeping her face neutral.

Rio nodded, stilling her face as well. ‚ÄúYes, want to do Wheel of Time?‚Äù It was a series they both loved that only they watched.

‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù Agatha replied. She thought about it for a second. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be Moirane‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio finished quickly, not wanting to be cast as the love interest, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be Lanfear.‚Äù

Agatha nodded, somewhat disappointed that Rio would go as her nemesis. For the best, though, she‚Äôll be hit on all night. She thought, but what did it matter to her?

Jen just nodded, inputting it all into her phone.

‚ÄúI shared the calendar with everyone. Just to make life easier. In reality, Jen knew it would put everyone‚Äôs mind at peace if they knew where everyone was. The collective amount of trauma, trust, and abandonment issues in this group was staggering.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

That night, Rio lay in the guest bed, unable to sleep. It was extremely comfortable, and her sleep playlist was on, but she just couldn‚Äôt get her mind to turn off. The conversation around the fire replayed in her mind. Everything had happened so fast. She knew she couldn‚Äôt talk to Alice about it right now, which also ruled out Jen. Wanda was stuck in her own personal ‚ÄòGood Luck, Babe‚Äô, and had orchestrated everything, most likely to distract herself . Nat was probably conversing with the security that Rio knew were crawling around the property, plus she would do whatever Wanda wanted. She sighed. The person Rio needed to talk to was the one she wanted to talk to the most.¬† She just had to trust herself and not throw herself at Agatha. There was just something about Agatha Harkness that she could get lost in.

Rio looked at her phone, one in the morning. ‚ÄúWorth a shot,‚Äù she breathed.

Me:

Hey, are you awake?

She waited to see if the three dots showed up. A few minutes went by, and nothing. Rio sighed, resigning herself to a sleepless night when her door opened and closed.

‚ÄúYes. I am.‚Äù A familiar voice said as the bed shifted.

‚ÄúVery presumptuous of you to just crawl into bed with me,‚Äù Rio said with a nervous smile.

‚ÄúPlease, we snuggle on the couch most movie nights,‚Äù Agatha responded, making herself comfortable.

She was right, and Rio didn‚Äôt mind. She felt like they had known each other for longer than they had, and Rio had grown accustomed to falling asleep near Agatha every Saturday night, which was four, but who was counting? ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt sleep.‚Äù She whined.

Agatha rolled her eyes, knowing Rio couldn‚Äôt see it in the dark. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all the smut you‚Äôve been reading.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt is not,‚Äù Rio sighed, ‚ÄúI keep thinking about what happened earlier and how you were kind of forced to invite me to everything. You don‚Äôt have to, you know.‚Äù Rio offered Agatha an out.

‚ÄúWhat if I want to? What if I don‚Äôt want to take someone else to a premiere? Or to New York? As a friend, of course. No one else will do Wheel of Time with me for Halloween, and you will have women all over you in whatever Lanfear costume we come up with.‚Äù Agatha replied sincerely. She could handle whatever happened at the Halloween party just fine. You‚Äôre lying to yourself. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be your wingwoman,‚Äù She added.

Rio smiled, her nerves dying down, knowing that Agatha hadn‚Äôt felt obligated. ‚ÄúOkay, as long as you didn‚Äôt feel forced.‚Äù She didn‚Äôt comment on the wing-woman remark. While Rio knew that was the better option, she also already knew it wasn‚Äôt what she really wanted.

‚ÄúPlease, kid, no one forces me to do anything.‚Äù Agatha scoffed. She was thankful for the darkness of the room, as she knew her eyes had drifted to Rio‚Äôs mouth. Just friends who had spent the past month of Saturday nights together. You have shared a bed with Wanda a million times. You aren‚Äôt attracted to Wanda, but it‚Äôs fine. You have slept on the same couch with this woman multiple times. You‚Äôve platonically cuddled. A bed is no different, Harkness. Get it together. She rolled over and created a bit more space between them.



Rio watched as Agatha rolled over, and she copied the movement, so that their backs were towards each other, with several feet in between them. This is a bad idea. This has to be a bad idea. She thought. The problem was that while she was hyperaware of the other woman in the bed with her, she already felt her eyelids getting heavier. Yes, the temptation was there, but so was the comfort and the ease of their relationship. She could easily fall asleep with Agatha Harkness every night. Preferably in more of a relationship context. Nicky graduates in two years. She sighed and froze when she realized how loud it had been.

‚ÄúEverything okay?‚Äù Agatha asked sleepily. She had still been battling with herself, but she was an actress for a reason.

How the fuck was she almost asleep? She thought. Though, her body was nodding off. ‚ÄúJust thinking.‚Äù Rio yawned, surprising herself.

‚ÄúI can go‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha started.

‚ÄúPlease don‚Äôt,‚Äù Rio said immediately. What the fuck? The woman is pure temptation. ‚ÄúI really am used to falling asleep near you on Saturdays. It‚Äôs what we‚Äôve done for a few weeks now.‚Äù She added.

Agatha nodded, ‚ÄúSo am I. It‚Äôs just a different environment. Who are you hoping to see at the movie premiere?‚Äù They were still turned away from each other, but naming off celebrities became like counting sheep, as they drifted off to sleep.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Sunday morning was a repeat of Saturday as Wanda and Nat sat at the table again after their run, drinking coffee close together with careful touches and native accents.

‚ÄúAgatha spent the night in Rio‚Äôs room.‚Äù Nat shared. She had been checking security footage, and a hallway camera had caught Agatha entering Rio‚Äôs room. There weren‚Äôt any cameras in private spaces, but with as many parties as they held here, they had been installed in all public spaces.

Wanda thought about it momentarily before responding, ‚ÄúNothing happened. If they had even kissed, she would have already told me.‚Äù She still smiled. Doesn‚Äôt date teachers, indeed. We‚Äôll see about that.

Nat knew Wanda was right. The two found sisters could practically read each other‚Äôs minds. It was why Agatha was the only other person who knew everything about Nat and Wanda, other than because she had been there right from the start. ‚ÄúThings are moving in the right direction for them if they‚Äôll let it continue.‚Äù

Wanda nodded as she blew out a breath, stood, and walked back into the house.

The Russian knew that there was no use in going after her, that Wanda was lost in her thoughts and needed a moment. Nat gathered both of their mugs and took them to the kitchen. The boys were staying at the house today, and she knew that while Wanda loved her family, she wasn‚Äôt happy about it.

Breakfast was the same as the day before. Everyone gathered in the kitchen, doing different things. It had been decided that everyone was spending the day at the house, out by the pool. Everyone changed into pool wear after eating and reconvened.

The boys goofed off and near heart attacks were had as Tommy and Nicky did flips into the pool, nearly hitting their heads multiple times.

Rio turned to Agatha, who had taken a chair next to her, ‚ÄúHow many ER trips have those two had?‚Äù She asked.

‚ÄúSurprisingly less than either of us thought they would. People know who we are regardless, however, when people know your security team and the nannies, you know it‚Äôs an issue.‚Äù Agatha recalled.

Rio blew air out of her nose. ‚ÄùThat was still less than you thought?‚Äù

‚ÄúBilly only had to go once or twice because he did something they told him to do,‚Äù Wanda said, as she pulled a chair up by their loungers. ‚ÄúThe other two, though. Stitches, broken bones, and a few false alarms. They‚Äôve calmed down a lot, but still, they think they‚Äôre invincible.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhich is why I have to do PR clean up for them too,‚Äù Jen added in, as she and Alice joined the group, Nat, behind them.

‚ÄúWhich is also why Vision is teaching them all to drive, he‚Äôs the safest and most patient of everyone,‚Äù Nat said as she sat in a chair beside Wanda.

As it was, Vision was having a discussion with Billy while yelling something about angles and rotations at Tommy and Nicky.

Agatha laughed, ‚ÄúHe tries, but those two are not applying physics to their recklessness right now.‚Äù Wanda nodded as she looked affectionately at Vision, and then over at Nat, who was in deep conversation with Alice and Jen.

Rio stood and sat on the edge of the pool with her legs in the water . Billy had gone off to take turns jumping in with the other boys. Vision stood next to Rio and started a conversation, and she took the opportunity to get to know more about him. He was an astrophysicist at UCLA and had met Wanda on a set when he was consulting. They had fallen in love and gotten married, according to him. Rio did see the love there and didn‚Äôt doubt that at all, though she still wondered about the full story.

Rio shared about her love of plants and all things science, loudly mentioning the upcoming quiz on Tuesday.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm giving a quiz on Tuesday, too.‚Äù Vision laughed. ‚ÄúEvil teachers unite.‚Äù

‚ÄúHere, here!‚Äù Alice said from where she sat, overhearing the conversation.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre all so mean!‚Äù Wanda shouted.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been studying for Alice and Rio‚Äôs classes while we‚Äôve been here,‚Äù Billy said, before jumping in the pool.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll probably fail,‚Äù Tommy said, shrugging.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just going to wing it, but I paid attention,‚Äù Nicky said before he pushed Tommy in.

Jen had snuck up behind Nicky, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre such a brat.‚Äù She said before pushing him in.

‚ÄúHey! That‚Äôs my son!‚Äù Agatha said, having snuck up behind Jen and pushing her in.

Rio couldn‚Äôt remember the last time she felt like this. Happy, surrounded by people she cared about. She stood up to get a drink when Agatha tried to push her in, too, but she grabbed on to her and pulled her in.

‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt you learn your lesson yesterday, Harkness? If I‚Äôm going down, so are you.‚Äù She laughed.

Wanda almost gave herself whiplash. ‚ÄúWhat happened yesterday?‚Äù

Rio just grinned. ‚ÄúOcean shenanigans.‚Äù

Jen sighed loudly, ‚ÄúKeep it out of the media.‚Äù

Nicky groaned. ‚ÄúMom.‚Äù

Agatha shook her head. ‚ÄúNothing happened, and you all need to get your minds out of the gutter .‚Äù

Nat bit her tongue, so tempted to add that someone slept in someone else‚Äôs bed last night.

The boys went in after lunch to play video games, and Vision joined them. He had been around this group to know they enjoyed their time together, and he did not enjoy the girl talk. He also had a book to read, essays to grade, football to watch, and his own friend to talk to while he did all of that.

April and Jen went upstairs, muttering about a nap while the other four women remained poolside.

Nat finally let her secret out . ‚ÄúSo, sleeping together now?‚Äù

‚ÄúFucking cameras.‚Äù Agatha scowled.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù Rio looked shocked.

Wanda suppressed a laugh.

Agatha turned her head to look at Rio. ‚ÄúThere are cameras in the public areas of the house since we have so many events here,‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúMs. Head of Security, here, must have been checking them.‚Äù She added, eyes darting over at Nat.

‚ÄúNothing happened. I couldn‚Äôt sleep because I felt like SOMEONE,‚Äù Rio cut her eyes at Wanda, ‚Äúhad pressured Agatha into inviting me to things, so I texted to see if she was awake. She came to my room instead of texting, we talked and fell asleep. That‚Äôs it.‚Äù she explained.

‚ÄúYou do not have to explain anything to these two busybodies. We are grown adults and friends. Close friends and nothing more.‚Äù Agatha glared at Wanda.

Wanda put her hands up in defense . ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt say a single thing. It was the other redheaded demon this time.‚Äù

Nat grinned wildly . ‚ÄúHey, I‚Äôm allowed to create trouble now and then. We‚Äôll see how long the two of you remain friends. I‚Äôm going to check cameras and do my job.‚Äù She said as she got up, eyes lingering on Wanda before she left.

Rio scoffed. ‚ÄúYou two aren‚Äôt very subtle.‚Äù

‚ÄúNeither are the two of you.‚Äù She shot back.

Rio bit her tongue before she said anything else. She didn‚Äôt have anything against Wanda and didn‚Äôt want to hurt her. She could tell that whatever the situation was, it was painful and tearing her apart. Instead, she reached over and put a hand on her shoulder.

‚ÄúIf you ever need to talk to someone other than Agatha, or if Agatha isn‚Äôt available, I‚Äôm here. I know a few things about extremely difficult situationships.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs voice was soft, and she gave her a meaningful look when she saw the tears Wanda was trying to hold back.

Wanda nodded. ‚ÄúThanks,‚Äù Wanda whispered, standing to leave . As she left, she gave Agatha a pointed look, bent over, and whispered, ‚ÄúI give you both until the new year.‚Äù

Agatha shook her head, earning a sigh from Wanda as her sister muttered something in Romanian and went inside.

Agatha turned to Rio. ‚ÄúWant to play a game?‚Äù

Rio raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúWhat kind of game?‚Äù

‚ÄúGet your ass in the pool and find out.‚Äù She replied as she got in herself.

Curious, Rio followed her. ‚ÄúOkay, what‚Äôs this game?‚Äù She asked as they were both treading water in the deep end.

‚Äú A little game of ‚Äòask me anything‚Äô. We‚Äôre going to race to the opposite side and back. Whoever wins gets to ask the other a question, and they have to answer it. The questions we refused to answer yesterday are off limits, and we can‚Äôt ask about‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio cut her off, knowing what she was about to say, ‚ÄúOther people‚Äôs stuff. I wouldn‚Äôt. Not our stories to tell.‚Äù

Agatha nodded. ‚ÄúRight. Up for it?‚Äù

Rio nodded. ‚Äú This is a trap, but prepare to bare your soul, Harkness!‚Äù She exclaimed as she set up to push herself off the wall.

‚ÄúWhatever, kid. Ready, set, go.‚Äù

They pushed off, both gliding underwater most of the way to the other side, they each got a few strokes in before flipping and pushing off the other side. Rio was only an inch taller than the older woman, so speed mattered. She touched the starting side right before Agatha did.

‚ÄúHa! I win!‚Äù

‚ÄúBarely!‚Äù Agatha shouted, but fine.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll start easy, favorite color?‚Äù Rio already knew it, but she didn‚Äôt want to start with soul-baring questions.

‚ÄúOh, come on. Purple, yours is green.‚Äù

Rio smiled. ‚ÄúOkay, then you can skip that one.‚Äù

Rio barely won the next round. ‚ÄúFavorite food?‚Äù

Agatha made an annoyed face. ‚ÄúRio. We each know that about each other, too. Yours is cereal, and mine is Italian, and anything you make.‚Äù

Rio smirked. She was just trying to annoy Agatha at the moment.

Agatha sighed, continuing, ‚ÄúWe know all the basics about each other. Our favorite movie? The Witches Road . Which you don‚Äôt think is conceited on my part, because it‚Äôs a fucking good movie. Our favorite TV show? Sisters . Yours to watch, mine for memories and milestones in my career. We both prefer the mountains and almost always have some type of background noise. My first pet was a rabbit named Se√±or Scratchy. Raven is yours. We‚Äôll be here forever if I start on music and books, so I think we can skip the easy questions and go a bit deeper.‚Äù

Agatha‚Äôs face was soft during her monologue, neither angry nor upset. She wanted, needed , Rio to understand that she had heard her and appreciated Rio, for Rio-as is.

‚ÄúWow, and we just met.‚Äù Rio joked, trying to lighten the moment, though the look in her eyes matched the seriousness in Agatha‚Äôs. ‚ÄúFine. What are those scars on your back and your leg? They‚Äôre very faint, so I‚Äôm sure you have them edited out of pictures and covered with makeup, especially the one on your leg.‚Äù

Agatha nodded, ‚ÄúGood job, detective. They‚Äôre souvenirs of when Nat tried to take me out that one time. Knife down the back, bullet grazed my leg. It was all very dramatic.‚Äù She would not be telling Rio about the other scar from that night.

Agatha reached forward and used her fingertip to gently close Rio‚Äôs mouth, which had come open from shock. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve lived an interesting life. Let‚Äôs go again, Vidal.‚Äù

This time, Agatha won. ‚ÄúAlright, let‚Äôs see. Most embarrassing high school moment.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh, that‚Äôs brutal and not fair because you didn‚Äôt go to high school!‚Äù

‚ÄúI also don‚Äôt have to answer.‚Äù She laughed.

Rio thought about it. ‚ÄúI had a crush on a girl and tried to let her cheat on my test in science class. Not only did I get caught, but our tests were different, so she would‚Äôve failed anyway.‚Äù She responded.

‚ÄúSmooth.‚Äù Agatha laughed.

‚ÄúI was absolutely not.‚Äù

Rio won the next round.

‚ÄúWorst person to work with?‚Äù

‚ÄúTony Stark. Completely full of himself. Pepper is great, love her. Tony is just all ego, even if he is a great dad and a decent husband. Don‚Äôt ever tell him I said those things .‚Äù Their rivalry was well known, though as an award-winning director, they did work together frequently.

Rio nodded. ‚ÄúI get that vibe. Morgan is a sweetheart of a kid, though. I took your recommendation and she‚Äôs cat-sitting for me this weekend. ‚Äù

Agatha smiled fondly at the mention of Morgan, ‚ÄúShe and Nicky have known each other since birth, really, but have been friends since pre-k. Again, great kid.‚Äù

Rio won again. ‚ÄúIf you hadn‚Äôt been forced into acting, what would you have wanted to do?‚Äù

Agatha bit her lip, deep in thought, and mulled over the question for a moment, putting one hand on her hip and lightly gripping the lip of the pool with the other, while treading water. She finally looked back at Rio, an eyebrow raised . ‚ÄúYou know, I have never thought about it. Hollywood has been my entire life. Even if I were to retire, I‚Äôm set and could just do charity work, some business, whatever I wanted. I never had that childhood ‚Äòwhen I grow up‚Äô dream.‚Äù

Agatha looked somewhat lost, and Rio felt for her. Neither of them had a traditional childhood.

‚ÄúI never had unrealistic career goals.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs fingertips barely gripped the edge of the pool. ‚Äú I never dreamed of being a rocket scientist or an astronaut. It was always a teacher, something that was practical and doable. Something that even someone from the neighborhoods I lived in could get a scholarship and do. I was good at science, and while there were other things I could do with that, teaching was the most achievable. Even though I grew up an unofficial Wu, it still made the most sense. Again, it's not glorious, absolutely not the best or easiest career choice, but not the worst. Solid. Achievable. Practical. ‚Äù Rio explained.

It was then that Rio realized that despite the age gap and the different worlds they were from, they were extremely similar, and it was why they got along so well and why they felt so seen by each other.

‚ÄúTell me you have trauma without telling me you have trauma.‚Äù Agatha smiled sarcastically. ‚ÄúOne more?‚Äù

Rio nodded, sensing some trick hidden under Agatha‚Äôs bikini strap, and she was right. As Rio closed in on her win, Agatha shoved her shoulder, pushed her back, and touched the wall before Rio could.

‚ÄúI win!‚Äù Agatha said, grinning.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre awful,‚Äù Rio said, splashing Agatha in the face.

‚ÄúYou love it.‚Äù She replied.

I could. She thought. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the question?‚Äù She asked instead.

‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt thought that far ahead.‚Äù Agatha thought for a moment. ‚ÄúDo you, or did you, ever want kids?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhy, Agatha Harkness, are you asking me to be your baby daddy?‚Äù she asked before breaking out into giggles. Rio Vidal did not giggle.

It was the sweetest sound Agatha had ever heard, and she vowed to make her do it again as much as she could. She couldn‚Äôt help but laugh, which caused her to snort. ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù She said, ‚ÄúIt was an honest question, you brat!‚Äù

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù She said after regaining some semblance of composure, ‚ÄúIf I were to be with or marry someone with a child or children, then yes. It was always a hard ‚Äúno‚Äù to that question growing up, due to my fears of falling in my mother‚Äôs footsteps . However, it depends on who I‚Äôm with and if that happens sooner rather than later. I‚Äôm not getting any younger. I‚Äôm not opposed. ‚Äù There was a time in the not-so-distant past when she thought she would become a stepmother to three blonde teenagers of whom she had been very fond, and possibly have a child. It was not something she wanted to dwell on right now as she pushed the old ache away.

Agatha wasn't entirely sure why that answer was so important to her, but she had found herself invested in Rio‚Äôs response . She had Nicky, and anyone close to her had to understand that he was number one in her life, even if he was older. She certainly wasn't having any more children, though the thought of being with a younger woman, or adopting, hadn‚Äôt completely been ruled out for her . Agatha saw a flash of something across Rio‚Äôs face with her answer, but didn‚Äôt want to pry. Something to unpack during a sleepless night, she thought.

They climbed out of the pool, went inside to shower, and changed to reconvene with the whole house.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The four women had been watching from an overlooking balcony. Wanda couldn‚Äôt have done much better if she had been in their minds herself. She knew Agatha and knew she wasn‚Äôt going to move faster than Rio was comfortable with.

‚ÄúWhy won‚Äôt they just kiss already!‚Äù Jen said, exasperated.

‚ÄúDo you know how long we said that about the two of you?‚Äù Nat asked.

‚ÄúTouch√©,‚Äù Alice said, raising her wine glass.

Wanda pinched the bridge of her nose. ‚ÄúThis is painful.‚Äù She sighed.

Nat looked over at her, knowing it wasn‚Äôt just the scene below them that she was referring to.

Jen leaned forward. ‚ÄúBetween the football games, the entire month of October, and whatever we need to do after that, they should figure it out.‚Äù

Alice shrugged. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know. Rio has a damn good reason as to why she doesn‚Äôt date parents.‚Äù As three sets of eyes looked at her, she shook her head, ‚ÄúOh no, not my story to tell. That‚Äôs all her.‚Äù

Wanda just nodded. ‚ÄúAgatha is many things, but if she really likes Rio, and I can guarantee she does, then she‚Äôs not going to do anything to go against that.‚Äù

They spent their last night around the poolside fire pit. Rio and Alice kept throwing out random questions for the boys to help them study. Tommy was trying, desperately.

‚ÄúRio, can you give me extra points because you‚Äôre into my aunt?‚Äù He teased.

Rio‚Äôs eyes went wide, and her face was one of shock, strictly from the audacity.

The looks on every face varied from shock to trying not to laugh. Agatha was biting back a laugh.

Nicky was not amused. ‚ÄúDude! That‚Äôs my mom!‚Äù He turned to Rio. ‚ÄúThat is my mom, though, so do I just get an automatic A, or‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúNicholas Scratch Harkness!‚Äù Agatha yelled, trying so hard not to laugh.

‚ÄúI am not into Agatha!‚Äù Rio cried, face bright red.

‚ÄúThe blushing says otherwise,‚Äù Alice goaded.

‚ÄúAunt Aggie has the hots for you, too,‚Äù Billy said, grinning.

‚ÄúYou are no longer my favorite!‚Äù Agatha shouted, her own face turning red.

Wanda owed the boys for this one. She had a shit-eating grin on her face and pointed at Agatha, who rolled her eyes at her.

Vision was laughing at the boys. ‚ÄúNow, boys, stop teasing. They‚Äôre just friends.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what Alice and Jen said for years,‚Äù Tommy replied.

Alice blushed. As Jen looked at Tommy. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it past your bedtime, rugrat?‚Äù

He stuck his tongue out at her. Wanda just nodded.

‚ÄúActually, boys, it is time for you three to head upstairs. Go.‚Äù She directed.

They nodded, gave their goodnights, and left, teasing as they went. Vision also made his departure, once again kissing Wanda on the forehead as he left.

Wanda looked pointedly at Rio,

‚ÄúWhat? Your son needs to study. He‚Äôs not getting extra points!‚Äù Rio replied.

‚ÄúIt was worth a shot.‚Äù Wanda laughed.

The women discussed upcoming football games and gossiped about which parents would be sneaking alcohol into the game, and what kids would be sneaking underneath the bleachers.

The night grew late, and everyone departed to their rooms, the beach weekend coming to a close.

Rio had changed into her pajamas, having showered after swimming earlier, when she heard her door open and close softly. She let out a breath she didn‚Äôt know she was holding as she turned around. She knew it was Agatha and found that she had hoped she would come.

Rio nodded as Agatha looked at her with the question in her eyes before settling into what was now her side of the bed.

‚ÄúNot a Saturday. So, when we‚Äôre in the same place overnight, we share a bed?‚Äù Rio asked.

‚ÄúLike friends,‚Äù Agatha stated, nodding.

‚ÄúAbsolutely,‚Äù Rio replied.

Even in their sleep, the two gravitated towards one another. The large California king mattress was no match for their attraction. ONLY FRIENDS, Rio reiterated to herself. Disentangling herself from Agatha's warm arms, which had wrapped around her in deep sleep. Still, it felt like the most normal thing in the world.

When they headed back the next day, she knew she had grown closer to everyone over the weekend, especially Agatha. She had to pull Jen and Alice apart, reminding them that they would see each other in less than twenty-four hours, and reminded the boys about their quizzes the next day.

If her friendship with Agatha was this strong after a month, where would it be by the time they went to New York?

Chapter End Notes

When will one of these women cave? WHEN?!

Soon, I hope.

The Best People In Life Are Free

Chapter Summary

Lilia gives some advice, High School football starts, and Rio and Nicky bond a bit.

Wanda finds herself at a major crossroads and turns to Rio.

Alexa - Play "Good Luck, Babe"

Chapter Notes

Grab some tissues kids and buckle up. I'm not sorry.
Here is the Wanda backstory you've all been waiting for.
Your regularly scheduled Agatha/Rio slow burn returns next chapter.

Updated 5/21/25

See the end of the chapter for more notes

üé∂

The rumors are terrible and cruel

But honey, most of them are true

New Romantics - Taylor Swift

üé∂

Early September

Rio never expected anything from her friends except for the ease of being around them. She never expected to be friends with superstars or get invited to movie premieres, Saturday Night Live, parties, or any of the things she was suddenly preparing to attend next month. It was overwhelming, but she felt like she was just doing things with her friends. Some of those things just happened to be red carpet and star-studded events, no big deal.

Before any of that, there was her actual job and the events and responsibilities that came with it. She had administered the first quiz of the semester the week after Labor Day and their amazing beach weekend. While most of her students had hit it out of the park , a select few had not, kicking off after-school tutoring and make-up testing . Rio‚Äôs Thursday tutoring session had just wrapped up, and she was about to leave herself when Lilia Calderu, principal of SHIELD, walked into the large science classroom and closed the door behind her.

‚ÄúVidal, have a seat, I need to speak with you for a moment,‚Äù the esteemed principal directed as she perched on top of a desk like it was the most natural thing in the world for her. ‚ÄúIt won‚Äôt take long,‚Äù she assured, noting the young teacher‚Äôs hesitation.

Rio nodded. ‚ÄúYes, ma‚Äôam. Let me text Alice and tell her it will be a minute.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù The older woman waited , looking around at the way Rio had set up the classroom, while Rio sent off the text and looked back up, meeting her boss‚Äôs eyes.

‚ÄúI know that you have joined a certain inner circle, and I must remind you that it is imperative to stick to NDAs and make certain you guard any secrets that may be shared with you by certain parents ,‚Äù Lilia said seriously.

Rio nodded. ‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù

Lilia regarded her for a moment. Lilia read people and she did it well. She wouldn‚Äôt be the woman she was or in the positions she was in if she didn‚Äôt. She had trusted Alice last spring and could tell that Rio was someone who was honest and genuine. Lilia Calderu also had her sources.

Lilia had a sworn duty to protect the people around her, and that included the secrets that those people held.

Lilia‚Äôs face softened, having found that Rio was worthy. ‚ÄúYou can trust Agatha, you know. It was I that made her bring Nicky here, connected the two of them to this place. Made sure she had the lawyer she had as a child. You do not know any of this, by the way,‚Äù She paused to make sure the teacher understood what she was conveying. Seeing Rio nod, she continued ,¬† ‚ÄúWhen you run a specific institution, you know a lot of things about a lot of people. You would do well to remember that. ‚Äù Lilia stood and looked back at a large planter in the corner of the room. ‚ÄúPilea Peperomiodes, not an easy plant to grow inside Ms. Vidal. I‚Äôve only known one other person to successfully do so, and yours is quite possibly healthier than hers. That‚Äôs quite the green thumb.‚Äù She turned back to her. ‚ÄúOh! And, parents like you so far, keep it up! Looking forward to the game tomorrow! Go Superstars!‚Äù She finished and left before Rio could reply, leaving the door open as Alice walked in.

‚ÄúYou ready to go?‚Äù Alice asked. ‚ÄúI knew Lilia wouldn‚Äôt stay very long.‚Äù

‚ÄúI never know what the fuck Lilia means. It takes me a good two business weeks to figure it out.‚Äù Rio continued to stare out the door.

Alice nodded. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a decade and I‚Äôm still learning.‚Äù

Rio tilted her head as she slung her backpack over her shoulder, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve been here for a while and know everyone well, was Lilia the reason Agatha brought Nicky here?‚Äù Rio asked as she turned off the lights and they walked out of the door.

Alice made sure she chose her words carefully. She wasn‚Äôt prepared to share everything with Rio yet. It wasn‚Äôt lying, really. She was just telling her half-truths. ‚ÄúLilia was one of Agatha‚Äôs tutors when she was young, and so when Nicky was old enough to go to school, she found out Lilia was the principal, and she trusted Lilia, so yeah.‚Äù

Okay, that‚Äôs close to the truth. Alice thought.

As they drove home, Rio couldn‚Äôt help but think about how normal everything felt so far. Football games, her best friend dating someone that seemed perfect for her , concerned parents, parents, and teachers still volunteering to help out at the concession stand. So there were bodyguards and heightened security everywhere, state-of-the-art facilities, a sniper‚Äôs nest at a high school football game‚Ä¶it wasn‚Äôt completely normal, but it was done in a way that it was very concealed.

‚ÄúOther than the football game, what are your plans for the weekend?‚Äù Rio asked.



‚ÄúJen and I are going out Saturday night,‚Äù they were actually having dinner with Lilia, but Rio didn‚Äôt need to know that. ‚Äú So we‚Äôll miss movie night, nothing Sunday, you?‚Äù Alice looked over at her.

‚ÄúMovie night Saturday, and it looks like everyone except you and I are headed out Sunday for promo events in New York for a few days, then they‚Äôll be back here.‚Äù

Alice shrugged. ‚ÄúGet used to a lot of texting.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what you mean. Just a normal amount of texting a friend of mine is all,‚Äù Rio shrugged back, slightly mockingly.

Alice rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve taken bets on how long it takes. Do you want in?‚Äù

‚ÄúSure, put me down for fuck you guys.‚Äù Rio groaned.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs only a matter of time. You‚Äôve already shared a bed.‚Äù Alice grinned.

‚ÄúI was spilling my very complicated feelings to you and you‚Äôre using that against me right now! I am hurt!‚Äù Rio joked, knowing that Alice didn‚Äôt mean any true harm.

‚ÄúI am your sister from an unknown mister, and it is my duty.‚Äù

After her usual bedtime routine, switching her playlist, and getting comfortable with Raven purring next to her, Rio grabbed her phone to text Agatha, as had also become routine.

Me:

The meddling bitches have

started a betting pool for

when we get together.

is in on this damn thing too.

fucking Danvers‚Ä¶

Agatha was holding on to the fact that she didn‚Äôt date Nicky‚Äôs teachers, or anyone, for that matter. She had her heart utterly annihilated once and would not go down that road again. She also didn‚Äôt want to lose Rio‚Äôs friendship if things went poorly. Lines were being blurred, but they could handle that like the grown adults they were.



Agatha üíú

Did you?

Me:

Apparently ‚Äòfuck you guys‚Äô wasn‚Äôt

an option.

If the last time Rio had dated a parent had ended terribly, this was bound to end even worse, and that was definitely not an option. The only way this could end worse , she thought to herself, is if you actually died this time. Okay, so not worse, but losing Agatha‚Äôs friendship would break her in a much different way.

going to sleep. See you tomorrow!

Goodnight Rio.

Agatha found herself almost adding kissing emojis like a teenage girl. She groaned. This was not normal for her. Agatha Harkness did not pine. She did not yearn. Women came to her. Women threw themselves at her. What was happening? She was fifty-one years old, damnit, not fifteen. She screamed into her pillow before rolling over and trying to go to sleep, only to dream of Rio.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Of course, a school for the children of Hollywood stars would have ‚Äòsuperstars‚Äô as its mascot. Rio had rolled her eyes when she had first heard it and still thought it was too on the nose even now. She thought cougars would have been appropriate and funny, but she hadn‚Äôt been in charge of choosing the mascot.

Rio looked around the gym as students gathered for the pep rally. As she mentally went over the students‚Äô names, she was reminded that it wasn‚Äôt just the Hollywood elite that sent their children to SHIELD, it was athletes, CEOs, billionaires, tech bros, politicians, and people up in that range.

She stood with the other teachers and cheered as the football players came out, cheering for Nicky. She waved to Billy in the stands and cheered for other students. Rio had always enjoyed supporting students for all activities, not just sports. Football days were also fun days for most or make-up days for students to bring up grades. She enjoyed it, and the chance to get to know her students better.

By the time the last bell rang, she was anxious for the football game. She didn‚Äôt care if they won or not. She was just ready to see a certain megastar. She told herself it was because they had gotten so close, and she would be excited to see Alice and the others as well. She was lying to herself, but it made her feel more like an adult and less like one of her students with a fleeting crush of the week.

Even if there was nothing fleeting about this.

By the time she got to the concession stand to report for her shift, she was vibrating with excitement. She knew they were also working with several other parents, including Carol Danvers. She and her wife, Maria, had a daughter Nicky‚Äôs age who was in Rio‚Äôs advanced class. Carol was another award-winning actress, and Maria was a literal rocket scientist.

Rio walked into the building to see Agatha setting up with other parents and teachers. Agatha smiled when she saw her, excusing herself and making her way to Rio.

‚ÄúHey! You‚Äôve got popcorn, I‚Äôve got candy.‚Äù She said as she hugged Rio in greeting , a hug that was over too quickly for Rio‚Äôs liking.

Rio was slightly surprised by the friendly greeting in such a public place, cut considering people were taking bets on them getting together, and they had shared a bed, she‚Äôd take it.

‚ÄúThey just happen to be right next to each other,‚Äù Danvers said as she walked over to the hot dogs with a smirk .

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre on hot dog duty?‚Äù Rio asked innocently.

‚ÄúYes, which works for me.‚Äù Danvers shrugged with a wink.

Agatha leaned over and whispered, ‚ÄúToday‚Äôs was Danvers‚Äô pick in the betting pool, and thought I‚Äôd like to be next to you.‚Äù

Rio stifled a laugh, remembering their ocean battle from last weekend and the bet they had made.

‚ÄúNicky going to lead us to state this year, Agatha?‚Äù Another parent asked, interrupting their conspiring.

Rio watched as Agatha turned into Agatha Harkness, football mom, superstar, and America‚Äôs Sweetheart. ‚ÄúHopefully! As long as your son can protect him long enough.‚Äù There was laughter before someone opened the windows to the stand, and their work began.

Shifts were only a quarter, and thankfully, the time went by quickly. Working in such a confined space, Rio and Agatha had bumped into each other constantly, mostly by accident, but neither woman minded. When their time was up, the next shift took over, and as they left the building, Agatha grabbed Rio by the arm and led her away before she could get caught up in any conversations with parents who wanted to know how their student was doing in her class.

‚ÄúHey! Mrs. Chavez needs to speak with me .‚Äù Rio laughed as Agatha pulled her away .

Agatha shook her head. ‚Äú I can assure you that she is not interested in the science you teach, and we have a game to catch and a quarterback to cheer for. ‚Äù

‚Äú Oh, right! Nicky. I haven‚Äôt seen him play yet. ‚Äù

They reached their group in the stands. Tommy was on the junior varsity team and wasn‚Äôt playing as their game had been the previous night. He was still paying very close attention to the plays and all the action on the field below.

‚Äú How‚Äôs he doing ?‚Äù Agatha asked as they scooted into the bleachers .

‚ÄúOne passing touchdown so far, and twenty yards from second. Tied game. Defenses are doing well and stopping everything on both sides .‚Äù Tommy rattled.

Agatha looked out at the field where Nicky was lining up. They were at the 20-yard line a pass he should easily be able to convert for a touchdown . He saw Agatha right before the snap, and that was the good luck he needed. Nicky couldn‚Äôt find an open receiver, scrambled, and ran it in for a touchdown . The stands erupted.

His ability to think quickly on his feet was what had secured him the starting quarterback position the previous year.

The game had been close , and the Superstars barely won 28-27. Nicky, a perfectionist like his mother, knew he needed to improve and discussed strategies with Vision and Tommy after the game.

‚ÄúI know there are a lot of great high schools around here, Nicky, but have you thought of watching tapes from schools in other great football states? To get plays and tips from those?‚Äù Rio asked as they all walked to the parking lot.

He shook his head, droplets of water from his quick shower flying off. ‚ÄúNo. I hadn‚Äôt thought about that.‚Äù

Rio smiled at him. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll text Rogers and give him some names of schools. I have a friend who coached basketball, and she did that, helped the team a lot.‚Äù

‚ÄúThanks Rio! So you like football?‚Äù

Rio and Nicky continued their conversation back to the vehicles and at their after-game victory dinner. A tradition Agatha had started with Nicky.

Wanda leaned over and whispered into Agatha‚Äôs ear. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre already bonding.‚Äù

Agatha nodded. ‚ÄúYes, like you do with your friend‚Äôs kids.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a little more‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúShut up and eat your fries before I steal them.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

September continued, filled with football games for two out of the three boys, and Billy started rehearsals for the fall musical. The coven continued with their movie nights, and everyone had work, whether it was celebrity or teaching-related.

Rio and Agatha continued to build a closer rapport, Alice and Jen were disgustingly adorable, and something was happening in the Maximoff household. Wanda was growing more and more restless, and it was affecting Nat.

As the month crawled along Agatha started table reads for her new TV show, as well as costume fittings, and promotional events were picking up for both stars. It was a Thursday evening later in the month as Wanda sat in the living room helping Billy run lines for his role in the fall musical. They were doing Beetlejuice, and he was the lead. Vision was on the floor at the coffee table, helping Tommy with his math. Tommy was failing and hadn‚Äôt been able to play in the junior varsity game that night. Coach Rogers wouldn‚Äôt even let him sit on the bench until he passed, and he was surly about it, but trying his hardest to truly understand the material. Nicky was listening to music on the opposite couch, typing a history essay for Alice‚Äôs class. He was staying over while Agatha was in New York for a few days. Wanda smiled as she surveyed the scene of happiness before her, then looked over at Nat, the beautiful redhead she had‚Ä¶ until reality hit her, as it always did. Nat‚Äôs face quickly dissipated into Vision‚Äôs, her husband. The man that she had married when she was twenty-six and had been married to for almost twenty years, and would be with for so much longer‚Ä¶

‚ÄúMom? Mom?‚Äù Billy‚Äôs voice cut through her thoughts.

She startled and looked at him, ‚ÄúOh, sweetie, I‚Äôm sorry. I just thought of something. Give me a quick minute.‚Äù She got up, grabbed her phone, and tried to walk as normally as possible to her bedroom.

‚ÄúOkay, Wanda, hold it together.‚Äù She whispered to herself, voice shaking. She did her breathing exercises to calm herself down so she could get through her mom and wife duties for another hour. Think. Agatha and Nat were in New York, so that was out. She couldn‚Äôt talk to Jen, who would just go into PR mode instead of friend mode, which also ruled out Alice since they were attached at the hip. Wanda opened her texts without thinking. Me:

Wanda smiled before blowing out a breath. She just needed to get through the evening, and then she‚Äôd drive over to Rio‚Äôs and just let everything out. She returned to the living room, resuming her position next to Billy.

‚ÄúYes, though, is it okay if I head to Rio‚Äôs in a bit? She‚Äôs having a bit of an emergency.‚Äù She replied in her best concerned friend voice.

Billy raised an eyebrow as Tommy smirked. Nicky, thankfully, couldn‚Äôt hear due to his headphones.

Vision ignored his sons, seeing through his wife‚Äôs white lie. ‚ÄúOf course, dear. I can take over running lines with Billy if you want to leave now,‚Äù he offered. Vision had noticed changes in Wanda‚Äôs behavior over the last few months. It put him on edge. He didn‚Äôt know what could be brewing next.

Billy‚Äôs head popped up as he gave his mom a pleading look. His dad was not good at acting.

Wanda just smiled. ‚ÄúNo, it can wait. Boys first.‚Äù

This was one of the reasons she had fallen in love with Vision, and she really had loved him. She still did, but it wasn‚Äôt a romantic love anymore if it ever had been in the first place . He was sweet and selfless, always putting his family first. He hadn‚Äôt had to think before offering to take over for her.

Forty-five minutes later, homework was finished. Wanda gave Vision a quick peck on the cheek goodbye, said goodnight to the boys, grabbed two bottles of wine, and headed to Rio‚Äôs. She was going to drive herself, but Vision had insisted on having someone drive her since she had planned on drinking. Not her having a caring and thoughtful husband while she weighed her options of leaving him.



Rio had been on edge since she got the text from Wanda. What could possibly be going on that she was coming to her for? She could only think of one topic that Wanda would come to her for right now, and not Jen or Alice, and that was a certain Russian. Agatha‚Äôs ‚Äòwait for her to come to you‚Äô when she had asked had apparently been more prophetic than anything.

Knowing they‚Äôd be up late, she was already in PJs and mostly ready for bed, her work bag ready for tomorrow and next to the door. She had chilled wine glasses and random snacks out, an appropriate playlist on, and a fresh box of tissues ready to go. She was ready to be a supportive friend.

She had been here before, normally one door down at Alice‚Äôs, and now about to share parts of the last twenty-seven years of her life, of which only a few other people knew every part. She clutched the tote bag that held the wine bottles and knocked, knowing that if Agatha was going to eventually be with Rio, then Wanda had to tell her at some point. Might as well be now.

Rio opened the door and let Wanda in. She closed the door and had barely turned around when Wanda broke into a sob and melted against her. Rio suspected it was bad if that‚Äôs all it took. She wrapped her arms around Wanda, and they stood there for a moment.

‚ÄúHey, it‚Äôs okay. We‚Äôre going to talk through it. You don‚Äôt have to keep it in, you can talk to me, okay?‚Äù She soothed. She knew how it felt to have your best friend sister in another city and no one to talk to. It‚Äôs how she had felt for the past few years.

As Wanda‚Äôs initial sobs died away, she stepped back, wiping her eyes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôve just been holding that back for longer than I thought,‚Äù she said with a watery laugh.

Rio‚Äôs eyes were soft as she gave a small smile. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine, I‚Äôve got Kleenex and everything ready to go, come on. Tell me everything.‚Äù She gestured to the living room.

They settled in on the couch, turning to face each other. Rio opened the wine and poured them both a full glass. She felt they were going to go through both bottles rather quickly. Raven had already found a home on Wanda‚Äôs lap, for which Wanda looked grateful. She needed to do something with both hands. Petting a cat with one hand and holding a wine glass in the other worked.

Wanda took a sip of her wine and looked at Rio, trying to decipher how to start the conversation, and she wasn‚Äôt sure how. She looked at Rio with big green eyes, ‚ÄúI don't know where to start‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio looked back at Wanda, raising an eyebrow. ‚ÄúWherever you feel comfortable. Agatha hasn‚Äôt told me much of anything, really. She would never betray your trust, so everything I‚Äôm about to say is what I have picked up over the past nearly two months.‚Äù Rio took a sip of her wine as Wanda nodded.

‚ÄúWhat I know is that you and Nat met when you were both 18. She was hired to kill Agatha, and from what I saw when Nat told me that story, she was not planning on you being there, or just you in general. Agatha struck a deal with her, and she joined the merry band of misfits. You married Vision, I assume, because you decided it was easier to fit into the mold created for you , and now you‚Äôre realizing that it wasn‚Äôt necessarily a mistake, but it‚Äôs not the life you wanted

‚ÄúYou and Nat are obviously in love, and you both have been doing a terrible job at hiding it around us, or at all, lately. I don‚Äôt know how deep it goes, I don‚Äôt know the whole backstory, but that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve gathered.‚Äù Rio finished her summary, watching for Wanda‚Äôs reaction.

Wanda sighed heavily, finishing her wine and pouring another. ‚ÄúYou aren‚Äôt wrong. That‚Äôs an oversimplification, but you aren‚Äôt wrong.‚Äù

Rio watched Wanda pour her second glass and realized just how much of a toll this had taken. Yes, Wanda drank, they all did, but usually not this quickly. ‚ÄúYou can share as much or as little as you want. There is no judgment here, Wanda. I am here for support, and insight if you want it, friendship, and the occasional snide remark.‚Äù She said sincerely. These women meant so much to Rio, and she truly wanted to be someone they could come to about anything and everything. She also wanted every single one of them to be happy and live their best life.

Wanda was quiet for a moment, still trying to decide where to begin, before taking a deep breath and letting it out. ‚ÄúNat once told me that she saw me and knew she couldn‚Äôt kill someone that immediately took her breath away, and that‚Äôs the only reason we got the upper hand.‚Äù She laughed. ‚ÄúHow‚Äôs that for a line?‚Äù

‚ÄúMan, oldest line in the assassin handbook, I‚Äôm sure,‚Äù Rio interjected, refilling her now-empty glass. She silently reminded herself that she had to work tomorrow and needed to slow down. She did not have to keep up with the Eastern European who could probably drink two bottles of wine and act out one of her earlier movies from memory.



Wanda laughed, ‚ÄúI was eighteen and Agatha was...twenty-four? When Nat tried to murder her that night. Good thing I looked cute. Agatha wanted to keep it out of the media, so she pulled some legal strings and found out who had sent Nat.‚Äù Wanda stopped, waiting for Rio to put a few pieces together.

Rio turned her head slightly. ‚ÄúWhat year was that?‚Äù

‚ÄúNinety-Seven.‚Äù

Rio remembered dates and years, especially major headlines, even if she had only been eight that year. Her eyes widened. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt that the year Agatha‚Äôs mom died in prison?‚Äù She asked cautiously.

Wanda shrugged. ‚ÄúThe Russians really hate it when you promise them something you can‚Äôt give them, and they lose one of their best assassins. They also love legal favors.‚Äù

Rio knocked back her wine and poured them a third glass, emptying the bottle. ‚ÄúFuck, that‚Äôs information I didn‚Äôt need . I‚Äôm going to pretend I didn‚Äôt hear that.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I do, with a lot of things .‚Äù Wanda continued. ‚ÄúAnyway, we were our little trio, Agatha sleeping with every woman with a pulse. I was, somewhat interested in guys, but not very. She was my best friend, but more than that, and Nat? She dated other women during those two years.

‚Äú One night in 1999, I found myself asking Agatha Harkness, this lesbian icon and bad boy, how to know if I was into women and, subsequently, if they were into me. That lovable bitch straight-up laughed at me. I was twenty, still so innocent, and extremely vulnerable, and the bitch laughed at me.‚Äù Wanda laughed at the memory.

‚ÄúShe didn‚Äôt say kiss, but yes!‚Äù Wanda exclaimed brightly, her native accent was starting to bleed through because of the alcohol. ‚ÄúYou know her so well. Anyway, so I did. I went directly to her room. We were all living together in the original house up on the hill. Her bedroom was right next to mine, and much like you and Agatha, we had already been lying to ourselves.‚Äù Wanda gave Rio a knowing look while Rio downed her wine, throwing caution to the wind, and uncorked the second bottle.

Rio raised an eyebrow in question to Wanda, and she nodded, a silent agreement to ditch the glasses. Tomorrow was Friday, she could teach with a hangover if she had to.

Wanda continued with the story. ‚ÄúI crawled into bed with her, something I had done hundreds of times before. It wasn‚Äôt unusual for us to cuddle, finding comfort in each other. She gave Rio another pointed look, causing Rio to roll her eyes, huff, and take a drink from the bottle . ‚ÄúAnd I cupped her face and kissed her.‚Äù Wanda finished her glass and set it down.

Wanda took a drink before responding. ‚ÄúShe kissed me back, and then I cried. I was so afraid to come out. I wasn‚Äôt as established as Agatha, I was already seen as this wholesome girl-next-door, date-the-boy type of star. I didn‚Äôt know what to do. We agreed to just keep it a secret and see what happened.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou were already in love,‚Äù Rio stated, trying to remain serious, though her words were beginning to slur. How strong was this wine?

Wanda nodded as a tear fell down her cheek. She wiped it away and continued. ‚ÄúWe kept it hidden for years, Agatha kept telling me there was room in the world for more than one lesbian superstar, but I wouldn‚Äôt listen. I wanted kids, I wanted to live an open life, and so did Natasha. Anytime I brought up coming out, our PR shut it down. That was way before Jen. There were so many arguments and fights. We were madly in love, but I couldn‚Äôt hurt my career. It was all I had , or so I thought . I kept having these bearded and PR relationships, though I didn‚Äôt need them. After the last one, I had decided I was done, I couldn‚Äôt do it anymore.‚Äù She took the bottle back from Rio, accent coming out even more . ‚ÄúWe might need more alcohol. Shit‚Äôs about to get fucking shittastic.‚Äù

‚ÄúOn it. Eat a snack.‚Äù Rio gestured towards the table in front of them as she gathered the empty bottles and glasses, left the half bottle, and went to the kitchen. ‚ÄúHow old were you at this point?‚Äù Rio called, words slurring, as she looked in the refrigerator, chose two ciders, and fixed two large tumblers of ice water with electrolyte packets .

‚ÄúTwenty-free, I mean, three.‚Äù She called back, giggling at her misspeak, opened a bag of popcorn, and grabbed a handful.

Rio laughed while she opened the wine and came back to the couch, resuming her position. She had done the math and looked at Wanda, understanding why she had been sent to get more alcohol even though they had half a bottle left .

Wanda nodded as she took another drink. ‚ÄúI met Vision. He was consulting on a movie, and for the first time, I actually felt something deep for a man, or so I thought . Color me startled.‚Äù

‚ÄúScarlet, I think.‚Äù Wanda resituated her legs before continuing. ‚ÄúNat and I had kept things so under wraps, Vis had no idea I liked women. He was so sweet and caring. Leave it to me to fall for the two most amazing, understanding, selfless people in the world at the same damn time.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat did you tell Aga‚Ä¶Nat?‚Äù Rio‚Äôs sapphics were running together with her increased blood alcohol content.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt have to. She came to me. She wasn‚Äôt mad, she wasn‚Äôt jealous. She just took me in her arms and asked me what I wanted. I was falling in love with someone else, again, or so I thought at the time, and the woman I also loved, who was madly in love with me, asked me what I wanted. She asked me what would make me happy. I was twenty-four, I didn‚Äôt know, and I told her that.

‚ÄúI told her that I was in love with both of them, but that wasn‚Äôt fair to either of them. That beautiful woman looked at me and said that she would always be with me, even if it wasn‚Äôt the way that she wanted to be. That she would always be mine, even if I wasn‚Äôt completely hers. ‚ÄúWhat did Vision say?‚Äù Rio asked, a tissue in her hand as well. The second bottle was now gone, and they had moved on to their ciders, an unspoken agreement that they were done after that. They were slurring words, and Rio was proud she could understand Wanda through her now heavy accent, and tears were flowing from both.

‚ÄúThat he understood. Can you believe that asshole ? So I went to Agatha. She knew everything, of course , she had been the support for Nat and me both, but never caught in the middle. She, of course, had her own brand of dry humor, and we listened to a lot of Melissa Etheridge and Indigo Girls. She told me that I had to do what I felt was right for me and what I could live with. I had to decide if I could live with potentially losing my fans. She had built her career on being gay. I hadn‚Äôt. However, fuck the people I lost because my happiness was worth everything.‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs eyes were watery.

Rio knew what happened next. She remembered the grainy pictures. She and Alice had been teenagers and were shocked when they saw the headlines in their favorite tabloids of the time.

‚ÄúThen the pictures broke,‚Äù Rio said softly.

‚ÄúI was twenty-four? Twenty-five? Vis and I were officially dating. Nat remained on security, of course, when that grainy picture of Nat and I making out at a concert was splashed everywhere.‚Äù Wanda sighed.

‚ÄúYour engagement was announced soon after,‚Äù Rio whispered, remembering.

Wanda nodded. ‚ÄúPR‚Äôs idea. Vis said we could call the whole idea off. He wasn‚Äôt even mad. Nat and I were still dating, we just kept it a secret like we had been. It was a moment of weakness, we were at The Killers concert and got caught up in the moment. Nat and I always do at concerts, music is important to us. However, studios had already started calling with questions, worried about their bottom line and how this would affect it and current projects. It was a nightmare. ‚ÄúHow did Nat take it?‚Äù Rio couldn‚Äôt imagine watching the person she was in love with marry someone else.

‚ÄúHard. She understood, but she hated it. She stayed by my side though, always mine, never hers.‚Äù Wanda swallowed a sob. ‚ÄúSo we went through the first few years. She would have been such a great mother.‚Äù Wanda knew that Nat couldn‚Äôt have children, not something she would be telling Rio. ‚ÄúAs it was, Vis knew the role Nat played . He always knew, it‚Äôs like they had some unspoken agreement. I had three people doting on me while I was pregnant. As I‚Äôm sure you can guess, Agatha was the third .‚Äù Wanda smiled at the memories, a small mountain of crumbled tissues in her lap.

‚ÄúNatasha Romanov is a great father, I mean mother,‚Äù Rio told her. ‚ÄúThose boys have three moms and a dad, and they, and all adults, know it. She would move planets for those boys, you, and even for Vision if she thought it would make you happy.‚Äù

Wanda gave a watery smile. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right, and she has. She also refuses to date anyone else , no matter how much I tell her to.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou would hate it if she did.‚Äù They were well past drinking now, trying to sober up a little, still slurring words here and there.

Wanda nodded. ‚ÄúIt would kill me. Just as I know it kills her to see me live the life we dreamed of, but with someone else .‚Äù She took another breath. ‚ÄúAround the time the boys turned one, and I‚Äôd been married for six years, I started to get restless .‚Äù Wanda saw the look on Rio‚Äôs face. ‚ÄúI know, it‚Äôs been thirteen years since then, yes. Vis knows how I feel , but he‚Äôs never said anything. He gives me my girl time and my Nat time . He‚Äôs an amazing husband and father.

‚Äú We have an agreement. Kisses, chaste touches. I think Vis would be okay if Nat and I were fully together, but that‚Äôs not fair to him, and I can‚Äôt be dishonest. I can‚Äôt break our vows. They mean something to me. I also can‚Äôt risk that leaking. I‚Äôm walking a tight line as it is.

‚ÄúHe deserves to be happy. I‚Äôm just so afraid of hurting the boys, and at this point, I‚Äôve sacrificed so much for this life, for my career. I hurt two people that I love, albeit in different ways, and I don‚Äôt want to do it again.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to hurt him, and at the same time, I‚Äôm not in love with him anymore, if I ever really was . I am still madly in love with her, just as much as I was when we were 20. I‚Äôve been in love with her for 25 years, Rio, and all I have to show for that is a few years where we were truly together, and decades of stolen moments. I want her. I want her to be the one doing homework time with me, her to be the one helping me in the kitchen, walking red carpets, and hugging me when I win awards. I want to stand up at that podium holding an Oscar and say ‚Äòthank you to my wife for always believing in me‚Äô, not just knowing I mean her when I mention my friends and family.‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs tears were flowing freely again, as were Rio‚Äôs.

‚ÄúI also feel like I stole twenty years of their lives, Rio. That‚Äôs twenty years neither of them can get back.‚Äù

Rio leaned forward and hugged her, Wanda hugging her back, burying her face into Rio‚Äôs shoulder. They stayed that way for a few minutes before Rio drew back.

Wanda wiped her face and looked at Rio through bloodshot eyes.

‚ÄúWhat if it‚Äôs too late?‚Äù

Rio looked at her with disbelief. ‚ÄúHave you seen the way she looks at you? Nat is as madly in love with you as you are with her. The decision you have to make is, are you willing to do this? I mean, really do this. Live your truth? There‚Äôs no keeping this secret. Not with two teenage boys and as famous as you are, social media, everything. You obviously have to talk with your husband, but Wanda. You‚Äôve been living your own personal ‚ÄòGood Luck, Babe‚Äô your entire adult life. You deserve good things, and you deserve happiness. How do you expect to set that example for your boys if you don‚Äôt do it for yourself? Billy is gay if you haven‚Äôt noticed. How do you think he‚Äôd react if you kept this hidden for another 30 years? A good half of the public already thinks you're fucking Agatha, there‚Äôs a subsection that already ships you and Nat. All of THAT aside, you have to live for YOU, Wanda. We can all see that you‚Äôre driving yourself insane. You‚Äôve been spiraling the entire time I‚Äôve known you, and you two aren‚Äôt subtle.

‚ÄúYou have not stolen time from either of them. Vision will always support you, and Natasha? Wanda, honey, the moment you are able to, we aren‚Äôt going to hear from either of you for at least a week. She only has eyes for you. Talk to your husband, get your woman. As you said, she will always be yours, go be hers.‚Äù Rio finished and handed Wanda a new Kleenex.

Wanda looked at the pile of tissues in her lap. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right, you know.‚Äù

‚ÄúI usually am.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhen will you follow your own advice and go after your happiness?‚Äù Wanda asked, not completely innocently.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not here about me right now. I have my own tragic story, but tonight isn‚Äôt that night.‚Äù Rio said, putting a hand on Wanda‚Äôs knee and squeezing. Wanda returned a slight nod .

‚ÄúI have some things to do as it is. Like, get home and talk to my husband for starters .‚Äù Wanda exhaled a shaky breath and texted her driver.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio gave Wanda a long hug goodbye and wished her luck, telling her to update her as soon as she had one. Wanda promised she would and thanked her before walking to the car, only stumbling twice.

Rio cleaned up, turning off lights throughout the apartment as she stumbled to her room herself. Once she had finished the bedtime routine and gotten situated, making sure to take Tylenol to head off any ill effects in the morning, she realized it was 2 am in New York, and she hadn‚Äôt texted Agatha.

Tonight with Wanda had been an eye-opener. She knew that something was going on between the two redheads, but a 25-year-long affair of sorts? That she hadn‚Äôt expected. She thought about her feelings towards Agatha. Was she living her truth? Was she being honest with herself? No. You want to kiss that woman. You have dreamt of that woman. You have had impure thoughts of that woman. You want to throw that stupid rule out the window and‚Ä¶

Her phone dinged, interrupting her thoughts.

Agathaüíú

Hey! I‚Äôm so sorry I didn‚Äôt text.

Nat and I went out and drinking

occurred. Never challenge Nat to

anything.

Me:

It‚Äôs okay! I was up late grading.

I‚Äôll remember that.

That was believable. She had promised Wanda she wouldn‚Äôt tell Agatha about tonight until Wanda was ready for her to know. Rio and Wanda were even closer now, and considering how much Wanda meant to Agatha, Rio would keep her promises. This family Rio had been welcomed into meant everything to her.

Besides, she was pretty buzzed hammered herself, which was dangerous, and she needed to say goodnight. She was trying to keep herself friend-zoned.

Agathaüíú

That sounds extremely boring.

We‚Äôre flying back tomorrow.

I‚Äôll see you at the game.

Me:

I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôll be back in time!

I‚Äôm sure Nicky‚Äôs missed you.

What she wanted to say was ‚ÄúI‚Äôve missed you.‚Äù She didn‚Äôt need to go there, though. She kept thinking about Wanda and Nat. Not yet.

He‚Äôs a teenage boy. He doesn‚Äôt

care. I‚Äôve missed you though. I‚Äôll see you

tomorrow. Nat said I‚Äôm not allowed to

text you when I‚Äôve been drinking.

I‚Äôve missed you, too

Goodnight, Aggie.

If Agatha said it first, then she could say it back, and they were absolutely close enough that it was time to use her nickname. This was a start.

Agatha ran into Nat‚Äôs room at the Manhattan apartment that she and Wanda owned, jumping on her bed as though the numbers in her age had magically flipped around . Agatha shoved her phone into Nat‚Äôs face as if the cute girl had just checked yes on the ‚ÄòDo you like me?‚Äô note.

After all, she had, hadn‚Äôt she?

‚ÄúShe said she missed me too and called me Aggie!‚Äù Agatha said uncharacteristically. She was well past buzzed.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt date teachers, or at all ,‚Äù Nat mocked.

‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm just excited to be missed,‚Äù Agatha stated, regaining her composure.



Nat grinned as her phone dinged, and she picked it up to check what was most likely her nightly text from Wanda. She covered her mouth with her hand, and the tears formed automatically.

Natasha Romanov did not create tears.

‚ÄúWhat happened? What‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù Agatha asked automatically, worried someone had died.

Nat turned the phone towards her, her hand shaking.

‚ù§Ô∏è Wanda ‚ù§Ô∏è

I know you‚Äôve always

been mine. Can I be yours

now?

Agatha‚Äôs eyes went wide. ‚ÄúWHAT?!‚Äù She shouted.

Chapter End Notes

I'm going to be spacing updates out a few days. I go back to work on Monday, so I'm trying to write ahead and NOT just post everything.
