I'd Be Smart to Walk Away

Chapter Summary

Wanda makes her decision.
It's Homecoming Weekend for SHIELD.
These women.

Chapter Notes

Thank you to the ever-amazing DaretoDream82 for being my sounding board and for reminding me that y'all can't read my mind.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

When Wanda returned home that night, Vision had been waiting for her in their bedroom, reading a book, knowing what was coming. He had anticipated this moment for the past twenty years of their lives and had noticed Wanda‚Äôs increasing distance, her frequent absences if the boys weren‚Äôt around, and the increased girl time. He gave her the space and time she needed. He would always love her, but he also knew what this had been and he had been grateful for it, but if she hadn‚Äôt come forward soon, he was going to. He deserved true happiness as much as she did.

There had been tears and conversation, but absolutely zero hard feelings on his side. They agreed to wait until after the holidays to tell the boys, and Wanda needed to talk to Jen about how they would approach the media. They would work out co-parenting and divorce details later. Neither planned on being nasty about it and they had been more like roommates than anything for a long time. Vision had joked about giving Nat the same shovel talk she had given him once, except she actually could make him disappear without a trace. Wanda had just smiled. She had sent that text to Nat before talking to Vision, knowing Nat wouldn‚Äôt respond. Nat would want to have that conversation in person. She also knew what Agatha would do.

Aggie

We will be home around 8 am Cali

time.

Me:

I thought you weren‚Äôt coming in

until early afternoon?

Aggie

Well when you basically tell the

love of your life that you‚Äôre leaving

your husband for her, your sister

makes phone calls to ready the

jet and deliver her back to you.

Wanda laughed and rolled her eyes. Of course, they both read in between the lines.

Aggie

Did you doubt me?

Me:

I knew I could trust you.

I love you.

Thank you.

Aggie

Be at my house so boys

don‚Äôt see. I‚Äôm sure they

know. I love you too.

Of course.



Nat had barely made it into Agatha‚Äôs house before Wanda had jumped in her arms, legs around her waist. She hugged her before kissing her deeply, sliding her hand to cup Nat‚Äôs jaw. Nat lowered Wanda slowly to her feet, careful not to break the kiss, running her tongue across her bottom lip.

Agatha cleared her throat, causing the two women to break their kiss.

Nat looked into Wanda‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúYes, you can be mine.‚Äù She answered.

Wanda just nodded.

Agatha clapped her hands together, walking past them. ‚ÄúGreat, now that that‚Äôs cleared up. Jen will be here in an hour, football game this evening, and kid?‚Äù She turned to Wanda, ‚ÄúI am so proud of you.‚Äù She winked before ascending the stairs.



‚ÄúWHAT?!‚Äù Jen exclaimed out of excitement, surprise, and confusion. There were a lot of emotions, and she said as much. ‚ÄúWanda, I am so glad you are finally clearing up your decades-long situationship, I am. But right now? Right before awards season? You just signed with Marvel!‚Äù Jen wasn‚Äôt sure how she was going to spin this, package it, anything. Wanda and Vision had been one of Hollywood‚Äôs very few long-lasting couples.

‚ÄúJen. Look, Wanda coming out of the closet will not surprise many. Marvel is going the way of queer anyway, so is Disney. We spin it positively. I‚Äôm gay and not at all monogamous, and they signed me. Everything will be fine. Our new movie? Wanda and I literally play lovers and have very convincing sex in it. Calm your tits Kale, or let Alice do it for you.‚Äù She smirked, eliciting a blush and an eye-roll. ‚ÄúBesides, America‚Äôs Stepford Couple will not announce it to the kids, let alone the rest of the world, until after the holidays. Nat and Wanda will just be more open and cuddly around us, but still play it cool everywhere else. Don‚Äôt expect them to go gaying it up everywhere else yet, okay? That‚Äôs my job.‚Äù Agatha explained.

Jen looked a lot calmer. ‚ÄúOkay, that makes me feel‚Ä¶oddly better.‚Äù

The couple in question was sitting together looking like two teenagers who had just told their parents that the condom had failed.

Jen looked at them both. ‚ÄúI am very happy for both of you. Truly.‚Äù

Wanda beamed. ‚ÄúMe too.‚Äù She turned to Nat and kissed her cheek. ‚ÄúAre you okay with this?‚Äù

Nat turned and looked at her. ‚ÄúI finally get you, Wanda -body, soul, home, and publically? Yes. I‚Äôm okay with it.‚Äù She gave her a chaste kiss as Agatha groaned again, smiling this time.

‚ÄúNow there‚Äôs two lovesick couples? Gross.‚Äù

Jen waved her hands out in front of her. ‚ÄúNo one said anything about love. Alice and I are taking it slow. It‚Äôs a very strong like.‚Äù She denied.

‚ÄúDebatable,‚Äù Wanda teased. ‚ÄúTo be fair, I‚Äôve loved Nat for 25 years.‚Äù Nat just nodded.

‚ÄúYes, but now you guys will be all open about it.‚Äù Agatha grimaced.

‚ÄúRight, and you and Rio don‚Äôt look at each other like middle schoolers discovering their first crush,‚Äù Nat said.

Agatha was proud of Wanda for finally coming to this decision. She knew it was one Wanda would make eventually, but was surprised Wanda hadn‚Äôt talked to her about it first. She had been just as shocked as Nat was when she received that text last night. She would either ask Wanda about it or Wanda would come to her, however, she suspected Wanda had talked to a certain brunette, and that made her heart soar that her sister was confiding in her new‚Ä¶close friend. Friend.

‚ÄúWe need to make sure that your girlfriends are on the same page,‚Äù Wanda said, seeing if Agatha caught what she said.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll text Alice now,‚Äù Jen said, side-eyeing Agatha, waiting for the response.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll text Ri,‚Äù Agatha said automatically. Her eyes suddenly went wide as it hit her. ‚ÄúSHE IS NOT MY GIRLFRIEND!‚Äù She yelled.

Nat fell into Wanda‚Äôs lap from laughing so hard.

‚ÄúOnly ALICE calls her RI!‚Äù Wanda shouted back.

Jen texted every word to Alice.

Across town, Alice broke out into laughter while half her class did makeup work, and the other half debated the believability of various movies their parents starred in.



‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

September ended and bled into October, Homecoming Week at SHIELD. For some reason, the powers that be, one Coach Rogers, thought that it would be a good idea to play their rivals for the big game. Bayside High. The schools had exchanged pranks and taunts for decades, and this year was no different. SHIELD may have been a K-12 school with a unique student body, but it still had a high school with teenagers with a penchant for bad decision-making. Nicky Harkness and Tommy Maximoff had surprisingly stayed out of trouble so far this year, surprising everyone. They had also met two girls from Bayside and asked them to the Homecoming dance that upcoming weekend after finding out that the guys they usually hung out with were pretty douchey.

That was how Nicky and Tommy ended up on A.C. Slater and Zack Morris‚Äôs radar. It didn‚Äôt help that Slater was also Bayside‚Äôs star quarterback and Morris was their star running back.

Tensions that week had been running high. Teachers were on alert, security teams were on alert, and even parents were on alert. Dressup days were decades-themed, and there were different events held every day. While Rio always enjoyed themed weeks and homecoming in general, she was not looking forward to quarterly exams the following week. However, it was a necessary evil to get to the fall break, which kicked off her series of events with Agatha. The premiere, NYC weekend with SNL, and then Halloween.

She had been looking forward to the second half of October since it had been decided over Labor Day weekend, and she found herself daydreaming about it. She was also anxious about spending a weekend, just the two of them, in New York. They would be staying at Agatha‚Äôs place, and while she could stay in the guest room, she knew where she would actually sleep. Her feelings for Agatha kept growing and becoming harder to ignore. Every touch, every lingering glance, every time she was so close to Agatha that she could hear her breathing and smell the scent of her skin. She needed to at least share with Agatha why she had her rule in place. She just worried that once that was all out in the open, Agatha would see her differently. That scared her almost as much as losing her did.

Thankfully, other than some trash-talking online and at the game, everything had gone smoothly between the two schools. While there had been several almost fights among players, students, and parents, nothing had happened at the game. The players were at a celebratory after-game party, and the six women were at Agatha‚Äôs. Agatha was still on high alert, however, just waiting for the other shoe to drop.

‚ÄúI just feel like something‚Äôs going to happen,‚Äù Agatha said for the fourth or fifth time since they had been at her house. Each pair of women had a designated couch now. Agatha and Rio had the middle couch, Nat and Wanda to their left, and Alice and Jen on their right. They had gotten pizza, and their various drinks were scattered around.

‚ÄúAggie,‚Äù Nat started ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs security with the boys, and they‚Äôre fine.‚Äù She reassured her.

‚ÄúSo they‚Äôre going to a high school dance with girls from a rival school who are technically dating football players from the other team. What‚Äôs the worst that could happen?‚Äù Jen teased. ‚ÄúDid they learn that from you, Harkness?‚Äù She added.

‚ÄúMother, son, and nephew bonding?‚Äù Rio asked before looking over at Wanda. ‚ÄúYou need better role models for your sons, Maximoff.‚Äù

‚ÄúEt, tu, Brute?‚Äù Agatha looked at Rio, feigning shock and hurt.

Alice laughed. ‚ÄúAt least they know how to fight.‚Äù

‚ÄúReal reassuring everyone,‚Äù Agatha said.

‚ÄúUsually, I‚Äôm the one that worries, and I‚Äôm not worried,‚Äù Wanda said nonchalantly, snuggling up against Nat with a yawn.

‚ÄúAs long as I can focus on positive PR, I‚Äôm good,‚Äù Jen added, her arm around Alice, smiling at her.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre all disgusting,‚Äù Agatha murmured. Rio was pressed against her side, and if anyone who didn‚Äôt know their status saw them, they would assume they too, were dating. The painful truth tore at Agatha. She was getting close to wanting to ditch her rule of not dating parents. There weren‚Äôt many rules Agatha was afraid of breaking or bending. She had done a lot of things to survive and get where she was today. This, however, was more for her son. The no relationships period rule was for her. She had had one relationship in her life, and it had gone poorly. No one knew about it, and only Wanda knew snippets. Hell, Wanda didn‚Äôt even know who the woman was. It would always be Agatha‚Äôs secret.

She had to get to a point where she could share that with Rio, and she didn‚Äôt know if she could.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The boys and their dates were taking pictures around the compound and looked adorable. Tommy, Nicky, Billy, and Billy‚Äôs ‚Äòfriend‚Äô, Eddie, were wearing matching suits. Tommy‚Äôs date, a girl named Kelly from Bayside, was wearing a silver spaghetti strap dress with a sweetheart neckline and a flared skirt that came to her knees. She had matching silver heels, and her hair was pulled up. Tommy had a matching silver vest and bowtie with his suit to match. Jessie‚Äôs dress was a strapless purple number that managed to be fitted but appropriate for a sixteen-year-old. She had black heels, and her hair reminded Agatha of her own, long, wild curls with a mind of their own. Nicky‚Äôs vest and bowtie were purple to match Jessie‚Äôs dress, and Agatha teared up at how he looked simultaneously grown up and like he was still her little boy. Then there was Billy and Eddie. Billy had a blue vest and red bow tie, and Eddie with a blue bow tie and red vest. The six of them all looked amazing. The three women who had known Nicky and the twins since birth had tears in their eyes. Even Rio was tearing up.

Rio took pictures and sent them to Alice, even though she and Jen were out on their own date.

After the pictures, the teenagers left for dinner and the dance. Everything had gone fine the night before after the game, and Agatha was still oddly anxious waiting for something bad to happen.

The last pictures they had taken were taken on a balcony at Agatha‚Äôs house, and they had all come back through the house.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm getting a drink,‚Äù Agatha announced.

‚ÄúWe are going to Nat‚Äôs place for date night since we can do that,‚Äù Wanda stated, grabbing Nat‚Äôs hand and leading her towards the door. ‚ÄúLove you both, have fun, confess your feelings, bye!‚Äù She said, closing the door behind them.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a bitch, and there‚Äôs nothing to confess!‚Äù Agatha yelled before the door closed.

Rio was leaning against the bar with her face buried in her hands, ears pink. ‚ÄúWhy do they keep doing this shit?‚Äù She asked.

‚ÄúAt this point, it‚Äôs just poking the bear,‚Äù Agatha said, pouring whiskey into her coke, handing one to Rio. ‚ÄúCheers to shitty friends that mean well.‚Äù

She lifted her head, taking the glass with one hand and putting the other on the cool marble of the bar. ‚ÄúCheers,‚Äù Rio said, lifting her glass as she clinked it against Agatha‚Äôs.

They turned and assumed their usual positions on the couch, their sides pressed against each other.

Rio poked her tongue in her cheek, trying to decide if she wanted to stay in safe waters or go deeper. She had so many things she wanted to ask, but she wasn‚Äôt sure if she was ready to cross into those territories quite yet.

Agatha decided for both of them.

‚ÄúWhat are you wearing to the premiere?‚Äù Agatha asked, trying to sound innocent.

Rio looked at her, pretend shock on her face. ‚ÄúYou know good and well that I have been sworn to secrecy, and no one is allowed to say anything!‚Äù

Jen had given them all very specific instructions not to tell each other what they were wearing. They were all getting ready together, and they would see then, but for some reason, it was very hush-hush until then. Agatha didn‚Äôt understand it either, and she had been doing this her whole life.

‚ÄúWe are riding together. We are getting ready together with the same make-up and hair team, at my house. I do not understand why we can‚Äôt tell each other. Yet, just to prepare you, it‚Äôs this way for every red-carpet event. Whether it‚Äôs a premiere or an awards show.‚Äù Agatha looked over at her to gauge her reaction.

Rio met her gaze, trying to read the look.

‚ÄúWhy would you need to prepare me?‚Äù Rio asked, searching her eyes. She needed Agatha to confirm it,

‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Agatha was trying to put it in just the right words. ‚ÄúFor any future awards shows or premieres, I was hoping you would go with me. As my new standing red carpet buddy. Wanda will probably start showing off her not exactly new girlfriend, and Nicky is getting too cool to go with his mom‚Ä¶‚Äù She trailed off, she hadn‚Äôt broken eye contact with Rio, and while she was trying to play it off, her eyes were soft and drew her in.

Rio knew this was Agatha‚Äôs way of asking her to stay in her life, a commitment of sorts. Rio nodded, her own eyes were a reflection of Agatha‚Äôs. ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù She whispered. She didn‚Äôt know when they had leaned into one another or how they had, once again, gotten this dangerously close.

Agatha could feel Rio‚Äôs breath on her face and her body was buzzing everywhere it connected with Rio‚Äôs. She so badly wanted to cross that line, but if they were going to do that, some things needed to be said first, and that wasn‚Äôt happening tonight. She quickly turned and stood.

‚ÄúI need another drink? Do you?‚Äù She asked.

Rio nodded, clearing her head. ‚ÄúJust water.‚Äù Water was much safer.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

They had fallen asleep watching The Craft, Rio tucked against Agatha, her arms around her, when Agatha‚Äôs phone rang. She jolted awake and looked at the time. It was only 10:30 and she hadn‚Äôt heard Nicky come in, she grabbed the phone and saw Lilia Calderu‚Äôs name on the screen, which shocked her into alertness.

‚ÄúLilia? What‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù

Rio had woken up when Agatha‚Äôs phone went off. When she heard the panic in her voice and the name, she grabbed her shoes and phone.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll be right there.‚Äù Agatha hung up and went to call Wanda, only to see that Rio was hanging up her phone.

‚ÄúWanda and Nat are on the way here, and we‚Äôll go to the school together. Wanda‚Äôs calling Vis.‚Äù She said, grabbing their purses.

‚ÄúHow?‚Äù Agatha asked as they headed to the door.

‚ÄúYour voice, the look on your face, and I could hear everything Lilia said through the phone.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo you know the Bayside football players showed up, and there was a fight?‚Äù Agatha relayed.

‚ÄúYes. She didn‚Äôt say how serious it was. Shouldn‚Äôt be too bad, though.‚Äù

When the four women reached the school, Jen was already there in full PR mode, as were a few other PR reps for some other families. As it turned out, it was worse than they thought.

Nicky, Tommy, and a few other football players from both the varsity and junior varsity teams had decided to stop by Bayside on the way to the dance. The victory the night before had been solid, 28 -7, and they had learned about some rather degrading treatment of the girls on campus by boys across the school in general. The SHIELD team took it upon themselves to cross out ‚ÄòTigers‚Äô on the field, replaced it with ‚Äòpussycats‚Äô, and stole the head of their mascot‚Äôs costume, flying it up the flagpole on the SHIELD campus. They had used paint that would wash off the field easily and planned to return the head on Monday. No major damage and it was all pretty harmless. The problem came when the Bayside football team crashed the dance as students were departing, and a fight broke out in the parking lot.

Agatha was more worried about legal ramifications and the physical well-being of the kids than anything else, which was what Wanda and most parents were also worried about.

‚ÄúNicholas, are you okay?‚Äù She asked, rushing to where he was sitting in the clinic.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm fine, Mom. Slater won‚Äôt be able to open his left eye for a while though,‚Äù he said with a small smile and winced when she hugged him.

‚ÄúNicky? What‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù She asked, alarm.

‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt block correctly and took a blow to the ribcage,‚Äù Nat said, storming in. ‚ÄúI checked the cameras, and have already had a word with security.‚Äù Her accent was thick as she joined Wanda and Vision with the twins.

Agatha shook her head. ‚ÄúWill you and Tommy please not start shit?‚Äù She asked, checking him over for any other damages.

Nicky just scoffed as he looked down. Rio had sidled up next to Agatha and had a comforting hand on her lower back, helping to ease her anxiety. It had worked, as Agatha wasn‚Äôt shaking as she had been before.

Rio put her hand on Nicky‚Äôs shoulder and squeezed. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just glad you and your cousins didn‚Äôt get seriously hurt.‚Äù She smiled at him, and he returned it.

Agatha knew how they looked right now, and she didn‚Äôt care. Let people talk. Jen could spin it to be like another Wagatha situation. Why that stung her, she wasn‚Äôt sure. You know why. Her inner voice said. She ignored it as she put her arm around Rio‚Äôs waist and gave her a quick side hug.

No one was pressing charges, though there had been a heated debate over who had been in the wrong and what the appropriate consequences were. Security footage proved that Bayside had attacked first and SHIELD students had defended. Tommy had a few scrapes and bruises but was fine. Billy had stayed out of it. A few other students were a little scuffed up. Students were picked up, and the excitement died down. Agatha had left the clinic and joined Lilia in dealing with the few police officers who had shown up. Wanda and Vision gathered the twins to go home, letting Rio know, while Nat figured out exactly why security had been nowhere to be found during the scuffle. Jen and a few other reps were scrubbing pictures off of social media, Alice was talking with the teachers who had chaperoned the event, and Rio was sitting with Nicky.

‚ÄúYour mother was worried.‚Äù She said, ‚ÄúWhat actually happened?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat do you mean?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know what I mean.‚Äù

‚ÄúThose guys are real jerks. It‚Äôs funny how people think we‚Äôre these elitist snobs, or completely out of touch, but we‚Äôre not. They‚Äôre the ones who don‚Äôt know how to treat people.‚Äù He said, looking at the ground. They were sitting in the office lobby now, an ice pack on his rib cage. ‚ÄúThe girls over there aren‚Äôt treated nicely by the guys and they say mean things to the LGBTQ+ kids‚Ä¶it‚Äôs like a stereotypical high school you see on TV, Rio.‚Äù He looked like a lost puppy, hurt to discover the world's injustices.

‚ÄúI know, kid. I‚Äôll make sure to tell Lilia, and maybe she can talk to the principal. What could you do about it? How could you spread awareness about how not to be a teenage douchecanoe? You‚Äôre the child of one of the most famous people in the world. You have a platform.‚Äù She knew he wanted to make a difference and knew that he could if he wanted to.

‚ÄúDo you honestly believe that? That I could inspire others?‚Äù He asked, looking hopeful.

‚ÄúYour mom is Agatha Fucking Harkness, kid. Which makes you Nicholas Fucking Harkness. You are unstoppable.‚Äù She grinned and ruffled his hair. ‚ÄúYou can do anything.‚Äù

Agatha had watched the exchange, and while she wasn‚Äôt sure what was said, she could see it had been a heartfelt conversation that ended in grins and her son being comforted by the woman she was falling for.

‚ÄúShe is just as scared, hurt, and cautious as you are. If you would just open up and take a chance, you might find love again.‚Äù Lilia said.

Agatha jumped. She had no idea when the woman had drawn up beside her, but here she was in all of her wisdom. Agatha looked around, noticing that everyone had left or was in the process of doing so.

‚ÄúWhat are the consequences?‚Äù Completely ignoring what the principal had said.

‚ÄúFor the boys? They‚Äôll clean up Bayside‚Äôs field tomorrow and do whatever exercises Rogers has for them. However, I believe Nicky has something to tell me, and an investigation into student conduct will be open at Bayside. He‚Äôs a good kid with a good heart. Like his mother, despite her rough exterior,‚Äù she looked over at Agatha. ‚ÄúFor you? Well, if you don‚Äôt finally open up, then you lose that amazing woman in there, and you go back to your old ways, and you‚Äôre as miserable as you ever were. If you do open up and get rid of that stupid rule? Well, hopefully, she follows suit and everything works out.‚Äù Lilia looked back at Rio, who was looking at things on her phone with Nicky and pointing at something on the screen.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not talking in riddles right now. Why?‚Äù She looked over questioningly. Lilia was rarely this candid.

‚ÄúYou know why. Now take those two and go home, Agatha.‚Äù With that, Lilia turned and left.

Agatha just shook her head and walked through the doors into the office. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon, you two. Let‚Äôs go.‚Äù She smiled and led the way out.

As they rode back to the compound, Agatha thought about the night's events. Rio had stayed. She had called Wanda automatically without hesitating, hadn‚Äôt once complained, had swooped in, comforted Nicky, sat with him, and waited with him. Even now, Nicky had fallen asleep leaning on Rio. This woman, who had only been in their lives for two months, had stepped up, been a calming presence, and shown up for both of them without being asked. Like a partner would.

It was two a.m. by the time they got home. Nicky hugged Rio and thanked her, before hugging Agatha and whispering ‚ÄòI like her‚Äô in his mom‚Äôs ear. He waved and went upstairs to bed.

Rio yawned. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to head out myself.‚Äù She grabbed her bag and turned before Agatha caught her arm.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a long night and a rough one at that. Will you‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha hated being vulnerable, and she had never actually asked Rio to stay before. It just had worked out that way. Rio turned, looking at Agatha.

Rio knew that they were in deep at this point. Very deep. To the point that they would soon need oxygen masks. The normally collected woman before her was anything but. While the night's events had turned out to be a minor innocent, Rio had seen the panic and fear on Agatha‚Äôs face and heard it in her voice. She could see the adrenaline wearing off and knew that she was still in need of comfort. The great Agatha Harkness, as rough around the edges as she could be, just needed someone to hold her and tell her everything was going to be okay. At that moment, Rio desperately wanted to be that person for her. She would take away all of her pain, trauma, and fear if she could. Forever and Always. She just nodded before responding. ‚ÄúOkay, Agatha.‚Äù

Rio knew that it would have been so easy to close the gap between them right now. To cup Agatha‚Äôs face before sliding her hands into her hair as she kissed her, and damn. She wanted to. She wanted to feel her lips against her, wanted to explore her mouth with her tongue, bite her lip, swallow her moans... No. You can‚Äôt risk it.

Agatha thought for a moment and knew she had to think quickly. She was vulnerable, what Lilia had said was still fresh in her mind, and yet, she didn‚Äôt want to fuck anything up. If she and Rio went upstairs, she wouldn‚Äôt be able to trust herself not to do something stupid. The couch was the safer option of the two. Letting Rio go home had been the better option, but she needed her. Honestly, she and Rio needed to be on different continents to be safest, yet here they were.

She led Rio to the couch and they positioned themselves in a way that Agatha had her back leaning against Rio‚Äôs chest, Rio‚Äôs legs on either side of Agatha, Rio‚Äôs back against the arm of the couch. Rio played with Agatha‚Äôs hair as they turned on a random TV show.

‚ÄúWhat were you and Nicky talking about?‚Äù Agatha asked, remembering how intently they had been speaking.

‚ÄúOh! Something is happening at Bayside. We need to talk to Calderu. Nicky said that it‚Äôs a very typical high school like you would see on TV; bullying, homophobia, misogyny. He wants to do something about it, and we talked about how he can use his proximity to fame to rally other teens to use their collective voices and be a force for change. He‚Äôs such a great kid. You should be so proud of yourself, Aggie,‚Äù Rio‚Äôs voice was full of admiration and awe.

Agatha‚Äôs heart swelled, not only because of Nicky but because of how Rio had talked about him. ‚ÄúThank you for being there for him. That meant a lot to me. Just the way that you jumped in and took control of everything.‚Äù She was thankful that Rio couldn't see her face as she bit back tears. ‚ÄúNot many people would have done that.‚Äù

‚ÄúI care about you both, you‚Äôre‚Ä¶important to me, Agatha. With that comes Nicky. I‚Äôm fond of the kid, whether I‚Äôm his teacher or not. He‚Äôs an extension of you. I‚Äôm going to treat him like he‚Äôs mine.‚Äù She smoothed the ends of Agatha‚Äôs hair. You might as well tattoo ‚ÄòJust Friends‚Äô on your foreheads at this point to remind yourselves.‚Äô It was one of the many reasons this couldn‚Äôt go any further. She couldn‚Äôt hurt Nicky like that.

The words ‚Äòlike he‚Äôs mine‚Äô stayed with Agatha and landed, like so many other things with Rio, in her heart. It‚Äôs what she had wanted, wasn‚Äôt it? Someone who truly cared about them both? Someone who wasn‚Äôt there to try and be a second parent necessarily but wasn‚Äôt afraid to love and guide him either?

Maybe they could just wait until Nicky graduated Agatha thought. Jen and Alice had waited years to finally get together, and Nat waited twenty years to fully get Wanda back. It was less than two years, and as smart as Nicky was, he could probably graduate earlier. Then she would just need to find a way to open up about why she had shied away from relationships. No, they wouldn‚Äôt make it that long, either. They were doing a bad job at making the two-month mark. Useless lesbians.

Despite her inner turmoil, the adrenaline had worn off and Agatha couldn‚Äôt resist sleep anymore, not while Rio absentmindedly played with her hair, the smell of Rio‚Äôs eucalyptus shampoo filling her nostrils.

Rio felt Agatha‚Äôs body become heavier against hers, knowing she had succumbed to sleep. She knew Agatha needed it and was glad she had finally let herself find it. Meanwhile, Rio was mid-crisis. She was attempting to suppress feelings and recreate boundaries, but those lines were all but erased at this point. She managed to sleep for a few hours, but only due to her personal Agatha-shaped weighted blanket.

She remembered they had shifted in their sleep and was not entirely surprised to wake up sandwiched between the back of the couch and Agatha. Agatha‚Äôs back was flush against Rio‚Äôs front, Rio‚Äôs arm over her middle, Agatha holding her hand. She breathed in the familiar lavender scent that she now associated with the woman in her arms and let herself to just be. It was moments like this when Rio didn't have to be scared of Agatha, the possibility of them together, and all the ways it could go horribly wrong. Rio relaxed, imagining all the good without the risk of the bad.

Before she fell asleep again, Rio wiggled away, grateful that Agatha was such a heavy sleeper. Rio quietly gathered her things and left. She needed to prepare for the final week before break and had things to think about.

As she glanced back at Agatha, sleeping peacefully, she tried to crystalize the scene and how happy she felt right now in her heart and mind. I can't lose her , she thought. No matter what I am feeling, I have to turn it off. It can't turn out that way again .







Chapter End Notes

WHEN?! C'mon you two!

So far, I am a chapter ahead of myself and I hope to post every few days. The next chapter should be Thursday!

You Came Along and Changed Everything

Chapter Summary

Feelings are starting to be confronted, and a premiere is attended.

Chapter Notes

This chapter was going to include a few other events, but it would have been 15k or more words. So, I decided to split it. I hope to post Saturday or Sunday. Winter break ended this week and those darn students really cut into writing time. However, snow days today and tomorrow hopefully will provide the time to write...except we're moving this weekend. So...we'll see what happens!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Rio found herself storming into Alice‚Äôs apartment Sunday evening after a day of preparing for mid-terms and quarterly finals. She had also been reflecting on her feelings all day. She was happy being Agatha‚Äôs friend, she really was. There were also feelings there, and she needed to get them out and talk to the one person she could always count on to help her keep a level head. The one person who knew everything. She sent Alice a quick text to let her know she was coming over in case Jen had been there. Rio was agitated and had to get out her frustrations. It was impossible to turn these feelings off.

Jen was sitting cross-legged in an armchair, typing statements from last night's teenage shenanigans. Alice was on the couch and offered Rio a cider, which she declined.

‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôve had enough alcohol the past two months. Maybe I need to stop drinking. Maybe I need to keep a clear head.‚Äù She said, agitated, as she gestured wildly while pacing around the living room. She had sat much of the day while preparing for the week and now Rio needed to move.

Jen looked at Alice and raised an eyebrow. Alice shook her head once. She knew Rio and knew she needed to let everything out.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt date parents. I don‚Äôt. We both know there‚Äôs a fucking good reason for that. That two-year affair in San Francisco nearly KILLED me, Alice, you saw me. You came to the hospital and saw me.‚Äù She realized that Jen was present and quickly turned to look at her. ‚ÄúSay a damn word of any of this to anyone, and I‚Äôll make a phone call to Nat. She owes me a favor,‚Äù She said, pointing a finger in Jen‚Äôs direction.

Jen looked at Rio with confusion for a moment. ‚ÄúWhy would Nat‚Ä¶‚Äù the pieces clicked for her. ‚ÄúOH! You‚Äôre the one, got it,‚Äù Jen nodded, waving her hand for her to continue.

‚ÄúNothing leaves this apartment,‚Äù Rio added, watching as the other two women nodded their agreement. She continued her movements around the room. ‚ÄúYes, I know this is different, but I almost lost my career. I don‚Äôt want another relationship to almost cost me everything again. I don‚Äôt want a breakup to cause me to lose a friend, which is the most important part of this dilemma. She means so much to me. I can tell her almost anything. I can‚Äôt lose that! I can‚Äôt lose this coven of lovable bitches either.‚Äù Her gestures were wild, and she roamed every space in the main area of the apartment. This was not a new experience for Alice as her eyes tracked Rio around the room. Jen, however, was amused.

Do you know what she asked me last night? She asked me to be her consistent date for red carpet events. Agatha. Agatha Fucking Harkness, who always takes Wanda ‚ÄòIn Love With the Deadliest Woman Alive‚Äô Maximoff or her own son, wants me to be her forever red-carpet buddy. You know, as FRIENDS. I can count on one hand the number of times she has taken someone that wasn‚Äôt one of those two since I‚Äôve been ALIVE.‚Äù

‚ÄúWait,‚Äù Jen interjected, shocked. ‚ÄúI have been with Agatha for ten years, and she has NEVER wanted anyone other than Wanda or Nicky on a red carpet more than once or twice. It‚Äôs because of all the pictures that are taken. She doesn‚Äôt want to look back and be filled with sadness repeatedly because of what she‚Äôs lost. She knows Wanda and Nicky are constants, and she‚Äôll always be filled with happiness and joy when she sees those pictures, no matter what.‚Äù Jen looked at her. ‚ÄúRio, that‚Äôs huge.‚Äù

Rio leaned against the wall, feeling as if all the air had been sucked from her lungs. Agatha knew that she would always associate good things with Rio. AFTER TWO MONTHS? What kind of witchcraft was happening? Agatha wanted her to be a constant in her life, and Rio so badly wanted that, too, which was what had brought forth this crisis.

‚ÄúHang on, then why were you all so insistent on FORCING her to take me to the premiere? Knowing it was such a big deal to her?‚Äù

Jen waved her hand. ‚ÄúAgatha isn‚Äôt forced to do anything. If she didn‚Äôt want to take you, she wouldn‚Äôt, and again, more than once or twice. One premiere, okay. Wanting you to be her constant? Rio. She‚Äôs planning on you being beside her, in some capacity.‚Äù Jen internally screamed. Everyone had gotten on to her and Alice for taking so damn long to get it together, Wanda and Nat took a quarter of a fucking century, and now Rio and Agatha were alternating between going too fast and slamming on the brakes. Maybe she should have set up a fake dating ploy. Those situations seemed to move more quickly.

Rio nodded slowly. ‚ÄúSo she wants me in her life forever but isn‚Äôt sure about the capacity. Cool. Cool, cool, cool, cool, cool.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt date parents.‚Äù Alice reminded.

‚ÄúEXACTLY! And why don‚Äôt I date parents? Because of the bitch back in San Francisco! I fell in love once, ONCE! Everything was going great, but then I found out she was NOT separated from her husband. That she was not going to get a divorce, and I broke it off, because OBVIOUSLY. She didn‚Äôt get the hint. Suddenly, she‚Äôs EVERYWHERE. Do you know how odd it is for a teacher to have to get a restraining order against a parent of a student?‚Äù She was power-walking all over Alice‚Äôs apartment at this point.

Jen looked at Alice. ‚ÄúIs she just monologuing?‚Äù She asked.

Alice looked back, ‚ÄúShe does this. I just go with it.‚Äù

Rio kept going like the Energizer bunny, not even hearing them, ‚ÄúLong story very short, Jen, I survived but ended up in the hospital with sustained injuries from the fucking husband! Swore off parents after that. Calderu knows, yet even SHE seems to want this. I also don‚Äôt trust that bitch not to show back up solely because she‚Äôs the jealous type, and I have to keep everyone safe.

And then, THEN, there‚Äôs the NICKY of it all. I fucking love that kid! I‚Äôve known that damn kid for TWO MINUTES, and I would do anything for him. He‚Äôs so much like her, the mischievous little shit. If anyone had said it was his fault last night, I would‚Äôve caused some damage of my own. Do you know why he and Tommy wanted to take those girls out? Because the Bayside dickheads are misogynistic assholes, and our boys wanted to learn more to know what THEY could do to raise awareness about douchey behavior in high schools. Who does that sound like? His activist mother. That‚Äôs who. He is an amazing kid and I would be so proud to be a part of his life.

I shared what he told me with Agatha and I‚Äôm sure she let Lilia know since Lilia listens to her for some unknown reason. The kid is 16 and has more empathy in his pinky than some grown-ass adults because the people that raised him, I know it wasn‚Äôt ALL Agatha, are just that fucking good. You Kiss Me In A Way That's Gonna Screw Me Up Forever

Chapter Summary

The premiere, a weekend in New York, and a Halloween party. Our favorite woman have so many opportunities to talk and get closer.

Chapter Notes

Thank you so much to the ever-so-amazing DareToDream82! She has been indispensable in this! She has absolutely helped me sort out my Carolina Reaper level of neurospicy and put it in order.

I apologize for the wait! Have 13.5k words. I refused to split this chapter and I hope what I (we, really) have brought you makes up for it!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Rio was captivated by what was unfolding on the screen before her. There was such amazing chemistry between Agatha and Wanda, even she believed they were passionately in love. The beautiful love scene at the end of the movie was the perfect end to this dramatic psychological thriller. Rio was struggling to stay awake. She wanted to tell Agatha about San Francisco, about what‚Äôs her name, but she couldn‚Äôt form words. It probably wouldn‚Äôt have made sense anyway. She felt awful for drinking so much, but had she really been ready to open up? To be rejected? Would Agatha date her, knowing she potentially still had a crazed stalker out there somewhere? It was too much. Her eyelids were heavy, her brain hurt, and she needed to sleep. She slung her arm over Agatha‚Äôs middle and clumsily scooted closer to her.

‚ÄúNight Aggie. I‚Äôm sorry I fucked up,‚Äù she mumbled. Her eyes had closed, and her words were barely audible.

‚ÄúYou have nothing to apologize for. Good night, Ri,‚Äù Agatha didn‚Äôt always call her Ri, only sparingly since it felt so intimate. They were going on three months of friendship, and she realized they were more than friends at this point. Rio began to snore a few minutes later as only the drunkest do, and Agatha chuckled. She twisted a little to look at Rio‚Äôs face. She kissed her on the forehead and whispered, ‚Äúyou might be worth the risk.‚Äù She went to sleep as she thought about all of the pros and cons.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Things were strangely awkward on Saturday. Neither woman acknowledged anything from the night before. Rio was clearly hungover and felt awful about how things had unfolded, choosing silence over apologies. Agatha was acting normal for the most part but acting like they hadn‚Äôt shared any intimate moments. The women had gotten dressed and had a quiet breakfast, making small talk about the day ahead of them before going to the SNL studio. It was quite the experience, and they got along swimmingly, helping the day fly by without forcing Rio to think about last night or confront it with Agatha.

It was roughly half an hour until show time, and Agatha hadn‚Äôt spoken to Rio most of the day. The show was about to begin, and she had no idea where Rio even was. Things had been awkward all day, and she hated it. Rio had barely said anything to her since breakfast. They had been so close last night, but she wasn‚Äôt entirely sure what had happened. Wanda had checked in earlier, and Agatha just told her they drank too much. She‚Äôd fill her in later.

Rio was avoiding Agatha. That hadn‚Äôt been her intention when she woke up that morning, but it was now her tool of choice. She knew she‚Äôd have to face her after the show, but that was future Rio‚Äôs problem. Rio did want to wish Agatha luck though, and that was her current conflict. The good friend in her won, as she walked up to Agatha, who wore a flattering white suit for her monologue.

‚ÄúHey, break a leg tonight. You‚Äôre going to be amazing. You always are.‚Äù She said, walking up behind her.

Agatha turned around and smiled. NOW Rio was talking to her, and she didn‚Äôt sound mad or upset. A wave of relief washed over Agatha.¬† No matter what happened or was going on in that head of hers, Rio was still there to support her. Agatha hadn‚Äôt realized that it would mean so much to her.

‚ÄúThank you,‚Äù she responded.¬† What‚Äôd you do today? I didn‚Äôt see you around much.‚Äù

Rio noticed the sadness in Agatha‚Äôs eyes as she said it, and she felt the pain in her own chest, knowing she had caused it.

‚ÄúI hung out with Chappell Roan and her girlfriend, talked to Chloe and Heidi when they weren‚Äôt busy, met Kate McKinnon and fan girl‚Äôd there, talked to Keenan, oh, and met Colin and Michael.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you had a good day. The show‚Äôs about to start. See you in a bit.‚Äù

Agatha rushed off with a sweet smile on her face. Now that she had confirmation Rio was done avoiding her, she wanted to get back in the right headspace to host a live show.

Agatha‚Äôs face told Rio everything she needed. Not only had Rio ruined last night, but she hurt the one woman she truly cared about today. I need to fix it when we get back to Agatha‚Äôs later, she thought. For now, she took her reserved spot in the audience and got ready to watch the great Agatha Harkness dazzle everyone. Rio had watched Agatha countless times on screens, but seeing her live was an altogether different experience. It almost canceled out her awkward and negative feelings from the night before. Before she knew it, the show was over and Rio was determined to make up for last night.

The show ended, and Agatha found Rio quickly. She needed to know why she had been avoiding her all day, but not here. But, just in case, Agatha was going to give her an out: ‚ÄúSome people are going to go‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio cut her off. ‚ÄúNo. We‚Äôre going to your place.‚Äù

Agatha nodded, relieved that Rio had chosen to return with her instead.

They had changed into pajamas and were sitting in the bed facing each other. Agatha had opened her mouth to start talking when Rio held her hand up.

‚ÄúWait. I need to say something first. I am so sorry about last night and today. I spent today avoiding you because of everything that happened last night and how awkward I made things. I came here with a plan, but it didn‚Äôt go the way I thought it would. I think part of my drinking was needing courage, but I know that if I needed to drink to have the courage to talk, then Agatha, I‚Äôm not ready.‚Äù The look on her face was earnest, and there was regret and pain in her eyes. She hated herself for not being ready.

Agatha nodded. If she were being honest with herself, she wasn‚Äôt quite there either. She nodded, her own blue eyes meeting Rio‚Äôs, filled with the same pain and sadness. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right, and we can‚Äôt force it. No matter how tempting it may be.,‚Äù Agatha said softly.

Rio sighed heavily. ‚ÄúI doubt either of us will go to sleep quickly.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Agatha laid on her back and put her arm out. ‚ÄúCome here.‚Äù

Rio assumed her position against Agatha, head on her shoulder, arm and leg over her. ‚ÄúWhy is this so natural?‚Äù Rio asked.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a very comforting presence.‚Äù Agatha smiled.

Rio laughed. ‚ÄúYou must be. Confession. Ever since the Ballad of the Witches‚Äô Road came out, it‚Äôs been on my sleep playlist. All iterations of it. Several of your songs have been from over the years. Your voice has always calmed me and helped me go to sleep. When we met that day at SHIELD? I even fell asleep to The Ballad that night,‚Äù Rio knew her face was bright pink from her confession, but she didn‚Äôt care. It was important to share something personal, even if minor compared to the confession still locked up within.

Agatha looked down at Rio, the small divulgence rolling around in her mind. She had comforted this woman for years and hadn‚Äôt even known it. Sure, she heard things like this all the time, but coming from Rio was, as always, different and felt special. ‚ÄúYou can tell me that, but‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs different, Harkness.‚Äù

‚ÄúThank you for sharing that with me. It makes me feel very special, and now I know how to get you to sleep.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou are special, and having Agatha Harkness sing me a lullaby? Dream come true.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, then prepare yourself,‚Äù She smiled into Rio‚Äôs hair as she began to sing, ‚ÄúDown, down, down the road‚Ä¶‚Äù

If you had told 22-year-old Rio that Agatha Fucking Harkness would one day be one of her best friends and hold Rio in her arms while singing The Ballad to help her get to sleep, Rio would ask you to share whatever drugs you were on. Yet here she was, living that exact scenario, with zero drugs involved.

Agatha felt Rio succumb to sleep as she sang and softly ran her fingers through Rio‚Äôs hair. Agatha thought it was one of the sweetest and most intimate things she had ever experienced. She didn‚Äôt understand how she could have these extremely intimate moments with Rio, yet to profess that which rattled about her core and begged for release scared the hell out of her. Because you‚Äôre afraid she‚Äôll reject you, and you can‚Äôt handle losing her.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The return flight was rather uneventful, and they both knew they wouldn‚Äôt be able to see each other much the next few weeks. Agatha shared everything with Wanda Sunday evening. Wanda seriously considered slightly maiming her.

‚ÄúI told you that taking her to ‚ÄòThe Hex‚Äô was a bad idea!‚Äù Wanda practically shouted.

Nat was at football practice with Nicky. The last game of the season was Friday, and they were playing Bayside again before playoffs began. SHIELD was undefeated and had already secured their spot. Bayside had to win on Friday to earn theirs.

‚ÄúI thought it would be fun! And it was fun but also a bad idea. It turned out, though, that neither of us was ready to have that discussion. And we‚Äôve agreed to hold off that conversation until we are both ready. Not to force or rush it.‚Äù Agatha looked at her, knowing she would understand.

Wanda deflated. ‚ÄúI know, I just was hoping for a summer wedding,‚Äù she teased.

Agatha froze. She was trying to get the courage to date someone, which was already a leap from her fuck and forget days. She was NOT in love and nowhere near marriage. And here was Wanda talking about weddings.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, what? Absolutely not. That is, just. No. Your wedding, maybe.‚Äù Agatha was short-circuiting.

Wanda laughed. ‚ÄúWHOA! Okay, I struck a nerve there. Also, no, we haven‚Äôt talked about it either, though I do want to marry Nat. I‚Äôd marry her yesterday if I could.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know you would,‚Äù Agatha said, putting a hand on Wanda‚Äôs. ‚ÄúBack to me, though. What do I do now?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou have an extremely busy schedule leading up to Halloween. You focus on that. Go cheer Nicky at the football game, and go nerd out together at the party. You‚Äôre there together anyway.‚Äù

Agatha nodded. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm surprised. That was a very mature answer.‚Äù

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt choose any days in the betting pool for the next two weeks.‚Äù

‚ÄúI hate you.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou fucking love me.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Alice and Rio's conversations were mirror images of the ones that Wanda and Agatha had, as if in parallel universes. Ultimately, Alice conceded that she was proud of Rio for not forcing the issue no matter how much she had hoped otherwise.

The next two weeks had gone by quickly. Rio fell back into the school routine, and that Friday, Bayside beat SHIELD. Both teams would be in the playoffs the day after Halloween. Agatha was engrossed in filming, and while it was in LA, it often ran late. They texted, but many nights, it was just to say good night. They watched Halloween movies on their Saturday night, and they ended up falling asleep halfway through Hocus Pocus.

Finally, Halloween arrived, and with it the annual party. They were at some venue owned by Tony Stark. He held the party for the older kids and adults, around 10, and it transitioned to an adults-only event. Stark could be a pretentious asshole, but he liked parties and tried to do right by his daughter.

Agatha had on THE Moiraine traveling costume, a blue shirt and pants, boots, and a long blue coat with leather on the shoulders. Her long brown hair loose about her shoulders.¬† She loved the way she could use the coat as a cape and be dramatic with it. Rio was dressed as Moiraine‚Äôs nemesis, Lanfear. She had forgone the headpiece, but the black leather dress looked amazing on her. The right sleeve was long, and the shoulder was puffy. There were straps around the neck, and criss-cross straps on the left shoulder, otherwise that side was sleeveless. The neckline went straight across her chest with a studded belt right below her breasts. There was a piece in the middle of the dress that came down to the top of her knee that was separate from the sides of her dress, that split on both sides at the top of her thighs, giving a cape-like effect that went to her ankles. She had on wedge platform boots that laced up to mid-thigh and three black leather cuffs on her left wrist. She looked every bit the part of the evil lover of the devil she was portraying.

Alice and Jen were dressed in the classic Xena and Gabrielle costumes from the 90‚Äôs TV show, and Wanda still did the Fiyero and Glinda bit with Vision. It was even funnier knowing that Wanda was in love with Nat, dressed in a green and black suit, giving subtle Elphaba vibes. They were all team Gelphie, themselves. Tommy and Nicky were running around as zombies, and Billy and Eddie were Wiccan and Hulkling from The Young Avengers comics.

‚ÄúHave they confirmed they‚Äôre dating yet?‚Äù Rio asked Wanda, nodding at the boys.

‚ÄúNo, but look at them. I wish he would just tell me.‚Äù She gestured at the two teenagers leaning into each other and acting like they were the only two people who existed.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre adorable.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre more put together than you and Agatha,‚Äù Wanda looked at her knowingly.

‚ÄúOh, so you heard about New York?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, I did. And, close only counts in horseshoes and hand grenades.‚Äù

‚ÄúThank you for comparing my dating life to yard games and weapons.‚Äù Rio scoffed.

‚ÄúWhy are we talking about violence?‚Äù Agatha asked, walking up to them.

‚ÄúThe Xena and Gabby costumes.‚Äù Rio lied before Wanda could say anything.

Agatha nodded.

Wanda rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to go find my husband,‚Äù she looked at the ceiling before whispering, ‚Äúor my girlfriend,‚Äù and giggled. She had been drinking, and while she was keeping everything quiet until after the holidays, she was getting very impatient.

Agatha shook her head. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs going to get too bold, and someone‚Äôs going to find out.‚Äù

‚ÄúProbably,‚Äù Rio nodded. ‚ÄúAfter 25 years of hiding, can you blame her?‚Äù

Agatha shook her head, ‚ÄúNot at all. I‚Äôm so proud of her.‚Äù They were in a quiet area upstairs. ‚ÄúShe told me that you were the one she talked to who gave her the push.‚Äù Rio and Agatha were facing each other, bodies only a few feet apart.

‚ÄúAlice and Jen, Wanda and Nat.‚Äù Agatha smiled. They had both decided not to drink and were completely sober.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just your regular lesbian matchmaker. Maybe I can find someone for Vision after the divorce.‚Äù They both laughed.

‚ÄúHonestly, you came into our group like a force of nature. It felt like you had always been one of us and truly belonged with us. With me. I can‚Äôt imagine our lives, my life, without you in it.‚Äù

Eyes locked, they had moved closer together, separated by only inches.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want a life without you in it, Agatha.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs eyes dropped to Agatha‚Äôs mouth.

Caught up in the moment, Agatha closed the space between them and wrapped her arms around Rio‚Äôs waist, pulling her flush against her, and pressed their lips together. Rio‚Äôs arms immediately went up and around Agatha‚Äôs shoulders as she pressed herself against Agatha, parting her lips to meet Agatha‚Äôs movements.

Agatha raised her hand to cup Rio‚Äôs jaw as she slid her tongue against hers, deepening their kiss. Finally, Agatha thought. It was everything she had hoped and dreamed for months. They could go back to her place and talk. She was prepared. She was just so happy to finally kiss this amazing, beautiful woman.

Rio‚Äôs hand had slid into Agatha‚Äôs hair as she used her tongue to explore Agatha‚Äôs mouth. She withdrew momentarily to bite Agatha‚Äôs bottom lip and then swallowed the whimper that followed. She scratched lightly at Agatha‚Äôs scalp as they battled each other for control of the kiss. Rio wondered if they could go back to Agatha‚Äôs since they didn‚Äôt have school tomorrow. Then it hit her. This was Agatha Harkness. Mother of one of her students. They still hadn‚Äôt talked, and that needed to happen before this could continue. Fuck.

Rio froze, eyes flying open as she released her grip on Agatha and stepped back and out of her embrace.

Agatha‚Äôs eyes opened at the sudden loss. ‚ÄúRio?‚Äù She saw the panic in Rio‚Äôs eyes and realized what had happened. ‚ÄúHey, it‚Äôs okay, let‚Äôs talk.‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs eyes were wide as she shook her head. ‚ÄúAgatha, I‚Ä¶I can‚Äôt.‚Äù

She turned and bolted.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre an idiot, Harkness,‚Äù Agatha pinched her nose before turning on her heel and going after her. She reached the top of the stairs before she felt a hand on her arm. She turned her head to see Lilia.

‚ÄúSometimes, you have to give people processing time before they‚Äôre ready to talk to you.‚Äù

Rio had run. They had known they needed to figure things out before jumping in, and yet, they hadn‚Äôt. Everything could be ruined, and Rio‚Äôs emotions and thoughts were too unstable to figure it out here. She had pulled her phone out of a hidden pocket and texted Alice to meet her in the front and that they were leaving. Adding SOS next to it. She was crying as she, Jen, and Alice left.

Agatha found Wanda and Nat staring in confusion as they watched Alice‚Äôs ride leave with the three women inside. Agatha silently cried as she watched the car disappear.

Worst Halloween ever.

These two, I swear.

The Spell is Cast, How Long it Last

The aftermath.
The talk.

The Raven.

Chapter Notes

I hope the longer chapters make up for the longer breaks between updates! Adulting really impedes hobbies.
Thank you so much for the kudos, shares, and comments! They mean so much! I am loving this journey so much!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Agatha Fucking Harkness had kissed her like a soldier returning from war, and now Rio was curled up on her couch, head in Alice‚Äôs lap, hugging Raven, sobbing like she‚Äôd been dumped on prom night.

Nothing made sense anymore.

‚ÄúRio. It‚Äôs okay. Why can‚Äôt you just talk to Agatha about it now?‚Äù Alice asked, rubbing her back.

‚ÄúBecause I‚Äôm a coward, and what if she can‚Äôt accept it? What if it‚Äôs too much? We can‚Äôt go back. She‚Äôs one of my best friends, and now I know what it‚Äôs like to kiss her, and I will always want that,‚Äù She explained as the tears continued to fall.

Alice acted hurt, trying to lighten the mood, ‚ÄúWait a minute! We‚Äôve kissed!‚Äù

Jen gasped from her spot in the armchair, ‚ÄúWait, what?‚Äù

Rio gave a small smile as Alice laughed. ‚ÄúWe practiced kissing each other when we were in middle school,‚Äù Rio supplied.

Jen looked relieved, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what I was expecting, but that makes a lot of sense,‚Äù She regarded Rio for a moment. ‚ÄúAgatha won‚Äôt push you away, you know. She has an entire security team, everything will work out.‚Äù She paused momentarily, ‚ÄúHell, Nat would probably go after the ex personally, and no one gets past Nat.‚Äù

Alice nodded. ‚ÄúRio, Agatha likes you, not just as a best friend, either.‚Äù

Rio shrugged. ‚ÄúI just, I don‚Äôt know. There are a lot of other things too. The whole, she‚Äôs Agatha Fucking Harkness thing, for one.‚Äù

Jen just groaned and looked at Alice. Alice looked at her de facto sister. ‚ÄúIf she wasn‚Äôt one of the most famous people in the world and a parent of one of your students, and you just met, what would you do?‚Äù

‚ÄúI assume in this hypothetical, all the feelings are still there? I would ask her out,‚Äù Rio replied.

‚ÄúThen respond to one of the ungodly number of texts she‚Äôs sent you in the past two hours since we‚Äôve left!‚Äù Jen nearly yelled, her tone bordering on frustration. It was only a matter of time before grainy photos leaked, and she still had a job to do.

Rio bit her lip. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt, okay! I can‚Äôt bring potential harm to their doorstep.‚Äù Fresh tears streaming down her face.

Alice squeezed her shoulder. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre safe here, and that bitch isn‚Äôt going to do anything.‚Äù

Rio rolled onto her back, looking up at Alice, ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt trust it, and pictures are all over the internet now from the premiere and a few from New York. You know that demon has seen them, and she knows, and she is definitely the jealous type.‚Äù Rio knew for a fact that she had seen them, but she wasn‚Äôt telling anyone that.

Jen moved over to the couch, putting Rio‚Äôs legs over hers, ‚ÄúYou two have never once told me this bitch‚Äôs name. Why?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like summoning Beetlejuice,‚Äù Alice scoffed.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not wrong. Also, when I say she‚Äôs a model, I mean somewhat well-known, and her husband IS well-known,‚Äù Rio added.

‚ÄúYet, you‚Äôre worried about Agatha‚Äôs fame?‚Äù Jen shook her head.

‚ÄúI knew San Francisco was never going to make me public. Ever,‚Äù Rio shrugged.

Jen was filled with sadness for her friend. ‚ÄúThat wasn‚Äôt a red flag for you?‚Äù

Alice looked down at Rio. ‚ÄúThis one was collecting red flags like they were Pokemon. It‚Äôs why all of Agatha‚Äôs green ones scare her.‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha has her red flags, but they‚Äôre more from trauma,‚Äù Rio said, ignoring Alice‚Äôs very correct assessment.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre more yellow, maybe orange,‚Äù Jen suggested. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt call them red.‚Äù

Rio sat up, causing Raven to finally jump down. Rio crossed her legs and leaned back against the couch. ‚ÄúAgatha being more than willing to break the law, and breaking the law, might be a red flag‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúEh, depends on the reason,‚Äù Alice said, waving Rio off. ‚ÄúAnyway, back to the matter at hand. What are you going to do? You can‚Äôt just ignore her. It‚Äôs currently,‚Äù She checked her phone, ‚Äútwo in the morning, and there‚Äôs a football playoff game at six-ish tonight. You know you have to be there.‚Äù

Rio groaned. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right, I can‚Äôt skip it. I have to support Nicky, and the rest of the team. With injuries, Tommy is playing in it. I‚Äôll figure it out.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt will just be awkward.‚Äù Jen mused.

Rio nodded. ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt know what to do. We need to talk, but I don‚Äôt know how to start that conversation now. ‚ÄòThanks for kissing me in a way that might screw me up forever if it never happens again, but let me tell you about the time I was almost murdered and how I have a crazy ex-girlfriend who is also a stalker. Oh, and there‚Äôs a restraining order. A TEMPORARY restraining order because the judge is a fan of hers and her husband.‚Äô That will go over like a pregnant pole-vaulter.‚Äù

Jen sighed. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be ready for her to call the lawyers, call in favors, pull strings, the things Agatha does.‚Äù She put a comforting hand on Rio‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúEverything will be okay.‚Äù Rio nodded. ‚ÄúIf you guys think so. It‚Äôs just, my ex is a sociopath.‚Äù

Alice put an arm across Rio‚Äôs shoulders. ‚ÄúI know she is honey, but we have a‚Ä¶former‚Ä¶assassin, two extremely powerful and connected actresses, a fixer, me - your knight of wands, and you, our mad scientist. It‚Äôs going to be fine. Right now, we need to focus on how you‚Äôre going to handle this.‚Äù

Rio sniffled. ‚ÄúLike an adult. Hug my cat, ignore the pretty girl, and drink.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Jen and Alice said simultaneously.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to respond to her tonight or even talk to her in the next day or so, okay? You can take a break. However, you need to decide what you‚Äôre going to do. Tell her everything or decide you aren‚Äôt ready and take a few steps back?‚Äù Alice laid it out plainly.

Rio knew she wanted to tell Agatha everything. She also knew that it wasn‚Äôt just dating parents, dating scared her as a whole. She had dated the crazy bitch for two years and been in love with her, and it had ended badly. She wanted Agatha, yes, but they were going to have to take this slowly, and she wasn‚Äôt sure if Agatha would be okay with that.

There was also what she wasn‚Äôt telling Alice and Jen, and that was that crazy pants had absolutely seen the pictures and had sent Rio a message from a blocked number. Rio had ignored it, hoping there would be zero follow-up, but it still existed.

Blocked

Stay away from Agatha.

I love you, and you are still

mine. I will always love you.

Always find you.

Surely, Rio didn‚Äôt need to worry about that yet.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Wanda filled Vision in on what had happened, and he took over teenager duty while she and Nat took Agatha back to the compound. The boys were going to a co-ed sleepover, and Vision had volunteered to be one of the parent chaperones. No one had trusted a bunch of hormone-filled teenagers to be left to their own devices. They may be rich and famous, but they weren‚Äôt stupid.

Back at Agatha‚Äôs, free of makeup and in comfortable clothing, Agatha was staring at her phone as if it would do tricks.

‚ÄúHoney, I don‚Äôt think she‚Äôs going to respond,‚Äù Wanda looked at her like she was delivering horrible news.

Agatha chewed on her thumb. ‚ÄúI fucked up.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou did,‚Äù Nat agreed. ‚ÄúBut in your defense, something had to give, and no one was talking.‚Äù

Wanda cut her eyes to Nat and back to Agatha. ‚ÄúNat is‚Ä¶partially right. You two have to talk, and soon, now. You have now pulled back the curtain and know what‚Äôs there.‚Äù

‚ÄúFireworks,‚Äù Agatha interrupted.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll talk about all that in a moment,‚Äù Wanda continued, ‚ÄúNow you two know that for anything to continue, you have to talk. It‚Äôs time. You can‚Äôt go back. You can‚Äôt just push that aside.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know, it‚Äôs just, what if she doesn‚Äôt like what she sees. We can‚Äôt go back, and I can‚Äôt take back that kiss. What do I do then? Say, sorry, I shoved my tongue down your throat? That was the best kiss of my life, and we KNOW what that means, but let‚Äôs just go back to being friends?‚Äù Agatha threw both hands in the air, her fingers spread out towards the ceiling, a questioning look on her face.

‚ÄúNow we‚Äôre going back in circles and beating a dead horse. AGATHA! You won‚Äôt know until you talk to her!‚Äù Wanda grabbed her by her shoulders and shook her a little while Nat huffed a laugh.

Agatha dropped her arms. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so glad you two are taking this seriously.‚Äù

Nat looked at her, ‚ÄúAggie, we are. Trust me. You have been there for us for the past 25 years as we‚Äôve navigated our own mess, and we will be here for you.‚Äù

‚ÄúHow will I talk to Rio if she won‚Äôt respond?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe football game tomorrow!‚Äù Wanda suddenly remembered.

‚ÄúYes, let me have a heart-to-heart with my son‚Äôs TEACHER at the high school football game,‚Äù Agatha said sarcastically, ‚ÄúI am sure she will be totally comfortable baring her soul in front of the whole school. Afterward, we could all go get ice cream.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôd go get ice cream.‚Äù Nat mocked.

Agatha was picking at loose threads on her yoga pants and just nodded.

‚ÄúOf course you two do, but you ended up together,‚Äù Agatha pointed out.

‚ÄúWhat if we don‚Äôt?‚Äù Agatha frowned.

Nat looked at her seriously, ‚ÄúHow do you know if you don‚Äôt try?‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

SHIELD hadn‚Äôt reached the playoffs in years, and Lilia Calderu was extremely proud of her school full of nepo babies and kids born with silver spoons in their mouths. Her kids worked hard, practiced hard, played hard, and were dedicated.¬† They deserved this just as much as any other school in the Trinity League. Of course, with the NDAs in place and the secrecy that shrouded the school she ran, the media was extremely unhappy as they were only being allowed to cover the very basics of the game. If SHIELD did make the finals, there would be negotiating with lawyers.

The coven sat in the bleachers as they always did, cheering on Nicky, and now Tommy and Eddie who had both been moved to the varsity team to cover injuries. Billy still wouldn‚Äôt admit that he and Eddie were dating and just turned red when anyone insinuated as much. While Rio usually sat next to Agatha, she was not sure what to do or say about the kiss the night before. Knowing that a high school football game was not the place for it, Rio did her best to distance herself from Agatha.

Agatha yawned. ‚ÄúFuck.‚Äù

‚ÄúExactly.‚Äù

Agatha woke up in the morning a bit hazy but fine. She rarely got hangovers, a superpower from her years of heavy drinking. She heard purring in her ear and turned to see Raven curled up next to her head. ‚ÄúYou are not the woman of the house I wanted to see first thing this morning,‚Äù She said as she scratched the feline on the head. Agatha leaned against the door frame and smiled as she imagined cooking together in her kitchen at the compound. ‚ÄúYou took care of my drunk ass, and now you‚Äôre making me breakfast?‚Äù She had one eyebrow raised and her arms crossed over her chest.

‚ÄúA few, nothing major. Lost my appendix somehow. Still not sure how that correlated.‚Äù She scoffed.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio laughed as her phone dinged.

I Swear There is Someone, Somewhere, Watching Me

Chapter Summary

There's some drama at school and Rio gets flowers!
A decision is made!

Chapter End Notes

Lou is the Lou from Ocean's 8. So Cate Blanchett.
I would gladly let Cate Blanchett stalk me, but this is crazy Cate Blanchett.
I'd still consider it...

For the next chapter, we are taking scrunchie donations. We will need them.
