I Like Your T Swift T-Shirt On The Ground

Chapter Summary

Thanksgiving Day is rather eventful and Rio makes a confession Agatha isn't quite expecting.
Vancouver lifts everyone's spirits and unspoken promises are made.

Chapter Notes

Alexa, play "Body is Bible" by Fletcher.

Warning: Spice.

Also, yes, I made some changes to real-life events, you know we wanted her to wear those outfits, and I needed her to sing that specific line!

Thank you so much for all the comments, kudos, telling your friends, interaction on my socials, etc. It means so much to me, and my amazing beta/sounding board. I try to respond to every comment! The dopamine/serotonin boost is so welcome! Thank you for reading/liking/loving my drabbles!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It was Thanksgiving morning, after all, and everyone was waiting downstairs. Once Agatha was presentable and everyone had busied themselves with meal preparations, Agatha took a picture of her and Rio and made a Jen-approved post on her socials.

‚ÄúHappy Thanksgiving from us to you. Thankful for my girlfriend, son, and amazing family and friends!‚Äù

She threw in a few hashtags and let it go. Rio made a mental note to check the comments later when her phone dinged.

Blocked

WHAT?!

GIRLFRIEND?!

YOU‚ÄôRE SPENDING TODAY

WITH HER?!

There was also a picture attached, except it wasn‚Äôt the one Agatha had just posted. It was worse. It was of Agatha and Rio in Agatha‚Äôs bed, with Rio straddling Agatha and kissing her. It looked like the picture had been taken through the window. Rio was shaking. The phone dinged again. Another picture. This one of her staring at the phone. She looked up, trying to figure out the angle as she stormed out the door.

Agatha noticed when Rio received the text and alerted Nat. When Rio went outside, everyone followed.

Rio‚Äôs eyes were wide with panic and fear. She was rubbing the left side of her chest as she felt the familiar symptoms of a panic attack seep in. She whipped her head around to search for Lou, looking into the trees, bushes, everywhere. Then, she heard whirring of some kind and saw a flash of red hair leap into the air and take down a low-flying drone, landing in some superhero pose.

They heard a woman‚Äôs laugh, the slam of a car door, and a car speeding off. Nat looked at the drone.

‚ÄúThere must have been two. This one is a red herring, but I‚Äôll take it to Darcy,‚Äù She was pissed, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm taking another trip.‚Äù

Wanda shook her head, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not leaving until tomorrow. Please,‚Äù she pled. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre getting to be ourselves this year.‚Äù

Agatha was ready to commit murder herself as she wrapped her arms around a frozen and sobbing Rio. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay, we‚Äôll increase security, it‚Äôs okay.‚Äù She soothed.

Agatha turned towards the group. ‚ÄúEveryone back inside, blinds and shades closed. We‚Äôre not letting her ruin this, okay?‚Äù She corralled everyone inside as Nat made calls and increased security around the compound.

All eyes turned to Rio‚Äôs phone when it dinged again.

Blocked

Baby, I love you.

Come back to me.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs a psychopath,‚Äù Jen exclaimed after she read the text.

Agatha looked at the girlfriend whose hand she still held, ‚ÄúWas that the laugh we heard?‚Äù

Rio shook her head, ‚ÄúNo. Someone else, a P.I. or someone she hired, most likely. I don‚Äôt trust it, though.

‚ÄúMom, what happened?‚Äù Nicky asked from the table. The three boys had picked up that something was happening but didn‚Äôt know what exactly, as they had been instructed to stay inside.

Rio buried her face in her hands as she turned into Agatha and sobbed. Her world had crashed in as she realized that the boys were potentially in danger now.

Agatha held Rio tightly as if she was the only thing holding her together. The four parents exchanged looks, trying to decide how best to handle the conversation.

It was Alice who spoke instead.

‚ÄúI know you boys have some experience with this from your mom‚Äôs fame, but Rio has a stalker. A relentless one. It‚Äôs one of the reasons she moved here. We call her SF for San Francisco. If you say her name three times, she‚Äôll appear like Beetlejuice.‚Äù Billy smiled at that one. He was playing Beetlejuice in the school play in just a few days.

‚ÄúWas she hurt?‚Äù Tommy asked. He vaguely remembered someone sending his mom random notes a few years ago, but nothing came from it. He had heard horror stories at school, though.

Rio was still seeking solace in Agatha and thankful that Tommy had gathered that now was not the time to ask Rio any direct questions. These boys were wise beyond their years.

Alice nodded. ‚ÄúShe was. It‚Äôs why I brought her here. I knew she would be safe in our little coven.‚Äù

Nicky thought everything over carefully. He knew Alice hadn‚Äôt done it intentionally. She hadn‚Äôt known his mom would be taken by Rio, but he would have to thank her one day. Things were a little scary right now, but Rio had been good for every single person on the compound, especially his mom. Agatha had never been unhappy, necessarily, but he had never seen her this happy either. He and the twins had also deduced that Rio had been the one to make the final push for Aunt Wanda to make her decision as well, AND Jen and Alice were together. There was something about Rio that was magic. He also knew his mom and Mr. Stark weren‚Äôt on the best terms, so if Rio could smooth things over in that department, this could work for him, too.

He came out of his thoughts as Billy shook him, ‚ÄúHey, space cadet. We‚Äôre going to help Jen monitor the internet for anything shady being posted.‚Äù

Nicky nodded. ‚ÄúSounds like a plan.‚Äù

The excitement of the morning had died down, and cooking had resumed. There was still tension, but Nat had worked quickly to call in a few favors and increased security, pulled camera footage, and even called Darcy to see if she could trace the number that had texted Rio that morning. Unfortunately, SF was good and it led to a useless burner phone. That‚Äôs when Nat decided to create a clone of Rio‚Äôs phone on her computer and reverse-stalk Lou. The phone Lou was using was off, so she couldn‚Äôt see her current location. However, a few older texts came up. The texts from this morning were not the first Rio had received. That girl had been hiding this. Nat swore under her breath. Agatha had found someone who also dealt in half-truths. Nat walked into the kitchen, where the other women were cleaning up. ‚ÄúRio, can I borrow you for a minute? Nothing major.‚Äù She knew Rio was on high alert and didn‚Äôt want to cause her anxiety to go any higher.

‚ÄúSure,‚Äù Rio put a plate in the dishwasher, kissed Agatha on the cheek, and followed Nat. Wanda and Agatha exchanged looks as the other two women walked out.

Once they were out of earshot, Nat turned and held up Rio‚Äôs phone.

‚ÄúI cloned your phone so I could keep track of SF,‚Äù Nat said quietly as she handed it back to the wide-eyed woman. Rio hadn‚Äôt even known Nat took it in the first place. ‚ÄúBefore you even say anything, why didn‚Äôt you say anything earlier, before the flowers?‚Äù Nat seemed more concerned than mad.

‚ÄúI thought I could handle it, or that she would just give up,‚Äù Rio said meekly, "I know she‚Äôs not the most stable, but I didn‚Äôt think she would fly off the handle like this.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs voice went even quieter, and Natasha had to lean in so she could hear her. ‚ÄúI still don‚Äôt think she‚Äôd actually hurt me in any way. It was Shane who did that, hurt me, not her. Never Lou.‚Äù When she finished speaking, her voice was barely audible, and a fresh tear slid down her cheek.

‚ÄúFuck,‚Äù Natasha stood. ‚ÄúYou still love her.‚Äù It was a statement, not a question.

Rio shrugged. ‚ÄúI really don‚Äôt know. I am still processing it. It was a large part of my life that just fell apart so quickly.‚Äù

Natasha nodded. She knew a thing or two about things happening quickly.

‚ÄúTalk to Agatha. If you don‚Äôt tell her, I will. I‚Äôm not going to watch her get hurt‚Ä¶‚Äù Nat had to stop herself from adding ‚Äòagain‚Äô. She knew Agatha hadn‚Äôt told Rio about that, but she was ready to threaten Agatha, too. ‚Äú...and this would crush her if you don‚Äôt tell her now. Anyone in the state of California with eyes can see you two‚Ä¶care‚Ä¶about each other. Communicate. Please.‚Äù

Rio nodded, gathering her composure. ‚ÄúI will. Tonight.‚Äù

Everyone had left, and Rio thought about what Nat had said. She needed to come clean, and she knew that she couldn‚Äôt completely be with Agatha in any physical way until she told her about her emotional conflicts. Rio wordlessly took Agatha‚Äôs hand and led her to the couch, guiding her to sit so they could face each other.

Agatha had noticed that Rio had been rather quiet since speaking with Nat in the hallway an hour ago, and Agatha had been worried. She put down her wine, taking Rio‚Äôs hands in hers.

‚ÄúWhat is it, Rio? What‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù

Rio let out a shaky breath. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been lying to you, and I need to confess a few things.‚Äù The words tumbled out of her mouth, and they were not the ones she had rehearsed in her brain for the past forty-five minutes.

Agatha started replaying every conversation since they first met. ‚ÄúOkay‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio looked down at the couch. ‚ÄúToday was not the first time SF texted me. It was actually a few weeks ago‚Ä¶‚Äù She told her about the warning to stay away from Agatha, the text about the stars, and the one from the night prior. ‚ÄúNat knows now and can now see everything that comes into my phone.‚Äù She could tell that Agatha was considering Rio‚Äôs words. She wasn‚Äôt mad but hurt.

‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you tell me?‚Äù Agatha ached at this, but at the same time, wasn‚Äôt she still harboring a giant secret? One that ate at her more and more by the day?¬† Although,¬† this could have caused harm to all of them, and still could. She pushed her hurt aside, knowing it was a small penance for keeping her secrets tight to her chest.

Rio curled into herself, wrapping her arms around her knees, trying to make herself as small as she felt. She hated having to admit these feelings to Agatha. She didn‚Äôt want to have them for anyone but Agatha. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt think she would do anything, Agatha. L‚Ä¶SF had never hurt me, physically. Had never hurt anyone I was close to. I didn‚Äôt think she had completely lost it, didn‚Äôt want to believe it. It was her ex-husband that hurt me. And then, Alice was with me, there was the order, no contact‚Ä¶.‚Äù

Another tear escaped the war behind her eyes as her voice died out. She couldn‚Äôt bring herself to look at Agatha.

Agatha felt like a fist had closed around her heart. She knew what Rio was saying without her actually saying it, and Agatha was trying her best not to crumble. ‚ÄúRio,‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs voice shook, ‚Äúhow do you feel about her?‚Äù Agatha had to know if Rio was still in love with her. She had just finally gotten Rio, that fucking morning. Now, here they were with Rio about to tell her she may still be in love with another woman.

Rio winced. Agatha‚Äôs voice was too shaky, yet too strong at the same time. ‚ÄúYou have to understand everything that happened,‚Äù Rio started, ‚ÄúI found out on Christmas Day that things were absolutely not over between her and the hubby, and they most likely never would be. I stormed out of the house and out of her life. We had been talking about our future that morning. A secret marriage, leaving the country, her retiring, very Evelyn Hugo, when she got a phone call from him, and you would think I hadn‚Äôt even existed. Like we hadn‚Äôt spent the entire morning making love and talking about our plans, so I made up my mind and left. Alice came to town that day and found me sobbing.‚Äù

Agatha realized that their pasts weren‚Äôt that dissimilar, this would be the perfect time to divulge her own past, but this moment wasn‚Äôt about her. She waited patiently until Rio inhaled deeply, ready to go on.

‚ÄúWhen she realized I was serious, the texts, gifts, pictures, the whole stalking thing started. When she broke into my house in February, I had to get a temporary order, and you know the rest. I never got closure, Agatha. We were never able to discuss everything. One minute, we were talking marriage and‚Ä¶well, it doesn‚Äôt matter, but then we were over. She was the first woman I thought I could spend the rest of my life with, and then it was over.‚Äù Rio had stopped crying, and she found that she was angry more than anything.

Rio hadn‚Äôt answered her question, and Agatha still needed the answer. She untangled Rio‚Äôs hands from her knees, tipped her chin, and locked eyes. She had to be able to see Rio‚Äôs eyes when she finally got her answer. ‚ÄúRio, now that I understand everything. How do you feel?‚Äù She asked again.

Rio shrugged.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not in love with her. I don‚Äôt want to be with her. I meant it when I said I want to be with you, Agatha. I care about you deeply. I choose you, Agatha.‚Äù

That was the truth. Did part of her love Lou? Yes, but it was more of a mourning of a sudden loss than anything. She was Agatha‚Äôs, and all the crazy in the world wasn‚Äôt going to change that. She grabbed Agatha by the collar of her shirt and brought her in for a searing kiss, a proclamation, and a promise, the taste of salt from tears mixed in with hot breath, moans, and teeth. Agatha shifted and kissed away Rio‚Äôs tears before leaning back slightly. ‚ÄúRio?‚Äù

‚ÄúHmm?‚Äù She answered, her lips swollen, trying to chase Agatha‚Äôs mouth to continue what they were doing.

‚ÄúNo, Rio, be serious.‚Äù She said in a slightly more commanding tone.

Rio leaned back and tried to focus.

‚ÄúPlease stop keeping things from me,‚Äù The hypocrisy was not lost on Agatha, but this wasn‚Äôt about her. ‚ÄúYou can tell me anything. If we‚Äôre going to do this, we have to be honest and communicate with each other,‚Äù she realized she wasn‚Äôt applying this same logic to herself. However, she hadn‚Äôt survived this long in the industry by being honest.

Rio nodded, ‚ÄúYes. Thank you for being patient with me. I know this is a lot.‚Äù

Agatha kissed her again, ‚ÄúI will always choose you, too.‚Äù

Rio sat back, wiping at her eyes. ‚ÄúOne minute! If you‚Äôre going to do this, so am I.‚Äù She pulled up her socials, as some people had already found her throughout the day since she had ‚Äòliked‚Äô Agatha‚Äôs posts. ‚ÄúCome here,‚Äù she turned so she was in front of Agatha and took a selfie of them, Rio‚Äôs back pressed against the front of Agatha, Rio kissing Agatha‚Äôs cheek, Agatha looking down at her and smiling.

‚ÄúPerfect!‚Äù She posted it with the caption. ‚ÄòSo thankful for the woman I call my girlfriend! Happy Thanksgiving!‚Äô

Agatha grinned. ‚ÄúI really like the sound of that, by the way,‚Äù as she kissed Rio again, slowly.

It was then that Natasha barrelled through the door. ‚ÄúAlice‚Äôs, NOW.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Lou sat in Alice Wu-Gulliver‚Äôs darkened apartment. The restraining order only covered Rio‚Äôs physical location and apartment, not Alice‚Äôs. Surely, Lou could speak to Alice and tell her how she felt about Rio. If anyone could talk sense into her beautiful Rio, it was Alice. Lou couldn‚Äôt believe the pictures the investigator had sent her that morning, and she hadn‚Äôt been able to get to LA quickly enough. Agatha Harkness was obviously bad for Rio. She was a known fuck boi, Lou knew that personally. So what if Agatha was slowing down in her old age? She was using Rio. Probably for better grades for her son or something. Rio was better and out of Agatha‚Äôs league. Rio belonged to Lou and only Lou. She had thought about cat-napping that incessant beast of Rio‚Äôs, but that was the one thing she would never forgive. Crow? Finch? Whatever bird the damn thing was named after meant the world to Rio. Lou hated cats, and the foul thing hated Lou.

Maybe, if this didn‚Äôt work out, she could make it look like Agatha poisoned the damned thing. Rio would surely come back to Lou in that scenario. That was a thought. Rio would never love Agatha, then.

Lou snapped out of her thoughts when she heard a key turn. It was about damn time. Why did everyone spend so much time at that damn compound anyway?

‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt see why you can‚Äôt tell me who the psychotic bitch is, honey,‚Äù Jen said to Alice as they walked in the door.

‚ÄúBecause it‚Äôs,‚Äù she flipped on the lights, and her eyes automatically landed on the blonde model sitting on her couch. ‚ÄúLou,‚Äù she finished.

‚ÄúSee,‚Äù Jen laughed, ‚ÄúThat wasn‚Äôt so hard,‚Äù it was then that Jen‚Äôs eyes also landed on the woman, her mouth forming an ‚Äòo‚Äô. ‚ÄúLou Falco? Oh shit. Rio does have a type.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about time, Alice,‚Äù Lou said, not bothering to get up. She turned her head to Jen, ‚ÄúYou must be the infamous Jennifer Kale, charmed, I‚Äôm sure,‚Äù she looked back to Alice. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here about Rio.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou heartless bitch. Leave her alone. She was healing. She was finally moving on from you.‚Äù Alice was furious as she stalked towards where Lou was on the couch.

Lou sighed, ‚ÄúOh Alice, don‚Äôt you see I‚Äôm here because I love her? I need you to see that so you can tell her so and talk sense into her. Agatha doesn‚Äôt love her. Not like I do. Agatha will just fuck and forget her like she does every other woman.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou hid her, Lou. Lied to her. Your husband almost killed her. If he had still been in his prime, he would have. You USED her, Lou. Not Agatha.‚Äù Alice may have been smaller, but she was ready to kill to protect one of her coven.

Jen had quietly taken a picture and sent it to Nat, and was now discreetly recording the entire thing. She made sure her phone was on silent so if Nat texted back, Lou wouldn‚Äôt be alerted. Jen wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if this lunatic were armed. She stepped forward and put an arm around Alice‚Äôs waist.

‚ÄúI know who you are, and I can destroy your entire career.‚Äù Jen spat.

Lou rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúPlease, I‚Äôd give it all up for Rio.‚Äù

Alice cackled, ‚ÄúRight. If you were willing to do that, you‚Äôd have done it already. You‚Äôll do what you always do: promise her the world, make her come back, and then crush her heart. You do it every fucking time. If you did love her, you‚Äôd let her go. You‚Äôd let her be happy. AGATHA makes her happy. She was NEVER that happy with you. She‚Äôs always smiling now, Lou. She doesn‚Äôt call me in tears anymore. She doesn‚Äôt call me because she saw Agatha on someone else‚Äôs arm. Do you know why? Because she‚Äôs the one on Agatha‚Äôs arm. Agatha Fucking Harkness, who infamously NEVER takes anyone to anything, has and will take Rio to EVERYTHING, Lou. You were afraid to be seen in public with her. Even as a fucking friend unless it was as a group. Even that only happened a handful of times in TWO YEARS. They‚Äôve been friends for FOUR months.‚Äù Alice was breathing like she‚Äôd been in a boxing match.

Lou‚Äôs phone went off and when she checked it, her face went pale. Though Rio had blocked her on all of her socials, Lou followed her anyway on burner accounts. The notification was a post from Rio. A declaration and commitment to Agatha. After the lengths Lou had gone through for her today, Rio was making the relationship public now and even posted a picture.

Alice raised an eyebrow and checked her phone since she received a similar notification. She smiled and handed her phone to Jen.

‚ÄúLooks like she chose Agatha over you,‚Äù Jen smirked, ‚ÄúDo you get it now? She doesn‚Äôt love you, Falco,‚Äù Jen was choosing her words carefully, the phone still inconspicuously filming.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs clearly been brainwashed,‚Äù she scoffed but turned eager once more. ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt over. I was hoping you could help me, Alice. You were always the one to help my sweet Rio make decisions when she was confused about her emotions.‚Äù Lou stood and started towards the door, pulling a hood over her face.

‚ÄúYes, I usually told her to leave you.‚Äù Alice moved out of the way before Lou could even brush against her.

‚ÄúI assume Agatha has at least one goon on the way.‚Äù She eyed Jen. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be taking my leave.‚Äù

‚ÄúRio‚Äôs coming with them.‚Äù

Lou stopped, ‚ÄúShe is?‚Äù

Jen nodded in agreement. ‚ÄúYes, now‚Äôs your chance.‚Äù Natasha had texted back that all four of them were on the way.

Lou looked around. She was cornered here, it wasn‚Äôt a good idea. She could make her escape if she met them outside though. She kept walking and easily slipped by both women and out the door.

Jen looked at Alice, ‚ÄúDo we go after her?‚Äù She asked her girlfriend. Alice just nodded. She already had her hand on the doorknob.

Alice saw the door to the stairs close and nodded to the elevator. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs going to meet them outside. She‚Äôs done this before. Let Nat know.‚Äù

Wanda was ready to tear this SF bitch limb from limb herself. She knew the threat to her family and her happiness this woman posed and she was ready to do what she needed to do.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not here yet?‚Äù Alice looked around.

Rio shook her head.

‚ÄúI recorded everything,‚Äù Jen told Nat as she turned to Rio. ‚ÄúYou need to hear it.‚Äù

Rio nodded. Everyone stilled when they heard running. Jen turned her phone on to record as Nat motioned for Wanda, Alice, and Jen to get back in between the vehicles.

Nat, Agatha, and Rio stepped out.

Lou came into view, slowing her steps, taking in the three women. Agatha and the pretty goon weren‚Äôt her concern. It was her beautiful Rio that she had her eyes on. She knew she only had a few minutes. She had told her own personal bodyguard to drive through here like a bat out of hell in five minutes, shooting if need be. Agatha, that cad, had her arms around Rio. Didn‚Äôt that movie star whore know that Rio belonged to Lou?

‚ÄúRio, love, I came for you.‚Äù Lou smiled as she approached.

Agatha tightened her grip on Rio as she got a look at the woman coming close to her. She knew it was Lou Falco, but she looked more familiar than that as if she had seen her recently. Maybe in an ad or a commercial or something? ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs close enough Lou.‚Äù She said firmly.

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt your business, Harkness.‚Äù Lou barked. ‚ÄúThis is between my fianc√©e and I.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou never proposed. You just made promises you never planned on keeping,‚Äù Rio said, voice steady. She laced Agatha‚Äôs fingers through her own. ‚ÄúStop pursuing me, Lou.‚Äù

Lou grinned threateningly, ‚ÄúBut I love you, and you‚Äôre mine.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs her own person!‚Äù Agatha shouted. She hated when people thought they owned others. Yes, you could ‚Äòbelong‚Äô to someone if you chose to do so, but you were still your own person first.

Lou was closing in fast and reached towards Rio, who stepped into Agatha at the same time Agatha pulled Rio into her and in between their SUV and another car, knowing Nat was going to take over.

Takeover Nat did. She slammed Lou to the ground with the full force of her body as she slammed a fist into her left cheek. She was just getting started when she heard tires screeching. Nat dove away from Lou and heard the slam of car doors and tires screech away. She waited a moment before jumping up and running to Wanda first, helping her up as she ran her hands over her and covered her in kisses. ‚ÄúAre you okay?‚Äù Nat asked as she checked for even the smallest scratch while Wanda laughed.

‚ÄúBaby, all I did was watch.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care, I was worried.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre fine too, by the way,‚Äù Jen said, pulling Alice up and waving her phone slightly. ‚ÄúEverything was recorded.‚Äù

Agatha had gently helped Rio to her feet, lightly caressing her face, arms, and shoulders. If she could have caressed her heart and mind, she would have. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs over,‚Äù Rio whispered as she hugged Agatha.

‚ÄúI know, sweetheart, I know.‚Äù Agatha held her while looking at the other women. She was ready for the fight of her life.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Someone had poked the bear inside of Agatha, and she was ready to maim.

Nat had left the next morning and gone to Connecticut, straight to Shane Falco, Lou‚Äôs ex-husband. He walked into his office at ESPN to find Nat with an envelope and an offer. He could choose to have full custody of his children and file charges against his wife for child endangerment, forcing a psychological evaluation and hospitalization, or Nat could expose the bribery from Falco over what had happened last spring with Rio. She filled him in on the last twenty-four hours and the actual story of his ex-wife‚Äôs actions. Nat was not one to use someone‚Äôs mental health against them, but this was a different story.

The way Lou spun the ‚Äòsituation‚Äô, as Shane called it, with Rio was much different than what had really happened. Lou had lied about the entire relationship to Shane. He had finally divorced Lou after seeing holes in her story. He feared for their three kids and was generally concerned about Rio‚Äôs safety, as well as apologetic about what he had done.

He wasn‚Äôt a bad guy, Nat thought, but another victim of Lou‚Äôs manipulation. By Monday, he had the kids, and Lou was admitted against her will. That was taken care of, at least temporarily. Rio hadn‚Äôt wanted her name involved or any connection to Agatha, so it was only a matter of time before Lou‚Äôs return.

Agatha still had increased security, warned the school, and had bodyguards assigned to everyone. She didn‚Äôt care where Lou was. If she wasn‚Äôt six feet in the ground or scattered across the earth, she didn‚Äôt trust it.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The comments about Agatha and Rio being an official couple had been mostly positive. Jen had given an official statement to a few of her magazines of choice over the next few days about how Agatha and Rio were just taking it slowly and seeing where things led. With Rio posting from her personal socials, her last name had leaked, and they now had two hashtags, and the internet had gone wild.

‚Äú#ViDarkness is much more creative than #Agathario.‚Äù

‚ÄúHave y‚Äôall seen Rio‚Äôs cat? She‚Äôs so freaking cute!‚Äù

‚ÄúRaven needs her own account.‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha Harkness and girlfriend Rio Vidal make things official after being seen together since October.‚Äù

‚ÄúNew photos leak!‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve always had it covered with makeup or edited out,‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been for me and me only, really. A reminder of what I‚Äôve been through in life.‚Äù

Rio traced it with her fingers, ‚ÄúGrief and sorrow I get. Heartbreak?‚Äù She raised her eyebrow at Agatha.

Rio asking her about heartbreak would have been the perfect time to tell her about that time of her life. Right after having sex, however, was not.

‚ÄúAll of those experiences being the heartbreak. My mother dying the way she did, watching Wanda go through what she has, knowing there was nothing I could do for Lorna, my childhood, everything. There‚Äôs a lot of heartbreak in this career.‚Äù It was another half-truth she could live with.

‚ÄúI never want to cause you any of those things, just be there for you if you have to face them,‚Äù Rio said seriously before kissing her.

As tired as they were, they didn‚Äôt get much sleep that night.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha hadn‚Äôt been asleep for very long when her alarm went off at five that Monday morning following the concert. She and Rio had slept for maybe an hour. Their naked bodies pressed together. Agatha was wrong about wanting to wake up with Rio in her arms every morning. She wanted to wake up naked with Rio every morning.

‚ÄúWhy is your alarm set?‚Äù Rio mumbled, mostly asleep.

‚ÄúGolden Globe nominations are being announced. Movies up first.‚Äù

Agatha rolled back to throw something on and brush her teeth before going to the main area of their suite.

Rio followed her and kissed her with fresh peppermint breath.

Agatha opened the door and entered the main room. Surprised no one was there, she turned back to Rio when she noticed the scrunchie on the handle.

‚ÄúRio, did you put one of those on the other handle too?‚Äù Agatha asked, going back into the bedroom to retrieve their phones.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù she yawned, going ahead and turning on the TV and finding the broadcast.

As expected, Agatha had several texts with a picture of the door, asking if it was safe to come in so they could all watch the announcement broadcast together, an annual tradition. She texted the group chat, telling them it was safe to enter.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about fucking time!‚Äù Wanda breezed in immediately after receiving the text, carrying several coffees in hand.

‚ÄúPun intended,‚Äù Nat added smirking, carrying more coffee.

‚ÄúCan we just ignore what happened in here last night?‚Äù Nicky asked as he carried in donuts he and the other two boys had gone and retrieved.

‚ÄúPrepare yourselves to post on socials,‚Äù Jen looked at Agatha and Rio, ‚ÄúShower and look less‚Ä¶like that before posting any pictures, though.‚Äù

The announcements started, and they ate donuts and drank their coffee as announcements were made. Death‚Äôs Beloved was nominated for Best Motion Picture - Drama, Agatha was nominated for Best Lead Actress in a Drama, and was pissed as she turned towards Wanda, ‚ÄúYou deserve to be nominated too. We are BOTH the lead in the movie.‚Äù

Wanda shook her head, ‚ÄúI have a better chance in the supporting actress category where I‚Äôm not up against you. I‚Äôve never won against you Agatha,‚Äù she looked at her best friend in admiration, not jealousy.

Agatha crossed her arms. ‚ÄúThat WILL change one day, superstar. You‚Äôre so much better than me.‚Äù Agatha gave her an adoring look. It wasn‚Äôt a competition, but if you asked Agatha, Wanda Maximoff was a thousand times the actress and woman Agatha was.

As predicted, Wanda was nominated for supporting actress. Their director, screenplay, and score were all nominated. The song ‚ÄúMy Beloved‚Äù was nominated, ‚ÄúIf you win this, Aunt Aggie, you should win the Grammy,‚Äù Billy said excitedly.

The film was also nominated for cinematic and box office achievement for the records they had broken, especially for being such a hit as a sapphic movie.

Neither of them had TV shows they would be up for that year, so they turned the TV off, not interested in sitting through the rest of the list. Jen would bring them up to speed later.

Jen looked around at everyone. ‚ÄúJanuary 5th for the Globes, so everyone begin working on what you‚Äôre wearing and who you‚Äôre walking the red carpet with.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Once on the plane and headed back to LA, Agatha and Wanda made their celebratory posts about their nominations. Wanda took another group selfie of everyone and posted it along with:

‚ÄúMy family, related and chosen, are so grateful that all of you support me in what I do! Death‚Äôs Beloved has been one of the most amazing films I‚Äôve ever gotten to work on, and doing it with Agatha was so special! This is such an honor!‚Äù

She had also posted several pictures from the weekend in general. Very cute, very wholesome, very Wanda Maximoff.

Agatha posted pictures from the concert, her and Rio with Taylor, the group with Taylor, just her and Rio, the group on the plane, and her and Rio on the plane.

‚ÄúThis has been such a great weekend! Taylor, you were amazing, as always! We love you, and thank you so much for having us and the fam! Thank you to everyone out there for supporting Death‚Äôs Beloved the way you have! We led in nominations, and I am so humbled that I get to do the things I do! I love you all!‚Äù

The internet had already been abuzz since last night it seemed, and Jen had already fired up her laptop, fingers flying. The boys were digging through everything they could find, and Nat was making sure there was nothing they didn‚Äôt want out there.

‚ÄúAgatha and Rio Get Cozy at Last Eras Stop‚Äù

‚ÄúWagatha and Friends Are Swifties!‚Äù

‚ÄúWagatha‚Äôs Boys Are All Grown Up!‚Äù

The story headlines themselves were fine. There were plenty of pictures of them all, especially shots looking into the tent, though it didn‚Äôt seem any pictures had been taken of Nat and Wanda. For that, they were thankful.

‚ÄúRio‚Äôs living a damn fairytale, and her Princess Charming is Agatha Harkness.‚Äù

‚ÄúLook at them singing to each other!‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha is in love with that woman.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah, and she‚Äôs in love right back.‚Äù

‚ÄúTHEY‚ÄôRE IN LESBIANS!‚Äù

‚ÄúCHAT, my cousin was there, really close to the VIP tent. She said that Wanda and Nat kept being surrounded by Vision and the boys during ‚Äòromantic‚Äô times, and it looked like they were kissing.‚Äù

‚ÄúWho‚Äôs Nat?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe main bodyguard!! She‚Äôs the hot redhead always following them!‚Äù

‚ÄúOh please, Wanda Maximoff is the straightest woman in the world.‚Äù

Agatha cackled from where she had been reading over Rio‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúI think they both should have been nominated for lead! Homophobes.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf we complain enough, we could still influence The Oscars.‚Äù

The comments and articles went on as Rio put her phone down, leaning into Agatha. They would land soon, and she was exhausted.

Jen had been on the phone and turned to Alice crestfallen.¬† She removed the device from her ear and whispered in Alice‚Äôs ear.

When Alice‚Äôs face fell, too, Nat spoke up. ¬† ‚ÄúWhat happened?‚Äù She asked her two covenmates.

‚ÄúThe deal on the house fell through,‚Äù Jen said as she took Alice‚Äôs hand. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been putting deals on houses, but we keep being outbid at ridiculous prices.‚Äù

The whole mood of the plane had been brought down. Disappointment battled with previous euphoria. Agatha looked at Wanda, shared concern in their eyes. Wanda‚Äôs expression suddenly shifted, and Agatha knew immediately where her best friend‚Äôs mind had gone. Agatha nodded.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Wanda began. ‚Äúwe have an idea.‚Äù

Chapter End Notes

Agatha, girl, I need you to confess.

Too Soon to Tell You I Love You

Chapter Summary

It's December! A holiday dance at SHIELD, Christmas...

New Year's.

Then there's the SF of it all.

Chapter Notes

This is a very long chapter! I hope the week-long wait is okay when it's a 15k-word chapter. Broken up for easier reading! It's another emotional roller coaster!

Please enjoy!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Jen had been looking at houses for the past year, knowing she wanted a bigger place. Something had told her she would eventually need the added space, and finally, dating Alice solidified it. Asking Alice to move in with her felt natural, but she didn‚Äôt think finding something in their flexible price range would be hard. They were being grossly outbid and refused to pay the outrageously inflated prices. Jen was becoming suspicious and didn‚Äôt want to play this game. Getting another phone call that their offer had fallen through didn‚Äôt exactly surprise her, and she was ready to make a voodoo doll of a very specific blonde model.

She had always suspected that Wagatha was damn near telepathic, but watching their silent exchanges was still slightly unnerving. Wanda turned to Jen and Alice.

‚ÄúWe have an idea.‚Äù She had said, contemplating.

Jen threw up an eyebrow in question, though she had an idea she already knew.

‚ÄúBuild a house on the compound. There‚Äôs plenty of room.‚Äù Wanda finished.

‚ÄúWho the fuck are you, and what have you done with Agatha?‚Äù Jen turned to Agatha, eyebrow still raised. She loved Agatha, sure, but they tolerated each other the way you tolerated your older sister, whom you cleaned up after.

Agatha smirked. ‚ÄúWe wouldn‚Äôt live right next door. You could even live further to the back of the property. We‚Äôre already clearing land for another house anyway. Either a guest house or if Vision wants to stay within the castle walls.‚Äù

Vision‚Äôs head snapped up from where he had been helping Tommy with schoolwork, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre building a just-in-case house?‚Äù That was a complete surprise to him.

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù Agatha, Wanda, and Nat all replied at the same time.

‚ÄúDarling, there‚Äôs a house near the compound I may be interested in, and it‚Äôs close enough for me. I am not a lesbian and do not feel the need to still live within 300 yards of my ex-wife.‚Äù Vision turned to look at Wanda.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll discuss it later?‚Äù

Vision nodded as the twins looked at each other. Their parents, biological or otherwise, never argued in front of them.

Alice looked at everyone, ‚ÄúSo, one big happy, mostly queer, family compound?‚Äù She wasn‚Äôt going to add the almost , though she had thought it.

The boys had it covered, though, ‚ÄúJust missing two people and a cat.‚Äù Nicky mused with a sly grin.

Rio‚Äôs eyes went wide. ‚ÄúUh, that is‚Ä¶not, we‚Äôre not even‚Ä¶‚Äù she stammered. These were inside thoughts for her.

Agatha did her best to keep a blank face, looking at Rio next to her and then back to everyone else.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not there yet,‚Äù she stated simply.

Wanda scoffed before adding, ‚ÄúOnce the divorce is finalized,‚Äù she looked over at Vision. ‚ÄúSorry, dear.‚Äù

Vision just shrugged and waved it off. ‚ÄúNo need to apologize, Darling.‚Äù

‚ÄúThen, Nat will move in.‚Äù Wanda looked over at Nat, smiling brightly. She had waited to live with her again for twenty years.

As the plane began to descend in LA, the women discussed contractors while the boys continued to check the home network and various devices, employing the background bots and light hacking skills Nat had taught them how to use to monitor for any possible leaks and to delete what they could.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Nat looked into the very suspicious bidding wars once they had returned home. She wasn‚Äôt sure how news was leaking to SF, but it was, and she didn‚Äôt like it. Nat didn‚Äôt like making people completely disappear, but she was beginning to think this was a safety issue, so she made a note to keep track of who actually bought the properties and who, if anyone, moved in. Nat was also closely monitoring the woman, who hadn‚Äôt been released yet, though she knew the model‚Äôs lawyers were working on it, and it was just a matter of time. The head of Wagatha, and coven, security had to make a decision, and quickly as Lou was slowly going after more than just Rio. Nat knew what this woman was doing, and it was psychological warfare.

Two could play that game, Nat thought, as she dialed a number to an old acquaintance. ‚ÄúYa sobirayu eto odolzhenye.‚Äù She spoke quickly in Russian. I‚Äôm collecting on that favor.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The fact that Lilia had let Alice and Rio off for two days that week had shocked Rio. How was it that all it took was a mention of Agatha, and the permission was granted? It was finals week, and the winter formal was on Saturday. There had been a few mutterings about favoritism, but they died quickly after Lilia popped into those specific classrooms. What this meant for the teachers of the coven was that they had to hit the ground running Wednesday morning and administer exams Wednesday and Thursday.

This was why, after having spent Monday and Tuesday with Agatha, Rio needed to go home. It was four in the afternoon, and she had to prepare for the next day. She had been home to check on Raven, but she knew her cat and knew she needed actually to be home.

They were lying in Agatha‚Äôs bed, facing each other. Rio was twirling strands of Agatha‚Äôs hair around her fingers, and Agatha lightly traced her fingers over Rio‚Äôs scars.

‚ÄúAggie, I really need to head home.‚Äù

‚ÄúI remember you saying that two hours ago,‚Äù Agatha smirked.

‚ÄúI did, and then a very beautiful cougar of a woman pushed me against a wall, kissed me, and took me to her bed.‚Äù

Agatha clicked her tongue. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got to watch out for those cougars. I hear they‚Äôre bad in these Hollywood hills,‚Äù Agatha moved forward and kissed Rio. ‚ÄúStay the night again?‚Äù She asked as she moved back.

Rio gave a small smile. ‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt have everything for tomorrow, and I need to be home for Raven occasionally. Come over tonight? Nicky could stay with Wanda?‚Äù Rio countered.

Agatha knew that Nicky could stay by himself or with Wanda, but it was a school night, he had finals tomorrow, and routine was important. If only she could admit her feelings or be an adult about literally any of this. However, she could not. Instead, she found herself giving Rio a sad smile as she saw the disappointment in Rio‚Äôs eyes. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, babe, it‚Äôs a school night, and I have to keep up the routine while I can. I film the next three days, and then we will film in Canada, starting a few days after the Globes and going for three weeks.‚Äù

Rio had completely forgotten about Canada. ‚ÄúWill you be in Canada the entire time?‚Äù Rio whispered, feeling preemptively sad. She knew she was being ridiculous.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll be home Friday afternoon and leave out on Sunday evening. It‚Äôs just for three weeks. Disney reads start in May. Marvel things start shortly after that, and then they‚Äôll revolve around each other. For the TV show, we‚Äôll see if more episodes are ordered, but it premieres in March as a shortened season. Agatha smiled, ‚ÄúOf course. Now, before you leave me and I don‚Äôt see you until the weekend, come take a shower with me.‚Äù

Hell, her bathroom is barely big enough for her skin routine.‚Äù Alice laughed at her girlfriend‚Äôs preferences. ‚ÄúWanda and Agatha are her only clients, so that makes sense. Then she‚Äôll still have her office for meetings with studio heads or if she needs a quieter space than the compound.‚Äù

Alice nodded.

‚ÄúYes. Bitch put in bids and drove prices up, but nothing had been finalized. Nothing else from there.‚Äù She kept her expressions neutral and her voice even. She didn‚Äôt want Rio to worry.

Alice shrugged, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what Jen and Nat are trying to find out.‚Äù Alice stretched out across Rio‚Äôs bed after helping her with all the chores. ‚ÄúRio?‚Äù Her voice had turned serious.

Rio hung up the last piece of clothing and shut the closet door, lying down next to Alice. ‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù The tone of Rio‚Äôs voice matched Alice‚Äôs.

‚ÄúDo you still have all of Gran‚Äôs jewelry?‚Äù Alice turned her head to face Rio.

Rio was already turned toward Alice, a question on her face.

‚ÄúYes, why?‚Äù

When Gran died, Alice and Rio donated or sold almost everything, keeping only that which was sentimental or a family heirloom. Rio, being the more responsible of the two, stalker issue aside, had held on to the jewelry and had it in a safe with important documents.

Alice was trying to choose words carefully, as she wasn‚Äôt completely sure herself. ‚ÄúJust making sure is all,‚Äù she replied.

Alice huffed a laugh. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know. I often wonder what would have happened if I hadn‚Äôt been an idiot for a decade, where we would be by now. I never wanted kids. I have plenty of those at work, but we could have four dogs by now.‚Äù

Rio raised her eyebrows as her forehead crinkled, ‚ÄúJennifer Kale does not seem like a dog person to me.‚Äù She thought for a moment. ‚ÄúWell, maybe one of those little yappy purse dogs.‚Äù

‚ÄúGood thing I love you, you ass. Speaking of love‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio cut her off with a groan. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt start. I care about her, okay? Can we leave it at that? It‚Äôs been four and a half months. It‚Äôs too soon.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not, really. When you know, you know. You‚Äôre basing too many things off of she-who-must-not-be-named. Love doesn‚Äôt have an incubation period.‚Äù Alice had been looking at Rio seriously, trying to get the words to seep through her thick skull.

Rio stared up at her ceiling fan and blew out a breath as she ran her hand through her thick hair, deep in thought.

‚ÄúWhat if I‚Äôm not ready?‚Äù she turned her head back to meet Alice‚Äôs eyes.

‚ÄúThat is different than saying it‚Äôs too soon or denying it. Everyone around you two sees it. Not being ready to go there is one thing, but at least let yourself feel and accept it. Let her in. She would do anything for you. Let her.‚Äù

Alice let out a small laugh. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôd be lost without me.‚Äù

‚ÄúWorse.‚Äù

The immortal cat opened her eyes and emitted a low growl before returning to sleep.

Rio picked up her phone, careful not to disturb the queen.

‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt understand how much these parents listen to me.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha never imagined she would ever want to consistently share a bed or night with someone again, let alone monogamously. She lay there, staring at the shadows on the ceiling as she was flooded with memories of her ex, her hand unconsciously touching the tattoo of Swords on her hip.

‚ÄúStay the night? Please?‚Äù Agatha had asked. She was twenty-three, and after years of Agatha chasing her, Swords had finally given Agatha a chance.

Swords looked her up and down. She was so much older than Agatha and made Agatha painfully aware of it.

‚ÄúRight. Don‚Äôt stay the night. Don‚Äôt give the paparazzi anything to see.‚Äù Swords was a mentor, after all.

‚ÄúPrecisely, good job.‚Äù Swords kissed her in a way that left Agatha feeling more owned than loved.

Another memory, 10 years later.

‚ÄúAgatha, I‚Äôm too old to have or raise a child, and with your schedule? I would be a primary parent. People would absolutely know we were together then.‚Äù Swords scoffed after Agatha brought it up yet again.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right about me. I can‚Äôt be a good parent with this life.‚Äù Agatha conceded.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt risk being your mother.‚Äù Swords reminded her.

Agatha winced at the blow. Another point Swords had used to talk Agatha out of having kids.

Agatha didn‚Äôt cry at these memories anymore. The ache remained, but the sting was gone. She had turned them off to keep going on with her life. Instead, she thought about how exactly Rio would pull off getting Tony to agree to Nicky taking Morgan to the dance. Rio. This woman had come into Agatha‚Äôs life and turned it upside down in the best of ways. Yes, she had unknowingly brought a stalker with her, but that they could handle. Agatha‚Äôs heart was healing after eighteen years. She was learning to care deeply about someone who wasn‚Äôt her family again. If she could just share the trauma of her past, she would be ready to admit her actual feelings. First, she needed Rio to stay over more. She pulled out her phone again and ordered what she needed to make her home Raven-friendly.

Rio met Tony Stark Wednesday afternoon when he picked Morgan up from basketball practice. He was standing in front of the gym a few minutes before practice was scheduled to let out, and she walked up to him wearing a bright smile.

‚ÄúHey, Tony! Morgan did great on her semester final today. I just finished grading it.‚Äù Rio said, stopping in front of him. It was true Morgan had crushed the paper portion, and Rio expected she would do just as well on the lab portion the following day.

Tony flashed a smile at Rio.

‚ÄúHey Rio, She‚Äôs actually been studying with Nicky,‚Äù he sounded surprised, ‚Äúhe‚Äôs Agatha‚Äôs kid, so of course he‚Äôs smart. I just thought I‚Äôd have to separate them more.‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause he‚Äôs Agatha‚Äôs son?‚Äù Rio raised an eyebrow questioningly.

Tony suddenly remembered that Rio was dating Agatha but didn‚Äôt let his demeanor change.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs your girlfriend. Tell me I‚Äôm wrong to think that.‚Äù

Rio had hoped he would reply that way.

‚ÄúDid Pepper worry that Morgan would run through teenage boys like you ran through women?‚Äù

Shock crossed Tony‚Äôs face before he was able to control it. He had not been expecting that from her. ‚ÄúOkay, maybe I deserved that‚Äù

‚ÄúNicky is a great kid, Tony. I‚Äôm sorry for whatever past transpired with you and Agatha but, it‚Äôs been years. More importantly, it has nothing to do with Nicky. Leave the kid out of it, please..‚Äù She was still smiling, and her tone was still very friendly.

Tony felt zero animosity towards Rio, even though he knew he should.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre still teenagers. What about him wanting to drive?‚Äù

‚ÄúDidn‚Äôt you at that age? Or did you want your dad‚Äôs drivers watching your every move? He just got his license, Tony. It‚Äôs one of the few times he can drive other minors without an adult. Yes, they‚Äôre teenagers. Smart ones that were raised well. Pepper did a good job with Morgan, and Wanda had a fabulous influence on Nicky.‚Äù Rio knew that while Tony found Agatha difficult to work with, he adored Wanda.

Tony nodded as Morgan burst out of the gym doors, waving to the other girls on the team and walking to where her father and teacher stood, eyeing them both. ‚ÄúDoes this mean I failed?‚Äù Her eyes darted between both of them nervously.

‚ÄúYes, you‚Äôre grounded.‚Äù Tony said, and Rio answered, ‚ÄúYou crushed it, Morgan!‚Äù

Rio looked at Tony and rolled her eyes.

‚ÄúNo, you did a great job, Maguna. I‚Äôm proud of you.‚Äù Tony smiled at his daughter. Tony, an arrogant Hollywood heir and proud dad. He turned to Rio and let out a defeated sigh.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm only doing this because you made a compelling argument.‚Äù he turned back to the sixteen-year-old, who looked at him questioningly. ‚ÄúCall your boyfriend and tell him to look decent for the dance on Saturday.‚Äù

Morgan‚Äôs face lit up as she hugged her dad and then Rio before leading her dad away, telling him about the dance‚Äôs theme before calling Nicky.

Rio smiled as she walked back to her classroom before meeting up with Alice. They both were staying late. She entered her classroom as she received a text and grinned.

Agatha üíú

You‚Äôre Nicky‚Äôs favorite person.

Morgan told him it was you.

Rio shouldn‚Äôt have been surprised. Teenagers were fast, and of course, he had already messaged Agatha about it.

Me:

I told you I‚Äôd handle Tony.

Agatha üíú

Thank you for that.

He‚Äôs extremely excited about driving.

Have to get back to filming.

Agatha sent the text and had been so close to typing something else but didn‚Äôt. Not before she told Rio everything, especially not in a text, that was immature and stupid. No, she pushed that feeling down and back into its box where it needed to stay. Instead, she typed something much safer.

Agatha üíú

You‚Äôre my favorite person, by the way.

There. That was safe, but she didn‚Äôt want to see the reply right now. Instead, she put her phone away and walked back onto the set.

Rio saw the text, and a giant smile crept onto her face.

Me:

I need a plaque that says

‚ÄúFavorite Woman of the Harkness

Family‚Äù

Achievement of a lifetime.

Me:

You‚Äôre my favorite too, Agatha.

She was still smiling as she put her phone in her pocket. She gathered her backpack and lunchbox when she heard footsteps.

‚ÄúAlmost ready, Alice,‚Äù She said, turning as her eyes landed on Lilia. ‚ÄúOh, Ms. Calderu! I thought you‚Äôd have left by now.‚Äù It was five, and while it was finals week, Rio expected teachers and coaches to be at school, not her boss.

Lilia gave her a polite smile that didn‚Äôt quite reach her eyes as she took her usual spot on top of a desk and gestured for Rio to sit. Rio was automatically filled with panic as Lilia never stayed for very long as she perched on a stool.

‚ÄúI saw you speaking with Tony Stark.‚Äù It was a statement, not a question.

‚ÄúYes, ma‚Äôam, Nicky wanted to take‚Ä¶‚Äù Rio was interrupted by Lilia before she could explain.

‚ÄúI know the situation.‚Äù Lilia crossed her legs at the knee, clasping her hands over where they connected. This woman had to be psychic, how could she know already too?

‚ÄúRio, I‚Äôm happy for you both and the way you handled Tony. Only a few can do so, myself included. Just remember that you have to put your own oxygen mask on first. Has Agatha put hers on?‚Äù She stood up and glided towards the open door before turning back to Rio, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry if I worried you, but you already had that heavy backpack on, and I didn‚Äôt want you to hurt your back. You‚Äôre rubbing the left side of your chest. It‚Äôs your tell when you're nervous.‚Äù She turned back to the door, ‚ÄúSee you at the dance on Saturday. Tell Agatha to wear a shirt under her suit. Four school days to go!‚Äù She called as she left.

Rio sat on the stool for a few minutes. Oxygen masks? Has Agatha put hers on? The fuck? She blew a breath out between her lips as Alice came in.

‚ÄúWhat was that about? I saw Calderu come out of here.‚Äù She gestured with her head for them both to leave.

Rio rose from the stool and followed Alice out of the building. She recapped what Lilia had said, even about her nervous stim.

‚ÄúOh, you always do that as a self-soothing technique. Since we were kids.‚Äù Alice noted.

‚ÄúWhat do you think she means?‚Äù Rio asked as she put her seatbelt on and started the car.

Alice just shrugged. ‚ÄúWho knows? She‚Äôs known Agatha forever and knows everything in general anyway. The vague comments don‚Äôt help.‚Äù

Rio thought as she drove. Lilia‚Äôs sporadic appearances and cryptic ‚Äòadvice‚Äô were slightly unnerving to her. She shrugged it off. The next Tuesday would be the last day of school for the semester, and they would have a break. She could work through whatever this was then. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right, Nicky‚Äôs gone to SHIELD since Pre-K.‚Äù She acknowledged.

‚ÄúOh, Lilia and Agatha were friends before then.‚Äù Alice supplied as she texted Jen.

Rio raised an eyebrow. She vaguely remembered Alice mentioning that once but had forgotten the context.

‚ÄúBefore SHIELD was as big as it is, not that it‚Äôs huge, some teachers would privately tutor child stars. Lilia was one of Agatha‚Äôs teachers. That‚Äôs how Lilia hooked Agatha up with the right lawyers during the trial when Agatha was sixteen.‚Äù

Alice reminded Rio.

Rio had forgotten that Lilia had been the one to help Agatha out all those lifetimes ago.

‚ÄúOh, right. She does know a lot about Agatha then. No wonder she‚Äôs been dropping random things this semester and winning so many of the dating pool bets.‚Äù Rio laughed.

‚ÄúBitch won the whole damn thing because she knows your story too!‚Äù Alice groaned.

‚ÄúSorry, there, sister-friend. No one beats Lilia Calderu, apparently.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Finals week had ended and things had gone well. Rio and Agatha hadn‚Äôt seen each other since Tuesday and Rio felt very teenage girl about it. She had just gotten home and set her school bag down when she heard the text alert.

Agatha üíú

Come over, bring Raven.

You‚Äôre staying all weekend.

Bring what you need for Monday.

Please.

Rio looked around at her home, she didn‚Äôt have any chores to do, and laundry was caught up. Taking Raven was such a hassle though, it was like packing for an infant. She also needed to start keeping clothes at Agatha‚Äôs.

Me:

Raven has more paraphernalia

than an infant.

Agatha üíú

I said Raven, not her

accessories. I may have

done some shopping.

Agatha then sent pictures of a litterbox, and the pet cameras that were already set up in various rooms so Rio could still check on the cat, auto feeder, and Raven‚Äôs food. Rio was impressed as she felt her heart melt. This woman knew exactly how to get to her.

Me:

I see how it is. I

win over your son,

you win over my cat?

Agatha üíú

I think we‚Äôre past that part.

I just know she‚Äôs an integral

part of you staying here for

more than one night at a

time.

Hadn‚Äôt Agatha figured out by now that she had won Rio over? She was right about Raven, though. Even if Rio checked in on the ancient cat while she was at Agatha‚Äôs. She smiled as she went to pack her bag.

Raven wasn‚Äôt happy about the car ride, but when she found Nicky‚Äôs room, she forgave Rio. Rio dropped her bag and dress off in Agatha‚Äôs room and returned to the kitchen, where Agatha had dinner ready.

‚ÄúIs Nicky at the clubhouse?‚Äù Rio gave Agatha a chaste kiss as she took their plates to the table.

Agatha grabbed their drinks and followed, ‚ÄúNo, he took Morgan out on a date.‚Äù

Rio had a look of shock on her face as she placed their plates on the table and lowered herself to her seat. ‚ÄúA date tonight AND a dance tomorrow? I AM good!‚Äù

Agatha let out a breathy laugh, ‚ÄúAccording to Pepper, Morgan told Tony she REALLY likes Nicky, so they are going on a double date. Chaperoned by Tony and Pepper.‚Äù

Rio placed her hand over her mouth as she tried to suppress her laughter, and failed. ‚ÄúOh no, poor Nicky.‚Äù Rio let out in between breaths.

Rio‚Äôs laughter was contagious, and Agatha began to laugh as well. ‚ÄúHe made Nicky drive so he could judge his skills,‚Äù Agatha added.

Rio‚Äôs laughter died down, ‚ÄúThe poor boy. That will cause anxiety.‚Äù

Agatha had taken a bite of the steak taco she had made and was still chewing as she nodded and swallowed.

‚ÄúHe was still muttering ‚Äòhands at ten and two‚Äô when he left.‚Äù She looked at Rio‚Äôs plate, ‚ÄúHow are you finished? You were talking and laughing!‚Äù She exclaimed, laughing herself. She was adjusting to Rio‚Äôs quirks and found them adorable.

Rio shrugged, ‚ÄúIt just happens! Raven helped, too.‚Äù

Agatha looked down to see the cat gazing up at her, licking her lips. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre worse than a dog.‚Äù She remarked.

‚ÄúThose are fighting words,‚Äù Rio retorted.

Agatha found that being with Rio was easy. Their conversations, banter, choosing movies, and even just how they fit together when they sat and cuddled. It had been this way since they met, and Agatha knew how rare that was. Even when they made‚Ä¶uh had sex, everything came easily. It was like they already knew each other‚Äôs bodies and preferences. Agatha had never truly believed in the concept of soulmates. That theory had been shot down when she was young.

They had been lying in bed at Sword‚Äôs ‚Äòsecret‚Äô apartment where they would meet. Agatha was 25 and traced the older woman‚Äôs collarbone with her fingers as their eyes met. Swords was actually looking at her lovingly, and Agatha blushed.

‚ÄúWhat are you thinking, my pet?‚Äù Swords had asked.

Agatha was afraid to tell her but did it anyway.

‚ÄúDo you believe in soulmates?‚Äù The younger woman whispered timidly.

Swords‚Äô eyes filled with sadness for Agatha as she suddenly sat up and looked at her, gathering the blankets in front of her naked chest.

‚ÄúAgatha, we are not soulmates.‚Äù She said firmly.

Agatha looked away. She had sat up as well, pulling her knees close to her chest. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt say that we were. I was just asking what your thoughts were on the subject.‚Äù Agatha had fixed her expression and no longer felt like she would cry as she turned back to look at the woman she had loved for years.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe in soulmates, Agatha.‚Äù Swords said as if she were slamming a door closed on a conversation. Her face softened a bit.

‚ÄúAs famous as you are and will continue to be, Agatha? If you remain in this career? You shouldn‚Äôt either.‚Äù

Rio shifted in Agatha‚Äôs arms as she slept, bringing Agatha out of her memories. The slants of moonlight highlighted the scars on Rio‚Äôs side. Agatha lightly ran her fingers along Rio‚Äôs ribcage, causing her to nuzzle further into Agatha. Agatha was having a difficult time finding sleep as she was plagued with guilt. She pulled Rio closer and whispered.

‚ÄúPlease don‚Äôt become another scar.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The coven had arrived to chaperone the winter formal before the boys did and had taken the opportunity to speak with other parents. When the boys and their dates arrived, the coven had taken pictures, much to the teens‚Äô dismay. Morgan‚Äôs dark brown hair was down in tight curls, and she wore a strapless floor-length red dress with black heels. Tommy‚Äôs date, Cassie Lang, had her light brown hair pulled up, her green halter dress stopped just below the knee, and with black ballet flats. The boys wore black suits and bowties that matched their date‚Äôs dresses. Billy and Eddie complemented each other in shades of blue.

The dance went well. Rio did her best to sing loudly and embarrass her students. For a few minutes, no one could find four of the six teens, but they returned, saying they had gone to the restroom.

Rio watched as the students got too close to each other or tried to sneak off to dark corners, and she went to haul them back to a more populated area.

Agatha laughed. ‚ÄúIs this what teaching is like?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know, it‚Äôs not much different. With this age group, it really is 65% keeping them from touching each other.‚Äù Rio laughed as she shot a look at a few students lingering by the refreshments.

‚ÄúThankfully, these guys aren‚Äôt huge into fighting,‚Äù Alice added.

‚ÄúI fought a lot,‚Äù Nat remembered.

‚ÄúShocker,‚Äù Wanda smirked.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre all standing too close. Leave room for Jesus.‚Äù Jen barked, causing Wanda and Nat to step apart, Alice to roll her eyes, and Agatha to pull Rio into her.

The last song, a slow song popular with the kids, played when Agatha noticed that Nicky had pulled something out of his pocket. He saw that his mom was watching him, so he grinned and rolled his eyes toward the ceiling, clicking the button. Pounds of white glitter, confetti, streamers, and feathers shot out of cannons above them. While the sounds were startling, once it was discovered what was happening, people laughed, throwing handfuls of confetti and glitter at each other. It was a harmless prank, though a few people slipped, but nothing too bad, Agatha thought.

Agatha leaned toward Wanda, ‚ÄúThese are the pranks I can handle.‚Äù

Wanda sighed, ‚ÄúI was worried about them stealing chemicals from Rio‚Äôs lab.‚Äù

Nicky and Tommy had overheard them as they walked up, both looking hurt at the admission.

‚ÄúWe would never do that Mom! Well, not to Rio, specifically.‚Äù Nicky said as Tommy nodded. Agatha hugged them all as everything ended, and the gym lights came back on.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre decent kids,‚Äù Agatha told them.

‚ÄúJust decent?‚Äù Nicky grinned.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt push it,‚Äù She said sarcastically.

‚ÄúCan I drive everyone home, Mom? I promise to drive the girls and Eddie straight home and then the three of us, please? I have Mr. Stark‚Äôs permission. If it‚Äôs okay with the other parents?‚Äù Nicky asked.

Agatha looked over at Wanda. She knew that Nicky was a rather safe driver and had become pretty responsible, minor pranks aside. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm okay with it, Wanda?‚Äù

‚ÄúI trust him with the twins. Just make sure the other adults agree.‚Äù Wanda nodded, her voice slightly nervous as she looked at Nat, who squeezed her hand and nodded in agreement.

Agatha inhaled deeply before turning to Rio. She knew this was an important step, and she could easily twist it to be less than what it actually was. ‚ÄúThoughts? These are your kids, after all, and I know you care about them. You also know Nicky‚Äôs reaction times.‚Äù

Rio was slightly shocked, this wasn‚Äôt her decision to make, and she saw through Agatha‚Äôs facade. Agatha was sharing a parenting decision with Rio and testing the waters.

‚ÄúNicky can handle five other people in the car and tune out distractions if you ask my professional opinion. As your girlfriend, I say let him have this.‚Äù She smiled and kissed Agatha.

Eddie and Cassie‚Äôs parents had agreed, and the six teens left. They were in a rather large, safe SUV, and no one was too worried as the roads were dry, and even though it was dark, the sky was clear.

The women had stayed to help clean up as Lilia pulled Agatha aside.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs been hurt, and if you‚Äôre not completely honest with her, it will only cause more damage.‚Äù The older woman mused as she swept up glitter.

Agatha scoffed. ‚ÄúWhat would you know about honesty?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve grown a lot as I‚Äôve aged. Now, if you‚Äôll excuse me, your son‚Äôs prank caused a few slight injuries. Glitter and eyeballs don‚Äôt mix, and I need to find Jen and do damage control.‚Äù Lilia handed the broom and dustpan to Agatha and hurried away.

Agatha looked after her and shook her head as Wanda drew up beside her. ‚ÄúWhat was that about?‚Äù

‚ÄúOur sons‚Äô prank caused minor eye damage. A few kids got glitter in their eyes.‚Äù Agatha said flatly.

Wanda shrugged, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had glitter in our eyes plenty of times. I‚Äôm more worried about the kids that slipped on feathers.‚Äù Wanda looked around. Everyone was fine and had a good time, and no one was seriously injured. ‚ÄúLilia‚Äôs just bent out of shape because she didn‚Äôt catch them first.‚Äù

Agatha half-smirked. ‚ÄúShe does hate it when they get one over on her.‚Äù



‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

They were back at Agatha‚Äôs, comfortable clothes on, as Jen ranted about having to talk a few parents down from their precious babies having glitter in their eyes or slipping on something.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs glitter! They‚Äôre always around glitter! These kids are idiots! They‚Äôre more likely to do something a hundred times dumber at school. Most of them were laughing about it!‚Äù Her hands were flying through the air as Alice sat next to her, drinking some fancy craft beer, trying not to laugh.

‚ÄúBabe, she‚Äôs just trying to make sure there are no slip-ups or cracks. She‚Äôs been pretty tightly wound since Agatha filled her in on everything.‚Äù Alice put a comforting hand on her girlfriend's thigh as Jen relaxed slightly.

Nat‚Äôs phone rang, and she left the room, speaking quietly in Russian. Wanda and Agatha were straining to hear.

‚ÄúI think it was cute, and the pictures came out great. Agatha, Rogers sent me this one of us,‚Äù Rio leaned over to show Agatha a picture of glitter swirling around them as they looked at each other, laughing. ‚ÄúPeggy took it, obviously.‚Äù

Nat came rushing back in. Agatha and Wanda hadn‚Äôt been able to hear her side of the conversation.

‚ÄúSF was released this morning. No one knows where she went. She‚Äôs not in San Francisco.‚Äù She was trying to keep a calm face, but her eyes were full of panic.

Jen looked at her phone to check the time and went back to the others.

‚ÄúWhy aren‚Äôt the boys back? It‚Äôs not like them to not check-in.‚Äù

Agatha felt dread seep into her bones as her phone rang at the same time Wanda‚Äôs did. They locked eyes as they both answered them with shaky hands. They had read the names on their caller IDs.

Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.

Agatha answered as a nurse explained that Nicky had been in an accident with three other people, two boys and a girl, Morgan. She would be the last one to take home , Agatha thought. They would get more details at the hospital, but they needed to get there as soon as possible.

They had already been on the move once their phones had rung. Nat called Vision to meet them at the hospital as he was out with friends. Jen and Alice were getting keys to the Tahoe so they could all go in one vehicle.

Nat drove, and no one commented on their speed or the fact that zero traffic laws were being obeyed. Wanda sat in front, white-knuckling Nat‚Äôs thigh, face pale. Agatha looked like a ghost, and Rio wrapped her arms around her, trying to provide some sort of comfort. Jen and Alice had remained quiet, Jen looking for news stories and searching police scanners.

They ran into the emergency room, where a nurse opened a door and pointed down a hallway to a set of chairs where Pepper sat with Morgan and Tommy. Morgan was wearing a pair of sweats that her parents had most likely brought her and had a small bandage on her forehead. Tommy had taken his suit jacket off, and his shirt had some dried blood on it. He had a few cuts on his face, and his wrist was in an ace bandage. Tony leaned against a wall.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about fucking time!‚Äù Tony Spat. ‚ÄúNone of your phones were working!‚Äù

Morgan nodded. ‚ÄúThe boys' phones auto-dialed when we were in the crash, and nothing happened.‚Äù

Tommy jumped from his seat to run to his mom when he heard Tony speak.

‚ÄúMom! It happened so fast, Billy.‚Äù He started sobbing into his Mom‚Äôs hair.

Agatha looked around for the other two boys, grabbing Rio‚Äôs hand and clearing the lump in her throat before asking.

‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs Nicky and Billy?‚Äù

‚ÄúDad!‚Äù Tommy shouted as Vision joined them and hugged his father, still crying.

Wanda held on to Nat, not giving a single fuck what anyone saw or thought.

Pepper had started to speak when a doctor came through the double doors and looked at the large group that had gathered.

‚ÄúMs. Harkness, Mr. and Mrs. Maximoff, may I speak to the three of you?‚Äù The surgeon asked asked them.

Agatha kept hold of Rio‚Äôs hand as she walked a few steps off with him. He introduced himself as Dr. Walker, and Wanda held on to Nat, though Vision told Tommy to remain with the others. Walker lifted an eyebrow at the addition of the other two women but said nothing.

‚ÄúMs. Harkness, Nicky received the most impact. When he swerved to miss the other car and was essentially run off the road, the front of the vehicle hit a tree, causing the airbags to inflate. He crossed his arms in front of his face, which, upon impact with the airbags, broke his left arm. He also has scratches from the glass, which were treated. We‚Äôre watching his head for any brain bleeding, and he‚Äôs in surgery. His appendix ruptured, and he has three broken ribs and a punctured lung. But everything is going well.‚Äù

Agatha wasn‚Äôt sure how she was still breathing or standing. Tears were running down her cheeks as she sobbed and turned into Rio.

Rio held her tightly, tears running down her face as well, but trying to hold it together for Agatha.

Dr. Walker looked at the Maximoffs. Wanda was crying for Nicky, her hand on Agatha‚Äôs back. ‚ÄúTommy has a wrist sprain, and he protected the girl, Morgan.‚Äù He turned back toward Agatha, ‚ÄúMorgan has a cut above her eye, but that‚Äôs it. Make sure to ask her why. You‚Äôll be proud of your son, Ms. Harkness.‚Äù He turned back to the three adults before him. ‚ÄúBilly hit his head hard against the glass. He has a pretty serious head injury and is unconscious right now, but he‚Äôll be okay. He‚Äôs had stitches, and we‚Äôre watching for brain swelling. He‚Äôll need to be here for a day or so.‚Äù

He nodded to both families and went back to the operating room. Wanda was relieved and felt terrible for feeling that way. They rejoined the others, and Nat relayed the information to everyone. Rio looked at Morgan, her face a giant question mark.

‚ÄúNicky wouldn‚Äôt let me sit in the front seat. We dropped Cassie and Eddie off, and then he made me get in the back. He said the drive to my place had a potential for deer, and the roads were darker, so no one was allowed to sit up front. Then, when the car came into our lane, and Nicky veered off the road so we wouldn‚Äôt hit it, he yelled, ‚ÄòTommy, get Morgan,‚Äô and Tommy grabbed me, which is why his head didn‚Äôt go into the glass like Billy‚Äôs did. However, I did take some glass to the forehead.‚Äù Morgan touched the bandage on her head gingerly.

Agatha‚Äôs hand was over her mouth as Pepper stood and hugged her.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a good kid, Agatha. He‚Äôs going to be okay.‚Äù



Rio was upset. She was also livid. This wasn‚Äôt an accident. It had Lou written all over it. How far gone was she to go after CHILDREN?! Rio looked over at Jen.

‚ÄúAre you going to have to issue a statement?‚Äù Rio‚Äôs voice barely over a whisper.

Jen shrugged as she glanced at the multiple parents.

‚ÄúIt was a weekend accident with major injuries, so it was on the news. It will depend on what those six want.‚Äù Jen always included Nat when she mentioned the parents.

Nat walked over to Rio and put an arm around her shoulders.

‚ÄúI need you for a minute,‚Äù she said as she led her off to the side. ‚ÄúI need to go check out the scene, look at all of our phones, but you know‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio interrupted her. ‚ÄúIt had to be...‚Äù Rio‚Äôs phone went off, and she looked at Nat. They both knew who it was.

Blocked

Oh, my beautiful Rio. Not their kids.

They‚Äôd be safer without you around.

My children, our children, were always

safe with you around.

A picture of the kids with Rio was attached. Rio knew that the oldest had known, but the other two didn‚Äôt. Rio was just a good friend of their mom‚Äôs. They had been watching a movie and were all four in a pool, smiling.

Rio‚Äôs eyes filled with tears as she looked at Nat. ‚ÄúI have to tell Agatha myself.‚Äù

Nat nodded, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to track this. I had a feeling.‚Äù

Much to Morgan‚Äôs repeated protests, the Starks departed, though Rio promised to update them. As they left, Tony put his hand on Agatha‚Äôs shoulder and leaned close to her ear.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry for all the hell I‚Äôve given you, Harkness. He‚Äôs a good kid. His decision probably saved my daughter. Keep me updated.‚Äù

Alice and Jen had returned to the compound and Nat‚Äôs house, conveniently very close to the compound, to get clothes for those staying at the hospital, which would be Wanda, Nat, Agatha, and Rio.

Rio and Agatha sat in the cushioned chairs of the waiting room in the early hours of Sunday morning, waiting for Dr. Walker to give them an update. The Maximoffs had been able to see Billy, and while he was groggy, he was okay. He had a few bruises and a head injury, but he would make a full recovery. Once he had seen that his brother was okay, Vision was able to talk Tommy into going home and resting. Vision assured him that the best he could do for everyone was to go to Agatha‚Äôs and take care of Raven.

Nicky had taken the majority of the damage.

Rio was nervous but knew she had to tell Agatha that this was essentially her fault. She sighed as she squeezed Agatha‚Äôs hand. ‚ÄúAggie?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not your fault,‚Äù Agatha said automatically, voice full of care as she turned to look at Rio.

Rio was taken aback, ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt even know what I was going to say.‚Äù

‚ÄúNat told us Satan was released this morning, and then we got a call. It wasn‚Äôt that hard to do the math, babe. Then you and Nat went off to talk, and you‚Äôve been nervous since. What did the text say?‚Äù

Rio showed her the text, and Agatha rolled her lips, keeping them in a thin line.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not your fault,‚Äù Agatha repeated as she squeezed Rio‚Äôs hand. At that time, Dr. Walker came out, and Agatha stood and met him.

‚ÄúMs. Harkness, Nicky is going to be fine and make a full recovery.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio had called Lilia early Sunday morning and taken the two days of that week off, starting her winter break early. Lilia had understood.

‚ÄúEven the strongest of towers need support, especially during storms,‚Äù Lilia had said. That message, Rio had understood.

Nicky was in a private ICU room, though considering who his mom was, the limited number of guests had been wavered. He was being kept in a medically induced coma for a day while his lung was being monitored, and Agatha sat at his side. Nat walked in and flopped on the couch next to Wanda with a defeated sigh. It was just the four women and Nicky in the room, and they could speak freely.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs bouncing her signal all over the place, so I can‚Äôt locate her. A cell tower was mysteriously down which caused our phones not to take calls for a bit last night. All I know is she‚Äôs not in the country.‚Äù Nat explained angrily.

All eyes turned to Rio, who shook her head, ‚ÄúShe has multiple places to hide. She was always good with investments. Shane too. So even with the divorce, that‚Äôs not an issue.‚Äù She explained.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôd she get released?‚Äù Wanda asked.

‚ÄúGood lawyers and technicalities,‚Äù Nat answered. ‚ÄúNo evidence of child endangerment apparent. She signed all of her rights over to Shane. There‚Äôs no hard evidence that it was her last night. It‚Äôs all circumstantial. I‚Äôve reached out to some former contacts that are more global. They all have very specific orders.‚Äù She finished, looking at Agatha seriously.

Agatha nodded. ‚ÄúGood. Right now, I‚Äôll make it through the winter if it kills me.‚Äù

Rio was starting to worry that it might, if Nat didn‚Äôt find Lou soon.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Billy was released on Monday, and Nicky was released the day after. The news had leaked, and Jen had released a statement on behalf of the family. An unknown driver had run Nicky off the road, and Nicky used his best judgment. All passengers were safe, and all parents were very grateful that it wasn‚Äôt worse. The families asked that everyone respect their privacy at the time. The Starks made a similar statement adding that Nicky had made sure Morgan was sitting in the back to begin with and had made sure everyone was as safe as possible.

‚ÄúHarkness, Maximoff, and Stark Teens in Car Accident‚Äù

‚ÄúCedars-Sinai Reportedly Treats Children of Stars‚Äù

‚ÄúAccident or Intentional?‚Äù

The headlines continued, some truly harmless, some speculating.

‚ÄúSo Nicky is a knight in shining armor? Refusing to let his girlfriend sit in the front seat because it‚Äôs dangerous at night? Someone find me a Harkness!‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Tony and Agatha famously hate each other? How are their kids dating?‚Äù

‚ÄúRomeo and Juliet?‚Äù

‚ÄúReportedly, Pepper and Agatha get along.‚Äù

‚ÄúRio‚Äôs a teacher, right? She can negotiate with anyone. Even directors.‚Äù

‚ÄúI hope the twins are okay! Agatha breaks up with Wanda and then her sons are in a car accident with Agatha‚Äôs son.‚Äù

‚ÄúWanda and Agatha were not dating, get a grip.‚Äù

‚ÄúSome people that were at the hospital took pictures of them! Rio was there to comfort Agatha!‚Äù

‚ÄúLorna Wu‚Äôs fucking daughter is Rio‚Äôs best friend!‚Äù

‚ÄúWanda was leaning on the bodyguard for support, not Vision.‚Äù

‚ÄúWomen are just more supportive, Wanda is straight.‚Äù

‚ÄúPeople. This is about the KIDS.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe hug Pepper is giving Agatha looks a little too personal.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Agatha Harkness.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just glad the kids are okay and I hope they find the asshole that ran them off the road.‚Äù

It was too much for Rio. Comments were all over the place, and she needed to stop reading them. Her own socials were flooded, asking if everyone was okay. Why were people so parasocial all of a sudden? She shook her head and looked over at Agatha, who was asleep and curled in a ball on the couch. He wasn‚Äôt thrilled, but he needed to wait until his ribs weren‚Äôt as tender before climbing the stairs several times a day. Rio guided them up the stairs, through Agatha‚Äôs bedroom, and into the bathroom. They had taken quick showers at some point at the hospital, but Rio didn‚Äôt think that counted as really getting clean. That was removing a basic layer of germs. ‚ÄúYou've been holding a lot in. Keeping a mask on for everyone else.‚Äù Rio said honestly as she turned Agatha around and began to wash her hair.

‚ÄúPardon?‚Äù Agatha said with a French accent as Rio massaged her scalp, and Agatha let a moan slip.
