‚ÄúFine,‚Äù Agatha said curtly.

‚ÄúAnd you call me a brat?‚Äù Rio teased.

They were sitting in the bed in lounge clothes. Nicky had been checked on and was still asleep with his feline protector. Rio was sitting with her back against the headboard, Agatha‚Äôs head on her shoulder as Rio stroked her hair.

‚ÄúAgatha, talk.‚Äù

Agatha sighed.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just a lot. I don‚Äôt blame you at all. You cannot control what that psycho does.‚Äù

Agatha really did not blame Rio. Would this have happened if she and Rio weren‚Äôt dating? No. Did she want a life where she wasn‚Äôt dating Rio? No. What she wanted was a world where Lou Falco wasn‚Äôt a problem, and she had people working on that. She had learned a long time ago that she couldn‚Äôt control everything or what other people did. She could, however, arrange for those people to be taken care of.

‚ÄúThe important part is that I raised my son to be mindful of his surroundings and to think. It could have been so much worse. Vision taught him well, too. I‚Äôm not discounting that man's driving lessons. I sent him out in a tank of a vehicle, and that was absolutely the correct choice. He didn‚Äôt want to take any other car.‚Äù She chuckled, ‚ÄúHe said Tony would want her in the safest vehicle we own, Mom.‚Äù She mimicked her son.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs good that you can acknowledge all of that, babe. Thank you for not blaming me. I blame myself. I know I brought this all down on everyone.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo. She made that decision. You did nothing.‚Äù Agatha yawned. ‚ÄúMy biggest fear is losing Nicky and then the people I love and care for. This is the closest I‚Äôve ever gotten to that, and it was terrifying.‚Äù

Agatha wasn‚Äôt sure when she started to cry, but she knew there were tears on Rio‚Äôs shirt now.

‚ÄúI was afraid. Afraid for everyone else, but also because I love those kids, especially Nicky. He truly means a lot to me, Agatha.‚Äù Rio finished with a whisper.

The gravity of the admittance hit Agatha right in the heart. Agatha knew how she felt for Rio, but she had to tell her everything, and this just wasn‚Äôt quite the right time for that.

‚ÄúThank you for being there with me and not leaving my side. Only Wanda and Nat have done that for me. Thank you, that means so much.‚Äù Agatha sat up and looked at Rio. ‚ÄúI can do anything with YOU by MY side, Rio.‚Äù Agatha kissed her softly before settling into the bed and pulling Rio down with her, laying back on Rio‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúNow, what do you want for Christmas?‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The following week leading up to Christmas was full of adjustments and healing. Until Nicky‚Äôs ribs felt better, he had to stay downstairs, and the twins spent more time at Agatha‚Äôs instead of everyone being at the Clubhouse. Tommy‚Äôs wrist had healed quickly and Billy‚Äôs injury was starting to fade. Morgan hung out too, not because she felt obligated, but because she genuinely wanted to. Throw in Eddie and Cassie, and Agatha felt like her home was turning into a teenage hangout.

‚ÄúThis is literally why we have a separate house for them,‚Äù Agatha bemoaned while sitting in Wanda‚Äôs living room two days before Christmas. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like it here as much.‚Äù

Wanda rolled her eyes.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just mad because you and Rio haven‚Äôt had much alone time.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve spent most of our time at Rio‚Äôs but come back at night. Still, I‚Äôd like for there not to be six children eating me out of house and home.‚Äù Agatha said as she wrapped a present for Nicky.

‚ÄúHey! I foot half that bill, thank you!‚Äù Wanda laughed as she threw a gift bow at her sister.

Nat walked into the room at the separate piles of gifts and the mounds of gift-wrapping paraphernalia.

‚ÄúI still don‚Äôt see why you two don‚Äôt just wrap a few things yourselves and hire someone else to do the rest. You know, like all your other famous friends do?‚Äù Nat mused before sitting down and grabbing a present to help. ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs everyone else?‚Äù She asked.

‚ÄúJen and Alice are packing and showing Jen‚Äôs house, I think is what they said?‚Äù Wanda answered as she finished another gift and placed it in the Billy stack.

‚ÄúRio said she had things to do at her place.‚Äù Agatha shrugged.

‚ÄúVision is playing racquetball with Herb but should be home soon,‚Äù Wanda added.

‚ÄúNever beating the dating allegations,‚Äù Nat smirked as she wrote on a gift tag.

‚ÄúI wonder what Rio got you for Christmas, Aggie?‚Äù

Wanda grinned and looked at Agatha. She was looking forward to seeing someone who was actually dating Agatha give her a gift. Wanda had never witnessed it before. From what she could remember, Agatha‚Äôs secret girlfriend never gave her anything, and if she had, Agatha had never talked about it.

‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt have to give me a present.‚Äù Agatha kept wrapping gifts, partially ignoring the looks of the other two.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so hard getting gifts for women that have or can buy anything they want or need,‚Äù Nat spoke from experience.

‚ÄúYou are not to get me anything for Christmas. We file the divorce papers, and then it‚Äôs our personal Christmas.‚Äù Wanda said, looking at Nat as if she were prey.

‚ÄúI am well aware.‚Äù Nat returned the same look.

‚ÄúI am literally right here. Not waiting until it‚Äôs finalized there, kids?‚Äù Agatha raised an eyebrow.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll wait for it to be finalized before we get engaged. However, it‚Äôs been 20 years, so, no.‚Äù Wanda said, voice serious.

‚ÄúWell, we‚Äôll make sure to be nowhere near here.‚Äù Agatha grinned. ‚ÄúYou better still get this one an actual present though. You know she‚Äôll pout if you don‚Äôt,‚Äù Agatha added, looking at Nat.

Nat just looked at the task at hand and smiled as Wanda shot Agatha a look.



Rio stood at her kitchen table with her project spread in front of her. All of her presents were wrapped, and this was the last thing she had left to complete. Agatha‚Äôs present was ninety-nine percent completed, and she was putting the final touches on it. She wrote one final word on the last page before putting it together and wrapping it. She was nervous but couldn‚Äôt wait to give it to Agatha. It would either go incredibly well or burst into flames. She cleaned up the table, threw trash away, and put the scissors, glue, tape, and other supplies back where they belonged. They would be spending the next few days at Agatha‚Äôs and she had replenished the clothes in her duffel and gathered all the gifts in a bag. Raven was still at Agatha‚Äôs as the feline refused to move from Nicky‚Äôs side unless necessary. She was often curled up next to his ribs as if she were trying to heal them faster. Nicky told Raven she was helping.

Rio loaded everything in the wagon she used to take things to the car so she didn‚Äôt have to make more than one trip. She was getting ready to leave when someone knocked. She froze as she wasn‚Äôt expecting anyone. She really needed to get a video doorbell or start tracking everyone. ‚ÄúWho is it?‚Äù Rio called as she walked cautiously toward the door, picking up a potted plant in case she needed to smash it over someone‚Äôs head.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Jen, and I‚Äôll use my key if I have to,‚Äù Jen called back.

Rio released a breath she didn‚Äôt realize she was holding as she unlocked and opened the door. Jen‚Äôs eyes immediately went down to the plant.

‚ÄúWere you going to fend someone off with a love fern?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a love fern, and if needed, yes.‚Äù Rio sat the plant back down as she let Jen in, closing and locking the door behind her. ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you text or call?‚Äù Rio asked as Jen stood in front of the couch. She looked nervous, and Jennifer Kale was never nervous. ‚ÄúJen? Sit.‚Äù

Jen sat, her leg bouncing. This was not the calm, cool, and collected Jen that Rio was used to. ‚ÄúIs it Alice? Is she okay?‚Äù Rio sat down next to Jen, turning to look at her, concern etched on her face.

‚ÄúYes. Yes, it‚Äôs Alice, and yes, she‚Äôs okay, it‚Äôs just‚Ä¶‚Äù Jen‚Äôs voice shook, and she looked like she was going to cry. Rio put a hand on Jen‚Äôs for comfort.

‚ÄúBreathe, Jen. Do you need water? A beer? Anything.‚Äù Rio offered.

Jen took three deep breaths, regaining her composure. ‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm okay. I brought Alice back to her apartment, and I was going to leave but I made a last-minute decision. You‚Äôre the closest thing Alice has to family, and it‚Äôs old-fashioned and stupid, but I do love her, and I have for years.‚Äù

Jen‚Äôs face was soft and tears were forming. Rio realized that she had tears of her own forming. She knew what was coming, and at the same time, she was shocked that Jen was in front of her, giving her this speech.

‚ÄúI promise that I‚Äôll take care of her, and if I don‚Äôt, you may send Nat after me. Can I have your blessing to marry Alice?‚Äù

Jen scoffed, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not wrong. If it weren‚Äôt you, I wouldn‚Äôt. However, given your relationship and that you‚Äôre all the family she has, it felt right.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt does feel right. Yes, you have my blessing and/or curse to marry my sister. However, you have to do it with the right ring.‚Äù

When Gran got sick, we had strict instructions to keep the rings; whoever married first was to get them, and the other was supposed to give them to whoever proposed. So,‚Äù Rio had entered her closet, found where the safe was hidden, entered the code, grabbed the ring boxes, closed, locked, and concealed the safe and reappeared. Intimate.‚Äù She offered.

Everyone would gather at Agatha‚Äôs that afternoon to eat and exchange gifts, though the two families currently living at the compound did their Christmas mornings separately. Nicky had gotten everything he wanted, including a car, as long as he kept his grades up and the troublemaking to a harmless minimum. Nicky had gotten Rio a coffee cup as a gag gift that said ‚Äú#1 Stepdad‚Äù. His serious gift to her was a signed Phoenix Mercury jersey and a framed picture of all of them from the concert, and he had gotten Raven, a pillow for his bed.

‚ÄúDear World,

It seems that I was outed today, on Christmas of all days. People come out every day, and so many famous people belong to the LGBTQIA+ community these days that it shouldn‚Äôt be a big deal. The Wanda Maximoff.

The boys each had their dates, Nicky still with his broken arm, though his ribs were feeling better, which he attributed to a certain magical feline. He and Morgan were dancing to the best of his abilities with his arm in a sling a week and a half after the accident.

‚ÄúGood thing that‚Äôs me. I would be very upset if it weren‚Äôt.‚Äù Rio took the glass and pulled Agatha close to her.

She turned and looked at the phone as if it had started speaking, then looked back at Agatha.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay, baby, it‚Äôs just scare tactics.‚Äù Agatha ran her hand down Rio‚Äôs back.

It was January 1st, 2025, and the restraining order officially expired.

Chapter End Notes

Thank you so much for all the love you've shown! Kudos, comments, love on socials, etc.

Realistically, unless I start writing smaller chapters again, there are probably only a few chapters left. However, I want to make this a series and do a follow-up with one-shots of different moments of life. What would y'all like to see? There are some things I want to go back and do different POV's of, further into the future on some things, etc.

If that's something anyone would be interested in, of course.

Glitter On The Floor After The Party

Chapter Summary

The order has expired and New Year's Day is full of confrontations and confessions, leading into Golden Globes weekend.

Will Lou meet her end?
Will Agatha come clean? About everything?
Will our favorite idiots confess their feelings?
Will Death's Beloved win all the awards?

Chapter Notes

Trigger Warnings: Light violence, dangerous driving, Lou, heartbreak, mention of pregnancy loss (from personal experience, don't come at me), so much angst, hurt, and anger.

But then, not.
I'm here if anyone needs comfort or to talk. We're at the turning point, really.
Yes, it's another long chapter. You guys know me by now.

Thank you ALL so much for the comments, kudos, WE SURPASSED 10K views and I cried. I came back to writing after an extremely long time of not (as evidenced by the first few chapters) and this journey has been amazing. The love on the socials, just THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!

Thanks to my amazing Beta/Editor/AuDHD thought detangler.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It was New Year‚Äôs Day, barely after midnight, as Rio clung to Agatha and stared at her phone. ‚ÄúDo you think she‚Äôs actually here? In LA?‚Äù Rio wasn‚Äôt asking anyone specifically.

‚ÄúI was able to mask the tracking and finally pinpoint her. According to that, she‚Äôs here. As in about to crash the party.‚Äù Nat said, head whipping around.

‚ÄúWe will not be staying for that,‚Äù Agatha said firmly. ‚ÄúNat, divide up security. Stay with the Maximoffs. Jen and Alice are with them. Ri, carry your shoes and come with me.‚Äù Agatha took Rio‚Äôs hand after they both slipped their shoes off and led her in the opposite direction from the main exit.

This was a plan Agatha and Nat had already devised in case SF reared her gorgeous blonde head. Nat would separate the others into two cars and send them home, while Agatha and Rio would slip out the back. While it would look like they got into one of the standard large black SUVs, they would get into an unassuming black Subaru Outback capable of off-roading with Nat as the driver.

‚ÄúAgatha, you know I trust you, but where are we going?‚Äù Rio asked as she was led away from the door.

‚ÄúWe planned for her,‚Äù Agatha said over her shoulder as the power went out. They both stopped. ‚ÄúWe did not plan for that.‚Äù Thankfully, backup generators roared to life, and the power flickered back on. Agatha quickened their pace to where they were practically running as they burst through the back door. ‚ÄúOkay, go around the SUV and get in the Subaru,‚Äù Agatha instructed.

Rio flung open the passenger door to see Wanda.

‚ÄúShotgun.‚Äù Wanda waved.

‚ÄúNat, Wanda is supposed to be at the compound with everyone else!‚Äù Agatha admonished as she and Rio climbed in the back, buckling their seatbelts.

‚ÄúYou try telling her no.‚Äù Nat shot back as she pulled away from the building.

‚ÄúI have. Plenty of times.‚Äù

‚ÄúTo be fair, you‚Äôre not in love or sleeping with me.‚Äù Wanda turned around in her seat, smiling.

Agatha rolled her eyes.

Oh Cinderella, we didn‚Äôt

even get to dance.


Rio let out a feral scream, causing Nat to run off the road momentarily before correcting.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm tired of this! I hate this! Why can‚Äôt she just leave me alone?‚Äù Rio had tears in her eyes as Agatha held her hand. ‚ÄúAgatha, being with you has made me so happy, yet I have cried so much. I have caused you so much pain. We had to leave a party early, in a fucking getaway car, because of my ex. Thanksgiving and Christmas were partly ruined. The boys have been put in danger. Who knows what else she‚Äôll do? She had been looking at Agatha before looking at Wanda, who had turned around in her seat. She inhaled deeply. Darcy had upgraded the networks at the compound and all houses, as they hadn‚Äôt found a single bug anywhere. She hadn‚Äôt necessarily confessed to Rio as much as Rio had found out about it accidentally.

‚ÄúWell, Cinderella, looks like your Princess Charming from Hell is trying to collect on that dance,‚Äù Nat said as she looked in the rearview mirror. ‚ÄúEveryone, hold on. This is our exit.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt an‚Ä¶‚Äù Wanda started as Nat made a hard left onto a hidden dirt path, thankful there was no oncoming traffic on this particular backroad.

Nat didn‚Äôt slow the vehicle down as they bounced over the uneven terrain and careened around trees, following what seemed like an invisible path. Rio kept her eyes trained on the headlights behind them before they finally fell out of view. She turned around, slumping in her seat, ‚ÄúWhere are we?‚Äù

Agatha leaned close as a precaution before whispering, ‚ÄúSecret back entrance.‚Äù

They went through a gated entrance at the back of the compound, passing by the foundation of Alice and Jen‚Äôs house, the skeleton of the guest house, and around to the front of Agatha‚Äôs. As they exited the vehicle, Rio motioned for them to leave their phones in the car and stay outside for the moment.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if she can hear us through the phones, but I‚Äôm now highly paranoid, pumped full of adrenaline, and running on champagne fumes at one forty-five in the morning on New Year's Day. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a fan, what if‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha started before Rio put her fingers to Agatha‚Äôs lips.

‚ÄúPlease. Let me do this. We have to try and end this. If it doesn‚Äôt work, it doesn‚Äôt work. I still believe she won‚Äôt hurt me.‚Äù She removed her hand and kissed Agatha before she could respond.

Wanda and Nat exchanged looks. They weren‚Äôt as certain as Rio seemed to be.

Agatha swallowed the tears and confessions in her throat. ‚ÄúAlright,‚Äù she turned to Wanda, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs go superstar.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh! Wait!‚Äù Rio held up a hand before they entered the house. ‚ÄúRaven is staying here. They hate each other, and I do not trust Lou to be nice. Now, everyone, get your phones first.‚Äù

Rio stormed into the house first, where everyone was gathered. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt do this to everyone anymore, Aggie! I want this so much, but it‚Äôs just causing pain!‚Äù

‚ÄúWas that acting?‚Äù Agatha asked, looking at Alice.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure,‚Äù Wanda answered.


Nat had followed Rio outside. ‚ÄúHey, stop for a second!‚Äù She called out as Rio stopped right in front of her car, not turning. Nat stopped behind her, whispering. ‚ÄúShe does, you know. She just doesn‚Äôt know how to say it. Don‚Äôt give up on her.‚Äù

Nat put a firm hand on her shoulder. ‚ÄúLook, you have to go in there with a clear head, okay? Also, do you want this?‚Äù She offered a small handgun, not wanting to say the words aloud for fear of Lou‚Äôs eavesdropping.

Rio shook her head. She could shoot, but she didn‚Äôt want to. ‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm covered.‚Äù She said, brandishing a small knife. A rather creepy smile pulled at her lips.

‚ÄúScary bitch. Alright, go. We‚Äôll see you soon.‚Äù Nat let her go and stepped back as Rio left.


Rio was numb on the drive to her building, and facts swirled around her head.

Lou was insane and dangerous.

Lou loved Rio but felt like she owned her.

Lou viewed Rio as an object.

Agatha was amazing and wanted a life with Rio.

Agatha refused to find and/or admit her feelings.

Rio was not in love with Lou.

Rio had caused her friends a lot of problems.


Rio was madly in love with Agatha.

Rio felt her stomach churn.


She was conflicted. Rio knew she had these feelings for Agatha, but she hadn‚Äôt fully admitted them to anyone else. She should be able to share them, shouldn‚Äôt she? She had told Alice she wasn‚Äôt ready, but when would she be? What was holding her back? Was she waiting for Lou to disappear? Was she waiting on Agatha? When would she know?

She had to keep her head clear and protect the people she loved.

Rio was jolted out of her thoughts when her phone dinged, and her GPS showed a new location. Lou must be controlling her phone. Rio would have to tell Nat but couldn‚Äôt risk using the compromised cellphone.


Blocked

I have a surprise planned for us.

I can‚Äôt wait to see you.


Rio felt sick, but she also knew she needed to follow the GPS. She drove as it directed, trusting that Nat would be able to find her, and followed the automated voice to a fancy apartment building in an isolated nice area of town.



Nat saw the message mirrored on the clone of Rio‚Äôs phone as Rio turned in the opposite direction. She would have to follow discreetly.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs she doing?‚Äù Agatha asked from the passenger seat.

They had been able to convince everyone else to stay at the compound.

‚ÄúSF hacked Rio‚Äôs phone and sent her to a different location,‚Äù Nat responded, careful to follow from a distance. The route started to look familiar. ‚ÄúAgatha, are we headed to‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù Agatha interrupted. ‚ÄúMy condo.‚Äù She finished.

‚ÄúYou still own it?‚Äù

‚ÄúYep,‚Äù Agatha said with a pop.

‚ÄúHave you listed it?‚Äù Nat looked at her briefly before turning back to the road.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù she said with a sigh. ‚ÄúThis is going to be really bad.‚Äù

Nat nodded.

Agatha had learned from Swords that it was best to keep a separate place for flings and one-night stands. Her condo was out of the way, discreet, and everything she needed it to be. She had meant to list it and hadn‚Äôt yet, knowing she had to confess to Rio first. Then, she would sell it as a final symbol of shedding her past life.

Nat slammed her fist into the steering wheel, startling Agatha.

‚ÄúBlyat, Agatha! I threatened Rio so she would open up to you when YOU‚ÄôRE the idiot here! I have been keeping your extremely dark secrets for decades and making sure none of your poor decisions come back to bite you in the ass. Rio comes into our lives and, in a few months, does things that even you couldn‚Äôt do, Agatha. Yet YOU won‚Äôt tell her everything. I know there are secrets that Lorna took to the grave with her, but it‚Äôs time to confess all of those to Rio and finally tell her that you love her. She‚Äôs not going to wait for you forever, Agatha.‚Äù

Nat‚Äôs face matched her hair, and Agatha understood where her anger and frustration were coming from.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right,‚Äù Agatha whispered, staring straight ahead as they reached the building.

‚ÄúI know I am. Now, before we bust in there, we‚Äôll listen to the conversation to see when we need to save the day.‚Äù Nat had produced a laptop, and her fingers were flying across the keyboard.

‚ÄúHow?‚Äù

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a mic in the necklace that I can tap into,‚Äù Nat said as she brought up the audio. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, it‚Äôs ONLY for emergencies,‚Äù Nat added, seeing the look of concern on Agatha‚Äôs face.


Rio took a deep breath as she reached the building she had been directed to, trusting that Nat and Agatha weren‚Äôt far behind.


Blocked

Look at the row of

mailboxes. You‚Äôll be

Rio walked into the building. The doorman looked at her slightly confused before he nodded and greeted her by name. She walked the row of mailboxes and saw A.H. on the last one.

A.H.? Agatha Harkness? Why did Agatha have a condo here?

She took the elevator to the penthouse and stepped out before walking to the unit. 821. The numbers seemed familiar to Rio before it clicked, Lorna‚Äôs birthday, backward. January twenty-eighth. Rio approached the door and looked at the keypad on the door. If this really was Agatha‚Äôs place, then she knew the code would be the day the order to be free of her mother was granted. She prayed it wouldn‚Äôt work as she typed in the numbers. The light flashed green, and the lock clicked as she turned the knob and pushed the door open.

Rio was still wearing the dress from the party, and she suddenly became painfully aware of how revealing it was as the door closed and locked behind her. Lou was standing in front of her, wearing jeans and a black cable knit sweater. Lou looked flawless as her eyes wandered possessively over Rio‚Äôs body.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve missed you, my pet,‚Äù Lou said.

‚ÄúI hate you,‚Äù Rio walked into the room, past Lou, and perched on the arm of a couch. The apartment didn‚Äôt have many personal effects, but it oozed Agatha‚Äôs personality.

‚ÄúWhat is this place, Lou?‚Äù Rio asked with a sigh.

A smile crept across Lou‚Äôs face as she stalked towards Rio.

‚ÄúAgatha‚Äôs fuck pad, pet. She didn‚Äôt take women home with her. She brought them here. Funny, she still has it.‚Äù

Rio looked away, not wanting to give Lou the satisfaction of seeing the hurt on her face. It felt like someone had stabbed her in the heart and twisted. No wonder Agatha hadn‚Äôt told her she loved her. She couldn‚Äôt let go of the past. ‚ÄúOkay, so it hasn‚Äôt sold yet.‚Äù She said quietly.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not even on the market.‚Äù

Another blow. Rio stood, moving further from Lou.

‚ÄúLike you were always truthful, Lou? I almost died because you weren‚Äôt.‚Äù Rio was trying to keep her voice flat and void of all emotion, but the emotions were seeping in.

‚ÄúI realize my actions caused you harm, and I would never hurt you, Rio. I am so sorry, and as for all of this,‚Äù She gestured around, ‚ÄúI had to get your attention, baby.‚Äù

Lou was right behind Rio as she wrapped her arms around Rio‚Äôs waist.

Rio stiffened. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt get to touch me like this anymore, Lou.‚Äù She said hotly, flinging Lou‚Äôs arms away, stepping out of the embrace, and turning around. ‚ÄúIs this your master plan, Lou? Come in here, show me Agatha has a secret apartment, and hope I break up with her? This is a conversation, Lou. Not a reason to break up with her.‚Äù

Rio was more annoyed at this point.

‚ÄúHonestly, I thought she‚Äôd be here with you.‚Äù

Lou had closed in on her again, and Rio felt like she was being chased around the apartment.

‚ÄúSo you‚Äôre stalling until she shows up? God, Lou. You have lost it. We are not getting back together. You hurt our kids, Lou.‚Äù

Rio spat, looking right at Lou, who was only inches away.

Lou looked hurt at that.

‚ÄúBaby, I would never hurt our kids. They‚Äôre safe with Shane.‚Äù

Rio was shocked. Did Lou really think she was talking about Lou‚Äôs kids?

‚ÄúNo, Lou. Nicky. Billy. Tommy. Hell, even Morgan. You‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio was cut off as Lou slapped her, open-handed across the face, before shoving her against the wall, hand wrapping around Rio‚Äôs throat with the slightest amount of pressure. Rio brought her hands up and wrapped them around Lou‚Äôs wrist, trying to push it away.

Lou raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúYou used to love it when I choked you. Begged me to choke you harder.‚Äù She purred.

Rio scoffed, ‚ÄúThat was before you completely ignored the safe word and blew past all my boundaries. You know who doesn‚Äôt do that? Agatha. You know who takes care of me in bed? Agatha. In bed and everywhere else. It will always be Agatha. Not you.‚Äù

Lou‚Äôs grip tightened despite Rio‚Äôs best efforts to loosen it.


The door flew open as Nat and Agatha ran in. Lou quickly removed her hand and looked at the newly arrived women as Rio fell to her knees, gulping in lungfuls of air.

‚ÄúWell, it‚Äôs about fucking time!‚Äù

Lou watched as Agatha ran to Rio and knelt beside her. Agatha had tears building from seeing and hearing where Rio had been hurt and from the anger toward Lou rising in her.

‚ÄúRio, are you okay?‚Äù Agatha asked as she lightly touched Rio‚Äôs reddened cheek where Lou had slapped her.

Rio looked at Agatha, hurt and pain in her eyes.

‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm not. We have to talk.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs voice was raspy as Agatha helped her stand.


Nat hadn‚Äôt drawn her weapon, but she had positioned herself where Lou would have to go through her first to get back to Rio or Agatha.

‚ÄúLeave her alone, Lou, she doesn‚Äôt want you,‚Äù Nat said harshly.

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt your fight, you feisty chihuahua.‚Äù Lou looked back at Agatha. ‚ÄúAh, and the bitch that stole what‚Äôs mine.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt belong to anyone.‚Äù Agatha took a step forward, her arm protectively in front of Rio.

‚ÄúI gave her everything!‚Äù Lou screamed.

Lou‚Äôs face was screwed up in fury as she stepped towards Agatha only stopping when she saw Nat take a step forward.

Rio lowered Agatha‚Äôs arm aside, moving towards Lou.

‚ÄúYou gave me NOTHING. You took and took everything from me. A sardonic smile cut across Lou‚Äôs face.

Agatha narrowed her eyes at her. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know anything.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you think Rio‚Äôs phone was the only one I hacked? I heard an interesting conversation between the unholy trinity here, my sweet. Looks like Superstar and Jane Bond only know half-truths about your global sweetheart here, too.‚Äù

Lou‚Äôs arms were crossed in front of her chest, and her smile was a Cheshire cat-like grin.

‚ÄúNat, end her,‚Äù Agatha instructed.

Rio shook her head, moving forward.

‚ÄúAgatha, Nat, is this true?‚Äù Rio asked, her eyes filled with uncertainty and pain.

Sensing the opening, Lou jumped in. ‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt love you the way I do, baby. Just look at her phone. Go to November first.‚Äù Lou instructed.

Agatha handed her phone to Rio, scouring her memory of that night.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the night I went out to the club, Wanda brought my drunk ass to your house. I have nothing to hide, Rio.‚Äù

Rio took the phone and tapped in the code.

‚ÄúAt least she has been forthright. I trust the blonde sociopath over there more than you right now.‚Äù

She pulled up the photo app and went to November 1st. There were pictures from the football game and pictures from the club, and then, Rio‚Äôs hand flew to her mouth as she let out a gasp. Nat rushed to look over Rio‚Äôs shoulder, shock on her face.

‚ÄúWhat? What is it?‚Äù Agatha asked.

‚ÄúOh? You don‚Äôt remember?‚Äù Rio spat each word dripping acid. Lou began to laugh maniacally.

Lou interrupted in the most rational voice she could muster.

‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt tell you she loves you. She gets drunk and makes out with someone less than twenty-four hours after kissing you, and then a few hours later, what does she tell you? Oh, right, that you‚Äôre the only one she‚Äôs wanted since she first saw you. Now, I admit I‚Äôve fucked up, but baby, not only has therapy helped me. Guess the cat‚Äôs out of the bag now.‚Äù Lou put her hand over her mouth like she had accidentally let it slip.

Agatha just flinched, and Nat looked at Agatha with her eyes wide.

Rio turned to Agatha.

‚ÄúWHAT! Is THAT why you don‚Äôt date?! Because of some brutal relationship you had? That‚Äôs an important thing to tell me!‚Äù She exploded.

Nat turned back to Lou. She was going to make this bitch disappear. ‚ÄúWhere did she go?‚Äù She asked out loud.

In all the commotion, Lou had escaped. The door was slightly open, so Nat ran out to see if she could chase her down, closing it behind her.

Rio looked at Agatha, flames in her eyes, ‚ÄúYou begged me to be honest and upfront and tell you everything, and I did. But, you kept lying to me!‚Äù

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt lie. I just didn‚Äôt tell you the complete truth,‚Äù Agatha lied.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs even worse!‚Äù Rio yelled. ‚ÄúYou were in a relationship for TEN years, Agatha. TEN YEARS. You didn‚Äôt think that was something I needed to know? ‚ÄúBecause I wasn‚Äôt going to say anything in front of my sociopathic stalker of an ex, dumbass! So¬† for the record, I am NOT CALM ABOUT IT.‚Äù

Rio stopped and looked straight at Agatha. Rio ran her hands through her hair, she couldn‚Äôt stay here right now, she didn‚Äôt want to hear Agatha‚Äôs excuses or explanations, but she also knew they weren‚Äôt over.

‚ÄúGod, Agatha, to think, I was ready to tell you‚Ä¶it doesn‚Äôt matter. I can‚Äôt look at you right now. I‚Äôm going to my place, I‚Äôll get Raven later. Agatha sank onto a couch, buried her face into her hands, and cried.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê


Agatha had napped on the couch, waiting for Nat to text her, telling her she could text or call Rio. Well, almost everything. Some things may still be better off unsaid. She rolled onto her back and stared at the high ceiling of the living room.


‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt you ever tell the whole truth?‚Äù A 21-year-old Agatha asked Swords with naive curiosity. Swords was still rejecting her, but they had run into each other at the New York club that Agatha secretly owned and were speaking as friends.

‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt you want anyone to know you own this place?‚Äù Swords countered.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want people to try and get in my good graces just for free drinks or to expect me always to be here. Or to think I‚Äôm trying to curate my own pool of women, as it were.‚Äù Agatha explained.

‚ÄúRight. You want to uphold a certain image, and so do I.‚Äù Answered Swords. ‚Äú There are certain things I want to keep quiet about myself. I don‚Äôt mind that people know I have a life outside of my career or hold secrets by NDA, but being with some of the biggest names in Hollywood? I can‚Äôt have that. I can‚Äôt be accused of the things I would be accused of, kid.‚Äù Swords replied, flipping her hair back.

‚ÄúDo you ever want kids‚Ä¶?‚Äù The question was out of her mouth before Agatha even thought about it.

Swords chuckled. ‚ÄúWith my job? Probably not. I‚Äôm already getting past that age, and you know how hard it is to have a successful career and kids. Look at Lorna.‚Äù

Agatha nodded and looked down, trying to school her expression. Alice was five, and Lorna barely saw her. She said she was better off with Norma and away from this life where she would spend all of her time with nannies.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs better to create the image you want people to see, Aggie. Keep a few people close and most distant. The world loves you and accepts your bad girl ways. Play into it. It makes you unique. Keep the new kid, the redhead, close. She‚Äôs interesting and your opposite. You want that balance. Be her Lorna. Keep Lorna close to you, too. Now, we‚Äôve been seen together for far too long, and there is a very cute girl over there with pink hair that has been trying to get your eye.‚Äù Swords said as she left.


Swords had taught Agatha a lot over the years‚Äîthe influence upon her life beyond quantifiable. Even if Swords had destroyed her, she had done some good things. However, the wound she intentionally or unintentionally inflicted left a scar so sensitive, that Agatha was still so hesitant to let herself love again.


Agatha was 27, and she and Swords were having a pleasant night in. They had had an actual date. Pizza, movies, and Swords was trying to develop Agatha‚Äôs taste for wine. Agatha preferred harder liquor and fruity things. However, Swords was trying to make her more sophisticated.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre on Broadway, kid. You spend time with people like Meryl Streep and Cher. You need to drink more than Malibu, Grey Goose, and‚Ä¶are these Smirnoffs?‚Äù Swords said, looking through Agatha‚Äôs fridge.¬† It was summer, and they were in New York again.

‚ÄúSo? I‚Äôve been on Broadway before, I won a Tony as a teenager, in case you‚Äôve forgotten and Cher is more your friend. Lorna, Wanda, Drew, Madonna, none of them have problems with what I drink.‚Äù Agatha reached for a green Smirnoff, only for Swords to swat at her hand.

‚ÄúNone of them have an EGOT with another Broadway show forthcoming.‚Äù Swords was pouring a glass of wine. ‚ÄúA lady knows her wines.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou certainly don‚Äôt fuck like one,‚Äù Swords laughed.

Agatha leaned against the counter, crossing her legs at the ankles. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to get me drunk for that if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre trying to do.‚Äù

They sat, Agatha, tucking her legs under her. ‚Äú...do you love me?‚Äù

Agatha gave a small cry of frustration.

‚ÄúOf course she does! I can‚Äôt help that she figured it out! Stop ignoring the question!‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù Swords was shocked. Agatha had never kicked her out before.

‚ÄúYou heard me, leave.‚Äù She said, standing up and walking to her bedroom.

She heard Swords leave and sobbed, calling Lorna, who was so proud of her for standing up for herself.

Agatha begged Swords to forgive her four days later.


‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Me:

Jen listed the condo.

Rio, I am so sorry.

Can we please talk?



Okay, so Agatha probably should have told her in person, but she needed to get that off her chest. She stared at her phone, waiting for the response.

Alice told me.

Yes.

When?

Have you eaten?

I‚Äôll order something?

Meet here in an hour?

Yes.

You better be ready.


Me:

I am.

Pizza?

She tried to talk me out of children for the longest time when I finally decided I wanted a child more than I wanted her.‚Äù

Agatha‚Äôs voice was full of sadness, but she didn‚Äôt cry. It felt good to get it off her chest, to confide in Rio.

‚ÄúShe worked with a lot of celebrities in different capacities and didn‚Äôt want being associated with me to screw it up. Imagine being associated with me being viewed as a bad thing.

‚ÄúAnyway, I was madly in love with her, but she didn‚Äôt love me the same way, and every single time she broke my heart, I would just crawl back to her, and every single time she would act as if she were teaching me some valuable lesson.‚Äù

Agatha looked off to the side as though she saw the memories pass by.

‚ÄúAfter I finally walked away, I told myself I would never let myself experience that heartbreak again. I threw all my love into my family, career, and other projects.

‚ÄúThen you came along, and for the first time in eighteen years, I felt something more than mere lust or desire.‚Äù

Agatha cradled Rio‚Äôs cheek and wiped away a tear that had escaped one of her beautiful brown eyes.

‚ÄúIt terrifies me to feel this again, Rio. But, I know you wouldn‚Äôt hurt me.‚Äù


Rio was processing everything Agatha had just told her and felt tears on her cheeks for the young Agatha. Rio‚Äôs story wasn‚Äôt great, but ten years of a dead-end relationship with someone who was never completely yours because they didn‚Äôt want to be? What was it with the women around here having tragic love lives?

‚ÄúAgatha, why didn‚Äôt you just tell me all of this in the first place?‚Äù

Rio searched Agatha‚Äôs eyes for something that told her she was being dishonest, and all she saw was pain and regret.


‚ÄúOur original conversation had come to a natural end, and I didn‚Äôt know how to restart it. I was scared. I was so afraid it would be too much. I haven‚Äôt allowed myself to have any romantic feelings until you, and look at how much I‚Äôve fucked it up.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am so sorry, baby. Then, the apartment, I should have told you. Part of me was waiting to make this big declaration and listing it as this big symbol of shedding the last part of my old life when I should have done it from the start.‚Äù

Rio wiped Agatha‚Äôs tears as she lightly kissed her cheeks where the tears had been.

‚ÄúOh Agatha, I‚Äôm not surprised you had an apartment. It was the fact you hadn‚Äôt listed it yet, or even told me about it. We‚Äôve barely been together for a month. I‚Äôm not stupid. You‚Äôve just sounded so sure of everything, so set on this, on us. Then you throw out things like you‚Äôre not the marrying type.

‚ÄúYou refuse to call this what it is. It‚Äôs confusing. I know we‚Äôre still at the beginning of this, though it feels like I‚Äôve known you my whole life, and everything comes so easy with you.‚Äù

Rio sat back, immediately missing the contact. Agatha blew out a breath and looked down at her hands.

‚ÄúAgain, this terrifies me. You have seen me in some of my most emotional states, Rio. Yes, I begged you to let me in and bare your soul to me, and you did. This is me laying it all out to you,‚Äù most of it, Agatha thought, a small pang of guilt slicing through her heart. She still felt like she had to protect Swords. There were even darker secrets to be told, and she was still trying to control the narrative of her image. Some secrets were between her, Swords, and Lorna. ‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt know if I can say those words yet, and I am so furious at myself for that because I want to, and yet, I can‚Äôt.‚Äù Agatha started crying again. Rio put her hands on Agatha‚Äôs knees.

‚ÄúAgatha? Do you believe in soulmates?‚Äù She asked, echoes of young Agatha‚Äôs voice echoing in her ears.

‚ÄúI thought I did once,‚Äù Agatha said timidly.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm beginning to think I do, and Agatha, with how quickly we‚Äôve come together, how quickly I‚Äôve fallen for you, and how natural everything seems? I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs any other explanation, but it shouldn‚Äôt be this hard to admit it.‚Äù Rio was going back and forth. Should she tell Agatha, and just not expect anything back? Should she leave? There was no script for this.

‚ÄúYou were so worried that you were broken, and you are not, Rio. People did things to you, yes, but that‚Äôs not you. You were not broken. Being with you is as easy as breathing, Rio. I am damaged. I am the one that has to learn how to do all these things normally. You had every right to be afraid, and you went for it. I completely understand if you need to walk away, if you need us to take a break for a while‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs tears flowed freely now, and there was no use trying to get them to stop. She knew her eyes were red and puffy, and she couldn‚Äôt imagine what would happen if the deepest, darkest secrets ever came out. Swords was a completely different person now, and she didn‚Äôt want to cause her pain or potential pain to Alice if she knew that her own mother had known.

Rio had been looking down as she played with the hem of her sweats, and her head snapped up. ‚ÄúA break? Excuse me? You‚Äôre about to go to Canada, and you want to take a break?‚Äù Her voice was bordering on hysterical.

Agatha‚Äôs hands had been in her lap, and she quickly took Rio‚Äôs hands. ‚ÄúBaby, no, I was saying if you wanted a break because I can‚Äôt tell you how much‚Ä¶‚Äù Her voice trailed off, not able to say the words. Something deep within her told her she couldn‚Äôt without telling her everything, and how was she supposed to do that?

Rio gave her a defeated nod as she stood. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want a break, and I‚Äôm not walking away. However, I am exhausted, and we both need sleep.‚Äù She stood there for several minutes, looking between the stairs, in the direction of the front door, and at Agatha.

Agatha watched as Rio struggled to make her decision before Rio finally sighed and grabbed Agatha‚Äôs hand, hauling her to her feet.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve developed a bad habit; we‚Äôre going to bed,‚Äù Rio said, her voice shaking.


Minutes later, Rio was drifting off to sleep in Agatha‚Äôs arms. She wasn‚Äôt as peaceful as usual, but she was where she wanted to be. She knew Agatha well enough by now to know that Agatha hadn‚Äôt been completely honest with her and was still holding back. Agatha‚Äôs breathing had evened out, and upon checking, Rio deemed that she was asleep.

‚ÄúI love you, Agatha,‚Äù she whispered before falling into a fitful sleep.

Agatha hadn‚Äôt been completely asleep when Rio‚Äôs whispered words filled the dark bedroom. Her heart stuttered, and she wished she could return the sentiment and show Rio how much she loved her. Instead, coward that she was, Agatha continued to feign sleep.


‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê


Lou had heard the whole conversation. She couldn‚Äôt listen into their phones anymore, but she was still tapped into the houses through the pet cameras and mic. She looked down at the copies of the documents she had taken pictures of. The marriage certificate that had never been filed or signed, with the other name blacked out. The ultrasound pictures dated 6 weeks, 8 weeks, 10 weeks, and 11 weeks, with Harkness, Agatha in the top corner. Lou had guessed what had happened after that, seeing as how they were from two years before Nicky was born. She had also taken pictures of pages from Lorna‚Äôs journal, although even she had used the nickname for Agatha‚Äôs ex. It was all spelled out there in print. She just had to convince Rio to look at the envelope of evidence and prove to Rio that Agatha was still refusing to tell her the whole truth.


‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê


Agatha was still awake with Rio asleep in her arms when Nat‚Äôs text came through around one, letting Agatha know that Lou had whatever secrets Lorna had and may have kept. Agatha turned her head toward Rio with a tortured look. Rio mumbled in her sleep, and Agatha only caught every few words. Lyrics to Taylor Swift songs, something about ‚Äòjust tell me‚Äô and ‚Äòfucking Lou‚Äô. Agatha ran her fingers through Rio‚Äôs hair and thought about the past few months. The day she met Rio, or well, met grown-up adult Rio. She had been stopped in her tracks by Rio‚Äôs warm mahogany eyes while surrounded by the smell of Axe. It would absolutely be a story one day. Rio was right in how easy and natural everything was between them. Agatha would never have crawled into bed with someone just to cuddle. The great Agatha Harkness had been brought to her knees by this woman in less than a month and had tried to ignore it until she couldn‚Äôt any longer.

Then, the scrapbook Rio had made her, the pictures, the things Rio had remembered to write, the lyrics. Rio often spoke in lyrics, movie and TV quotes, and pop culture references. She had put all of that into the scrapbook and enlisted Wanda‚Äôs help with pictures, pulling them from every available source. The woman was as cunning as Agatha was, and Rio had left blank spaces around the picture of Agatha; she assumed she would fill in the future. However, there were blank spaces around a few other pictures.

It was then that the light bulb went off. Rio had seen every single one of Agatha‚Äôs movies, including the most recent one. Death‚Äôs Beloved and a few of the mystery and action ones had included black light ink. Agatha carefully removed herself from beneath Rio, kissing her lightly on the forehead as she left the bed, grabbed the scrapbook off her nightstand, and went to Nicky‚Äôs room. She knew he had a blacklight pen left over from a spy-themed birthday party from a few years ago. She found it and took the two items downstairs. She settled on the couch cross-legged, opened the scrapbook in her lap, and turned on the blacklight.

The picture Wanda had taken of them at the back-to-school party. They were sitting on the beach, talking animatedly with the sunset in front of them. She scanned the page as hidden lyrics popped out, separated on the page. ‚ÄòMet you at the right time‚Äô; ‚ÄòLivin‚Äô in a movie I‚Äôve watched,‚Äô; ‚ÄòFunny, ‚Äòcause you couldn‚Äôt have called it‚Äô.

She flipped through pages, a movie night where Wanda had taken a picture of them cuddled on the couch, Rio‚Äôs head in Agatha‚Äôs lap, Agatha playing with Rio‚Äôs hair and talking to Jen or Alice off camera. In blacklight ink, lyrics from ‚ÄòEnchanted‚Äô, a recurring song throughout so far, ‚Äòtwo a.m. who do you love?‚Äô, ‚Äòplease don‚Äôt be in love with someone else‚Äô. That picture had been taken in early October, it seemed.

Pictures from New York, a paparazzi shot of all things, but a damn good one. Above this one, ‚ÄòWe fell in love in October, that‚Äôs why I love fall.‚Äô Agatha waited for her heart to stop, for some wild reaction, raised anxiety, and nothing. She was calm as a warmth washed over her, and she smiled. Agatha had started falling for Rio before October, but that was a definite turning point.

A picture from their first date, ‚ÄòAll my life, I‚Äôve been looking for this‚Äô. Another date, ‚ÄòFor me, it‚Äôs always you‚Äô. Thanksgiving and the social media posts, ‚ÄòIs it alright to feel this way so early?‚Äô, ‚ÄòYou‚Äôre the risk I‚Äôm gonna take it‚Äô. A picture from the winter dance, ‚ÄòToo soon to tell you I love you‚Äô. Rio and Agatha on the couch in Nicky‚Äôs hospital room. Wanda had taken it because she thought it was sweet. Agatha had succumbed to emotional exhaustion, and Rio was holding her as if she was trying to protect her from everything going on in the world, ‚ÄúI want you for worse or for better.‚Äù


The hidden messages combined with what had already been written only amplified the meaning of the gift that Agatha held. She did her best not to get any tears on the scrapbook and was thankful for the page protectors. She knew this had been made with care and love, but it was so much more. It was the words Rio had said to her just a few hours before. Then the picture of Agatha. She took a deep breath as the blacklight landed on the page, and it lit up like Coachella in the middle of the desert.

‚ÄòI wanna teach you how forever feels,‚Äô; ‚ÄòYou could absolutely break my heart, that‚Äôs how I know we‚Äôre in love,‚Äô; ‚ÄòI‚Äôm gonna give you my heart‚Äô; ‚ÄòI want the secrets your secrets haven‚Äôt found,‚Äô;

‚ÄòWhat if I let it slip? (Tell you that oh, my God, I fucking love you)‚Äô.

At the bottom, there was an arrow telling her to turn the page, and on the back was a letter from Rio.

Agatha,

As I am writing this, it has been roughly five months since we met at the fieldhouse at SHIELD. We have been through so much in that time. Our friends will say we put them through a slow-burn romance, though compared to those four, we sped through this. I know it‚Äôs a stereotype that sapphics move rather quickly, but I think we just go with what feels right, and this does.

I grew up watching you and idolizing you. Never in my wildest dreams did I think I would ever be friends with you, let alone one of your inner circle. Then, we fell for each other; you kissed me, you took me on dates, Agatha Fucking Harkness swept me off my feet, and fuck it, I fell in love with you and am finally admitting it to myself.

I hope when you find this, we‚Äôve either finally admitted it or you‚Äôve at least figured out how you feel. I feel like we‚Äôve lived a movie of our own, full of drama, and we deserve a happy ending.

Please be my happily ever after.


Love, Rio.

She wasn‚Äôt shaking from Rio‚Äôs confession, but because she knew without a shadow of a doubt that she was ready to tell Rio what she hadn‚Äôt told her earlier. Fuck Swords, she could protect herself, and Rio would never find out who she was anyway.

Agatha hummed as Rio sat next to Agatha, curling her legs underneath her arm on the back of the couch. Agatha turned to face her, mirroring their positions from earlier in the night.

‚ÄúI did, and I love everything in it. Everything.‚Äù

She made sure to hold Rio‚Äôs gaze as she said it. Agatha cupped the back of Rio‚Äôs neck with one hand and her cheek with the other as she pressed her lips to Rio‚Äôs. Agatha‚Äôs thumb caressed gentle circles along Rio‚Äôs jaw as she kissed Rio tenderly. As Rio attempted to deepen the kiss, Agatha reluctantly pulled back. Rio made a whining sound at the sudden loss as she watched Agatha sit back.

‚ÄúRio, there are some things I need to tell you before we go any further,‚Äù Agatha was finally ready to share some of her deepest and darkest secrets that only two other people knew, and one of them was no longer alive.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to explain that too, okay?‚Äù Agatha looked at Rio as if seeking her permission and approval to continue.

‚ÄúFirst, you need to understand that outside of professionals, the only other people who knew about these events were myself, Lorna, and Swords. The reason I didn‚Äôt tell you earlier was that I wanted to control my own narrative and protect Swords. However, I believe your feelings about me won‚Äôt change, and Swords can protect herself. I‚Äôm still not telling you who she is, just in case your paths ever cross.‚Äù Agatha looked at Rio for confirmation.

Rio nodded, ‚ÄúI knew there was still something, which is why I wasn‚Äôt sleeping well and then came down here when you weren‚Äôt in bed.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou were right. However, there‚Äôs something I need to tell you first. I wasn‚Äôt asleep earlier, and then with everything written in there,‚Äù Agatha gestured toward what was now one of her most prized possessions, sitting on the table. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been running from my feelings, and I have to stop. Rio Vidal, I am absolutely in love with you.‚Äù

These were not words Rio was expecting to hear yet, and they were words she was willing to wait for, but hearing them made her heart almost burst with joy. She knew Agatha had things to tell her, but right now, she was just happy that Agatha Fucking Harkness was in love with her and finally admitted it. Rio surged forward, grabbing Agatha by the shoulders to kiss her hard and fast. There would be time for more later, but she had to kiss her right now. As Rio leaned back, she looked at Agatha and grinned.
