As they went back upstairs, Agatha began. ‚ÄúRemember how I told you that Swords didn‚Äôt want kids?‚Äù

Rio nodded as they walked back into Agatha‚Äôs room.

‚ÄúWell, she continuously talked me out of it, and finally, at 33, I decided I would with or without her.‚Äù

They had assumed their normal position, and Agatha sighed contentedly. Something about holding Rio gave her the confidence she needed to get through this. Agatha continued.

‚ÄúWe had had a discussion, and I had asked her one last time about kids, and she shut it down and told me I couldn‚Äôt risk becoming like my mother. She didn‚Äôt know that I was already going through fertility treatments and had chosen a donor, the whole nine yards. It was my roundabout way of seeing where she was at for the final time. She shot it down, so I knew what would happen if I succeeded.‚Äù

Agatha was looking down at Rio, who was, in turn, looking up at her. They had perfected this way of lying and talking, Agatha running her hand up and down Rio‚Äôs side, Rio‚Äôs hand in Agatha‚Äôs hair.

Rio was doing the math. Nicky was born in 2008 when Agatha was 35. It had been a thing, the world‚Äôs favorite lesbian becoming a single mom thanks to science. It put women‚Äôs healthcare and fertility treatments in the spotlight. Yet another trailblazing moment for Agatha Harkness.

‚ÄúAgatha, please tell me that it was near the end of the year, and it took a bit to get pregnant,‚Äù Rio looked at Agatha, concerned. Nicky‚Äôs birthday was in June, and Agatha‚Äôs was in March. She had been barely 35 when she had Nicky, and the math wasn‚Äôt mathing the way Rio wanted it to.

Agatha gave Rio a sad smile.

‚ÄúNo, baby. We‚Äôre getting there. I got pregnant pretty quickly. It was September 2006 when I told her about it. Anyway, Wanda and Nat were out of the country as Wanda was filming. Lorna knew, though. I wasn‚Äôt trying to baby-trap Swords. I made sure she knew that. I gave her the option to break up, and we did. Then, something changed her mind in October, and she decided to marry me and have a family. I had asked her so many times if she was sure, and she said yes.‚Äù Agatha sighed. ‚ÄúI lost the baby a few days before the wedding and told Swords. There I was, in November, on the beach with Lorna, a white dress and all‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs voice trailed off, and Rio desperately tried to fill in the blanks and hurt this obviously caused the woman she loved.

‚ÄúDid she use the loss as her way out? To leave you at the altar? I‚Äôll kill the bitch!‚Äù While she was so thankful she had Agatha, her protective side wanted to throw hands.

Agatha shook her head.

‚ÄúNot the main reason, no. She initially put her career first, but it was a reason. She said the pregnancy clouded her judgment, and to play devil‚Äôs advocate, she never did want marriage and kids. I was still shattered, though. I was so desperately in love with her, and that‚Äôs the day I decided I was done with her.‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs heart hurt for Agatha. This woman, who seemingly had everything, hadn‚Äôt been allowed to have the one thing she wanted most: a relationship.

‚ÄúDoes she work in Hollywood?‚Äù Rio asked softly.

Agatha nodded.

‚ÄúYes, and before you ask, yes. We still come in contact with each other, and she has changed since then.‚Äù

She saw the question in Rio‚Äôs eyes.

‚ÄúNo, I wouldn‚Äôt. She could beg me to come back, and I would tell her no. She missed her chance and absolutely destroyed me. Comparing this to that, well, there‚Äôs no comparison. This? What you and I are building? This is pure. It‚Äôs not built on youthful infatuation and puppy love. We went in with eyes wide open and knew the risks. We have mutual respect, and we have our autonomy. This?‚Äù She gestured between them, ‚Äúis real, Rio.‚Äù

Agatha had bared everything except for Swords‚Äô true identity and how they met. She finally felt free of the secrets she had been holding.

Rio felt the intensity of the moment as she stroked along Agatha‚Äôs jaw and down the length of her neck. Her thoughts were overwhelmingly crowded, and she couldn‚Äôt separate them. What she did know was that she loved Agatha more than she had ever loved before and she couldn‚Äôt imagine why someone would throw away the opportunity to spend their life with Agatha and throw it away for some dumb career in Hollywood. She hoped Swords‚Äô money and, Rio assumed, career made Swords happy because Rio was the true winner in this. Rio kissed Agatha before she looked at her again.

‚ÄúI have questions,‚Äù Rio stated.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure you do.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat does she say about Nicky?‚Äù

Agatha took a moment to consider her response.
‚ÄúHonestly, I think she‚Äôs surprised I‚Äôm this involved.‚Äù

‚ÄúGood. That bitch,‚Äù Rio smirked. If she ever found out who Swords was, she couldn‚Äôt promise niceties.

Agatha huffed a laugh, ‚ÄúWhat if it‚Äôs someone you like? It could be Cher.‚Äù

Rio looked scandalized. ‚ÄúShe is twenty-seven years older than you.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe fact that you automatically knew that isn‚Äôt surprising at all. Would you believe that Cher‚Äôs ‚ÄúBelieve‚Äù is about me? But no, it‚Äôs not her.‚Äù Agatha hated that damn song. ‚ÄúI have a question for you, though, about something you mentioned previously.‚Äù Agatha bit the inside of her lip, not sure how she was going to respond to the answer.

Rio knew that Agatha had picked up on what she had said and knew this was coming as she motioned for Agatha to go on.

‚ÄúWhen you said that you and the supermodel from hell had been talking about marriage and planning a future‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha trailed off, letting Rio take it from there.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Rio answered the unasked question. ‚ÄúWe were talking about kids, even hypothetically planning it, very ‚Äòtalking rings and talking cradles‚Äô, though I know now that she is not the love nor the loss of my life. I told you Labor Day weekend that it was dependent upon who I was with, and you do come with a kid. Three, technically.‚Äù

This was not a conversation Rio wanted to have right now. They both needed sleep, and she wanted to engage in other activities once she knew what day it was.

Agatha picked up on Rio‚Äôs hesitation and left it for now. She knew they needed to sleep, though that was not the activity she wanted to engage in. Being responsible was not for the faint of heart. However, neither of them had slept much in the past forty-eight hours, and that would not do for what she had planned.

‚ÄúWe can revisit everything later. Our sleep schedules are now nonexistent. It might be Thursday, and we have a big weekend ahead of us,‚Äù Agatha said as she kissed Rio‚Äôs forehead and settled in more. ‚ÄúBesides, I need energy to show you how much I love you. I hope you don‚Äôt have plans later today.‚Äù


‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

By Sunday morning, sleep schedules had returned to somewhat normal, and award season was kicking off. Agatha‚Äôs house was full of makeup artists, hairstylists, and stylists, and the boys had been sent on yet another caffeine run.

Wanda and Agatha were having their hair done in Agatha‚Äôs bathroom, attempting to talk while having makeup applied at the same time.

‚ÄúI am so excited for you actually to have Nat with you as your date, Superstar,‚Äù Agatha said, careful not to move her eyes.

They would have other security with them. Wanda deserved this. Vision was glad he didn‚Äôt have to do the whole dog and pony show and could just sit in the family sections with the boys and Alice. Jen would be working and checking in with everyone as she could. She had already briefed red-carpet correspondents and was currently texting other PR reps. Several of them wanted to make sure their celebrities were able to get pictures with Agatha and Wanda. Several young actresses were especially interested in being in Agatha‚Äôs orbit, and Rio was not amused.

Wanda was trying very hard to keep down the emotions. She had been waiting for this for so long, and it was finally here. She would get to be seen, very publicly, with the true love of her life. They were skipping the whole girlfriend title, Jen putting them out there as partners. If she could, they would already be married, but even no-contest divorces in California took six months to finalize. No amount of fame could get around that. She and Agatha both tried.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs still so surreal. I finally get to be public with her, and it‚Äôs absurd to me the way it happened,‚Äù she was trying to talk without moving her mouth, and after all these years, she and Agatha could understand each other perfectly.

Agatha smiled and was promptly scolded, ‚ÄúWhen are you proposing?‚Äù

‚ÄúAs soon as I fucking can. We know we‚Äôre getting married. We didn‚Äôt even have to have that discussion. I still want to give her the proposal she deserves. Enough about me, I‚Äôll get in trouble if I cry and ruin my makeup. When are you proposing?‚Äù Wanda grinned with her eyes as she was instructed to hold her mouth a certain way for lipstick.

Agatha choked on her spit. ‚ÄúI just told her I love her, Wanda,‚Äù A chorus of ‚Äòawws‚Äô went up from everyone within earshot. ‚ÄúI am not ready to think about marriage,‚Äù It was mostly true. Agatha had absolutely thought about it, and even though she didn‚Äôt believe you had to get married, she wanted to. Just not anytime soon.

‚ÄúOh, please. You would move her in here yesterday if you could. The two of you have played house all winter break. Billy called her Aunt Rio yesterday, and no one blinked an eye. Raven practically lives here now.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs moving in, Wanda. Not marriage.‚Äù

Agatha had thought about that one, though, and would suggest it when Rio‚Äôs lease came up for renewal this summer. Wanda rolled her eyes as she started getting dressed.

‚ÄúAt least you‚Äôre moving faster than anyone else did around here.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê


The red carpet for the Golden Globes was crowded with interview stations set up everywhere and cameras constantly flashing. The audience area was full of screaming fans, and many celebrities were taking pictures or stopping near the area so their pictures could be taken. Agatha and Wanda were stopped continuously, which meant Nat and Rio were as well. Wagatha were two of the most sought-after celebrities on the carpet, as were their current headlines. Wanda had an upcoming interview with Drew and everyone had questions about what she was going to say, though her only answer was, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll just have to wait.‚Äù The two megastars were more than happy to talk about the film, talk up their fellow nominees, and gush about the women with them.

With the hype surrounding Death‚Äôs Beloved, Wanda and Agatha had used their red carpet looks to pay homage to their characters, as well as incorporate their signature colors. Wanda had gone with a one-shoulder floor-length black dress that was gathered at the right side with a ruby-encrusted silver skull, an ode to her role as a serial killer. The dress was cut up to her thigh on the same side and she wore red heels. Her hair was down in a side part, ruby red earrings that matched the heart necklace Nat gave her for Christmas.

Wanda had convinced Nat to wear something that didn‚Äôt make her blend in or scream bodyguard, and Wanda was kicking herself for it because all Wanda wanted to do was skip the ceremony and go right back to the compound to their newly redesigned and refurnished bedroom and take the strapless dark red dress right back off Nat. Nat‚Äôs hair was up, and Wanda kept staring at Nat‚Äôs neck, thankful for makeup that covered the bruises and bitemarks Wanda may or may not have put there. Nat‚Äôs dress also had a high slit, and Wanda was making a mental note that Nat was to wear suits at awards shows for the rest of their lives, as she wondered if anyone would notice if they went missing for a while.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre drooling,‚Äù Agatha whispered in Wanda‚Äôs ear. ‚ÄúI get you‚Äôre making up for lost time, but you‚Äôre not ready for quickies at awards shows, angel. I‚Äôm the punchline for that joke in every single opening monologue.‚Äù

Agatha knew there would be at least one joke at her expense, most likely about her reputation. One year, it was a joke about looking under your seat for your designated time to meet up with Agatha in the bathroom. The joke was on them, though, that year. She had scoped out a room in the back and a beauty with whom to share it.

Agatha had leaned into the FBI agent she played with a perfectly tailored suit. However, she opted for an eggplant purple corset underneath, her signature brooch perfectly in place, hair up in a twist, and the same purple stilettos she had worn on her first date with Rio.

Agatha turned to Rio and squeezed her hand.

‚ÄúAre you ready for all of this?‚Äù

Agatha gave her girlfriend a comforting smile and a quick kiss on the cheek, grazing the corner of Rio‚Äôs mouth. Rio nodded.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs time to get used to it, and I‚Äôve had media training from Jen.‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs smile was electric and purely for Agatha. She hadn‚Äôt been in Agatha‚Äôs life when she made the movie, but she was still extremely proud of her and her accomplishments. Rio wore a forest green halter dress that came down to mid-thigh. It was draped on her left thigh in a way that showed off a silver thigh chain that had amethyst stones and an amethyst A. She wore black strappy heels, and her shooting star necklace, and her hair was in loose waves around her shoulders.

They chatted with friends, and the starlets were pulled and directed several different ways. Rio received several hugs from students' parents, some of whom were nominated in the same categories as Agatha, Wanda, or the movie itself.

Once the chaos of the red carpet was over, they entered the main hall and found their seats. The host‚Äôs monologue started, and of course, several jokes were aimed at Agatha and Wanda, who at this point of their career, took it in stride.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a sad day for the women in attendance. If you haven‚Äôt had your gay awakening yet, Hollywood‚Äôs sapphic tour guide, Agatha Harkness, is in a relationship and is no longer offering her services. In a surprising turn of events, the straightest woman ever, Wanda Maximmoff, is a¬† lesbian. So if any of you had ‚Äòhell freezes over‚Äô on your Bingo cards for this year, cross that one out.‚Äù

‚ÄúDeath‚Äôs Beloved is set to win everything at every awards show this year. So, if you are nominated in a category against them, you may go ahead and go to your after-parties. Sorry, everyone.‚Äù

There were jokes at Tony‚Äôs expense and a few of their other friends before getting started on the awards. The first category was Film Supporting Actress, Wanda‚Äôs category. Why was Wanda shocked when she won? The coven would never understand.

Wanda immediately turned and kissed Nat. For the first time accepting an award, she was fucking kissing Nat. She had been waiting for the moment she could thank Nat from a podium and it was finally happening. She was shaking and had frozen. Nat mouthed, ‚ÄòGo, this isn‚Äôt your first time, go!‚Äô

Agatha grabbed Wanda‚Äôs hand and pulled her towards the stage. Wanda looked back at Nat, words formulating in her head. By the time they got to the mic and Wanda the award, Wanda nodded at Agatha, indicating she could handle it. Agatha stepped back next to the presenters.

Wanda took a deep breath and focused on Nat.

‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt frozen when winning an award since I was a kid, and Agatha,‚Äù she looked at her best friend. ‚ÄúWas the one that dragged me to the stage then too. I have been waiting to say this on stage since I was in my twenties. Natasha, thank you so much for supporting me and always being there for me, you‚Äôve always been there for me. I love you so much.‚Äù

Just the responses to that were deafening, and she laughed.

‚ÄúRarely do thank you speeches get that kind of response. I‚Äôd also like to thank Vis, Billy, Tommy, Agatha, Alice, Rio, Nicky, and Jen for supporting me and being there for me for all of these years and being the best family I could have ever hoped for‚Ä¶‚Äù

She thanked the usual people associated with the film and gave a heartfelt thank you to the fans before adding. ‚ÄúAlways live your truth. You, you can‚Äôt get back lost time.‚Äù

Wanda looked at Agatha, who grabbed her hand, and they walked off together. Nat met them backstage to go with Wanda to do a follow-up press interview, and Agatha went to get ready for her musical performance.

Rio checked in on social media, most of which was positive, and she put it back in her clutch. Agatha would be performing the song from the movie soon, and Rio was excited to see Agatha perform live, something Rio had never been able to do. Rio was very thankful for her position at SHIELD as Rio knew quite a few people in attendance, and even though her three table companions were currently missing, Rio still had people to talk to and didn‚Äôt feel out of place. They had come back from a commercial break, and the hostess commented on Wanda being the only person ever to thank a soon-to-be ex in an acceptance speech.

Tony announced Agatha, as the board always thought it was funny when the two of them presented or announced each other, as they infamously did not get along. This time, he added, ‚Äúthe woman who happened to partially raise my daughter‚Äôs boyfriend, though I attribute all of his good qualities to Wanda, Agatha Harkness.‚Äù They always tried to throw each other off their game.

Agatha had been prepared and, thanks to her in-ears, was completely unphased. The hauntingly beautiful melody began, and the spotlight fell on Agatha, who was wearing a black ball gown as she began to sing. Agatha‚Äôs eyes were on Rio the entire time, and the song was quickly becoming a favorite. The experience was over incredibly too soon, and she was covered in goosebumps.

Everyone had returned to the table, and Agatha was back in her original outfit, arm draped over Rio‚Äôs shoulders as they watched friends and acquaintances get flowers for their hard work over the past year. Death‚Äôs Beloved lost Best Screenplay but won for Director and Score.

Best Song was up next, and while Agatha was used to this and calm, Rio was on edge. She had always been nervous watching from home, but being here, dating and in love with Agatha, was different and much more intense.

As Agatha‚Äôs name was announced, she leaned over and whispered to Rio, ‚ÄúI save my big speeches, don‚Äôt get mad.‚Äù

Agatha kissed Rio and made her way to the stage, where she met with the songwriters, making sure they went first. Then, she gave her very practiced Agatha Harkness smile and thirty-second speech. She thanked her family and friends, everyone who worked on the song, and that was it.

Wanda leaned over to Rio.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs taking a calculated risk,‚Äù Wanda explained.

‚ÄúI know, I‚Äôve seen this show before,‚Äù and Rio had. She knew that the older Agatha got, the less joint awards became about her. That wasn‚Äôt the case when Agatha was younger, but now it was.

Agatha and everyone else were right back on the stage after the next commercial break for Film Cinematic and Box Office Achievement.

It had been a long evening, and it was only eight when the last four categories arrived. Two of which were theirs, Film Drama Actress and Film Drama. First up was the Actress category, and Rio squeezed Agatha‚Äôs hands as they went through the nominees. She knew Agatha was the favorite, and that was her calculated risk. Rio wasn‚Äôt surprised Agatha won, but she was still elated.

Agatha loved it when she won for her sapphic performances. This film hadn‚Äôt pushed an agenda, it was just the story, and that story happened to be queer. Agatha smiled as she kissed Rio, reaching back to smack Wanda on the shoulder as Wanda made snide comments behind her. When Agatha reached the stage, she blinked against the blinding lights and looked around the room.

‚ÄúWow, thank you for this,‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs eyes fell on Rio. ‚ÄúFirst, I‚Äôd like to thank Rio, my amazing girlfriend, for supporting me through the end of this past year and being there for all of us. I love you so much, and you are one of the best parts of my life. Thank you to my amazing family and friends. Wanda, thank you for convincingly playing my wife. That‚Äôs absolutely why we won tonight, and I am so proud of you, kid. Thank you to everyone who worked on this film and, most importantly, supported this film. Knowing that ALL stories are normalized now is truly a great thing to see, and I am so proud to be a part of it. To our boys, thank you for supporting us, and I am so proud of the young men you are becoming. Again, a huge thank you to everyone and all of you beautiful humans in this room. You‚Äôre all amazing.‚Äù

Agatha waved as she walked off to applause. She would do the media and press later. The movie was up for Film Drama in roughly ten minutes. She made her way back to the table, hugging people as she walked past them. She kissed Rio again as she sat down,

‚ÄúI love you, Agatha.‚Äù Were the first words out of Rio‚Äôs mouth once they broke the kiss.

Agatha gave her a genuine smile. ‚ÄúI love you, too. I am exhausted, though.‚Äù

Nat leaned over Wanda to Rio.

‚ÄúAlmost done,¬† and put your shoes back on,‚Äù she instructed.

They had changed from heels to something more comfortable for most of the ceremony, Wanda and Agatha only changing when they were up for something.

Rio gave her a questioning look, and Agatha answered, ‚ÄúMore press after, babe.‚Äù

Rio sighed. ‚ÄúThe fact that I am wearing heels for you is a testament to my love.‚Äù


Death‚Äôs Beloved won, and the awards season was off to a great start. As they headed to an after-party, Rio was reminded that they all returned to the real world in a few days. Everyone would resume filming, work, or school on Wednesday, and she dreaded it. For now, she reveled in the fact that Agatha Harkness loved her and everything was right in their world.

Chapter End Notes

The next chapter or two will be rainbows, butterflies, smut, social media reactions, all the smooth sailing things before we have some final drama.

The main fic will conclude at the end of SHIELD's school year. Then we'll have one-shots, lore, the Lorna story, the Swords story, etc.

I do post sneak peeks during the week, and pics of Raven as everything must meet her standards. Of course.

Y'all are amazing.

Safe As Kittens

Chapter Summary

Everything is calm and right in the world of our beloved coven. Agatha is filming and coming home on weekends, Rio has a new role at SHIELD, and Wanda has her interview with Drew.

A nice, calm month-ish with Oscar nominations, the Grammy's and a realization for Nicky.

Chapter Notes

Triggers: SMUT. Two scenes. SPICE. Bit of self-inflicted blood, the woman was feral, okay?

The Grammy's will be a one-shot later, because this year's Grammy's were a hoot and a half and inserting Agatha and Rio sounds like a blast to me.

Note: I kept Sokovia as a real country, so Wanda's native language is Romanian (sticking to the show). Nat occasionally speaks to her in Romanian and Wanda speaks to Nat in Russian, because they're effing adorable.

Thank you all for the love and for reading the words! More fluffiness and potentially getting back to some drama next chapter...

Oh! I've been obsessing over curating the perfect 'soundtrack' (Spotify playlist) for the past week). I need your recommendations for songs for each chapter. Thanks!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Harkness and Maximoff Stun on Red Carpet

Death‚Äôs Beloved Sweeps Golden Globes

Harkness and Maximoff Thank Girlfriends

‚ÄúDid you guys see how happy Wanda looked walking that carpet with Natasha?‚Äù

‚ÄúI saw how horny Wanda looked‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúNat sure did have a lot of makeup on‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúLeave them alone, they‚Äôre adorable.‚Äù

‚ÄúWho will play them in the movie they‚Äôll make about it?‚Äù

‚ÄúDo we know if Nat acts?‚Äù

‚ÄúDoes Chappell act?‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha and Rio, I LOVE THEM!!‚Äù

‚ÄúThat thigh chain Rio has?!‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs giving lesbian Guilty As Sin.‚Äù

‚ÄúHow do I get Vis‚Äôs number though? Surely he needs support during these trying times.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe has got to be one of the best men out there. Seriously, as if a woman wrote him.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs going to have women throwing themselves at him.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhile I‚Äôm sad Wagatha isn‚Äôt endgame, they are adorable together.‚Äù

‚ÄúCan Agatha Harkness be my personal emotional support lesbian too?‚Äù

‚ÄúI want her to be the reason I need a personal emotional support lesbian.‚Äù

‚ÄúJudging by the looks Rio gave some of the women that approached Agatha, you would need a coroner if you even got close.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre we actually in the timeline where Agatha settles down?‚Äù

‚ÄúPour one out y‚Äôall.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe Wagatha boys are so proud of their parents!‚Äù

‚ÄúDid you guys catch the ring on Alice Wu‚Äôs RING FINGER?!‚Äù

‚ÄúWait, LORNA‚ÄôS daughter?!‚Äù

‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs the screencap? Someone find Jennifer Kale‚Äôs left hand!‚Äù

‚ÄúRING SPOTTED ON KALE‚ÄôS LEFT HAND!‚Äù

‚ÄúHow has Rio not posted anything about her best friend being engaged to her girlfriend‚Äôs fixer?‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you guys ever think we‚Äôre too parasocial?‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt overthink it.‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha is definitely going to win the Grammy and an Oscar! Triple EGOT!‚Äù

‚ÄúI swear this woman is a witch.‚Äù

Rio just shook her head as she closed out of her socials. While some comments she could do without, some just made her laugh. Class started soon, and it would officially be the Spring semester at SHIELD. Agatha had left that morning, though she would be back on Friday. Rio was trying to readjust to being back in a routine, and her pack of teenagers calling her Ms. Vidal again. With all of the developments over the break, she was not surprised when Lilia strolled in.

Rio put her phone down. She looked up and saw a flustered Sicilian in front of her.

Rio‚Äôs eyes filled with concern as she checked the time. It was another fifteen minutes before students would be in class, and Lilia was usually in her office preparing for the morning announcements.

‚ÄúRio, I need you to fill in for Coach Carter for the girl's basketball team for the rest of the season.‚Äù

Rio loved basketball. She had played for years, kept up with the WNBA, and used to coach. However, she didn‚Äôt think Lilia knew any of that.

‚ÄúWhy me?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre one of the tallest actual lesbians on staff. I assume you play. Not to mention, you wear Phoenix Mercury shirts often. You played in college and coached at your last school. I did read your resume, Vidal.‚Äù Lilia kept looking at her phone as if waiting for a call or message at any moment.

‚ÄúDid Peggy go into labor this morning?‚Äù

Rio knew Peggy was due soon. She was far enough along that the baby would be healthy, and that was the only reason she could think of for her to miss the rest of the season, though Rio could have sworn she saw Peggy in the lounge earlier.

‚ÄúNot yet. Anyway, Daisy Johnson will fill you in on everything,‚Äù Lilia‚Äôs phone rang, and she answered automatically.

‚ÄúYes, Steve, I‚Äôm on my way there right now. Go ahead and take her to the hospital, well, I told you both she would go early‚Ä¶‚Äù Lilia‚Äôs voice faded as she left Rio‚Äôs room and rushed down the hallway.

Rio shook her head as Alice popped her head in the doorway, ‚ÄúPeggy‚Äôs having a baby!‚Äù Alice said excitedly.

‚ÄúI know. Lilia just assigned me to the girls‚Äô basketball staff. She‚Äôs psychic, I swear. So unless you want to be stuck here after school, separate cars it is.‚Äù Rio explained.

‚ÄúBonding with your future daughter-in-law!‚Äù Alice grinned as she ducked back into the hallway when the rock-shaped stress ball sailed past Alice‚Äôs head.

Rio had decided to take lunch in her classroom so she could go over the folder Morgan had brought her from Coach Johnson. The roster, remaining schedule, and potential for the playoffs were all there. She wasn‚Äôt sure what athletic voodoo or super serums Rogers and Carter were potentially giving their athletes, but the girl‚Äôs basketball team was potentially better than the football team and had a better chance of going to state. Morgan, and a few of the other girls, were already being scouted by universities as juniors. SHIELD held many surprises and the sheer amount of budding athletes running around this place was one of them. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why everyone points that out. For some reason, new life makes me even more observant,‚Äù Lilia mused, referencing Steve and Peggy‚Äôs newborn son, James.

‚ÄúAh,‚Äù Rio studied Lilia for a moment.

‚ÄúWhy me, Lilia? Why offer me the position and bring me out here?‚Äù

Lilia hadn‚Äôt known her. She just came to San Francisco at Alice‚Äôs request last Spring and offered her the position.

‚ÄúI trust Alice, and she wanted to keep you safe. I knew you would be a good fit, and you have been, in many ways. Now, I have a few security things to take care of. Start prepping for playoffs, coach!‚Äù With that, Lilia walked off.

‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt made it that far!‚Äù Rio called after her, but the woman didn‚Äôt reply.

Nicky made it home to the compound before Rio did. He had given Morgan a quick hug and kiss before promising to call before bed. He was relieved to see his Mom as he sat next to her and buried his head on her shoulder like a little kid.

‚ÄúDid Aunt Wanda tell you what happened?‚Äù He asked in a whisper.

She ran soothing fingers through his hair like she often did when he was a little boy.

‚ÄúYes, and I‚Äôve talked to Lilia.‚Äù She had also verbally eviscerated Daisy, but he didn‚Äôt need to know that.

‚ÄúRio called me her son.‚Äù

‚ÄúI heard. How do you feel about that?‚Äù Agatha still wasn‚Äôt sure how she felt about it. She loved it and was scared at the time.

‚ÄúHonestly?‚Äù He pulled back and looked her in the eye.

She nodded.

‚ÄúHonestly. No cap, or whatever the kids are saying,‚Äù She gave him a sarcastic smile as he groaned. Parents should not use teen slang.

Nicky thought about it, letting the words marinate. ‚ÄúI know we‚Äôve joked, and I‚Äôve called her dad, which is still funny because it‚Äôs Rio, and she gives those vibes,‚Äù

‚ÄúFair.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs always been you and me. Aunt Wanda, Uncle Vis, and Aunt Nat too, but you know what I mean,‚Äù Nicky looked up through long, thick eyelashes.

Agatha knew exactly what Nicky meant. He would always have this family, but Agatha was his anchor.

‚ÄúI love her mom, and she‚Äôs a good addition to our family. I don‚Äôt want to say a missing piece because we aren‚Äôt incomplete, though we were sorely lacking in the ancient cat god department,‚Äù he said as Raven jumped into his lap and purred.

‚ÄúI think those choose the human, not the other way around,‚Äù Agatha mused. ‚ÄúWhat part about it scares you?‚Äù Her stomach dropped at the look on his face. ‚ÄúRight. Still me.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you blame me, Mom? I got into an argument with a grown adult because she‚Äôs jealous of your girlfriend as she‚Äôs one of I don‚Äôt even want to think of how many women you‚Äôve slept with. I‚Äôve defended you since I was a kid. I should not know this much about my mom‚Äôs extra-curricular activities. I‚Äôm sorry if I worry.‚Äù

Agatha had always tried to keep her hobbies away from Nicky but knew he would be exposed to them, no matter how hard she tried.

‚ÄúI have changed, Nicholas.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know, Mom. Just know that she really is becoming like a mom to me, even if it hasn‚Äôt been that long, okay? Or at least until I get in major trouble and she has to put her foot down. I might change my mind then.‚Äù

Headlights washed over them as Rio drove up the long driveway.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs my cue since you two tend to get gross. I love you, Mom,‚Äù he hugged her before heading up to his room, Raven in his arms.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha woke up the Monday morning after the Grammy‚Äôs, thankful there was no school and that she could hold Rio in her arms. The ceremony had been a celebration of women, queerness, POC, and just fun. Rio had been a pure chaos demon with Taylor, and Agatha had taken it all in. Agatha had won her third Grammy, and while that technically gave her her triple EGOT, she wasn‚Äôt counting it until she won her third Oscar for Best Lead Actress. She was an overachiever after all. She had thanked Rio first last night, causing several of her friends in the industry had lost their minds, including the younger sapphics in the crowd. It truly was a great night, and she looked forward to always having Rio next to her as her forever date for these events and all of the memories they would create.

Her phone brought her out of the lavender haze as Nat texted the group chat, instructing everyone to put their clothes on and meet in Agatha‚Äôs living room in forty-five minutes.

‚ÄúWhy MY house?‚Äù Agatha grumbled as she kissed Rio awake.

Forty minutes later, everyone was in Agatha‚Äôs living room with the TV on.

‚ÄúCare to fill us in, Nat?‚Äù Agatha asked, nursing her second large thermos of coffee and still grumpy about being awake at eight in the morning.

‚ÄúI received some information last week, and this morning, one of my‚Ä¶shadow associates, if you will, told me to watch the news at this time. So here we are.‚Äù Nat was focused on the TV.

The boys were groggy but had been dragged from their beds for this. Jen and Vis were the only two that looked put together, the others all looked as if they put on the nearest, cleanest, most acceptable articles of clothing and game over or downstairs, which is what they had done.

‚ÄúHush, it‚Äôs starting!‚Äù Wanda quieted everyone.

‚ÄúBreaking news! Out of San Francisco,‚Äù The reporter started. ‚ÄúWe go now to recently disgraced supermodel Lou Franco‚Äôs house where the FBI has identified her as the person behind many high profile jewelry thefts‚Ä¶‚Äù

The color completely drained from Rio‚Äôs face as she clapped a hand over her mouth, and the other rubbed those too-familiar circles on the left side of her chest. She wasn't sure why she was anxious or crying.

There was Lou, glaring into the camera, in handcuffs.

All eyes in the room landed on Rio. Agatha put her arms around her.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs over,‚Äù¬† she whispered into Rio‚Äôs ear.‚Äù in an attempt to soothe her.

Jen turned to Nat, ‚ÄúHow‚Äôd you finally do it?‚Äù

Nat stood there, watching the oversized screen, taking it all in. Yes, she had gotten documents and fingerprints, but they weren‚Äôt necessarily the ones that would tie all the heists together.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt do this.‚Äù Nat started. ‚Äú I provided some evidence to an associate, but this wasn‚Äôt me,‚Äù her voice was low and hollow.

Alice shrugged.

‚ÄúWhoever it was, they‚Äôre on our side, and we can breathe more easily,‚Äù she said assuredly.

Rio looked at the screen. Things were going well at school. She was coaching again, Wanda and Nat only had a few months until they could get married, Jen and Alice were beginning to plan their wedding, all the boys were doing well, Vis was settling into his life, the boys were doing great, and she and Agatha were doing well. The Oscars and Spring Break were coming up, and best of all, Lou was gone.

Rio looked back at the screen just in time to see Lou look into the camera as her lips curled into an evil smile, ‚ÄúTe veo, pet,‚Äù she mouthed before passing out dramatically as the camera cut off.

I see you.

Rio just shook her head. ‚ÄúNope, bitch is gone, and all is well.‚Äù She decided.




Chapter End Notes

It's about time, AWAY LADY.

Thank you so much for all the love! I ADORE YOUR COMMENTS! Here, social media, everywhere, and I try to respond to all of them! Also, thank you for sharing! I can't believe my words are being read by so many people!

Oh, and umm, Happy Valentine's Day, you're welcome.

She Means Everything To Me

Chapter Summary

Another month for our coven!
Valentine's Day, a surprise getaway, Rio's a disaster, communication, The Oscars, a wedding, Spring Break...
You know, just normal coven things.

Chapter Notes

I am so sorry this is later than usual. The next chapter won't be as eventful, so should be shorter.
It was a week.

Thank you, as always, for all of the comments, kudos, and general love!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It was Valentine‚Äôs Day, and as cliche as it was, Wanda was going to propose. She was tired of waiting, and with everything finally being calm, now was a good time. She looked down at the dark wooden box in her hand, opening it to reveal the black titanium engagement ring inlaid with red diamonds and a red ruby in the center. The ring had never been worn despite being purchased over twenty years ago.

‚ÄúAggie, I‚Äôm going to propose to Nat,‚Äù Twenty-four-year-old Wanda Maximoff said decisively to thirty-year-old Agatha Harkness.

Agatha was sitting in the living room of the house in LA, which they shared with Nat, who was out on a run. She set down the script she was reading and looked at the young girl in front of her.

‚ÄúOh honey, do you think you‚Äôre ready for that? What about Vision?‚Äù

Wanda had thought of that.

‚ÄúYes, and I love him so much Aggie, but Nat is the one. I don‚Äôt care what the fans say,‚Äù Wanda sat down next to the woman who had become her older sister over the past eight years.

Agatha smiled and extended her hand, ‚ÄúLet me see the ring.‚Äù

‚ÄúHow do you know I have a ring?‚Äù Wanda asked indignantly.

‚ÄúBecause you always do this when you see rings that remind you of her. I assume you saw the perfect ring, no one was there to tell you no, and you bought it.‚Äù

Wanda‚Äôs entire face flushed. Agatha could read anyone, especially Wanda. She sheepishly handed Agatha the box, pouting that the older woman had been partially right.

‚ÄúClose, I saw one I liked and had this, and the matching band custom made.‚Äù

Agatha opened it with a smirk, having been proven mostly correct, and let out a sad sigh when she saw the ring.

‚ÄúOh, angel, it‚Äôs perfect.‚Äù

She looked at Wanda with a sad expression, gripping her hand.

‚ÄúYou WILL get to put it on her hand one day, and I will be by your side either as your Maid of Honor or the one giving you away.‚Äù

Wanda nodded, a tear sliding down her cheek. She knew Agatha was right. Wanda wouldn‚Äôt have the courage to do it, no matter how much she wanted to spend her life with Natasha.

Wanda closed the box and tucked it in the pocket of her maxi dress. Agatha had been right. The concert had happened a few days later, and everything after that was a blur. Here they were, over two decades later, and Wanda would finally get to propose. She had her speech, decorated the gazebo out back, and planned what to make for dinner. Everything was ready down to the music; she had practically grown up in the movie industry, so the cinematics were inevitable.

Nat could be covered in mud and wearing a potato sack, and Wanda would still think she was the most gorgeous being in the universe. Wanda knew she would remember the jeans and Lilith Fair hoodie Nat was wearing for the rest of their lives as they sat outside watching the sunset on the cold February evening around the firepit in the gazebo, drinking hot chocolate and snuggling together after dinner. It had been a quiet Valentine‚Äôs evening at home, which was precisely what they had wanted.

‚ÄúDo you remember our first Valentine‚Äôs together?‚Äù Wanda asked, moving closer to Nat.

Nat smiled at the memory.

‚ÄúWe were living at the clubhouse, and Agatha was still teaching us how to cook. You were much better at it than I was, though that‚Äôs not saying much. You tried to make Beef Wellington and almost burned the house down. We had to order pizza, and then we watched But I‚Äôm A Cheerleader for the hundredth time. Agatha was gone that night, and when she got home, she laughed for a good ten minutes.‚Äù

Wanda laughed at the story. ‚ÄúI was trying so hard to impress you!‚Äù

‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt need to! We had been together for a few months, and I was already completely in love with you. You could‚Äôve made me a Hot Pocket, and it would‚Äôve been the best day ever,‚Äù Nat took Wanda‚Äôs hand and looked at her with pure love.

‚ÄúWhat about the first concert we went to?‚Äù Wanda prodded, eyes dropping down to Nat‚Äôs hoodie.

‚Äú1998 Lilith Fair. I spent most of the festival trying to keep track of Agatha. You and I, however, danced very inappropriately to Missy Elliot, considering we were just friends and I was your bodyguard...‚Äù

‚ÄúYou were definitely guarding my body,‚Äù Wanda interjected.

Nat smirked as she continued, ‚Äúand gave new meaning to the song ‚ÄòSomething to Talk About‚Äô.‚Äù

Wanda just grinned. ‚ÄúWe do cause a commotion at concerts, don‚Äôt we? Spice Girls, Warped Tour, NSYNC, Madonna, Lollapalooza,‚Äù they had been to so many over the years, she couldn‚Äôt begin to name them all. ‚ÄúGood thing we can be out now.‚Äù

‚ÄúMusic is important to us, and we tend to get carried away. Now we can.‚Äù Nat leaned forward, kissing Wanda. ‚ÄúMy turn to ask a question: do you remember the first time I officially acted as your bodyguard?‚Äù

‚ÄúYES! It was for the Emmys! Agatha and I were up for Sisters! I couldn‚Äôt stop staring at you in that suit! I should‚Äôve known I wasn‚Äôt straight, but I kept telling myself I was just envious that you pulled it off so well.‚Äù Wanda laughed.

‚ÄúSolnyitza, you should have known. Every guy you were set up with was PR. Nothing happened with any of them. Vis was the first and only man you ever did anything with, including unscripted kissing,‚Äù Nat reminded.

Wanda thought back on all of her so-called relationships.

‚ÄúGood point. However, the same can be said about you, zvezdochka, star. You‚Äôve been the only woman for me,‚Äù She scoffed. ‚ÄúForty-five, and I‚Äôm still the girl next door.‚Äù

‚ÄúForty-six in two days,‚Äù Nat reminded.

‚ÄúRemember my thirtieth birthday?‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha threw you that eighties-themed birthday party and made everyone dress as their favorite eighties character! It was so cute! I still don‚Äôt know why you got so mad at her.‚Äù

Wanda huffed, ‚ÄúBecause Nicky was almost one, and what no one else saw was Agatha teasing me all night about how I wasn‚Äôt getting any younger and I needed to choose my baby daddy,‚Äù She rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúShe also brought Nicky over earlier that day in a shirt that said, ‚ÄòI love my aunts and uncle‚Äô. Lorna kept telling Agatha to lay off.‚Äù Wanda shook her head.

‚ÄúIf it weren‚Äôt for Agatha, I never would have met the love of my life,‚Äù Nat caressed Wanda‚Äôs cheek. ‚ÄúBesides, you have two baby daddies. Those are my boys, too.‚Äù Nat pulled Wanda in for another sweet kiss.

When they parted, Wanda looked up at Nat, glad that her plan was going the way she wanted. ‚ÄúDo you remember when we found out I was pregnant?‚Äù

Nat‚Äôs face softened, a smile still on her lips as the clear visual came into her mind.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll never forget it. You came out of the bathroom, test in hand, and we stared at it for what seemed like forever. We were in Budapest on a set, and you had gotten sick. You thought you were just sick when the doctor on hand sent you to your trailer with a pregnancy test. We watched in agony as it turned positive, and even though we weren‚Äôt technically together, I was so happy. You weren‚Äôt mine, no, but Wanda, I was always yours, and I am so grateful that I was allowed to be there every step of the way. You called Vis, and he told you he knew you were in good hands for the rest of the shoot.‚Äù

Wanda was trying not to cry, and while she had more memories to bring up, she knew it was time.

‚ÄúMoya zvezdochka, my star, I‚Äôm getting cold. Will you grab a blanket from the chest?‚Äù Wanda asked, giving Nat her best puppy dog eyes. Nat rolled her eyes.

‚ÄúYou have two perfectly good legs, but yes, solnyitza, sunshine, I will.‚Äù Nat got up and walked across the gazebo to fetch the blanket in question.

‚ÄúNat, do you remember the time I proposed?‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be silly, you‚Äôve never‚Ä¶‚Äù the words died in her throat as she turned around to see Wanda down on one knee, holding an open box with the most beautiful ring Nat had ever seen. The blanket fell from her hands as a hand flew to cover her mouth, and tears filled her eyes. It was finally happening. Her feet propelled themselves toward Wanda.

As she cleared her throat, Wanda had tears of her own, watching Natasha walk toward her. ‚ÄúNatasha, I have loved you for twenty-five years, and I so badly want to be yours. You have been by my side through every up and down in my life since I was eighteen. You were the first woman I ever kissed, the only woman I‚Äôve ever loved, and one of the few people I‚Äôve shared everything with. You are a parent to my sons, the person I want to fall asleep next to every night, and the person I wake up to every morning. So many of my best memories are with you, and I want to create more of them for however many years we have left. I want to grow old with you, make out at concerts, and actually impress you with my cooking skills now that I can,‚Äù Wanda laughed through her tears, remembering the multiple cooking failures they had both had. ‚ÄúYou are the one I want by my side at every event, in every picture, in every way imaginable.

‚ÄúI have wanted to put this ring on your finger for so long and never thought this day would come. I know this is the most cliche day to ask you this. Natasha, you are the love of my life, the person I have been madly in love with since we were kids, who patiently waited for me, who supported all of my decisions, maddening as they were. Will you finally marry me?‚Äù

Tears streamed down Wanda‚Äôs face as she looked into Nat‚Äôs eyes, awaiting her response.

Nat had knelt in front of Wanda, tears of her own mirroring Wanda‚Äôs as she nodded. She held out her shaking left hand as Wanda slid the ring on her finger.

‚ÄúYes, Wanda. I will absolutely marry you. No matter what day you asked me.‚Äù She smirked, swiping at her tears. ‚ÄúYou have always been it for me, and I would have been content just being here, a part of your world. Being with you again is something I had only dreamed of.‚Äù

Nat leaned forward, hands clasped in between them. She slid her lips against Wanda‚Äôs, bringing a hand to Wanda‚Äôs cheek, and smiled into the kiss. It was sweet and slow, tips of tongues swiping across each other, not quite going deeper. Wanda whimpered as Nat pulled back.

‚ÄúOne moment, √Ængera»ô, angel,‚Äù Nat stood up and brought Wanda with her. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not the only one that has been holding on to something for a ridiculously long time. I was trying to wait until your birthday.‚Äù Nat said, fishing a box out from the pocket of her hoodie.

‚ÄúBecause that‚Äôs not just as cheesy.‚Äù Wanda sniffed, new tears creeping from her eyes.

‚ÄúYou still win on that.‚Äù

Nat laughed as she opened the box, revealing a gold ring with a ruby heart. The band was braided with a row of diamonds on either side.

‚ÄúWanda, when you sent that text a few months back, my heart stopped. I watched you play house for decades, and I would do it again and again if it meant being even a fraction of your life. You asking if you could be mine were words I never thought I would see or hear. They were wishes and dreams. I couldn‚Äôt get back here, back to you, fast enough. We have loved each other in secret and lived for the stolen moments for so long, and to finally be ourselves has been freeing and amazing. But know that I would do it again and again if it meant that I would still get to be with you. I love you so much, Wanda, the Sunshine in my day. Will you marry me?‚Äù

Wanda was ugly crying, and she knew it.

‚ÄúYou already said yes,‚Äù Wanda sobbed a laugh.

‚ÄúJust give me this.‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, my North Star, I will marry you.‚Äù Wanda grinned.

Nat placed the ring on Wanda‚Äôs finger, wrapping her arms around Wanda‚Äôs waist and kissing her passionately before turning off the firepit and leading her to their bedroom.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha had never planned an actual Valentine‚Äôs Day. She had absolutely ‚Äòcelebrated,‚Äô but a proper date? It had never been her thing in the past. She had tried with Swords but had been shot down. Maybe it was time to start tackling the Swords' trauma with her therapist. She shoved the thoughts aside. Tonight was not the night for those memories. Rio had offered to plan the night, but this was something Agatha wanted to do.

Except her plans were shot when Rio turned into Coach Vidal, and there was a basketball game on fucking Valentine‚Äôs Day. The rest of the coven didn‚Äôt even come since her kid was the only one technically involved, and her girlfriend was the coach. She could salvage it, right? But then, it was a doubleheader, and Rio was coaching both JV and varsity due to the JV coaches having some mystery flu. Calderu had suspended Daisy from coaching until March, and no matter how much Agatha had tried, Lilia hadn‚Äôt let up.

That‚Äôs how Agatha found herself in the gym at SHIELD, cheering alongside the Starks and the Langs, wearing a SHIELD jersey with VIDAL Number 13 across the back.

Tony smirked, leaning across Pepper to talk to Agatha.

‚ÄúI never thought I‚Äôd see the day Agatha Harkness had another woman‚Äôs name on her,‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôd never thought I‚Äôd see the day Pepper would give you your balls back, and what do you know? I still haven‚Äôt,‚Äù Agatha shot back to Pepper‚Äôs laughter.

‚ÄúShe has you there, honey,‚Äù Pepper added.

Tony turned bright red.

‚ÄúGood thing Nicky learned from his other parents,‚Äù he grumbled.

‚ÄúFor the most part,‚Äù Agatha smirked before turning to Pepper as Tony returned to his original place. ‚ÄúMorgan is a really great kid. Are you sure it‚Äôs okay for Nicky to take her out after this without an adult chaperone?‚Äù

Nicky and Morgan had planned to go out to a diner and a late movie with a pass, stating it was a school event. If they did get pulled over and caught, Agatha and Tony planned to play the megastar and extremely famous director card to get around the California state minor driver rules. Misdemeanors, not felonies and all that.

Pepper smiled.

‚ÄúI trust them both to make good choices, and I trust you two to get them out of any trouble they could potentially get into. By that, I mean I trust our collective legal teams,‚Äù

‚ÄúSmart girl,‚Äù Agatha smiled.

They continued to cheer the team on. Junior varsity had already played, though they still sat on the bench out of support and respect. Tommy had come along to support Cassie Lang. They were ‚Äòhanging out‚Äô and not necessarily dating. Neither of them wanted labels, stating that they were too young for that and only freshmen. Yet if you asked Billy, he and Eddie were going to get married, Eddie was going to be a doctor, Billie would follow in his mother‚Äôs footsteps, and they would have two point five children, two cats, matching Subarus, and work closely with LGBTQIA+ organizations. The twins could finish each other‚Äôs sentences but were as different as night and day.

Agatha turned to watch Rio and Nicky as they coached in sync. They made a great team, and it made her heart flutter. Rio was back at her apartment during the week now that filming had wrapped up, and Nicky missed her. Agatha hadn‚Äôt addressed the ‚ÄòMy Son‚Äô comment with Rio, and Rio hadn‚Äôt brought it up, but Agatha found Rio catching herself slipping and purposely not saying it.

Agatha was lost in her thoughts when she felt eyes on her and looked over to see Lilia staring at her, the old bat. Agatha just glared at her and flipped her off. She was still mad about the basketball game situation. Lilia rolled her eyes.

SHIELD won yet another game and Agatha said her goodbyes to the other parents while waiting for Rio when Lilia pulled her aside.

‚ÄúWhat do you want?‚Äù Agatha said coldly.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt remain angry at me for a schedule created before I made Rio the coach,‚Äù Lilia said with an exasperated sigh.

‚ÄúI can be rather stubborn.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm painfully aware Agatha. You can still have a good night and watch your movies. She has tests to grade this weekend, no matter where she is. Also, she had a rough day. Just be there for her, not whatever extravagant thing you tried to plan to sweep her off her feet with tonight,‚Äù Lilia suggested.

‚ÄúYou are the one to be giving me romantic advice? Why the sudden interest?‚Äù Agatha asked suspiciously.

‚ÄúEven Hollywood playboys deserve to settle down eventually, no matter with whom, Agatha. Besides, happy coaches win games. Winning games leads to state. Winning state propels the school,‚Äù Lilia smiled. ‚ÄúIt may also be time to address when she called him ‚Äúher son‚Äù - everyone heard it, and I am sure you haven‚Äôt approached it.‚Äù She added before turning away and briskly walking away with a wave over her shoulder. Agatha had known the woman forever, and she was still often confused by her. She shook her head as she turned to see Rio headed toward her, looking exhausted.

Rio took Agatha‚Äôs hand, kissing its back. ‚ÄúI love the jersey, m‚Äôlady,‚Äù she looked around as the gym cleared out, eyes landing on Morgan and Nicky as the teens walked up to them.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre headed out, and I‚Äôll be home by curfew,‚Äù both teens hugged the women.

Agatha looked up at her son. ‚ÄúBe very careful. Watch for deer and insane blondes, got it?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, Mom,‚Äù he hugged her again and looked at Rio, ‚ÄúAnother great night.‚Äù He waved as he took Morgan‚Äôs hand. ‚ÄúGood night, Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day. Love you, Moms!‚Äù Nicky flashed another smile, and they left.

Rio turned to Agatha, ‚ÄúDid he call me mom in a non-joking manner?‚Äù

‚ÄúHe did.‚Äù

Rio remembered the last time she became attached to someone else‚Äôs children. Three blonde kids she would still do anything for. The oldest was in college now and all three crossed her mind occasionally. She couldn‚Äôt take losing another kid, set really, as she considered the twins partially hers as well.

‚ÄúWe should probably discuss this.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs face was solemn as she watched Nicky and Morgan leave the gym.

‚ÄúMy house?‚Äù Agatha watched Rio carefully. She knew Rio had referred to it as home before but didn‚Äôt want to push it right now.

‚ÄúYour house. Where‚Äôs Tommy?‚Äù Rio scanned the gym for the Maximoff they were supposed to be in charge of.

‚ÄúHe went with Cassie and family for pizza and a game night. Vision will pick him up later.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what the kids call ‚Äòhanging out‚Äô these days?‚Äù

They started walking to Rio‚Äôs car as they continued their conversation.¬† Agatha shrugged.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so different from when I was a kid. Then again, I snuck around on movie sets and in trailers. My teenage dating life wasn‚Äôt really typical.‚Äù Agatha recalled.

Agatha opened the car door for Rio like she always did, and Rio rolled her eyes.

‚ÄúNo wonder you make all the women swoon,‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm oozing with charm.‚Äù Agatha leaned in, kissing Rio. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry our first manufactured day of love isn‚Äôt more romantic.‚Äù

‚ÄúSpoken like Agatha Harkness. Let‚Äôs go back to the compound and talk about the whole son thing. We‚Äôve been pushing it off long enough. Then we‚Äôll go from there, okay?‚Äù

They sat on the couch, a movie playing in the background.

‚ÄúAre you okay that I called Nicky my son? It really did just slip,‚Äù Rio asked, drinking a cider and watching Agatha‚Äôs expressions.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve thought about it, and I am. It surprised me at first, but more because I‚Äôve never had a serious romantic partner that I saw as his other parent before. Swords came around when he was born, and I think she considered it for a minute but ultimately decided against it.‚Äù Something dark slid over Agatha‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúI mean, she bailed after the first pregnancy ended. I shouldn‚Äôt have been surprised when there was an actual baby.‚Äù

Rio hated this Swords bitch. ‚ÄúBut you have concerns,‚Äù Rio surmised.

‚ÄúNicky is still concerned about the me factor,‚Äù Agatha confirmed with a sigh.

‚ÄúHe loves you. He trusts you. You are becoming another mom to him, and it scares him how fast it‚Äôs happening. However, there‚Äôs still my past and reputation. I‚Äôm not exactly the poster child for steady relationships.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm proud of you for communicating and being open and honest.‚Äù Rio wanted to validate Agatha before she shut down. Sometimes, she had to treat her with teacher gloves. ‚ÄúI love him very much, as if he were my own, but it did happen very quickly, and I can back off some. I‚Äôm still going to be protective of him, but if I overstep, just tell me. I love you and will respect all of your boundaries.‚Äù

‚ÄúDamn Rio. I am a powerful woman, and you just come in here, break down my walls, and make me completely vulnerable in every way except physically.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have a gift,‚Äù Rio smirked.

‚ÄúNow, I heard you had a bad day. Come here and tell me all about it,‚Äù Agatha adjusted so Rio could lay against her and vent all she needed to.

‚ÄúI teach high schoolers, and it was Valentine‚Äôs Day. I also had the freshman biology class dissect sheep hearts, so that was fun. Do you know how many students I had to pull apart from each other today? Khan and Chavez were like sapphic bunnies. They were EVERYWHERE too! I do have a very decent supply of candy and chocolate in my desk drawers, though, and I ran a carload of flowers and stuffed animals home after school before the game.‚Äù

Agatha almost interrupted her to tell her she didn‚Äôt see any of those things around until she remembered Rio meant her apartment and not Agatha‚Äôs house. Rio was still recounting her day.

‚ÄúThe gifts do not matter to me, but it‚Äôs so sweet that they bring me things, especially at this level. So that wasn‚Äôt bad. I could‚Äôve done without some of the teasing from the jealous teachers though.‚Äù Rio rolled her eyes. ‚ÄúLilia keeps shutting it down, and then I feel like a teacher‚Äôs pet. I‚Äôm worried the coworker dynamic will affect it.‚Äù

Agatha ran her nails along Rio‚Äôs scalp.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure it won‚Äôt, baby. There‚Äôs nothing to worry about.‚Äù

‚ÄúSays Agatha Fucking Harkness. Oh! That reminds me, I got you something. It‚Äôs in my school bag,‚Äù Rio hopped up from the couch and retrieved a card from her bag that she had sat at the table. When she returned, Agatha was holding a gift box of her own.

Rio looked around, trying to determine the origin of the box.

‚ÄúI hid it under the couch,‚Äù Agatha said cooly.

‚ÄúOf course you did. It‚Äôs not much, but here, you go first because I went first at Christmas,‚Äù Rio instructed as she sat back on the couch.

‚ÄúYes, Coach,‚Äù Agatha handed Rio the box, opening the envelope. The card was sweet and held tickets to the Beach Life Festival for the first weekend of May.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs mainly for Alanis, Train, Sublime, Lenny...okay, there‚Äôs a lot of people we like. I thought we could make a weekend out of it since it‚Äôs a four-day weekend for us anyway.‚Äù Rio pushed her hair behind her ear, looking down sheepishly. Agatha leaned forward and kissed her.

‚ÄúI love it and look forward to making memories with you. However, I think we‚Äôre beginning to think alike. Open yours.‚Äù

Rio tilted her head questioningly as she opened the box revealing plane tickets that had ‚ÄòHarkness Airlines‚Äô on them with Lima, Peru as the destination, tickets to see Shakira, and a pack of gum.

‚ÄúIs this because of how badly my ears popped the last flight?‚Äù Rio laughed as Agatha nodded. Rio looked closely at the dates. ‚ÄúWait, Aggie, this says we leave tomorrow!‚Äù

‚ÄúConcert is Monday, got you out of your teacher workday on Tuesday, and Lilia took care of Wednesday for you. I couldn‚Äôt get you out of the game tonight, but I did get you out of Wednesday. Alice, Wanda, and I packed for you. Alice and Jen will Raven sit. Lesson plans are also taken care of, courtesy of one of your backups that you already had in your Google Drive.‚Äù Agatha had planned everything.

‚ÄúAgatha Fucking Harkness, if I wasn‚Äôt exhausted‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs always time for that later. It‚Äôs a 9-hour flight. Now, let‚Äôs get those sore muscles of yours into a hot bath, and I will take care of you, my love.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

‚ÄúYou do have a type, and I may have made a few requests for the set list,‚Äù Agatha put an arm around Rio, pulling Rio onto her lap. ‚ÄúI love when you sing to me.‚Äù

Rio took the hint and straddled Agatha, wrapping her arms around Agatha‚Äôs shoulders.

‚ÄúHow did I get so lucky?‚Äù

Rio gazed into the sapphire blue eyes of Agatha Harkness. In them, she saw the hope and promise of their future and at the same time, she still wasn‚Äôt sure what their future was. They hadn‚Äôt been together that long, but she still wondered.

‚ÄúI believe I‚Äôm the lucky one here, my love,‚Äù Agatha kissed the hollow of Rio‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúYou came to LA and all.‚Äù

Agatha grinned as she reached for a remote and turned off the lights in the cabin. ‚ÄúI believe we can remedy that.‚Äù

As they entered their suite in Peru hours later, Rio entered the bedroom and collapsed on the bed. Jetlagged and exhausted from their in-flight activities. With customs, the flight, a three-hour time difference, and getting checked in, it was nearly midnight, and Rio was ready to sleep for the next twenty-four hours.

‚ÄúAre you going to change first?‚Äù Agatha lay next to her and slung an arm across Rio.

‚ÄúI took my shoes off, and I‚Äôm tired,‚Äù Rio muttered back as Agatha‚Äôs phone went off, the ringtone indicating it was Jen. ‚ÄúI love her, but it‚Äôs midnight, and she knows where we are.‚Äù

Agatha groaned as she answered, and Jen‚Äôs face appeared on the screen. ‚ÄúWe could have been naked,‚Äù Agatha said in place of a greeting.

‚ÄúNothing I haven‚Äôt seen before. Anyway, is your other half around?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou can see her next to me.‚Äù Agatha moved the phone more to show Rio.

‚ÄúNo, the redheaded one.‚Äù Jen rolled her eyes as if it were obvious who she meant.

‚ÄúNo, it‚Äôs Valentine‚Äôs and her birthday weekend. Nicky‚Äôs staying with the twins and Vision. Wanda and Nat won‚Äôt surface until we get back, most likely. Why?‚Äù

‚ÄúWait, you‚Äôre in Peru without Nat?‚Äù Jen looked alarmed.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not stupid, Kale. We do have security with us. I know I can‚Äôt go anywhere without an armed bodyguard,‚Äù Agatha huffed. It was not something she liked about her fame. ‚ÄúGet on with it. Why are you calling me this late at night and looking for Wanda, too?‚Äù

‚ÄúI have had a flurry of phone calls and e-mails, and you‚Äôre both about to be very busy women‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm already a busy woman,‚Äù Agatha turned her head and grinned at Rio as Jen rolled her eyes again.

‚ÄúStop acting like a teenage boy and go into global megastar mode, please?‚Äù

Agatha disgruntedly blew a strand of hair out of her face as Rio suppressed a giggle.

Jen carried on, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve had requests to present at a few awards shows and accepted them, the Spirit awards, you‚Äôre presenting at the Oscars for Supporting Actress, then the SAG, QUEERTIES, GLAAD, and you‚Äôre nominated at all of them. Both Agatha and Rio were sitting up now. Rio was trying to take everything in.

‚ÄúWait, what about the festival in May? Coachella? Spring Break? Your wedding and reception? Prom? There are some important things we had planned,‚Äù Rio looked between the phone and Agatha.

Agatha put her hand on Rio‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúWelcome to the reality of being me. The past few months were a break period. Now everything is kicking into high gear. I‚Äôm sure Jen worked out a few non-negotiables, but some sacrifices will have to be made. Weekends are generally free, most shoots are Monday through Friday, and we can only work five consecutive days a row. Thank you, SAG-Aftra. Spring Break is probably one of those sacrifices, though,‚Äù Agatha turned back to the phone to confirm her suspicions.

Jen was nodding. ‚ÄúI was able to negotiate your music festivals. Coachella was easy. Most celebrities go. Nicky‚Äôs junior prom is safe, and our Vegas wedding and the reception are safe. Your Spring Break plans are not. Agatha, you‚Äôll be making the promotion rounds that week.‚Äù Jen gave Rio a sad smile, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry. I hate to be the bearer of bad news this weekend, but I had to sync calendars and deliver the news as soon as I could.‚Äù

‚ÄúI understand, mood killer,‚Äù Agatha smirked. ‚ÄúSend me the itinerary for Spring Break, please, once you plan it. Maybe we can salvage something.‚Äù

They hung up, and Agatha turned to Rio, who was pouting.

‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt lying when I said this is one of the reasons I didn‚Äôt date before. It‚Äôs a lot to ask of someone.‚Äù Agatha said softly, trying to gauge where Rio was at with her feelings.

‚ÄúI understand it‚Äôs your job. I just hate how everything can change so quickly.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know, baby. It‚Äôs a lot. Let‚Äôs enjoy this weekend, and then come with me or stay with Nicky when you can. Please?‚Äù

Agatha was not used to asking someone these things, but it felt right. She liked knowing that Nicky could stay at the house with Rio and loved having Rio by her side.

‚ÄúI understand if you can‚Äôt come on school nights. Lilia might start saying no to you being out so much,‚Äù Agatha did not want to hear what Lilia had to say about that.

‚ÄúI hope you can make it to the playoff games if the team makes it, though even if we lose the rest of the regular season, we should still make it.‚Äù

Saturday night faded into Sunday morning and they were up extremely early, despite the time change and jet lag. Rio had wanted to do some sightseeing while in Peru and dragged Agatha out to Machu Picchu. Agatha had been before but enjoyed exploring the ruins with Rio and was glad that Alice had been part of the packing team. Alice knew Rio would want to go and had packed the appropriate gear for the hike.

Agatha had to guide Rio away from a tarantula they saw amongst some rocks that Rio had wanted to ‚Äòrehome‚Äô back to LA.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs cute, and I want to name her Victoria,‚Äù Rio said.‚Äù

‚ÄúI will buy you a tarantula, my love. Wait, what would Raven do?‚Äù Agatha tilted her head, picturing the cat-shaped Eldritch creature training an overgrown furry spider to do her bidding.

‚ÄúProbably snuggle with it,‚Äù Rio shrugged, waving at the spider and walking back to the main group with Agatha and their security detail.

‚ÄúI was imagining her training it to do things for her,‚Äù

‚ÄúAlso a possibility,‚Äù Rio agreed.

After breakfast on Monday morning, they lay in bed discussing the upcoming busy schedule.

‚ÄúAll of the awards shows are in or around LA, which makes it easy. Talk shows are mainly in LA and New York and mostly over Spring Break. It looks like filming for the show is back in LA, so that makes that easy. Marvel and Disney are between LA and New Jersey, and then this summer, I‚Äôll be in England, Italy, and Australia. It may extend longer. You can come with me over Spring Break if you want to.‚Äù Agatha was trying not to sound desperate to spend every moment with Rio and failing.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a possibility, depending on the schedule. I was hoping we could have some fun this summer, not you working the whole time.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt make sense to bring you along either, especially Marvel. It‚Äôs a closed set. If they could cut you off from the entire world until the film was done, they would.‚Äù Agatha spoke seriously.

‚ÄúSo I‚Äôve heard. I can come to visit, though, right?‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll figure out something. I cannot go for three months without seeing you and Nicky,‚Äù she kissed Rio before turning the discussion to upcoming awards shows.

The concert was amazing, Rio honing into her Spanish-speaking childhood. They sat in a box, which was safer for them, even with security. Rio‚Äôs hips absolutely did not lie as she danced the entire night and sang to Agatha. Rio rolling her R‚Äôs made Agatha feel very indecent things that she planned on capitalizing on when they returned to the hotel.

Keeping to her word, Agatha had indeed made a few requests for the setlist as several older songs were played, and Shakira mentioned singing them for ‚Äòa friend‚Äô, winking in the direction of their box.

They flew back early the next day so they could recover on Wednesday before Rio had to go back to teacher mode. They mostly slept on the plane and looked through the pictures they took and a few that popped up online.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still getting used to people posting pictures of me online. It‚Äôs so weird. People will post ‚ÄòRio Vidal sightings‚Äô now.‚Äù Rio mused.

‚ÄúThis is your life now,‚Äù Agatha looked at her. ‚ÄúAs long as you want it.‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs breath caught for a millisecond. What did Agatha mean when she said those things? Did she just want to date forever? Get married? Live together? Would she be okay if Rio ended things? Was she waiting for Rio to end things? Agatha was not the most forthcoming when it came to commitment, although Rio was the one they had waited on in that department. She would drop it for now and focus on other things.

They had left Rio‚Äôs car in the lot near the private hangar at the airport. Security escorted them until they sat in the car, Agatha climbing in the passenger seat after opening Rio‚Äôs door when she pointed at something.

‚ÄúRio, what‚Äôs that?‚Äù Agatha pointed at a letter on the dashboard that was addressed to Rio in Lou‚Äôs handwriting.

Rio froze for a few beats before reaching out and calmly taking the letter. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs from Lou,‚Äù She said, her voice cold. ‚ÄúI thought she was still in prison?‚Äù

Agatha sighed, her head falling against the headrest. ‚ÄúI swear this bitch has nine lives. Her lawyers must have gotten her out on house arrest or something. We will need to tell Nat. Do you want to open it or wait until you‚Äôre alone?‚Äù Agatha wanted Rio to share with her, but it was for Rio, and she wouldn‚Äôt force her.

‚ÄúMy Dearest Rio,

The night Agatha confessed to you, she knew I had documents proving the near marriage and her first pregnancy. Did she tell you because she wanted to or because she wanted to beat me to it? Can you trust her to tell you the truth without being forced?

What else is she still keeping from you? Other than her ex‚Äôs identity?

You will always be mine,

I love you. No more secrets.

Lou."

Rio didn‚Äôt know how to feel. She just slouched in her seat and leaned her head back, clutching the letter. She let out an exasperated sigh, not even turning to look at Agatha. ‚ÄúSpeak.‚Äù She commanded in a tired tone.

‚ÄúI had felt guilty for not telling you ever since that initial discussion. When Nat told me Lou had Lorna‚Äôs documents, I knew which ones they were. ‚ÄúWhat do you want me to say, Agatha? My psychotic ex tells me in a letter that you bared your soul after you found out she knew your dark secrets. You wouldn‚Äôt tell me you loved me until then. I somewhat understand why your ex is still a mystery.‚Äù Rio sighed. She did that too much lately. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs just go back to the compound.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Agatha grabbed for the luggage.

‚ÄúLeave mine, I‚Äôm going home tonight,‚Äù Rio said softly before walking toward the door.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

‚ÄúOkay, seriously though, I am so forking proud of all of you. You have done an amazing job this season, and I am so thankful that you guys let me just come in and take over. Rio‚Äôs plays.

Rings were exchanged, a pronouncement was made, and Alice and Jen were officially married. There was not a dry eye in the place.

They had a small dinner afterward to celebrate before everyone went their separate ways and began their Spring Break plans. The newlyweds were off to somewhere tropical for a few days before being back in LA for the reception. Vision and the twins were going to hike in the Grand Canyon for a few days. Nat and Wanda had plans to hustle a few poker tables for sport, and Billy went back to his room to talk to Morgan. He was going skiing with the Starks for a few days, and they were making plans for the trip. The boy was exactly like his mother when it came to love.
