I knew some of what was in there, not what‚Äôs written in the journal, other than it‚Äôs for Alice if she ever reads it.‚Äù Agatha turned to Rio. ‚ÄúFor everything else, you really do need to talk to Alice.‚Äù

Rio accepted that. She knew Lorna and Agatha had been close and that there were things about that particular history that she would never know.

‚ÄúWill do. Now, we have a busy week ahead of us and an early flight to New York tomorrow. I say we leave the red-headed demons to their hustle and, um, turn in for the night, my love.‚Äù Rio placed her empty champagne flute on a nearby table and took Agatha‚Äôs hand, leading her to the door.

‚ÄúOh? Tired already?‚Äù Agatha placed her glass down and followed Rio.

‚ÄúSomething like that.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Spring Break felt like a movie montage. The first few days were spent in New York, and the second half was spent in LA, leading up to Alice and Jen‚Äôs reception. Wanda and Nat had come with them so Nat could do bodyguard duty, and Wanda was on some of the press as well, with the awards' success. Rio loved watching Agatha do interviews and talk about her projects; how animated she was speaking about her work, facial expressions, and reactions. Agatha was so dedicated to what she did, and it showed in interviews. Everyone she spoke with would ask Agatha about Rio and Nicky, and she would gush about Nicky and try to be close-lipped about Rio but blush and say things were good and she was happy.

They went to Buzzfeed, where Wanda and Agatha both filmed a segment for ‚ÄòThirst Tweets,‚Äô which was full of laughter and was highly inappropriate. Rio and Nat were both mentioned in several of them and could be heard from behind the camera.

They flew back to LA for more press as everyone else started to return and prepare for the reception on Saturday. Lou‚Äôs trial was also that week, and everyone watched it closely. They expected her to plead insanity and get it. The sentencing is what they were the most concerned with, and how to keep her wherever she was sent to. That was the hard part.

Rio sat in front of the TV at Agatha‚Äôs, waiting for the final word when everyone else came back from whatever show they had been filming for.

‚ÄúAny word yet?‚Äù Agatha asked.

Rio just shook her head, eyes glued to the TV as Jen‚Äôs phone rang and the special report cut off.

All eyes turned to Jen as she hung up the phone.

‚ÄúBefore sentencing occurs, Lou is requesting to speak to you privately at the courthouse. She says she has information you‚Äôll want, and some things that belong to you, specifically those videos. Lawyers will meet us there.‚Äù Jen turned on her heel and walked back out.

Rio sat in the judge‚Äôs chambers across a table from Lou. Everyone else was outside and pissed about it‚Äîno recording devices, just the two of them, as Rio glared at her.

Lou inhaled sharply, ‚ÄúWhere do you want me to go, Rio?‚Äù She asked sincerely.

Rio looked at her cautiously. ‚ÄúWhat are you playing at?‚Äù

Lou let out a shrill laugh. ‚ÄúI want you more than anything, and I love you more than anything. Yet here I am. The past finally caught up to me. Oh, we‚Äôre not over, not in the least. I‚Äôll get out, and I‚Äôll get you back. I still have eyes and ears on you and Agatha. However, it‚Äôs not looking great at this moment. Lawyers say if I can get a good character witness, I might not be sent to the Island.‚Äù

A sarcastic smile slid across Rio‚Äôs face before she started laughing.

‚ÄúAre you fucking kidding me? You‚Äôre asking me to put in a good word for you? You‚Äôre unbelievable! No one gets out of The Island. It‚Äôs the most secure psych institution in the world; people disappear from there, never to be seen again, Lou, and I sincerely hope you‚Äôre one of them. How the fuck do you still have eyes and ears on us?‚Äù That tidbit just hit Rio as she backtracked.

‚ÄúYou are obsessed with knowing what your precious cat is doing all the fucking time,‚Äù Lou let out an exasperated sigh. ‚ÄúI just laid it all out for you, and you‚Äôre still going to let them put me away, possibly never to see me again?‚Äù

‚ÄúI hate you, and I don‚Äôt hate anyone! You made me despise you! You made me genuinely afraid for my life! You tried to hurt my son, Lou! I can‚Äôt trust you. You want to know where I want you? In a fucking grave! It‚Äôs the only way to know I and everyone I love is safe! Alice and Jen got married, and I was nervous you would find a way to ruin their day! You tried to win me back with empty promises of a baby, that‚Äôs a whole new level of fucked up, even for you! No, I will not be a character witness. Wait, is that the information you had? How you were still listening in? Through the pet cameras?‚Äù Rio was livid.

‚ÄúIt got you down here, didn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

Rio slammed her hands on the table, causing Lou to jump. ‚ÄúWhere are these belongings? Videos? Whatever the fuck else you have?‚Äù

‚ÄúHouse, in the safe. You need me‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt. You‚Äôre predictable, and I know all your codes.‚Äù Rio stood and walked toward the door. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to see your face again, Lou Falco. I feel so bad for Shane‚Äôs kids and pray they have a wonderful therapist. I hope you rot and are never heard from again. I was in love with you once, but I‚Äôm not now. When I do get married and potentially have a baby, it will be with Agatha.‚Äù With that, Rio left the room, Lou screaming behind her.

Rio looked at Nat as she walked past her, ‚ÄúI assume you got all that somehow, and we‚Äôre disabling Raven‚Äôs cameras and sending a team to Lou‚Äôs?‚Äù

Nat nodded.

‚ÄúGood.‚Äù Rio took Agatha‚Äôs hand as they walked out a side door where they had come in unseen. ‚ÄúI have a feeling she‚Äôll disappear in a few days and won‚Äôt be heard from again.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Alice and Jen couldn‚Äôt have asked for a more beautiful reception. Their friends had outdone themselves, and everything was going amazingly well. They had repeated their vows for everyone and were mingling, staying together, and accepting congratulations from co-workers, friends, and acquaintances.

Rio watched as everyone enjoyed themselves. The past few days had happened in a whirlwind, and she had to work in less than forty-eight hours. She watched as Wanda and Nat whispered to each other, discussing their future wedding most likely. The boys and their dates were dancing and laughing, and Agatha was talking animatedly with the Starks, among others, when she looked back at Rio and winked.

Rio‚Äôs mind wandered, taking in the expanse of celebrities and people now a part of her daily life. Everyone seemed to be here. Suddenly, she couldn‚Äôt help but think about how Agatha had mentioned that Swords was still in her life. Was Swords here? At Alice‚Äôs reception? It bothered Rio that Swords might be someone who would be at big events like this, and she didn‚Äôt know it. She looked around, surveying the room for older Hollywood women.¬† That‚Äôs when Rio heard a familiar voice.

‚Äú...you know, I helped Cher write Believe.‚Äù

No. The world stopped in the worst of ways, everything happening in slow motion. The voice floated to Rio‚Äôs ears again.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon kid, the song isn‚Äôt THAT old.‚Äù

Is that where Agatha got the ‚Äòkid‚Äô habit from?

Swords wasn‚Äôt a Hollywood powerhouse. No, she was the mysterious figure in the shadows, a keeper of secrets. Not famous, but infamous.

Puzzle pieces started to fall in place. The older woman, the caring mentor.

Rio turned her head, eyes landing on the owner of the voice, knowing full well the owner‚Äôs identity but not wanting to admit it to herself as the full weight of it hit her like a punch to the chest, shattering her heart, and sucking all the air from the room.

The Calderu knows best attitude, arrogance, and entitlement.

Lilia was Agatha‚Äôs ex.



Chapter End Notes

Oh damn.

I Have Learned The Lesson Of All That's Foul and Fair

Chapter Summary

A chronological flashback from 1987 to 2024.
How did we get here?
How did Lilia become the Swords of Agatha's tortured past?
How did Lorna fit in?
Just where did everything go so very wrong?

Chapter Notes

In this universe - Agatha is Idina Menzel as well, so, original Maureen, Elphaba, Elsa...

Trigger warnings: All of them.
Death, loss, implied abuse, pregnancy loss, addiction, drug use, implied minor doing illegal things, implied illegal activities, Agatha being Agatha, illness, birth, cold cougars.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

1987 Los Angeles

‚ÄúMom! Why can‚Äôt I just go to school normally like other kids? Instead of being tutored and doing everything from a distance? There‚Äôs that school for kids of celebrities and the rich that‚Äôs right here. I could socialize and be out of your hair.‚Äù Fourteen-year-old Agatha Harkness asked her mother. She spent all of her time either under Evanora‚Äôs very controlling thumb or on a set. She had her ways of rebelling and doing what she wanted, but more freedom was something she craved. She had gone through tutors and homeschool programs, and if her mother would let her, she could test out of high school and probably a few degree programs. She could speak multiple languages, code those new computers, and run all the movie equipment‚Ä¶what else was a bored child star supposed to do with her spare time? She broke laws, learned, and had a lot of mature fun with her costars.

Her mother wanted her to waste her talents on bible studies and high school work.

‚ÄúYou have been learning things above your station, Agatha. You will also spend more time in your religious studies. I only allow you to continue this devil‚Äôs work because it is good money for your future.‚Äù Evanora replied in her normal, harsh voice.

‚ÄúHa. You mean for you.‚Äù Agatha responded and received a slap across the face. It was a wonder she didn‚Äôt have a constant bruise on her left cheek.

‚ÄúYou will not smart back to me!‚Äù

It was then that there was a knock on the door. Evanora looked at Agatha severely. Agatha couldn‚Äôt remember a time when there was love in her mother‚Äôs eyes.

‚ÄúThat school you so desperately wanted to attend sends teachers for distance students. No need to physically go to the school. Ms. Calderu will be your teacher for the rest of your high school years. You will be respectful. Now, I have errands to run.‚Äù

Evanora opened the door of the trailer, welcomed Ms. Calderu in, and introduced her to Agatha before leaving. Agatha knew her mother was going to some church function.

‚ÄúGood afternoon, Miss Harkness,‚Äù Lilia greeted her, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Ms. Calderu, and I‚Äôll be your teacher for the remainder of your high school experience. I understand that you‚Äôre actually quite advanced,‚Äù The teacher smiled warmly at her, setting books down on the table and sitting.

Agatha looked Lilia up and down. The older woman had long brown hair that she wore up, hazel eyes, and an Italian-New Yorker accent. Agatha propped her chin in one hand. This was going to be fun.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your first name?‚Äù Agatha asked innocently.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt see why that‚Äôs relevant,‚Äù Lilia replied, sorting through a stack of papers.

‚ÄúYou know mine, and if I‚Äôm going to be stuck with you for the next several years, it‚Äôs only fair I know it,‚Äù Agatha reasoned.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been warned about you, Miss Harkness. Your tactics won‚Äôt work, and you won‚Äôt scare me.‚Äù

Lilia had indeed heard how Agatha had either outsmarted, outwit, psychologically tortured, or plain seduced any previous person who tried to teach her. Purely for fun. SHIELD was the elder Harkness‚Äôs last option. Agatha wasn‚Äôt a bad kid. She was just trying to spite her mother.

‚ÄúOh? Did Evanora warn you? Tell you I was born evil and should have been killed at birth?‚Äù

Agatha‚Äôs face hardened. She no longer looked fourteen, but much older. Lilia wanted to soften but had been warned about this, too.

‚ÄúNo, a mutual friend of ours, and I‚Äôve been told you like a mystery. So, for every lesson we complete, I‚Äôll either answer a question of yours or let you guess who our mutual friend is, agreed?‚Äù

Lilia had always been good with these Hollywood kids. She had grown up adjacent to Broadway and moved out to LA when her best friend had. The child stars had to be given some semblance of control as they had so little of it.

Agatha looked at her cautiously, ‚ÄúFor each assignment I complete, not a lesson, an assignment could be a worksheet, that could be four or five a session,‚Äù She countered, her blue eyes sparkling.

Lilia scoffed. ‚ÄúEvery two,‚Äù she counteroffered.

‚ÄúDeal.‚Äù Agatha agreed.

That day, Agatha learned that Ms. Calderu was 28, her first name was Lilia, she was originally from New York, and her favorite color was yellow.

When Lilia returned to the house she shared with her friend, she sat her bag down and sighed.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right. She‚Äôs a smart kid but is trouble with a capital T and is shadier than a forest. Her mother is also a complete loon and abusive.‚Äù

Hollywood superstar Lorna Wu nodded.

‚ÄúI hope to get her out of there one day, sooner rather than later. She has a bright future ahead of her if we remove the crazy factor. That‚Äôs where you come in.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

1989 Los Angeles

‚ÄúAfter being outed as a lesbian, and her mother attempting to murder her, Agatha Harkness, the sixteen-year-old award-winning actress, has won her legal battle against her mother and is now legally independent from her‚Ä¶‚Äù

Agatha cut off the TV that showed a picture of her with a stoic expression on the steps of the Los Angeles courthouse, watching as her mother was escorted away. Evanora had been hurling bible verses at her as they led her away. Lawyers surrounded Agatha, the face of America‚Äôs brave lesbian sweetheart. Sixteen and on her own.

She sat in her house. She planned on selling it and buying a condo, with Lorna and Lilia in the condo on either side, watching her carefully. She had guessed that Lorna was the ‚Äòmutual friend‚Äô three months into Lilia being her teacher.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sixteen,‚Äù She said softly, lip quivering. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sixteen and will be seventeen in a few months. My closest friends are a twenty-nine-year-old movie star who made me the godmother of her child and my thirty-year-old teacher. I am technically a self-inflicted orphan, the face of the queer community, a child star still on the rise, I have a growing reputation for being a bit of a party girl, and people want to be me,‚Äù A tear fell down her cheek as she looked at both of them. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to be me right now.‚Äù

Lilia pushed a piece of hair behind her ear. ‚ÄúI know Aggie. We‚Äôre both here for you. You have a staff of people, and you are the strongest person we know. You can go to school now if you want. You can stop acting, whatever you want.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, I love acting and telling stories. My filming schedule isn‚Äôt conducive to going to school, and I‚Äôm almost done. I do want to get my college degree, though. I just, it‚Äôs a lot. Thank you both for everything you‚Äôve done to get me out of there. Lorna, you‚Äôll be a great mom. I really think if you moved Gran and Alice out here‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha trailed off. She knew it was no use. Lorna was more of a mom to Agatha than Evanora had been, but Lorna was insistent on Alice having a ‚Äònormal‚Äô life.

Lorna pulled out a small box and handed it to Agatha.

‚ÄúWe got you something to commemorate today, and our little coven, so to speak,‚Äù Lorna looked to Lilia as Agatha opened the box.

Agatha took in the gold, purple, and ivory locket with the three women on it, looking at the women on either side of her, eyebrows raised in question.

Lilia reached over, pointing to each silhouette as she spoke. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the triple goddess, maiden, mother, crone.‚Äù

Lorna nodded, adding. ‚ÄúThe three of us. Lilia‚Äôs the crone,‚Äù She grinned. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a reminder that while you‚Äôve freed yourself from Evanora, you‚Äôre never alone. We‚Äôre in this together, sweetie.‚Äù

Agatha lightly ran her fingers over the three silhouettes, an idea pushing it‚Äôs way to the front of her brain. ‚ÄúWait one minute!‚Äù She got up, her bare feet running to the bathroom and she returned with three small rubberbands and scissors, one of the very few times her age actually shone through her more mature facade.

‚ÄúCut off a small lock of hair and hand it to me.‚Äù The older women did as commanded, and Agatha took the auburn, chestnut, and jet black locks of hair and secured them in the locket.

‚ÄúThere,‚Äù she said, voice wavering with the weight of her emotions, ‚Äúthe three of us, together, forever.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

1991, Los Angeles

It was Agatha‚Äôs eighteenth birthday. Although she had been an adult for longer, she was now legally an adult. That day, she bought a large piece of land that she eventually wanted to build on. For now, she would need to work on getting permits, clearing the land, and extending utilities to it.

Agatha was not like any other eighteen-year-old in the world.

She also was finally going to act on recently developed feelings.

Lately, she had begun to see Lilia in a different light.

Lilia had always been one of her two mentors. She had come into her life with a mission to free her from Evanora‚Äôs clutches, had been there for her during very dark times, and was one of her closest friends.

Agatha absolutely loved Lilia, just as she loved Lorna. Her best friends happened to be in their thirties, and Agatha happened to be more emotionally mature than her eighteen years on this earth. She wasn‚Äôt in love with Lilia, no, but she was attracted to her. She always had been to a degree, but now, it was boiling at the edge, and she needed to act on it.

For her birthday, they had rented out a club in downtown LA. She had been drinking. No one cared how old you were when you were as famous as she was. She had finally mustered up the courage, and ‚ÄúRescue Me‚Äù by Madonna was playing when Agatha found Lilia standing on her own.

Perfect.

‚ÄúHappy Birthday, Gorgeous!‚Äù Lilia smiled as Agatha approached.

Agatha was fueled by vodka and couldn‚Äôt stop. She went all in, hooked her fingers through the belt loops of Lilia‚Äôs jeans, and kissed Lilia like it was the last thing she was going to do.

The best part was when Lilia kissed her back.

Agatha relaxed into the kiss when Lilia forcefully shoved her back, eyes wide, lips swollen.

‚ÄúAgatha, I‚Ä¶‚Äù She was stepping away from Agatha in shock. ‚ÄúI hate Madonna,‚Äù she blurted before she darted away. Agatha went to go after her when she felt a hand close around her bicep. She turned to see Lorna, eyes full of worry, as she pulled her to a quieter area.

‚ÄúWhat were you thinking, Agatha?‚Äù she asked. She wasn‚Äôt mad, just confused.

‚ÄúYou know I‚Äôve always been attracted to her,‚Äù Agatha replied. She was leaning against a wall, still fuzzy from the alcohol, arms crossed, eyes trained on the toes of her shoes.

‚ÄúYes, but that doesn‚Äôt mean kiss her the day you‚Äôre no longer jailbait, sweetie,‚Äù Lorna put a comforting hand on her shoulder. ‚ÄúDo you really want to turn one of your best friends into another conquest? You just turned eighteen, and everyone knows what you‚Äôve been up to since you were thirteen. Now, you can broadcast it. Do you want Lilia to be another on a growing list?‚Äù

Lorna wasn‚Äôt judging. At thirty-one, she had a long list herself and several divorces to her name. There was no shame here. Agatha let out a sound of agreement.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right.‚Äù

‚ÄúI usually am. Now let‚Äôs go find Lilia and get some water in you, birthday girl.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

1993 Los Angeles

Agatha had just returned from several months of filming overseas, and Lorna was still abroad. Things had gone back to normal in the past two years, though Agatha still had feelings for Lilia.

Lilia wasn‚Äôt sure how she felt about Agatha, but she knew she didn‚Äôt feel right dating her, and she was not going to be another notch in her metaphorical bedpost. She was, however, going to take her out to celebrate her return. Agatha had matured more and looked far less like the fourteen-year-old girl she first met six years ago and more like the woman she was destined to be. Lilia was proud of her. She was racking up awards and rising in fame and popularity. She hadn‚Äôt gone the way of some childhood stars, and she was using her fame for good.

Lilia loved and cherished her career. However, she also loved the position it put her in and the proximity to power. You could take the Italian out of New York‚Ä¶

She dealt in secrets and information, her ability to read people gave her the upper hand on these power players, and she could negotiate a Hollywood contract with the best of them. Lilia was behind some major dealings in Hollywood, and no one would ever know. She had recently purchased an old Victorian mansion and was having it renovated. ‚ÄòOh, an uncle back east passed.‚Äô she had said. More like, ‚ÄòHoward Stark closed a major deal with my help. ‚Äô

Some of this knowledge she would pass to Agatha. How to be discreet in your affairs, curate the you that you wanted the public to see. Agatha was going to be a star like no other. She knew it, and so did Lorna. Or at least, that was their hope.

Agatha had told Lilia all about filming and stories about her co-stars. She had been nervous throughout dinner and then afterward at the bar they had gone to. She‚Äôd even turned down every woman who approached her, which was very unlike her. Lilia had an idea of what was happening, and she had to stop it.

‚ÄúLilia, I‚Äôve been thinking about what happened when I turned eighteen‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha looked at her nervously.

‚ÄúAgatha, you can‚Äôt even legally drink yet,‚Äù Lilia knew what she was about to say.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm drinking right now. In public.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot legally.‚Äù Lilia pointed out.

‚ÄúLilia, I‚Äôm legally an adult. I own property, in fact, several homes. Hell, I run a successful club in New York, have an EGOT, and more awards than some actors three times my age.‚Äù Agatha listed off qualifications as if she were in an interview.

‚ÄúAgatha, you know I don‚Äôt care about any of that. I‚Äôm not going to be another name on your list.‚Äù Lilia didn‚Äôt expect Agatha to be offended.

‚ÄúLilia, that‚Äôs not what I want. I respect you too much to just make you another nameless woman in a pile of bodies. I want to date you.‚Äù

Lilia was shocked. ‚ÄúAgatha, we cannot date. People would talk,‚Äù she lowered her voice. ‚ÄúPeople would think I had had a relationship with you when I taught you. I could lose my career.‚Äù Lilia had invested too much to get where she was.

‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt though, that‚Äôs disgusting. I thought you were pretty, but no.‚Äù Agatha wrinkled her nose.

Lilia smirked, ‚ÄúBecause you weren‚Äôt having age-inappropriate relations at that age?‚Äù

‚ÄúNot with you,‚Äù Agatha replied.

‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt. Go home, Agatha, you‚Äôve had too much to drink, and you‚Äôre not thinking straight.‚Äù Lilia took her drink from her.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not capable of thinking straight,‚Äù Agatha muttered.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

April 1996 New York City

It was the opening night of Rent, and Agatha was playing Maureen. She had just put on an amazing performance and was hoping this would be her second Tony. She met Lorna and Lilia backstage, both of them glowing.

‚ÄúOh, sweetie, you did such a great job! I am so proud of you! Your second Broadway show, and it‚Äôs going to be such a success!‚Äù Lorna gushed like the proud surrogate mother she was. Alice was seven, yet here Lorna was, a bigger part of Agatha‚Äôs life than Alice‚Äôs. Agatha would always carry that guilt with her.

‚ÄúDo you really think so?‚Äù Agatha asked, seeking the approval she so desperately desired.

‚ÄúOf course, you‚Äôre the perfect person to play Maureen. No one can cage you.‚Äù

Lilia added, pulling Agatha in for a hug. They both smelled like the lavender incense that engulfed Agatha‚Äôs Brooklyn apartment. Agatha‚Äôs feelings for Lilia had only increased, and she knew that once she added alcohol to the mix, she would be making moves tonight.

They were celebrating opening night and were out with the cast, crew, friends, and family. Lorna had already left with her current flavor of the moment, and Agatha and Lilia had stolen off to a corner and were considering leaving themselves. Agatha had shows the next day and had been drinking.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôs the kid?‚Äù

Agatha asked, referencing the sixteen-year-old Sokovian refugee, Wanda Maximoff. She had recently been taken in by her aunt, a producer, in LA after losing her parents and twin brother after the war had basically wiped her small country off the map. She was a sweet kid and was cast alongside Agatha in a TV show, ‚ÄòSisters‚Äô. Agatha was doing Rent for a few months while they were off and then would return to LA. Agatha didn‚Äôt trust Wanda‚Äôs aunt and was keeping a close eye on her. Agatha fully planned on being the Lorna in her life at Lilia‚Äôs insistence if needed. She would have done it anyway. She knew what it was like to be in an abusive environment.

‚ÄúWanda‚Äôs aunt is getting worse, but we have eyes on the kid. She‚Äôs asked about you. Give her a call or an email sometime, will you? Wanda misses you. You‚Äôre like an older sister to her. She really doesn‚Äôt have anyone, and we‚Äôre ancient in her eyes. She‚Äôs not as mature as you were at that age.‚Äù

Lilia had concern in her eyes and was acting as a teacher to Wanda just as she had to Agatha nearly a decade ago.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad she has both of you, like I did. How‚Äôs Lorna doing?‚Äù Agatha asked as they started to head toward the exit.

Lilia just made an exasperated sound. Lorna‚Äôs ‚Äòdemons,‚Äô as they called it, were increasing. Agatha‚Äôs own drinking was increasing, so she couldn‚Äôt say much. Lilia was the only one who had any control of anything and had to for her career.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm keeping an eye on her. I wish she would move Norma and Alice to LA. Enroll Alice at SHIELD. Norma would keep her healthy, at least. She‚Äôd get you into shape, too. Every time you visit them, she lays into you.‚Äù Lilia gave Agatha a knowing look.

‚ÄúI know. I know she wants Alice to experience some type of normalcy. She can still be involved, though.‚Äù

Agatha ended that line of conversation there, switching back to the musical as they talked until they arrived at the apartment in Brooklyn. She had dreams of renovating an entire floor of a building one day, maybe in Manhattan. For now, she liked this one.

Agatha always had an air of confidence bordering on cockiness, and it was partly how she got to where she was. The older she got, the more it grew, and the bolder and more arrogant she became. Her increasing alcohol usage did not help, and her increased tolerance hid her lack of sobriety well.

They settled for the night, and it was now or, well, next time. Agatha looked at Lilia, who was telling her a very animated story about school. NDAs be damned, Lilia told Agatha anyway and just spoke in initials. They were sitting close together on the loveseat, twisted towards each other. Agatha kept subtly moving closer, something that naturally happened between them until she was leaning against Lilia. Agatha turned her head, their faces inches apart. Their eyes locked.

This time, it was mutual.

It was passionate.

It was forbidden.

Lilia was, once again, the one to pull back.

‚ÄúAgatha, we can‚Äôt.‚Äù

Instead of panicked, she looked sad.

‚ÄúWe can, and I‚Äôve thought about it. Just listen,‚Äù Agatha had both hands on Lilia‚Äôs forearm. Lilia had one arm on the back of the couch and a hand on Agatha‚Äôs thigh. ‚ÄúYou have to go back to LA, and I‚Äôm staying here. We both excel at casual. That‚Äôs what we do.‚Äù

Lilia wasn‚Äôt so sure.

‚ÄúAgatha, you‚Äôve wanted to date for years. I don‚Äôt think you can do casual, and I don‚Äôt do monogamous. You‚Äôve known me for almost ten years, and you know my history. Lorna is a serial monogamist. I date many people, and you‚Äôre, well you‚Ä¶‚Äù Lilia trailed off.

‚ÄúI have a very high libido,‚Äù Agatha finished for her. ‚ÄúI can do this, Lilia. Just don‚Äôt fall in love with me. I‚Äôm very irresistible.‚Äù

It was an extremely bad idea.

They made an extremely bad decision that would change their lives.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

April 1996 Los Angeles, a few days later

‚ÄúYOU HAD SEX WITH AGATHA?! WHAT WERE YOU THINKING?!‚Äù Lorna screamed.

Lilia expected this reaction as they stood in Lilia‚Äôs kitchen. Lilia was trying to get her to eat something after a few days of Lorna obviously not eating anything.

‚ÄúThat she‚Äôs a very attractive woman and can make her own decisions,‚Äù Lilia responded, directing Lorna to the table.

‚ÄúNo, Lilia. You cannot do this. We practically raised her. This is not okay.‚Äù Lorna sat, accepting the bowl of pasta from her friend.

‚ÄúYOU practically raised her. I‚Äôm more of an older friend and gay auntie. Okay, yeah, that makes it weird.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou have taught her how to lie, cheat, curate her image, and now what, hone her skills in other areas? No, do NOT tell me about that.‚Äù Lorna added as Lilia began to speak. ‚ÄúShe is going to fall in love with you, Lilia. She‚Äôs been halfway there for years as it is.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe said it would be casual,‚Äù Lilia repeated. She had repeated it to herself over the past few days, trying to make herself feel better about what had happened.

‚ÄúYou believe that? Agatha is manipulative. You know that! You, of all people, should be impervious to her tactics, but you let your desires get in your way. I get that she is young, smart, and beautiful. She even makes me question myself. Alas, tragically straight. But Lilia, she‚Äôs not one of your Hollywood side items. She‚Äôs our Aggie.‚Äù Lorna finally took a bite of pasta, trying to let her words sink in.

‚ÄúWhat if I want to continue this? What if I like being with her, Lorna?‚Äù Lilia asked, slumping into a chair with pasta of her own.

‚ÄúDo you want commitment? Do you want to be public?‚Äù Lorna asked between bites, being careful not to eat too fast.

‚ÄúNo. I can‚Äôt risk my job like that, teaching or behind the scenes,‚Äù Lilia sighed. ‚ÄúI also want her to have someone there for her. Her drinking is getting out of hand and‚Ä¶‚Äù She looked away from Lorna, not able to see it.

‚ÄúAnd I started out as a functional alcoholic, and you don‚Äôt want her to spiral like I am?‚Äù Lorna raised an eyebrow.

Lilia worried at her bottom lip. She couldn‚Äôt voice what she was actually thinking. Yes, Lorna had things mostly under control for now, but that was the real reason she didn‚Äôt want Alice and Norma to move to LA. Lilia knew Norma would be tougher on Lorna than Lilia and Agatha were. Norma would light into Agatha, too. It‚Äôs what both of them needed, really.

‚ÄúYou know I just want what‚Äôs best, and I worry. I want you to live to see Alice get married, have kids if she wants, and excel in whatever career she chooses,‚Äù Lilia gestured with her hands.

Lorna smiled. She spoke with her mom every day about Alice. ‚ÄúShe plays school with her dolls every day. She‚Äôs going to teach, like you.‚Äù She pointed at Lilia with her fork.

‚ÄúHopefully, the teaching system gets better. There‚Äôs always a place at SHIELD for her.‚Äù

Lorna shook her head, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to run that place, could you imagine? Her teaching for you?‚Äù

Lilia laughed, ‚ÄúYeah, and Agatha will have kids there. That‚Äôll never happen.‚Äù

Lorna finished eating and returned to being serious. ‚ÄúAre you going to keep this thing up with Agatha?‚Äù

Lilia shrugged, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know. I care for her, and we have fun. What‚Äôs a little harmless fun between friends?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not harmless,‚Äù Lorna said darkly.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre both adults, Lorna.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know you‚Äôve been cryptic with her on occasion. When she acts flirty with you. She tells me everything. You have to remain that person. You can‚Äôt let her fall in love with you Lils. ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you? Because you‚Äôre playing with fire.‚Äù

Lilia knew she was playing with fire, but she could also be cold,¬† cryptic, and distant.

What she didn‚Äôt know was how much damage her decisions would actually cause.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

August 1996, Lilia‚Äôs Side of the ‚Äòstay the night‚Äô Flashback

Lilia was trying so hard to be cold to Agatha, and it hurt like hell. She knew why she had to do it. She couldn‚Äôt let Agatha fall in love with her. Lorna would murder Lilia. She could not lose Lorna or Agatha. They were the two most important people in her life. Sleeping with Agatha was not the best decision she had ever made, but that was Lilia‚Äôs infatuation.

Lorna had drugs.

Agatha had alcohol.

Lilia had Agatha.

Agatha had asked Lilia to stay the night, but Lilia‚Äôs heart dropped. She so badly wanted to say yes. She wanted to wake up with her the next morning, but that really wasn‚Äôt her thing, and she couldn‚Äôt give the paparazzi anything. Instead, she played the role of the older woman here for casual sex. Lilia played two roles. Lilia, her loving friend and mentor, and Lilia, Agatha‚Äôs casual fling..

It was exhausting.

It might destroy her.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Christmas 1997 San Francisco

Agatha and Wanda had gotten close. Agatha was a Lorna to Wanda. They were on a hit show together, and they had built a house on the land Agatha had bought at eighteen. A gorgeous Russian spy had attempted to kill them, now, said spy lived with them, and her mother was dead.

What a time to be alive.

She was also sleeping with Lilia Calderu, so that was a plus.

What wasn‚Äôt a plus was that Agatha was currently in San Francisco.

She loved Norma Wu not only because she was Lorna‚Äôs mother but also because she had raised Lorna to be an amazing woman.

However, she could have done without Norma‚Äôs lectures, especially when Lilia would take her side every single time.

The five women walked into the large home on Christmas Eve to be welcomed by the small, rambunctious eight-year-old, followed by a joyful but judgy older woman.

‚ÄúWelcome, girls! Come in, get settled in your rooms! You must be Wanda and Natasha!‚Äù Norma addressed the two younger women.

‚ÄúAlice, show these two to the guest room. I hope you two don‚Äôt mind sharing a bed.‚Äù

She added, raising an eyebrow at Agatha. Norma just assumed everyone was gay at this point. Agatha shrugged. She had an inkling, but no clear confirmation yet.

‚ÄúCome with me! Where‚Äôs your accent from? Gran says our house is like the United Nations!‚Äù She chattered as she skipped down the hallway.

Gran turned towards the other three, a finger in their faces. ‚ÄúNo sex, no drugs, no alcohol. Do you three understand me?‚Äù

Agatha scoffed. ‚ÄúAlways such fun, Norma.‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha Evanora Harkness,‚Äù Norma began, causing Agatha to wince. She hated her middle name and wanted to legally change it to Fucking. Norma was five foot even and was truly the only person on the planet that terrified her. Especially when she used Agatha‚Äôs middle name.

‚ÄúYes, ma‚Äôam,‚Äù She agreed.

‚ÄúGood, Lorna and Agatha, take everyone‚Äôs things to their rooms, presents under the tree. Agatha is staying with you, Lorna, in the other guest room. Lilia, I need to see you in the kitchen.‚Äù

Norma turned and walked toward the kitchen while the three women exchanged glances. Whatever was about to happen to Lilia wasn‚Äôt good. There were sharp objects in there.

Lilia and Norma reached the kitchen, and Norma pointed to the table, instructing her to sit.

‚ÄúAny progress with either of them?‚Äù Norma asked, taking a seat.

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Lilia looked defeated. ‚ÄúThey haven‚Äôt gotten worse since they‚Äôre busy filming, so that‚Äôs something? It helps that Agatha has the girls now, and she‚Äôs been roping Lorna in with that.‚Äù Lilia reported.

‚ÄúAnd your‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúOn and off,‚Äù Lilia supplied, knowing what Norma meant.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been over a year. Don‚Äôt you think it‚Äôs time to end it?‚Äù Norma asked.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been done this road enough, Norma. I brought them here for Christmas like you wanted. Now, you can try your intervention on them, not me. There are two people involved in my situation, not just me.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre older, Lilia,‚Äù Norma reminded.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs a consenting adult, Norma.‚Äù

Agatha thought Christmas had gone well, though that was the first Christmas Lilia had been weird about their gift exchange, and their dynamic started to change.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

1998 Los Angeles Lilia‚Äôs Side of the Soulmate Conversation

Agatha had just asked her if she believed in soulmates. Lilia was a student of tarot. Of course, she believed in soulmates.

She sure as hell wasn‚Äôt telling Agatha that.

She remained cold, distant, and casual‚Äîan older fling.

She believed Agatha had a soulmate somewhere.

Lilia Calderu had to believe she was not that person, though, and it killed her.

Right now, she was not letting her emotions color their moment, lying here.

Right now, she focused on Lorna‚Äôs warning and her duty to Agatha, to keep her at an emotional arm‚Äôs length.

Instead of romance and sweetness, Lilia reverted to her now well-practiced advice on the challenge of maintaining a long-term, steady relationship with the amount of fame Agatha held. She deliberately lectured and called Agatha ‚Äòmy pet‚Äô to reduce the intimacy she felt as they recovered from another beautiful time together.

Her tactics worked. Lilia could feel the discomfort and slight hurt from Agatha as the wedge she hammered in place deepened the gap between them. The longer Lilia had to play cold and distant, the harder it became to separate the two identities.

It‚Äôs why, though she tried to stay away, stay strong, and stay cold, the infatuation won out, and they always fell back into bed.

Lilia could barely resist Agatha, and she knew that could be as damaging as any addiction.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

1999 Los Angeles, Harkimoff HQ

Agatha, at an old and wise twenty-six years old, knew that something was going on with the two redheads. It once more brought up the mystery of that night two years ago. There had been no reason for Natasha not to murder Agatha that night, but Natasha hadn‚Äôt expected Wanda‚Äôs presence‚Äî or at least, that‚Äôs what the former assassin kept saying. Agatha knew she was lying. No, Natasha hadn‚Äôt just been distracted by Wanda; she had been mesmerized. Cupid‚Äôs arrow struck the assassin as she confronted her target, abandoning her assignment, and spent the next two years watching Wanda figure out her feelings.

Now, here sat a Wanda, who seemed younger than her twenty years, asking Agatha how to tell if she liked girls. Agatha knew she should be helpful and supportive. Instead, she cackled. Agatha had always known she was gay. She took one look at boys as a kid, said no thanks, and started going after girls and women.

Now, sweet, innocent, girl-next-door Wanda Maximoff, who had been raised by Agatha for the past four years, was asking for help deciphering her confusing feelings for Nat.

‚ÄúJust go fuck her, Wanda. That will be pretty telling,‚Äù Agatha said after she finished laughing.

‚ÄúYou are of no help,‚Äù Wanda said, getting up to storm off.

‚ÄúAngel, no, seriously. Do you have any desire to do anything with any of these PR guys you‚Äôve been set up with?‚Äù Agatha asked.

Wanda sighed, hands gathered on one hip. ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat about Nat?‚Äù

Wanda looked at the ceiling and blew out a breath.

‚ÄúI want to do unspeakable things and grow old with her,‚Äù she finally admitted.

‚ÄúWelcome to club lesbian. Your membership card will be in the mail. Go get your girl,‚Äù Agatha grinned.

Agatha watched as Wanda climbed the stairs, knowing she was headed to Nat‚Äôs room.

If only her own situation were that easy. She was happy to see that these two dear friends would share a sweet moment and maybe more. But their happiness and Wanda‚Äôs excitement stirred a hidden pain in her. She and Lilia had been going back and forth for three years now, and things were only getting more confusing.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

2000 New York City

Lilia‚Äôs Side of the ‚ÄòDo You Love Me‚Äô Night

They had had a nice night, and Lilia, still vibrant and alluring at forty-one years old, had so wished she could be ‚Äòfriend‚Äô Lilia to Agatha right then, but those lines were blurring more frequently. She was in too deep, and she knew she should have listened to Lorna four years ago when this had started. Lilia scolded herself. She should have put a stop to this a long time ago. She still should stop it now.

To no one‚Äôs surprise, Agatha had grown more beautiful and was intoxicating at twenty-seven. Lilia couldn‚Äôt get enough of her. There was no gum or patch for this. No twelve-step program. No rehab.

Agatha and Lorna had tried rehab and failed for their vices. Lilia didn‚Äôt even have that option. Here she was, trying to get Agatha just to drink wine and not the myriad of alcohols and liquors she had in the fridge. The kid referred to Smirnoff as ‚Äòalcoholic kool-aid‚Äô.

Agatha had her legs tucked under her. She was effortlessly beautiful and always had been.

‚ÄúLilia, do you love me?‚Äù

Lilia had stilled, turning towards Agatha, trying to decide how to answer. They had used that term platonically for years. But no one had ever said so romantically.

‚ÄúOf course I do,‚Äù Lilia replied, as she had done so many times before, silently praying Agatha would drop it. Knowing she wouldn‚Äôt. Her eyebrows knitted together, preparing what to say next.

‚ÄúNo, I mean, are you in love with me?‚Äù Agatha took a deep breath. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just that I am so deeply in love with you. You won‚Äôt let me tell anyone we‚Äôre seeing each other, while I want to scream it from the rooftops. I want to spend the rest of my life with you, and you laugh it off, insisting we see other people.‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs eyes were watery. Lilia hated being the one who made her cry.

Every single time, they found their way back into each other‚Äôs beds.

Every single time, Lorna got pissed at Lilia.

‚ÄúLorna knows,‚Äù Lilia replied, hoping it was some small consolation. She so badly wanted to hold Agatha, console her, and kiss away her sadness. But she didn‚Äôt reach out, steeling herself against the emotion and guilt that bubbled within.

‚ÄúOf course she does! I can‚Äôt help that she figured it out! Stop ignoring the question!‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, I love you, Agatha, but those things are impossible. I don‚Äôt want any of that, and you know it. I will not explain it to you again. Now, don‚Äôt go ruining a good night before it‚Äôs even begun.‚Äù

Knowing that while she could give in and be happy for a little while, her true nature would eventually emerge and ruin both their relationship and the beautiful woman with whom she was in love.

‚ÄúLeave,‚Äù Agatha said abruptly.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù Lilia was shocked. Agatha had never kicked her out before.

‚ÄúYou heard me, leave.‚Äù She said, standing up and walking to her bedroom.

Lilia watched Agatha walk down the hall as she got up to leave herself. She and Lorna had a New York apartment they shared, and she would call Lorna once she got back. That would give Agatha time to call her first.

But Agatha was water, and Lilia, the lover, was parched in the middle of a desert.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

2003 Los Angeles, Harkimoff HQ

‚ÄúI know the shady shit you do behind the scenes, did you have a hand in this? I told you about Wanda‚Äôs plans, and I swear to Lorna if you messed with my sister, not only are we over, but I will murder you right here,‚Äù she said menacingly, eyes devoid of any caring feeling.

Agatha looked at Lorna. ‚ÄúDo you know anything?‚Äù

Lorna shook her head as she lit her pipe, ‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôve been keeping an ear out, though. Howard is passing things off to Tony. If Howard knew, he may have hired someone to get proof that Wanda isn‚Äôt squeaky clean to push her back into hiding.‚Äù

‚ÄúI will fucking murder Tony,‚Äù Agatha turned on her heel to head out the door. Lilia stood and grabbed her hand.

‚ÄúAgatha, no. It‚Äôs not Tony‚Äôs fault, and we don‚Äôt even know, okay? It may have just been random paparazzi. You‚Äôre not throwing your life away. We wanted to kill Evanora and never did. Now sit down.‚Äù

‚ÄúI just want to protect her!‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs what I‚Äôve been trying to do for you for years. Sadly, I can‚Äôt protect you from everything or everyone.‚Äù

Neither of them were smoking to get high, merely to calm their nerves and maintain a calm demeanor. She offered the pipe to Lilia, who looked at Lorna like she had grown a second head. Lorna shrugged and passed the pipe and lighter back to Agatha.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt protect them from everything, and it‚Äôs one of the many reasons Alice stays with Mom. Speaking of, Mom sent pictures! She basically has Alice‚Äôs friend living with them. Cute kid. Here.‚Äù Lorna pulled out a stack of pictures, handing them to Lilia. Agatha put the pipe and lighter on the glass coffee table and moved to sit by Lilia to look at the pictures. She laughed as she saw the pictures of Alice and the other fourteen-year-old sitting on inflatable furniture, sticking their tongues out.

‚ÄúNorma‚Äôs house is the United Nations,‚Äù Agatha noted as they flipped through the pictures. It was the distraction they needed. Lorna nodded.

‚ÄúPuerto Rican kid. Rio. They met two years ago. Similar story as you, shitty parents. She spends most of her time at Mom's unless her parents need her for some scam. Mom said she was skin and bone when Alice dragged her home one day after hearing gunshots at her apartment. They move around a lot. Mom hopes she sticks around or her parents disappear and leave the kid. It makes me feel less guilty for only having one kid.‚Äù Lorna got up to rummage in the pantry.

‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt need more kids,‚Äù Lilia called after her.

‚ÄúDamn right,‚Äù Lorna called back.

‚ÄúI want kids.‚Äù Agatha looked at Lilia.

Lilia shook her head. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt. Besides, that requires you to get sober.‚Äù

Agatha‚Äôs face fell. ‚ÄúI could get sober if I was motivated enough.‚Äù She took out a flask and took a long drink.

Lorna came back from the kitchen with a bag of 3-D Doritos.

‚ÄúWhy does the Wanda thing bother you so much anyway?‚Äù She asked Agatha. Lorna knew why, but she needed Lilia to hear it. Agatha glanced at Lilia before moving back to the armchair.

‚ÄúI want Wanda to be happy. To be with the woman she loves, openly. Have babies. Build a home. All the things I‚Äôll most likely never get to do.‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs voice had shrunk as she said it.

Lilia had looked away.

Lorna popped a Dorito in her mouth and turned to Lilia. ‚ÄúMaybe we should listen to our friends, hmm?‚Äù she whispered.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

April 2006 Los Angeles

Lilia‚Äôs Side of the ‚ÄòBaby‚Äô Convo

Lilia hated it when Agatha brought up having a baby. It meant she had to don her ice queen persona again. This back-and-forth had been going on for ten years. It happened so frequently that Lilia could barely keep track of which version of herself she was anymore.

‚ÄúAgatha, I‚Äôm too old to have or raise a child, and with your schedule? I would be a primary parent. People would know we were together then.‚Äù Agatha was almost thirty-three, and Lilia herself was nearly forty-seven. She was scheduled to have a hysterectomy soo,n and while she regretted never having kids, she was trying to push it out of her mind. She still didn‚Äôt want to risk her career. There was talk of the principal retiring, and she was on the shortlist for it.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right about me. I can‚Äôt be a good parent with this life.‚Äù Agatha conceded.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt risk being your mother.‚Äù

Lilia wanted to take the words back as soon as she said them and saw the hurt on Agatha‚Äôs face. She had gotten so good at being cold when she was this person that it came naturally, and she hated it.

Lilia wondered if she had lost who she once was and their relationship had changed so much. Even when they were being friends, it didn‚Äôt come as easily. Agatha‚Äôs alcohol use had gotten so bad that Lilia‚Äôs main concern was the withdrawals in Agatha‚Äôs preparations to have a child. Could her body even handle it? She‚Äôd been drinking for so long that she wasn‚Äôt sure how she would handle it. Lilia knew that Agatha would be an amazing mother.

Just not with Lilia.

Lilia hadn‚Äôt known that Agatha had taken that as Lilia‚Äôs final decision. She had gotten good at continuing to act like she was drinking. But, she had stopped last Halloween and had been preparing to start treatments and trying for a baby.

Agatha didn‚Äôt need Lilia in order to have or raise a baby.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

She hadn‚Äôt told Lilia yet and had no idea how she would react.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs trying to get sober, Agatha,‚Äù She said in place of a greeting.

‚ÄúI know, and that‚Äôs part of why I‚Äôm here. I need her to come back and finish filming. I‚Äôll keep an eye on her. I‚Äôll also get her into rehab as soon as we‚Äôre done. I‚Äôm sober, Norma. If I can do it, so can she.‚Äù Agatha explained.

Norma squinted at her. ‚ÄúAre you serious?‚Äù Norma didn‚Äôt trust her.

‚ÄúA hundred percent.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm proud of you. She‚Äôs in her room. I hope you can do it.‚Äù

Norma stepped aside to let her in. Agatha walked down the familiar hallway lined with pictures of Alice and the other teenage girl. It was late, and she didn‚Äôt even knock. Norma was awake, and she looked up from her reading. Agatha set down her overnight bag on the floor before she made Norma scoot over.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôs the detox going?‚Äù She asked.

‚ÄúTerribly.‚Äù Lorna laid her book down and put her head on Agatha‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt see how you did it.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey say alcohol is easier. But, I think I had a great motivator.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have a whole kid and still‚Ä¶‚Äù Lorna sighed. ‚ÄúHow is operation reproduction going?‚Äù

‚ÄúIt worked,‚Äù Agatha smiled.

‚ÄúWhat? I‚Äôm going to be a grandma?‚Äù Lorna said excitedly.

‚ÄúYeah, so get clean so you can be around for this one and Alice,‚Äù Agatha said with tears in her eyes.

Lorna hugged her tightly before loosening her grip and laughing.

‚ÄúI guess I won‚Äôt squeeze baby Harkness too hard.‚Äù She looked back at Agatha, concerned. ‚ÄúHave you told her?‚Äù

‚ÄúShe made it very clear she didn‚Äôt want a baby, Lorna.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou should still tell her, you never know what she‚Äôll decide. She might surprise you.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt need her criticism,‚Äù Agatha chewed on the side of her thumb.

‚ÄúI know, but at least give her the chance,‚Äù Lorna implored.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll think about it. I‚Äôm going to get ready for bed. Do you want me to stay with you tonight?‚Äù Agatha knew Lorna would have nightmares at this point in the process.

Lorna looked at her lap and nodded. She was forty-six, but at that moment looked like a vulnerable little girl.

Agatha would do anything she needed.

She grabbed her pajamas and toiletry bag as she left the room and collided with a teenager who was not Alice.

‚ÄúWho the fuck‚Ä¶‚Äù The dark-haired girl started and then noticed who she ran into and her eyes went wide. ‚ÄúHoly fuck, you‚Äôre‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha Harkness, hi. You must be Rio. Nice to meet you,‚Äù she shifted everything to one hand and held out the other. Rio shook her hand, still shell-shocked.

‚ÄúHow?‚Äù Rio started again.

‚ÄúNorma talks to Lorna, and Lorna‚Äôs my best friend. I‚Äôve got to get ready for bed though. It was nice to meet you. See you in the morning.‚Äù Agatha turned on her heel and walked to the bathroom. She had to pee and could not hold it, she also felt the need to puke.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Later September 2006 Los Angeles

Agatha was nervous. Wanda and Nat were overseas and they didn‚Äôt even know she was pregnant. hey certainly didn‚Äôt know she had been in a quasi-relationship with someone for ten years. Lilia was coming over and she was going to tell her about the pregnancy.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not drinking?‚Äù Lilia asked, surprise written all over her face.

‚ÄúLilia, I haven‚Äôt had a drop of alcohol since last Halloween. I‚Äôve been faking it.‚Äù Agatha replied casually.

Lilia was suspicious and confused. ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want anyone to know I was doing fertility treatments.‚Äù

They were sitting in the living room at Agatha‚Äôs, she was eating blueberries and drinking water, gauging Lilia‚Äôs reactions closely.

Lilia had just taken a sip of tea and nearly choked.

‚ÄúWHAT?‚Äù She yelled. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt that a discussion?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo. I‚Äôm my own person, we aren‚Äôt anything,¬† which you‚Äôve made very clear, and I don‚Äôt need you to have or raise a child, Lilia.‚Äù Agatha popped another blueberry in her mouth.

Lilia looked at Agatha cautiously, ‚ÄúSo are you‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúPregnant? Yes. Due in May,‚Äù Agatha answered before Lilia finished the question. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt expect you to continue this with me, to marry me, to do anything. I know this isn‚Äôt what you wanted and I respect that. If that side of this stops, then I do want our friendship back, Lilia,‚Äù Agatha laid it out. She wanted Lilia to remain in her life. They didn‚Äôt have to keep up whatever they had, but she needed Lilia in her life, in this child‚Äôs life.

Lilia stood abruptly. She looked like a fish gasping for air.

‚ÄúI have to go, I can‚Äôt, Agatha, I‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù And she was gone.

Agatha thought she could handle motherhood solo, and she could handle Lilia saying no. But she couldn‚Äôt handle her walking out of her life, and the sobs spilled out of her.



Lilia went to Lorna‚Äôs. She was back in LA and was trying her best to be sober, weed they could handle. Lilia sat on the couch, face splotchy from crying.

‚ÄúGod, Lorna. What have I done?‚Äù Lilia asked looking at her best friend.

‚ÄúBeen the world‚Äôs worst surrogate gay aunt for ten years,‚Äù Lorna said, munching on a bag of Chips Ahoy.

‚ÄúPlease stop referring to me as that, it makes it sound so creepy,‚Äù Lilia already felt terrible enough.

‚ÄúWhat do you want me to say, Lilia? You acted like a bipolar bitch for a decade. I know I‚Äôm not a saint, none of us are, but you‚Äôve ruined the kid when it comes to relationships, do you not see that? She is in love with you and tries so hard to hide it. You love her too, in your own infatuation way,, but you‚Äôre not the settling-down type and that‚Äôs okay. She doesn‚Äôt hold it against you as long as she gets to be with you. This whole thing never should have started. AS I SAID. She‚Äôs not even asking for you to marry her or help her raise the kid, she just wants you to stay in her life and be her friend again Lilia, yet you‚Äôre in too far and you can‚Äôt separate the two Lilias anymore.‚Äù Lorna looked at her, face hard. ‚ÄúI told you this would happen, and Lilia, all you had to do was listen, but just like always, you think you know best.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo sorry that I didn‚Äôt take advice from you!‚Äù Lilia spat.

Lorna sat straight up in shock. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs that supposed to mean?‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know what it means,‚Äù Lilia‚Äôs eyes had grown cold as she walked out of the condo.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

October 2006, Los Angeles

Lilia left SHIELD in September, she hadn‚Äôt told anyone, and it was part of the reason she had been such an ass lately. That and her hysterectomy. The loss of children she never had and never would grated on her soul, but she wasn‚Äôt saying that out loud to anyone. She regretted what she had said to Lorna, and she didn‚Äôt mean it. Not really. She loved Lorna and she would never hold her addiction against her, just like she didn‚Äôt hold Agatha‚Äôs against her. Lilia was so proud of Agatha for being in recovery, no matter what it had taken.

The pregnancy news shocked her, but Agatha would be a fantastic mother if she could balance it with her career.

Lilia had a tarot reading done weeks earlier. New beginnings, it said. New life.

Maybe she was supposed to take a chance with Agatha.

That‚Äôs how she found herself at Agatha‚Äôs now, ready to take that leap if Agatha would have her.

Agatha was shocked to see her at the door.

‚ÄúLilia? What are you doing here?‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs voice was full of skepticism.

‚ÄúMay I come in?‚Äù Lilia was nervous and lacking the confidence she always had.

Agatha stepped aside as Lilia walked past her. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been thinking, Agatha, I do love you, and I have, for years. I‚Äôm sorry for before, but I am here now.‚Äù

Lilia‚Äôs voice was sincere and shaking with the weight of the words. She looked at Agatha, Lilia‚Äôs eyes were full of years of regret and poor judgment.

Agatha was cautious.

‚ÄúWhy now? I don‚Äôt want you to feel obligated, that‚Äôs not what I was trying to do.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know it‚Äôs not. I just think it‚Äôs time I stopped being two different people and chose you. Let‚Äôs get married. I want to raise a family with you.‚Äù

Lilia kissed her in a way that actually conveyed love and not ownership. Agatha let her carefully built guard down.

A mistake if there ever was one.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre absolutely positive?‚Äù Excitement rang in Agatha‚Äôs voice.

‚ÄúYes baby, yes.‚Äù Lilia smiled sincerely. She could do this, she absolutely could.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

November 2006

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry Ms. Harkness, there‚Äôs no heartbeat, you have‚Ä¶‚Äù

A high-pitched tone replaced the doctor‚Äôs voice as she droned on and Agatha felt her chest tighten. She hadn‚Äôt even told Lilia she was going to the doctor, afraid of what was happening. Lorna was with her instead. Lorna wrapped her arms around Agatha‚Äôs shoulders.

Agatha couldn‚Äôt even cry. She just felt hollow. Her precious baby. Her child.

‚ÄúNow, after the fetus passes and there‚Äôs an exam, it may take a few months‚Ä¶

Agatha knew Lorna was listening for her, thankfully. Something about how long it would be before cycles returned and she could try again. Fertility and success percentages.

It wasn‚Äôt something she was concerned about right now. Right now she was concerned about her body failing her. It had one basic job and it had failed. Or had she failed it?

‚ÄúThis is rather common, 1 in 4‚Ä¶‚Äù

Her doctor was trying to comfort her with statistics and Agatha just wanted to scream.

Would Lilia still marry her? Why was Agatha even having those thoughts? Surely she would. Lilia loved her, right?

The doctor finally handed a card to Lorna before putting her hand on Agatha‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúIf the fetus doesn‚Äôt pass in about a week, give us a call, I am so sorry Ms. Harkness,‚Äù with that, she left the room.

Agatha looked at Lorna, she knew she had been crying silently, as Lorna handed her tissues.

‚ÄúOh sweetie, I am so sorry. I love you so much. What do you need?‚Äù Lorna took it upon herself to wipe Agatha‚Äôs face.

‚ÄúJust take me home?‚Äù She asked meekly. She didn‚Äôt want to be here in this gown anymore, she just wanted to be home, in her bed.

‚ÄúOf course, Aggie, whatever you want.‚Äù

When Agatha told Lilia, she didn‚Äôt react, just nodded. They were to be married in three days on the beach. She craved Lilia‚Äôs love and warmth. Agatha had lost a baby but all Lilia could do was nod.

It took three hours before Lilia finally wrapped her arms around Agatha and cried.

Wedding Day

Lilia wasn‚Äôt going to show up. It was apparent now. Lorna‚Äôs phone rang and she answered it. It was Lilia. She said, ‚ÄúTell her I‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù before the line went dead.

Lorna turned to Agatha, sorrow in her eyes.

Agatha fell to her knees, sobbing.

She lost her entire future in three days.

Lorna walked her up to the beach house and helped her get changed. That day, Agatha drank and cried herself to sleep. It was the first drink that crossed her lips in over a year. Lorna would stay and make certain Agatha remained safe. Her maternal instincts, repressed for so long, were on heightened alert. When she went off to get Agatha some water to help flush her system, she returned to a scene that broke her heart for her pseudo daughter for the second time that day. Agatha was finally asleep, her tri-goddess locket in her hand. On the floor lay a small lock of hair. Lorna didn‚Äôt have to look closely to understand what had happened. Agatha had removed Lilia from her life.

Once Lorna was certain Agatha was safely asleep, she drove over to Lilia‚Äôs and stormed through the door.

She slapped Lilia the minute she saw her.

‚ÄúHOW COULD YOU!?‚Äù She screamed. Lorna saw red.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt be tied down, I just, I can‚Äôt Lorna.‚Äù Lilia rubbed her cheek. It stung, but she deserved it.

‚ÄúYou have to talk to her, she deserves that much. She thinks you left her because she miscarried.‚Äù Lorna was so mad she could spit nails.

‚ÄúI think the baby clouded my judgment‚Ä¶‚Äù She told Lorna about the reading.

‚ÄúYOU AGREED TO GET MARRIED BASED ON TAROT?!‚Äù Murder was the only thing on Lorna‚Äôs mind.

‚ÄúI knew you wouldn‚Äôt understand. I think I misunderstood the new beginnings card. I was offered the principal position at SHIELD, and I think that‚Äôs where I need to be. I also can‚Äôt do that while with Agatha. Neither of us would truly be happy. She needs someone closer to her age, or younger. I would eventually be unfaithful, we both know that. She needs someone who can compliment her lifestyle and career, someone who hasn‚Äôt fucked with her for ten years. Someone who doesn‚Äôt tell half-truths, who loves her fiercely. None of that is me, Lorna.‚Äù Lilia tried to defend herself and knew she was failing.

‚ÄúYou basically fucked with my daughter, Lilia,‚Äù Lorna spat.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt get you, Lorna! You treat her like this daughter you never had and let her come between us. But you HAVE a daughter that you NEVER see. Agatha is only thirteen years younger than you, and you‚Äôre closer to her than your own flesh and blood. Why is that? Why do you choose her over Alice? Over everyone?‚Äù Lilia was furious.

‚ÄúBecause we saw what growing up in this world did to Agatha. You know what having famous parents has done to those brats you teach. How entitled and spoiled they are. Alice is none of those things. Alice is grounded. Alice saw a kid in trouble and acted like we did, Lilia. Your brats wouldn‚Äôt do that. Agatha was an alcoholic before she was ten, just like other kids in this town. Do you think I want Alice around me? No. She doesn‚Äôt need to see me like this! Alice has a better chance in life because of my choices.

‚ÄúIf I can shape Agatha at all, I‚Äôm going to fucking do it, and God knows I‚Äôm trying. You were trying too until you decided to fuck her and ended up breaking her, and she is broken, Lilia. She is one of the strongest women I know and I don‚Äôt know if I can pick up the pieces this time after what you‚Äôve done.‚Äù

Lorna had never spoken to Lilia this way. They had never spoken to each other this harshly and they had never fought like this. Not over Lorna‚Äôs demons, not over other disagreements, nothing.

Only over Agatha.

Lilia‚Äôs voice shrunk. She knew she was in the wrong. She had become a monster and she had destroyed thiswoman with so much life ahead of her.

‚ÄúI never meant for any of this to happen. I had to separate myself into two different people. I want to console her and tell her everything is okay, yet I‚Äôm the one that did this. I lost one of the people closest to me.‚Äù Lilia sobbed.

‚ÄúTwo people,‚Äù Lorna‚Äôs voice was cold and hard. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt do this with you anymore, Lilia.‚Äù With that, she left.

It was one of the last times Lilia saw Lorna alive.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

June 12, 2008 Cedars-Sinai Hospital Los Angeles

Despite the labor pains, Agatha‚Äôs excitement still showed through for those initial centimeters. The baby boy Harkness would be here soon.

But, now. Right now she was very much not amused at this process. Oh, god, it hurt.

Lorna was on one side of her, Wanda and Nat on the other.

‚ÄúI hate all of you!‚Äù She screamed as they gave her instructions on how to breathe.

‚ÄúSweetie, you did this to yourself,‚Äù Lorna reminded her.

‚ÄúWell, right now, I blame you three.‚Äù She said through gritted teeth. Her doctor chuckled.

‚ÄúI take it you're ready for the epidural, Ms. Harkness? Last chance.‚Äù Dr. Munsie offered.

‚ÄúNope. I got it doc.‚Äù Agatha was about to break Wanda‚Äôs hand, but she was going to prove the ghost of her mother wrong. She was not weak.

‚ÄúHaving an epidural doesn‚Äôt make you weak, sweetie. It helps you relax and means Wanda leaves here with her hand intact, which Nat will appreciate‚Ä¶one day.‚Äù Lorna affirmed and winked at Wanda and Nat.

Agatha chose the epidural, which also did wonders for her anxiety.

Nicholas Scratch Harkness was born at 10:14 PM PST. He came into the world crying and perfect.

Agatha chose Scratch because that‚Äôs how he was made‚Äîfrom scratch, with love. Also, Nicholas Scratch was a nickname for the devil, and the kid was of her. She wasn‚Äôt exactly a saint.

Lorna was the one who sent Lilia the text. It had been very to the point.

Cedars-Sinai.

RM 220

She had the baby.

Get your ass up here.

Lilia visited twelve hours after Nicky was born. Wanda and Nat were delighted to see her. hey had missed her coming around. She blamed work. They were trying to put more effort into the athletics department and it was taking a lot of time to find quality coaches, and she was starting to scout college players.

Lorna suggested to the two youngest women that they go in search of food, letting Lilia and Agatha have time alone with Nicky.

‚ÄúWhy are you here, Lilia? I accepted your apology. You are off the hook.‚Äù Agatha said dryly, holding a sleeping Nicky. He had been fed, burped, and changed, and was now sleeping peacefully. Lorna had been the first one to call him Nicky minutes after he was named.

Lilia had told Agatha the same thing she had told Lorna, when Agatha finally agreed to talk to her again. Lilia was honest, even including that the pregnancy had clouded her judgment and that she still loved her, but not in the way that justified marriage.

It crushed Agatha for the hundredth time, breaking what was left of her heart.

Agatha swore off relationships for the rest of her life. She would never allow herself to be hurt like that again, and now she had to think of Nicky.

She looked at Lilia, wanting to stab her with a scalpel.

‚ÄúLorna texted me. Told me to get my ass up here. I wanted to come, Agatha. I still care about you. You‚Äôre still you and I‚Äôm still me,‚Äù Lilia tried.

Agatha shook her head.

‚ÄúYou killed that relationship long ago, Lilia,‚Äù She was trying not to cry and she didn‚Äôt want to wake Nicky. ‚ÄúYou should go.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs perfect, just like you.‚Äù Lilia turned and left, stopping at the door. ‚ÄúCute name by the way. You always were a little devil,‚Äù she left, running into the other three on her way out.

Lorna grabbed Lilia‚Äôs arm. ‚ÄúWait.‚Äù

She looked at the other two women. ‚ÄúYou two take the food up to Agatha, I‚Äôll be right there.‚Äù She watched them go and turned back to Lilia.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sober. I thought you should know.‚Äù Lorna let go and walked away.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

January 2009 San Francisco

Agatha had left Nicky with Wanda, Vision, and Nat. She was back in San Francisco to bring Lorna back for filming. The story was that she had gone to Norma‚Äôs to get clean.

It was a lie.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôs she doing?‚Äù Agatha asked Norma, sitting in the kitchen before going to Lorna‚Äôs room to talk with her.

‚ÄúThe girls are visiting, so I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs helping or hurting, but she‚Äôs not doing great, as expected,‚Äù Norma looked stressed and Agatha didn‚Äôt blame her. She was worried as well.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll go talk to her then.‚Äù

She stood and went to Lorna like she had so many times before. She didn‚Äôt bother knocking. She just walked in like she owned the place and sat at the foot of the bed.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to beat this.‚Äù Agatha wasn‚Äôt sure they would, but it was her turn to be strong for Lorna.

It didn‚Äôt matter what Lorna had been diagnosed with. What mattered was that for all of her years battling addiction, it was something unrelated that had her health declining.

Lorna‚Äôs eyes were puffy, ‚ÄúAggie, I‚Äôm about to be forty-nine and I‚Äôm dying.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not dying,‚Äù Agatha said firmly. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre fighting this.‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha, you heard what they said.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo did you, and there‚Äôs a lot that can be done. We‚Äôre fighting this thing together. Alice and I can‚Äôt lose you,‚Äù Agatha was not going to cry.

Lorna looked at Agatha sadly, ‚ÄúI think this movie will be my last.‚Äù

‚ÄúOnly because you‚Äôre going to retire,‚Äù Agatha was trying to remain hopeful.

Agatha emerged from Lorna‚Äôs room, eyes puffy and red. She was headed to the kitchen when once again, she ran into Rio. She had slightly matured but still looked like the teenage girl that she was.

‚ÄúWe must stop meeting like this,‚Äù Agatha said, her throat was raw and her voice was hoarse.

‚ÄúHi Ms. Harkness,‚Äù Was all Rio could manage as she blushed.

Agatha smiled. This kid lived with Alice Wu-Gulliver, yet she was starstruck around Agatha. It was cute. ‚ÄúHey, Rio.‚Äù

Rio was stunned, ‚ÄúYou remember my name?‚Äù

‚ÄúSure do.‚Äù Agatha noticed Rio get flustered. ‚ÄúHave a good night kid, I need water,‚Äù Agatha winked at the young girl and walked past her. She was exhausted but never got tired of people fawning over her. She didn‚Äôt know that the next time she saw Rio would be at Lorna‚Äôs funeral.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

October 2010 Los Angeles

Lorna stood in front of Lilia‚Äôs house. She had to do this. She was dying and she was going to soon. But do it on her terms. But first, she had to talk to Lilia. They wouldn‚Äôt be able to go back to how they were, but she at least had to talk to her. Lorna took a deep breath and knocked on the door. Lilia looked like a ghost was standing before her.

‚ÄúYou look like shit. I thought you were sober?‚Äù She said it as a question, stepping aside and helping Lorna in.

‚ÄúDifferent types of drugs, these are prescribed,‚Äù Lorna half laughed, as she took a seat. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll cut to the chase. I‚Äôm dying and I want to say I‚Äôm sorry for the way I said what I said,‚Äù Lorna chewed on her lip, not meeting Lilia‚Äôs eyes.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre WHAT?‚Äù That was all Lilia could ask. Lilia was shocked.

‚ÄúYeah, this is a wig, the press and media, no one knows.‚Äù Lorna looked away. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to die with things still shitty between us. I don‚Äôt want Aggie to think it‚Äôs her fault.‚Äù

Lilia‚Äôs face fell. Right, of course, this was for Agatha.

‚ÄúSo, this is more for Agatha, not so I don‚Äôt live with guilt for the rest of my life,‚Äù Lilia said slowly.

Lorna sighed.

‚ÄúShe will never be the same. Ever. She throws everything she has into that beautiful boy of hers, into Wanda‚Äôs babies. Wanda had twin boys, by the way. The three of them are going to be terrors,‚Äù Lorna had a wistful smile, how badly she wanted to watch the three of them grow up. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs promised to watch over Alice. To try and get Alice here, to you. To SHIELD.‚Äù Lorna looked at Lilia hopefully.

‚ÄúWhat? You want Alice at SHIELD? Lilia repeated.

‚ÄúI may still blame you for destroying Agatha, but I know Alice will be in good hands there. I need eyes on Alice, Mom won‚Äôt be around forever and I need people around her, to tell of the person I really was. She didn‚Äôt get to know me and that‚Äôs my fault. I just need people who will love her in the way I would. You also have to watch over those boys Lilia,‚Äù Lorna was staring into Lilia‚Äôs soul.

‚ÄúAgatha isn‚Äôt going to let me do that, Lorna,‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, she will. If you tell her that I wanted you too, she will.‚Äù They both knew that Lorna was right.

‚ÄúSo keep manipulating her? Didn‚Äôt we do that enough when she was younger?‚Äù

Lilia had wondered over the past years just how much damage they had both done to Agatha.

‚ÄúWe guided her Lilia. There‚Äôs a difference,‚Äù Lorna looked like she was trying to convince herself more than Lilia.

‚ÄúHow long?‚Äù Lilia whispered.

Lorna knew what she was referencing. ‚ÄúA few months. I‚Äôm hoping to live long enough to win the Oscar.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhy did you wait so long to come to apologize?‚Äù Lilia asked casually.

Lorna‚Äôs head shot up. Lilia had struck a nerve. ‚ÄúBecause I‚Äôm not the one who was in the wrong, Lilia. I‚Äôm not the one who broke Agatha. I‚Äôm not the one who caused the damage. I came to clear my conscience, yes, but you should have come to me long ago,‚Äù Lorna sighed as she got up. ‚ÄúI can die in peace now. This is yours to live with now. Goodbye, Lilia.‚Äù

Lorna walked out the door.

It was the last time Lilia saw Lorna alive.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

February 27, 2011, Los Angeles

Oscars Night

After winning an Oscar, Lorna had insisted on going to an after-party. Agatha had wanted to take Lorna home. She wasn‚Äôt doing well at all and Agatha knew the end was near, something in her gut told her it was. Lorna hadn‚Äôt told anyone about her diagnosis. Only Agatha, Lilia, and Norma knew. She allowed everyone to think she had relapsed. The way she looked certainly supported that narrative.

She didn‚Äôt want anyone‚Äôs sympathy, didn‚Äôt want anyone to think of her as a sob story that had beaten her addiction only to be taken by some cruel twist of fate. So she controlled the narrative. The Witches‚Äô Road was a dark movie. She said it had consumed her, taken a toll on her psychologically that she couldn‚Äôt deal with alone.

Agatha hated it.

Lilia was nowhere to be found.

Wanda, and everyone else, believed it.

When Lorna collapsed at the party and 911 was called, Agatha knew it was the end.

She knew Lorna wasn‚Äôt going to make it to the hospital.

Lorna made her promise to watch after Alice.

Agatha rode in the ambulance.

Lorna was pronounced dead before they even reached the hospital.

Lorna had always said she would go out on her own terms, and she had.

It didn‚Äôt matter what she took. But she had.

Agatha wasn‚Äôt angry with her.

Agatha knew Lorna didn‚Äôt want to suffer in the final days.

They knew it was stage 4.

They knew it was incurable.

Inoperable.

Spread throughout her entire body.

Afterward, she found that Lorna had left letters. A journal. An envelope of documents.

Agatha kept the letters addressed to her and would give everything else to Alice.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

March 4th, 2011 San Francisco

The Funeral

Norma had closed the funeral to celebrities. The media said it was because she was angry and blamed Hollywood for Lorna‚Äôs death.

In reality, it was because she didn‚Äôt want it to turn into a media circus.

She knew Agatha and Wanda would be there in disguise. She had asked them to do so. Alice and Rio didn‚Äôt know that. A few other celebrities had done it that way.

Lilia had disguised herself as well.

Agatha, Wanda, and Nat hugged Norma out of sight in a back hallway. Wanda and Nat offered their condolences before slipping into the main area, leaving Agatha and Norma alone.

‚ÄúNorma, I‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs voice betrayed her as she started to cry.

‚ÄúAgatha, it‚Äôs not your fault. You can‚Äôt heal the sick,‚Äù Norma looked at Agatha the way Lorna did, causing Agatha to cry harder.

‚ÄúYou shouldn‚Äôt have to bury your child,‚Äù Agatha admonished in between her crying.

Norma was crying herself as she looked at her tenderly. ‚ÄúOnce Lorna fell into this cursed lifestyle, I knew I would outlive her. I started having some hope when she was pregnant and sober, but then I found myself raising my grandchild. When Lorna finally achieved sobriety, I thought maybe she would be a parent to Alice and outlive me. Fate is a cruel mistress. I hold nothing against you, Agatha, and neither does Alice. You‚Äôll be able to make it up to her in due time, and I trust you will. Right now, you need to grieve. I grieved my daughter long ago, and while I am grieving, I always knew that this was the most likely outcome. I used to think so about you, too. You proved me wrong. Now, go talk with Alice,‚Äù Norma hugged her. Though Norma was crying, but had much more composure than Agatha did. Norma turned to head back into the main room before pausing at the door and turning her head slightly.

‚ÄúLilia is here.‚Äù

With that, Norma pushed through the door and disappeared.

Agatha and Wanda waited until after the funeral to pull Alice aside.

‚ÄúThis is from your mother.‚Äù Agatha handed her the large manilla envelope. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot in here she wanted you to have. You also need to read this,‚Äù Agatha handed her a letter. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to have a lot of questions kid. You need to call me. I know you graduate this year and there‚Äôs a job at a school in LA if you want it‚Ä¶‚Äù

Alice cut her off, ‚ÄúWhy would I go there, Agatha? I saw what Hollywood did to my mom.‚Äù Alice‚Äôs eyes were dark, haunted. ‚ÄúIt took her away from me, Agatha. I only saw her on holidays and when she tried to get clean.‚Äù

Alice‚Äôs words stabbed at Agatha, releasing guilt that had built up for years. Hollywood hadn‚Äôt taken Lorna away from Alice, Agatha had. Agatha was sixteen when Alice was born, and Lorna had been putting everything she had into making sure Agatha was safe, that Agatha was okay. That Agatha had a mother figure.

When Lorna had found out she was pregnant, Agatha and Lilia insisted she keep the baby.

Lorna took Alice to Norma, ‚ÄúMom, I can‚Äôt possibly care for an infant in this environment. She needs a Norma, not a Lorna.‚Äù

Lilia and Agatha had tried to convince Lorna to raise Alice with their help, but Lorna refused. She was adamant that Alice grow up far away from the life they led.

Agatha knew Alice was better for it, but it didn‚Äôt mean she had any less guilt.

‚ÄúJust read the letter, please. I don‚Äôt know what it says, but it was important to your mom,‚Äù Agatha hugged her and left. Wanda and Nat followed behind.

As they left, Agatha saw Lilia out of the corner of her eye. ‚ÄúYou two go ahead, I‚Äôll be right there.‚Äù

Wanda shrugged and she and Nat went to the car as Agatha turned and walked to Lilia.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know if you‚Äôd come,‚Äù Agatha said softly. She expected to be angry, but couldn‚Äôt find the energy.

‚ÄúOf course I did,‚Äù Lilia stared straight ahead.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you came, Lorna told me‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha couldn‚Äôt finish the sentence.

Lilia looked down. ‚ÄúHow did it happen?‚Äù

‚ÄúHer own terms. In my arms. We made it to the back of the ambulance,‚Äù Agatha swallowed hard. It would forever be a core memory for her.

‚ÄúDramatic as always.‚Äù

Agatha chuckled at that, ‚ÄúLifetime Achievement Award just for that.‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha,‚Äù Lilia turned to look at her.

‚ÄúNo.‚Äù Agatha said firmly as she turned and walked out of the door.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

March 6th, 2011 Los Angeles

Agatha was on the phone with Alice, who was very confused.

‚ÄúThis whole time and you‚Äôve been my godmother?‚Äù Alice was shocked.

‚ÄúYes. I was sixteen and your mother thought it was a good idea to potentially leave you with me. I was stunned.‚Äù Agatha laughed. It was good to talk to Alice.

‚ÄúAnd she really had been sober‚Ä¶‚Äù Alice was proud of Lorna and finally understood her decision at the end.

‚ÄúYes, I was so proud of her,‚Äù Agatha echoed Alice‚Äôs earlier sentiment.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt hate you, Agatha. Mom explained why she made the decisions she did. Gran has raised me in a way that I don‚Äôt think Mom was capable of. She also talked about some of the men she was with and no thank you. She basically gave me this little alternative family.‚Äù

‚ÄúI appreciate that, though anytime you need anything, I‚Äôll be there. I‚Äôll always feel like I took your mom away from you. The men were terrible, though, and I‚Äôm glad you found your chosen family, too.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm ready to move out there yet. Gran needs me.‚Äù Alice wasn‚Äôt ready to leave Gran, and it was too soon to enter her mother‚Äôs old world.

‚ÄúWhenever you're ready, we‚Äôre all here for you.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

July 2012 SHIELD
