Nicky would be in Pre-K that year, and SHIELD was the only institution Agatha trusted, whether she wanted to or not. Lilia of all people was droning on and on as she showed her around. They were doing a pretty decent job at pretending like they didn‚Äôt know each other. Agatha couldn‚Äôt take it anymore, and they were in a deserted hallway in the elementary building.

‚ÄúLilia, cut the bullshit,‚Äù Agatha stopped walking and leaned against a wall. Her heart still ached from the loss of Lorna, and Lilia reminded her of what she had lost. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the only person I trust to oversee Nicky in a sea of children.‚Äù

Lilia's eyebrows shot up. ‚ÄúYou trust me?‚Äù

‚ÄúWith my son, Lilia. Not with me. There‚Äôs a difference.‚Äù

Agatha knew Lilia was great with kids and she knew that Lilia would protect Nicky with everything she had. She would treat Wanda‚Äôs boys with a side of favoritism as well. Agatha herself was a different story.¬† Lilia looked away.

‚ÄúGot it. You know I‚Äôll take care of him, Agatha. As if he were mine.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe could have been,‚Äù Agatha turned and started back to the office to finish enrollment.

‚ÄúAggie, wait.‚Äù

Agatha froze but didn‚Äôt turn around. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt get to call me that anymore.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù Lilia said sincerely. ‚ÄúDid you actually change your middle name, legally?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Agatha was tense and refused to turn back.

‚ÄúIs it actually ‚ÄòFucking‚Äô?‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what the rags and some of my documents say,‚Äù Agatha smirked to herself.

‚ÄúWhat did you really change it to?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll give you three guesses and the first two don‚Äôt count,‚Äù Agatha started walking again.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôd be honored,‚Äù Lilia called after her, holding back tears.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

April 2014, San Francisco

Norma‚Äôs Funeral

Agatha had disguised herself at Norma‚Äôs funeral, Alice didn‚Äôt need to deal with anyone knowing that Agatha was there. Agatha wanted to be there for Alice, she needed someone. Agatha and Alice had kept in touch over the past three years, unbeknownst to almost everyone.

‚ÄúPsst, kid.‚Äù Agatha stepped up next to Alice. She was wearing a blonde wig and oversized sunglasses.

‚ÄúYou look ridiculous Agatha,‚Äù Alice whispered.

‚ÄúI look amazing, how are you holding up?‚Äù Agatha looked her over. She looked tired, but otherwise, not awful.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been better. Rio‚Äôs been amazing. She helped so much in the last several months. Best sister I could ask for.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you two have each other. Have you thought about my suggestion?‚Äù Agatha had yet again suggested she call Lilia.

Alice nodded. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to leave Rio, but I think it‚Äôs time.‚Äù

‚ÄúGood. Let me know what you need. I‚Äôm hiring a new right-hand girl. She can help you get set up in LA.‚Äù Agatha squeezed Alice by the shoulders. ‚ÄúWelcome to the family, kid. We‚Äôre fun.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The rest of 2014 - Early 2024

Let‚Äôs speed this up, shall we?

Lilia had only professional interactions with Agatha. That is to say, only in her professional capacity, although she took every one of them personally. Agatha was always a fierce competitor, and as a mother, she was unbeatable. Every time Nicky found himself in trouble, there was Agatha, convincing Lilia to let him off the hook. She knew Agatha thought it was because of her powerful personality, but¬† Lilia had never overcome the guilt and sadness of the losses of the most important women in her life. She let it color her interactions with Agatha and allowed the starlet to get away with anything. Even when against school policy or when it dealt with Wanda's twin boys.

Agatha always treated Lilia with a side of cynicism, but her anger lost its edge the day that Lilia showed up to the house with a bag of sick-day material.

Lilia was at Agatha‚Äôs house, Nicky was a freshman, fourteen, and had mono. She came to make him soup like she had done for Agatha when she had caught mono from another actress when she was sixteen.

Agatha opened the door and her eyes went wide seeing Lilia with the oldest pot on the planet.

‚ÄúIs the tetanus free?‚Äù She asked once she had recovered.

‚ÄúOh shut up and move over Harkness.‚Äù She pushed past Agatha and easily found her way into the kitchen.

‚ÄúLilia, what the hell are you doing?‚Äù Agatha followed her.

‚ÄúDo you remember when you had mono?‚Äù Lilia asked, placing the pot of soup on the stove and turning on the burner.

Agatha smiled at the memory. ‚ÄúUnfortunately. You made me some Italian soup from scratch in that same pot, which I swear made me feel so much better. You also had some type of tea, and homemade bread, made me watch The Wizard of Oz, and sleep,‚Äù Agatha recalled.

‚ÄúAll of that, except the sleep, is in that bag,‚Äù Lilia gestured to a bag on the counter.

Agatha pulled everything out of the bag and smiled, yet she was confused. They didn‚Äôt have this type of relationship and hadn‚Äôt in a long time.

‚ÄúWhy are you doing this Lilia?‚Äù Agatha leaned against the kitchen counter and crossed her arms over her chest.

Lilia stirred the soup as it heated, turning her head to look at Agatha.

‚ÄúYou were always terrible at taking care of the sick, and Agatha, I do care about him, and you too, I know things may never be the same between us, but if I can occasionally do something for him, and maybe even you, I‚Äôm going to. So excuse me while I finish this magical soup for the kid,‚Äù Lilia fixed Nicky's soup, bread, and tea, and pushed Agatha to take it up to Nicky. He was surprised to see real soup, not something out of the can, and ate eagerly.

Agatha sighed. If she was being honest with herself, she missed Lilia, the old Lilia. Her friend and the woman that would take care of her when she was sick, or teach her how to cook. The woman who was caring for her son, that was the Lilia she missed. Not the woman whose memory was tattooed on her hip. No, that was a different woman entirely, wasn‚Äôt it?



By early 2024, Agatha and Lilia were on even ground with each other. Nicky was calming down. He had earned the starting quarterback position the previous fall after the previous quarterback was injured. He knew that in order to remain the quarterback for the varsity squad, he had to keep any and all pranks to a harmless minimum. He had also started seeing Morgan Stark, someone he had known since he was four, in a much different light. He didn‚Äôt want to lose his chance in any of these respects, so he adjusted his behavior accordingly. Now, Lilia had fewer reasons to call Agatha to deal with her son, and Agatha had fewer reasons to show her sharp tongue. It was a new equilibrium. It wasn‚Äôt much. But, it was a start.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

March 2024. Los Angeles

Alice abruptly hung up the phone as she got up from the couch and headed towards the door, grabbing her bag. ‚ÄúI have to go to San Francisco, I‚Äôll be back in a few days. It‚Äôs an emergency,‚Äù she said over her shoulder at the other four members of the coven.

Agatha looked alarmed. ‚ÄúIs it a Nat emergency? I‚Äôll send her with you.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo. It‚Äôs Rio, I‚Äôll be back.‚Äù

She was out the door and on the phone with Lilia.

Alice made it to San Francisco in record time. Rio looked like shit. Alice was just thankful she was alive.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll kill the fucking bitch.‚Äù Alice saw red and she was looking around for any sharp object she could find.

‚ÄúAlice, no. Lou didn‚Äôt do this, Shane did. She would never hurt me, she loves me.‚Äù Rio slurred from the pain medication.

‚ÄúTherapy. You need therapy.‚Äù Alice was pacing. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre moving to LA, my boss is coming out here tomorrow. Just do a small interview, please?‚Äù Alice pleaded.

She had tried to get Rio to SHIELD for years, and now it was the only way to make sure she was completely safe.

Rio let out a defeated sigh. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll talk to her okay?‚Äù



Rio Vidal would be the perfect addition to SHIELD. But she was very much a broken woman, physically and emotionally. It didn‚Äôt take a psychic to see that. It reminded Lilia of a memory she had buried from long ago. No one should be hurt like that without a chance to heal. Somehow, she had to give Rio just that chance. Alice would be key to that. So would the little family that Agatha had pulled Alice into. Maybe Rio could also fill part of that gaping wound she had opened in Agatha? But that was one stubborn fifty-year-old woman. Maybe Rio would be up to that challenge or distraction, too? Perhaps with enough work, there could be room again for Lilia in their lives. It wouldn‚Äôt be what it once was, but to have Aggie back in her life would be enough.





Chapter End Notes

Reaction chapter on Saturday (hopefully)!

This was a hard one to write. I always knew that Lilia had turned herself into the villain in Agatha's story, though she never intended for that to happen, but damn.

Also, LORNA?! God.

Damnit Lorna.
For those of you that don't remember Agatha and Rio meeting before, Chapter 3 and 5 reference it, though it's vague.
Now we know why Agatha made sure the boys went to therapy as kids. Well-adjusted humans with healthy coping mechanisms from the start.

Does she still drink? Sure. Does she sometimes drink too much? Maybe.

Is she in control now?
Absolutely.

Somethin' Happens When Everybody Finds Out

Chapter Summary

Rio finds out.
Wanda finds out.
Agatha and Lilia face each other.

Chapter Notes

I'm sure there are trigger warnings, but honestly, you know what you're walking into now.

For those of you that follow me on socials, you know that this past weekend was rough and I had to put this chapter on hold. Thank you so much for being patient and understanding!

Raven, my cat who is Rio's cat in the story, crossed the Rainbow Bridge on the last day of February. She was at least 18 and I had her for 16 years. We went through A LOT together (I was a wee baby at 23 - I'll be 39 at the end of this month). I'm so sorry this chapter is late!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Present Day

Lilia was Agatha‚Äôs ex.

Rio felt as though the walls of the familiar venue were closing in on her. She looked around frantically. She couldn‚Äôt fall apart here, not on her sister‚Äôs big day. She would never do this to Alice. She had to get out and get out now. Rio slipped into a back hall, thankful that she had driven. Agatha could call her driver. Rio didn‚Äôt care. Seriously, fuck Agatha. No wonder Agatha hadn‚Äôt wanted to tell her. Lilia?

Rio needed to talk to Alice, but she couldn‚Äôt.

Rio had so many questions for Agatha.

Rio had so many questions for Lilia.

Rio needed an Ouija board.

Rio didn‚Äôt know what to do.

She stumbled through the back hallways towards the parking garage, stopping to empty the contents of her stomach. She was reeling from the revelation.

She knew that Agatha and Lilia had known each other for a long time.

Since Agatha had been fourteen.

She thought back to The Harkness Brag Room. Why weren‚Äôt there more pictures with Lilia in that room?

She retched yet again on the concrete, leaning against an unfamiliar vehicle. Unfortunately, it wasn‚Äôt Lilia‚Äôs.

Snippets of previous conversations sprung to her mind as she climbed into her car.

‚ÄúI was young, twenty-three, and I had chased her for years‚Ä¶‚Äù

Rio let out a feral scream. Rio remembered when she stood in Lilia‚Äôs office to ask if she could experiment with her chemistry class using open flames and different chemicals. Lilia had, of course, agreed. But, as she watched Lilia consider her request, Rio had noticed several pictures around the office, including one of Lilia, Lorna Wu, and Agatha on the opening night of Rent.

Yet, in every picture Agatha had from that night, Lilia was missing.

She drove away from the venue toward Agatha‚Äôs house to collect Raven. They couldn‚Äôt stay there right now. The urge to snoop and find evidence of Lilia being Swords crept in. Rio quickly dismissed it. She had all the evidence she needed.

‚ÄúI call her Swords.‚Äù

Rio recalled seeing the deck of tarot cards in Lilia‚Äôs office. Lilia also had a few signed Playbills and posters hanging around her office. She had several of Agatha‚Äôs, mainly from 2006 and earlier, which fit with the timeline that formed in Rio‚Äôs mind.

She grew more conflicted by the second.

Rio needed her emotional support Raven.

Then she needed to return to her apartment and plan which of these Hollywood cougars to confront first.

Rio was angry.

Rio was disgusted.

Rio was hurt.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

It had been thirty minutes since Agatha had last seen Rio. One minute, Rio was standing and observing everything from the side, taking it all in. Agatha looked over and winked at her, eliciting a gorgeous smile. Rio, in that orange dress that Alice had picked out with her. Rio‚Äôs hair had gotten longer in the past few months, and she kept tossing it over her shoulders. Rio, with her brown eyes that expressed everything and saw into the depths of Agatha‚Äôs soul. Rio, the woman who had absolutely shown Agatha what love was truly supposed to be, even if Rio‚Äôs own history caused doubts. They had been able to work through them all - together and in such a short time. Weddings had never made Agatha wistful or weepy, but now? With Rio? She was starting to think of a future that she had previously thought impossible.

And it no longer terrified her.

But at this moment, Agatha could not locate Rio. Agatha‚Äôs eyes scanned the area for any sign of her and saw none. She took a mental headcount of the coven and children, four sapphics, two adult queer men, six teens, herself, no Rio. She pulled out her phone and called, straight to voicemail. Agatha began to worry but didn‚Äôt want to alarm Alice. The psychotic blonde had been sent to The Island, never to be heard from again, so she didn‚Äôt need to worry about that. She locked eyes with Wanda as she headed toward the redheads.

Wanda saw the alarm in Agatha‚Äôs eyes, no matter how hard she was trying to hide it. ‚ÄúAggie, what‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù She asked, meeting her in the middle.

‚ÄúHave you seen Rio? Her phone is going straight to voicemail.‚Äù Agatha was trying to appear calm, though Wanda saw right through it. Wanda looked over at Nat, who had her phone out.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm tracking her now. It's a good thing she never takes that necklace off.‚Äù Nat looked up at both of them. ‚ÄúOh, I can track the necklaces whether the buttons are pushed or not. Emergency feature. Seems Rio already left. It shows she‚Äôs headed back to the compound.‚Äù She looked at Agatha, clearly confused.

Wanda gave Agatha a look. ‚ÄúWhat did you do this time??‚Äù

Agatha threw her hands up. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt do anything, I promise.‚Äù

‚ÄúMaybe the festivities led her to have doubts again?‚Äù Wanda wondered out loud.

Agatha shook her head. ‚ÄúNo, I think we‚Äôre okay there. The only thing I‚Äôve kept back is ‚Äòthe ex‚Äôs‚Äô identity. But, I haven‚Äôt told any of you that.‚Äù

Agatha threw her hands up in the air in frustration.

‚ÄúMaybe something just happened to her. How did this end up as my fault? Stop giving me that look. Your face is going to freeze like that.‚Äù

Agatha pulled out her phone when it dinged with a text from Rio.

Rioüíö

Hey, started feeling sick and

didn‚Äôt want to worry Alice.

Grabbing Raven from your

house and heading home.

Don‚Äôt want to get you or

Nicky sick

Agatha waved her phone at Wanda and Nat. ‚ÄúSee, what did I tell you?‚Äù

Wanda raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúDo you believe her?‚Äù

Agatha bit her lip and shook her head. ‚ÄúNo, but I‚Äôm about to be the best girlfriend ever. Tell Alice and Jen I love them, and take my kid home, please. I need to go take care of a sick Rio.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio had gotten back to the apartment and found a spiral notebook. She knew she couldn‚Äôt just march over to Lilia‚Äôs without being entirely sure that it was Lilia. The Swords that Agatha talked about was cold and distant. A heartless bitch that didn‚Äôt love Agatha and had left her at the altar.

The Lilia Calderu she knew was manipulative and cryptic, sure, but she had also let Rio off on late notice to go gallivanting around the world with Agatha. She had given her insight into Agatha and noticed when she was anxious.

Frantically, she wrote down everything she had thought of while in the car. Starting with when she met Lilia a year ago. She knew she had to sort out her thoughts before confronting either of the older women.

March 2024 - San Francisco

AWG [Alice] visits RV [Rio] in the hospital and tells RV to come to LA to SHIELD.

LC [Lilia] visits RV and offers RV position on AWG‚Äôs request. LC does conduct a quick interview. Explains that she understands needing to start over and the importance of being near family, blood or otherwise.

Signs LC is Swords

LC is 65 - 14 years older than Agatha (AH)

  • Knows a significant amount about AH
  • Favoritism towards coven
  • Very protective of the coven
  • Friends with Lorna?
  • At SHIELD forever
  • Won all major bets - insider knowledge?
  • Helped Cher write Believe
  • Says ‚Äòkid‚Äô
  • Broadway obsession
  • Loved Wicked (AH the original Elphaba and a cameo in the movie)
  • Rent (AH the original Maureen)
  • Extra protective of Nicky and Wanda‚Äôs boys
  • Warned me about guarding certain secrets - Wanda came to me shortly after
  • Tarot

Rio stopped writing and thought back on different interactions and what she knew. Lilia being Swords would explain why she had such a soft spot towards Nicky, but so would Lilia and Agatha being close.

Lilia and Agatha didn‚Äôt act like they had been close for thirty-seven years. They didn‚Äôt act like bitter exes, either.

It was some weird middle-ground.

That also explained why no one else knew. Leave it to Agatha to not want her past to cloud other people's judgment of someone.

So WHY had Lilia pushed Rio towards Agatha? She needed to talk to Lilia. Lilia had emotionally scarred Agatha and ruined her.

This same woman had helped Rio find a home and allowed her to coach again, knowing it would bring her joy.

Had she done that out of loyalty to Alice, because of her last name?

What in the holy hell was happening? It was eight on Saturday night, and the reception had been wrapping up, so hopefully, Lilia would be home by now.

Rio grabbed her keys and headed to Lilia‚Äôs.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha had soup, crackers, Gatorade, and everything she needed in case Rio had actually fallen sick. If she had had time, she would make soup herself. It was something Lilia had taught her how to do that week Nicky had mono.

The week that an unspoken truce had been made between them.

Agatha even had a giant stock pot now that would one day also be ancient and possibly come with a side of tetanus.

If you‚Äôre lucky, Lilia had said, shaking her head at Agatha‚Äôs sarcasm.

Agatha had even picked up treats for Raven and flowers for Rio. Agatha commended herself for getting better at this girlfriend thing. She was hoping she would still have a girlfriend in a few hours. Agatha was still in her suit from the reception as she knocked on Rio‚Äôs door and waited.

Nothing. Just as she feared.

‚ÄúMaybe she‚Äôs asleep.‚Äù Agatha thought aloud. She used her key and let herself inside. ‚ÄúBaby? It‚Äôs just me. I brought you soup! From the place you like down on the corner!‚Äù

She put everything in the kitchen and checked around the apartment, looking in the bedroom. Agatha flopped on the bed. Raven lifted her head and meowed.

‚ÄúMy thoughts exactly, Raven.‚Äù

Agatha called Rio, surprised when she answered.

‚ÄúHey baby, I‚Äôm sorry I didn‚Äôt tell you I was leaving.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs voice was hollow.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay. I was just going to stop by and bring you some soup and other things. Maybe we can watch a movie?‚Äù Agatha asked, hoping Rio would tell her the truth.

‚ÄúYou know, I just got out of the shower and am going to bed. I‚Äôll call you tomorrow.‚Äù

‚ÄúSure, my love. I hope you feel better. I love you, Rio.‚Äù Agatha was holding back a sob.

‚ÄúGoodnight, Agatha.‚Äù

The line went dead.

Agatha hung up the phone and cried. Raven came over and rubbed against her.

‚ÄúWhat have I done now?‚Äù Agatha asked Raven, searching for answers in those wise, feline eyes. Then the horror of the possibility hit her. Could Rio have figured it out?

‚ÄúI should have just told her it was Lilia, and then I could have explained everything, how I was young and stupid. What young lesbian doesn‚Äôt fall for an older woman? God, Raven. Why am I like this? She went to Lilia‚Äôs, didn‚Äôt she?‚Äù

Deep down, Agatha knew she had.

Raven hopped down from the bed and started walking toward the living room. She stopped and looked back at Agatha.

‚ÄúWhat? You want me to follow you? Did Timmy fall down a well? You know, following an immortal cat isn‚Äôt the strangest thing I‚Äôve done.‚Äù

She stood and followed Raven into the living room. Raven jumped onto the coffee table and pawed at the open notebook Rio had been writing in.

‚ÄúShe does know.‚Äù

Agatha looked at everything Rio had written down.

‚ÄúOf course, she has pictures in her office. Idiot.‚Äù Agatha scoffed. ‚ÄúOkay, Raven, here‚Äôs the play. I leave everything I brought for her, including your treats, I write her a note, go home and cry, and then it‚Äôs up to your mom and whatever fucking Lilia says.‚Äù

Raven meowed.

‚ÄúYeah, I know. I‚Äôm fucked, and not in any of the fun ways.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio had been to Lilia‚Äôs a handful of times but had the address to the Victorian house in Angelino Heights saved in her phone. She wasn‚Äôt sure if she was glad Lilia was home or disappointed. She had just hung up with Agatha and was upset with herself. Rio had lied to Agatha and hadn‚Äôt told her she loved her because she felt conflicted. The plethora of feelings roared back to life as she walked up to the door and knocked.

Lilia was not surprised to see her.

‚ÄúI was wondering when you would figure it out.‚Äù

Lilia turned, walking back into the house, not waiting for Rio.

Rio was right on her heels.

‚ÄúSo you just expected me to figure it out on my own? KNEW I would come over?‚Äù

‚ÄúI read people, Rio. It‚Äôs how I‚Äôm so good at my job. Tea?‚Äù Lilia offered, walking to the kitchen like she had invited Rio over, not like it was possibly her last few minutes on earth.

‚ÄúWhat? No! I‚Äôm pissed and homicidal, Lilia!‚Äù Rio was still following her, hands flailing. She couldn‚Äôt stay still. Lilia walked back to the living room with a cup of tea and sat down on a grey, overstuffed couch while Rio began her habit of covering every inch of floor space.

‚ÄúI know you‚Äôre going to walk around while you rant, but feel free to sit when you need to. You know how Agatha reads people? I taught her that,‚Äù Lilia said, sipping the hot liquid, and the subtle reminder of Lilia‚Äôs influence over Agatha enraged Rio more.

‚ÄúRight, because you taught her everything! Which brings us to my first thing. Lilia, you were her teacher. How could you?‚Äù Rio‚Äôs words were laced with venom as she aimed them at Lilia.

‚ÄúI will stop you right there, Rio Vidal.‚Äù Lilia‚Äôs words came out harsh for the first time. ‚ÄúNOTHING ever happened when Agatha was underage. EVER. I didn‚Äôt ever think of her like that, and I never would.‚Äù Lilia sighed deeply as the pain of the past overtook her features. ‚ÄúDo you want the whole story, or do you just want to pace around and yell?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat I WANT is to cause some damage,‚Äù Rio said seriously, wishing she had the dagger she used to carry on her for SF-like emergencies.

‚ÄúLorna wanted to murder me, too. I‚Äôm honestly shocked she never did.‚Äù She looked at Rio, watching the gears turn in the woman‚Äôs mind.

‚ÄúTalk,‚Äù Rio said with all the restraint she could muster, ‚Äú but then I get to ask questions, and you will answer honestly. Without being cryptic.‚Äù

Lilia sat her tea down and looked past Rio, seeing the women of the past parade past her eyes.

‚ÄúI met Agatha when she was fourteen and I was twenty-eight. Her mother had been abusing her for years, and Agatha would do whatever she could to ruffle Evanora‚Äôs feathers.‚Äù

Lilia told her about young Agatha, the mischievous child star that terrorized anyone and everyone she could if she didn‚Äôt try to seduce them first. A menace first and Hollywood starlet second. Lilia had an encyclopedia of stories from the mundane to the absolutely absurd, and they were all very Agatha, from the hilarious to the horrifying. Lilia also explained Lorna‚Äôs plan to get her away from Evanora and where she came into it.

‚ÄúEvanora did it for us, though. Lorna and I, that is. When she caught Agatha with another girl, she lost it with her righteous bullshit. I‚Äôll never get over the irony of holier-than-thou Evanora Harkness turning Agatha into Lesbian Jesus. Regardless, she shot at Agatha in public, thankfully, she missed. The woman couldn‚Äôt hit the broad side of a barn if it were lit up like a Christmas tree. I happened to know a powerful attorney, and you know the rest, Agatha gained her freedom. Lorna was like a mother to her, and I was, eh,‚Äù Lilia hesitated, ‚Äúan older figure.‚Äù

Lilia still felt guilty all these decades later. She had helped shape this woman, took all of Agatha‚Äôs love and trust, and thrown it away and destroyed it. Destroyed Agatha. Lorna had once called her Lilia ‚ÄòThe destroyer of all that is well and good in this world‚Äô Calderu during an argument. Lilia turned around and called her Lorna ‚ÄòMother to all but her own child‚Äô Wu. It was one of their nastier fights near the end of their friendship.

‚ÄúLorna was a mother to Agatha, but not Alice,‚Äù Rio said slowly, trying to make it make sense. Alice had yearned for more of a relationship with her mother, but understood, at least when older, that her time with Norma had been better for her. Alice was so well-adjusted and had a happy, loving childhood,¬† raised by Gran. Alice and Agatha were pretty close these days, and Alice was so happy for Rio. Alice had even encouraged Rio‚Äôs relationship with Agatha. Did she know the dynamics of Agatha and Lorna‚Äôs relationship? How much of any of this did Alice know? Had ALICE, her chosen sister, been lying to her? Rio pushed that thought aside, one potential traitor at a time.

‚ÄúLorna had chosen a different life for Alice after seeing how growing up here had affected Agatha. She knew that her hopes for Alice‚Äôs life and future were incompatible with the celebrity lives they led; sex, drugs, and alcohol.¬† As she must have told you, Agatha was an alcoholic before she was in double digits, as were most Hollywood kids back then. And, Lorna, well, you know her story.‚Äù Lilia waved her hand.

‚ÄúAgatha was an alcoholic? I knew she partied. I didn‚Äôt know she was an alcoholic. She still drinks now, should she not?‚Äù Rio was mildly irritated that her concern for Agatha was eroding at the anger that was fueling her conversation. Lilia nodded.

‚ÄúFrom the time she was a kid until she was thirty-two. She quit when she started her fertility journey. I didn‚Äôt know immediately, having pushed her away as much as I could, showing her a colder vision of myself. Let‚Äôs go back‚Ä¶‚Äù

The truth hurts, Lilia reminded herself, even to the person saying it. Yet, this was a necessary hurt today. Rio‚Äôs main concern was evident. She needed honesty after months of being lied to. Anything less would remove any chance Lilia had of staying in Rio‚Äôs good graces. And, if Lilia had any chance of returning to Agatha‚Äôs life, she had to be honest with Rio. Lilia had to overcome the survival instinct to battle what she imagined was Agatha‚Äôs narrative of the story, that of Lilia the cold-hearted villain. If Lilia wanted to manipulate this to her advantage at all, this would be the way, by not omitting anything or attempting to portray herself in a positive light.

Lilia let the story escape, a torrent held by an age-old dam. Nothing was held back anymore. She told Rio everything, how Agatha had kissed her on her eighteenth birthday, the conversation about Agatha‚Äôs feelings, and how they decided to be casual. She told Rio about how she separated herself into two personas to keep Agatha at arm‚Äôs length. Lilia added Lorna‚Äôs take on it too, her insistence that Lilia was in the wrong and the fights it caused between the best friends.

Unable to stop the truth, Lilia talked about how the dynamic shifted after Nicky was born. Although it had been clear that there were no second chances, she continued the cruel demeanor to focus Agatha away from her. After all, she was, wasn‚Äôt she?

‚ÄúAnd that‚Äôs where we are today,‚Äù Lilia finished, eyes puffy from crying.

Rio ran a hand over her face. Thoughts fluttered around her brain, making it difficult to pin one down for long. But her emotions stayed strong. Rio was livid and conflicted. Her heart ached for Agatha and Lilia in completely different ways. It made her want to stay and comfort or run far away.¬† These situations were just so fucking convoluted. One thing was clear to her. She couldn‚Äôt imagine losing Alice because one of them had made such a stupid life choice. To endure this crazy life and do so alone and without forgiveness and closure from your best friend. It was heartbreaking.

This whole thing was messy. It was complicated. It was a psychological drama Rio wasn‚Äôt sure she wanted to play a part in anymore. Still, Rio was never one to stand down when justice needed to be done.

‚ÄúWhat the fuck, Lilia? There is so much to unpack here. I don‚Äôt know where to start.‚Äù

‚ÄúGive it a shot,‚Äù Lilia said with tired cynicism, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve heard or thought it all.‚Äù

‚ÄúAgatha trusted you! You were supposed to be a safe person for her! You were one of two people that she had in this world and you didn‚Äôt just fuck her over, you actually fucked her. You KNEW better, Lilia! So WHAT if she was a consenting adult, or mature? She was still a kid compared to you, Lilia. One of your two best friends! Lorna was a much better woman than I am.‚Äù

Rio paced the room, fists clenched. Yes, it took two people to get into the situation, but Agatha had been young, and it had been Lilia‚Äôs job, no, her duty, to shut the whole thing down.

‚ÄúLorna was a better woman than all of us,‚Äù Lilia corrected. ‚ÄúI regret what I did to Agatha and how. I took a moment of weakness and stretched it for a decade. I destroyed myself, Agatha, and the family we built in the process. Each one of us had a vice, and somehow, mine turned out to be the most damaging. I suspected from the beginning I wasn‚Äôt the person for Agatha, but I selfishly thought maybe it could work out. I deluded myself that I was balancing it well, jumping between two personalities with her, warmly loving and coldly distant.¬† It didn‚Äôt work as well as I had thought, and Agatha had cried, god, I don‚Äôt know how many times to Lorna, who affectionately called me a ‚Äòbipolar bitch.‚Äô It wasn‚Äôt just a bad situation, it was a disaster, and I was too blind to see it or what it did to me. I completely lost sight of who I was, and every word said under that other version of me made me hate myself, too. I‚Äôve never been able to forgive myself.‚Äù

Lilia looked down at the floor, her eyes following patterns in the wood.

‚ÄúWhat about Nicky? You didn‚Äôt want him, so why bother treating him with such favoritism?‚Äù

Rio had stopped pacing for a moment.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a part of Agatha, and that makes him special. Just as Agatha will always be special to me, I will always love her, Rio. Not the way you do, no, but the way I have always loved her,‚Äù

Rio jumped in, ‚ÄúThe way you always loved her? Like you still want to sleep with her?‚Äù Rio‚Äôs face was one of utter disgust.

Lilia‚Äôs face did not change. ‚ÄúNo, Rio, I do not want to sleep with Agatha, that is not a part of it. As I was saying, I also care about all our students. But I will go further to protect Nicky and the twins out of loyalty to Agatha, Wanda, and, most importantly, Lorna.‚Äù

‚ÄúWANDA!‚Äù Rio remembered the good-hearted redhead with an inability to keep secrets, realization dawning.

‚ÄúShe must not know any of this! Does she even know what truly happened to Lorna?‚Äù

‚ÄúI doubt it. One great thing Agatha picked up from Lorna is a protective streak. With that, and Agatha‚Äôs maturity beyond her years, she sheltered Wanda from all that she could.¬† Agatha swooped in and has always tried to take away Wanda‚Äôs pain from the atrocities of genocidal war and then an exploitative family member. Agatha immediately got Wanda into therapy once she got Wanda away from her aunt. If Wanda will ever tell you about those first few weeks at Agatha‚Äôs, let her. It will give you more insight into Wanda and why she has let Agatha lead and guide her for so long. But I digress.‚Äù

Lilia finished the now cold tea as she tried to remember where she was going with that last story and looked at Rio. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre conflicted.‚Äù She stated.

‚ÄúNo shit,‚Äù Rio replied. ‚ÄúOn the one hand, the ex Agatha told me about is this awful, terrible, cold, and unfeeling woman‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúShe was,‚Äù Lilia confirmed.

Rio‚Äôs face twisted as she looked at Lilia.

‚ÄúBut, you‚Äôre not. You‚Äôre Lilia. You care about these kids, especially the boys. You hate injustice, you get nervous over a teacher going into labor, and you worry about students getting glitter in their eyes. You want what‚Äôs best for former friends, you give women second chances, and you watch over your former best friend's daughter. Alice told me about the advice you gave her about Jen. You warned me about keeping Wanda‚Äôs secrets. The Lilia Calderu I know, cryptic and shady though she may be, is not the woman of Agatha‚Äôs past.‚Äù Rio didn‚Äôt know what to do or really what to think, about anyone.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of shady characters around here, my dear.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou and Agatha, primarily,‚Äù Rio said, looking at the floor as she had a thought. ‚ÄúLilia, why did you bring me here? Don‚Äôt give me the bullshit about teaching or because of Alice, why did you really bring me here?‚Äù

Rio knew the answer but needed to hear it straight from the source.

‚ÄúDo not discount my support for Alice and her moment of need. But, yes, I also saw two broken women who could support each other. With what I knew of that little wild coven, it would be inevitable if you came back with us.‚Äù

Lilia waited for Rio‚Äôs reaction, knowing it could go a myriad of ways, really hoping anger wasn‚Äôt the one Rio chose, but knowing too well that her cards were upside down at this point.

Rio chose anger.

‚ÄúWHAT?! You tried to set us up?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo. Words have meaning, my dear. I said you could support each other. I didn‚Äôt expect all of this to happen, though part of me always hopes for the best for Agatha, in love as well. I only want her to be happy and for Nicky to be surrounded by love. Everything else? All of that was more than I could hope for, but I would do it over and over if I knew the results would be the same.‚Äù

All Rio heard was how Lilia had set them up.

‚ÄúYou KNEW I had a stalker, and you put them in harm's way to make up for the pain you caused her? That‚Äôs selfish, Lilia!‚Äù

Rio was moving faster now, careful not to trip over her own two feet as she wore a path in the wooden flooring. Lilia‚Äôs eyes followed Rio.

‚ÄúYes, a stalker. Not a crazy, psychopath who would follow you across the state! I didn‚Äôt know Lou would completely lose it, and neither did you. I certainly didn‚Äôt know she‚Äôd go after Nicky. I would have never let it get that far.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou weren‚Äôt at the hospital when he got injured,‚Äù Rio spat out the accusation.

‚ÄúNot that you were aware of, sure. I told Wanda not to wake either of you or tell you I was there. Anytime Nicky or the twins hurt themselves, I am in the shadows. Don‚Äôt underestimate me, Vidal. You‚Äôre losing focus.‚Äù Lilia reminded her with a slight smile.

‚ÄúThis is too much,‚Äù Rio shook her head. ‚ÄúYou were a monster and shattered her. Now,¬† you‚Äôre what, trying to redeem yourself? You bring me here, effectively putting her in danger, Agatha and I fall in love, what do you get? Absolution of your sins?‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs mind was reeling.

‚ÄúMy sins are my own, and I have to live with those, with what I did and what my actions caused. I lost my family because of what I did, Rio. All the money and notoriety in the world can‚Äôt replace that, and it was a hard lesson to learn. I went from being a planet in someone‚Äôs solar system to a monster lurking in the shadows.‚Äù Lilia was willing Rio to understand, without a side of anger.

Rio had stopped making her laps in Lilia‚Äôs front room. It was late, and her energy was fading. ‚ÄúSo this was your idea to what, to return to dwarf planet status, Pluto?‚Äù Rio had her hands on her hips, her hard expression returning.

‚ÄúSomething like that.‚Äù

Lilia finally stood, walking back to the kitchen to put away the now empty teacup‚Äîmore to keep herself busy than anything else. Rio was shaking, though she wasn‚Äôt sure whether it was from convoluted emotions, adrenaline, or shock.

‚ÄúIs this your entire redemption arc, Lilia? Restore love to Agatha‚Äôs life and maybe, just maybe, find your way back in, because I may not allow that to happen, purely out of protection. What if I don‚Äôt trust you anymore?‚Äù

Lilia scoffed, rinsing the cup and placing it on the drainboard, turning to face Rio.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have a malicious bone in your body. Norma raised you better. It‚Äôs why Lou is still breathing and why I‚Äôm still standing. If Agatha didn‚Äôt want me here, I wouldn‚Äôt be, and you won‚Äôt go against Agatha.

‚ÄúYou also won‚Äôt hurt Alice, and she still sees the good in me. Alice is the one who called me to you, in case you‚Äôve forgotten. She is the one that gave me the idea to bring you here, and it‚Äôs already crossed your mind how much she‚Äôs withheld.‚Äù

Rio quickly looked away. Lilia was, after all, the master at reading people.

‚ÄúDid my career amount to anything in your principal Calderu eyes? Or was it merely my trauma and relationship with Alice?‚Äù

Rio was floundering.

‚ÄúOf course it did. I wasn‚Äôt letting an unqualified teacher around my kids. I may be kooky, Rio, but I‚Äôm not certifiable. I do have some standards.‚Äù

For the first time during their conversation, Lilia felt slightly offended. Rio shook her head, walking back through the living room.

‚ÄúThis conversation isn‚Äôt over, Lilia. I don‚Äôt know what to think. I don‚Äôt know who you are anymore. I‚Äôm confused about my feelings. I have no idea what‚Äôs real and what was manipulated. I need the week, Lilia, I won‚Äôt be in.‚Äù

Rio headed for the door as Lilia caught her arm.

‚ÄúRio, wait, just hang on for a minute.‚Äù Lilia dropped her hand and went to where keys were hanging by the door, taking one on a triple moon keyring and writing down an address in the Sierra Nevada region.

‚ÄúGo home, get some sleep, drive up in the morning. It‚Äôs a good place to do some thinking. Lorna and Agatha did a lot of‚Ä¶retreats there. I know things aren‚Äôt okay, and I know they aren‚Äôt okay with us. I‚Äôll take care of work, and you go clear your head. As for Agatha, a couple of things. Her drinking is under control, and she has a small Army of friends to pull her away from most bad situations. But, lastly, and most importantly, I can bring people together Rio, but I can‚Äôt make them fall in love. You have every right to be mad at me, and if you burn down the cabin, I deserve it. But don‚Äôt take it out on Agatha, don‚Äôt shut her out, and don‚Äôt cause her pain like I did.‚Äù

For the first time, Lilia actually looked her age, and older.

‚ÄúNo one is even slightly capable of doing what you did, Swords,‚Äù Rio retorted as she took the key and address and closed the door firmly behind her.

She had gone in, guns a-blazin‚Äô, and came out surrounded by ghosts. Calling Lilia Swords was what Rio had needed to remind her that this woman had hurt Agatha all those years ago.

Lilia could only smirk at the nickname as she watched Rio through the glass in the door. Confirming the rumor of the tattoo and recalling something Lorna had once said before Witches‚Äô Road had even been written.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not taking a knife to her heart, Lilia, you‚Äôre taking a sword to it.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

It was after midnight when Rio entered her apartment and turned on the light. Her eyes automatically landed on the flowers on the coffee table and the opened spiral. She picked it up and sat on the couch, reading the note from Agatha.

My Love,

I came by to bring you soup and other supplies. Everything is in the fridge. Raven led me to this.

Yes, Lilia is my ex. Please give me a chance to explain after you hear her side of the story. I love you so much, and I do not want to lose you. I know you have your reasons for not telling me you were going to see her, and I respect that. I am here to answer any and all questions you have when you‚Äôre ready.

I love you.

Your Love,

Agatha

Agatha had even left her boutonniere from the reception lying next to the letter. Rio put her head in her hands and sobbed. When she finally stopped, she dragged herself to the shower, sitting on the floor as the hot water washed away her tears and thinking about her next move. She had a lot to process, and thanks to Lilia, the root cause of most of this, she had a fortress of solitude awaiting her escape. Still, her thoughts scattered like the water around her.

She needed Alice, but she couldn‚Äôt ruin this time for her and Jen.

Alice might also have been keeping secrets all these years.

Rio hadn‚Äôt felt this alone since before she had crossed foot into Norma Wu‚Äôs house. Even on her own in San Francisco, she could call Alice and talk to her. Meet up on the weekends.

Oh, Wanda. Poor Wanda, too. Someone else who would just be crushed. She would have to wait for Wanda to reach out to her.

Rio lay in her bed, having transitioned from her shower to the comfort of her blankets, and emotional support Raven curled on her stomach as she let out a harsh laugh. This damn situation was so convoluted because Agatha was at the center of this little lesbian universe.

No, she would do as Lilia had instructed, wouldn‚Äôt she? Get some sleep, because deep down, Rio knew it was the best thing to do. Not because Lilia had suggested it but because it was the smart thing to do.

She would pack, leave a note for Alice to take Raven to Nicky, and flee to the cabin in the mountains.

Maybe she would burn it down.

After all, she did feel like causing some damage.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

‚ÄúLilia. It was Lilia?‚Äù

Wanda‚Äôs face drained of color, a feat for the already fair-skinned redhead. Then, it contorted to hurt as the realization of the past nearly thirty years crept in. Lilia and Lorna had been such a force, their friendship stood solid through everything, and they had been there through everything. Lilia had always been there for them, and then suddenly, she hadn‚Äôt been there as much. Then, she had more to do with Wanda, and by extension, Nat. Not as much with Agatha. Wanda hadn‚Äôt known what had happened. All she remembered from those years was the inherent sadness that never left Lorna‚Äôs eyes and how her emotions flared and tears flowed if anyone even mentioned Lilia.¬† Her heart ached for their friendship, derailed by horrid decisions and poor life choices. Wanda couldn‚Äôt imagine losing Agatha‚Äôs presence like that, and the mere thought made her eyes well up with tears once more. Lilia had brought Wanda so much hope when she came to visit the hospital on the day of Nicky‚Äôs birth, thinking things would be all right again, but nothing came of it. Which again sent a wave of sadness over her now as it had years ago. Wanda knew Lilia would have been over the moon for Lorna‚Äôs sobriety had she been made aware.

They had all been so proud of Lorna.

Then she and Agatha did that movie.

Lorna relapsed.

Lorna died.

The memory of the days surrounding her death made her eyes sting again.

They all moved on, honoring Lorna with the best lives they could lead and raising their sons in a happy and stable home. Then, it came time to send the boys to school, and Agatha insisted on SHIELD. Wanda was elated to have Lilia back, if even on the periphery of their small family. That‚Äôs when she could see Agatha and Lilia's relationship begin to thaw slowly.¬† It was one of the reasons Wanda was so insistent on becoming the ultimate school moms. The parties, the functions, everything. She so badly wanted to rebuild their group‚Äôs old dynamic.

It wasn‚Äôt just for Agatha, who would never admit to needing Lilia around. Wanda had needed Lilia back in almost the same way that Lilia needed them.

Wanda turned to Nat, not quite looking at her.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve kept secrets for Agatha, did you know?‚Äù

Nat shook her head. ‚ÄúNo, this is one she didn‚Äôt let me in on either.‚Äù

Nat looked up at Agatha, eyes searching.

‚ÄúThey were our friends too. Missed holidays, birthdays, and milestones. It was our family. Agatha, you had no right to decide for us.‚Äù

Wanda nodded, something darker rolling across her face and into her tremulous voice.

‚ÄúI get wanting to have secrets, but why didn‚Äôt you tell me? Me, Aggie. I told you everything, every time. I thought it was mutual. You‚Äôre my sister, for god's sake! You know what I mean. And it isn‚Äôt just one secret now like you always said. Not just the identity of your ex. But, also the two biggest losses and moments in your life before Nicky and I never knew a thing. I didn‚Äôt even suspect something was wrong. Why didn‚Äôt you trust me with these and let me be there for you? Pregnancy, miscarriage, stood up at the altar‚Ä¶ what the hell, Aggie!‚Äù The words tumbled out of her. Wanda felt as though she had been stabbed in the back repeatedly.

By Agatha.

Agatha looked at Wanda with the same sisterly look as always, ‚ÄúYou were filming overseas, I wasn‚Äôt going to burden you, I -‚Äù

‚ÄúNO!‚Äù Wanda shouted and jumped up, startling both of the other women. ‚ÄúNO! You don‚Äôt get to do that. I wasn‚Äôt a little girl, Agatha! I wasn‚Äôt then, and I‚Äôm not now.

‚ÄúBut, Agatha, I so badly wanted and still want to be there for you, for everything. I was honored to be in that delivery room the day Nicky was born. I gladly would have let you break my hand that day. Every scandal when I got to be there by your side and handle something the way you taught me to was when I finally got to be the person that Agatha Harkness was for me. Now, I find out that you kept two of your darkest moments from me? So I was not able to be there as I should have been and so wished to be. Aggie, I am just devastated.‚Äù

Tears were dripping from Wanda‚Äôs chin and jaw. Nat sat beside her on the couch, also crying, but holding Wanda‚Äôs hand. She looked up at Wanda, nodding in agreement and resisting the urge to put her arms around Wanda.

Agatha wiped her face with the sleeve of her shirt, which was covered in tears and snot, despite having changed just a little while earlier.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want to cloud your judgment now by telling you who, and back then, I didn‚Äôt want to bother you with everything you had -‚Äù

This time, it was Nat who interrupted.

‚ÄúWe aren‚Äôt an excuse to use, Agatha. We all knew what we were doing, and Wanda did a damn good job at balancing us with everything else.‚Äù

Wanda nodded.

‚ÄúI would‚Äôve been back here immediately. Lilia being your ex doesn‚Äôt cloud my judgment now, and it wouldn‚Äôt have then. This was something you did for you, not us. I am capable of talking to someone and separating their past indiscretions. You wanted to maintain control and the facade of your life. We can call it a lesson you picked up in your youth. But, that control would have cracked had you tried to reconcile the truth with the facade you presented. Yes, it was complicated, but Lilia was a big part of all our lives. And whether you want to admit it or not, you needed her back in your life when Lorna died. You chose to go through so much on your own when you had me, us, and probably her too.‚Äù Wanda gestured. ‚ÄúAll you had to do was tell us.‚Äù

Wanda took a moment to breathe. Her words marinated in Agatha‚Äôs head.

‚ÄúRio is good for you, the best really. But, it‚Äôs not all about having a perfect partner.‚Äù Wanda looked at her hand in Nat‚Äôs before reaching out with the other to Agatha. ‚ÄúYou also need the old Lilia to fill a different role. Stop thinking of her as your ex. That woman is long gone, and you know deep down that she is.‚Äù

Agatha did not reach for Wanda‚Äôs outstretched hand, unconsciously taking a step back instead and causing another wave of sorrow to hit Wanda.

‚ÄúAgatha, God! I‚Äôm so over the manipulations and the betrayal! Nearly THIRTY years of it. How can I trust you, that this is all of it, that you‚Äôre not holding back anything else important?‚Äù Wanda looked away from Agatha, her bottom lip quivering.

‚ÄúI was never supposed to be the one being betrayed, Agatha.‚Äù



Agatha leaned forward, her head dropping. She knew that the hardest challenge still lay ahead, and she dreaded having to add salt to Wanda‚Äôs emotional wounds tonight. She hated the feeling of causing pain to the person she swore to protect.

Yet, Agatha still had to tell her how Lorna died. Not the fabricated story that she had reiterated so many times over the years it almost felt like a truth of its own.

There was also the letter Lorna had written for Wanda, too. Agatha had never given it to her, not because she didn‚Äôt want to, but because it had specific instructions:

When Wanda and Nat get married.

Or 15 years from now (2/27/26),

whichever comes first.


She assumed that Lorna had written it in that letter. Lorna had a flair for the dramatic, but no, she needed to tell Wanda now, before she did any more damage.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right, Wanda. There‚Äôs more I need to tell you. But this one was not exactly my secret.‚Äù

She raised her eyes to meet Wanda‚Äôs scrutinizing gaze, knowing this was going to deal a harsh blow.

‚ÄúYou might want to sit down.‚Äù

Wanda didn‚Äôt sit down. Instead, she remained standing, knowing she might end up bolting out of the door and sprinting across the compound. Nat stood, taking up a protective stance next to her.

Agatha blinked back tears and drew a shaky breath.

‚ÄúPlease know that Lorna didn‚Äôt want anyone to know, but she never relapsed. She remained sober.‚Äù

The confusion instantly hit both redheads.

‚ÄúThen what happened? Agatha, we know what substance abuse looks like. Lorna looked so bad at the end. She looked‚Ä¶‚Äù

It clicked for both of them at that moment as she looked at Nat. Where Nat accepted it with a silent nod, Wanda let out an ear-splitting scream.

‚ÄúNO! She was clean, she was sober, she was vibrant! WHY?! Why did this happen to her? Why didn‚Äôt you tell us?‚Äù

Wanda wasn‚Äôt really standing as much as Nat was holding her up as she relived that night.

‚ÄúLorna didn‚Äôt want anyone to pity her, didn‚Äôt want to become some sob story or martyr. She was down to the last few weeks, days really. And, went out on her own terms at that party we were all at, and you know the rest.‚Äù

Agatha had relived the memory so many times over the years. It was a piece of her.

Wanda clung to Nat as she let the initial shock subside and stood straight. There was time for rehashed grief later.

‚ÄúIn hiding all of this, you did more damage than good. Once more your secrets and manipulations hurt us all. We deserved to be there for Lorna and for you. We deserved to mourn and honor her.¬† Lilia isn‚Äôt the only one that‚Äôs been playing two different people, Agatha. She may have started the demolition, but you kept it going.‚Äù

She motioned to Nat for them to go as she looked back at Agatha.

‚ÄúI have to think some things over. You know we‚Äôll be okay in a few days because that‚Äôs what family does, Agatha. They forgive each other, no matter the transgressions or duration. Ironically, it was you and Lorna who taught me that. Just give me some space to process this.‚Äù She paused a moment. ‚ÄúI just hope Rio can forgive you. If Alice knew ANY of this and didn‚Äôt tell Rio, then may God have mercy on her soul.‚Äù

Hand-in-hand, Nat and Wanda walked out of Agatha‚Äôs house. Wanda would absolutely forgive Agatha in a few days. She wouldn‚Äôt let this come between them. There would be scars, but she saw how haunted Lilia still was to this day, and she would not make those same mistakes.

As the hurt redheads returned to their house, Wanda turned to Nat as they buried themselves in each other‚Äôs arms.

‚ÄúHow do you manage to remain so stoic and not completely lose it?‚Äù Wanda sniffed.

‚ÄúSome training never leaves you, but also, I had a hand in Lorna‚Äôs death,‚Äù Nat whispered.

Wanda pulled back and looked up at her.

‚ÄúWhat? But she chose that herself, you had nothing to do with that unless you gave her the‚Ä¶‚Äù Wanda looked at her in horror and stepped back. Nat ran a hand through her hair.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt give her anything! She came to me asking about certain pills and medications. I assumed it was for a role, and I answered her. Just like I would you. I gave her the names of some people from whom she could get more information. She asked me if I used to carry things on me, and I told her I still did for‚Ä¶trickier situations I occasionally find myself in involving you two. Stalkers, if anyone is ever kidnapped, any possible revenge; you know, the shadier side.‚Äù

Agatha Harkness was not your normal, run-of-the-mill celebrity.

Wanda nodded, not liking where this was going. Nat crossed her arms, tears gathering at the rims of her eyes.

‚ÄúI did not tell her where I kept anything; she was clever,‚Äù Nat smiled. ‚Äú It was Lorna, she had known me for fourteen years and had a hand in forming me. She knew how to get into my house. She knew all my secret hiding places, the secret panels. A few days after she died, I had a suspicion, and I checked. It was all missing, with a note that said, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm so sorry, you‚Äôll learn why one day. I love you, Nat. Take good care of them, especially Wanda.‚Äô‚Äù

The tears had spilled over as she looked at Wanda.

‚ÄúI am so sorry, Wanda.‚Äù

The sleeves of Wanda‚Äôs shirt were permanently tear-stained, she was sure. ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt you tell me?‚Äù

Nat couldn‚Äôt meet her eyes. ‚ÄúTo protect you,‚Äù she whispered.

Wanda was done.

‚ÄúI am NOT a child that needs protecting! I wasn‚Äôt then, and I‚Äôm not now! You‚Äôre sleeping on the couch.‚Äù

She turned on her heel and stomped up the stairs.



Agatha had just stood and stared after Wanda and Nat. Her hands had dropped to her sides, and she truly did not know what to do with herself.

She was losing people quickly.

Her phone dinged, Nat had installed the tracking app for the necklace. Rio had just left Lilia‚Äôs. Agatha huffed.

‚ÄúAlright, you old bat, time for us to do this,‚Äù she said aloud.

She swore she heard Lorna‚Äôs laughter.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha sailed into Lilia‚Äôs house as though she belonged there, locking the door behind her.

‚ÄúI see you were expecting me.‚Äù

Agatha noticed a mug of black coffee on the coffee table as she settled in the old armchair beside it, the one that had always been her favorite. It was still just as comfortable.

‚ÄúYou should keep the door locked. You never know what shady characters will come in, present company excluded, of course.‚Äù

She looked down at the wooden floor and noticed a burn mark, a memory of a time she had missed the ashtray. Lilia walked in from the kitchen with a new cup of tea.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs two in the morning, and you‚Äôre the second dark-haired lesbian in my house tonight. I think I‚Äôll take my chances.‚Äù

‚ÄúI take it things didn‚Äôt go well,‚Äù Agatha concluded, pushing away the memories of her time spent here. In the past, the two women had at least kept their activities relegated to different spaces. This house held the better memories - the memories of family. There were arguments, especially near the end, sure. However, this house mostly reminded Agatha of who and what she lost and she realized she was losing her anger quickly, even though she was trying to hold on to it.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm alive, so it could have been much worse. Have you heard from her?‚Äù Lilia quirked a brow.

‚ÄúNo, and I don‚Äôt think I will for at least a day or so. She lied to me about coming here. She told me she was at her apartment while I was physically standing there, so that‚Äôs where we are with that. Did you orchestrate this? Don‚Äôt tell me you didn‚Äôt. You know better than to meddle in the affairs of a Harkness.‚Äù

Agatha could have sworn she saw ghosts of their younger selves everywhere. Agatha had crossed her legs at the knees and held her mug at her lips. Lilia sighed.

‚ÄúYou and I both know that I am not the woman I was all those years before.‚Äù

Lilia‚Äôs eyes met Agatha‚Äôs.

‚ÄúMaybe not completely, but there‚Äôs still that Calderu manipulation there. That was always a staple. Half-truths, cryptic advice, the ultimate mastermind.‚Äù

Agatha took a sip of her coffee, her gaze steady.

‚ÄúYes, and you are my protege, don‚Äôt forget that,‚Äù Lilia reminded.

Agatha looked away at that.

‚ÄúThe question still stands,‚Äù Agatha replied.

‚ÄúI brought her here because she would be a great fit at SHIELD, Alice needed her, and she would also fill gaping wounds.‚Äù Lilia studied Agatha‚Äôs reaction carefully.

‚ÄúFifty-one, and you‚Äôre still trying to control my life,‚Äù Agatha barked, though they both knew there was no real bite to it.

‚ÄúI just want what‚Äôs best for you.‚Äù

The anger in Agatha attempted to shove forward with that admission. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs best for me? WHAT‚ÄôS BEST FOR ME?! Was staring at me for three hours after I told you I miscarried, what was best for me? Was leaving me at the altar what was best for me? Was using me for ten years? Don‚Äôt tell me what‚Äôs best for me, Lilia. Actually, it‚Äôs about time we have this heart-to-heart, isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

Lilia settled into the sofa, her face soft after the wave of verbal blows from Agatha. Agatha paused, chest heaving after her release.

‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt process it, Agatha.‚Äù Lilia began. ‚ÄúThere was so much going on with me and in my head. I had lost my ability to have children and had barely worked through that. I was so concerned and worried for you and your future. I knew you needed comfort, and at the same time, not from me. Yet, I mourned for you inwardly. As cold as I was to you, I felt it all rage within me. I had compartmentalized completely until I disassociated from everything and everyone. The two people I had become warred with one another, as was so frequent for me then.

‚ÄúMy first instinct was to hold you, Agatha. It always was. The night you told me you were in love with me? I wanted to console you, kiss you, hold you. All of the times that widened the gap between us? I never wanted to cause the divide to begin with, but I knew I wasn‚Äôt that person for you either, Agatha. I could have tried, but it would have ended with even less chance of any reconciliation.

‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt let you end your career, Agatha. Not when you sacrificed so much and worked so hard, look at all the good you‚Äôve done! We both know that neither of us would have been happy, and I never meant to use you.‚Äù

Agatha had expected a verbal fistfight. She didn‚Äôt expect Lilia to roll over this easily, and she certainly didn‚Äôt expect the venom to be drained from her own proverbial fangs.

She looked at Lilia, skeptically. This had to be a ruse of some type. A power play or manipulation. This was not the ruthless Don Calderu she had known. Yet, the realization of the truth also stung.

‚ÄúYour first instinctual reaction to me confessing my love for you was to console me?‚Äù Agatha shook her head, scoffing aloud. ‚ÄúI guess I never really understood our dynamic and you are one fucked up lady.‚Äù

The shock on Lilia‚Äôs face and the reversal of the conversation energized Agatha.

‚ÄúSo, what then? Why are you confessing everything now? Not even arguing or defending yourself? This is not like you.‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs arms were crossed tightly against her chest as she scrutinized Lilia‚Äôs every movement.

Lilia placed her tea on the table next to a scratch caused by a glass pipe long ago.

‚ÄúLorna was my friend too,‚Äù She said softly.

Agatha felt as though Lilia had screamed it. Again, she felt that age-old hurt of coming second to Lorna in Lilia‚Äôs eyes.

‚ÄúLorna told me for ten years to end it, that I was breaking you, little by little, yet I kept on. Kept convincing myself that you were an adult, kept trying to prove to her that I wasn‚Äôt wrong. I was technically correct, but I still should have ended it or never let it begin in the first place. You were my vice, and I became the worst of the three of us. You and Lorna stayed true to who you were. In the end, I left you, unrecognizable, and I lost my best friends and my family, in the process.‚Äù

Lilia‚Äôs face showed the worry of someone who had experienced great loss. Not the carefully constructed mask she had worn for so long.

‚ÄúI should have been there with you, Aggi...Agatha.‚Äù She stopped herself from using the nickname Lorna had given Agatha all those lifetimes ago. ‚ÄúI should have been there the whole time, the treatments, the appointments, at the end. Supporting you. I know you didn‚Äôt tell Wanda, she and Nat were one of the worst-kept secrets in Hollywood, and she wouldn‚Äôt have been able to keep Lorna‚Äôs secret. You did it all alone, and you shouldn‚Äôt have had to.‚Äù

Lilia had moved to be closer to Agatha and tentatively put a hand on Agatha‚Äôs knee. Agatha stared at Lilia‚Äôs hand, which she had known so well, that had brought her comfort and pleasure and was now offering comfort again. It was also offering a bridge back to something more familiar.

Agatha covered Lilia‚Äôs hand with hers.

‚ÄúI told Wanda everything tonight.‚Äù

She spoke around the lump in her throat. She had wanted to say other things, lash out at Lilia for not being there, and continue to shift the blame. She couldn‚Äôt do it anymore. Lilia‚Äôs honesty had disarmed her.

Manipulative bitch.

‚ÄúOh, Agatha, how did she take it?‚Äù Lilia asked. Her voice was that of the caring, loving Lilia from long ago. The Lilia that Agatha had so desperately needed since Lorna died.

‚ÄúNot well,‚Äù Agatha sniffed. ‚ÄúShe said that I also turned into two people, and she‚Äôs right. I betrayed the person I swore to protect,‚Äù Realization dawned on Agatha.

‚ÄúOh my gods, Lilia. I didn't screw her, but I sure as hell screwed her over‚Ä¶fuck,‚Äù Agatha was going over everything in her mind. She was two different people, and in some of the same ways, she had done to Wanda what Lilia had done to her. ‚ÄúI kept telling myself that it wasn‚Äôt my secret to tell. Lorna left a letter for her to open when she and Nat either got married or fifteen years later. I told myself I was protecting her.‚Äù Agatha looked at Lilia with tired, watery eyes.

‚ÄúAh yes, Lorna‚Äôs letters. I received an envelope of them in the mail the day after she died. I told myself I was trying to protect you and keep our friendship intact. As you can see, it did not work. As for Wanda, she isn‚Äôt that scared little girl anymore.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs exactly what she said, and then I covered a secret for Nat, so that‚Äôs going to make things worse, and there‚Äôs still Rio. She hates me, doesn‚Äôt she? I‚Äôve lost my sister, two of them really, and the love of my life because I don‚Äôt know how to tell the truth, and I wish I could blame you, but I can‚Äôt.‚Äù Agatha saw Lilia in a different light.

If Agatha keeping secrets from Wanda did major damage, wouldn‚Äôt she do whatever it took to stay in Wanda‚Äôs life? To repair things between Wanda and Nat? The things Nat had were for one specific purpose and didn‚Äôt count as drugs in her eyes. Nat had zero ill intentions and never suspected that Lorna would do what she did. She had come to Agatha as soon as she had discovered them missing, and Agatha had been the one to tell her not to tell Wanda. She would shoulder all the blame for it if she needed to. They had finally gotten engaged. They were finally getting married. Agatha wouldn‚Äôt let anything come in between that.

Isn‚Äôt that what Lorna and Lilia had always done?

Lilia would always be there for the boys, Agatha, Wanda, and Nat, if they ever needed her. And Agatha had been playing the Lilia card all year to get Rio, and occasionally Alice, out of work, hadn‚Äôt she?

Lilia had shed the Swords persona long ago.

Agatha had developed one of her own.

Now, Agatha was paying for it, and she had blamed Lilia for it this whole time.

‚ÄúI have to talk to Rio.‚Äù Agatha stood up abruptly and lost her balance. Lilia pulled her back down to sit before she fell over.

‚ÄúNo. I gave her the key to the cabin so I could keep an eye on her and know where to send you. She‚Äôs going to find out that Alice knew, and her heart will absolutely shatter. I also knew you would come clean with Wanda soon, and she would turn to Rio. Wanda will probably go with her if she catches her early enough. You and Nat can head up in a day or so. I‚Äôll give Alice time off when she needs it. You should probably make sure Jen and Vision are ready to be on kid duty.‚Äù Lilia laid it all out, the mastermind at work.

‚ÄúOur family has everything, doesn‚Äôt it? Drama, generational trauma, so many lesbians‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha was trying to make jokes like she always did, but her heart wasn‚Äôt in it. ‚ÄúAm I going to lose her?‚Äù

Lilia thought about it.

‚ÄúNot if you‚Äôre honest, and I do mean completely. If I can learn how to tell the truth, you can too.‚Äù Lilia leaned in and patted her shoulder.

Agatha smiled and gave a small laugh.

‚ÄúI know that‚Äôs a manipulation technique, Lils. I am, after all, the Luke to your Yoda.‚Äù

Lilia‚Äôs heart stopped at the old nickname as she stared at Agatha, who had looked away when she realized what she had said.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt make a big deal out of it, okay?‚Äù She scoffed, looking back at the other woman.

‚ÄúSays the woman who expressly put nicknames off limits.‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you blame me? I was still hurt, and I still am, but things have been somewhat repaired, and Rio has been integral to that. I cannot lose her, Lilia,‚Äù she reiterated. ‚ÄúI know that now. How long do I give it?‚Äù

Lilia laughed.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre looking at me now? For relationship advice?‚Äù

‚ÄúI mean, you‚Äôve done pretty well so far‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha smiled at the absurdity of it all.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôll know. Don‚Äôt make the same mistakes I did, okay, kid?‚Äù Lilia squeezed Agatha‚Äôs hand. Both of them had done entirely too much crying tonight.

Before Agatha could overthink it, she moved from the armchair to Lilia‚Äôs side, wrapping her arms around her, and cried on her shoulder.

They were sixteen and thirty again, the self-inflicted orphan and the gay aunt.

Agatha had memorized the letters Lorna had written to her. She hadn‚Äôt opened them all, as some had explicit instructions. But the one she had opened on her fifty-first birthday nearly a year ago when she turned the same age Lorna had been when she had died was explicit:

Aggie,

I know you‚Äôre freaking out this year because it‚Äôs the age I died at. If you have yet¬† to forgive Lilia, it‚Äôs time. You know you need her.

Make your family complete again, Agatha.

Even dead, I know you.

I love you, Sweetie,

Lorna

P.S. I really hope you‚Äôve found love by now. You‚Äôre not broken, just bent.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Wanda hadn‚Äôt slept well. How could she? She knew Nat had left, either to the Clubhouse, Agatha‚Äôs, The Beachhouse, hell, maybe even Tahoe. At that moment, she didn‚Äôt care that much. She had never been this upset with Natasha. To sit on a secret for thirteen years, and one this big? How dare she! Nat had never kept something like this from her, and she certainly had never told anything more than a white lie to Wanda. Something like ‚Äòof course it tastes fine burnt, sunshine.‚Äô Wanda couldn‚Äôt imagine staying there right now, and she knew one person she could talk to about all of this.

Rio.

Rio had also been hurt, albeit much worse, by Agatha. Wanda still didn‚Äôt know how much Alice knew and preemptively hurt for Rio in that regard. She needed to talk to Rio, and going to her apartment sounded like a good idea.

Me:

Agatha lied to me too.

So did Nat.

I can‚Äôt stay here.

Can I come over?

Wanda didn‚Äôt know why she was nervous while she waited for a response.

Rio:

I talked to Lilia last night.

I assume that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre

referring to.

Lilia gave me the keys to a cabin

in the mountains. Do you want

to come?

We can be miserable together?



Rio thought it would be nice to have another person with her, someone to talk everything out with. Someone Agatha had also betrayed. She couldn‚Äôt imagine how Wanda felt. Probably the same way she was going to feel once she talked to Alice and confirmed her suspicions.

Me:

I haven‚Äôt been there in

quite some time.

I‚Äôll take you up on that.

Yes. Meet at your place at ten

this morning?

Wanda glanced at the clock. It was seven, and they had plenty of time.



Rio nodded silently to herself.

Rio:

Sounds great.

See you then.

I‚Äôll bring the wine.

Wanda quickly sent Vision a message asking if he could take the boys for a few days, and he agreed.

Instead of leaving a note for Nicky on Alice‚Äôs door, Rio texted him about Raven, and he was excited, although a little confused about why he needed to take care of Raven. He would pick her up later that day, probably after Rio and Wanda left.

Rio hugged Wanda when she arrived before loading her luggage into the car.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt exactly pack lightly, Maximoff,‚Äù she joked as Wanda smiled.

‚ÄúHave you talked to Alice?‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs mouth was a thin line as she shook her head.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid to. What if she did know?‚Äù

Wanda put a hand on her friend‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúThen we face it together, and I‚Äôm here to get you through it. Let‚Äôs go cry, drink, and potentially cause trouble in the mountains.‚Äù

Rio was grateful for the other woman in the car. Already her heart felt lighter. Even in what felt like her darkest moments of this year, she had never been alone. The hurt was still there, but the love that surrounded her, here, and she knew, in Agatha‚Äôs heart too, comforted her nonetheless.




Chapter End Notes

Thank you all so very much! I love your comments and replying to them! I also love seeing y'all on Thread, Tumblr, and Bluesky!

Two more chapters maybe?

In My Defense, I Have None

Chapter Summary

Wanda and Rio head up to the mountains for some much-needed bonding time.

Meanwhile, all of the conversations are had back in LA, and then up in the mountains. A lot happens in a short amount of time.

Chapter Notes

Thank you so much for your patience and for being so amazing! This is an extremely long chapter.
I apologize for nothing. Hydrate. It's broken up for convenience, like always.

Trigger warnings: We know me. A roller coaster of emotions with a side of darkness. Touches on addiction, and extremely illegal activities, we get into childhood backgrounds a bit more and they aren't pretty.

Also, welcome to the musical episode of Buffy - I went on some side quests apparently.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It was Wanda‚Äôs turn to drive as they talked about the revelations of the past eighteen hours and how they were feeling about everything.

‚ÄúI feel so stupid, believing I was exempt from Agatha‚Äôs betrayal,‚Äù Wanda began. ‚ÄúI mean, small lies and omissions, sure. Not big things like this, though. Then Nat kept something from me on top of all of it? Nat has NEVER lied to me apart from things like ‚Äòno sunshine, I‚Äôm not getting you anything for your birthday‚Äô, or ‚Äòno honey, I didn‚Äôt eat the last of the ice cream, it was Tommy‚Äô. Tommy doesn‚Äôt even like pistachio ricotta cheesecake ice cream!‚Äù

Wanda was waving wildly with one hand and barely keeping her other on the steering wheel as they headed north.

‚ÄúWell, welcome to this side of your sister. Sorry, it‚Äôs your first time.‚Äù Rio deadpanned.

She felt terrible that Wanda was having to experience it, yet in the short time she had known Agatha, and the even shorter time she had been with her, this seemed to be a reoccurring event, and she hated it. Yes, Rio had kept things from Agatha, but she had made a concerted effort not to do that any longer after the Lou fiasco.

Yes, Rio had slept with a sociopathic jewel thief, thought for a millisecond she was still in love with her, and briefly considered going back before she realized the manipulation techniques‚Äô effects. However, she had made it very clear to both Agatha and Lou that she no longer wanted anything to do with Lou Falco. She very much wanted to see her dead, and Lilia was right when she said Norma had raised her better than that.

Then there was Agatha. Agatha had slept with Rio‚Äôs boss for a whole decade. Rio didn‚Äôt know her back then, but it still felt strange, especially knowing that Lilia had acted as a puppet master to some extent. To her, it was very much like a sapphic Lifetime movie. She still needed to process and maybe even talk to Lilia more. She especially wanted to hear stories of a young Agatha. If they ever got to a comfortable sharing point, that is.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry she‚Äôs been doing it to you this whole time,‚Äù Wanda was saying as she looked between the road and Rio. ‚ÄúHow long are you going to hold it against her?‚Äù

Rio looked at Wanda. ‚ÄúHow long are you?‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Nicky had Agatha‚Äôs key to Rio‚Äôs apartment and was opening the door to get Raven as Alice and Jen were leaving theirs. They had another week until they moved onto the compound and were in full-on packing mode. Alice was confused upon seeing Nicky, as he usually didn‚Äôt come over.

‚ÄúHey, what are you doing over here?‚Äù She asked with a friendly smile.

‚ÄúHi Alice, hi Jen.‚Äù Nicky smiled back. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm keeping Raven this week. Rio‚Äôs going out of town, I think, though I‚Äôm not sure why.‚Äù

Confusion crossed his face as he hoped these two women would give him answers, though they seemed just as confused as he was. The newlyweds looked at each other, an unasked question passing between them.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know she was going anywhere,‚Äù Alice answered, unsure why Rio hadn‚Äôt asked her to keep the centuries-old feline.

‚ÄúAgatha and Wanda have to work this week, and you guys return to school. I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on.‚Äù Jen added.

Nicky raised his eyebrows in growing concern. ‚ÄúBilly and Tommy are with Uncle Vision this week. Aunt Wanda went with Rio.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat about your mom and Aunt Nat?‚Äù Jen asked, trying to decipher just how difficult her job was about to become.

Nicky shook his head. ‚ÄúAunt Nat left the compound last night. Billy and Tommy think their moms got into an argument, and then mom didn‚Äôt come home until this morning. I think Mom did something stupid again, but my aunts never argue, so it must be really bad, and clearly, they have forgotten their communication techniques.‚Äù

Nicky bent down to pick up Raven, who had come into the hall to investigate and rubbed her in between the ears.

‚ÄúRio does stupid things too, Nicky,‚Äù Alice said in defense of Agatha.

Nicky put Raven‚Äôs head to his chest and tried to cover both of her ears. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt talk about her mother like that in front of her,‚Äù he gasped.

Jen tried to hide her smile. For a kid who wanted nothing to do with acting, he had his mother‚Äôs natural talent.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to call Rio and find out what‚Äôs going on. You take good care of the cat-god there.‚Äù

Alice turned on her heel and went back into the apartment, already calling Rio. Jen shook her head.

‚ÄúI have a feeling my blood pressure is going to be very high this week.‚Äù

She waved to Nicky and followed her wife back inside. Nicky looked down at Raven.

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs get your stuff packed up, and then you can tell me everything you goddess, you,‚Äù he scratched between her ears as he walked into the house, Raven meowing the whole time.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Alice knew something was horribly wrong. Rio hadn‚Äôt stayed late at the reception yesterday, she hadn‚Äôt even given Alice a goodbye hug or an ‚ÄòI love you‚Äô‚Äîsomething they always did. Yes, Alice and Jen were celebrating their marriage, but Alice would always make time for Rio, no matter what.

She thought Rio felt the same way.

That old familiar pang of jealousy slowly crept up on Alice, and she had to bat it away mentally. It was something she had dealt with after her mother had died and the real reason she couldn‚Äôt move out to Los Angeles immediately. She had to work through a lot in therapy before she could be within striking distance of Agatha.

Now, as she waited for Rio to pick up, she was reminded that the feeling was reappearing, and once again, Agatha Harkness was responsible. It went to voicemail, and Alice hung up, not leaving one. She looked up at Jen, worried. ‚ÄúMaybe there‚Äôs no service where they‚Äôre at right now?‚Äù Alice looked to Jen for reassurance.

‚ÄúOf course, love, I‚Äôm sure everything is fine.‚Äù

Jen took Alice into her arms and held her against her. She didn‚Äôt know what was going on, but her senses told her nothing good. The only person who ever saw this soft side of Jen was Alice, and she would deny she even had one until the day she died.

Wanda looked at Rio as Rio stared at her phone.

‚ÄúYou have to call her back. You know she‚Äôs going to worry, and she doesn‚Äôt even know what‚Äôs going on. Put it on the Bluetooth.‚Äù The redhead instructed.

Rio bit the inside of her bottom lip before replying.

‚ÄúWhat if I‚Äôm right? What if she did know?‚Äù

‚ÄúThen you have to talk through it, Rio. You can‚Äôt just let it fester.‚Äù

Wanda spoke from recent experience. Rio sighed and called back.



Alice jumped as her phone rang, and she removed herself from her wife‚Äôs arms, answering and putting the call on speaker. She heard the undeniable sounds that signaled car Bluetooth. Wanda was listening.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Alice answered, not sure what she should ask first.



Rio looked nervously at Wanda. ‚ÄúHey, sorry, you popped up as a missed call. I guess we were going through a dead spot.‚Äù It was all she could say.



Alice looked at Jen, clearly confused. This was not like Rio. Alice decided to get straight to the point and sat down, Jen taking her place by her side, running her hand through Alice‚Äôs hair, calming her.

‚ÄúWe saw Nicky getting Raven. He said you and Wanda are headed up to the mountains. What‚Äôs going on, Ri?‚Äù Alice asked, her voice shaky.



Rio inhaled deeply through her nose and exhaled through her mouth.

‚ÄúWanda and I are heading to a cabin in the mountains so we can do some thinking,‚Äù She said slowly, not sure how much she should say.

Alice was even more confused. ‚ÄúWhat happened?‚Äù

‚ÄúLast night at the reception, I heard a conversation someone was having and started looking for them. I found out who Agatha‚Äôs ex is, and it‚Äôs Lilia.‚Äù Rio waited for Alice‚Äôs reaction and reply. Just how much had Alice actually known?

Alice‚Äôs and Jen‚Äôs eyes went wide as they looked at each other. They had their suspicions, but to have it confirmed was something different entirely.

‚ÄúLilia!? Jesus! Well, that at least makes sense now that I think about it. Have you talked to Agatha? Is that why you two are headed to the mountains?‚Äù

Alice was starting to get a clearer picture, and she needed to know just how much Rio knew.
