‚ÄúWanda did. I talked to Lilia. Alice, I need you to answer me honestly. Me. The person that may have withheld some things from you, but never lied. You always told me that Lorna had relapsed and overdosed. What really happened?‚Äù

Rio was blinking back tears as Wanda reached over and put a hand on her knee. They would be at the cabin soon and could debrief then.

Jen moved closer to Alice and wrapped an arm around her. She knew that Alice had known quite a bit about Lorna. She also knew that Alice had grown close with Lilia over the past ten years and had flown under the radar. It‚Äôs why they had their suspicions that something had happened between Agatha and Lilia. Alice had shown Jen the letter that Lorna had left her. Alice confided in Jen in a way that she couldn‚Äôt in Rio because Jen had signed the same NDAs, and Alice, the law-abiding citizen that she was, wouldn‚Äôt break that NDA. While Alice could have told Rio about Lorna, she didn‚Äôt want Rio to worry, especially with Alice working at SHIELD.

Now, it was coming back to bite her.

Just as Lilia had warned Alice.

Alice‚Äôs heart squeezed as a tear slid down her cheek.

‚ÄúIt sounds like you already know.‚Äù

Rio choked back a sob. ‚ÄúHow long have you been keeping it from me?‚Äù



Alice leaned into Jen, needing the support. ‚ÄúMom left me a letter and that envelope we kept in your safe. Agatha gave it to me at the funeral, along with Lilia‚Äôs information. I never did open the larger envelope, but I read the letter and called Agatha a few days after the funeral and talked to her. Mom put everything in that letter.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou knew for thirteen, no, fourteen, years, and never told me. Three of those years, you were still in San Francisco, and we taught at the same school Alice. I‚Äôm not having the rest of this conversation over the phone. It‚Äôs not fair to either of us. I love you, but we are not okay.‚Äù

Rio waited before she hung up. They had agreed a long time ago to never hang up on each other, especially when upset.

‚ÄúI love you too, and that‚Äôs fair. I‚Äôll be up there in a few days. Be careful.‚Äù With that, they hung up, and Alice slumped into Jen.

‚ÄúWhat did I do?‚Äù Alice whispered.

Jen smoothed her hair and rubbed her back.

‚ÄúWhat you thought was best, and you stuck to the law, no matter how many times Lilia told you to tell Rio everything anyway vaguely.‚Äù

Alice sat up to look at her wife.

‚ÄúWhat do I do now?‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat you always do. Seek Lilia‚Äôs guidance and then head up to face the music while I face whatever fresh hell is about to break out here.‚Äù

Jen knew that nothing good was about to come from whatever part Nat had played and just where Rio‚Äôs mind had gone when she found out about Lilia.

‚ÄúHow are you feeling?‚Äù Wanda asked Rio after the connection ended.

Rio was looking out of the windshield at the scenery, trying to process it.

‚ÄúFourteen years,‚Äù it was all she could say.

‚ÄúI know how you feel,‚Äù Wanda said in solidarity.

‚ÄúWe should go snowboarding while we‚Äôre up here, or snowmobiling, definitely to a bar.‚Äù Rio was compartmentalizing but also trying to find something to distract both of them.

‚ÄúWe have no security detail, recognizable faces, and it‚Äôs a peak time of year.‚Äù Wanda grinned mischievously.

‚ÄúLook up stuff for us to do. We‚Äôre going to have fun, and for once, I‚Äôll be the one causing Jen‚Äôs blood pressure to rise.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio set her green suitcase on the floor of what Lilia had called a cabin. Rio was expecting a log cabin with a fireplace, maybe two bedrooms, and a bathroom. This was more like a mountain retreat, complete with a hot tub and a game room.

‚ÄúWow, you guys call this a cabin?‚Äù Rio let out a low whistle.

She‚Äôd been a part of this bitch pack for seven months now and she still hadn‚Äôt gotten used to the magnitude of it all. Wanda smiled as she searched for something.

‚ÄúIt has wooden features, doesn‚Äôt it?‚Äù

She took a picture frame off the wall and opened a panel behind it, revealing a switchboard of some kind, and flipped several off. Rio‚Äôs eyes followed the woman as she closed the panel, replaced the picture, and continued on her search.

‚ÄúWhat are you doing?‚Äù Rio finally asked as she watched Wanda find a screwdriver and head upstairs.

‚ÄúDisabling the inside cameras. Of course, there aren‚Äôt any in private areas, and I‚Äôll keep the outside ones enabled, but the inside ones go to an app on Lilia‚Äôs phone. We don‚Äôt need anyone to know what we‚Äôre up to. That‚Äôs exactly why she sent you, us, here. So she could keep her eyes and ears on us both. She forgets who raised me. I WIN LILIA!‚Äù

Wanda finished before heading up the stairs.

‚ÄúOh, go claim a room. Lilia has maintained this place and recently renovated it, but knowing her, the room I usually stayed in is still mine, and Agatha‚Äôs is still hers, up here, hall on the right, room on the left.‚Äù

Rio picked her suitcase back up and headed up the stairs behind Wanda. She might as well stay in Agatha‚Äôs room. She knew what was going to happen. She and Wanda would talk things through with each other, Agatha and Nat, maybe even Alice, would come up, and everyone would talk, and she would fall back into Agatha‚Äôs arms. That was the habit they were building, wasn‚Äôt it?

Agatha hadn‚Äôt done anything other than withholding information, which Rio had admittedly also done. It was just that Agatha kept doing it, and this was important for Rio to know. Especially since it affected her relationship with her best friend. Not to mention there were a lot of holes to fill in with the past now. She remembered every detail of those run-ins with Agatha all those years ago and the following mornings. What was the real story as to why she was there?

They could talk through that later. As for now, she walked into the room that Wanda had labeled as Agatha‚Äôs, and Rio agreed. It had been updated, but Lilia had kept the touches of Agatha here. Not as a shrine, but as a reminder of the times spent here, the times Rio assumed Agatha had spent here with Lorna trying to detox. Wanda had talked about their trips here, all those years ago. Of a time Agatha had broken her leg trying to show off for a hot ski instructor, Lorna bringing back a souvenir. The souvenir was a 6‚Äô3 blonde man who was visiting from Texas, and they dated for four months.

Rio looked around the room with its purple accents. A stuffed moose that looked old enough to have chronic back pain sat in the middle of the bed on the pillows. There was a picture on the nightstand of an extremely young Agatha - not more than twenty, with Lorna and Lilia on either side of her, leaning against a pool table. Agatha had a devilish smirk on her face as if she knew she had each woman wrapped around her little finger. Lorna had an arm wrapped around Agatha, with Lilia‚Äôs hand in hers. The way these women held themselves was as if they knew that their mere presence could cast a spell on someone, and they would immediately be at their service.

Looking around the room, Rio could see how much hope Lilia had that everything would eventually be reconciled, whether Rio was in the picture or not. She ran a hand through her hair and huffed. Rio knew how important found and chosen family was and how much she would put into reconciling with Alice, no matter how betrayed she felt at the moment.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a lot to take in, and the feelings are all over the place. I get it.‚Äù Wanda was leaning against the door frame. ‚ÄúSo, snowmobiles? Bars? Tattoos? What reckless decisions should we make?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes.‚Äù Rio turned to her suitcase. ‚ÄúLet me find something more weather-appropriate. Have you told Nat where you are?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo. She can track me if she‚Äôs so concerned,‚Äù Wanda said curtly as she pushed off the doorframe and went back to her room to change.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not wearing your necklace!‚Äù Rio called after her.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs a big girl, she can figure it out,‚Äù Wanda called back.

It was late afternoon when they arrived at the snowmobile rental place. Wanda looked over at Rio.

‚ÄúHave you ever driven one of these?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, but Taylor and Harry did it. How hard can it be?‚Äù

‚ÄúThey also got into an accident and almost died.‚Äù

Wanda hadn‚Äôt done this in years, and the last time she had, she very narrowly missed a tree.

‚ÄúWell, let‚Äôs not do that.‚Äù Rio looked at her as if it was a simple task.

‚ÄúWell, if we die, Jen can‚Äôt be mad, right?‚Äù

‚ÄúExactly,‚Äù Rio confirmed with a nod.

While they had attempted to disguise themselves, they had done so poorly as people near them were starting to whisper and take pictures. Wanda looked delighted. ‚ÄúYou wanted this to happen, didn‚Äôt you?‚Äù Rio whispered out of the side of her mouth.

Wanda nodded enthusiastically as they signed papers and took the keys from a starstruck kid who was not so subtly taking pictures.

They walked outside to find their vehicles and hopefully not end up wrapped around a tree. Rio noticed that her notifications for various apps were already increasing by the second.

‚ÄúHey, Red, looks like we‚Äôve been sighted together.‚Äù Rio zipped her phone into her snow pants and climbed on the black snowmobile.

Wanda was tucking her hair into her helmet.

‚ÄúIs that so? What else are the citizens of the internet saying?‚Äù

Rio put on her own helmet and started the snowmobile engine.

‚ÄúThat we were standing very closely together,‚Äù Rio yelled over the noise of the engines as she started to pull slowly out of the lot.

‚ÄúWhat a scandal!‚Äù Wanda yelled as she followed her. They both picked up speed as they hit the open snow.



‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Much earlier that morning

Nat couldn‚Äôt sleep and, knowing Agatha had gone straight to Lilia‚Äôs, decided to join both of them. Nat had done what she could to keep Lilia in her life, even if at the edges. Lilia and Lorna had done so much for her all of those years ago.

When Wanda met Vision and subsequently fell in love, Nat stayed strong for Wanda but died on the inside. She went straight to the two people who had more experience with relationships. Lorna changed relationships more than some people changed their sheets, and Lilia was polyamorous before there was even a mainstream term for it Nat knew making Vision disappear, while the easiest solution was not the best solution. The two wise aunts of her youth, however, helped both of them navigate the rocky terrain of their relationship with Wanda and each other. It hadn‚Äôt been easy, but Nat and Vision made it work, and all three of them were stronger for it.

Wanda never knew just how integral Lorna and Lilia had been to her happiness or just how close she had been to losing both Nat and Vision. However, that‚Äôs a story for another time.

Nat smiled wryly at the memories and advice from the older women, two of three members of the original coven, as she walked up the few steps to Lilia‚Äôs and used the key she had made years ago to let herself in. When Lorna died, Nat had taken her protection charge from Lorna to include Lilia, and she unofficially watched out for her, too. Nat suspected Lilia knew and never said anything.

Lilia looked up from where she and Agatha were talking and did a once-over of the newcomer, completely unfazed by her unlocking the door.

‚ÄúYou look like shit, kid,‚Äù Lilia said as she finished her assessment and Agatha agreed.

‚ÄúNeither of you looks any better,‚Äù Nat retorted, walking to the kitchen and pouring herself a glass of water. After a moment of consideration, she also opened the freezer and took out a bottle of vodka. She walked back into the living room and sat next to Lilia on the couch. Agatha had moved back to the chair, legs thrown over one of the arms. Nat raised the bottle to Lilia.

‚ÄúYou still keep the emergency vodka, I see.‚Äù

‚ÄúI never know when you‚Äôll need it.‚Äù She smiled warmly and patted Nat on the leg. ‚ÄúWhat happened?‚Äù

Nat shot Agatha a dirty look.

‚ÄúSomeone told me to keep a secret from Wanda of all people for years, and it blew up in my face tonight. Spectacularly,‚Äù Nat‚Äôs bottom lip began to quiver. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs so upset with me, and I know she‚Äôs not mad about what happened. She‚Äôs mad that I never told her and that I should have. We‚Äôve never fought like that.‚Äù

Nat leaned into Lilia and sobbed in a way that Agatha wasn‚Äôt sure she had ever seen.

Nat was the most steadfast and strongest of them all. Yes, she had shed a few tears here and there, she had cried at Lorna‚Äôs funeral, cried tears of joy in delivery rooms, and cried at Jen and Alice‚Äôs wedding. Agatha had seen Nat cry. She had never seen Nat sob and openly weep like this. She wasn‚Äôt entirely sure what was happening as she watched Lilia soothe Nat. This was not the sadness associated with hurting someone. There was something else there, something Agatha hadn‚Äôt seen in Nat. It was a fear and sorrow combined. But, what was different this time?

Then, Agatha understood that in the past, Nat had cried over what she could not have. Now, she cried at ruining what she finally had, and it was all Agatha‚Äôs fault.

March 2, 2011, Los Angeles

Three Days After Lorna‚Äôs Death

Agatha had been packing to leave for San Francisco the next day. She had stopped and sat on the edge of her bed to catch her breath. She felt like she was drowning again, and she couldn‚Äôt get enough air into her lungs. She clutched the locket in her hand as she felt the familiar sting at the back of her eyes, though she knew the tears wouldn‚Äôt come right now. She couldn‚Äôt remember the last time she had anything to drink, and she knew she was dehydrated.

That‚Äôs when she heard the door downstairs fly open, and Nat‚Äôs voice quickly followed it, ‚ÄúAGATHA! I need you! AGATHA! Something‚Äôs not right!‚Äù Natasha‚Äôs voice was full of alarm and uncertainty, and Nat was never either of those things.

Agatha didn‚Äôt remember running down the stairs, too afraid something happened to Wanda, and knowing that her heart wouldn‚Äôt be able to handle it.

‚ÄúNat? Is it Wanda? What happened? Is she okay?‚Äù Agatha knew her eyes were swollen and red and that she was an absolute mess as she gripped Nat‚Äôs shoulders. She was not yet thirty-eight and had just lost the closest thing to a mother she had. Not everyone was given a replacement mother, and she had been, only to lose her entirely too soon.

Nat looked like she had seen a ghost, and Agatha quickly pushed her pain and grief aside for a few moments as she saw the fear, worry, and confusion in the younger woman‚Äôs eyes.

‚ÄúNatasha, what happened?‚Äù Agatha asked again.

‚ÄúA few days ago, Lorna asked me about certain,‚Äù Nat tilted her head back and forth as if looking for a way to phrase it, ‚Äú‚Äòmedications,‚Äô and I thought she was researching a role or something.‚Äù

Nat was staring into Agatha‚Äôs very being, willing her to understand, not wanting to say the words. Agatha had seen the reports. She knew exactly what had happened. She had read that first letter. Lorna didn‚Äôt say where she had gotten her means to an end, just that she had. Everything clicked, and she knew.

Nat removed one of Agatha‚Äôs hands from her shoulder and thrust a piece of paper into it. Agatha read Lorna‚Äôs words, and her head dropped.

‚ÄúDamnit Lorna, why?‚Äù

She whispered before looking back at Nat, and dropping the other hand, giving her the note back.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt tell you why; she just knew what she was doing,‚Äù Agatha explained while Nat nodded, accepting it. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt tell Wanda.‚Äù

‚ÄúI tell Wanda everything. There are no secrets between us, Agatha.‚Äù

‚ÄúLorna didn‚Äôt want anyone to know for very specific reasons, and I have to honor that. Please?‚Äù It was more of a plea than anything.

Nat was struggling internally. How was she supposed to keep this from the woman she loved more than anything? Yes, Agatha had a sworn loyalty to Lorna, and they both knew that Wanda was terrible at keeping secrets. It was a miracle their‚Ä¶situation hadn‚Äôt been splashed everywhere by now. She assumed that was Agatha‚Äôs doing. Nat gave a resigned sigh.

‚ÄúWhat happens when she eventually finds out, Agatha? What then?‚Äù

‚ÄúI deal with it then. Trust me, Nat, it will be fine.‚Äù

Agatha tried to smile, but she didn‚Äôt have it in her right now. She knew what would happen. She would take every ounce of blame for Nat. She would never come in between two of her favorite people. She was still living for the hope of Wanda and Nat getting their happily ever after. She had already come in between one extremely strong friendship. She wouldn‚Äôt come in between a relationship. Nat still looked conflicted as Agatha wrapped her arms around her.

‚ÄúI love you both so much, and I will do anything to protect both of you. This is for your protection too, you know. I will do whatever I need to do if she finds out, okay? I am so sorry you were dragged into this, and I know if Lorna had another option, she never would have involved you.‚Äù

Agatha kissed her on the top of the head and leaned back to look at her, using the pad of her thumb to wipe the one lone tear from Nat‚Äôs cheek.

‚ÄúCareful, Romanov, someone will think you‚Äôve gone soft,‚Äù Agatha teased.

‚ÄúShut up,‚Äù Nat mumbled. ‚ÄúI know Lorna must have had her reasons. I won‚Äôt say anything, but if and when she finds out, I trust you to fix it, Agatha,‚Äù Nat‚Äôs blue-green eyes were stormy blue, severe, and serious. Nat looked like the eighteen-year-old assassin Agatha first knew, not the twenty-seven-year-old woman who stood before her.

‚ÄúI promise, kid. Now, go pack and provide the type of comfort only you can provide, Wanda. Vision has all the boys at the clubhouse right now, and she needs her North Star.‚Äù

Nat smiled at the nickname Wanda had given her years ago. ‚ÄúHow do you know about that?‚Äù

‚ÄúWanda can‚Äôt keep a secret.‚Äù



‚ÄúYou promised me, Agatha,‚Äù Nat said between sobs as she glared at Agatha.

Agatha was staring at her blankly.

‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù She blinked, coming out of her memories.

‚ÄúYou promised you‚Äôd fix it,‚Äù Nat repeated.

Agatha looked at her with warmth and false confidence. Am I trying to convince Nat or myself of this?

‚ÄúAnd I will, once she‚Äôs ready to talk to us, once they‚Äôre both ready. You know as well as I do that they both need time.‚Äù

Lilia chuckled, ‚ÄúRight, and who told you to wait before going to talk to Rio?‚Äù

‚ÄúCan it, Calderu.‚Äù

Agatha rolled her eyes. She turned back to Natasha, who seemed to be slowing a bit with her sobs. Agatha‚Äôs first reaction had been to go to her, but it seemed as though Natasha had needed Lilia more. Agatha thought that she had just removed Lilia from her life, and Lorna‚Äôs by extension. However, Lilia had stayed away from all of them. She was slowly learning that they all retained relationships with Lilia but not in the same capacity and intensity. Nat had been right to say that it wasn‚Äôt Agatha‚Äôs decision. She remembered back to when Wanda first met Vision and how Nat had been a bit guarded when Wanda and Vision had first started dating. Nat had spent a lot of time doing extra weapons training those first few weeks.

Agatha looked at Lilia. Nat was now quieter, the vodka had calmed her and brought her back to the intense Slavic introspective state. She drank water instead of vodka as she leaned against Lilia.

‚ÄúIt was you, and I‚Äôm sure Lorna,‚Äù Agatha pointed a finger in Lilia‚Äôs direction accusingly. ‚ÄúWhen Wanda and Vision started dating, worlds began to collide. Nat went to the two of you. You two are the reason they get along so well. Nat didn‚Äôt just roll over, she was pissed and ready to put up a fight. Vision is a golden retriever, she‚Äôs a black cat, and you two somehow got them to work it all out.‚Äù Agatha realized that she had two Ms. Miyagi‚Äôs and she was the grasshopper.

Nat looked at her. ‚ÄúSome of the best advice either of us got.‚Äù She looked back at Lilia. ‚ÄúSounds like you both should have taken your own advice.‚Äù

Lilia sighed. ‚ÄúSometimes the burden of being wise is knowing what advice to give to others and not knowing what advice to keep for yourself.‚Äù

Nat gave a short laugh and looked back at Agatha. ‚ÄúYou must have learned that from them, too.‚Äù She then looked between both of them. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre repairing things. You two need each other.‚Äù

Agatha crossed her arms over her chest like a petulant teen. ‚ÄúI do not need anyone,‚Äù She lied.

‚ÄúOh, shut up,‚Äù Lilia and Nat said in unison.

Lilia regarded Nat carefully as if to make sure she wasn‚Äôt at risk of breaking apart again. ‚ÄúAre you okay? I haven‚Äôt seen you like that since you came to us worried you would lose Wanda.‚Äù

Nat let out a shaky breath. ‚ÄúI think so? As long as I don‚Äôt lose her. It takes a lot to break me, but hurting or losing her? Russian assassin training didn‚Äôt prepare for that.‚Äù

Lilia gave her a look of warmth and put a comforting hand on her knee.

‚ÄúThere are some things in life that we cannot prepare or train for,‚Äù Lilia turned and looked at Agatha as well.

Agatha felt that in her soul.

‚ÄúWell damn, we‚Äôre just all getting insight tonight, aren‚Äôt we?‚Äù Agatha ran her hand through her tangled mess of hair. ‚ÄúSo do we wait for Alice to join team ‚Äòwin Rio and Wanda back‚Äô or go up ourselves?‚Äù

Nat slumped back onto the couch. ‚ÄúShe knew, didn‚Äôt she?‚Äù

Agatha and Lilia both nodded. ‚ÄúAlice has been keeping a lot of cards close to her chest, right Lils?‚Äù Agatha shot her a look.

‚ÄúI told her to tell Rio everything, law be damned,‚Äù Lilia replied.

‚ÄúOh fuck. She might be in deeper shit than we are,‚Äù Nat took a swig of emergency vodka out of solidarity for Alice.

‚ÄúEither way, the next few days are going to be interesting for you three,‚Äù Lilia gestured.

‚ÄúUs? You‚Äôre not getting out of this unscathed.‚Äù Agatha said, sitting up.

‚ÄúNo, but I‚Äôve been preparing for this and wasn‚Äôt blindsided.‚Äù

‚ÄúI need to get better at telling the truth,‚Äù Agatha admitted, surprising even herself.

‚ÄúNo shit, can we get a recording of that?‚Äù Nat pulled out her phone.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a hard lesson to learn,‚Äù Lilia spoke from experience.

Agatha had always learned her lessons the hard way.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha had returned to the compound around nine Sunday morning. She knew she had to wait before rushing up to the Mammoth Lakes area where Lilia‚Äôs cabin was, roughly three hours south of the Tahoe cabin. She would shower, pack preemptively, and bide her time. Nat had stayed back at Lilia‚Äôs for a bit to let the vodka wear off before driving, and they all agreed it was best to wait until Wanda left before she went back to the house. Vision had texted Nat to ask what was up since he was keeping the twins, and she told him everything. Agatha had always been amazed at how quickly they had formed a bond all those years ago, and it really didn‚Äôt surprise her that Lilia and Lorna had a hand in that.

They had played puppetmaster more than she knew.

Agatha showered and thought of Rio. Lilia had told her about the conversation, so she knew that it was the omissions and the lies that bothered Rio the most. Not to mention the who of it all. Agatha had slept with the majority of the women at SHIELD, which didn‚Äôt bother Rio, but Rio had developed a working friendship with Lilia, more than that, Rio trusted Lilia. Lilia had given Rio advice, pushed them together, and had a hand in bringing her out here.

Then there was just Lilia, as part of Agatha. Lilia wasn‚Äôt just another notch in the mountain of invisible lipstick cases either. Lilia was the only other relationship that Agatha had ever been in, as contorted as it was. Rio also hadn‚Äôt known just how big of a part Lorna and Lilia had played in Agatha‚Äôs past, it wasn‚Äôt something they talked about.

‚ÄúMaybe it‚Äôs time to write a book about the first part of my life,‚Äù she said to the empty bathroom as she turned the water off and stepped out of the shower to dry off and put on comfortable clothes. She planned on taking a nap and texting Rio later. She wanted to give her some space right now and let her spend time with Wanda.

The contrast of where she was yesterday evening and now stood out to her. Yesterday, they were celebrating Alice and Jen, and she was picturing her future with Rio. Now, she was preparing to fight for that future. She would be fifty-two soon, and she was done letting the trauma of the past hold her back. She and Rio needed to communicate and, for the love of all things holy and unholy, be honest with each other. Discuss what they wanted, talk through where they stood, and discuss a way forward.

Agatha had to stop, separate her personas and truths, merging them into one person, for Rio at least. She would always put on a different mask for public consumption, but for her loved ones, she had to remove this mask she had been wearing. She had to let down the walls she had constructed.

She also had to fix things with Wanda, she and Lilia were mending their relationship, and she had to speak with Alice before she spoke with Rio.

Jen was going to be working overtime this week when Agatha and Wanda weren‚Äôt where they were supposed to be.

Agatha groaned as she rolled over to try to take a nap.



Something warm was on Agatha‚Äôs chest. Something warm and loud. She cracked her eyes open and looked down to see two green eyes staring at her.

‚ÄúRaven? How did you get here?‚Äù She asked, fully expecting a spoken response. Instead, the cat just looked at her, as if expecting the human to read her mind.

Then, memories of the last twenty-four hours rushed back. She remembered that Rio had headed north with Wanda and suspected that Alice had been lying to her for over a decade. This would make sense as to why Raven would be here since Rio fully trusted Nicky to take care of the person that Rio might love most in this world. Her cat.

‚ÄúNicky has you for a few days, doesn‚Äôt he? Well, welcome back, Your Highness,‚Äù Agatha said as she gently lifted Raven off of her chest and placed her on a pillow. Raven rewarded her with a low growl. ‚ÄúWell, I love you too.‚Äù Agatha got up and went to find Nicky to see what he knew.

It was mid-afternoon, and she found him downstairs sitting on one of the couches, scrolling on his phone. He raised his head when he heard her come down the stairs.

‚ÄúThere you are, Mom. Come sit down, we need to talk.‚Äù His voice was serious, and so was his facial expression.

She was slightly taken aback as she had a seat and looked at her son.

‚ÄúGeeze Dad, what did I do? I promise it was Johnny who caused me to stay out past curfew!‚Äù She played innocent, trying to make him laugh.

It didn‚Äôt work.

‚ÄúCut the theatrics, Mom, this is serious. Tommy and Billy are at Uncle Vision‚Äôs house. Aunt Nat didn‚Äôt get home until after Aunt Wanda left. Rio and Aunt Wanda disappeared to the mountains, and they didn‚Äôt go to the cabin in Tahoe. Alice didn‚Äôt know anything and was worried when she called Rio. You left late last night and didn‚Äôt get home until this morning. I‚Äôm taking care of Raven instead of Alice.‚Äù He threw a hand into the air. ‚ÄúWhat is going on?‚Äù

Agatha looked at her son, realization hitting her like a blow from an MMA fighter. Nicky was like her in so many ways, and she and Wanda, along with Vision and Nat, had worked so hard to raise these boys in a happy and healthy home with many adults who loved them. They had vowed to let them be kids and give them every opportunity they could. They made sure to take care of their social-emotional and psychological needs as well as their physical and educational needs.

Yet here Nicky was, still wise beyond his years. It wasn‚Äôt a bad thing, but Agatha wondered just how much of his youth she may have stolen from him. How much he had been forced to grow up.

Like she had been.

How many times had he parented her? Like he was doing now. She had always treated him like an actual human being. She had never talked down to him or treated him like a second or third-class citizen like some people did with children.

Here he was, demanding answers for what should be adult problems, yet he cared because it did involve him. This was his family, and she didn‚Äôt want him to worry.

Agatha felt as though she was waking up from a nearly twenty-year dark night and realizing there had been quite a few casualties along the way.

‚ÄúBefore I answer any of your questions, Nicholas, do I allow you to be a kid?‚Äù She asked softly.

His shocked expression as he thought about how to answer told Agatha that this was not the conversation he had been expecting.

‚ÄúYes. You give me a lot of independence, and I honestly think I‚Äôm better for it. Billy and Tommy, too. You, Aunt Wanda, Aunt Nat, and Uncle Vision, you‚Äôre all as involved as you possibly can be, and unlike our friends with famous parents, we weren‚Äôt constantly left with nannies or other people. I love that we have a compound of people and our private little woods to explore. I wouldn‚Äôt change the way I grew up and am still growing up for anything, Mom. I wish I didn‚Äôt see details about my mom‚Äôs other activities everywhere though, and I have seen some pictures of you, and Aunt Wanda, by accident that I did not want to see.‚Äù

Nicky‚Äôs face was one of pure teenage disgust. Agatha remembered that day. He had been very curious as to why there were certain movies of theirs he couldn‚Äôt watch. Just like his mother, he found out the hard way.

He never questioned either of them again.

‚ÄúI know I‚Äôm wiser than my peers, don‚Äôt look so shocked that I‚Äôm self-aware, Mom. I hear it from my teachers. I think that comes from being a Harkness and all the social-emotional workshops and different things we were put in as kids. My childhood has been different, but you still let me be a kid. You allowed me to make mistakes, but I still had and have consequences, I played more than my share of pranks. You didn‚Äôt take my childhood from me, Mom. It‚Äôs been different, but all three of us are still getting to be kids. We just have to reverse roles sometimes because our three moms didn‚Äôt get to be kids. You may think you‚Äôve buried the past, but there are some very dedicated fan accounts out there.‚Äù He took a drink of the soda he had. ‚ÄúThere are also some very interesting pictures that I‚Äôm sure you didn‚Äôt know existed.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I want to know how much you know.‚Äù Agatha hated how dedicated some of her fans were. She was flattered, yes, but also, she didn‚Äôt need that complication.

‚ÄúThank you for being honest, Nicky, and please remember to be a kid. No one is pushing or forcing you to grow up, okay? Enjoy this time while you can.‚Äù She moved to sit next to him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre such a great kid.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have some pretty awesome parents, but most of all, Agatha Harkness is a kick-ass mom.‚Äù Raven jumped over the back of the couch and positioned herself in between them. ‚ÄúRight, the actual reason for all this. Mom? What is going on?‚Äù

Agatha looked down at the purring traitor and scratched her under the chin. ‚ÄúWhere to begin? Okay, I told you I was in a relationship once, right?‚Äù She couldn‚Äôt remember who knew what.

‚ÄúYes, before I was born. No, I don‚Äôt know who that was, and I do not need to know.‚Äù

Nicky tried to keep his mother‚Äôs indiscretions separate. Rio was one thing, he didn‚Äôt need to know about any others. They weren‚Äôt important.

‚ÄúRight, well Rio figured out who it was yesterday at the reception and didn‚Äôt exactly take it well. That set off a series of events which led to several difficult conversations. Nat revealed something she was keeping from Wanda‚Ä¶‚Äù

Nicky‚Äôs jaw dropped. ‚ÄúAunt Nat kept something from Aunt Wanda? I didn‚Äôt think that was possible for them to do.‚Äù

Nicky knew that his aunts were always honest with each other, no matter what.

‚ÄúYes, so Wanda is hurt, as you can imagine, and Rio is mad at me because, yet again, I didn‚Äôt tell her the complete story. So the two of them went to Lilia's cabin, where Lorna and I spent a lot of time when I was much younger. Rio then found out Alice and I were closer than Alice let on, and that‚Äôs it in a nutshell.‚Äù She explained quickly, hoping he didn‚Äôt connect the dots.

Nicky pretended he did not connect the dots and pushed the unwanted information to the dredges of his mind. He could work through that in another ten to fifteen years.

‚ÄúSo go after her. All three of you, go after them.‚Äù He looked at her like she was an idiot for staying.

She shook her head. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt yet. They need some time to talk about things and process, and then we‚Äôll go up there and get everything worked out.‚Äù

Nicky gave his mom a sad look. ‚ÄúThis is what I was worried about.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know, Nicholas.‚Äù She patted his knee. ‚ÄúThis is what I tried to prevent, and I did a terrible job of it.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt wouldn‚Äôt kill you to just stick to the truth, Mom.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure if I know what it is anymore. Not completely.‚Äù She frowned down at the floor.

‚ÄúMom, I suggest you journal. It‚Äôs a very healthy coping mechanism.‚Äù Journaling! He should be having fun, not getting on to his mother.

‚ÄúGo back to being a kid. Have a pasture party, throw a house party in the clubhouse, do something.‚Äù

‚ÄúBefore I throw a party so epic the cops get called and I begin my criminal record, you better get her back, Mom. Yes, you both have your baggage, but she‚Äôs good for you. Your son cannot have a more stable relationship than you do, and I like seeing you happy. You‚Äôre not the only one that will lose.‚Äù

She nodded and patted his shoulder.

‚ÄúI know, kiddo. I love you and thank you for parenting me sometimes.‚Äù

He scoffed. ‚ÄúYeah, well, you need it. I‚Äôve seen your criminal record.‚Äù

‚ÄúThose records are sealed, sir.‚Äù She held her hand to her chest in shock.

‚ÄúSo you do have a criminal record!‚Äù He affirmed.

‚ÄúWhat? You tricked me!‚Äù

‚ÄúI learned from the best. I love you too, Mom. Make sure you get my future stepmom back, and I am absolutely having that party next week.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The wind whipped past Rio‚Äôs face, filling her with a rare exhilaration as they zipped through the trees in the growing darkness. She knew they should head back, but they had headlights, and these things were easy to maneuver. She was probably going entirely too fast, and neither of them were in their twenties anymore. If they wiped out, they could seriously injure themselves.

She looked over her shoulder at Wanda to motion to her to turn around, to see Wanda pointing frantically and slowing down.

Rio turned around too late and hit the snowbank going extremely too fast. The vehicle went airborne as Rio went over the handlebars and landed in the snow, everything going black.

‚ÄúRio! Rio! Oh God, if you die, Agatha is going to kill me.‚Äù Wanda had gently taken Rio‚Äôs helmet off and was looking down at her, worried and blinking back tears.

Laughter floated to Rio‚Äôs ears, and she was immediately angry. Who would laugh at this situation? She could be seriously injured.

Then, she realized she was the one laughing.

‚ÄúWanda, I‚Äôm fine!‚Äù She sat up and groaned. She would absolutely feel this in the morning. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to be bruised in the morning, and my head hurts, but I‚Äôm fine.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe need to get you to a medic or something. you could have a concussion.‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs eyes were wide as she looked around to see if there was anyone around that she could flag down.

‚ÄúA medic? What is this, war? Don‚Äôt worry, battle buddy, I‚Äôll be fine. Help me up. Let‚Äôs return these and go find a bar or something. Nothing a few shots won‚Äôt cure.‚Äù

Rio carefully stood with Wanda‚Äôs assistance and waited a moment to make sure she was balanced.

‚ÄúOkay, I‚Äôm good,‚Äù Rio said, taking a few steps and almost falling down. Wanda caught her by the waist. ‚ÄúThat was a trust fall,‚Äù Rio said as Wanda side-eyed her. ‚ÄúNo, really, I‚Äôm fine,‚Äù Rio let Wanda help her over to the overturned snowmobile. It was a little dented but turned on and seemed to still run.

‚ÄúAre you sure you can drive?‚Äù Wanda asked skeptically.

‚ÄúYes, we‚Äôll just go slower, and I‚Äôll make sure to stay near you.‚Äù Her head was pounding. ‚ÄúDo you know if there‚Äôs a first aid station anywhere? It probably wouldn‚Äôt hurt to get checked out, just in case,‚Äù Rio said as she touched her head and winced at how tender it was. No blood, so the helmet did its job, but it didn‚Äôt feel great.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre surrounded by chaos. I think I saw one between here and the rental place. Come on, don‚Äôt get hurt anymore. Remember, we only have our phones for Nat to track us if they figure out we left the necklaces at the cabin, and service isn‚Äôt that reliable out here.‚Äù

Wanda mounted the snowmobile and watched Rio as she got on hers. The first aid station was right next to their destination. The women returned their rentals first, thankful they had gone with the insurance to cover any damages. Rio seemed to be doing better after the initial shock to her system, though Wanda still insisted she get checked out. Rio‚Äôs phone had survived the impact, for which she was immensely grateful.

They stepped into the small building that was equipped to handle basic emergencies until other arrangements could be made. The nurse‚Äôs eyes widened once she realized who had just walked through the door.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre Wanda Maximoff!‚Äù She exclaimed, blinking rapidly like she was trying to clear her vision. She was a short woman with pale skin and short blonde hair cut in a bob. She had blue eyes and, if Rio had to guess, was in her late fifties. The woman looked at Rio, still stunned. ‚ÄúAnd you look like you‚Äôve had better days. Rio, right?‚Äù

She asked as she pointed to a table and turned to get gloves, the shock wearing off as she set to her task.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm Sharon, Wanda dear, have a seat. I‚Äôm a big fan of yours and Agatha‚Äôs. I thought I heard whispers that you were here again.‚Äù

Sharon went over Rio, checking her eyes with a flashlight, lightly pressing her neck, and checking her scalp for any contusions.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to have some nasty bruises tomorrow, but that helmet did its job. You took a nasty tumble. Did you hit a snowbank?‚Äù

Rio nodded. This woman was good.

‚ÄúGoing about seventy, flew over the handlebars?‚Äù Sharon continued. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen this same scenario hundreds of times.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs exactly what happened. It was terrifying.‚Äù Wanda said from behind them.

‚ÄúMost people walk away with just bruises. You were still lucky. That could have been much worse. Now, you need to be very careful with that head injury. You do have a mild concussion, and you need to keep an eye on it. No strenuous activity for the next couple of days, definitely no more snow sports.‚Äù Sharon looked at Wanda. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let her do anything stupid, please.‚Äù Sharon unlocked a cabinet and grabbed a bottle of prescription-strength Tylenol. ‚ÄúHere, this will help. I trust you both to take these responsibly.‚Äù

They nodded, feeling as though they were being scolded and threatened at the same time.

‚ÄúNow that we‚Äôve got the head and neck out of the way, how does the rest of your body feel?‚Äù Sharon asked, looking her over with well-trained and knowledgeable eyes. She had done this for so long and had listened to her breathing, watched her walk, how she talked, and how she sat. She knew nothing was majorly broken, and there wasn‚Äôt any internal bleeding. Rio might not actually have a concussion, but Sharon firmly believed in being cautious with heads and brains.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sore, but I‚Äôve had broken bones before, and nothing feels broken,‚Äù Rio thought back to a year ago when she was in the hospital, and while she hurt, it was not like that. The snow was much softer than the pavement.

‚ÄúGood. If you feel worse, go to the hospital. You‚Äôre too far from LA to go to your regular doctor.‚Äù Sharon looked from Rio to Wanda. ‚ÄúSo, why are you two up here with seemingly no security detail, girlfriend, fianc√®e, ex-husband, kids, or entourage?‚Äù

Rio shifted in her chair while Wanda looked away. They both seemed like teenagers who had gotten caught sneaking out in the middle of the night.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, I‚Äôm not telling anyone I saw either of you, laws and all, but I do keep up with celebrity news, and Rio, I know you‚Äôre a teacher and tomorrow is Monday.‚Äù Sharon had seen many things in her decades as a nurse. ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt the first time celebrities or people dating them have come through trying to escape something. I do still get starstruck because it‚Äôs just so exciting, but you still have to face your problems eventually. Watch your head, blow off some steam, and then face it head-on. Not literally. Whatever it is you two need a break from, you can absolutely handle it, especially since you have each other. Now, I need to close down the clinic, and I have a feeling you are not going to take it easy. I have a few suggestions of places to go to if you want them.‚Äù

Rio wasn‚Äôt sure what it was about this woman that seemed familiar, but it did. Sharon wrote down a few different places for them, restaurants that would be more discreet, a karaoke bar, and even tattoo artists she recommended. Rio exchanged numbers with the nurse. She had a feeling they were going to see Sharon Davis-Hart again.

As they walked back to the car, Rio took two Tylenol and chased them with water that Sharon had given her. She screwed the lid back on and climbed into the passenger seat. ‚ÄúWhy did she seem so familiar?‚Äù Rio asked, buckling her seatbelt.

‚ÄúYou got that feeling, too? I‚Äôm glad it wasn‚Äôt just me. Maybe she‚Äôs just one of those people?‚Äù Wanda shrugged. ‚ÄúAnyway, dinner? We can change out of snow clothes when we get there.

‚ÄúThen, concussion be damned, drunken karaoke!‚Äù Rio pumped her fist in the air. It was going to be a fun night.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

By Sunday evening, Agatha was at Lilia‚Äôs again.

‚ÄúIs this becoming a habit?‚Äù Lilia asked as Agatha walked in. ‚ÄúDo I need to install a revolving door? I see you still have your key.‚Äù

Lilia had also noticed the skull and crossbones keychain attached to said key.

‚ÄúNot a sword for the keychain?‚Äù Lilia asked, continuing her task in the kitchen as Agatha sat at the table and watched her.

‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt find one.‚Äù She took a sip of her water from her giant tumbler. She was trying to drink mainly water for her next role. ‚ÄúWait, how did you know?‚Äù Agatha said, choking on her water.

Lilia smirked as she stirred a pot of her vodka sauce.

‚ÄúThere were rumors of a certain tattoo on a certain lesbian sweetheart's hip going around SHIELD last year. It was some sort of rite-of-passage confirmation that people had slept with you. For a little while, they called themselves the fencing club.‚Äù
She laughed as she dropped handmade gnocchi into another pot and watched it closely.

‚ÄúThen Rio called me swords last night, and I knew.‚Äù She moved the gnocchi around a bit, ensuring they were cooking evenly before removing them from the boiling water. ‚ÄúLorna always said I was taking a sword to your heart, not a knife. So, it‚Äôs appropriate.‚Äù She portioned the potato pasta into two bowls and put the rest into a third for later. Lilia then spooned vodka sauce into the bowls, picked up forks, and carried them to the table. She placed a bowl in front of Agatha.

‚ÄúI know, you‚Äôre preparing for a role. Eat,‚Äù Lilia instructed as Agatha opened her mouth to protest.

Agatha gave a small smile.

‚ÄúI took the nickname from my character‚Äôs tarot card.‚Äù Agatha knew she didn‚Äôt have to name the movie.

‚ÄúI know. That card was fitting for you as well.‚Äù Lilia took a bite of the gnocchi and looked at Agatha. She looked tired, stressed, and oh so worried. ‚ÄúStill haven‚Äôt heard from them?‚Äù

Agatha stabbed a perfectly shaped potato dumpling. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù she said tersely, not making eye contact. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to push it, but I‚Äôm worried. Nat hasn‚Äôt heard anything either, but we‚Äôve seen things on social media. Apparently, they went snowmobiling. Why haven‚Äôt they called? Texted? Smoke signals? All day, I have realized just how much I‚Äôve manipulated everyone over the years. Just like‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha looked away, not wanting to admit it.

‚ÄúAgatha, we did what we thought was best, and that‚Äôs what you were doing. In protecting everyone, we ended up manipulating situations. You never had a childhood, granted. Your generation didn‚Äôt have a childhood, but you especially. You‚Äôve been an adult since your first role. When Lorna met you, she immediately tried to protect you, and then she brought me into it. We did everything we could, and then, well‚Ä¶I very much got sidetracked, and I am so sorry, and I take the blame for teaching you how to split yourself into two people, Agatha.‚Äù

Lilia just wanted to hug her‚Äîthe years of hurt, the years of good intentions leading to hell. Agatha looked up at her.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve done a lot of thinking this morning, talking to Nicky. I know I‚Äôm going to have even more conversations. Lilia, it‚Äôs not all your fault. Especially as I got older, I knew we were doomed, but I got to a point where I thought that was the only way to keep you in my life, and it wasn‚Äôt. I needed to communicate, we both did. I think that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so nervous about not talking to Rio right now. I know communication needs to happen, and she‚Äôs not communicating.‚Äù

Agatha had always acted older than her years, but for the first time, she looked it. Lilia reached across the table and put her hand on Agatha‚Äôs.

‚ÄúAggie, everything will be okay and work out, okay?‚Äù

Agatha nodded, softening at Lilia's familiar nickname for her. She needed this, Lilia. The Lilia that always had something cooking, the one that had comforted her when she lost out on roles or awards or put ice packs on bruises that Evanora had inflicted on her.

‚ÄúRemember when you taught me how to make alfredo sauce from scratch?‚Äù Agatha asked.

Lilia laughed. ‚ÄúYes! Lorna and I lived together. You were sixteen, and we decided it was time for you to learn how to make healthy food.‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause your Alfredo sauce is healthy?‚Äù

‚ÄúSicilian calories don‚Äôt count, kid. Anyway, Lorna kept laughing because of how big of a mess you were making, even though she had burned the fettuccine noodles.‚Äù Lilia laughed at the memory.

‚ÄúWhich I made fun of her for, only then I scorched the cream for the sauce and she wouldn‚Äôt let me live it down,‚Äù Agatha snorted.

This was what Agatha had missed and needed back in her life.

Agatha stood to clear the table when the door flew open, and Alice stormed in with Jen behind her. Jen closed the door softly, eyes narrowing as they landed on Agatha.

‚ÄúLilia, Rio knows I‚Äôve been lying to her, not telling her everything, whatever the fuck it is I‚Äôve been doing,‚Äù Alice said as she stormed straight into the kitchen and into Lilia‚Äôs waiting arms. Lilia had stood just in time.

Agatha put the now clean dishes on the drainboard and leaned against the counter with her arms crossed over her chest and her legs crossed at the ankles. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve been what now?‚Äù Agatha said, now ready to fight someone.

‚ÄúOh, like you haven't been doing that to absolutely everyone you‚Äôve ever met,‚Äù Jen said as she walked into the kitchen and fixed a bowl of gnocchi.

Lilia released Alice. ‚ÄúWhat did I tell you, Alice?‚Äù

‚ÄúTo tell her everything, law be damned.‚Äù Alice looked down at her shoes, knowing that past Alice was yelling at her.

‚ÄúWait, just how close are you two?‚Äù Agatha asked, trying to put things together.

‚ÄúPretty damn close,‚Äù Jen answered, taking a bite of her food. ‚ÄúLilia, can our next cooking lesson be this sauce?‚Äù Jen asked, trying to goad Agatha.

‚ÄúOf course,‚Äù Lilia turned back to Alice. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm the one that told her. I don‚Äôt apologize for that. She needed to know. I didn‚Äôt tell her that you and I have developed a friendship or anything. That was something you needed to do, and you‚Äôve had a year.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know it was. I just, I didn‚Äôt know how, and then she and Agatha became friends, and I barely saw her‚Ä¶‚Äù Alice walked into the living room and sat on the couch, the other three women followed behind her.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre jealous of me again,‚Äù Agatha said knowingly as she sat in her chair. ‚ÄúYou blamed me for taking Lorna away from you, and then you got jealous when Rio and I grew close, even if you were in the same room.‚Äù

‚ÄúDO YOU BLAME ME?!‚Äù Alice shouted, standing up. ‚ÄúLorna was never my mother. She didn‚Äôt even try until she started dying, and that was from guilt. She did more parenting through letters after she died than she did when she was alive because of you, Agatha. It took me the three years between when she and Gran died to work through that in therapy before I could take the job at SHIELD because I couldn‚Äôt stand to be anywhere near you. To be reminded of what I lost. Gran tried to make sure that Rio and I weren‚Äôt home if Mom was going to be so that we wouldn‚Äôt see whatever state she was in because everyone was trying to protect me. Even Rio tried to protect me from it because of what she saw during her first twelve years of life!‚Äù Alice was breathing heavily while Agatha looked at her lovingly.

Agatha had zero negative feelings toward Alice, and it only fueled Alice‚Äôs anger.

Lilia touched Jen‚Äôs arm and made her go to the backyard with her, saying she needed help in the garden.

‚ÄúTHEN, because Mom had specific instructions on some of her letters, there was one I was supposed to open when Gran died. Do you know what THAT letter said? That sixteen-year-old Agatha Harkness and Lilia were the two people who convinced her to keep me. The person she chose to raise over me was the person who had said, ‚ÄòLorna, you‚Äôll be a great mom. Keep your kid.‚Äô She also went on to say how much you wanted her to move Gran and me to LA. How many times you told her that she did a great job with you and would do a great job with me, too. How could I be mad at that? As an adult, I came to terms with it, and I was fine, but then Rio moved out here, and I felt it bubble up again. I want Rio to be happy. I encouraged this, and I still do because I know how much she loves you and Agatha, you love her so much. But fuck, I was transported back to that kid that always saw Lorna Wu on red carpets next to Agatha Harkness on TV. Or Lorna Wu talk about Agatha Harkness in interviews, and now my sister is being talked about by Agatha Harkness. So yes, I did get jealous because it‚Äôs deja vu for me, okay?‚Äù

Alice‚Äôs chest was rising and falling rapidly, her anger still on display. Agatha‚Äôs face had not changed. She knew this day was coming.

‚ÄúThen, when I came out here, I knew that Mom and Lilia had been close. Mom told me so in a letter. So yes, Lilia and I developed a friendship, and then Jen and I developed a friendship, and I made the biggest mistake of my life by not telling Rio, and when Rio told me you had been in a relationship forever ago, Jen and I guessed it was Lilia. You and Lilia kept each other at arm‚Äôs length, which we thought was odd considering how close she and Mom used to be, how close you and Mom were, and the stories we‚Äôve heard. Then I lied to my best friend and sister, and based on Wanda going with Rio, it sounds like you did the same thing. I‚Äôm you.‚Äù Alice finally lost steam and plopped down on the couch.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not me, Alice. You weren‚Äôt lying or withholding for selfish reasons. I have tried to apologize and make things up to you since you moved out here, before, really. I love and care for you so much and have since the day you were born, and you refuse to see it or let me get too close. I cut your umbilical cord. Well, Lilia, your mother and I, we all did it together. Your mother did such a fantastic job that day. I was exhausted. She was a superhero.‚Äù Agatha smiled at the memory. ‚ÄúYes, I was still a baby myself when you were born, kiddo, and when your mother decided I was a great candidate to leave you with if something were to happen. Please know that I have been trying to do whatever I could to make up for you not being raised by Lorna. I still feel guilty about it, and it‚Äôs still a thing I discuss with my therapist. It‚Äôs also one of the reasons I am so involved with Nicky, put him in different programs, raised him the way I did, built the compound with Wanda, and am bringing you into the compound because of what your mother taught me about chosen family and parenting. If I need to push Rio to spend more one-on-one time with you, I will. I understand needing that time and I am so thankful that Vis and Nat have always understood that about Wanda and me.

‚ÄúI never meant to take Lorna from you, and that was her decision. I will never take Rio from you. You do have a lot to explain to her, though, just as I have a few more tough conversations to have myself.‚Äù

Agatha moved next to Alice and wrapped her arms around her like she would with Nicky.

‚ÄúOne of the things your mother wrote to me in one of her letters was to make sure you knew how much she loved you, and Alice, she really did. It‚Äôs why she did what she did, leaving you with Norma.‚Äù

Agatha squeezed her. Alice nodded.

‚ÄúI know that now, and I know you aren‚Äôt awful. I should have been honest with Rio and you, too.‚Äù

Agatha sighed again.

‚ÄúIt sounds like a lot of us should have been. Now, just how close have you and Lilia been this whole time?‚Äù

Alice laughed.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Jen sat in a chair on the back porch, staring at Lilia, straining to hear the conversation.

She couldn‚Äôt hear anything other than an occasional murmur and looked nervously at Lilia.

‚ÄúEverything will be okay, right?‚Äù She asked the wise-to-her woman in front of her.

Lilia patted Jen‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúOf course, Jen. This truth that is coming out about everyone changes dynamics a smidge, and everyone will have to adjust to that. There are growing pains in the process. Secrets hurt people. I know that more than anyone.‚Äù

Jen and Alice had talked about the possibility of Agatha and Lilia being exes, but now that it had been confirmed, Jen was a bit weirded out by it all. It was a lot to take in.

Lilia seemed to be reading Jen‚Äôs mind.

‚ÄúI shouldn‚Äôt have let it happen, but people do stupid things. I, unfortunately, let it continue for entirely too long.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs why you kept telling Alice to talk to Rio for so long.‚Äù Jen studied Lilia, trying to read her the way Lilia read others.

‚ÄúYes. I told Lorna. I told her everything, and I encouraged Alice to do the same. She never did, and now we‚Äôre here.‚Äù Lilia looked at the door as she heard laughter.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs good, right?‚Äù Jen looked at the door.

Lilia nodded. ‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs our cue. Jen, just keep loving and supporting Alice no matter what.‚Äù

‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù Jen rose, reaching for the door, Lilia next to her.

‚ÄúThis could be a very rough week, Jen,‚Äù Lilia reiterated as they reentered the house.

‚ÄúMy clients are Agatha Harkness and Wanda Maximoff. I‚Äôve been on blood pressure medication since I was thirty-one.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

WandRio, as they were now calling themselves, had found a restaurant that Sharon had recommended on the main strip in town where all the storefronts were designed to look like one large ski resort. In their planning, they had found the karaoke bar and a tattoo parlor, which was no longer a joke and very much a reality as they booked appointments for the next afternoon, knowing they couldn‚Äôt get them after drinking. They had found a place to change and were doing a terrible job at hiding who they were as they sat in a back corner of the rustic dining establishment.

‚ÄúHow are you feeling about everything?‚Äù Rio asked as she drank her second margarita, having finished her meal at record speed.

‚ÄúJust conflicted. I really need to talk to Nat and Agatha. We‚Äôve been this family for so long, and I was able to keep some contact with Lilia, but not like I wanted to. Lilia, Lorna, and Agatha raised me, and they raised Nat, too. Nat, like Agatha, was always more mature, as you can imagine. I was so naive, and my parents had tried extremely hard to shelter me from what they could, even growing up in a war zone.‚Äù Wanda popped one of the last few fries in her mouth.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm familiar with some of your backstory, what you‚Äôve shared in interviews, and the little bits and pieces I‚Äôve picked up from the past few months. I‚Äôm so sorry for what you went through, Wanda.‚Äù

Rio was sincere. She remembered seeing footage of that particular Eastern European conflict on the news when she was very young and then learning about it in high school. By then, Wanda was a movie star and was always mentioned as a survivor of the war.

Wanda hated it and yet, just shrugged. It was a habit she developed as a means to avoid the topic.

‚ÄúWe all have a past, and some are worse than others. Yours isn‚Äôt very pretty, either. Did you know that Norma sent pictures to Lorna of Alice, and we would occasionally see ones with you in them too?‚Äù

Rio nearly choked on her glorified alcohol slush.

‚ÄúWHAT? No, I certainly did not know that.‚Äù Agatha had seen pictures of her as an awkward teenager? Oh God. How were they dating? She and Agatha had also met a few times, but they had both just laughed those off.

‚ÄúYou and Alice were so gorgeous at prom when you went together.‚Äù Wanda teased.

‚ÄúI hate you.‚Äù Rio glared as Wanda laughed, causing a few people to look at them and snap pictures.

‚ÄúAnyway, you didn‚Äôt have a great past, either. Norma didn‚Äôt tell us the whole story of course, just that you had shitty parents and she had decided you were hers and Alice‚Äôs after a few months. Agatha did fill me in after you told her the rest, though.‚Äù

Wanda ate her last french fry and pushed the plate away from her.

‚ÄúI went from a loving, caring family to not that. I met Agatha almost immediately. I was obsessed with sitcoms, and she had been in some of my favorites when she was a child and teenager, and then I was cast in a show with her due to nepotism. She noticed the signs of mistreatment almost immediately, as did Lorna and Lilia, having been through it before with Agatha. It didn‚Äôt take them long to basically get custody of me. My aunt got fired, and who knows what happened to her. I honestly don‚Äôt know, actually.‚Äù Wanda shrugged.

‚ÄúAnyway, Lorna and Lilia were quirky, but they loved us. They didn‚Äôt bat an eye when Nat joined the picture. Agatha became the big sister I had always wanted and needed. She got the lawyers for me, an agent, a therapist, and moved me in with her.‚Äù

Wanda stopped when a waitress came by to see if they needed anything else, and they went ahead and requested the check. Wanda continued her story while they waited.

‚ÄúMy aunt had been giving me some pretty strong sleep medications because I had such terrible nightmares, and she didn‚Äôt want to deal with them. When I moved in with Aggie and started therapy, I stopped taking things to help with sleep, though the nightmares still came.

‚ÄúYou know what that woman did? She realized I had them at the same time every night and made sure she was home at those times so she could fucking spoon me and help me through the nightmares so I wouldn‚Äôt develop any sort of dependence on the meds because that‚Äôs who the true Agatha Harkness is.

‚ÄúWe then built a house, a life, a family together. She took her would-be Russian assassin and gave her a home. She shared her family with me. She gave me so many acting tips and helped me build my career. I can never repay her for everything she‚Äôs done for me.‚Äù

They left the restaurant, entered the karaoke bar, and were finding a table when Wanda looked at Rio. Her eyes looked like they were holding back a river of tears.

‚ÄúThen I find out she‚Äôs been holding all these things back?‚Äù

Rio hugged her. ‚ÄúOh, Wanda. I am so sorry.‚Äù Rio knew how it felt. Her chosen sister had been hiding things from her, too.

‚ÄúI know she was doing what she thought was best, but it still hurts. And Nat?‚Äù

‚ÄúI think Nat probably went to Agatha, don‚Äôt you think?‚Äù Rio reasoned.

Wanda thought about it for a few minutes. ‚ÄúThat makes sense, but I‚Äôm still mad. I‚Äôm going to get drinks. You can sign us up for some amazing songs.‚Äù

A smile spread across Rio‚Äôs face as she slid off the stool and walked up to the sign-up sheet.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Lilia looked around her house at the four women that had gathered. Nat joined them and sat on the floor, absentmindedly flipping a pocket knife. Jen was worriedly scrolling through her phone and scowling, using one hand to smooth Alice‚Äôs hair while Alice slept in her lap. Agatha was curled in that ancient armchair Lilia had reupholstered and returned to its rightful place, smirking as she scrolled through social media and looked up at Lilia.

‚ÄúPenny for your thoughts.‚Äù Agatha tilted her head. There was a time she could almost read Lilia‚Äôs mind, but that time was long past.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs getting late,‚Äù Lilia said, pushing away from the doorframe of the kitchen where she had taken up residence.

‚ÄúAre you kicking me out?‚Äù Agatha said, feigning shock.

A soft smile crossed her face as she walked to where Alice was sleeping and put a hand on her arm. ‚ÄúNot you,‚Äù she said to Agatha and then turned to Jen.

‚ÄúSorry, Jen, I need someone at school tomorrow.‚Äù Lilia looked down at Alice, ‚ÄúAlice, honey, you need to go get some sleep. Teenagers in the morning.‚Äù

Alice grumbled as she rubbed her eyes with the heels of her hands. ‚ÄúAny word?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, babe, just social media,‚Äù Jen wiggled the phone at Alice.

‚ÄúHow bad?‚Äù Nat asked, not taking her eyes off the knife.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre pretty fucking drunk for eleven on a Sunday night, singing karaoke, cover blown, at a fairly reputable place,‚Äù Jen sighed.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre having a great time and drawing a large crowd,‚Äù Agatha added, watching another video.

‚ÄúWhich means this could go on for another day or two,‚Äù Jen groaned.

Lilia shook her head. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it will. Maybe a day. I think they‚Äôll call the three of you tomorrow.‚Äù

Lilia knew something. Agatha was sure of it.

‚ÄúWhat songs have they done so far?‚Äù Alice sat up and put her feet on the floor to slide her Vans on.

‚Äú Man I Feel Like A Woman, Out of the Woods, No Body, No Crime, and Father Figure,‚Äù Agatha rattled off. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm keeping all of these videos. Rio singing Father Figure is something I need to see live. Am I still upset? Yes. Am I highly amused? Also, yes.‚Äù Agatha was still upset with herself, but the videos of her best friend and girlfriend doing drunken karaoke together were highly entertaining.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs still super drunk and pissed. It‚Äôll come. Okay, babe, take me home and to bed.‚Äù Alice yawned and stretched, not realizing what she had said, as the other three women turned to look in their direction. Jen flushed.

‚ÄúWhat? We‚Äôre married, you heathens.‚Äù

They said their goodbyes and left. Lilia promised to update Alice in the morning.

Agatha turned back to Lilia as the Sicilian sat on the couch, and Nat joined her. ‚ÄúOut with it, Calderu.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just nice to have a semi-full house again, is all. Yes, Alice has been coming over a fair amount over the years, and Jen. Though it started for the worst reasons, tonight has been nice.‚Äù

She looked away, afraid of showing too much emotion. It had been an emotionally loaded weekend.

‚ÄúThings are changing for the better, Lilia,‚Äù Agatha said softly.

Nat put the pocket knife away. ‚ÄúThe band‚Äôs getting back together,‚Äù Nat added. ‚ÄúAs soon as we finish our forgiveness tour.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

WandRio was having a blast and enjoying themselves. Rio‚Äôs phone alerted her that they were trending, and she did not want to see the proof. They went to sit at their table as one of the bartenders came over with several shots.

‚ÄúHello, you two. How‚Äôs your head, Rio?‚Äù Sharon asked, lining shots up in front of both of them from the bartender‚Äôs tray.

Wanda and Rio looked at each other and laughed.

‚ÄúWhat the hell are you doing here, Sharon?‚Äù Wanda asked as she and Rio both took a shot that tasted like pineapple.

‚ÄúI own the place.‚Äù She gestured.

‚ÄúDamn, well, we love it,‚Äù Rio told her taking another shot.

‚ÄúGood. I wanted to be able to keep an eye on you two tonight. I had a suspicion there‚Äôd be heavy drinking.‚Äù She looked at the now-empty shot glasses.

‚ÄúGuilty.‚Äù They both said at the same time.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you two are having fun, but seriously, watch the head.‚Äù She gave Rio a long look before returning to the bar.

‚ÄúShe still seems very familiar,‚Äù Rio noted as Wanda nodded.

Rio turned back to Wanda. ‚ÄúOkay, what song next?‚Äù

Wanda grinned. ‚ÄúSilver Springs, Fleetwood Mac. Let‚Äôs get some angst out.‚Äù

They wrote it down and waited for their turn once more. The bar had filled up once people had heard who was inside, and everyone was more than happy to let the two women have the stage.

Rio wasn‚Äôt an actress, but she could bring the drama too as the song started and the song started.




Agatha, Lilia, and Nat were seated on the couch, holding Agatha‚Äôs phone and watching a live video of the performance as Rio and Wanda belted out Silver Springs.

‚ÄúTime casts its spell on you, but you won‚Äôt forget me. I know I could have loved you, but you would not let me‚Ä¶‚Äù Wanda and Rio were somehow standing upright and knew the words, though it was obvious how drunk they were as they sang, looking into each other‚Äôs eyes. The crowd loved it. You could hear it through the phone. The three women on the couch, however, were not. Lilia looked at Agatha, and Agatha looked away. Nat bit her nails.

‚ÄúThey know what they‚Äôre doing,‚Äù Lilia said cautiously.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs working,‚Äù Agatha said quietly.

‚ÄúCan we go up there yet?‚Äù Nat asked.



Wanda and Rio were having fun, and Sharon‚Äôs night was going well as her staff continued to fill orders, wash out glasses, and take pictures for social media. She kept a close eye on the two women on stage, diligently staying on task.

Rio was extremely excited about their next song and had told Wanda why. As the music started, Wanda started grinning. She tossed back a shot that one of the employees had handed her, and Rio downed hers as well.

They looked at each other and started to sing once more, ‚ÄúDo you believe in life after love, after love, after love‚Ä¶‚Äù



Agatha groaned and tossed her head back.

‚ÄúI fucking hate you, Lilia.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe lyrics are supposed to be from your point of view. It‚Äôs not ABOUT you. It was FOR you,‚Äù Lilia explained.

Nat was confused.

‚ÄúWhat am I supposed to do? Sit around and wait for you?‚Äù Came through the speakers.

Agatha‚Äôs eyebrows were high on her head as she looked at Lilia.

‚ÄúSo you helped Cher write a song that was from her and my point of view? Not yours?‚Äù Agatha said in disbelief. ‚ÄúAfter our first major fight?‚Äù

‚ÄúYes. I knew then we should have ended things, and then, well‚Ä¶‚Äù Lilia trailed off.

Agatha softened again. ‚ÄúWe made more stupid decisions.‚Äù

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù Lilia agreed as she turned to see the song ending.

Nat got up from the couch. ‚ÄúThis calls for the emergency vodka solely to cleanse images from my brain.‚Äù



Wanda and Rio knew Jen was back in LA, not sleeping and having heart palpitations if her texts were anything to go by. There were pictures and videos of them everywhere, and they had lost count of how many songs they had sung. They were slurring, and they had just sung all seven-plus minutes of C√©line Dion‚Äôs Because You Love Me with everyone left in the bar, which, for four a.m., was still a considerable amount of people. Sharon had been making sure they both had been eating with their alcohol and had given them something for nausea. She finally had to call it a night and close the bar down, kicking everyone out except for Wanda and Rio.

‚ÄúAnother!‚Äù Rio held a shot glass up from her spot laying on the bar on her stomach.

Sharon poured water that she kept in an old vodka bottle into Rio‚Äôs glass and left it for her. ‚ÄúHere you go, hun, on the house,‚Äù she winked.

Wanda sat on a stool and laid her head on Rio‚Äôs back, studying Sharon. ‚ÄúYou know us, not just from movies and stuff, but know us,‚Äù she slurred, attempting to watch Sharon closely but just seeing double.

Sharon shook her head. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre both just very drunk,‚Äù she reassured as she closed out the registers.

Wanda shook her head. ‚ÄúNo, though you don‚Äôt know Rio.‚Äù She jabbed a finger into Rio‚Äôs ribcage. ‚ÄúBut you know the rest of us.‚Äù

Wanda was adamant. Her accent was thick, the way it was only when she was drunk, and she spoke in cursive.

‚ÄúWait!‚Äù Wanda sat up and almost fell over. Rio tried to reach out to catch her and almost fell off the bar herself.

‚ÄúYou own the coffee and games place we used to go to, too! You‚Äôve just always been here and around. You know Lilia! You‚Äôre a plant!‚Äù Wanda threw out the accusation.

‚ÄúThree ferns in a trenchcoat!‚Äù Rio added, sitting up and lowering herself to a stool, almost falling to the floor.

Sharon laughed. ‚ÄúYou caught me, yes. Lilia asked me to keep an eye on you two. Make sure you‚Äôre safe. Rio, keep drinking that vodka, Wanda, you too, " she instructed. Neither of them questioned her as they passed the bottle back and forth.

Wanda narrowed her eyes or tried to. They were already half closed from being heavily intoxicated.

‚ÄúSo this was all another set-up,‚Äù she gestured around, ‚Äúanother manipulation.‚Äù

Sharon shrugged, ‚ÄúWould you rather that or get completely wasted somewhere with zero security detail with no one looking out for you?‚Äù

Wanda was drunk. She hated feeling like an overprotected child, but she was also reasonable. She knew what could have happened to her and Rio because of their recklessness.

She also knew exactly what Lilia had been doing, so she wasn‚Äôt too angry. It was not so much manipulating as protecting, even if just from the sidelines. Just like Agatha did because she had learned from Lilia and Lorna.

No, she wasn‚Äôt a child who needed protecting, but she tended to make chaotic decisions. She was entirely too drunk to think logically.

No, if she had consumed the amount of alcohol she thought she had, she would be dead. She looked back at Sharon, realizing that yes, she spoke with an accent and that she spoke in italics, but it wasn‚Äôt as bad as she had thought.

‚ÄúHow much alcohol did we actually have?‚Äù Wanda asked.

Sharon smiled genuinely.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve probably had half of what you think you did, and I gave you something to make sure you wouldn‚Äôt have a nasty hangover tomorrow. Rio had a fourth of what she thought she did. She doesn‚Äôt have your Eastern European tolerance. I‚Äôve also been watching her concussion. Neither of you is driving, though. I can drive you to the cabin and have one of my staff drive me back, or I can call you an Uber.‚Äù

Wanda laughed.

‚ÄúLeave it to Lilia. I still had a lot of fun. Thank you, Sharon. What about you, Ri?‚Äù

She turned to Rio, who was lying across the bar, asleep.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Wanda woke up to the early afternoon sun streaming in through the blinds. Whatever Sharon had given her, she felt fine. She was thankful she had showered before she fell into bed earlier and lay there remembering the events of the past few days. She was still hurt, yet was forming a better understanding, especially when looking at things from her mama bear point of view. An arm flopped across her stomach, and she froze. She didn‚Äôt remember going to sleep with anyone. She was both married and engaged. She did not need any more complications. Her eyes followed the arm up to find Rio‚Äôs face, and she relaxed. She then panicked again until she checked to see if they were both wearing pajamas. She reached over and shook Rio‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúHey, Rio, wake up. We‚Äôre getting tattooed in a few hours, and we should probably at least text the womenfolk.‚Äù

Rio yawned. ‚ÄúWhat happened last night? Why are we in bed together?‚Äù She eyed Wanda suspiciously.

‚ÄúBecause clearly, you came to your senses and chose the better one. Duh.‚Äù She exaggerated her facial expressions and grinned.

‚ÄúNope. Your future wife terrifies me. Hard pass.‚Äù

Rio smiled and got out of the bed.

‚ÄúI think I came in here to talk, and we both fell asleep?‚Äù That was as much as she could remember, and Wanda agreed.

Wanda‚Äôs stomach growled. ‚ÄúDress, eat, tattoo, then maybe we call them?‚Äù

Rio nodded. ‚ÄúYes, it‚Äôs time we talk to those idiots.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt exactly handle things well, but ink therapy first,‚Äù Wanda confirmed, looking through her suitcase for something to wear.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

It was Monday afternoon and Agatha was dying on the set. She still hadn‚Äôt talked to Wanda or Rio and didn‚Äôt know when they would be ready to do so. She had seen all the speculation online about the shenanigans of the night before and she and Nat were packed and ready to go at any moment. They had been texting Alice at school and she was also panicking.

Lilia had been their voice of reason, reminding the three anxiety-riddled women to wait for Wanda and Rio to summon them.

It had been a long time since Lilia had been Agatha‚Äôs voice of reason, and it was jarring.

Agatha and Nat‚Äôs phones dinged at the same time, finally. Nat grabbed them and read them both while she waited for Agatha to finish her scene.

Rio üíö

If this was a movie,

you‚Äôd be here by now.



‚ù§Ô∏èWanda‚ù§Ô∏è

Stay if you want to love me, stay

Oh, don‚Äôt be shy, let‚Äôs cause a scene

Like lovers do on silver screens

Let‚Äôs make it, yeah, we‚Äôll cause a scene



Nat handed Agatha her phone with the Taylor Swift lyrics. She then showed her The Killers lyrics that Wanda had sent her. Agatha gave her a sweet smile.

‚ÄúThe song you two got caught kissing to, that‚Äôs romantic. Wonder what Alice got?‚Äù

As if on cue, Alice sent the screenshot of her text.

Sister Rio:

Sisters never pack up,

We always run back, love

Me:

Not the Beaches quote?

Sister Rio:

Knowing what I know now,

and with Agatha doing the remake,

how close to home that must

have hit her. No. But that still stands.

Now get up here, dumbass.

Agatha looked at Nat. ‚ÄúShe can quote Beaches. I fucking love that movie.‚Äù

Nat shook her head. ‚ÄúYou can fuck about it later, now come on.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Wanda handed over the chaos sigil she had doodled over to the tattoo artist. In her research, she learned that drawing your own chaos symbols held more meaning and power. Wanda had drawn inspiration from the chaos magick of their newest Marvel show and the brilliant costume designers, and how they infused symbology everywhere. Wanda looked back on her life and could see the chaos threads woven in, so why not create her own sigil powered with her intentions?

She had drawn an angular letter W with an N overlaid. Each leg transformed into the arrows leading to the cardinal directions and imposing order onto the chaos. It was going on her ankle, and she liked it, love emerging from the chaos for her.

Rio was far calmer than she would have expected at the tattoo parlor. Though she had considered a tattoo for years, she could not commit to anything that meant enough, or she didn‚Äôt think she would regret later. The moments from the last 30 years of death, destruction, and sadness that had fueled her previous tattoo designs that never materialized flashed through her mind. She took a pencil to paper and began to draw. ‚ÄúFrom death, comes life. And life, to death.‚Äù She muttered to herself as she erased a small portion.

Rio put the pencil down. This was precisely what she wanted, meaning, design, and all. On the paper was the Egyptian eye of Horus, except where the pupil was supposed to be, was an ankh. It would be a small but powerful reminder on the inside of her wrist, right over her pulse point, that her life continued despite the death that surrounded her.

They sent their messages, knowing it would take at least six hours for the other three women to join them.

‚ÄúAre you ready for this?‚Äù Wanda was trying to hold her ankle still.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think either of us has a choice now.‚Äù Rio could only use one hand to talk and didn‚Äôt like it. ‚ÄúHonestly though, I‚Äôm more ready to talk to Alice than Agatha. She still hasn‚Äôt looked at the contents of that big envelope and I think she‚Äôs waiting to do it together, knowing her as well as I do.

‚ÄúAnd, as much as I love Agatha and truly want a life with her, I could live without her in my life if I had to, she‚Äôs only been in it for a short time. I do not want to do that, though. Alice? She is a permanent fixture, and it would kill me. I don‚Äôt see how Agatha did that as close as you say she and Lilia were. So I know things will be much easier with Alice. This was a big thing, but I know she had her reasons, and we‚Äôll be okay.‚Äù

Everyone in the shop had been made to sign NDAs, brought over by Sharon with a quick smile and mouthing ‚ÄúLilia‚Äù to the women. At least Wanda and Rio weren‚Äôt worried about any secrets being leaked, though they still spoke vaguely. Wanda frowned.

‚ÄúI completely understand that for you. I can‚Äôt lose either Nat or Agatha. I just got Nat back, and I‚Äôm not losing her again. I do think Agatha will be the hardest one for me as well. I do not see how L did this all those years ago when she lost Lilia, though. It would absolutely wreck me to lose Agatha, but Nat? It‚Äôs an impossible choice, but I know which one I would make, and that hurts.‚Äù Wanda had a pained expression as she looked past Rio.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a choice you will ever have to make. You know you two will be okay, even if it‚Äôs a hard conversation. She‚Äôs the sister who raised you, loves you no matter what, and would sacrifice herself if it meant saving you.‚Äù

Rio knew that was all true. It‚Äôs what she would do for Alice. She and Alice had always said their partners would have to understand that it was a package deal.

‚ÄúI would do the same for her and Alice for you,‚Äù Wanda said softly as her artist, a young guy named Spin, wiped away a tear.

‚ÄúAre you going to forgive Agatha?‚Äù Wanda asked, making eye contact.

Rio let out a heavy sigh, she was bruised and sore from yesterday‚Äôs incident and didn‚Äôt notice the supposed pain from the tattoo needles.

‚ÄúI just need her to be honest, but, Wanda? I have never loved someone the way I love Agatha Harkness. Romantically. No, it hasn‚Äôt been very long, but she‚Äôs my person. So, yes, I‚Äôll forgive her. I‚Äôm not perfect either, but we need to get on the same page in every aspect.‚Äù

Rio stood up as Ghost, her artist, had finished. Wanda‚Äôs ink was complete as well. They completed their business and stepped back into the daylight.

‚ÄúReady to go wait for those three?‚Äù Wanda asked, gnawing at a fingernail.

‚ÄúMight as well,‚Äù Rio said, resigned to their fates.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Nat attempted to obey the speed limit as they headed to the cabin. Jen was not happy having to tell two different directors that their stars needed time. She also wasn‚Äôt excited about being put on teenage boy duty with Vision.

Lilia had a few upset teachers with Rio and Alice missing and handled them easily.

Agatha gazed into the rearview mirror, which revealed the back of the vehicle. ‚ÄúWhen did you start a friendship with Lilia?‚Äù she asked Alice nonchalantly.
