‚ÄúAbout two or three years in, I think? Once I tested the waters and knew I could trust her. We had been work friends, but that‚Äôs when we really started to become closer. You had already taken me in, but I had learned a bit through Mom‚Äôs letters and decided it was time. Don‚Äôt worry, I never gave her too much information about you, and she didn‚Äôt ask.‚Äù Alice did not feel like this line of teenage girl conversation was useful.

‚ÄúNo, I just wondered is all. I‚Äôm glad Lilia has had you.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the deal with the chair?‚Äù Alice asked.

‚ÄúWhat do you mean?‚Äù

‚ÄúLilia‚Äôs always had a different chair in that corner. Then I walked in yesterday, and that purple, wingbacked armchair is there with you sprawled in it like the useless lesbian that you are, and you can just feel that it was specifically for you.‚Äù

Alice held Agatha‚Äôs gaze in the mirror.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve heard this story. I know it‚Äôs your chair, but I haven‚Äôt heard the story behind it. When you and Lilia had what we called your friendship breakup, it was replaced. I was surprised to see it back out.‚Äù Nat threw in.

Agatha hadn‚Äôt been inside Lilia‚Äôs house in nearly two decades and had no idea it had been removed. However, it didn‚Äôt surprise her. She smiled as she thought of the sixteen-year-old Agatha and her two much older guardians.

‚ÄúI was sixteen and had won my court case. I sold my house and just about everything in it. Lorna bounced between men and either lived with them or Lilia so that she didn‚Äôt have to worry about losing a house and some of her hard-earned estate. I bought a condo and brand new everything. Lilia was keeping the house and would buy her current house a few years later, and Lorna decided to buy the condo next to mine. Anyway, Lilia needed a new chair for her house, and we stumbled into a cute little antique shop and came across that one. I fell in love with it but didn‚Äôt have a place to put it, and Lorna thought it was terrible. So Lilia bought it, saying it had an ' Old Crone‚Äô vibe. It quickly became my chair. I don‚Äôt know how much alcohol I spilled or how many burn marks I put on that thing. I carved our initials in the bottom when I was seventeen and bored,‚Äù She laughed. What she had actually carved was:

Maiden Agatha

Mother Lorna

Crone Lilia

‚ÄúShe did know I was coming,‚Äù Agatha added, looking at both women.

‚ÄúDamnit, Agatha, you better not make her put that chair back up,‚Äù Nat warned.



‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Nat pulled up and parked next to Rio‚Äôs SUV. The three of them sat there, gathering themselves for a moment.

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs do this,‚Äù Agatha said resolutely as they unloaded themselves from the car, ready to face the consequences of their actions. As they trudged up the short walkway, the cabin door swung open, and Rio flew out. Agatha immediately stopped and opened her arms.

‚ÄúMy love, I‚Äôm...‚Äù Her words died as Rio went past her, and she wrapped her arms around Alice.

‚ÄúI am so sorry! I should have told you.‚Äù Alice‚Äôs voice hit Agatha‚Äôs ears once she recovered from the snub.

Nat clapped her hand on Agatha‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúWell, we know where you stand,‚Äù Nat whispered with a mixed expression.

Agatha just smiled and nodded. ‚ÄúI wonder if this is what Lilia felt like when Lorna and I put each other before her,‚Äù she whispered sadly.

Nat turned Agatha back to the door and walked toward Wanda.

‚ÄúWorse, I‚Äôm sure. Lilia and Lorna knew each other before you.‚Äù Nat shrugged and dropped her hand, walking into Wanda‚Äôs arms.

Agatha froze.

For the first time, she realized how much pain she must have caused Lorna.

Agatha had forced Lorna to choose between Lilia and herself. And Lorna had chosen Agatha, abandoning what was arguably the most important relationship in her life in her friendship with Lilia.

Lorna had never mentioned it. Not while she was alive.

Not in her letters.

Never.

Nat had said something to Wanda, causing her to look at Agatha like an injured puppy. Agatha began to cry with her new revelation.

There were few people in this world that she had tried to never bring pain to and Lorna Wu was one of them.

She couldn‚Äôt even apologize.

Wanda‚Äôs arms were around her in seconds.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Alice and Rio were sitting at the kitchen table across from one another. Rio had been crying as she put the last of the letters down.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe she wrote you ten letters and pre-dated them,‚Äù Rio said, wiping tears from her face.

‚ÄúThere are more. She wrote like she was running out of time, and she was. She must have started writing months before she died.‚Äù

Alice ran her fingers over the first envelope.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a lot of feelings, Alice. Why didn‚Äôt you tell me? And why haven‚Äôt you read that journal? She obviously wanted you to! She‚Äôs mentioned it in every letter, she knew you still wouldn‚Äôt have looked in it.‚Äù

Rio knew it would be hard to do, but it was something Alice was going to have to do eventually.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll do it with you when you're ready,‚Äù Rio said quietly, looking up through her lashes as she picked at her nailbeds. Alice looked at her, her face full of regret.

‚ÄúI am so sorry. I should have told you, shown you these, something. You never grieved when your parents died, and I felt bad if I grieved in front of you, and then I felt so alone.‚Äù Alice looked away.

Rio thought back to all those years ago. She had lived with Alice and Gran since she was fourteen, for the most part. Her mom and stepdad never really noticed she was gone unless they needed her for something, and that was the only time she went back to their apartment. At one point, they had moved and hadn‚Äôt told her where they had gone. She found their new place three months later. When she did go back to them, she returned to Norma‚Äôs a few hours later, in terrible condition. She wasn‚Äôt sure how many times Norma had threatened them.

So when they died, Rio didn‚Äôt feel anything.

The police officers had come to Norma‚Äôs house and asked for Rio. It was ruled a murder-suicide. She was seventeen. She had just looked at the officers and said, ‚ÄúThank you, is that all?‚Äù

Norma disappeared to make a phone call, and Rio asked Alice if she wanted to go back to studying for their first test of senior year.

Rio turned back to Alice.

‚ÄúI grieved Norma. I was devastated when she died and you disappeared. I didn‚Äôt grieve my mother because she hadn‚Äôt been my mother since I was six. Gran was my mother. I don‚Äôt even remember the guy she was married to. Alice, you met them, they were horrible. I grieved the loss of my mother once she lost herself in her addiction. Lorna never lost herself, and she beat it.‚Äù
She shook her head.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to fight or argue with you. It was hard enough being mad at you. I finally joined you out here after ten years, and I am so thankful I did. I understand I wasn‚Äôt here to share everything with, but I still shared every single damn thing with you.

‚ÄúI understand you signed pieces of paper. I get it. But Alice, so did I, and I still told you about that blonde bitch. I even told her I was going to. I know you‚Äôre a rule follower, but it‚Äôs me. You know I wasn‚Äôt going to say anything to anyone other than Raven, and she doesn‚Äôt count.‚Äù

Rio wrapped her arms around herself. Wincing as she grazed a bruise.

‚ÄúI know, and every time I said something about it, Lilia would just remind me that she and Lorna never let NDAs stand in the way of telling each other everything. Then it just got to where I felt it was too late. Right before you moved out here, she told me she would give me the school year to tell you and that if I didn‚Äôt, she would.‚Äù Alice stared down at the table as she pulled at the hem of her sleeve.

‚ÄúWait, what? Why would she tell me?‚Äù Rio was confused. Why did Lilia feel like she needed to give Alice an ultimatum? Alice sighed.

‚ÄúShe said sisters shouldn‚Äôt separate themselves and lead double lives, that someone hurts the other.‚Äù Alice popped her head up and looked across the table. ‚ÄúMother fucker!‚Äù

‚ÄúYes, but we can come back to that.‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, she was warning me about becoming her! The way she hurt my mom and Agatha!‚Äù Alice was tired of having life-changing revelations, but she was also understanding a lot more.

‚ÄúDamnit Rio. That‚Äôs what I was doing. I was closer to Lilia than I let on, closer to Agatha and everyone, and had Jen and confided in her. I was living this whole other life and justifying it with the law when I should have roped you in.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo, you admit that you were wrong, you‚Äôre going to be honest with me, we‚Äôll read the journal, and we‚Äôre okay?‚Äù Rio summed everything up.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something else‚Ä¶‚Äù Alice continued.

Rio slouched and sighed.

‚ÄúI was jealous of Agatha. Yes, I wanted, and I want, you to be happy. Yet the jealousy I had when I found out how close Agatha was to Mom? It returned when you started spending so much time with Agatha.‚Äù

Rio smiled. ‚ÄúThen why didn‚Äôt you tell me, idiot? I will always make time for you.‚Äù

Alice‚Äôs cheeks turned pink. ‚ÄúBecause I was spending a lot of time with Jen in an official dating capacity.‚Äù

Rio found that she really couldn‚Äôt be mad at Alice, and she never could be. Had it hurt that Alice had kept something so major and important from her? Yes. She understood why Alice had done it, though, and she wouldn‚Äôt hold it against her. Alice wasn‚Äôt just her best friend. She was the sister the universe had given to her.

Rio put her elbow on the table between them and stuck her pinky out like she had done so many times since they had become friends when they were twelve.

‚ÄúPromise me that we will never keep secrets from each other again, no matter what we have signed. We will always be open about our emotions and feelings, and we‚Äôll tackle the envelope when you‚Äôre ready.‚Äù

Rio said, staring Alice down. Alice joined her pinky with Rio‚Äôs.

‚ÄúOn the graves of Lorna and Norma Wu, I pinky swear.‚Äù

They squeezed each other‚Äôs pinkies before letting loose a fit of giggles.

‚ÄúIf you children are done, then come in here,‚Äù Nat called from the other room.

Alice tried to look at Rio seriously. ‚ÄúTime for the boss fight.‚Äù They both started giggling again.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio and Alice had walked off into the kitchen for their chat while Wanda, Nat, and Agatha remained in the living room.

Agatha had been nervous the entire drive and wanted to make sure everything was right between Wanda and Nat before anything else. Nerves pushed her to speak quickly, uncertain of how long they had before Rio and Alice returned.

‚ÄúAngel, don‚Äôt be mad at Natasha, please. It was my fault. When she came and told me what she found that day, I immediately told her not to tell you. I didn‚Äôt tell her exactly why, just to trust me. That if you ever found out, I would take care of it. None of this is on her.‚Äù

Agatha was sitting cross-legged on the couch, arms wrapped around her stomach as if she were trying to hold herself together. She was trying to keep herself and her world from falling apart.

Wanda was tired of crying, and she knew everyone else in this house was too. Yet, she felt the all-too-familiar sting at the edges of her eyes creeping up on her. She knew Agatha was trying to protect them, she always was, but she needed confirmation of something.

‚ÄúAgatha, why didn‚Äôt you want to tell me?‚Äù Wanda barely spoke above a whisper.

Agatha knew she had to be honest, and she hated it.

‚ÄúWanda, everyone knows you can‚Äôt keep a secret.‚Äù Agatha looked at her as if saying the words caused her pain. Wanda recoiled as if Agatha had slapped her. She closed her eyes as a tear slid out.

‚ÄúAgatha,‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs voice wavered. ‚ÄúWhen have I EVER let one of YOUR secrets slip to anyone that wasn‚Äôt Nat?‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs voice trembled as she blinked her eyes open, trying to fight back the tears.

Agatha furrowed her brows as she thought about it before it hit her.

‚ÄúNever.‚Äù

Wanda was not the best at keeping secrets, but when it came to Agatha? She only told Nat. Wanda had once told Agatha that she could trust her with anything. She had meant it with her entire being.

‚ÄúNot. Once.‚Äù Wanda replied, voice hardening.

She turned her head sharply, looking at Nat. ‚ÄúYou knew that! Just like with you! I tell the two of you everything, yes, so I can get it out, but that‚Äôs it. All other secrets are fair game. The two of you? Absolutely not.

‚ÄúAgatha, you are my best friend, my big sister, the person who will and has done anything and everything for me. I share almost everything with you. I would never do anything to hurt you, and then you betrayed me. I know it‚Äôs how we grew up and how we were raised, but it‚Äôs up to us to change that. To stop it. It‚Äôs not going to be easy, Agatha, but how many more of us do you have to hurt to realize what you‚Äôre doing?‚Äù Wanda was pleading for Agatha to hear her. Agatha had her hand to her mouth, genuinely listening to what Wanda was saying. Wanda had never spilled one of Agatha‚Äôs secrets, yet she had been adamant about not sharing with her. She had betrayed and hurt Wanda. Keeping things from her and causing herself to deal with so much pain on her own.

Wanda was so goodhearted. So many bad things had happened to her, yet she still saw and found the good in life and people. Still defended Agatha no matter what she did. Bad ‚Äòboy‚Äô Agatha Harkness and girl-next-door Wanda Maximoff. Sure, Hollywood had played off of their dynamic for decades, and it was a classic buddy comedy trope, but it worked for them. She knew that the past really would have been different if she had taken the kid gloves off earlier and shared more with her earlier.

Agatha looked up and locked eyes with Wanda.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right.‚Äù

Wanda looked shocked. ‚ÄúSomeone record this.‚Äù She said, genuinely surprised at the omission.

‚ÄúI mean it, Wanda. I did become two separate people, and I hate it. I have been doing a lot of thinking. I do need Lilia back, we all do, and she and I have done a lot of talking already.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe brought the chair back out,‚Äù Nat interrupted. She had moved to Wanda‚Äôs side and was holding her hand. Wanda had allowed it and smiled. They would be perfectly okay.

Agatha nodded.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know she had put it up, obviously. It was there when I went over late Saturday Night, early Sunday Morning. Anyway, I don‚Äôt want to be that person anymore, and I‚Äôm working on it. You all deserve better. Our sons deserve better. Alice deserves better, Rio, that beautiful woman who has somehow not run away screaming, my future if she‚Äôll still have me? Deserves the world. I‚Äôm lucky enough to have people around me who care and will call me on my shit, I fucking love you, Wanda. I am so sorry for being overprotective, and I will step back. I can‚Äôt promise to never be a little too overprotective, but I‚Äôll work on it. I‚Äôm also working on the whole secrecy thing. I know sorry isn‚Äôt enough, but I am so sorry, kid.‚Äù

Agatha had stood at some point to walk and gesture while she talked. She had come to a stop, hands stopped mid-gesture.

‚ÄúOh! And please forgive Nat. She wanted to tell you she loves you more than anything, and I saw her full-body sob, and it was absolutely heartbreaking and terrifying, frankly.‚Äù Agatha added.

Wanda turned her head to look at Nat, ‚ÄúYou full-body sobbed? Why, my love?‚Äù

Nat brushed Wanda‚Äôs hair behind her ear and locked eyes with her.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the sunshine in my day, Wanda. Do you know what happens to Russian assassins when they fail a mission and are compromised? They‚Äôre permanently retired. I saw you and immediately risked it all. The shady bitch over there pulled some major strings for everything to work out the way it did because she saw something spark between us. I‚Äôve loved you since we were eighteen in a back alley, Wanda, as sappy and awful as that sounds. To lose you a second time after finally being able to have you fully? I couldn‚Äôt handle it. So yes, for the second time in my life, I was full-body sobbing on Lilia Calderu‚Äôs couch as Lilia held me. Before you ask, the first time was in the same spot, with the same woman, plus Lorna, because I thought I was losing you the first time.‚Äù

Nat was caressing Wanda‚Äôs cheek. She had never told Wanda that she had struggled with the thought of losing her when Wanda fell for Vision. Agatha stood there listening to Nat, wiping tears away from the corners of her eyes. She would never forget that night. She knew exactly what would happen to Nat after Agatha escaped their encounter unscathed. Thankfully, Agatha knew a guy, or, well, Lilia knew a guy. That was also how the deal was made involving Agatha‚Äôs mother, and they had themselves a Nat.

Wanda was fully crying as she leaned forward and kissed her fianc√©e.

‚ÄúIt took me two years to figure out how I felt about you. I had you for five years before I married Vision, and then I was at arm‚Äôs length for twenty. We are getting married in a few months, Natasha. I am not losing you over a secret my stupid sister made you keep, okay?‚Äù

Nat nodded, sniffling slightly. ‚ÄúOkay. Te iubesc.‚Äù Nat leaned forward and kissed her again.

Wanda grinned. ‚ÄúYa tebya lyublyu.‚Äù

Agatha wiped away more tears. When had she become so sentimental?

‚ÄúHi, stupid sister here. Am I forgiven?‚Äù she asked, knowing she probably was, but asking anyway.

‚ÄúGet over here,‚Äù Wanda waved her arm.

Agatha sat next to Wanda and hugged her. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry, honey. I didn‚Äôt even realize what I‚Äôd been doing.‚Äù

Wanda tucked Agatha‚Äôs head under her chin.

‚ÄúAggie, I fucking love you too. Stop lying to your therapist and authentically work on the things you need to work on. That woman in there wants you to be her future, and I want that for both of you. I also want a niece, and you‚Äôre getting old.‚Äù Wanda smiled as Agatha pulled back to glare. ‚ÄúYou have to start being honest with us and stop telling half-truths. I‚Äôm not saying she‚Äôs perfect. She‚Äôs not, but she‚Äôs perfect for you.‚Äù

They turned toward the kitchen as the sound of giggling floated in.

‚ÄúLooks like you‚Äôre up, slugger,‚Äù Wanda said.

‚ÄúIf you children are done, then come in here,‚Äù Nat called.



‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio and Alice walked in, leaning against each other and laughing over something. Rio‚Äôs laughter immediately died upon seeing Agatha. She hadn‚Äôt stopped because she was still angry, she was fighting her instincts to run to her and tell her all was forgiven.

No, they needed to genuinely talk.

Agatha pulled away from Wanda as Wanda and Nat stood.

‚ÄúAlice, come with us, we‚Äôre going to play pool.‚Äù Wanda gave Alice a look that told her she didn‚Äôt have a choice, so they left the room.

Rio looked at Agatha, hugging herself, the look of hurt she had worn so many times over the last forty-eight hours returning.

Agatha stood up, walking to Rio. She reached out and lightly placed her hands on her arms, waiting for resistance.

There was none.

Rio stepped into Agatha, letting Agatha wrap her arms around her.

‚ÄúI understand you‚Äôre angry,‚Äù Agatha started.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not angry,‚Äù Rio murmured. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm hurt, Agatha.‚Äù She stepped out of the embrace and took a seat, still hugging herself.

‚ÄúI accepted that your ex was someone you occasionally worked with, someone I might meet in passing, someone in your orbit. But finding out it‚Äôs Lilia? That‚Äôs really something I needed to know. I know you didn‚Äôt want to change how I saw her, but Agatha. Don‚Äôt you think I would have found out eventually? What was going to happen the longer this went on? It would have been even worse. The lies, the omissions, they have to stop.

‚ÄúThen, I need you to start telling me more about the past. I had no idea just how involved Lorna and Lilia were in your life. I just read ten letters to Alice from Lorna. Lorna telling Alice to give you a chance, to form a relationship with Lilia. Aside from Alice and Norma, you and Lilia were the best parts of her life, and you and Lilia convinced her to keep Alice. Thank you for that, by the way.

‚ÄúIt was just so much. I know I don‚Äôt need to know everything, but it also explains a lot about why you and Nicky get away with murder. Plus, she‚Äôs my boss, and I trusted her. I was forming a friendship with her. I respected her, Agatha!‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs thoughts were everywhere, and the more she looked at Agatha, the more she wanted to kiss her and have Agatha tell her everything was okay. Agatha sat beside her.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre right, and yes, I‚Äôll record it for you if you want me to. Wanda and Nat gave me that same look. You have every reason to be hurt and I should have told you who it was, as it does have a major effect on our lives. You can still have a friendship with her and respect her, Rio. I understand the emotions are very conflicting right now, but you‚Äôve read the letters and know how big a part of my life she played, other than that. I‚Äôve spent a lot of time over there the past forty-eight hours, and fences are being mended. If you‚Äôre not okay with that, then I‚Äôll stay at arm‚Äôs length.

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt about that right now. This is about us. Rio, I want there to be an us. For a very long time, and for that to work, we have to be open and honest with each other, I agree. Wanda says I have to stop lying to my therapist and start working on some other things.‚Äù

‚ÄúWanda‚Äôs right,‚Äù Rio interjected.

‚ÄúShe has an uncanny ability for that.‚Äù Agatha smiled. ‚ÄúRio, I don‚Äôt want to fight, and I don‚Äôt want to argue. Over the past few days, I realized that I also became two separate people, like Lilia did. I know I need to work on myself, and I plan on doing that. I also know we need to work on our communication. I don‚Äôt want to watch Heartbreak Karaoke featuring you and Wanda on a grainy live stream every time we don‚Äôt communicate. However, it was highly entertaining, and now I do want to go to karaoke with you.

‚ÄúI digress. I want you to read the letters I have from Lorna. I want to be more open with you, and I want you to be more open with me. I love you, and I want this to work, whatever it takes.‚Äù

Agatha had never been much of a crier off-screen, yet these past few months had been brutal, and she blamed menopause. Rio huffed.

‚ÄúHow do you do that? Completely disarm me to where I can‚Äôt be mad at you if I wanted to be? I‚Äôm still slightly wounded, but not nearly as much as I should be.‚Äù

Agatha smirked. ‚ÄúI came by it honestly.‚Äù

She had done the same thing to Rio that Lilia had done to her. She hadn‚Äôt meant to, it just happened. Now that she thought about it, Lorna had the same ability.

‚ÄúI have a feeling you learned it from the women who raised you.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs eyes narrowed.

‚ÄúI learned a lot from them. They raised me. Back to us, I know we still have some things to work out and work through, as well as relationship dynamics to navigate. Are we okay for now while we build this to what we want it to be?‚Äù Agatha cupped Rio‚Äôs cheek and caressed it with her thumb.

‚ÄúAgatha Harkness, where is this coming from all of a sudden?‚Äù Rio was slightly taken aback at the sudden relationship skills her girlfriend had.

‚ÄúWould you believe me if I said my son?‚Äù Agatha winced slightly.

‚ÄúYes, actually.‚Äù Rio was not surprised in the slightest.

‚ÄúHe recommended a podcast. The advice was not from him,‚Äù Agatha clarified.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm slightly disappointed in our son now,‚Äù Rio smirked.

Agatha smiled at hearing Rio saying ‚Äòour son‚Äô again.

‚ÄúIn case you hadn‚Äôt gathered, we‚Äôre okay for now. I love you.‚Äù

Rio leaned in and kissed her, running a hand through Agatha‚Äôs hair. She could work with this. They could work through these things and navigate whatever came at them. Agatha placed her hand on the back of Rio‚Äôs head, only for Rio to hiss in pain and pull back. Her head was still tender, and the Tylenol from earlier was wearing off.

Agatha looked at her, worried. Why was she hurt?

‚ÄúRio, what‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù Her eyes scanned over Rio, noticing a few light bruises.

‚ÄúI flew off of a snowmobile yesterday,‚Äù Rio admitted.

‚ÄúWhat? Why didn‚Äôt you tell me? Wait, why were you drinking last night? We need to get you checked out, baby. I am so sorry. Does anything feel broken?‚Äù

Agatha‚Äôs mind was racing. Rio had gotten injured almost a year after the last time she had been seriously injured. Rio started to laugh.

‚ÄúAggie, I‚Äôm fine. I have a mild concussion, and I‚Äôm banged up. We went to the first aid station. Very nice woman.‚Äù

Agatha was still looking at her in horror. ‚ÄúI saw you on live streams! You were completely plastered! That‚Äôs not good!‚Äù

Wanda walked back in upon hearing Agatha panicking.

‚ÄúWe were at Sharon Davis-Hart‚Äôs bar, Agatha. Remember her? Anyway, she did a good job of making us think we were drunker than we were. She kept an eye on Rio and made sure she was fine.‚Äù Wanda sat on a couch catty-corner to the one Agatha and Rio were on.

‚ÄúLilia,‚Äù Agatha stated. ‚ÄúOf course, she called Sharon. Well, still, that means it‚Äôs time for you to go to bed and rest your head.‚Äù Agatha was still concerned. She had read several studies and articles from medical journals about concussions when Nicky started playing football and did not play around with head injuries. Agatha helped Rio up, and they said their goodnights, walking up to Agatha‚Äôs old room.

Nat and Alice had taken their bags up to their rooms. Agatha stepped into the room and passed echoes of herself through the ages. Teenage Agatha getting ready to go skiing, teenage Agatha making out with someone, teenage Agatha dancing around with Lorna and Lilia, young adult Agatha with a broken leg, laughing with Wanda, young adult Agatha dancing around and drinking with Wanda, Nat, Lilia, and Lorna.

She had seen these memories playing out like old film reels downstairs, but she hadn‚Äôt expected it as much here. They all faded away when she realized Rio was in front of her.

‚ÄúAgatha, are you okay?‚Äù Rio asked, wrapping her arms around Agatha.

‚ÄúYes, just remembering the times I spent here is all. And, at least the room‚Äôs decor has been updated. I was serious about sleep and no strenuous activities.‚Äù

Rio pouted.

Agatha got right next to Rio‚Äôs ear, her breath hot. ‚ÄúOnce you‚Äôre cleared, we can be as strenuous as you want,‚Äù she purred before stepping back to change for bed.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Tuesday morning had begun with Jen calling Agatha to get all of them to the nearest TV in the next fifteen minutes. She woke Rio and pounded on two bedroom doors. Ten minutes later, they were waiting for the news as Jen had instructed. Coffee was brewing in the background and they would eat after they watched whatever it was they were supposed to watch.

Breaking news music played, and the graphic flashed across the screen as the announcer came on the screen.

‚ÄúLou Falco, famed supermodel and ex-wife of former NFL quarterback Shane Falco was found deceased at the infamous Island psychiatric prison complex early this morning‚Ä¶‚Äù

She didn‚Äôt know if someone had muted the TV, but Rio didn‚Äôt hear another word, and her body numbed at the words. She wasn‚Äôt sure how to feel. She didn‚Äôt want to be happy that someone was dead, but she was relieved to know she was finally safe, and that slightly concerned her.

It was how she felt when her parents died. However, back then, she was very young. That she didn‚Äôt find it concerning.

The touch of Wanda‚Äôs hand brought Rio out of her spiraling thoughts.

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt make you an awful person to feel safe,‚Äù Wanda said, leaning over the couch and rubbing Rio‚Äôs arms. ‚ÄúIt makes you human, and that‚Äôs okay.‚Äù

‚ÄúI just... three kids lost their mother,‚Äù Rio said, voice barely above a whisper.

Alice reached out and put her hand on Rio‚Äôs knee.

‚ÄúRi, those babies haven‚Äôt had a mother in years. You even told me that when the oldest left for college, she went no contact and only talked to you.‚Äù

Rio nodded as Agatha sat beside her and wrapped her arms around her, kissing her cheek.

‚ÄúI love you. You‚Äôre one of the strongest women I know, and I am here for whatever you need.‚Äù

Rio knew she was surrounded by love, and yet again, it was comforting.

It was definitely time to get back to therapy, though.

Agatha was projecting all the warmth she could onto Rio. Inside, she had chilled to the core. Jen had known, what else had been set into motion? Agatha thought of the Russian assassin. She wasn‚Äôt sure how or when Nat had done it, possibly pulling some strings and making some calls. She never questioned Nat‚Äôs methods in all of these years, she was just glad everyone was safe. But, the ruthlessness and reach sometimes surprised her, and Agatha worked to keep it all to herself.

Nat continued to read the words that were scrolling across the screen. She had sent a few details here and there, but just like always, she hadn‚Äôt done the dirty work. Not enough to get into any serious legal trouble.

She hadn‚Äôt gotten her hands bloody in that way since Agatha had made her a part of their ragtag family twenty-seven years ago. Fights, framing, blackmail, and threats to make people disappear. Yet, she was never the one who followed through on that, and the women always dismissed her denials as necessary theater and plausible deniability. But Nat knew that was untrue.

Someone else just always got there first.

Chapter End Notes

Sharon!

I thought things would be more explosive, but I have no control anymore and this is where it went. I am literally the author and I control nothing.

The next chapter might be the last, might not. I don't know anymore.
What I do know is I have ideas for a sequel and so many one-shots, a series of Lorna's letters, the Nat and Wanda story, just so many things. Make sure to subscribe to the series! I've given over 200k words and I have many more to give!

Get Your Shit Together, So I Can Love You

Chapter Summary

Things start to settle down with the coven and Wanda talks to Lilia.

Chapter Notes

It's a shorter chapter.
Warnings:
Underage drinking alluded to, other illegal activities. Like we do.
Smut!

Again, thank you so much for all the love! Make sure to subscribe to the series!
There really is only one more chapter for this part!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Hours after the news broke, Rio sat on the couch, scrolling through social media. The internet was buzzing with news that Agatha and Wanda were not at their respective sets, videos of drunken, angry karaoke, pictures of someone that looked like Rio coming out of the small clinic on the mountain, and just pictures of WandRio in general.

They were sticking with the nickname to everyone's annoyance.

Alice had been texting back and forth with Jen all Tuesday morning, especially after the news of Lou‚Äôs demise had broken. Jen was trying to make sure no connections were made. She had already intercepted a picture of Rio from the previous school, coaching one of Lou‚Äôs daughters, hoping nothing else leaked. Combined with speculation from the internet, Jen was trying to put out fires everywhere and was drafting a statement to put out just in case.

The news had said that the supermodel succumbed to natural causes, and an autopsy would be performed. The woman had only been fifty-five, and Rio wondered what natural causes people would believe. She tried to focus on her mindless scrolling and read various things about her and her friends.

I hope Rio is okay after whatever happened while they were snowmobiling!

So are they on a girl‚Äôs trip (friend) or a girl‚Äôs trip (forget our wives)?

Neither of them has a wife‚Ä¶

Yet

Wanda still has her engagement ring.

I'm pretty sure it‚Äôs a friend trip.

They are so bestie coded.



Rio and Wanda singing Father Figure? Your honor, I am gay.

I just want older women to do unspeakable things.

I always pictured Agatha with this song, but this performance has clearly changed my

mind.

Where is Agatha? Why isn‚Äôt she there?

Wherever she is and whatever she did, surely she regrets her life choices.

I would just like to thank all of the people who live-streamed this for HOURS and then uploaded the videos for us.

You know that bar did great that night.

Where is the security detail? My friend was there and said it was just the two of them. Something is going on.

While I hope everything is fine, I‚Äôm glad it gave us THIS.

It isn‚Äôt safe for them to be in public without security. Wanda is too famous.

Wanda looks like she can protect herself.

Rio doesn‚Äôt exactly look like a damsel in distress herself.

Some of these songs sound personal. Extremely personal.

Trouble in paradise?

Breakup announcement incoming? In which case, Agatha, I am here for a rebound.

Dude, no.

Guys, these songs are getting dark, and they are singing with their whole chests.

They‚Äôre drunk. Wanda is baby Gen-X and Rio is a solid millennial, dating a Gen-Xer.

Of course, these are the songs they‚Äôre singing.

Surely everything is fine.

I still find it odd that they aren‚Äôt at the place Wanda and Agatha share in Lake

Tahoe.

Do you know where all their houses are?

Doesn‚Äôt everyone?

Rio made a mental note to check just how much information was on the internet and out there for the public. Maybe she could talk to Jen about that. She looked at what was currently trending, and her stomach flipped.

RIP Lou Falco, you were so amazing and such a great role model!

All of the charity work she did? She was such a great woman!

I feel so badly for her children!

Are y‚Äôall forgetting that she was also a felon?

Because she was such an intelligent woman! Look how long she got away with it!

Computer smarts, creativity, sneaky, seriously, perfect woman!

You people are weird.

I feel so badly for her kids! They already had to see her go through that awful witchhunt of a trial, and then she was murdered!

She wasn‚Äôt murdered! She died of natural causes.

Please! At that place? At 55? She was murdered!

Oh please. I doubt it. Don‚Äôt be disrespectful with your conspiracy theories!

Rio paused. It‚Äôs what she had been worried about. There were always conspiracy theories when these things happened, especially when high-profile people died while incarcerated in any type of way. This was not good, and while their relationship had been buried and those directly around the woman had signed NDAs, the school itself had not required them as SHIELD did.

This did not bode well for anyone.

‚ÄúWhy do people keep saying nice things about this horrid woman?‚Äù Nat spat, tossing down her phone.

‚ÄúCan you wipe it all?‚Äù Wanda looked up at her from where she was lying in her lap. The two had been even more tactile than usual since apologizing.

Nat smiled down at her future wife, ‚ÄúNo, iubirea mea, that would look highly suspicious. Plus, that would be more of a Darcy-level task.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo? I‚Äôm sure everyone would blame the ex-husband.‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs gaze traveled to Rio. ‚ÄúHow are you doing?‚Äù

‚ÄúTrying not to vomit. I‚Äôm going to stay off social media for a few days. I can‚Äôt handle all of this, and my head still hurts. I wonder if Sharon will write a note so I can say this was mandated time off.‚Äù Rio wondered out loud, her head still throbbing, though she didn‚Äôt like to admit it.

‚ÄúShe already did, though Lilia had no problem with you taking time in the first place.‚Äù Agatha walked into the room and took a seat next to Rio. Agatha handed her the next dose of pain meds, and Rio took them gratefully, curling into Agatha after swallowing them with water.

Alice had been on the other side of Rio and sighed. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not for Lilia. It‚Äôs so the Fencing Club doesn‚Äôt bully her about being the principal‚Äôs pet because she‚Äôs sleeping with you.‚Äù

Agatha, Wanda, and Nat all turned to look at Alice with shocked expressions.

Agatha was the first to speak. ‚ÄúWhat? How do you know about the fencing club?‚Äù

‚ÄúBecause I work there and have ears, Agatha. It‚Äôs not all of them, obviously, but it‚Äôs led by one or two of the more jealous types. Then the sorry bitches who just tag along to be cool and enjoy the commiseration of being among the many rejected by THE Agatha Harkness. Lilia can‚Äôt just fire them, though she wants to. Several teachers, other than myself, have come to her defense, notably Rogers and Carter.‚Äù Alice‚Äôs frown deepened. ‚ÄúLilia won‚Äôt let me punch the smirks off their faces.‚Äù

‚ÄúAre you in high school or teaching high school?‚Äù Nat‚Äôs eyebrows formed a question mark.

Rio laughed dryly.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the same thing. English departments are the absolute worst, though. High School teachers are just as clique-ish as the kids.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo all of the women you slept with at SHIELD call themselves the fencing club after your tattoo?‚Äù Wanda asked incredulously.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs high school for you,‚Äù Agatha confirmed.

‚ÄúI am so glad that part of your life is over. One less thing for Jen to worry about.‚Äù

Wanda had repositioned herself and was now leaning her head against Nat‚Äôs shoulder, her legs draped over Nat‚Äôs lap, with Nat absentmindedly running her hand up and down Wanda‚Äôs back, looking at Wanda like she was the only woman that existed.

Seeing the two of them in this state, Agatha would never know that Nat had been somehow responsible for handing out consequences to some very terrible people over the years. It still blew Agatha‚Äôs mind how Nat could compartmentalize so well and easily slip back into that role.

Nat‚Äôs insistence that she hadn‚Äôt been the cause of all those unfortunate events was starting to wear at Agatha‚Äôs assurance that it was Nat. Something had started to poke at her mind and memories, and it was something she would have to explore later. Right now, Agatha was focused on her happiness for Wanda and relief that Wanda had been more upset than angry.

‚ÄúSpeaking of my‚Ä¶our incredible fixer,‚Äù Agatha started and winced. The words ‚Äòfuture sister-in-law‚Äô had threatened to spill out, but she had thankfully been able to stop them. Seeing the smirk on Wanda‚Äôs face, however, told her that someone had noticed. Had she really begun to think of Alice as her sister by proxy of Rio?

‚ÄúJen has had to handle several things already. It doesn‚Äôt look good when you leave a set and don‚Äôt come back or don‚Äôt show up to one.‚Äù Agatha cut her eyes to Wanda. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs also the speculation about the weekend shenanigans, my son‚Äôs posts about catsitting Raven, as the cat has a cult following, Vision was pictured on a date with Herb, and then she‚Äôs having to closely monitor any leaks about any connection to the wicked witch. It‚Äôs too late in the afternoon to drive back today, but we have to head back tomorrow and get back to everything. Alice just got married. We can‚Äôt make her a widow already because Jen had a heart attack.‚Äù Agatha smiled over Rio‚Äôs head at Alice.

‚ÄúJust make sure Jen gets a decent Christmas bonus,‚Äù Alice responded, shaking her head as she texted calming affirmations to her wife, who was currently ranting about the disease that was social media.

‚ÄúConsider your house paid for,‚Äù Agatha countered, nonverbally discussing it with Wanda.

‚ÄúI was joking.‚Äù Alice rolled her eyes.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not,‚Äù Wanda added. ‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt put her through this much in a while, and if anyone does make the Rio/Super Psycho connection, it‚Äôs going to get worse.‚Äù

Rio had dozed off, leaning against Agatha. She knew that some of this was her fault. She hadn‚Äôt communicated, hadn‚Äôt talked rationally about anything, just grabbed Wanda and ran away. She was also the reason for the SF complication. Well, that was partly Lilia, wasn‚Äôt it? She had brought her out here after all. Hadn‚Äôt she?

Her head was swimming, and she was tired. It was mid-afternoon. They could go back now.

Rio sat up and yawned. ‚ÄúWe could go back now,‚Äù She said groggily, stretching her arms above her head. It was Nat who spoke first.

‚ÄúNo, the damage has been done, and while it‚Äôs not that late, it will look better if we stay a bit longer in case the connection is made. It would be good for us to be seen around town this evening.‚Äù

Nat spoke from experience, and while people wouldn‚Äôt necessarily suspect Agatha or any of their family if any of the stalking or connections came to light, it would still be better to establish alibis. As it was, Nat wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if they were questioned depending on the autopsy reports. Nat hadn‚Äôt spoken with Shane and didn‚Äôt know who had pulled off the hit. The restraining order and court appearance were enough that if Nat were a detective on the case, she would come sniffing around asking questions of the coven at least. Nat began to wonder if there was something or someone else at play. This wasn‚Äôt the first time that Nat had this nagging suspicion. To this day, she hadn‚Äôt figured out what befell the stalker who came after Wanda and the boys all those years ago. While Nat had let almost everyone assume it had been her doing, she had been clear with Wanda that that wasn‚Äôt a Nat operation. Still, no one asked questions and the event just faded into the background.

‚ÄúI agree with redheaded demon number two,‚Äù Agatha was saying. ‚ÄúHow are you feeling?‚Äù Agatha looked at Rio, worried.

‚ÄúI‚Äôd like to take an actual nap if that‚Äôs okay. Sorry.‚Äù Rio yawned. Although her head hurt, this did not feel at all like the concussion from last year. Rio reluctantly agreed with Agatha and conceded to a nap.

‚ÄúAs long as most of us are seen, it should be okay.‚Äù Agatha nodded, forehead wrinkled with worry. She looked over at Alice. ‚ÄúAre you coming, Mrs. Wu? Or is it Mrs. Kale?‚Äù She asked with a smile. Lorna would have been so happy for all of them, and Agatha had to swallow the lump in her throat.

No one had called her Mrs. yet, let alone asked which last name she was taking. Alice felt her cheeks redden as she sunk into the couch.

‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt settled on last names yet and may just keep ours. We thought of hyphenating, but both Wu-Kale and Kale-Wu sounded off to us, and I really want to keep Wu. I‚Äôll drop Gulliver, but I‚Äôm not losing Wu,‚Äù Alice and Jen had done this back and forth for almost three months now. Jen didn‚Äôt want to lose Kale for business reasons, and Alice had finally started feeling a connection to what her last name truly meant. They had their disagreements, but this had been the longest-running one.

‚ÄúPlease go with Wu-Kale and adopt a few dogs so I can call them the Wu-Kale clan,‚Äù Rio looked at her with pleading eyes.

Alice failed to suppress her laugh. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not, Method Man, go to bed.‚Äù She looked at Agatha. ‚ÄúAs for the original question, I think I‚Äôll stay here and keep an eye on this one.‚Äù She pointed at Rio, who was standing to go upstairs.

‚ÄúGood,‚Äù Rio grabbed Alice‚Äôs hand and tugged. ‚ÄúCome tell me about the decade of your life I wasn‚Äôt here for,‚Äô‚Äô Rio bent back down to give Agatha a quick kiss.

‚ÄúPlease be very careful. You don‚Äôt have a full security detail. Don‚Äôt do anything Wanda and I would do. Te amo.‚Äù

Rio turned quickly and disappeared upstairs with Alice.

Agatha watched her go and groaned. ‚ÄúThat woman is going to be the death of me.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Jen swore out loud as she hung up the phone and put her head in her hands, leaning back in her office chair. They were a few days away from the big move and her office provided the calm she needed, whereas the apartment was a mess of boxes and bubble wrap.

She had completed damage control with two separate directors. One for Agatha‚Äôs TV show, and the other for Wanda‚Äôs movie. They had both continued filming scenes that didn‚Äôt include the two stars, and as long as they were at their respective studios on Thursday morning, everything would be fine. Wanda‚Äôs director, Maxwell, understood immediately and was very understanding. Wanda didn‚Äôt disappear or pull stunts. That was always Agatha‚Äôs department. Agatha‚Äôs director, Dottie, had been miffed, but once Jen explained that it was a matter of love, she softened.

Jen knew everyone‚Äôs weaknesses.

No, it was not the directors that had Jen exasperated and anxious. It was Disney and Marvel. Fittings and table reads were scheduled to start soon, and they were not happy with two of their stars splashed all over the internet. Especially when their very wholesome star was now very suggestively participating in drunken karaoke.

No, this was not good, and Jen had to do some serious explaining. Thankfully, just mentioning a particular lawyer‚Äôs name was enough, but Jen certainly did not want to call him. Team Wagatha had a team of lawyers. There were the lawyers for the more mundane things like Wanda‚Äôs divorce, contract negotiations, real estate, and NDAs. Then, they had their very special lawyer. Jen was certain the man was ageless. He kept everyone out of prison, dealt with anything that could go awry, such as breach of contracts, and expedited citizenships. He was the kind of lawyer that people were afraid of because he wasn‚Äôt crooked. He was just that good and terrifying.

The minute Jen said, ‚ÄúI can always send their contracts over to their legal team. I‚Äôm sure the head of their team, Mr. Fury, would be happy to speak to you,‚Äù The executive on the other end of the line had gone silent. Breathing was the only thing Jen heard. ‚ÄúOh? So you have heard of him? I can have,‚Äù

The executive cut her off. ‚ÄúNo, Mrs. Kale, that won‚Äôt be necessary. Just make sure your clients are where they need to be when they need to be there.‚Äù

The line had gone dead immediately.

Now, Jen had to let Fury know, and she did not want to contact him. Contacting him about these types of things showed weakness, and she hated that. She reached for her phone and opted to text.

Me:

I had to mention you

to Disney/Marvel. It

shouldn‚Äôt become a thing.

Man:

I thought you might have to.

I‚Äôm always watching.

Man:

You could have reached out.

Before now.

You looked beautiful.



Jen inhaled sharply. She hadn‚Äôt seen him at the reception though that didn‚Äôt mean he hadn‚Äôt been there. He was friends with Tony, another client. Tony had probably told him as he was one of the few people who knew of her connection with the powerful attorney.

Me:

You weren‚Äôt invited.

Man:

I was, just not by you.

Me:

Who?

Man:

Several people that

love and care for you.

Jen made a mental note to put her walls back in place and interrogate Alice. Love had made her too soft. She was finished with this conversation, and she knew the longer she stayed here, the likelier it was for him to track her location and show up. Just because they had set boundaries didn‚Äôt mean he wouldn‚Äôt cross them. She slipped her laptop into her bag, turned off the lights, and locked up. Once in her car, she rechecked her phone just to see if Fury had gotten the hint that she was finished talking with him.

He had not.

Man:

She‚Äôs a great girl, Jennifer.

I knew her mother.

Me:

I know.

It‚Äôs part of why I

have this job.

Agatha told her otherwise constantly, though Jen knew that in the beginning, his connection to this particular trio was precisely what landed her the job. Hollywood was filled with nepotism in all industries, and she hated being one of them, even if only a small number of people knew. She knew that Agatha wouldn‚Äôt take just anyone to be her sole representation for everything, but she still did everything she could and worked as hard as she could to prove to Agatha that she was more than her genetic makeup.

It was also why she had been so insistent on not dating Alice. She didn‚Äôt want Fury to take credit for everything she had in her life. She tossed her phone into the passenger seat and drove back to the apartment.

He‚Äôd probably take credit for the house on the compound, too.

Man:

I‚Äôm proud of you.

I mean it.

Jen sat on the couch in the apartment, surrounded by boxes. She couldn‚Äôt wait to get everything into the new house on Saturday. The last message had irritated her. Where was that the last forty years? No. She didn‚Äôt have time for this. She was done with this conversation.

She pulled out her laptop and began working on a statement for People.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha sat in a booth at Sharon‚Äôs bar, drinking water, knowing that this wasn‚Äôt the time for alcohol, reaffirmed by the all-knowing look from Wanda as the thought crossed Agath‚Äôas mind. They had eaten dinner, wandered the area, and been highly visible. The way her notifications were going off told her it was working.

‚ÄúHave you two set a date?‚Äù Agatha asked, trying to be happy for them but completely focused on her relationship.

‚ÄúNot yet. The divorce isn‚Äôt finalized until June twenty-sixth,‚Äù Nat answered, drinking some type of stout.

‚ÄúThe wedding is June twenty-eighth,‚Äù Wanda said decidedly. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the last Saturday of Pride. We can make sure to be home from filming for a few days. I‚Äôve already checked the filming schedules and with the director. We‚Äôll have a small wedding. I was thinking of either the beach house or the compound.‚Äù

For once, Nat had nothing to say. She just sat there slack-jawed and stunned. This was a side of Wanda she hadn‚Äôt seen. Her first wedding to Vis had been a production, and Wanda had been indecisive about every little detail, down to her shoes. Nat looked at Agatha, who seemed more attentive now, before turning to her equal half and putting her hand on Wanda‚Äôs knee.

‚ÄúWhy the rush?‚Äù

Wanda looked down at her hands where she was picking at her cuticles, an old habit she occasionally reverted to.

‚ÄúWith the recent revelations and my self-reflections, I don‚Äôt want to spend any more time as anything but your wife, Nat. Girlfriend, partner, fianc√©e, that‚Äôs not what I want to be. I‚Äôm more sure about this than I was about having kids. There are still days I‚Äôm not so sure about them.‚Äù She turned and smirked at Nat. ‚ÄúBesides, what better way to end Pride month than with a lesbian wedding?‚Äù Wanda leaned over and quickly pressed her lips against Nat‚Äôs in a chaste kiss. ‚ÄúPlease?‚Äù

Nat pressed her forehead against Wanda‚Äôs. ‚ÄúI will never tire of hearing you refer to yourself as my wife, and we‚Äôre not even married yet. Yes, June twenty-eighth, whenever and wherever you want.‚Äù

Nat kissed Wanda again, sliding her hand into Wanda‚Äôs hair to deepen the kiss. Agatha loudly cleared her throat.

‚ÄúHey kids, this is a very public bar, and your pictures and videos are already being posted on the internet. I already have two texts from Jen that say, ‚ÄúOh God, make it stop,‚Äô and ‚Äòkill them now‚Äô‚Äù

Wanda finally pulled back, laughing. ‚ÄúTell Jen it‚Äôs my turn to be a menace.‚Äù

Agatha pressed stop and sent the video. ‚ÄúYou told her yourself.‚Äù

Agatha stuck her tongue out and did a little dance on her side of the booth as if bragging. Wanda just shook her head. She was glad that they were acting like them again. She took a drink of the fruity concoction the bartender had made for her before looking back at her sister.

‚ÄúSo when are you proposing?‚Äù

Agatha choked on air.

‚ÄúExcuse me? It hasn‚Äôt even been a year!‚Äù Agatha exclaimed after she recovered.

Wanda shrugged. ‚ÄúOkay, and? Get it together, Harkness.‚Äù

‚ÄúNot happening. I am, however, officially asking her to move in. We have discussed that at least, so I‚Äôm going to make it official.‚Äù

Agatha was proud of herself. It was Wanda‚Äôs turn to choke on something., ‚ÄúWhat? When?‚Äù She spluttered as Nat just smirked.

‚ÄúAre you really surprised? They‚Äôre always over at each other‚Äôs places anyway, and with Alice moving to the compound this weekend, they can still carpool.‚Äù Nat commented.

Agatha rolled her eyes at Nat before answering Wanda. ‚ÄúIt would be in June, so, you know, all the gayness during Pride. I want to ask her on my birthday.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs on Friday. That‚Äôs THIS Friday!‚Äù If Wanda hadn‚Äôt been in a booth, she would have fallen off her chair.

‚ÄúI know when my birthday is.‚Äù

‚ÄúNicky‚Äôs going to be so excited. He loves that cat,‚Äù Nat smiled, leaving the unspoken ‚Äúand Rio‚Äù in the air.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve never lived with a partner before,‚Äù Agatha realized out loud.

Lilia had always shot that request down, no matter how many times Agatha brought it up. Agatha had lived with Wanda and Nat, and Lorna had lived with her a few times in between men before she stopped marrying them and finally bought her own place and just dated. She had shared places with other actresses while filming, but this would be a first for her. Agatha started laughing.

‚ÄúI am nearly fifty-two and have done things in the strangest order my whole life. I divorced my mother and struck out on my own at 16. I technically adopted a teenager at twenty-two,‚Äù

‚ÄúExcuse you, a sibling,‚Äù Wanda interjected.

‚ÄúShe did raise you,‚Äù Nat pointed out.

‚ÄúShut up,‚Äù Wanda retorted.

‚ÄúI was in the world‚Äôs most messed up relationship for ten years, had a kid on my own, my real mother was only thirteen years older than me and had a child that I took in later, I adopted the person hired to kill me, and now she‚Äôs marrying the other woman I raised, I fell in love with the best friend of another child I took in‚Ä¶‚Äù Agatha stopped as she snorted. ‚ÄúOh my God, it‚Äôs this entire universe. I should chart it. I‚Äôm like the sun.‚Äù

Wanda just shook her head. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like you‚Äôre drunk on your own absurdity. We‚Äôre taking you home.‚Äù

Agatha raised her head and looked around. ‚ÄúWait, where‚Äôs Sharon?‚Äù

As if summoned, the woman appeared beside their table.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just dropping by for a second. I was told you were here and wanted to check-in. Is everything okay?‚Äù Sharon was eyeing Agatha.

Wanda nodded. ‚ÄúWe were just about to leave and get back to Rio and Alice.‚Äù Wanda and Nat slipped from the booth and hugged the older woman, sensing that Agatha and Sharon needed to talk for a few minutes.

‚ÄúEverything okay with you and Rio?‚Äù Sharon asked as Agatha stood, and the two whispered together conspiratorially.

‚ÄúIt will be,‚Äù she stopped next to the door and turned to face Sharon, looking down at the shorter woman. ‚ÄúThank you for watching over them and taking care of her.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôll always be that sixteen-year-old kid causing trouble, Aggie. Global award-winning star or not, and Lilia asked me to keep an eye out.‚Äù

Agatha‚Äôs smile softened. ‚ÄúHow are things going between you two?‚Äù she gave Sharon a knowing look.

Sharon gave a sly smile. ‚ÄúHow did you know?‚Äù

‚ÄúA hunch, and I know Lilia,‚Äù Well, I did. Agatha shrugged.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs casual, has been for a few years. We spend time together when she‚Äôs here, or I‚Äôm in LA. We have a good time together, and that‚Äôs it. See other people, that kind of thing.‚Äù Sharon‚Äôs face said it was moving past casual for her, and Agatha knew she was going to be poking and prodding at Lilia soon.

‚ÄúMaybe she‚Äôll retire soon and move up here,‚Äù Agatha tried to be hopeful.

The older woman just scoffed. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôll never leave that haunted house of hers.‚Äù

‚ÄúAt least the ghosts are friendly.‚Äù

Sharon locked eyes with Agatha, her voice tinged with sadness, ‚ÄúThe ghosts of the living are never friendly, Agatha.‚Äù



‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Rio had fallen asleep while talking to Alice, during which time she had learned more about Alice‚Äôs ten years in the city before Rio‚Äôs arrival. When Agatha introduced Jen and Alice, they quickly became friends. Then, when Alice found she had no one to talk to about everyday life at SHIELD, she had Jen, who often had dealings with the school and had signed the very same NDAs. They grew closer, and Alice woke up one day and realized she was in love with Jen. By then, she valued her ever-growing relationship but didn‚Äôt want to ruin anything. Alice hadn‚Äôt dared to do anything until Rio came back into her daily life and gave her that push.

Alice recounted how she decided she needed to build a relationship with Lilia to learn more about Lorna and that she had built a closeness with Agatha but still kept her at a slight distance. Rio had fallen asleep as Alice‚Äôs little spoon while clutching the geriatric moose while Alice was telling her about different pranks the boys had played. Rio usually did not sleep like the dead. That was Agatha‚Äôs job. She hadn‚Äôt noticed when Alice left, tucking a blanket around her before she went.

Agatha and the redheaded wonders returned to see Alice watching crime documentaries.

‚ÄúIs Rio still asleep?‚Äù Agatha asked, already on her way up the stairs.

‚ÄúYes, do not wake her up, Agatha Fucking Harkness!‚Äù Alice yelled as Agatha vanished.

Wanda and Nat joined Alice as the expert on the television was explaining how the murder was committed.

Nat scoffed. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs giving the wrong directions.‚Äù

‚ÄúBabe, they‚Äôre not directions,‚Äù Wanda looked at her in amusement.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre still wrong.‚Äù

Agatha quietly slipped into the bedroom and stood at the side of the bed, watching Rio as she slept, curled up with the ancient moose, before she joined Rio on the bed and pressed herself against Rio‚Äôs back. She carefully draped her arm over Rio‚Äôs torso and covered the younger woman‚Äôs hand with her own, placing a kiss on the back of Rio‚Äôs neck.

Agatha thought about her little family and how she had watched Wanda and Nat while they were out, as well as the look on Alice‚Äôs face when she texted Jen. The way she oversaw and, at times, facilitated those journeys over the years, the people she loved and cared for the most had all found love.

There was no reason why this couldn‚Äôt finally work out for her, and she was fully committed to it.

‚ÄúI love you,‚Äù she whispered into Rio‚Äôs ear.

‚ÄúLove, too,‚Äù Rio mumbled, rolling over and nuzzling into Agatha‚Äôs chest, moose in between them, like an anchor to reality.

‚ÄúHow‚Äôs your head, my love?‚Äù Agatha ran her hand up and down Rio‚Äôs back and kissed her forehead.

‚ÄúBetter, hurts less.‚Äù Rio forced her eyes open as she brought herself out of her slumber to look at her girlfriend. Agatha‚Äôs beauty disarmed her momentarily. She was so in love with this woman. Then thoughts and questions from the past several days flooded her mind and out of her mouth as though she hadn‚Äôt just woken up.

‚ÄúThe two times we ran into each other at Norma‚Äôs, why were you really there? I remember running into you and then pretending like we hadn‚Äôt bumped into each other the night before when Norma introduced us or reintroduced us. What was that about?‚Äù

Agatha ran a hand through Rio‚Äôs hair, not showing sadness at a ruined moment but committed to telling the truth.

‚ÄúWell, the first time was to bring Lorna back to LA but also to tell her I was pregnant. She was so excited. I just panicked the next morning, not wanting anyone to think I was creeping around the night before. The second time, she had run after finding out she was sick, and I came to bring her back and tell her we were fighting it together. It was another panic moment. You were also of age then, and I did not need an interrogation from Norma. She knew about the relationship with Lilia and kept telling me I was going to rob a cradle one day. She‚Äôs laughing from beyond the grave, I‚Äôm sure of it.‚Äù Agatha smiled.

‚ÄúI remember every detail of both times. I couldn‚Äôt share either time with Alice. I knew she‚Äôd make fun of me forever. As it was, she teased me over how much I blushed the times we officially met. There are only a handful of things I‚Äôve kept from Alice, those being two of them.‚Äù Rio fought the urge not to bury her face in her hands. ‚ÄúDid I ever tell you that you were my gay awakening?‚Äù

Agatha snorted. ‚ÄúI have heard that millions of times, but to hear it from you is a completely different feeling,‚Äù

Rio could feel her cheeks reddening. ‚ÄúI was young, maybe seven or eight? It was a high school slasher flick you were in, and you had on this purple bikini, coming out of the water, and it was that moment when I felt something and thought, ‚ÄòI like girls.‚Äô As I got older, it never went away, and I never felt the same way about boys. So, I can honestly say I fell in love with the woman that made me realize I was gay.‚Äù

Agatha smiled. Something about knowing she was the person who first made Rio realize she liked girls made her heart stutter.

‚ÄúFull circle, huh?‚Äù While Agatha‚Äôs words were teasing, her eyes were not. ‚ÄúThat was a terrible movie. You were way too young to watch it, and I was in an awful headspace. I am glad you watched it, though, and that seeing me on a screen helped you realize your attraction to the fairer sex.‚Äù

Rio looked down at the comforter in thought for a moment before looking back at Agatha.

‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt just your looks, Agatha. It was the way your personality shone through. I went to the library after that and looked up every interview you had done, anything I could find on you‚Äînewspaper articles about your court case, any newsreel. Even though I was young, I had this thirst for knowledge and a slightly obsessive nature. I had been forced to grow up already, and I connected with something in you. I needed to know more, and I found all of that out. You immediately became my favorite actress. While other little girls in 1997 were obsessed with boy bands, I was obsessed with learning about how you had advanced queer rights, changed laws, and continued to be yourself and not shy away from it.

‚ÄúMeeting Alice and being taken in by her and Gran was one thing. I was starstruck the first time I met Lorna, but Norma tried to make sure we weren‚Äôt there when Lorna was detoxing. Your presence nearly killed my baby gay self.‚Äù Rio laughed and then changed the subject quickly to cover up her awkwardness. ‚ÄúWho gave you this senior citizen?‚Äù Rio motioned with the moose she held, assuming there was a story.

Agatha let Rio get away with the topic switch and looked down at the moose, a hint of sadness in her eyes.

‚ÄúI was sixteen, Evanora was in prison, and it was technically my first Christmas on my own, even though I wasn‚Äôt. Lorna and Lilia brought me up here and we spent Christmas up here. I saw a moose in the wild for the first time. It was huge and scared the life out of me. I was skiing and almost went into a snowbank. So they presented me with the moose here. They thought they were hilarious.‚Äù She smiled at the memory.

‚ÄúDoes he have a name?‚Äù

‚ÄúI was sixteen‚Ä¶‚Äù Was the only answer Agatha gave, her face flushing.

Rio couldn‚Äôt help but laugh. ‚ÄúYou named him horny, didn‚Äôt you? Those are antlers, Agatha.‚Äù

‚ÄúI was sixteen!‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs laughter died out as she cupped Agatha‚Äôs chin and made Agatha look at her.

‚ÄúI want to hear about them and the past, Agatha. I want to hear more stories about Nicky as a kid and what playing Elphaba was like. Reliving the past can hurt, I know, but that‚Äôs how we keep those memories alive,‚Äù Rio placed her thumb in the middle of Agatha‚Äôs cleft chin. ‚ÄúI love you, Agatha, and if I have to tell you that every hour of every day for you to get it through your thick skull just how much I mean it, I will. The good, the bad, the ugly, I‚Äôm here for it all, Agatha Fucking Harkness.‚Äù

Rio‚Äôs hand slid from Agatha‚Äôs chin to her chin and around to the back of her head as she moved to press herself against Agatha, who moved the Moose.

‚ÄúLorna,‚Äù Agatha replied. ‚ÄúI actually changed my middle name to Lorna.‚Äù

She clarified as she pulled Rio closer and drew her in for a kiss.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The five women had returned to their homes in the city on Wednesday to prepare for their return to their various places of employment on Thursday. Rio, however, was not allowed to return until Monday due to her recovery. Sharon and Lilia‚Äôs orders.

Jen had put out a statement in People that had gone over well, and the celebrity-obsessed internet was making video edits of either one deceased supermodel or two women singing drunk karaoke. With everyone returning to their normal lives, Wanda had one issue that needed resolution.

Wanda hadn‚Äôt technically asked Lilia if they could meet. Instead, she texted the older woman and declared when she would be at her house and that Lilia needed to be there. Wanda, being more polite than her counterparts, though, at least announced her arrival as she crossed the threshold into the house.

‚ÄúLilia, just what the hell were you thinking!‚Äù Wanda yelled as she stormed in, volume and anger surprising even herself. Her plan to walk in calmly and talk this out flying right out the window. This was Lilia, Wanda reminded herself. They needed her, and she was family. And family wrongs must be addressed.

Agatha was more than just her best friend. She was her sister.

Agatha had been there through everything. Agatha had taken her in and taught her almost everything she knew. Agatha held her through nightmares through heartbreak and had been there when the boys were born. Agatha was one of the most important people in her life, and to know she had been hurt so deeply by Lilia, of all people, and under Wanda‚Äôs nose activated every protective instinct in Wanda she possessed.

Wanda was furious.

Lilia sat at the kitchen table, legs crossed at the knees, drinking her tea, a stack of papers set to the side. A cup of tea sat across from her next to a plate of homemade pizzicati.

‚ÄúI was not surprised to get your text, Wanda. I just didn‚Äôt know when I would get it, ceai?‚Äù Lilia gestured toward the seat.

Wanda stood and glared at Lilia, awaiting an answer. Lilia exhaled sharply through her nose.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been asked that question a few times the past few days, and I honestly don‚Äôt think I was. Not clearly, anyway.‚Äù

‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs fucking obvious!‚Äù Wanda spat, full accent on display.

Wanda‚Äôs accent came out on three occasions. When she used it with Nat on purpose, when she was drunk, and when she was furious.

Her accent had not come out with Agatha or Nat the other night. She had been upset with them, but not to this level.

Lilia had only seen Wanda like this once before, and she remembered that day with clarity.

When Wanda was stalked, the stalker went further than any of them thought he would.

He threatened the boys. Agatha had been out of town when the threat to the boys had been made, and Wanda immediately appeared at school. She walked a path across Lilia‚Äôs office, speaking three different languages, like a caged tiger.

The body washed up on the beach a week later.

Right now, Wanda stood, eyes attempting to set Lilia on fire.

‚ÄúIn my country, you would be food for pigs. I hear it‚Äôs the same in most of the American South.‚Äù Wanda continued. Her arms were crossed, and she was tapping her foot. She looked every bit the disappointed mother but much more frightening, especially with the Romanian accent.

‚ÄúHow could you do that to her? You left her when she needed you! You helped raise her! You had a relationship with her?! I‚Äôm still both shocked and disturbed by that. If the two of you had just communicated at all, none of this would have happened!‚Äù Wanda threw her hands in the air with a cry of exasperation.

Lilia opened her mouth to speak, but the words died before leaving her mouth when Wanda held up her hand to silence her, and the younger woman continued.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what everything boils down to, isn‚Äôt it? No one knows how to talk to each other?‚Äù

‚ÄúI-‚Äù Lilia started.

Wanda‚Äôs glare just intensified as she continued talking.

‚ÄúYou can speak when I‚Äôm done,‚Äù Wanda said sharply. ‚ÄúLook at what you did to yourself, Lilia! Was it worth it? Was playing this game and losing Lorna worth it? I saw how it broke Lorna those last few years. Every time Nicky did something for the first time, she and Agatha both wished you were there to witness it, Lilia. The looks they gave each other and the sadness they communicated. I knew, maybe no one else did, but I understood that you were missing. I never knew what happened until this past weekend, and no one would tell me, but damnit Lilia. I can‚Äôt imagine how I would have felt if Agatha hadn‚Äôt been there for those moments. Or at least watch videos of them. I missed you being there with the twins‚Äô milestones, too, but I knew I could still bring them over here occasionally until they learned to talk and rat me out.‚Äù

Wanda still spoke from a place of anger but softened when she talked about the boys. It hardened again when she jumped to the next topic.

‚ÄúI was so hopeful when you were at the hospital when Nicky was born! Lorna was sober, and I know you would have been happy for her.‚Äù

Lilia spoke up then.

‚ÄúLorna told me when she sent the two of you back up with Agatha. I was so proud of her. I texted her later, telling her as much. She never responded. I knew she was sick at the end. She came to my house a few months before it happened. She wanted to apologize for the things she did. I said something stupid, and instead of being us again for the last few months of her life, that was the last time I saw her. I‚Äôm sorry Agatha didn‚Äôt tell you what happened.‚Äù Lilia blinked the tears back.

Wanda‚Äôs face hardened. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve forgiven her because that‚Äôs what family does, Lilia. You and Lorna let your pride get in the way. For the two women who taught Agatha and me how to be a family, you two didn‚Äôt listen to yourselves.‚Äù She moved to drink her ceai. Her voice was hoarse from talking so much.

‚ÄúI also haven‚Äôt told you it‚Äôs your turn yet.‚Äù She replaced the cup on the table. ‚ÄúHow could you destroy her like that? I have watched her for eighteen years continue to give her body to near strangers night after night because she wouldn‚Äôt form a connection with anyone. Only sex. She would constantly tell Nat and me that sex was all she could do. I watched her scream along to angst-filled songs that ripped at her heart and cry over old pictures when she didn‚Äôt think anyone was watching. I watched her live with that pain, Lilia.‚Äù

How Wanda was still in control of herself, she wasn‚Äôt sure.

‚ÄúWanda, I,‚Äù Lilia tried again.

‚ÄúNope. When Lorna died, she needed YOU, Lilia. Not me. YOU. I‚Äôm a big enough person that I can admit that. Hell, we all needed you, but Agatha especially. She still wears that locket to everything, and even when you can‚Äôt see it, she has it on her. Yes, she told me what it means. I asked her once when I was younger. She may have removed your hair from it, but she still has it.‚Äù Wanda had walked the length of the kitchen twice and was boring a hole into Lilia‚Äôs soul.

Lilia had known that Agatha had removed her lock of hair. Lorna had told her. Lilia did not, however, know she had kept it.

Wanda‚Äôs anger was beginning to wane somewhat, but only because she was so tired of all of this. ‚ÄúYou didn‚Äôt just hurt Agatha. Your actions hurt all of us. She trusted you, and yes, she is beautiful and alluring, but damnit Lilia. You two couldn‚Äôt have kept it in your pants?‚Äù She spat, her face had lost the scarlet it had held while she was angry, and she had lost much of her steam. ‚ÄúYou may speak now.‚Äù

Lilia looked up at her with pride. The one they had always protected had become a protector.

‚ÄúYou have grown into an incredibly strong woman, Wanda. I am so proud of you. You‚Äôre one of the few people who Agatha will let fight for her because she fully trusts you. I know you are outraged with me, and I would be too. I am, still. You watched Agatha and Lorna go through it, not understanding what happened, and now that you know that I caused it. The one person who was never supposed to cause any of them, or you, harm, you‚Äôre angry. You‚Äôre also sad.‚Äù

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt think you can Calderu your way out of this, Lilia.‚Äù

Lilia scoffed. ‚ÄúOh, I know I can‚Äôt. You‚Äôre going to keep a very watchful eye on me.‚Äù

‚ÄúAbsolutely.‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs accent was dissipating, but she was still weary of Lilia. She loved the woman, but Lilia was right. Wanda would be watching her. Wanda slid into the kitchen chair.

‚ÄúI never meant to hurt anyone, and as they say, hindsight is 20/20. If I could undo it all, I would. However, I did, and I have to own up to that. I did hurt everyone I love and I can never fix things with Lorna, which is why I want to at least try and repair things now. I am so sorry for what I did to all of you. I needed all of you in my life, and I‚Äôm glad I had you in the small capacity I did. I‚Äôm sorry she kept it from you, but that‚Äôs my fault. Lorna and I taught her to keep things close to the vest, and she did.‚Äù Lilia left out the hair tidbit and watched as Wanda thought everything over.

‚ÄúAnd Rio?‚Äù

Lilia smiled warmly. ‚ÄúI did not plan on them falling in love. That‚Äôs a little too manipulative, even for me. For example, when I scheduled Morgan and Nicky to be in the same classes since pre-k, I was trying to mend the relationship between Tony and Agatha. Certainly not matchmake children. They‚Äôre children.‚Äù Lilia hated that someone had even suggested it.

Wanda took a bite of one of the jam-filled cookies before her. ‚ÄúWhat is the story between Tony and Agatha? She‚Äôs never told me.‚Äù

A memory flashed across Lilia‚Äôs face as she shrugged.

‚ÄúAsk again. I‚Äôm sure she‚Äôll tell you now. Back to the topic at hand, I‚Äôm glad you and Agatha can move past things and that you and Rio get along so well. You also didn‚Äôt find all of my hiding places in the cabin.‚Äù She smirked, referencing the mics, ‚ÄúHopefully, you and Nat can set a better example of healthy relationship dynamics. Wanda, it‚Äôs my fault she never told you about us. I insisted that we not tell anyone. I‚Äôm the one who told Lorna, and even then, Lorna acted like she figured it out. When in reality, I told Lorna because while I told myself she‚Äôd be happy for us, I knew she‚Äôd be upset, and God was she. I destroyed our relationship over it.

What I learned, Wanda, is that if the person you have been closest to for the majority of your life tells you that something is a terrible idea, you should listen. Chances are, they know you better than you know yourself. Lorna was right, and she kept telling me I was ripping Agatha and myself apart. Unfortunately, we‚Äôre all stubborn and hard-headed here.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm truly happy for Agatha and Rio if that‚Äôs what you're truly worried about. I have no romantic feelings for Agatha anymore. Like I told Rio, and she, I‚Äôm sure, told you, I love Agatha very much, but it‚Äôs the way I always loved her. Not the infatuated love I had for her once. I care for her, for all of you. I love all of you. Being in Agatha‚Äôs life in a larger capacity doesn‚Äôt just depend on Rio, and I know that‚Äù Lilia eyed Wanda, measuring just where she was now.

Wanda looked at the now empty plate. Damn Lilia and her culinary skills. ‚ÄúLilia, I love you, and we need you in our lives and our family,‚Äù Wanda‚Äôs eyes turned dark, ‚ÄúBut if you cause any more harm to my sister or anyone in this family, it won‚Äôt be Nat that you‚Äôll have to worry about.‚Äù

Lilia had never been afraid of Wanda. The woman was kind and gentle. She once squashed a spider and cried.

At this very moment, the sweet redhead terrified her.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha had decided long ago to only have large celebrations for her birthday every five years. She had told Rio no gifts, though Agatha had a feeling she wouldn‚Äôt listen. No one ever did.

Agatha had arrived home late from filming that Friday evening and had told her family that if they insisted on celebrating, then cake only. Maybe dinner. Rio was still restricted from too much activity until Sunday, which, while disappointing, just meant they‚Äôd have a bit of a busy week.

Agatha was slightly shocked that only Rio‚Äôs car sat in front of her house, though she knew better.

She walked into her house, the distinct smell of Lilia Calderu‚Äôs cooking in the air.

Lilia was in her house, on her birthday.

Most likely making Pasta Alla Norma.

It‚Äôs what she made Agatha every year for her birthday. Starting when she turned fifteen, Evanora had always spent Agatha‚Äôs birthday at church. Praying it would be Agatha‚Äôs last. Lorna and Lilia snuck Agatha out of her house and threw her a birthday party.

Her very first one.

Agatha walked into the kitchen to see her family, original members, and new additions.

‚ÄúI said no celebrations unless it was cake.‚Äù Agatha tried to act annoyed.

‚ÄúYou said dinner was a maybe, so we took that as a yes,‚Äù Rio kissed her on the cheek. ‚ÄúHappy birthday.‚Äù

In all actuality, Agatha loved it. She had missed celebrating with Lilia. It just felt right. There was still work to be done, but things were improving. The kids didn‚Äôt even ask about her presence. They were smart. They could figure it out.

Herb had fit right in, and the boys seemed to like him. Vision was taking things slowly with him, and Jen had handled their date expertly in the People article.

‚ÄúVision has always remained faithful to Wanda, though now that they are separated, he is free to date whoever he likes and has his family‚Äôs full support.‚Äù

The three additional teens were a stable fixture. No one knew where Cassie and Tommy would end up, but they made great friends either way. Wanda had a betting pool going.

The house was filled with noise, celebration, and love. There was cake and Lilia‚Äôs cannoli, another birthday staple. Rio somehow managed to get icing on her nose, and Agatha kissed it off. Morgan told them to get a room. Nicky shouted that those were his mothers she was talking about.

After dinner, entirely too much sugar and the presents which slightly annoyed Agatha, the teens made off to the clubhouse, and the men departed. The kitchen had been cleaned when Agatha wasn‚Äôt paying attention and suspected that was Wanda and Lilia‚Äôs doing.

Lilia took Agatha‚Äôs arm. ‚ÄúWalk me to the door,‚Äù she instructed.

‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs your car?‚Äù Agatha asked the question that hadn‚Äôt been answered yet.

‚ÄúWe parked at Wanda‚Äôs, and the kids started bringing our cars over when they left a few minutes ago,‚Äù She winked.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs dark outside. The twins are still fourteen!‚Äù Yes, the four freshmen were being taught by Vision, as he was the village driving instructor, and Cassie and Eddie had turned fifteen and had learner's permits, but that didn‚Äôt make it safe.

‚ÄúAgatha, they don‚Äôt have to leave the compound. It‚Äôs not far, they‚Äôll be fine. How old were you when you learned to drive?‚Äù

‚ÄúDifferent times,‚Äù Agatha conceded.

They stood on the front porch when Cassie and Tommy drove up in Lilia‚Äôs black BMW. ‚ÄúI remember a time when you tried to pretend you only made a principal‚Äôs salary,‚Äù

‚ÄúI invested very well in the nineties and sold when Apple hit its peak.‚Äù Lilia lied.

‚ÄúSure you did.‚Äù Agatha turned and hugged the shorter woman. ‚ÄúThank you. For everything. We‚Äôre not‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúI know.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut, one day.‚Äù

‚ÄúOne day.‚Äù Lilia gave her a tight squeeze, waved to the kids, and left.

Nicky walked up to her and looked at her closely. He suspected that he had connected the right dots, and he did not like the picture they made. ‚ÄúScandalous, Mom. I need brain bleach.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh, go have the party I‚Äôm pretending I don‚Äôt know about. No driving, take everyone‚Äôs keys, and for the love of God, don‚Äôt let anyone post on social media. Turn off all the routers, confiscate and lock up cell phones.‚Äù
