‚ÄúAlready the plan, love you.‚Äù he kissed her on the cheek and turned to where Morgan was waiting for him. The others had already left.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the rule?‚Äù she called after them.

‚ÄúMisdemeanors, not felonies!‚Äù They called back.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha walked back into the house as Alice and Jen were leaving.

‚ÄúHappy birthday, you old hag,‚Äù Jen said as she hugged her. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt forget, you promised to help tomorrow.‚Äù

‚ÄúI know I did. You overgrown prune,‚Äù Agatha released her and hugged Alice, ‚ÄúThank you both. I love you, mainly you, Alice. We‚Äôll see you tomorrow.‚Äù

She walked into the living room, where Rio and Nat looked at Agatha as if she were in trouble, and Wanda looked like a disappointed mom.

‚ÄúDid you tell our boys that they could have a party?‚Äù Wanda asked, her voice strained.

Agatha looked shocked. ‚ÄúWhy, absolutely not!‚Äù

‚ÄúThen why did Kamala Khan‚Äôs mom just email me a signed NDA and consent form?‚Äù Wanda held up her phone. Agatha did not have an answer to that.

‚ÄúWhat? I don‚Äôt know anything about that.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt appears that because the children are under eighteen and therefore cannot sign legal documents themselves, the people attending the party were given NDAs and consent forms to have signed by their parents. So I Dare to Risk This Heart of Mine

Chapter Summary

The end of the school year and a few events.

Chapter Notes

We are here at the end.
Thank you so much everyone! I never thought my little story would get this much love!!
Also, there's uh, the smuttiest scene I've done so far. More smut to come in the next stories.

Keep an eye out on the socials for when I update the first few chapters!
Also, for announcements for the next installment and other stories!

Thank you so much to DaretoDream82 who stuck with me through most of this thing and helped edit, beta read, translate my thoughts, pull thoughts from my head, worked so many late nights with me, even when she was overseas.
I'd also like to thank our wives for putting up with us.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Part of Rio had been worried that Alice was playing her own April Fool‚Äôs Day prank. However, walking into the teacher‚Äôs lounge and seeing the looks on a few faces of women in their black Fencing Club shirts reassured Rio that her ride and/or die had indeed been telling her the truth. Alice had gone with her and made sure to immortalize the looks of absolute horror and disgust and sent them to the rest of the coven.

It was a good day with zero harmful pranks, and the students just thought their teachers were referencing an after-school Happy Hour. These kids were not phased by many things and at this crucial time of the year, they had bigger things to worry about than what manner of questionable things their teachers were doing.

The shirt became one of Agatha‚Äôs favorites, judging by the way she greeted Rio at the door and ravaged her on the couch, unable to make it to the bedroom.

The school year always moved faster towards the end of the year with testing, ceremonies, performances, and all of the major projects due. With Agatha and Wanda so busy during the week, Rio felt like minutes flew by, but days slowed down. Football was in spring training, track was in full swing, and she found herself looking forward to the weekends more than usual or doing test prep with upperclassmen for college entrance exams. There were also AP tests and Dual Credit tests for those trying to get college credits.

They had Coachella, the Beach Music Festival, the Prom, and the SHIELD end-of-the-year showcase to look forward to.

While not all students at SHIELD were into fine arts, several still wanted to show off their talents and they prepared all year for this week. The last week of school was filled with showcase scrimmages, one-act plays, art displays, and recitals, with everyone showing off their skills. Their lives were packed for most of April and May, leading up to Memorial Day weekend at the beach house to kick off the summer.

The rest of the weekend went by smoothly, with Agatha and Rio enjoying each other and listening to great music. They watched the sunsets paint the sky in the background and saw many of Agatha‚Äôs friends who were becoming more than just acquaintances to Rio. ¬† This was becoming Rio‚Äôs world, too, and she was becoming recognizable even without being on Agatha‚Äôs arm.

The boys back home were doing well and had not thrown any parties, according to the couple that had stayed on the compound.

On Sunday night, it was finally time for Alanis to perform. It was Agatha‚Äôs favorite set of the entire weekend, and she sang each song as though she personally had written the lyrics. In some cases, she had helped. Agatha and Alanis had connected before the set, and they exchanged many knowing looks during the performance.

Rio wasn‚Äôt jealous at all, she kept telling herself, though she did make sure she was glued to Agatha‚Äôs side.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Prom was a few days away, and while Nicky was looking forward to it, Morgan‚Äôs birthday was the following Tuesday, and he had no idea what to get her. He‚Äôd been getting Morgan something every year since they had turned five, but it was always the latest toy, a gift card, a trending item or gadget, something you would get a friend. This year, he wanted to do something meaningful but was unsure of what. He didn‚Äôt want to do jewelry. No, they weren‚Äôt there yet. He had already given her the promposal stuffed toy penguins. He knew it needed to be something personal, and he knew just the woman to talk to.

It was sixth period and Rio‚Äôs planning time. Nicky easily obtained permission to speak with Ms. Vidal during sixth period, and he took all of his things and left, Morgan watching him suspiciously as he walked out of Mrs. Wu-Kale‚Äôs AP History class.

Nicky stuck his head in the open door, looking for the woman whose advice he was seeking, spotting her at her desk.

‚ÄúHey, Ms. Vidal, can I talk to you for a moment?‚Äù

Rio looked up and smiled at the teenage boy with his mop of chestnut curls that reminded her of his mother‚Äôs.

‚ÄúOf course, honey,‚Äù the endearment slipping out. ‚ÄúAre you hungry? I have snacks.‚Äù Rio always kept snacks for herself and used them as random incentives or when a kid needed a boost during the day.

‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm good, thanks.‚Äù He placed a stool on the other side of her desk and sat down. ‚ÄúI need some help with something, and I think you‚Äôd be a good person to ask.‚Äù

Rio stopped what she was doing and looked up at him. He looked nervous and was fidgeting in his seat. Nicky was usually confident, like Agatha, and took command in most situations. Also, like Agatha, he didn‚Äôt often ask for help.

‚ÄúNicholas, what‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù Rio‚Äôs worry emerged and she questioned if she needed to text for reinforcements.

‚ÄúNothing‚Äôs wrong, no. Morgan‚Äôs birthday is next Tuesday, and I‚Äôm clueless. I want to get something that says I love you, but teenage appropriate.‚Äù He tapped his foot on the rung of the stool nervously. Rio breathed a sigh of relief.

‚ÄúOh! Well, I do know Morgan well, being her coach, but Nicky, you‚Äôve known her most of your life. This isn‚Äôt the first birthday or Christmas you‚Äôve exchanged gifts. What have you gotten her so far in your relationship?‚Äù

Rio wasn‚Äôt sure why Nicky had chosen her, of all people to ask for advice on this. She had difficulty coming up with gifts for Agatha, and it took her some serious contemplation to finally land on the right one. She had never done well in relationships as a teen and young adult, and kids didn‚Äôt make mix tapes and CDs anymore. If anything, Wanda or Nat would be great people to ask.

Nicky blew out a breath.

‚ÄúUmm, Christmas, I got her a gift card for a sports store, and for Valentine‚Äôs Day, it was flowers, chocolate, and a giant bear.‚Äù He grimaced.

Rio suppressed a smile, even though her eyes brightened. ‚ÄúOh, Nicholas. I can see now why you‚Äôre asking for advice,‚Äù She gave him a playful smile and saw him relax. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt always have to give her something tangible. Your mother and I have exchanged material items, yes, but we have also given each other experiences and memories, like concerts and trips.‚Äù She clarified upon seeing the scandalized look on his face.

Nicky seemed to think it over for a moment before looking back at her, still thinking, ‚ÄúOkay, well, we‚Äôre still teenagers, so there‚Äôs only so much we can do, and I have to get Pepper and Mr. Stark‚Äôs permission to take her anywhere, and your‚Äôs and Mom‚Äôs of course.‚Äù He added.

Rio felt as though her heart did somersaults when Nicky said he needed both of their permission to do something. While they acknowledged that she was somewhat of a parental figure, she did not have that authority. This would need to be discussed.

‚ÄúIt depends on what and where it is,‚Äù Rio said cautiously. ‚ÄúWhat does she like?‚Äù

‚ÄúSports, music, surfing, we like a lot of the same things.‚Äù Nicky shrugged, trying to think of something they didn‚Äôt do a lot or hadn‚Äôt done before.

Rio knew this needed to be his idea, and didn‚Äôt want to just supply the answer for him, but she had an idea.

‚ÄúThe WNBA season is starting very soon, maybe look that up.‚Äù Rio knew it was starting the Friday after Morgan‚Äôs birthday, but she wasn‚Äôt telling him that.

‚ÄúIt does? Does LA have a team?‚Äù Nicky asked innocently. He followed college basketball and was getting more into the professional leagues. Morgan had mentioned to Rio that she wanted Nicky to watch more of the women‚Äôs league with her this year.

Rio looked at Nicky and shrugged, silently telling him to do this part himself.

Nicky understood her nonverbal cues and pulled his phone out of his pocket, tapping the screen quickly.

‚ÄúI found it! I wonder if I can get courtside seats and take her.‚Äù Nicky‚Äôs eyes lit up.

‚ÄúYou should give Pepper a call. She‚Äôll talk to Tony, and then we can all talk about it tonight.‚Äù Rio thought for a moment. She still wasn‚Äôt sure why he had asked her. She looked at the clock, noting they still had a few minutes and everything was ready for her next class. ‚ÄúHey, why ask me? Surely your mom is way better versed in this type of thing.‚Äù

Nicky gave her a soft smile as he stood. ‚ÄúSeveral reasons. You know Morgan and the two of you have some things in common. I know you‚Äôre going to be direct with me. Mom would tell me to ask my aunts or you, Aunt Wanda would go with something sappy, and Aunt Nat would go with either a weapon or defer to Aunt Wanda. One year, I did give Morgan a personalized pocket knife. She still has it. Mr. Stark makes her carry it on our dates,‚Äù he laughed. ‚ÄúThe main reason, though, is you‚Äôre my other mom, Rio. Why wouldn‚Äôt I ask you?‚Äù With that, the bell rang, and he waved and disappeared, leaving her to process that and teach simultaneously.

Kids.

Pepper agreed to the game, and Tony knew the team's owner, making it easier for Nicky to get tickets. All he needed to do was ask Agatha that night. Rio was also there as they discussed it.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the first game of the season. We‚Äôll be there too.‚Äù Rio was saying to Agatha. She knew Agatha didn‚Äôt have a problem with it and was just making Nicky sweat.

‚ÄúWe will?‚Äù Agatha threw a look at her girlfriend, who was sitting on the couch.

‚ÄúWell, I‚Äôll be there. I‚Äôll take Alice if you don‚Äôt want to go.‚Äù Rio continued to grade papers, unbothered by the other woman‚Äôs question.

‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôll go.‚Äù She turned back to Nicky, who sat, alert, on another couch. ‚ÄúOkay, you can go. Just be very alert sitting courtside, and be a gentleman. It‚Äôs a late game, so you‚Äôll have to go with us or a driver.‚Äù

Nicky frowned. It was the first time Rio had ever seen Nicky upset with a condition that Agatha had set. He looked over at Rio with a hopeful look on his face.

‚ÄúI agree. I know your mom has let you drive at night by yourself before, but this is different. It‚Äôs late, in a busy area, after a large event, in traffic. Not only is it against the terms of your license, it‚Äôs just not safe yet, Nicky. You‚Äôll both be tired, and this way, you can talk or anything else.‚Äù

Agatha had wanted to interject before Rio had responded but was impressed with Rio‚Äôs response. Nicky huffed, knowing if he didn‚Äôt accept the terms, it wouldn‚Äôt happen.

‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he grumbled before adjusting his attitude when he saw the warning looks from each of them. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going upstairs to get all that sorted out like the responsible and respectful young man I am. Thank you for the idea, Ri.‚Äù He turned on his heel and retreated upstairs before either mom could change their mind.

Agatha turned to Rio and rolled her lips. She wasn‚Äôt exactly upset, but Nicky had always come to her with things, and knowing he had gone to someone else had tied her stomach into a small knot. ‚ÄúHe asked you for advice?‚Äù There was a shadow of hurt in her tone.

Rio took Agatha‚Äôs hand. ‚ÄúYes, I should have told you. He came to me today and asked me what he should get for Morgan. I asked him why he had asked me when there were three other women to ask. Agatha, he said I‚Äôm his other mom.‚Äù Rio‚Äôs eyes filled with tears at the words she hadn‚Äôt quite processed.

Agatha smiled genuinely, though she was just as conflicted as she had been a few months ago. ‚ÄúI know he‚Äôs made references to it a few times, I‚Äôm just still getting used to sharing him with someone I‚Äôm romantically involved with. Decisions, what little discipline he requires, advice, and whatever else is needed. I know I‚Äôve shared these things with the others, but this is different.‚Äù Agatha‚Äôs thumb drew circles on the back of Rio‚Äôs hand. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to be out of the country for over half of the summer and away from both of you. I know he has several invitations to schools for visits and a few football camps.‚Äù Agatha paused, gathering the words. She knew she would be asking a lot of Rio. ‚ÄúYou can say no, but since you‚Äôll be living here, and he considers you a parent, would you go on his visits with him and share everything with me? It‚Äôs ultimately his decision, but I‚Äôd still like to know information about the programs, how the trips were, and both of your thoughts. I want to know that he is with someone I trust to guide him. I know you have the best intentions in mind for him, like I do.‚Äù Agatha looked hopeful as she looked into Rio‚Äôs eyes.

Rio wasn‚Äôt sure how to respond. Agatha wanted her to go through this crucial milestone with Nicky? ‚ÄúOf course. Your summer is busy enough. I do have his best intentions at heart, and yours.‚Äù She leaned forward and kissed Agatha slowly, placing her palm over Agatha‚Äôs heart. ‚ÄúI love you both, very much,‚Äù Rio whispered when she drew back and dropped her forehead to Agatha‚Äôs shoulder.

‚ÄúWe love you too.‚Äù The knot in Agatha‚Äôs stomach had dissipated, and she knew that this was right. Rio was the person with whom she wanted to co-parent Nicky or any future children.

Prom night, like all high school milestones, was a ritual Morgan had been looking forward to. Her dress was a one-shoulder, gold-sequined, floor-length gown with three straps across the back for extra support so she wasn‚Äôt tugging it up all night. Her hair was in an up-do and her dad wanted her to wear a scarf because of it.

Nicky wore a tux with a gold vest and bowtie. Both sequined, he was committed to matching. His moms had insisted on tagging along to the Starks so they could take pictures. It meant as much to Nicky that Rio was there for this, too, like a second primary mother. She loved him, and even if neither woman wanted to admit it, he knew Agatha and Rio would get married eventually. He saw how worried she had been when he got in that fight, and when he had gotten in that car accident. That wasn‚Äôt the look of a concerned teacher or family friend. That was the look of a worried parent. Right now both of them were beaming at him as they took pictures of the young couple dressed in their sparkly prom attire.

The parents finally let them go on their way.

Rio looked over at Agatha and Tony. ‚ÄúDid either of you tell them Chappell was performing?‚Äù

‚ÄúNow, why would we ruin that surprise?‚Äù Agatha took Rio‚Äôs hand to lead her to the car.

‚ÄúI promised her I wouldn‚Äôt let anyone know she was here.‚Äù Tony and Agatha had both pulled the strings for their special guest, Tony had kept her under the radar.

Pepper pat him on the back.

‚ÄúYou did a great job, honey.‚Äù She looked at the two women as she guided Tony toward the house. ‚ÄúI had to take his phone away so he didn‚Äôt tell everyone.‚Äù

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

The last week of school was showcase week and to Rio, each day brought with it a fresh new hell. Thankfully, the last day of school was Thursday, and Friday they were all going to the beach house for Memorial Day weekend.

Rio and Alice had already taken care of their end-of-the-year duties and would be able to leave as soon as the bell rang on Thursday. First, they had to get through four days of student exhibits and showcases.

Nicky, Tommy, and Eddie were playing in a football scrimmage -Tommy and Eddie would be playing on varsity the next year. For the football events, Agatha and Rio wore matching ‚ÄúFootball Mom‚Äù shirts that both read Harkness on the back with Nicky‚Äôs number. Nat‚Äôs shirt had Maximoff on the back with Tommy‚Äôs number, and Herb wore a ‚ÄúFootball Dad‚Äù shirt, but whose back matched Nat‚Äôs.

Billy wore his Football Boyfriend shirt with pride.

Academic and fine arts projects were on display, and both Rio and Alice were very proud of their student's hard work throughout the year, specifically the students of the coven. Tommy‚Äôs grades had improved immensely and his projects demonstrated it. Cassie had a lot to do with that, she encouraged Tommy to study and she found ways to make it fun for him. Wanda didn‚Äôt ask questions.

The basketball team also had a scrimmage and a teachers vs. students game. Agatha wore her Vidal jersey and cheered extra loudly when she watched Rio play. Rio was not nice to the girls at all, and the teachers won easily. Morgan grumbled the whole time.

Lilia laughed as she watched, she knew Rio had won a National Championship in college. The girls didn't.

Billy showed off his talent by doing a one-act play and a choir concert where he had a lead part and a solo. Wanda and Agatha were so proud. Jen already had a few people in mind to call about the kid.

It was finally Thursday and as Rio locked her classroom door, ending her first year at SHIELD, she looked forward to the future. This weekend was going to be all about beach time. Then she would move in with Agatha the following week.

Rio walked to her car, confidently optimistic for the future.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Agatha watched her family from the balcony of the beach house during the first weekend of summer. It was the calm before the whirlwind of summer filming, and they had all gathered to kick it off.

The teens were in the ocean and the boys were attempting to show off their surfing skills and doing terribly. She couldn‚Äôt make out expressions from where she stood, but she could tell that Morgan and Cassie were laughing as Tommy wiped out. Billy had snuck up behind Eddie and dunked him. The kids were being kids, and it warmed her heart.

Directly below her by the pool; Vision, Alice, Nat, and Herb were drinking, grilling, and laughing while Wanda, Jen, and Rio were planning the Maximoff-Romanov wedding that was only a few weeks away now. Agatha was ecstatic that the wedding, which had been twenty-five years in the making, would finally be happening. Wanda looked on the edge of joyful tears as she continuously looked at Nat and Vision. The two people who had come together and supported her throughout everything.

And Herb. Herb who had been Vision‚Äôs friend for as long as any of them had known Vision. Wanda‚Äôs worries about someone coming into Vision‚Äôs life and not understanding the relationship between them completely dissipated once Herb entered the picture. This teddy bear of a man didn‚Äôt mind the pecks on the cheek and forehead the exes gave each other or the pet names. They were close friends, and co-parents that still loved each other. Wanda and Vision didn‚Äôt divorce because they didn‚Äôt love each other, they divorced each other because they did, and Herb understood that.

The man, like Nat, was a national treasure.

Agatha had come into this life, born to a woman who did not want her. She became famous at an extremely young age based entirely on luck and was still convinced that her fame was the only reason Evanora had not killed her when she was a young child. She had met Lorna Wu as a pre-teen, and the woman took pity on her, hatching a plan to save her from her circumstances, and she had.

Lorna Wu had taught Agatha what family was.

It had gone off track a time or two, and she had lost people along the way and gained so many. Nearly forty years later, and here she was, Lorna gone, but her legacy lived on. Agatha and Lilia were restoring their relationship, and Lilia, her rightful place in the family.

Agatha and Alice had grown closer and had a deeper understanding of each other, as well as Lorna. Agatha looked on and caught Jen watching Alice with pure love in her eyes. Agatha knew Jen had her own skeletons and only let certain people in. She had been so hesitant about taking the leap with Alice, even though they could all see the love between them. Now, here they were, married, living on the compound, about to adopt a dog. Alice turned to see Jen watching her and walked over to join the planning group, bending down to kiss her wife.

Agatha was filled with a comfortable warmth watching all of them and the familiar pang of Lorna‚Äôs absence. It didn‚Äôt hurt like it had in the past, it was just the awareness that she wasn‚Äôt physically there. Having Lilia back had eased the pain. Having two-thirds of the original trio back.

Agatha had been in a staggering amount of movies, TV shows, commercials, plays, and musicals. She was no stranger to various genres of entertainment. She knew that life imitated art, and if you asked her which genre was her favorite, she would tell you it was life. After all, her life had everything. Romance, mystery, intrigue, murder, angst, anything you wanted, and a lot of things she hadn‚Äôt but was better for. Rio looked up and raised her water bottle toward her in a small toast.

Agatha raised hers back and smiled lovingly.

Agatha turned her head as Lilia walked up behind her as if Lilia had been summoned by her thoughts.

‚ÄúSo, you and Sharon?‚Äù

Lilia chuckled. ‚ÄúI was wondering when you were going to ask.‚Äù

‚ÄúThat woman is in love with you.‚Äù Agatha leaned forward and rested her forearms on the railing in front of her. ‚ÄúAnd you‚Äôre in love with her, or as close as Lilia Calderu has ever come to it. I‚Äôve seen how you look at her.‚Äù

Lilia hummed. ‚ÄúI remember someone telling me that once before, about a woman being in love with me. I lost my two best friends because of it.‚Äù

Agatha stood to her full height and put a comforting hand on Lilia‚Äôs shoulder.

‚Äú That was then, this is now, and you‚Äôre not that person anymore. You‚Äôre older and wiser. I know you‚Äôre only dating women now, and I know she‚Äôs the only one, you‚Äôre also the only person she‚Äôs seeing.‚Äù

Lilia smirked and raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúWell, look who took a page from Wanda‚Äôs playbook.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am not meddling. Call it a welfare check if you must.‚Äù Agatha dropped her hand from Lilia‚Äôs shoulder, taking Lilia‚Äôs hand instead. ‚ÄúLils, I‚Äôm not saying shack up and get married, I‚Äôm saying give her a chance and let her in. She‚Äôs a great woman. She put up with a very angry me when I broke my leg, remember? She also put up with me multiple times trying to detox with Lorna. She can handle your not-so-law-abiding self.‚Äù

Lilia but the inside of her lip. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs a tough woman, I know she can. But monogamy? Neither of us has been monogamous since the seventies, Agatha.‚Äù Lilia looked as though Agatha had asked her to impale herself with swords.

Agatha laughed at the thought of either woman in a completely traditional relationship. ‚ÄúNo, I would never suggest either of you do that. I‚Äôm saying make each other a primary relationship, the majority of your love lives. Whatever that looks like for you two. More than just a few weekends a year, Lilia.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôll think about it. Neither one of us has said the L word, and we‚Äôve been, having our fun, for years now.‚Äù

Agatha squeezed Lilia‚Äôs hand before letting it go. ‚ÄúGood, I just want what‚Äôs best for you,‚Äù she parroted Lilia‚Äôs words back to her.

‚ÄúI know, kid. I know.‚Äù

Agatha leaned back on the railing, something about the tone around the familiar phrase Lilia loved to use nagging at the back of her mind. She had to ask Lilia, who also leaned on the railing beside her. Agatha looked at her, considering everything she knew about her old mentor.

‚ÄúIt was you, wasn‚Äôt it? Not Nat. Every single time something needed to be handled?‚Äù

Lilia gave a wry smile. ‚ÄúNever send a Russian to do an Italian job.‚Äù

Agatha shook her head as she left Lilia at the railing, smiling the whole time, knowing that Lilia had still always been there throughout the years.

She joined everyone by the pool and seated herself behind Rio, letting the gorgeous woman lean back into her chest as she would a chair. Wrapping her arms around Rio, Agatha gave her a chaste kiss and looked at her family around her. She knew that this was exactly where Lorna had wanted them to be, and that warmed her heart all the more.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Until Next Time.

Chapter End Notes

This part is over.

Will Lilia and Sharon make a move?

Next: Editing the first few chapters, and then...converting this to a book and looking into publishing options.
Working on the next installment, some one-shots, and preparing for Agatha All Along week.

This universe will continue.

An Update

Chapter Summary

Updated!

Hello lovely readers!
While posting, I kept saying I was going to update the first few chapters.
Well, I did that. Today (May 6th, 2025), I updated chapters one through five. They are amazing and added quite a few words...
I have updates for other chapters too, especially six, but it's not ready to be posted yet. I added the scene of Alice asking Jen out, and it's cute y'all.

But Ellen (my pen name), what did you change/add/edit?
Well, I know the first several chapters were without a beta/editor (DaretoDream82). Because of that, they were rushed and I was still very rusty in my return to writing. We have more inner dialogue, more character development, just more . The first part feels more like the rest of the fic. I also just working on continuity issues as a whole.
ALSO, for those that did not follow the series, it IS a series now! I'm working on the next chapters for those right now. Good Luck Babe, the prequel of sorts, and I am Your Summer, the short mini-fic before the full-blown sequel.
I was hoping to post for Agatha All Along week, but I may just keep on with what I'm doing, we'll see what happens.
I will post updates as I update more chapters!
PLEASE ENJOY THE NEWLY IMPROVED 1-5!
